commentary vpon whole booke ivdges preached first delivered svndrie lectvres since collected diligently peruſed publiſhed benefit generally ſuch deſire grow faith repentance eſpecially would cleerely vnderſtand make vſe worthie example saint recorded diuine hiſtory penned richard rogers preacher god word wetherſfield eſſex hebr 12 1 wherefore ſeeing compaſſed ſo great cloud witneſſes let v cast euery thing preſſeth downe c whatſoeuer written written inſtruction wee conſolation scripture might haue hope wisdom peace peace plenty printer publisher device london imprinted felix kyngston thomas man ſold ſhop paternoſter row ſigne talbot 1615 right honovrable sir edvvard coke knight lord chiefe iuſtice england one maieſties moſt honorable priuie counſel r r wiſheth bleſsing internall externall eternall god father chriſt ieſus right honourable hath alway befallen beſt diuine humane lawes peruerted common profanenes lewd cuſtome ſo may verified thing like precious nature could neuer eſcape taint humane errour abuſe witneſſe inſtitution holy feaſt shiloh mentioned booke though firſt chiefly vſed memoriall god benefit yet proceſſe time grew extreme abuſe gaue occaſion vnlawful ſtealing virgin dance nay witneſſe euen approueable cuſtome dedicating bookes though hath long taken vp continued good reſpectiue reaſons yet hath old practiſe heretikes ſtill vnworthy writer conueigh poiſon book inferiour ſort ſtiling gracing name remarkable perſonages religion chriſtianitie miniſterie word profeſſion thereof thing name nature higheſt value howbeit faireſt apple worme ſo theſe expoſed treble corruption error infidelitie hypocriſie semblably writing diuine argument whether vpon scripture treatiſes conſonant thereto ſingular vſe church yet neuer free malignitie ſome men eſpecially ſuch either curioſitie endure nothing clawes leprous humor careleſnes profeſſe either meddle man writing without putting difference embrace good bad equall affection two former theſe three meane vngratiouſly nice graceleſly ſenſuall muſt ſay ſince scripture themſelues moſt ſolemne matter ſtile cannot relliſh deſpaire writing ſhould procure appetite yea peraduenture worke mine diſpleaſe daintie eye finger bignes ſo preiudice handling theſe therfore diſeaſe incorrigible profeſſe myſelfe cooke dreſſe diet rather leaue feede vpon chalke morter vnſauourie pamphlet others nouriſh mind wholeſome meate ſend trough akornes ſince refuſe angel food latter ſort ſince hope correct error others vice pray god generall willingnes reade would giue vnderſtanding heart diſcerne aright thing differ holy eye iudgement may like muſicall eare diſtinguiſhing ſounds like fining pot goldſmith ſeuering gold droſſe touchſtone diſcouering mettals alſo hope ſuch buy new bookes ſorts may happily holy writ courſe miniſterie theſe fourtie yeeres paſt god hath aſſiſted explane go audience haue ſome cauſes choſen leaue poore pledge memoriall god church fidelitie paine loue though reſpected alſo good requeſt owne congregation herein whoſe heart deſire doubly faſten naile wholeſome inſtruction ſoone ſlippeth yet ſeeing time ſhort voyce cannot reach beyond vſuall limit haue endeuoured pen draw long weariſome line defect might ſupplied looking vp requitall hath promiſed conceale labour loue heb 6 10 haue right honourable purpoſely altered courſe writing formerly haue vſed treatiſe eliſha prophet put hand vpon king iſrael 2 king 13 16 hand hee bad ſhoote ſo wee vndertake handling scripture holy ghoſt allowes v ſay wee inuent requires v put hand hand applie ſelues ſtrictly vnto drift tractates owne wherein generally ſcope libertie large yet text hath led haue held myſelfe theſe two markes one generall build vp chriſtian reader faith good life end haue alreadie written large diſcourſe haue yet come honour hand containing ground direction eaſie practiſing growing ſo haue annexed liuely example scripture illuſtrate thoſe precept naturall repugnancie whereof fleſh blood might otherwiſe breake gainſaying art itſelfe practiſe thereof particular ſhew diligent reader vſe hiſtoricall example old teſtament eſpecially doe afford v matter contemplatiue cold age little reſpected leſſe vnderſtood ſuch haue boldly preſented vnto lordſhip vpon threefold conſideration firſt god hath made principall member great bodie land gift perſonall publique hath iuſtly proportioned manner could well forgo yet church commonwealth literature could ill want ſame god hath thus enriched hath crowned gift ſo liue name bleſſed end life ſhall dye vndeſired▪ hath almightie thus graced doubtleſſe yourſelfe onely end sunbeames drawing vp ſweet vapour earth ſuffer fall vpon thirſtie mother againe doubly fruitfull influence ſo god talent meaſured largely vnto might entirely returne honour vnto giuer ouerplus veſſell full runneth ouer hath itſelfe bedeweth earth alſo neere ſeeing greateſt goodneſſe beſt creature cannot reach ſo high god himſelfe therefore hee expects drop vpon iudges heauen enabling encouraging ſo incredible fortitude ſucceſſe laſt named nature firſt admirable faith author hebrwes could heb 11 throughout ſilence thicke clowd witneſſes ſo thereby importeth generally life whereby chriſtians liue heb 10 37 eſpecially fortreſſe yea armour proofe magiſtrate onely ſword lord hand gedeon barak jphtah samſon mentioned booke fight againſt forreine enemy alſo humbly deuoted lord richard rogers miniſter goſpell lectvres sermon vpon whole booke ivdges firſt entrance confeſſe ſmall matter man take vpon ſet foorth lecture sermon part word god eſpecially whole booke thereof rather matter much greater difficultie danger ſo doe preach ſeeing mine owne part would eaſilier brought preach three sermon ſet foorth penne one beſides ſee learned men ſpeake many might excellent gift profit many doe church much good haraly drawne thereto leaue reaſons themſelues perhaps thinke needleſſe worke ſet foorth bookes mine owne part knowing many would reade little new bookes ſet foorth thinke good purpoſe labour kinde eſpecially thing ſet foorth quickening vp preſent drowſie age ſo teſtifie iudgement writing another minde would diſſent learned men ſeeke glorie praiſe practiſe ſpeake truth confeſſe freely reaſons attempt come many degree behinde gift purpoſe ſo would take vpon exerciſe writing vnleſſe led waightie reaſons ſimplicitie heart ſpeake ſet myſelfe worke haue time leiſure publike imployment miniſterie priuate duty euen keepe myſelfe danger euill world idleneſſe much tampering world ſuch like needleſſe hurtfull beſineſſe well deſire haue benefit hereby beſides thinke better benefit church wee liue ſhort time may riſe vp perfit ſuch beginning burie gift vtterly ſo depriue altogether ſame death alſo ſee euery age men hath ſundrie trouble annexed old well young occaſions offered ſinning offending god many way one occaſion thought come ſo much danger youth former yeeres life paſſed inwara peace without groſſe iuſt offence others yet doe men caſes rarely obtained without much ſtriuing watching enter ſtraight gate yet diuell ſo much enuieth credit church comfort haue god ſuch eſtate eſpecially miniſters therefore hee doth bend force againſt ſuch hee may latter end diſgrace winding ſome reprochfull foule offence ſo may much lieth make former vertues part life ridiculous account therefore aſhamed confeſſe haue receiued wonderfull cauſe thankſgiuing god ſo great bountie fauour towards moſt vnworthie younger yeeres keepe infection time ſins age wherein haue liued yet god mercifull many ſlips infirmity ſo ſay aſhamed confeſſe feare declining age haſting apace graue griefe heart haue ſeene many may poſsibly yea full eaſily drawne vnprofitable earthly idle dead courſe life thereby greater offending god blemiſhing profeſſion miniſterie vnleſſe ſhould labour preuent ſome ſet labour ſtudy ſo hold faſt haue receiued lord occupying vſing gift hath giuen kinde ſtudie namely writing may alſo ſhould endeuour grow forward grace experience 2 pet 3 17 knowledge lord ieſus chriſt man may eaſily hindred error wicked rather looke haue done heretofore might eaſily flatter myſelfe thereby ſo leaſt ſtand ſtay worſe goe backe ſo loſe part happineſſe continue end make chiefe account hauing fruition yet hope onely know may eaſily many wait hindred ſtaied satan handle matter ſee many goe worke cauſe deſire occupied vntill lord come manner hauing one foote graue end may tye myſelfe liue freer dangerous falles offence ſtranger abſent home therefore ſay haue ſet myſelfe kinde worke able debilitie body lamenes trauaile abroad helpe neighbour home preaching haue done ſince firſt began labour deſired conferring much occaſion offered vſed health doe laugh haue ſaid fearing myſelfe thinking meere folly cannot doe neither moued ſo cenſuring tell feare frailtie alſo count fooliſhnes haſt apace vtter miſerie taking booke hand ſet sermon vpon haue preached though haue gone ouer courſe miniſterie many beſides take booke hand making compariſon betwixt bookes scripture partly ſeeing lecture sermon ſet vpon know giue light helpe ſuch need partly earneſt deſire thoſe heard sermon may know perceiue labour thought worth ſetting foorth would willing much lieth doe like ſome booke worke beſide people brought vp learning may ſee whole life may directed hereby may much profit ſo intended alſo benefit student preacher yet experienced beſt furniſhed matter edifying hearer ſo beſide fruite may reape hereby common people ſo may learne make vſe hiſtoricall part bible learne draw doctrine inſtruction example thereof fit people bad well good euen well scripture haue learned doe neither haue attained vnto therefore doe oft time offer violence scripture making allegory ſo wreſting another ſenſe holy ghoſt hath made without manner handling draw none little matter moſt example ſtories ſo beſide doctrine ſoundly gathered ſo giue fearefull ſuſpition ignorant ſuch part scripture barraine drie doe ſuch ſhifts yet indirect ſo hardly draw matter doctrine yet certaine cleere full ſound inſtruction come purpoſe ſet downe ſome generall thing enter text may giue ſome light better vnderſtanding whole book ſuch gather partly obſeruing laying together read comparing one thing another partly learned reuerend father maſter peter martyr whoſe workes neither moſt priuate men vnderſtand many miniſters though may vnderſtand come neither ſhall finde ſhall much ſimpler hearer benefit firſt let reader marke booke agreeth former geneſis end ioſhua ſumme concerning booke geneſis mention made beginning creation world generation flood doth afterward ſhew god choſe people abraham poſteritie ſent egypt auoid famine exodus theſe thing principall people god multiplied increaſed land egypt till roſe king cruelly oppreſſed vexed ſore deliuered bondage moſes lawes giuen gouerne laſt point ſumme leuiticus alſo booke number declareth diuers resting place deſert going forward toward land canaan deuteronomy moſes depart world leaue people doth moſt faithfully repeate law generation came former liued meane poſteritie abraham came ioſhua led people promiſed land diuided land amorites canaanite partly ſubdued gotten hand partly remained conquered ſay diuided amongst twelue tribe according commandement god brought ouer iordan ſlaine many king canaan poſſeſſed city ground countrey ſumme content booke ioſhua death come purpoſe lord gouerned people hebrewes placed land iudges end indued excellent gift deliuered kept people hand enemy yet day iudges remaine great number vex vnderſtand better meaning word iudges materiall point booke vnderſtood though iudge ſignifie know caſes ſuch contend variance giue ſentence iudgement betwixt men yet theſe iudges mentioned booke office neither called iudges reſpect word ſignifieth alſo reuenge redeeme bondage thus thoſe iudges deliuer redeeme people booke large declared ſpeak • samuel ſaid iudge alſo deciding 1 sam 7 6 15 controuerſies ciuill cauſes theſe iudges office aſsigned god deliuer people haue ſaid enemy hand ſo iudge therefore called name iudges booke intreateth act throughout called booke iudges 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 briefly lay ſtate condition theſe people hebrewes liued whereby office iudges may better vnderſtood hauing yet conquered land occupied firſt entrance ioſhuas death ſubduing enemy afterward ſuffered remaine become tributary thereby god ſaw meete need required great perill miſerie becauſe people leſt ſhould haue vtterly deſtroyed theſe iudges raiſed vp without election men reſcue deliuer afterward reſt peace god gouerned thoſe iudges therefore iphtah deſired would raigne ouer neither authoritie ouer vſed help ſomeother excellent perſons fit vertues gift purpoſe ruled people iudges ſaid ſtirred vp lord great danger brought vpon enemy helper deliuerers vnto keepe peace afterward lined theſe iudges choſen ſucceſsion king neither voyces people raiſed vp god wee haue heard indifferently well one tribe another meane vnfit ſoeuer purpoſe god furniſh ſtirred vp moſt excellent gift end appointed went farre better people vnder afterward would need haue king raigne ouer alwaies deliuer people iſrael calamitie oppreſſed whereas king ſometimes waſte bring captiuitie moſt part idolater although vnder iudges people ſomtimes oppreſſed grieuouſly ſtrangers eſpecially vnder samſon philiſtims muſt know horrible ſinnes deſerued prouoked god deale manner yet neuer led captiuitie liued againe king good men iſrael one iudges moſt part ſuch good teſtimonie whereof haue epiſtle hebrewes thus reade commendation time would ſhort ſpeake gedeon barak iphtah samſon theſe holy ghoſt commendeth though ſome men ſometime fall yet thinke returned roſe vp againe ſeeing scripture remember doth neuer condemne reſpect helpe people could haue ſeene made benefit may ſay liued golden age whereas ſo apparantly ſeene booke doth ſet foorth chriſt vnto v commendation theſe iudges yet end bookes scripture ſuch demaund anſwere chriſt cleerely ſet foorth thoſe bookes old teſtament firſt written darkly type figure god ſaw meete thoſe age ſo wee thinke booke deliuerances ſo great enemy mentioned herein type great deliuerance redemption men wrought chriſt iawes diuell let commending ſundrie thoſe iudges holy ghoſt ſatisfie v could haue good men haue liued faith ſaid haue done beleeued chriſt ſanctified thereby beſides authoritie ſhall giue old teſtament commended haue men god diuers king prophet many liue walke faith ſeeing expreſſely ſet downe without could pleaſe god ſumme booke thus much firſt chapter 1 verſe 21 ſeene ſecond part 2 chapter 17 treateth iudges great actes according occaſions offered due time raiſed vp third part chapter 17 end ſetteth foorth ſome odious monſtrous act gathered 300 yeeres end booke ſhall better appeare particular handling inſtruct perſwade v latter age world carry ſelues vprightly ſtreight well ordred courſe proſperitie aduerſitie meane hold feare god keep hope patience pilgrimage prayer repentance god leſſe v good people mentioned herein order purpoſe obſerue lecture vpon booke firſt giue ſhort ſumme chapter deuide euery chapter part better diſtinguiſhing point thereof may better vnderſtood clearely ſeene thirdly giue ſenſe verſes fully lay forth doctrine reaſons vſe thereof though moſt part alwaies expreſſely ſet downe manner handling diuerſe hiſtories booke alſo thinke ſame preaching scripture namely meaning ſenſe apt fit inſtruction ſhould bee drawne application preſent ſtate need vſe hearer plainely pitbily may beſt edifying hold meeteſt vſed weuld god conſent giuen therto al preacher courſe aimed wiſh euery one follow owne priuate courſe hath neuer learned good way order preaching whereby commeth paſſe ſome fill sermon froth owne braines bare authority men leaſt proofe brought scripture alſo ſome preach darkely little benefiting hearer mention endleſſe although many thing leaue conſideration therof reuerend learned brother yet hope without oſtentation arrogating ought myſelfe may allowed ſpeake regard long time haue ſpent ſtudying learning practiſing haue able holie exerciſe preaching end theſe lecture ſay beſide varietie much good therein contained ſome point good purpoſe occaſioned touching faith repentance ſundrie direction giuen ſeeke lord haue ſlipped beare trouble aright thus much thought good ſay enter ſeuerall sermon euen end ſome good light may giuen marketh duly may appeare proceed text itſelfe first sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges vers 1 came paſſe ioſhua dead child iſrael asked lord ſaying ſhall goe vp v againſt canaanite fight firſt againſt vers 2 lord ſaid iudah ſhall goe vp behold haue giuen land hand chapter two thing chiefly contained ſumme part chapter ſet downe ſumme chapter part together firſt commendation tribe iudah 21 verſe cauſe ſhall heare afterward ſecond ſetting downe ſinne tribe mentioned ſlothfully ſuffered canaanite liue expell end chapter iudah commended double manner firſt actes time ioſuahs death eight verſe tribe done death reſt verſes 21 firſt part chapter come meaning firſt 7 verſes ſeeing lie together death ioſhua bin guide gone meaning 7 firſt verſes child iſrael ſaw muſt make warre forraine nation vnto day whole land though promiſed deuided amongſt yet wonne conquered lot inheritance euery tribe canaanite enemy ſtill dwelling remaining ſeeing knew muſt driuen force ſtrong hand god commanded therefore doubted whether ſhould goe againſt warre tribe ſhould firſt begin goe gouerne reſt thing ſuch waight went lord asked high prieſt propitiatory mercy ſeat manner doubtfull caſes tribe ſhould begin battaile exod 28 30 ſo anſwere ſatisfaction ſhould goe vp attempt god proſpered promiſed ſo iudah ſought helpe simeon brother neighbour tribe conſented readily ſo doe proſpered attempt victory ouer canaanite ſet downe together deſtruction adonibezek king thus much meaning theſe 7 verſes ſome generall manner haue meaning theſe verſes remaineth drawe thence ſuch inſtructions afoarded v beginning theſe two former ſet downe firſt firſt verſe people conſtrained looke ioſhua dead doe themſelues peace quiet hee doct 1 verſe 1 wont doe wee taught chiefe ſpeciall perſons taken away wont beare burden many left behinde muſt put forth themſelues take paine put greater plondges oh great eaſe men could conſider aright haue others beare brunt ſelues may ſit peace sauiour chriſt conuerſant diſciples earth ſheilded note matth 9 11 12 prouided euery way bare blowes ſhoulders phariſies cauilled whereby might eaſily haue bin diſcouraged tooke part weake defended ſaid peter litle aſcention thou ioh 21 18 waſt young thou girdeſt thyſelfe wenteſt whither thou wouldeſt thou art old another ſhall girde thee leade thee whither thou wouldeſt king gouerne wiſely conſcionably people ſit vnder vine 1 king 4 25 figtree ſaid liued dayes salomon hee nathan prophet zadok prieſt benaiah moſt worthy counſeller ſuch like alſo people ſetled vnder faithfull able teacher watch ſoules liue corner heauen ſee obediently ſit feete heare ſo may ſay child haue prouident godly parent regard welfare know ſorrow trouble meane glory child father inferiours haue good friend gouernours ſeeth priuiledged prouided aboue others theſe faile beginneth woe ſorrow thoſe leaue behinde vnwelcome parting couple mariage husband wife ſhe husband true loue betwixt daily ſeene proued deepe ſorrow longeſt liuer al haue ſaid ſhould ſuch ſo backed others weigh great goodnes god giuing ſuch helpes yeild due reuerence loue obedience lord carefully giuen euery good worke haue ſo great incouragements becauſe inioying ſuch made ſo common matter thing great reioycing liue according prouerbe beſt know good thing worth wee feele want therefore good ſuppoſe oft time put caſe ſuch worthy helpes friend taken ſhould doe left without vine wanting raile prop vp runneth ground waxeth wilde vnfruitfull ſimile ſo inferiours deſtitute godly ſuperiours waxe degenerate grow kinde lying open miſchiefe saul samuel death 1 sam 28 15 ſpeake truth pitie rare hardly bee found ſuch take great good thoſe helpes inioy vnleſſe thing temporary eaſe maintenance ſeeking note liberty fleſh neither forgoe haue grace bewaile loſſe reſpect earthly neither doe looke ſtand vp ought want roome care confidence become lightes good example keepe themſelues euill kept ſome doubt good friend prouide ill themſelues ſeeing people iſrael heere ioſhua dead great loſſe conſtrained looke better needed doe euen ſo hauing like befalne muſt take burden themſelues borne others ſo men ſhould make vſe ſuch change vſe 1 prouide learne want good helpes friend hand arme themſelues iob looke change ſee muſt need forgoe ſhould alſo acknowledge daily hearty thankes god benefit haue inioy vſe 2 doe good may helpe cannot doe muſt neceſſitie feele loſſe great ſee muſt lay ſhoulders burden therefore labour fitter beare vndergoe want wont ſtand ſo great ſtead wholeſome direction aduice ſuch haue helper friend yet remaining ſo eaſie ſee euery calamity ſuſtaine made ſuch vſe comfortably inioyed purpoſe adde ſo end point oh ſweetly good liking haue many liued others beare burden husband wiues ſubiects child neighbour friend benefit inioyed kindely aright doubt chiefeſt haue therewith god friend alſo ſeeing many depend onely carnall manner liuing ſtill reſt god therefore proppes faile deſolation commeth vpon enemy vpon vnarmed man particularly taught hereby example ſought god doubtes counſell reſolution doubtfull doct 2 caſes fewe partly touching eſtate towards god partly particular duty action ſpeciall calling condition life remaine earth ſhould conſult aske counſell god reſolution ſuch manner hath taught v wiſe conceale bury want defect trouble v paſſe ſinnes cleaue v difficulty dealing buſineſſe oppreſſe v ſo prouide ill ſelues euen liue ignorance ſorrow inconueniences annexed thereunto euer yet ſeeke anſwere reſolution wee muſt thinke inioyned god doe ſame particular manner theſe high prieſt might thought great trouble v ſeeing none theſe day aske counſell v muſt know haue moſes prophet apoſtles helpe miniſters god paſtors teacher bring v god meſſage minde word thereby inſtruct v wee ſelues occaſion ſerueth ſearch scripture anſwere owne doubt thereby ſettle eſtate god ward dauid act 17 11 pſalmes oft namely ſaith art thou heauy ſoule pſal 43 5 art thou ſo troubled within mee still truſt god praiſe beſt againe whereby ſhall man yea yong man doth pſal 119 9 hardly ouercome paſſions denie way ſo hee may proue himſelfe bleſſed anſweres scripture euen taking heed thereto god word teacheth thus ſay ſearch scripture hearing reading doe reueale god vnto v conſult men brother holy ghoſt hath ſet ouer v ende miſery age nothing called queſtion among note v thinke haue knowledge doubt nothing waightieſt matter ſo pray becauſe diligent carefull learne daily ſearch ſelues word ſee miſſe neede helpe nay fewe men care moſt ſuch chiefly deſirous enquire good god toward haue moſt profited thereby already ſo ought doe careleſſe liued ſo obſerue want themſelues drowſie wandring heare could ordinary miniſtery ſhould grow much ſetledneſſe ſound knowledge whereas ſee ſtrangers taught home reſort ſound teaching ſay though know much inquiſitiue deſirous anſwered doubt ſuch haue daily meanes hand whereby might reſolued reioyced much hearer goſpell frequent houſes preacher phyſitians enquire bodily health ſome hope looked liue euer deſire liue long heere bodily health though ſhort ſeaſon thoſe day gone yet time haue ſeene place meane men woman ſeruants would riſe early diſpatch buſineſſe lecture day end might repaire thither inquire god congregation would ready take good priuatly alſo queſtions good purpoſe neceſſary might maintenance bodily prouiſion many queſtions pray moued one dayes weekes worke bee brought end ſo ignorant knoweth mindeth way eternall life hath many cauſes day weeke aske himſelfe ſecret queſtioning whether well concerning account making god doubt ſuch matter doe greatly trouble v day wee run ſixe leuen blinde man caſts ſtaffe looking v might ſafely guided commeth ſuch raſh proceeding without conſulting god one example booke number may ſufficiently numb 14 45 appeare certaine people iſrael would need goe vp fight amalekites canaanite owne head ſent lord came againſt deſtroyed another fault committed kind though perſwaded ſo bad mind ſeeing without great danger giue warning men feele many doubt ariſe reaſon ſinnes fore trouble conſcience yet feare leſt ſhould haue anſwere liking ſhame leſt ſhould bewray ignorance ſecrets ſo bee reproched mocked ſame conceale till ſorrow deuoure opening mindes euen water pent burſteth violently note doth much hurt time hauing let foorth vented might haue auoided become people booke actes apoſtles pricked heart point ſword come apoſtles made complaint ſaying men brother ſhall doe yet act 2 37 ſtrong temptation open griefe becauſe much prouoked railed therefore troubled theſe doubt eſpecially conſcience bee great ſtraights vnquietneſſe feare god diſpleaſure wrath cannot owne knowledge put away trouble mind let inquire men brother well perſwaded reſolution comfort haue inſtruments god pricke wound ſo alſo helpe eaſe need feare god hauing promiſed ſhall find reſt ſoules impoſſible ſoeuer ſeemed bee ſo ſaid firſt verſe next manifeſt god gaue anſwer propitiatory verſe 2 mercyſeate receiued high prieſt ſo hee vſed doe one ordinarie meanes whereby god ſpake thoſe day onely ſo whereby ſatisfied queſtion anſwered alſo incouraged goe worke ſet promiſing victorie warre againſt canaanite ſaying haue giuen land hand iudah ſhall goe reſt attempting warre againſt word witneſſing ſo gracious anſwere god may clearely ſee ſeeking god doubt neceſſities vaine neither labour loſt ſo know perſwaded god anſwereth ſuites demand indeed otherwiſe deadly diſcomfort would diſcourage v much well dutie maketh ſee wicked wit end great danger haue helpe god reade saul ſought god asked counſell ſerue owne turne thereby againſt philiſtims rather pleaſe hee anſwered hee depth ſorrow complained cried ſaying lord hath forſaken mee anſwereth neither prophet dreames bleſſed name dealeth ſo neither let trouble ſo ſay although god anſwered people iſrael ſought yet hee doth ſo v know promiſe v aske according grant well hee anſwered 1 ioh 5 14 asked therefore pſalme ſaith call time trouble heare thee thou ſhalt glorifie agreeth pſal 50 15 word sauiour vttered aske ſhall giuen ſeeke ye ſhall finde matth 7 7 certaine euery child god maketh mone thus poureth complaint ſhall heard ſhould little whet v animate v draw neere god wee hauing ſo ſure word promiſe draw neere v ſeeking mortall man iam 4 8 diſtreſſe though little aboue v know readily chearefully goe perſwaded good anſwer doubt kind louing affection toward v contrarie hardly wee drawne ſue one alienated v ſeeing care thus ſtandeth betwixt god v oftener come welcome wee true former ſpeech ſeeing ſuch moſt inward beloued abraham moſes dauid others repaired ofteſt receiued moſt ſay ſeeing thus betwixt god v lamentable bewailed common men repaire god could marke may eaſily perceiue neglect doe ſo increaſe trouble get nothing ſeeing entred vpon matter thinke amiſſe ſhew three ſorts offend common ſort wholly neglect omit prayer altogether firſt thinking though pray ſhall ſpeed well haue good lucke ſo terme others ſhall boldly affirming ſee good come yet diſtreſſe thinke ſhould pray hauing neither skill thereto ſtead thereof curſe rage helped deliuered though ſome vtter word paſſion lord heares read pro 1 pro 1 20 one vttered none though cannot pray god yet make complaint moane euery man haue acquaintance heare breake mind cannot helpe yet would ſo gladly finde helpe paſſe preſent ſure helpe found folly nay madneſſe ſay truth god ſought vnto ſort ſuch ſhifts faile haue ſaid ſpeake ſecond ſort profeſſors forwarder ſort religion former theſe ſhould pray faith confidence repentance comfort well deſire obtaining thing want patient waiting god leiſure euen ſeeke god manner yet onely right way praying teacheth v alloweth v prayer made without theſe property bare noiſe word vaine repetition idle matth 6 7 ſpeeches god abhorreth neither may ſuch looke receiue thing iames ſaith ye aske obtaine becauſe ye aske amiſſe iam 4 3 ſee receiue thing aske euen well doe gather imagin though falſelie vniuſtly prayer doth good loſt labour ſeeing heard pray amiſſe ſo waxe ſlacke negligent therein omit altogether leſſe maruell ſeeing euen good chriſtians come third ſort go farre beyond ſo forget themſelues ofttimes ſo deluded diuell euen omit zealous ſeruent praying fall pray coldly deadly ſo many vaine deluzions alurements ſtand vp way vnſettle miſty cloud trouble diſcourage thus fleſh iuſtleth againſt good reſiſting time commeth paſſe euen haue gal 5 17 learned pray aright haue oft vſually done ſo yet ſoone decline ſometime bee aware fall pray cuſtome matth 6 57 courſe hartily aright ignorant wel vndermined ſlily deceiued malice ſubtilty diuell euill heart prayer corrupt hinder luk 18 1 liues breake offenſiue therein ought marke declinings decay one well coldnes deadnes pray well liue well contrary want goeth ſo ill v doth walke oft time note heauily cannot ſay god heareth v heere ſaid people god anſwered euen haue prayed yet ſatisfied neither reſt faith perſwaded god heare v yet one chiefeſt fruites prayer thus much god anſwere yet marke barely anſwere might haue done haue ſaid onely let iudah goe vp ſhall mine anſwere addeth gracious incouragement demanded ſaying haue giuen land hand commonly men ſuites better aske looke thinking meanes obtaine ſomewhat anſwerable expectation god giues asked thought needfull dealing doth adde yet greater hartening incouraging v prayer ſee oftentimes promiſeth giueth v looked deare saint god haue found time ioſeph whoſe feete pinned ſtockes prayed might deliuered pſal 109 18 priſon whereinto thruſt ſuite whoriſh miſtris gen 39 19 20 conſenting vnchaſt requeſt god onely deliuered gen 41 14 brought great honour eſther prayed againſt ſpitefull attempt haman ſhe people alſo god people might preſerued deadly eſther 7 10 ſnare laid liues lord onely ſaued vtterly deſtroyed cut cleane moſt ſhamefull reprochfull manner haman ſeede woman eſther 9 10 canaan asked chriſt helpe daughter poſſeſſed diuell mat 15 22 granted vnto beſide ſhe asked euen ſhe would wee luk 15 22 know prodigall ſonne penurie miſerie glad refreſh himſelfe fill bellie ſwines food deſired might receuied ſeruant father houſe entertained taken ſonne nothing coſtlieſt apparell daintieſt food thought good whereto tend theſe example incourage v acquaint ſelues god ſeeking know oft earneſt repairing aſſuring ſelues wee ſhall onely obtaine come prayer oft time much according epiſtle hebrewes commeth god let know heb 11 6 plentiful rewarder ſeeke hath experience god louing kindneſſe knoweth neither hath found himſelfe doe aske particular benefit euery day inioy one many ſhould leade poore life maimed body wanting finger eye tongue c wee receiued oft time aske omit thing long ſtand vpon hath proofe matter greater waight whereas ſometime anguiſh heauineſſe ſoule feare wrath god iuſtly prouoked ſinnes againſt hee would haue thought happineſſe haue bin eſpecially liuing heere haue bin freed feare condemnation ſay hath proofe himſelfe hee hath yet liued ſee good infallible euidence beſide hee deſired himſelfe made aſſured eternall glory ſo true god giueth could aske thinke becauſe aske name mediation ſonne whoſe merit interceſſion infinite likewiſe haue oft time bin depth calamity ſeeking god helpe therein haue onely found deliuerance therewith bleſſings vnlooked great admiration comfort god hath giuen v deſire way yet leaſt ſhould ſeeme way come ſhort promiſe hath ſuffered croſſe remaine till hath made v ſee therefore ſay hath turned farre greater benefit v preſently deliuered v neuer laid vpon v ſo true god giueth could looke asking thinke receiue ſhould vphold v againſt grudging time wee thinke god deales ſparingly ſhortens v deſires wee blinde reuel 3 18 obſeruing theſe thing becauſe want eye ſalue faith onely make v ſee thus leaue verſe another thing heere worthy marked doth onely incourage v ſeeke earneſtly hebr 2 6 like large offer made people withall giueth v ſufficient incouragement worke ſetteth v pſal 1 3 doth tribe iudah thou ſaith ſhalt fight battels againſt mine enemy thou among others ſhalt goe worke though enough harten thee command thee yet know thy better incouragement thee aſsiſting bleſsing thee yea alſo giue thee victory deliuering thy hand better certainty telleth hath done already yet teach v god ſpeake word ſhould counted one v done deed much like hebrwes 6 hebr 6 10 god denied ill maſters doe take knowledge ſeruants worke forgetfull ſeruants labour vniuſt leaue vnrewarded telleth deale liberally hebt 2 6 men promiſe much performe little yea many ſo vniuſt ſet worke neuer willing pay hire come reckoning becauſe well content defraud due take labour manner nothing god liberall paymaſter promiſeth afore hand looke euen make v able fit worke ſo may bee toileſome tedious vnto v beſide reward giueth afterwards euen ioſuah ſhould leade people firſt land canaan hee onely promiſed ioſ 1 5 whole land added therewith thee leaue forſake thee duly conſidered belieued ſtrongeſt motiue ſet v forward cheerefully onely thoſe duty workes calling doe cauſe ſome delight ioyned ſome profit alſo require much toile haue nothing incourage v god command v would haue v goe worke otherwiſe namely magiſtrate miniſter thoſe great work required cheerfulnes readines haue mentioned yea husbandman artificer ſame manner ſet vpon iohn 4 34 workes inioyned ſo likewiſe euen ſeruants doore keeper hewer wood drawer water baſeſt ſeruices meaneſt calling alſo keeper ſheepe ſwine pſal 84 12 ſo occupied calling long know condition ſhould liue ſerue god bee bleſſe therein may abide ſame comfort reſting vpon prouidence truſting promiſe ſhall reape fruit aſſuredly ſame would ſay woman place condition worke occupied bruing baking ſowing ſpinning ſuch like huſwifery ſhould ſtay long behauiour deutr 12 7 ſo heauenly earthly buſineſſe would better become man would thinke ſhould deſired ſought wiſe ſo might liue cheerefully peaceably would better become ſay life leade moſt part led diſtruſtfully vnquietly fretting raging earthly mindednes c becauſe truſt god ſucceſſe neither belieue direct helpe alſo giue good end labour though alwayes attaine outward profit ſeeke god prouiding better euen hardnes count contentation patience ſhall greater bleſſing inioyed commodity might haue bin looked oh wofull people like labour worke god allotteth appointeth take hand thinke good therein promiſe themſelues worldly men mentioned saint iames namely gaine ſhall haue without promiſe iam 4 13 god therefore diſappointed could finde heart contend god yeelding hope deſire vnto though bee directed ſhould yet quarrell diſpute faile looke elſe ſecret murmuring frettings againſt diſappointments thus ſee ill prouide themſelues take worke goe god ſo might alſo proſper therein wiſe ſhall repent iudah heere deſire god teach good pleaſure haue therein ſure ſhall goe well whatſoeuer take hand reſpect dauid wiſhed pſal 84 12 meaneſt place god houſe ſay ruleth rather greateſt higheſt elſewhere wel ſhewing example poore ſimplicitie make like choice may liue farre ſweetly note peaceably mightieſt refuſe learne ſo salomon ment ſaid diſh greene hearbs peace better ſtaled oxe ſtrife ſuch like place obiected god dealt farre better obiection people doth theſe day v particular doubt trouble might goe aske counſell god gaue anſwere againe thereto grant v like manner ſay good cauſe deede ſhould ſerue god readily ioyfully haue ſuch libertie aske manner like prerogatiue anſwering v againe anſwere ſay liberty granted one reſpect diminiſheth nothing god fauour v people iſrael promiſe god common wealth ſhould ſome ſort abide vnto chriſts comming cauſe great ieopardy rooted enemy god gaue leaue thus aske ſhould reſolued ſatisfied according promiſe made wit ſhould driuen land whereby knew thoſe trouble ſhould feared vtter ouerthrow captiuity afterwards ſeaſon appointed time reſtored againe pſal 126 1 returned owne land great prerogatiue ſuch anſweres god particular earthly benefit temporary bleſſing needed haue ſo ſtand need haue farre greater meanes ſaluation farre cleerely brought light greateſt benefit ſeeing wee haue many bookes holy scripture eſpecially theſe thing done ſpoken prophet new teſtament wee may well allow ſomewhat want praying god either thing heauenly earthly haue farre eaſie acceſſe god one thing excepted one liberty granted haue ſaid would aſwell appeare fruit prayer zealous oft conſtant therein vprightnes heart vſe liberty praying god hath allowed rom 1212 compared iam 5 16 taught v doe followeth third verſe second sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges verſ 3 4 vers 3 iudah ſaid vnto simeon brother come vp lott may fight againſt canaanite goe thee thy lot simeon went although god promiſed deliuer canaanite hand iudah yet end ſhould ſitte idle ſenſe waite ſo well incouraged ſhould vſe ſuch helpe thereto hand ſuch whereby might bring paſſe becauſe tribe simeon brother poſſeſſions mixed lying among field iudah therefore called helpe two mutually aſſiſted one neere dwelling neighbourhood cauſed defend one practiſe example iuſtified scripture learne two leſſons firſt although god hath promiſed bleſſing v owne free goodnes yet let faith vſe doct verſ 3 good meanes offereth v effecting ſame rather ought doe ſo iudah ioyne god promiſe prouidence together action warre ſo bound doe al action peace meane beleeue one ſerue haue ſeene ſhould tempt god doe otherwiſe ſo commanded doe god promiſed helpe pſalme yet willeth waite meanes vſing fitte like bring paſſe thus ſaith commit thy way thou pſal 37 3 5 good bring paſſe therefore dauid god ſtabliſhed kingdome hand promiſe yet treaſon abſalom 2 sam 15 16 34 ſonne onely prouide himſelfe ſaue life keepe kingdome himſelfe flying vſed alſo helpe huſhai arkite ſonnes prieſtes ionathan ahimaaz fruſtrate attempt abſolom paul receiued anſwere god angell act 27 30 ſhould one ſhippe loſe life dangerous voyage ſore tempeſt yet afterwards mariner would haue gone ſhippe paul ſaid centurion except theſe abide ſhippe ye cannot ſafe therefore salomon ſaith ſlothfull pro 20 4 worke sommer ſhall ſtarue winter dauid though anoynted king saul ſtead yet ſo much cherefully vſe meanes attaine much ſecured iſſue promiſe euen ſo wee except god ſhould reueale meaning otherwiſe helpe without meanes bound doe action ſpirituall temporall neither haue peace otherwiſe whither enioy deſire doctrine haue great cauſe learne marke well matter life alſo concerning ſaluation muſt guided ſicknes pouerty bodily diſtreſſe wee feele cauſe complaine prayer faith vſe helpe phyſition labour diligently calling vſe good meanes haue occaſion godlines ſuffer obtaine come helpe want god hath promiſed trouble minde wherein haue large promiſes god vpholding comforting v repaire men brother skilfull wound ſo act 2 37 alſo heale god hath promiſed thereby like meanes ſend deliuerance ſlacknes negligence much taken heed greater bane faith waite promiſe yet another extremity auoided wel neglecting meanes aſcribe ſo much tie god thereto ſo vſe imagine cannot faile helpe deſire one theſe two extremity wicked men continually holden either vſe meanes hearing god hath elected ſaluation thoſe ſaue conclude elected ſhall ſaued howſoeuer liue whereas god hath praedeſtinated meanes well decreed ende vſe meanes attribute nothing god glory great wealth wiſedome trauaile haue gotten ſacrifice net thus much firſt point ſecond thing haue learne theſe men iudah doct 2 vſed helpe next neighbour simeon might commodiouſly doe thoſe farther ſo inſtruct v rom 12 10 20 ſhould loue readines helpe one another neede requireth luk 10 34 35 among neighbour vnkinde refuſing mutually aiding one another though could liue alone earth becauſe ſometimes haue neede one another though chriſts charge ſo little regarded louing one another reaſons wee ought haue great care dutie beſides chriſts commandement firſt ſeeing one time ſtand need helpe gift one another day thou morrow god hath dealt ſocieties men member bodie giuing euery member diſtinct facultie might agree good whole ſeeing none could well ſpared without blemiſh secondly neighbour ſet neere habitation end ſhould bee neerely knit together affection readier helpe farther benefit though greateſt trouble yet time amiable full comfort preſerued due daily meeting publike aſſemblies preaching word prayer vſe sacrament alſo priuately may conueniently good communication heb 10 24 25 kind greeting ſalutations auoiding wronging one another diſcourteſies word deede countenance whereto note ſubiect readily knowing nouriſh vphold neighbourhood loue thereby ſhew willing breake knot hindred ſelfeloue while euery man regardeth himſelfe onely moſt part eſpecially men frowardly churliſhly diſpoſed neede oft remember word sauiour ſaying hereby ſhall men know ye diſciples iohn 13 35 ye loue one another cannot tell commeth paſſe one man wolfe lion another yea euen ſuch dwell together neerer one towne naballike churliſhnes blockiſh miſchieuous behauiour ſhould alſo neerely linked together doe thereby take occaſion ſooner wearie one another contend alſo fall ſmall trifle ſhal want matter ſundrie way men carefull preuent ſame wherein yet worſe ſuch euer iarre one dwell neere doe couer ſinne anſwering agree well enough others farre whereas monſtrous deſerued bad report among know v ſeeth eaſie matter bee peace ſtrangers man hath dealing neither commeth oft company apoſtle teacheth ſhould fetch teſtimonie chriſtian behauiour good conſcience ſo much farre weſeldome come eſpecially wee dwell conuerſe vſually deale thus ſaith corinthian amongſt liued reioycing 2 cor 1 12 teſtimony conſcience ſimplicitie godly pureneſſe wee haue conuerſation world moſt toward draw end point alſo ſhould throughly reſolued euery good chriſtian grieue offend meaneſt liueth either priuat contention iniuring reprochfull note behauiour liue peaceably ſo much lieth rom 12 18 looke carefully ſo offer friendly good meaſure ſo may ſtop mouthes ill diſpoſed haue intereſt ſuch perſons god ſhal viſit bring chriſtian religion exhort ſo haue hope bring repentance thereby inioy fruit ſuch wiſe kind peaceable liuing loue inward comfort paſſeth vnderſtanding yet need breake v becauſe wee haue fellowſhip epheſ 5 11 vnfruitfull workes darkneſſe walke ſame exceſſe 1 pet 4 4 heb 12 14 riot doe muſt remember muſt ioyne ſpeech holineſſe though grieue v forgoe agreement cannot lawfully hold wee ſhould comforted haue ſought much v lieth thus haue ſhewed god people keepe neighbourhood loue one another may beware ſtrāgers neuer doth good ſo giue watchword vnruly diſobedient groſſe common contention iarres ſuch liue among wiſhing conſider weariſome make liues diſpleaſing therefore ſtudie liue quietly companion euill thinke thus god deare ſeruants ſometime diſagree liue vnkindly haue grace though haue ſome much ſhould begin auoid miſlike ſuch vncharitableneſſe ill part liues haue grace ſpeedily leſt bite one another conſumed one another galath 5 15 deny haue ſhew neighbourly fellowſhip among moſt chiefly wickedneſſe wherein many ioyne eaſily together concerning friendſhip inconſtant hollow onely friend haue would haue longer briefly way ſeeing haue ſaid adde word another ſort neereſt place kindred ſhould bee moſt neere affection law nature teacheth acknowledge much married couple ſee band loue broken ſtrange monſtrous let ſhame ſuch heare ſeeing hath ſpoken reproofe others offend way ſhall moſt condemne followeth next verſe verſ 4 iuda went vp lord deliuered canaanite perezites hand ſlew bezek ten thouſand men iudah commanded god ſo ſo ſaid hee went vp c ſo counſelled lord ſhould doe euen ſo hee knew mind ready obey condemneth raſh zeale many readie aske goe word pray congregation manner beſt conſider doe ſo though thought god pleaſed ſuch halfe ſeruice vſe much like saul forward ſacrifice thinking god highly pleaſed therewith obeying commandement god deſtroying amalekites farre halues ſo prophet samuel faine ſay hath god great 1 sam 15 22 pleaſure burnt ſacrifice voice ſhould obeyed behold obey better ſacrifice hearken better fat ram make ſhew much forwardneſſe haue heart readineſſe doe men pretend ſay lord lord bee willing doe abomination matth 7 21 pſalm 50 16 pſalm 51 6 deut 5 29 lord loueth truth inward part ſaith oh hart people keepe commandements alwaies might goe well god cannot abide men ſhould ſhew alſo ſeruant paul abhorred doe reade place corinthian ſaying would haue none thinke otherwiſe 2 cor 10 6 ſee thus ſee vſe ought make example iudah giue god honour wee pray reſort know ſo ready indeuour doe ſeeke faithfull true ſeruants vnto rather ſo accounted ſhall otherwiſe little comfort iudahs obeying let v ſee lord haue heard promiſe made thē god ſubduing canaanite ſhewed performed men iudah doct 2 ſlew 10000 men another people ioyned namely perezites alſo 7 curſed nation heere victorie briefly ſet maner gotten large laid forth verſes following reſt ſeeing armie great thought fled away king taken caught lord keeping promiſe iudah ſee prooued affirmed god hauing ſpoke word much hee done deed word deed one ſo great matter eſpecially promiſeth worthie regarded may ſay ſelues prophet ſaid former time father hoped diſappointed put truſt pſalm 22 5 confounded wee ſee hardly found men keepe promiſe cannot bee truſted word though promiſe yea bind oath though depended waightie caſes ſay ſhould make v thinke eſtate twice happie may allowed reſt put affiance god without feare diſappointed greateſt matter wee wait patiently wee may bee ſure ſhall come paſſe hath promiſed yea till heauen earth periſh one iot tittle matth 5 17 hath ſpoken ſhall faile fulfilled comfort ought bring beleeuing chriſtians haue promiſes made temporary deliuerances benefit eternall happineſſe oh wanting faith beleeue note beſides whereas one greateſt griefes god people ſee vile pſal 73 13 men proſper wickedneſſe flouriſh greene bay tree haue pleaſure honor wealth could looke whereby ſeeme men placed immortalitie yet ſeeing pſal 1 laſt certaine ſhall come naught deſtruction abide eſtate 2 pet 3 9 heb 10 mouth lord hath ſpoken patience contentment ſhould bee faithfull remaine conſtant hope well though haue many diſcouragements wait patience little ſeeing come come tarrie point often taught therefore ſhall ſuffice haue ſaid applie wee truth bad god threatnings promiſe hath applied beleeuers threaten ſtand ſurely pay home dealt nebuchadnezzar dan 4 31 32 others god deliuering canaanite hand wee muſt doct 3 know done without iniuſtice ſeuerity ſome wil ready enough thinke otherwiſe though mention made deſertes tranſgreſſions manifeſt scripture moſt grieuous appeares lord owne word booke geneſis hee would ſhew reaſon hee would hold poſteritie abraham ſo long ſeaſon egypt came land promiſe make namely ſins canaanite come ful time geneſ 25 16 fulfilled come paſſe therefore iuſtly puniſhed abraham ſeed long brought egyptian bondage ſinne canaanite growne ripe knowne god come great height though ſet downe yea though manifeſt read ſtorie yet cleare enough haue ſaid therefore ſuffered puniſhed moſt iuſtly ſo heare muſt perſwaded god dealeth moſt righteouſly viſitations iudgements though men alwaies ſee cauſe haue great need well learne ſeeing readie cain geneſ 4 13 charge god rigour hard dealing ſmalleſt occaſion yet neither haue argument vphold v might haue learned iob diſputing god gaue v nothing yet iob 9 3 ſhould owe v nothing indebted haue dauid confeſſed lord corrected whereas pſalm 51 6 might haue thought haue dealt hardly reproouing ſo ſharpely ſending ſo heauie meſſage prophet nathan yet dauid himſelfe confeſſeth fault haue ſo heinous 2 sam 12 7 c ſinne ſo great god ſhew mercie correcting rather ſeueritie added hee ſhould alwaies iuſtified pſalm 51 4 found righteous howſoeuer men ſhould iudge though men dare word denie ſhould aſked opinion concerning yet god taketh ſeuerally hand rod vpon themſelues rare ſhall mind ſo confeſſe note men eſpecially affliction bee long ſmarty yet lord iuſt dealing righteous rather crie impatiently handled men would afflictiō vpon thē ſtead ſuffer exhorted patience ask wicked king iehoram attend god longer ſo great calamity whereas hauing 2 king 6 33 mercifull reſpect v regardeth wee fit beare moderateth chaſtiſements accordingly promiſing lay 1 cor 10 13 v make v able goe vnder moſt certainly great ſin labor containe ſelues meekly ſee ſo much amiſſe ful eaſily may euill heart liues may ſay alwaies ſoreſt correcting v lord righteous euer bee praiſed secondly ſhould teach v take part wicked moning pitying ſo purſueth wee ſee hand god vpon rather iuſtifie god nay giue thanks vnto iuſt dealing although wiſh ſaluation yet wee may reioyce puniſhment euen mourne impunity prouoke eſpecially know enemy church ſeeing iudge time wee know iuſt god render 2 theſ 1 6 tribulation haue troubled eſtate afflicted vnknowne v although may aſſured god iuſt yet wee muſt condemne leaue god ſpeake little canaanite becauſe eſcaped long doct 4 ſo great offender yet met withall laſt teacheth v god alwaies ſuffer rod lie backe righteous ſo neither pſal 125 3 ſuffer wicked eſcape goe vnpuniſhed bee reuenged due time yea quickly whereas yet luk 18 8 thinke cleane contrary imagine bee puniſhed ſoone haue treſpaſſed ſhall neuer come reckoning therefore merrily promiſe themſelues ſay doubtleſſe bitterneſse 1 sam 15 32 death paſſed thinke god neither doe euill good nay begin applaud themſelues wicked doings wee may ſee pſalme lord himſelfe chargeth pſal 50 21 therefore like scripture commeth fit ſeaſon vrged vpon ſuch though cry peace peace caſt remembrance 1 theſ 5 3 puniſhment behind backes yet god ſet face yea make ſmart ſtung adder hornet ſinne moſt certainely finde haman cruelty eſter 7 10 malice powred againſt god people great ioy notwithſtanding alſo king countenancing backing therein yet ſnare ſet ſumptuous banquet prayer faithfull receiued iuſt puniſhment doings little looked ſuch matter iezabell ſuffered goe forward murthers ſpirituall whoredomes along time ſparing lord faithfull prophet elia 2 king 9 30 31 c threatned death alſo ſhe middeſt pride braying boldly againſt lord auenger iehu comming doe execution vpon caſt downe window owne eunuch great diſgrace braines ſquaſhed againſt ſtones till ſhe made dogges meate doung former glory ſame might ſay infinite ſcorned heare thing iudgement comming againſt yet made vnlike luk 12 20 perſons iollitie neuer bin rich man goſpell epicure euen one ſhould ſee luk 16 22 23 goodly palace rich furniture thereof burned vnto aſhes simile ala ſpeaking ſuch thing new generation riſen vp farre gone iniquity yea adding alſo ſinnes ſtrange fearefull made wiſe former example though come ſhort abomination ſay haue one thing waſh away remembrance ſuch workes god tuſh tell ſhall like puniſhments bee ſcared time feare god iudgements theeues hue crie giue bee paſt peepe hole fall trade freſh til found taken ſo doe theſe turne away kinde people fearing doe loſe labour beſtow word haue hope preuaile doe good ignorant right worthy good chriſtians doe ſometime fall diſeaſe rocked ſleepe mentioned ſome particular falles haue found ſweetnes ſome baites ſinne haue ſo farre forgot themſelues ſnared deceitfulnes thereof haue begun thinke good continue ſtill ſo loath diſeaſed loue thinke time behold point beſt may eaſily brought god come againſt ſo diſguiſed fiue matth 25 5 wiſe virgin begin nodde nay church canticle cant 5 1 fall ſleepe doubtleſſe dangerous eſtate godly chriſtians vnbeſeeming ſome perhaps ſay doth puniſhment canaanite concerne theſe anſwere concernes much though ſeated ſaped ſinne like haue ſpoken already therefore danger puniſhed like yet ſinne great haue bin tenderly regarded lord haue ſet loue ſweet hony combe haue aduanced honour greater prince ſonnes daughter lord almighty yea haue ſworne dauid pſal 109 106 therefore ſhould performe keepe righteous iudgements looke backe onely sodome giue place euill luſts ſo farre take liking pleaſe themſelues vnfruitfull workes darkenes ſo could content ſtill ſolace themſelues therein periury againſt god treachery itſelfe ſinne ſuch perſons commit moſt fearefull horrible eſpie betimes ought haue preuented ſhunned firſt entrance god rouſe note coſt terror abaſhment eſpecially haue fallen ſo oftentimes haue experience woe hath brought time paſt could riſe vp againe torment hell lay could returne yet would haue man take thus though thought man truly conuerted god alwaies one ſame ſtate libertie ſerue god holde ſame meaſure grace time though might poſſibly yea eaſily euill note rom 7 19 heart great part remaineth luſting euill rebellious againſt god though might ſay eaſily carried euill pſal 30 6 7 time wholly abhorreth hath victory ouer doe deny may beſt nouriſh theſe ill deſires delight ſo danger commit ſinne hath drawen heart bee made drunken whether whoredome reuenge vniuſt dealing c ſo may come paſſe ſay changeth ſweet life ſowernes ſhew danger ſuch boldnes doth vtterly diſguiſe make profeſſion rediculus let ſee grow hee may vnderſtand god dealeth ſuch manner firſt ſuffereth vnſetled courſe ſo ſerue god awkly vntowardly goeth worke vſeth dull edged inſtruments cannot pray walke roundly cheerefully calling full vnquietnes much grudge conſcience taſt hell continue many houres dayes yet heauier burden greater bondage note yet relent vnſetled ſee themſelues thus far way godlines greater danger like follow ſhall hardened ſo farre repentance fall euill worſe till breaking open offence bee met withall requited ſundry open ſhamefull puniſhments lord manner dealing owne euen dealeth vngodly firſt warne ſecretly accuſation conſcience doe good call backe caſteth bodily viſible iudgement ſo beſtende haue rom 6 21 bad doings goe backe ſhame ſorrow whereas might haue ſhunned haue liued peace comfort duly conſidered hath made mee oft maruell men ier 31 18 19 know careleſſe yet bee ſo quiet think much ſinne committed ſuch perſons cannot ignorant haue done ſhould put vp ſo cleanely ſleepe vpon ſo eaſily ought trouble euen ſtomacke ouercharged ſeeketh vnburdened ſay thinke ſhould haue note ſmall peace within ſo much may bee ſeene bee amiſſe without let ſet faire face bad doings yet whole men goe god wil mocked muſt caſt vp vnſauorie gorge clenſe hart hand euill iames 4 8 god accept take knowledge conſcience tender like apple eie ſuffer violence loade ſo great burden knowne ſinnes muſt need cauſe cry doe true repentance ſeeke god mercie eaſe penitent ſoule cannot feele leaſt violence offered conſcience ſinne committed crieth cured therefore giue greater cauſe cannot bee good caſe ſet light hauing ſo ſore offended thus much occaſion canaanite ſinne followeth 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 third sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges vers 5 found adonibezek bezek fought againſt ſlew canaanite perezites vers 6 adonibezek fled purſued caught cut thumbes hand foot vers 7 adonibezek ſaid seuenty king hauing thumbes hand feete cut gathered bread vnder table haue done ſo god hath rewarded brought ieruſalem died make entrance theſe verſes haue read yee haue ſenſe heard god gaue victorie ſhewed particularly victorie mentioned gotten place ſet downe battel fought bezek king people mentioned adonibezek fled battell weake taken handled ſet downe text wit hee thumbes hand feete cut whether men iuda knew ſo dealt whether lord directed ſo doe without knowing ſuch thing expreſſed himſelfe confeſſed hee done ſo others god requited like ſaid canaanite puniſhment inflicted vpon ſin growne ripe may truly ſaid king owne confeſſion may gathered hauing ſpoken point alreadie omit ſay ſeeing adonibezek taken fled thumb cut verſ 5 doct cut others theſe verſes let v firſt note god meaſures men euen meaſure mete others according word sauiour meaſure ye mete ſhall bee meaſured matth 7 1 againe haue done ſo ſhall dealt lord confirmes truth ſaith ſheddeth man blood geneſ 9 6 man ſhall blood ſhed rightly verified haman many point firſt accuſed god people vniuſtly ſo charged king himſelfe yet guilty note condemned without ſolemne iudgement ſeeing done ſo others handled moſt reprochfully adiudged moſt ſhamefull puniſhment yet none pitied wonderfull thing ſpoken one ſo great fauor king euen becauſe pitileſſe towards might verified true afterward written iudgement ſhall bee mercileſſe iames 2 13 ſheweth mercy hanged vpon gallows ſet vp godly mordecay ſay ſtil euen ſcripture might fulfilled euery way done ſo might done eſter 7 10 hee purpoſed doe done alreadie god account wee may bring neerer ſelues many among v complaine wronged dealing men euill ſpoken ſlandred railed vpon ſay many way abuſed thinke receiue hard meaſure men hand hereby maruell complaine none vſed blindnes note couereth eies doe liue know leaſt owne conſciences tell haue dealt euen ſo thereby haue giuen cauſe ſo dealt withall againe oh blind ſelfeloue cannot ſee doe ſee meane thinkes tolerable one ſelfe yet hee accuſeth condemneth another ſeeth iuſt iudgement god vpon himſelfe men wronging hee himſelfe iuſt deſ •• t hath brought vpon owne head hereof thus tell truth ſinne hath found haue eares heare v waroe like offender puniſhment commeth god wil ſame manner auenged yet beleeue v till hee viſit ſome ſuch heauie manner indeed ioſephs brother begin ſay remember ſinne day euen haue done geneſ 42 21 v ſo wee haue done cruell king adonibezek ſayd seuentie king thumb haue cut c haue done ſo god hath note rewarded men ſhall come either god fauour amendment diſpleaſure hardning confuſion therfore wiſedome confeſſe time wee may bee taught told men conſciences crie true haue word deed iniuried haue receiued ſuch meaſure themſelues kind particular manner offended yet ſure haue done ſome way ſo haue iuſt cauſe wel waigh looke god hand therein beare ſuch indignity count offered meekeneſſe contentedly god dealt thus men would neuer acknowledge diſlike ſinne guiltie ſuffer lie ſecret worke miſchiefe whereas yet ferreted ſuch iudgements god cannot confeſſe eſpecially bee great feare danger death v warned wee haue part ſin common ſort wee haue ſmitten others tongue wronged intended euill way againſt learne wee great regard put ſpeedy end thereto repentance leſt god awake preuent v ſome ſuch like iudgement againe haue cauſed end put wee theſe two leſſons practiſe neither heart word deed offer hard vnequall meaſure man offer rom 12 21▪ v poſſible may without great hurt let v quietly meekely paſſe make great matter time ſhall come wherein ſhall wiſh wee done ſo haue laid ſo neere heart might eaſily haue paſſed v ſaying god hath rewarded noted heathen verſ 7 doct idolater could ſee ſo farre aſcribe god affliction whereby may ſee bad men doe acknowledge god ſtriker puniſher ſhould learne though good acknowledge yet many haue baptized doe come curſe ban rage fret affliction cry ill fortune call ſo farre reſting iuſtice god ſay hee hath done righteouſly alſo aſcribe chance fortune calamity ſo doe runne helpe witch sorcerer oppreſſed greatly conuicting ſhould much ſee hand god viſited heathen haue ſeene ſo farre aſcribe god trouble confeſſe ſinne adonibezek onely checketh ſuch haue mentioned laieth hard pſalm 95 20 charge alſo make ſome ſhew goodneſſe yet doe harden heart vnder affliction know god way though ſee well enough ſuffer euill deed neither relent feare iudgements though cannot deny due deierts particularly ſuch heathen king ſhall riſe iudgement againſt ſuch profeſſors ſee crueltie vnmercifulneſſe vncleanneſſe nouriſh themſelues oppreſſions alſo iniuries doe neighbour though bee moſt clearely laid yet pharaoh ſuch haue eſpecially god hand heauie vpon acknowledged lord done euen exod 9 27 wickedeſt man owne conſcience ſometimes accuſeth hee doth euil ought theſe much haue farre greater light tremble haue ſo groſſely offended ſay againſt thee againſt thee lord haue done euill eſpecially know danger thereby heauie plague hang ouer head ſame although ſuch muſt goe ſo euen tell themſelues god one vnleſſe acknowledge fault alſo ſubmit themſelues word teacheth howſoeuer ſhall pleaſe correct withall reſolue condition liues whatſoeuer indeuour readie obey alſo ſhould teach v receiue indignity men hand yet doct 2 2 sam 16 10 looke god ſet work againſt v dauid ſaid shemei dog doth catch ſtone leaue ſmiter though haue wronged v willingly yet wee conſidered lord ſhould leſſe mooued offended inſtrument whereas ſide beate braines ſtraine ſelues al purſue ſeeke reuenged yet lord ſufficiently puniſh wrong haue done example wee ſo quiet word ſpoken againſt v treaſon meane doe thinke haue prouoked lord ſtirre vp ſuch ill perſons againſt v adonibezek ſee would aſſcribe iſraelites ſaith god thus vnto furthermore heare crueltie thus laid doct 3 owne mouth played tyrant againſt many thoſe meaner perſons king cut thumb hand feete ſome euen ſeuentie perſons wee ſee raging furie vice crueltie depth euil carrieth men wiſely conſider fouleneſſe ſhamefulneſſe whereas one man ſhould ſociable another yea ſtrangers occaſion offered ſeeing euery one neighbour crueltie cutteth fellowſhip luk 10 37 nay libertie inioying ſuch benefit peace good like cruel man farre worſe thiefe yet odious driuen frō habitation men free dwelling houſes loathſome priſon among brutiſh companion vnleſſe cruell alſo content take ſhare good robbeth cruell man content ſhare might ſutable mind haue one time purſueth yea wil thruſt houſe home yea world alſo ſatiſfied caine little corrupt eſtate thing entred world geneſ 4 8 patterne cruel one cauſe giuen abel innocent brother hard handling yet becauſe accepted god himſelf hate without cauſe moſt vnnatural monſtrous roſevp againſt ſlue pharaoh exod 5 9 almoſt tyred poore people god ſtrangers land burden toile aſmuch could beare yet ſatisfied therewith made burthen farre greater til life vnwelcome death itſelfe crueltie might manifeſt haman ſo exceeded herein little take good god people eſter 7 4 hold bondman vnleſſe hee might haue liues alſo ſhould ſpeake iezabel woman exceeded men cruell alſo rehoboams cruell handling ſubiects ſtorie declareth ioſephs brother conſented ſell far countrey whence might neuer returne trouble hoped moſt agreed take away life alſo yet killed euen themſelues loſt liues alſo famine god ſent afterwards preſerued ioſeph among men theſe might make crueltie odious v many heare deſire know manner thing rageth ſort like flaming fire deuoureth deſtroyeth commeth demand godly briefly ſatisfie may therefore ceaſe maruelling fury crueltie meane bringeth ſuch ſtrange effect forth may know vile vitious habit cuſtome whereby men carried thing harſh hard beyond courſe compaſſe reaſon men thus ſet vpon deale led without reaſon much without religion chuſe bee rigorouſly handled cruellie delt fall hand maketh cruell man bee hated ſuch barbarous vnciuell ſucked dragon deſert heart ſo bound ſinewes iron ſpoile purſue raging raine tempeſt rendeth tree deſtroyeth fruites mooued life man dogge fallen therefore maruell dauid hauing choice plague preſented made preſent exception owne nature kind fearing knowing crueltie men ſaying let fall hand man heathen seneca ſaw ſaid thou art deceiued thou giueſt credit lookes thoſe meet thee haue face men mind wild beaſts ſpake man generall would haue ſaid particularly cruell man ſpeech common burne kill cut poiſon young old men woman brother kindred eate meate whoſoeuer doe croſſe miſtaken word wrie countenance word blow though murther vpon light occaſions haue gaine death haue inough take pleaſure whither might man goe argument giue inſtance lower matter kind hereof one neighbour bee treſpaſſed another corne commodity cattell way though bee without fault hath done treſpaſſe readie rage furie ſeeke reuenge laming hurting cattell hee would doe owner like lamech durſt ſpite railing exacting hand ſixe time valew damage detriment ſuſtained though annoy worſe manner yet maketh nothing ſhift cruell part thing ſo little valew vnto neighbour would hee doe thinke wee like minded matter waight ſtranger ſo much may call ſuch dealing crueltie ſeeing offered ſuch one treſpaſſeth another time farre worſe manner himſelfe like may ſaid cruell landlord maſters guardian stepmother c meaſure offend againſt themſelues though diuers degree many kind foule vice crueltie yet muſt know leaſt loweſt vnſeemely man odious indeed noiſome furious bee accompanied enuy therefore salomon ſaith ſtand enuy enuious prou 27 4 obſtinate cannot bee reconciled therefore whatſoeuer meaſure offered ſuch certaine ſhall hard inough ſeeing prou 12 10 mercy crueltie remaineth ſuch perſons doe end may poſſible caſt crueltie moſt filthie loathſome garment giue themſelues reſt til become odious loathſome hard obtaine perſwaded looke odiouſneſſe hath found may fall downe lord feete mercie couer fouleneſſe forgiue beleeued imbrace gentleneſſe mercie kindneſſe toward others ſtead rigor like act 16 30 iaylor actes though vſedg reat crueltie againſt paul silas yet hee repented waſh wound moſt louingly ſcourging made body ſet meate houſe moſt chearefully thruſt hungry inward priſon moſt cruelly alſo let teach v pray wee bee giuen ouer hand vnreaſonable vnconſcionable men abſurd cruell malice apoſtle willeth people pray 2 theſ 3 giue thanks wee haue 2 theſ 3 2 either kept pray ſuch deuourers mercifully ſnatcht iawes coſtly garment fire paſſe let v weigh vſed crueltie vpon ſeuentie doct 4 king ſo ſatiſfied ten twentie time continuing cruelty toward ſo many three time twentie would haue done ſame many hundred time hee cut ſo hindred god much mercie prouideth ſuch doings ſhall haue end may learne men haue entred bad courſe neuer time leaue come eſpecially haue benefit thereby take liking delight therein moſt profit delight growne cuſtome simon magus long time bewitched samaria ſorceries euen act 8 9 c almoſt whole citie neuer went deſiſt practiſe till againſt broken preaching phillip demeirius actes 19 24 siluersmith done like another kind citie epheſians deceiuing people along time owne gaine making ſiluer ſhrines temple idol diana ſo true man fall particular ſinne twice readier commit twenty time think himſelfe note breaking making lie falſe ſwearing deceiuing breaking sabbath picking ſtealing like bad tempering needleſſe medling way peter may bee ſeene neuer went ſo farre intend purpoſe euill demanded queſtion ſudden hee looked whither chriſts diſciple denied truth feare againſt mark 14 17 conſcience hauing ſo done asked ſame ſecond time ſo againe third time prouoked ſo denied oath curſing himſelfe knew man iehoſophat could warned forbeare fellowſhip ahab ſonne iehoram hauing ſuffered himſelfe take pleaſure therein though ſharpe warning ſmarted alſo ſame sampſon loue philiſtine woman ſuffering vnlawfully moue queſtion tended looſing life grace god moſt precious becauſe cut neither ſtaied firſt anſwered ſhould haue done though ment tell ſecret ſhe asked yet anſwered trifled ſo long needleſſe dangerous talke laſt importunitie ſhe got ſhe ſought hee neuer ment ſhee ſhould obtaine till hee found late yeeld giue place euill though twice breaking water cutting banck holdeth ſimile ouerflowing much ground ſpoileth ſo making breach conſcience yeelding giuing place euill note little layeth open man much bondage anoyance thereby ſo goeth runneth pace top high ſteepe downe hill able ſtay till come bottome truth verified ſo many thing salomon hath moſt liuely exemplified prou 23 27 one ſaying harlot deepe graue narrow pit falleth hardly get eſcape therefore come make vſe hath ſaid wee know counſell rule phyſition giueth preſeruing health namely wee ſhould reſiſt beginning danger ſo ſhall free euill would follow ſame meete ſuch bee followed deſire inioy ſpirituall health ſoules may feare well take great heed firſt inticed deceitfulneſſe ſinne reſiſt ſtrongly delight kindled dally tempted leſt bee alſo hardned doe ſhall purging corruption finde fruit holy counſell promiſe goſpell watch pray ſo ſhall yee fall matth 26 41 temptation oh ſome could haue done ioſeph haue gen 39 12 note inticed could haue ſhaken leaudneſſe euil heart eaſe freedome might haue walked haue giuing place luſts kurbing vp due time brought themſelues loathſome ſtate life continuall bondage confutes reprooued ſinne excuſe themſelues like child firſt time went ſo farre could eaſily deſiſt dally woman maydens vnchaſe ſpeech pſalm 51 5 behauiour euill thought many fall degree commit folly nay filthineſſe becauſe reſiſted dalliance nipt curſed fruit bloſſome remaineth verſe queſtion good purpoſe iſraelites kill tyrant adonibezek hand reſerue bondage die ſo anſwere god giuing commandement ſpare canaanite hee hauing cruell ſome god bee ſure inclined heart doe ſo might haue meaſure hee offered alſo might knowne hee died warre ſome glory vnmeet ſo cruell perſon ſhould haue ſo honeſt death another queſtion may bee concerning himſelfe tyrant ſo ſhamefully defaced diſmembred ſo many king yet would haue feed vnder table doubt remember ſhew glory victory made feede ſo baſely vnder foot dogges gather fel board ſatisfie proud vaineglorious humor therewith well pleaſing eares filled muſicke firſt namely fact iſraelites may learne meet monſtrous doings vilanies perſons wrought ſhould made odious according deſert murtherers prince lord annointed bee put extreameſt torment fearefull death haue certified exquiſit torture lately executed france vpon popiſh baſe fellow imbrued hand blood soueraigne wilfull common murtherers hanged vp chaines view vnnaturall killing neighbour companion ſo meete malefactor ſhould dealt withall according wicked way according commandement god euil may taken away land ſaid ioab lawes haue well prouided many 1 king 2 31 ſuch pleaſed gouernours thinke well atheiſts blaſphemers adulterer might haue ſhare among reſt according deſerts caſe would bee much better v many degree day ſaid occaſion firſt queſtion ſecond anſwer adonibezek glorying crueltie ſubduing ſo many king vnder pleaſure philiſtines liſted called sampſon priſon eies put make paſſe time giues occaſion v conſider exceſſiue pride luſt badneſſe people preſent age behind former therein god hath brought ſwadling cloutes came naked world wherein like haue miſcarried thouſand time able runne ſo ſhiftleſſe vnable helpe themſelues ſay place miſery beſides yet ſooner ſhell vſe ſay come man eſtate ſhew themſelues world plaiers ſtage leſſe diſguiſed ſtomacks behauiour quality many apparell eſpecially great borne thing admirable ſee profaneneſſe licentiouſneſſe riot gaming ſuch like intemperance euery ſeene owne pleaſure care dominere ouer inferiours vnder ripen pace kinde euill elſe moſt part bee learned ſuch ſeruice ſeeke match equal italienate faſhions diſguiſed carriage themſelues deſire riſe vp higher place better chiefly end may haue libertie doe euill tyrant tooke pleaſure kind ſins liked yet admirable thing heathen idolater euen ſo doe men age liuing vnder goſpel ſhould bluſh heare ſeeke pleaſeth god hath ſet vp owne pleaſure ſo vſuall common among many greater ſort taken vp among meaner alſo ſo much many degenerate profeſſion thereby become little better countrie vers 10 iudah went againſt canaanite dwelt hebron hebron time called kiriatharbah ſlew sheſhai ahiman talmai vers 11 thence hee went inhabitant debir name debir old time kiriathsepher theſe verſes follow 17 verſe repeated ſenſe book ioſhua chiefly 15 chapter brought hither end may vnderſtand tribe iudah poſſeſſed ieruſalem ioſhua yet aliue therefore might eaſilier better bring adonibezek thither priſoner thing repeated ioſhua partly theſe foure verſes haue read namely taking ieruſalem hebron debir fighting againſt canaanits dwelt mountaines partly thoſe thing following afterward 16 verſe ſhall ſhewed come vnto repeated manifeſt hereby declared chapter ioſhua king ieruſalem taken brought hand people god child iudah dwelt iebuſites 17 verſe holy ſtorie returneth ſet downe iudah many iudging matter caſe good deſire haue ſuch giue ſentence iudgement doubtfull cauſes rather others though ſet greatly religion themſelues ought incourage v labour god grace ſeeing make man ſtand honorable though money fauour reſpects chiefe gift moſt obtaine great place whereas doubt may ariſe ſaid iudah taken ieruſalem appeares haue ſo ſeeing expreſly ſet downe ioſhua chap 10 anſwere though bee plainely ſo obiection anſwere ſaid yet may well vnderſtood thing written namely king ieruſalem taken put death iudah dwelt citie could caſt iebuſits dwelt therein ſay appeareth citie taken generally verſe iudah fought againſt canaanite dwelt mountaine toward verſ 9 10 south low country particularly againſt dwelt hebron ſo diſcribeth citie another name giuen former time kiriatharba citie one arba ioſh 15 13 giant father anak anak hauing three ſonnes sheſhai ahiman talmai iudah ſlew theſe anakims ſo called father mighty tall ſtrong appeareth many scripture ſo deſcribeth goliah gath ſhaft 1 sam 17 7 ſpeare like weauers beame ſpeaketh ſpies went view land canaan returning feared people report ſtature ſaying themſelues graſſehoppers num 13 34 theſe giantlike men therefore thoſe vnder taken away benefit muſt needes bee child iſrael though theſe properly called anakims giant kind poſteritie remaine vexe faithfull chriſtians god church yet haue many kind enemy ſo alwaies ſhall ſhall doe ſame people god cruell ſcorneful contemners humble innocent iſraelites make liues vnpleaſant grieuous burden lay vpon deadly feare hold take life away alſo yet make weariſome ſo many deuoure themſelues theſe therefore may well called giant therefore god ſhal weaken ſuch anakims abate power take away cannot bee reclaimed brought repentance eſter 8 16 muſt counted ſingular mercy god world full ſuch prouerb verified might ouercommeth right men haue power authoritie wealth ſo deale liue others hold continuall ſlauery feare thus pharaoh giant ſonne anak ioſepbs poſteritie laying burthen vpon could beare thinking oppreſſed enough ſo added yet vnto alſo thus play part giant grind face poore ſound reaſon euen commandement god diſwading vtterly vnſauorie crauing pity hand vaine apparent ſutes controuerſies betwixt mightie meane one eating vp bread ſuch ſet place chaſe away wickedneſſe receiuing deuouring gift hand guilty lionlike roaring againſt innocent ſo ſucking aduantage liuing ſinnes people giant better anakims ſuch like aggricuances groned vnder godly eares lord deliuered ſuch burden haue great cauſe reioycing praiſe god people brought back captiuitie ſaying mouth full laughter tongue filled ioy pſalm 126 2 enough becauſe haue ſpoken like point verſ 7 goe forward ſtory ſaid iudah reſted verſ 7 ioſh 10 26 theſe deſtructions canaanite many mentioned booke ioſhua proceeded take debir another citie ſcituated hebron next verſe meane ſeaſon conſidered vnwearied iudah ſaid haue worke lord euen procuring deſtruction enemy canaanite ioſhua hee liued chiefe guide reſt diligence going one peece worke another ſhould notable incouragement ſeruants god worke ſets ſhould doe negligently ſtand ſtay good beginning though done ſufficiently alreadie muſt repeat labour cumbats paſt though done enough looke thoſe come apoſtle teacheth epiſtle philippian carefully philip 3 13 regarded whether performing outward duty theſe men iuda inward reſiſting temptation patient bearing affliction like ſhould alwaies vnwearied worke lord end god hath promiſed ſtrength armour chriſtian thus meet al ſuch grow ſtrength ſtrength faith faith god hath giuen commandement verifie written salomon righteous ſhineth light vnto perfit day rom 1 17 prou 4 18 plant rooted good ground doe burniſh ſpread branch bring foorth fruite plentifully ſuch muſt know note ſore diſcouragement weaker chriſtians ſhall ſee dampes deadneſſe ancienter profeſſors haue ſometimes prouokers ſtirrers vp others duty godlineſſe great blemiſh doubtleſſe may iuſtly charged doe ſo beſide inconueniences one beateth ſtrong conceit heart weake find liking god ſeruice told promiſed word god heare god truſted ſetting forth ſo large offer priuiledges therein though wearie weldoing affirme rancke blaſphemie ſhould ſo know ſuch meane god hath put ſervice ought long continuance therein houſe bee father procure ſeeke good weaker ſort brother haue great care none become faint example therefore ſhine light grow daily grace 2 pot 3 17 knowledge lord ieſus oh comely others behold owne glory ſee follow lord ſtil directing going time paſt like caleb fortie fiue yeere ioſh 14 8 lord ſet work one two counted faithfull reſt ſtrong fit hee ſo many yeeres know rare thing partly ſeeing liue ſo long partly ſeeing many waxe ſoone wearie well either haue meanes ſet forward elſe haue deſire vſe delight beſide many diſcouragements therefore ſay rare thing ſee men faithfull conſtant long time note goodneſſe ſo much commendable may bee found oh good thing alwaies conſtant good matter deny gal 4 18 beſt may eaſily doe wiſe virgin begin nod matth 25 5 church canticle fall ſleepe therefore needfuller quickned vp god promiſes incouragements cant 5 2 ſaith ouercommeth giue tree life reu 2 7 euerlaſting life ſuch like alſo quicken vp themſelues haue matth 26 41 ſaid diligent watching feruent prayer c periſh wicked world liue among know faithfulneſſe conſtancie therein grow laſt perſeuerance good end conflicting day muſt depart many ill action bad company make themſelues merry ſuch ſhal begin think reward life come wil anſwerable loſſe pleaſure forgoe reward yet hundreth fold euen matth 19 29 life beſide happineſſe afterwards let caſt account begin feare nothing owne weakeneſſe let diſcouraged god ſtrength let caſt care pſalm 27 1 care thus haue ſaid matter may eaſily ſeene take right courſe happineſſe theſe 1 pet 5 7 men iuda hold conſtantly vnwearied well notwithſtanding diſcouragements temptation oppoſition contrary fifth sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges vers 12 caleb ſaid ſmiteth kirlah sepher taketh euen giue acſah daughter wife vers 13 othniel ſonne kenaz calebs younger brother tooke gaue acſah daughter wife vers 14 ſhe came aske father field ſhe lighted aſſe caleb ſaid vnto wilt thou vers 15 ſhe anſwered giue bleſsing thou haſt giuen south country giue alſo ſprings water caleb gaue ſprings aboue ſprings beneath citie debir ſaid time paſt called kiriahſepher ſenſe verſ 12 23 citie one sepher put difference betwixt ſome name ſaid caleb ſeeing difficultie winne city offered reward would ſet vpon muſt againe put reader mind theſe thing
