ioſhua 10 38 winne becauſe inheritance othniel mentioned perſon tooke enioyed reward ſaid meaning theſe two verſes reconciling place cited ioſhua benefit wee reape hence manifold firſt difficultie danger winning doct 1 citie giueth v learne marke going duty particular calling warring againſt theſe city canaanite muſt thinke ſtrange ſome part life ſometime incumbred part time ſhould diſcouraged diſquieted ſee pſalm 30 6 pſal 42 4 5 ſo euen theſe good ſeruants god find ſo ſome part work ſome yet breake wiſely bethinke themſelues ouercome difficultie ordinarie paine care buſineſſe required like may ſaid religious duty generall calling concerning firſt ſecond table alwaies confidence ioy cheerefulneſſe diligence feruency vſe priuate meanes fruitfulneſſe note good others find theſe come much difficultie ſometime reſpect others commeth paſſe chance neither men vſe ſay prouidence god moſt iſely diſpoſeth ſo may oftentimes ſo v haue hard ſucceſſe leſt ſhould diſcouraged alſo leſt ſhould bring worke good point ſay labour ſhould loſt vaine nothing ſhould goe forward husbanding ground ſowing reaping worke belonging weather ſhould alwaies dropping although often ſo yet hee ſeeth conuenient ſometime men ſhould find ſo meane hardneſſe bring worke paſſe ſome difficultie though haue skill end may haue proofe patience ſuch time bee thankfull god falleth ſo oftentimes haue good ſucceſſe moſt part alſo may learne experience againſt like time contented ſhall ſo fall againe ſo may ſhew one euen tener life much may bee euery part note ſome equalitie care contentment cheerefulneſſe hope patience bee carried extremity many occaſions offered come paſſe daily ought guide men calling action liues well thing go againſt goe may al eſtates thankful reade holy iob eſpecially ſeeing know god ordereth iob 1 21 good ſucceſſe alſo contrary good husbandman hindred ſometime rainy weather yet ſo hath ſeaſons free doe buſineſſe artificer troubled putting away ware falling price ſo cannot alwaies make aduantage ordinarily doth maintaining himſelfe charge god changeth thoſe time ſo doe alwaies keepe one ſtay good miniſter ſometime troubled careleſneſſe prophaneneſſe people grieued ill ſucceſſe ſeeth labour god giueth incouragement againe ſome doe regard miniſtery receiue goſpell amendment ſaluation beſides diligenteſt labourer preaching oft ſeeke neceſſarie helpes life due rarely find ſeldome meet need ſoeuer haue get truly paid miniſtery ſo little account men world ſort greateſt number woman place haue many croſſings husband ſeruants child matter familie beſide vnlooked accident trouble ſee doe cauſe many 2 king 6 33 ſeaſoned grace ſauing knowledge bee exceedingly impatient diſquiet order therefore religious ſhould vnder like croſſes better gouerned though enioy many comfort married eſtate ſhould euer anon bee frame vnquiet ſort enioy benefit eſtate god hath allowed doe many teſtifie particular manner might ſhew diſapointments al ſorts people meet haue labouring man part behind reſt finding much hardneſſe meanes poore eſtate great price neceſſarie thing ſometimes eſpecially ſhould long ſhould ſtand vpon particular theſe wee adde diſapointments croſſes ill debters ſutes law loſſe friend vpholders liued diſeaſes ſicknes thouſand cannot remembred may ſee ariſe many thing condition dealing make ſome part men liues hardlier paſſed peace quietnes good liking though haue moſt part good ſucceſſe vſually labour ſome eaſe haue ſaid doe ſet downe matter hand may ſee wiſdome mercy god herein mixeth together becauſe life ſhould ſmoothly carried eaſily paſſed ſhould made thereby vnfit change eſpecially great trial come ſo likewiſe ſhould moſt part tedious troubleſome ſhould nothing manner wearineſſe diſcomfort therefore ſorts ſhould ſeeke god fauour ſo may alſo bee vnder gouernment eſtates ſo may daily keepe ſo aboue thing eſtate life onely hath promiſe bleſſing euery calling condition wanting confuſion moſt part breaketh amongſt men vnquiet trouble doe moſt vncomfortably go vnder difficulty alſo enioy freedome proſperitie euen beſt eſtate vnprofitable offenſiue troubleſome ſeeme ſtrange god thus diſpoſeth men trauels dealing ſucceſſe vncertaine let looke end doth ſo ſet downe namely much troubled many caſualities fall liues muſt know otherwiſe would keepe compaſſe therefore god ſeeth 1 pet 1 7 meet ſometime ſhould ſo another thing noted caleb hee ſaw required courage well skill aduenture ſet vpon citie doct 2 deſtroying god enemy hee commanded promiſeth daughter would ſet vpon ſmall matter offered marke haue ſhewed may ſee hee ſhew forwardneſſe rooting god enemy teacheth matth 5 12 13 lord ſake ought doe much yet count great matter doe aduance name helpe ſetvp true worſhip ſincere preaching goſpell ouerthrowing enemy ſuch like ſeruice euery man ought ready willing abaſed heb 10 33 note countenance weakened wealth ſuſtaine much hardſhip need dauid may brought ſet none meaneſt roomes behalfe dauid dancing michael saul daughter looked window diſpiſed 2 sam 6 16 thinking baſe thing king doe ſo anſwered lord would yet ſake vile eſter eſter 4 16 bringing people god deſolation vtter rooting put life danger ſaying periſh periſh moſes paul deſired exod 32 32 rom 9 3 rather periſh people god ſhould forſaken ſo god glory empeached ſhould theſe meane ſuch well euen king queenes lay downe crownes foot aduance hath honoured aboue others much wee meane inferiours ſhould think ſelues happie may bee imployed thing haue might doe ſeruice according written mark 1 loueth father mother marke 1 31 worthie true indeed wee ſhould loue nothing ſo well ſhould forgoe lord cauſe therefore ſaith giue thine heart ſonne ſhould reioyce aske prou 23 26 take thing haue yeeld readineſſe ought ſee may iuſtly complaine ſay wee like thoſe child hauing gotten father hand caſt flouriſh boldly haue gotten ſpeake thinke ſee mine owne eies god hath inriched men manifold bleſſings one many conſidereth hath receiued inioyeth glorieth 1 cor 4 7 owne ſetteth himſelfe anothers good though hee owed nothing receiued yet aggrauate ſin muſt need adde one thing perſwaded greatly ſhame conuiction many papacie ſhal neuer haue reward brought error many thing giue much ſuperſtitious zeale end may bee ſaued doe god neuer required hand therfore amiſſe ought haue learned better readily commanded eſpecially reward certaine doe merit ſhall neuer attaine ought much doe duty commanded belieue haue beſt thing freely promiſed meane eternall life alſo due time ſhall bee giuen v god meere mercie bountie caleb would giue daughter ſhould wee much giue ſome part ſubſtance feede hungry helpe cloath naked may yet reſerue ſufficient ſelues beſides whereas truth little wee doe good vſes wee might honour god caleb could affoord beſt thing yet v thought much little doe way leſt wee ſhould hinder ſelues end verſe caleb godly man well renowned doct 3 approoued grace greatneſſe ſaving hee would giue daughter wife ſheweth hee well learned moſes deut 7 3 doctrine whoſe day liued namely point many child diſpoſe owne marriage father though many haue loſt honour way vnfitter make choice child themſelues yet god hath giuen libertie good may conuicted place yeeres ſhould fitter make match good ſort child moſt part caried ſo much religion good aduiſedneſſe raſh beate make owne choice therefore ofttimes iuſtly requited god ought chiefly obeyed action make ſinne better appeare match ſoone repented many time inioyed moſes therfore god mouth people commanded teach parent authoritie prouiding marriage child thus ſaith thou ſhalt giue thy daughter ſonne canaanite take daughter thy ſonne therefore reade sampſon gaue honour father mother granting conſent marriage many like thus ſaith ſaw iudges 14 2 woman ſhe pleaſeth well therefore giue wife paul comming long moſes agreed faithfull ſeruants maſter teacheth dutie belongeth father ſaying 1 cor 7 38 giueth daughter marriage doth well ſignifying ſhould giue although ſpeake though might force child marriage liſt giue conſent aduice muſt bee ſome ſpeciall iuſt cauſe ſhewed expedient may cleare doth bewray boldneſſe wilfulnes diſobedience many child would thought wiſe enough know duty yet doe meanely grieue parent alſo prouide ill themſelues making match pleaſures beſide bring one little better canaanite ofttimes leaſt waſpe hagge otherwiſe badly qualified amongſt good kindred ſo themſelues ſeldome agree eſpecially one partie draw thing neerer god hereof commeth paſſe ſay onely doubtleſſe great part ſo many diſordered offenſiue match marriage perſons ſo weariſome one muſt either parted part themſelues cannot yet doe little better dwelling one houſe yet may many time meete parted bed board muſt haue another houſe ſet together whereby may bee eaſily gathered manner chriſtian ſociable life enioy together fruite reape iuſtling ſide commandement god comming together purpoſe ſhew annoiances vnlawfull marriage doe poynt ſome fall yea come oft ordinarily god ordinance commandement reiected child make owne marriage without parent againſt ſeeing occaſion may taken mouing queſtion two verſ 12 13 ſtand little vpon theſe two verſes ſatiſfying doubt raiſed make vſe thereof afterward therefore obiected whither obiection 1 caleb aduiſedly whither commended offering daughter ſhould winne debit knew whether might lawfully keepe promiſe partie ſuch one might haue alſo obiected winne thought 2 neare kinde othniel name ſaid younger brother ſo might lawfully take wife theſe thing therefore require anſwere firſt wee chiefely looke anſwere 1 namely commendation caleb would offer ſo largely deſtroying god enemy according god commandement holy ghoſt intended declare ſhould make queſtion whether rightly lawfully charitie ſuſpitious 1 cor 13 5 ioſh 14 11 ſo ſo rarely commended pietie obedience god becommeth v iudge cannot accuſe neither ſuch thing gathered againſt text true offered daughter vpon condition mentioned ſet downe manner reſpects ſo commended neither charged haue done raſhly hath man therefore doe challenge proue haue done raſhly ſhall neuer able doe ſeeing holy ghoſt commendeth denied ſinne vrge againſt take libertie thereby dealing vſe anſwer raſhly without due conſideration waightie caſes caſe marriage particularly affirming doe caleb aduenture either owne making childrens marriage ſuch perſons whoſe conuerſation doe know let ſeeke better defence doings example caleb beſides muſt liue rule example ſo neither draw ſuch liberty practiſe whatſoeuer may bee ſaid haue done good man concerning matter skilleth haue commandement marry lord ſeek defend 1 cor 7 39 match haue ſlightly bin made wherein god hath either ſmall hand hath ſufficiently branded ſet marke vpon haue gone finiſhed allowance direction ſo alowed though mariage otherwiſe bee honourable therefore beautified ſweete ſociableneſſe commodity hath annexed thoſe marriage approueth ſpeake large matter ſhall haue direct occaſion offered haue ſaid raſh marriage may ſay ſo take vnaduiſed inconſiderate action attempt whatſoeuer men haue authoritie taking hand calebs example neither haue scripture place euen ſo thereafter ſhall gaineſayings need goe worke manner next obiection gaue daughter raſh offer anſwere 2 one owne fleſh could marrie law god brother therfore vncle ſay younger brother hee gaue meane othniel kinſeman leaſt euery way among brother child father yeeres authority wealth yee obiect text calleth brother anſwer chriſts kinſmen called brother yet ſo diuines almoſt grant marie mother sauiour child chriſt therfore expound thoſe place mat 13 12 kinſmen kinſwomen matth 13 55 12 46 hebrew word vſed 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 properly ſignifieth naturall brother put vſually kinſeman alſo poſteritie brother scripture cleare plentifull ſhewing reade example leuit 25 leuit 25 46 word brother ſignifieth child brother ouer brother numb 32 6 child iſrael ye ſhall rule one ouer another crueltie numb 32 ſhall brother child iſrael goe warre ye tarrie place brother scripture meaneth poſteritie child 12 ſonnes iacob ſo many scripture doe ſo returne othniel achſah within degree forbidden might haue married againſt commandement god doubteth hee would haue better aduiſed hee meant offering doe thing ſhould offend god ſay therefore either othniel winning citie could lawfully haue married caleb would haue ſupplied offer ſome way contentment partie vpon anſwer queſtion ſay much like vpon anſwer former queſtion matter requireth giueth occaſion let none gather ſpeech caleb lawfull marrie within degree forbidden though caleb made ſuch marriage daughter although called kinſman yet ſeeing ſaid brother ſiſters ſonne therefore haue neceſſarie occaſion offered anſwere queſtion whether coſin german may marrie together yet ſeeing haue thus ſpoken therefore ſignifie iudgement agreeing ſuch haue read conferred although word god doe expreſſely forbid yet ſeeing prohibiteth thoſe degree great probabilitie chriſtiſhould common manner conſider examine weightie ſpeciall cauſes doe imbrace abſtaine ſuch marriage thinkes hath giuen ſome watchword thereof vnto v life many couple ſo marrying together hath found tedious accompanied mutual diſlikes betwixt party reaſon could ſeene thereof beſide proofe hereof hath acknowledged haue cauſe thereof part queſtion hath propounded mee ſuch marriage haue know practiſe many better haue haue ſay diſſwaded inconueniences vnlawfull ſo leaue point returne caleb although maried daughter within degree forbidden yet giuen libertie v doe ſo neither doe thing elſe vnlawfull forbidden word god foraſmuch haue direction may either matter marriage thing elſe whatſoeuer therefore wee ought little regard example leade way thus theſe obiections anſwered proceed th ſtory firſt ſaid othniel valiant man took citie verſ 13 doct 1 debir notwithſtanding difficulty win great wee ſee beſides verifieth prouerb heere ſpoken man gift preferreth like may ſaid ioſeph daniel others men ſhould ſeeke gift god may attaine honour giuer preferreth thereby ſay beſides may learne othniel religious prayer moſt faithfully 1 cron 4 10 made god reade chronacles ſo god heard yet tooke incouragement offer caleb ſet vpon great worke may ſay learne euen godly men may take vſe benefit ſuch incouragements lawfully offered going worke god commandeth true indeed euen bare word alone ought put life v quicken v duty much becauſe promiſe bleſſing annexed obeying euery commandement yea great promiſe reward yet pſalm 19 11 ſeeing weake becauſe fleſh ſtriueth againſt ſpirit v gal 5 17 therefore haue need helpes furtherance may whet v therefore though dutie othniel ſet againſt enemy god reſt iſraelites bound doe yet doubt much earneſtly ſet incouragement dutie euery faithfull miniſter god preach goſpel diligently willingly euen commandement chriſt thou loueſt mee feede iohn 21 16 lambes ſheepe yet lord bleſſe labour plentifully people miniſter readily ſo hee bee ſufficiently prouided man doubteth hee ſhall doe dutie much better ſeeing thereby hee good reaſon hee ſhould ſo bee highly well regarded chriſtian man laboureth hand calling god hath ſet ought bee occupied therein willingly conſcience ſake god bleſſe good ſucceſſe ſhall goe duty farre chearefully better ſort thing find thus goſpell ſoundly diligently preached ought ready heare magiſtrates themſelues bee forward way cauſe others authoritie doe ſame ſo ſee goſpel good account ſhall thinke quicken euen beſt much ſhould otherwiſe theſe meaner incouragemēts ſhould moſt preuaile men lord commandement yet ſhall better doe theſe alſo added helpe weakenes looke theſe principally chiefe neglected thing meerely prepoſterous next way pul downe al right maner going duty ſhewes thereof ſoeuer men wil make commonly ſo euer greateſt part offend way yet god ſeeing infirmitie people vnto wardneſſe godly duty hardly brought well diſcharging bare commandement hath drawne fit reward promiſes incouragements doubteth deare ſeruants god much heartned helped forward thereby yet god charge haue ſaid ought moſt preuaile though hypocrite timeſeruers doe make greateſt account little ſetting meane till god open eies repent till bee hardned one thouſand calling condition would labour trauell euen neceſſarie helpes life vertue bare commandement thou ſhalt labour gaine profit came thereby proceed othniel meaneſt father houſe yet caleb doct 2 keeping promiſe giuing daughter commendeth faithfulnes winde diſhoneſtly making good word men vſe doe euen hee ſet forth praiſed many reſpects praiſed men praiſe man ſelfe matter ſmall reiovcing lord praiſeth bleſſed iob ſeeing 2 cor 10 18 god himſelfe ſpake thus satan haſt thou conſidered ſervant iob feareth god departeth euill ſo commended zacharie iob 1 8 luke 1 6 elizabeth cornelius come particularly actes 10 2 commended meane faithfulneſſe keeping promiſe ſo great matter would othniels hand many thinke ſhall found wil doe ſo winde ſtanding word diſhoneſtly ſubtill diſtinctions wrangling wreſtings matter ſetting downe meaning promiſed eſpecially bee owne benefit aduantages oh lamentable euery behold ſo innocent moſt part poorer ſort goe commonly hardeſt yet let v know meane god take part wronged oppreſſed therefore let v beware world come hold moſt men word wrighting neither meanes may ſhifted denied cauſed salomon cry ſaying euery man prou 20 7 boaſt owne goodneſſe ſhall wee find faithfull man vertue god requireth hee put ſeruice meane faithfulneſſe paul ſheweth himſelfe counted faithfull 1 tim 1 12 put ſeruice wee earthly dealing good part ſoeuer find ſeruants yet glad forgoe cannot haue faithfull truſtie v ſo vnfaithfulneſſe contrarv ſo diſhked hated euen thoſe faultie themſelues though blind ſelfeloue ſeeing way hide breaketh forth thē ſeene openly brought vtter diſcredit euen ſo others commonly offend note cleanely conuay hide ſetting faire face brought light cannot ſo eaſily couer ſhould doubtleſſe little account many ſo euer tainted gehezay iudas ananias saphira wife simon magus iohn 1 47 gaue ſhew faithfulneſſe hee heard philip preach theſe many ſuch teſtifie faithfulnes iuſtled aſide reiected happie nathaniel true iſraelite guide reioyce doth inioy fruit heauen ſtaine reproch mentioned neuer put ſo conclude muſt ſhew faithfulneſſe deſire enter lord tabernacle pſalm 15 4 conſequently truly performe haue lawfully promiſed pſalme plainely ſhewed auoiding tediouſnes might laid large haue ſaid ſomwhat diſgracing ſin vnfaithfulnes general deceiuing one another breaking promiſe ſo much odious practized vnder pretence religion meane men ſhall profeſſe mouthes feare god yet denie power thereof liues ſome haue ſpoke ſhew calebs liberality othniel ſhewed giuen verſe 14 15 daughter ſo hee gaue liberall rich dowry vnderſtand haue ſo owne word ſhe ſaid father thou haſt giuen countrey might bee ſeene gaue freely promiſed doe hee great prince othniel ſame tribe moreouer ſhew libertie child haue allowed god ſaid ſhe deſired ground father ſhe mooued husband doe ſprings water fit vſe ſeeing dry ground giuen ſhe tooke fitteſt oppertunitie requeſt ſhe hauing gone abide dwell husband likelihood viewed ground ſhe returning father came meet ſhe caſt herſelfe aſſe ſhe might reuerence dutie father ſhee made petition ſaid clearing better vnderſtanding theſe two verſes ſtory though briefe doth giue good light v one dutie parent marrying child wit prouide may conueniently alſo liberty child againe beſtowed marriage namely may make requeſt neceſſaries haue neglect thereof firſt concerning parent ſeeing caleb gaue poſſeſſions daughter marriage according greatneſſe euen poſſeſſions ground bin lawfull haue done young couple ſame tribe teacheth parent putting child haue obedient charge marriage ſhould ſufficiently prouide may may ſtand conueniences ſhould ſeeke deſire pleaſe marriage without charge many inconueniences goe therewith abraham gaue portion iſaac iſhmael lord declared geneſ 25 5 6 ioſhua 14 15 16 17 v ſtory diuiding land canaan hee well pleaſed prouiſion ſhould made poſteritie one generation another neither could ſocieties otherwiſe maintained among men good ſort child beſtowed fit due time marriage whereby great hurt detriment muſt need fall church commonwealth herein meane parent prouiding child farre knowledge reacheth moſt part great fault bee found although indeed ſome vnnaturall hard harted men little nothing wrong though ability faile till muſt leaue good bee ſcrambled child much ſtrife contention ſeeing could neuer bee brought diſpoſe reaſonable ſort liued leaue theſe come againe fault twofold otherwiſe though moſt charged way haue ſaid one get much wealth ill meanes leaue richly child death beſtow pleaſe vpon life oft put owne hand childrens preferre marriage ſetting vp ſo high bring themſelues low theſe two euils common require good looking amending firſt ſweet comming good wring others oppreſſion extorſion violence fraud ſay ſweet comming bitter ſhall bee full going lord hath ſet v bound wee ſhould wiſe offer others matth 7 1 12 meaſure vnwilling ſhould offered v againe rule though perſwaded preacher may teare tongue ſtumpes ſhall bring many guided yet ſome hope wil ſubmit themſelues vnto dealing ſo many way found vphold men eſtates augment greateſt pretence child heare nothing ſpoken perſwade equitie innocency make practiſers thereof bold lion prou 28 1 trying doings whither good ſo many kind deceiuings cruell dealing practiſed executor detaining good committed fidelity put good vſes ſuch rackings men rent neuer regard tenant toile may poore ſort maintained forced neceſſitie leaue farmes ſome run cleane away exaction loanes till fill priſons cannot pay vnreaſonable demand whereas ſhould looke benefit thereby might ſtand benefit vſe imploy ſtocke giue taſte reſt theſe occupied greater dealing recken vp come ſmaller matter almoſt deales iuſtly ioynting one another two penny dealing pinching meaſures waights get groat ſhilling whole bargaine like ſo ſuch gaine ſweete reſt may lawfully take commodity prouerb ſtollen thing though prou 9 17 water ſweet conceiue reſt ſhal ſuffice ſay firſt ſinne parent prouiding child ſay nothing great hurt doe themſelues hereby thus greedily ſet ſeeke commoditie child bereaue themſelues knowledge grace yea waxe ſloathfull negligent vſing meanes increaſe alſo beſide omitting good others meanes leauing bleſſing caleb curſe poſteritie muſt pay ſhot full dearely thoſe commings vnrighteous mammon better beaſt child ſuch parent ſecond fault parent followeth put themſelues euen houſe home ſay preferring child great mariages little elſe reſpected wherein though deale ill former loading burdening conſciences yet latter prouide moſt vnwiſely themſelues bodily eſtate maintainance thereby muſt need goe worſe ſoules true indeed child gaine wel bargaine thing ſutable match religion party good liking betwixt cauſe heires promiſe wiſdome parent depriue themſelues many poore neighbour benefit might good right ought haue inioyed keeping eſtate eſpecially greateſt part owne hand thruſt head vnder childrens wing lift vp pluck downe themſelues yet moſt part child vnfit may meane fit enough vſe eſtate yet hauing obtained right al put poſſeſſion thereof vnmeet parent muſt beholding haue liue yet ſhall grudging enough yeelded vnto eſpecially deale flatterer benefactor haue ſucked vnthankfully caſt turne ouer perke nay parent haue kept thing owne hand relieue themſelues ſome child neuer well till haue vnder ſome colourable ſhew reaſon wound euen owne hand cannot death longed ſo may haue old age tedious irkſome wherein ſhould looke moſt kindneſſe quietnes childrens hand greateſt reſpect regard occupyings deny age hath made vnfit labour ouerſeeing commodity may conuenient yeeld childrens hand thoſe meane reſpects ſhall thought meeteſt ſame vpon good condition yet parent may well dealt keepe chiefe hold owne hand time theſe two danger wiſely auoided parent freely affirme ought prouide child 1 tim 5 8 haue ſaid beſtow marriage wherein yet muſt bee obſerued ſtraine themſelues good good haue ſhewed themſelues moſt obedient lord moſt humble qualified good fruites religion ſaid parent prouiding child putting forth marriage occaſion calebs ſo daughter followeth point ſhort ſtory libertie child haue time make requeſt themſelues parent cut hauing ouer long sixth sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges goe forward ſtory left concerning caleb verſ 14 15 opening acſah daughter wee conſider acſah calebs daughter ſaid father met haue heard himſelfe father gaue othniel marriage ſaid ſhe came firſt husband moued aske father field whither loath refuſed whither tarried long ſhe lighted aſſe made requeſt father herſelfe giuing oportunitie asking ſhe deſired ſeemes hee ſaw ſhee came ſome ſuch end ſhe beſought giuen drie ground without water ſo would giue ſprings water bound great large ſhe requeſting gaue vnto contentation hence may learne ſaid beſides reuerence ſhe ſhewed father lighting beaſt libertie child doct beſtowed marriage may deſire parent abilitie giue leaue ſuch thing ſee needful place honeſt ſupply want parent haue neglected ſeene remembred ſeeing looke none fitter meeter helpe want neceſſaries much diſcouragement ofttimes young beginner parent prouide lay vp child whileſt allowed deſire thing needfull meet 2 cor 12 14 fit ſtout ſtately maner require ſo forget themſelues humilitie requeſt neither fit ſerue owne turne liſt ſetting vp owne countenance pluck others wel regarded yet common euery one himſelfe doth conſider another himſelfe ſay muſt taken heed leſt raiſe diſagreement hard thought betwixt brother demand text plainly ſheweth needful ſhe asked though father granted portion wee know thoſe drie south country need water ſee requeſt ſo reaſonable father neuer ſtood yeelded freely liberally euen ſprings vpper nether ground like manner parent ſhould doe child according abilitie haue ſaid followeth vers 16 child keny moſes father law went vp city palme tree child iuda wilderneſſe iuda lyeth south arad went dwelt among people haue heard caleb othniel acſah proceed ſenſe chapter added next verſe interlaced betwixt former next following briefe mention kenites poſteritie keni moſes father law came downe tribe iuda time deſtroyed hebron debir dwelt tent hobab ſonne keni retinue perſwaded moſes child iſrael wilderneſſe going toward numb 10 29 land canaan goe hee promiſing lord ſaid would doe good ſo meane moſes would likewiſe make partaker thereof hereupon ſome theſe kenites went child iſrael guide wilderneſſe way went theſe kenites came ouer iordan iſrael abode tribe beniamin iericho citie palmtrees thence came abode men iuda woon forementioned citie thereby ſtory recordeth theſe went liued people iſrael better inſtructed right manner worſhipping god predeceſſors made beginning therin dwelling kenites people doct god leauing owne countrey ioyning thēſelues highly commendeth ſo teacheth behouefull v dutie much benefit ioyne ſelues wee may haue oportunitie godly fellowſhip theſe kenites done moſt doe ignorant law god ſo lyen darkneſſe knowne lord hope happineſſe regarding ſeeke true knowledge therefore leauing owne countrie much kindled incouraged thereby loue god promiſes proſpered among people god ſo ſay wee ought ſeeke ioyne ſelues acquaintance note religious godly liue faith hope ſuch maketh aſhamed though wee liue among heathen yet wee liue moſt part among papiſts atheiſts blind prophane worldings whoſe conuerſation example wee eaſily infected made like vnto wrote ſaith saint paul ye company ye haue 1 cor 6 11 fellowſhip fornicator drunckards extorſioners idolater railers ſuch like know euill word corrupt good manner although 1 cor 15 33 cannot liue ſuch iſrael egyptian yet bound euen ciuill contract dealing wee cannot chuſe haue vſe ſometime beware wee drawne neere ſocietie leſt learne manner leaſt wincke beare wee ſhould ſhew vtter diſlike ſeeing know two cannot walke together muſt one mind yet wee muſt ſcorne diſdaine worſt meaneſt liue among al innocencie humility good note carriage ſelues leſt harden rather wee may wait patiently ſee god time giue repentance company neere acquaintance godly ſo precious beware leſt forſake fellowſhip manner ſome make heb 10 25 much ſuch let delight dauid ſaid saint pſalm 16 3 earth ſuch excell vertue ſuch dwell among haue dealing neighbour neere ſeated together muſt need ſome ſort haue let take heed commonneſſe liuing waxe wearie bleſſing wee eaſily brought ſo eaſily alienated teſtineſſe conceit many euen ſmall occaſions trifle haue yet learned one beare anothers burthen religion teacheth v make eſpeciall account wiſe ſeeke peace inſue follow though flie v ſo heb 12 14 iohn 3 35 may ſay diſciples chriſt indeed ſo loue one another thus let doe good take good mutually together euery way good people commonly daintieſt euen ſuch dwel farre god declaring thereby dwell blind diſcerning ſeeing ſuch benefit worth therefore prouoke god giue habitation ſend among ſuch themſelues vnquiet froward people yea worſe ſo meane prophane skorners may thereby better know godly friendſhip worth wiſe would haue kept themſelues well well better company haue ſeene time ſome tooke pritch againſt note ſuch feared god truly religious diſtempered heate ouerhaſtie diſlike wearineſſe fellowſhip though farre better themſelues thus men caried ſections raſhly wilfully paſſion heate ſay would need reſolue remoue dwelling made choice owne liking perſwaſions might ſtay ſo handled ſtrangers knew god duty ſo vexed croſſed among cried one another wo pſalm 120 5 conſtrained dwell meſhec meaning ſo troubled pitty regard ſhame confeſſe cry godly neighbour treaſure wiſhed much loſſe dwell againe example kenites ſhould teach v though lawfull meete regard maintenance yet ought reſpect chiefly doct 2 zephath name tooke cityes beſides name ſett downe know poſſeſſed philiſtines noted waſted ſome cityes vtterly fire hazor iericho ſo delt mentioned zephath whereas inhabited others delt ſo ſett downe commanded ſure god might ſhew kindneſſe iſrael ſome vtterly ſubuerted greateſt danger feared teſtifie ſeueritie iuſtice ſuch enemy therefore crie crueltie righteous god ſaw meet done muſt learne though wee bee forbidden hate doct verſ 17 perſons enemy yet wee bee ſet lord execute iudgement vpon eie muſt ſpare vnder colour charitie compaſſion properneſſe manhood fooliſh reſpect neither may worke lord negligently thus ioſhua though pitied ſtate achan yet plainely tels much thou haſt troubled ioſhua 7 25 v lord ſhall trouble thee c thus lord puniſhed saul ſeuerely ſparing agag ahab ſo dealing benhadad ſaying thy life 1 sam 15 23 1 king 20 42 ſhall goe therefore muſt well aſſured god commandement goe ſuch thing againſt ſuch perſons beeleaud ſtubburne willfull commandement god extended onely againſt traiterous enemy church alſo againſt rauening roguiſh progeny ſpoilers peace gouernment hauocke maker commonwealth murtherers c therefore confuteth curſed practiſe ieſuites yet libel like muſt take great heed alſo colour cruell vncharitable action pretence zeale god yet giue place affection vnder colour ſeeking glory god may eaſily done apoſtles calling fire heauen vpon sam indignity committed againſt v withall meekneſſe deale mildly owne matter lord farre otherwiſe demanded whether may godly pray againſt tyrant true worſhip god hindred anſwere againſt tyrannie cruell doings ought pray againſt perſons may poſſibly repent lord hauing reuealed v wickedneſſe haue yet committed vnpardonable ſin therefore good meaning ſo euer wee haue therein wee allowed pray confuſion god make knowne mind ſuch haue deſtroyed prayed muſt approoue execute accordingly yet ſo men pitie sauiour denouncing againſt people ieruſalem luke 19 42 ſhortly bee deſtroyed yet wept beholding miſerie comming vpon next verſe ſhewed iuda yet preuailed woon ſenſe verſe 18 19 city named text yet 3 chapter booke ſaid haue hand philiſtines alſo long people iſrael oft prouoked lord ſo loſt againe ſome part euen like bee ſin loſt theſe city inioyed 19 verſe ſaid iuda poſſeſſed mountaines alſo end nothing might aſcribed men namely iudah simeon simeon entred couenant ioyne brother theſe warres ſo though iuda appointed thereto onely named end ſay nothing may aſcribed expreſſly added lord thoſe great enterprizes teach v doct ver 18 19 whoſe might preuailed cauſe ſo euen ſeeing god men wil grant much god man ſhall proſper none ſhall againſt hurt apoſtle writeth ſufficient reaſon ſhall reſiſt ſay word ſhall call backe know rom 8 31 god man idle weake mighty ſaith himſelfe aſa prophet lord looketh downe heauen ſee weake 2 cron 16 9 may ſtrong end ſo worthie point may throughly doe v good muſt vnderſtand haue god v ſo may reſt ſurely perſwaded ſo inioy preſence conſtantly liue treaſure vnualuable vnknowne world required v god firſt haue god truly reconciled lord ieſus chriſt neuer leaue v neither forſake v ſafely keepe v reſurrection day otherwiſe ioſh 1 8 except god thus made vnited faith howſoeuer ſhould done cannot ſet downe portion wealth wiſdome c haue communion accurſed know god may bee men ſome ſort power bodily helpe ſome time yet effectuall comfort alwaies theſe great matter duly conſidered v may wicked ſo ahab gaue great hoaſtes benhadad hand yea hee may bee preſent vnbeleeuers congregation inlightneth vnderſtand ſoundly taught take liking ſame power onely effectuall grace fauour mary freely luke 1 28 beloued god alſo made bleſſed ioyful thus v wil ſpiritually grace v alſo bodily bleſſe v ſhall expedient v euen hee gedeon iudges 6 12 ſaid end may deceiue ſelues behoueth v marke ſingular continuall comfort therefore let men giue diligence make ſaluation ſure come fauour god ſo may abide therein guide keepe comfort otherwiſe 2 pet 1 5 iohn 15 • 0 may haue god deny ſometime haue ſaid though hee owe euen ſo yet may miſerable vnhappie ſtill better manner hee iuda time mentioned alſo declared ſame giuing enemy hand confuteth conceit ſuch meaſure god raiſing wealth giuing deſires micah idolator applauded himſelfe beloued god becauſe hee gaue iudges 17 laſt leuite prieſt whereas giueth many wicked men deſires wrath yet denieth owne fauour haue make profit word mentioned iudah proſpered ſeeing god haue heard ouercame inhabitant hill countrey verſ 19 ſenſe ſeeing god ſame verſe added ouercome inhabitant valley ſeeing charriots iron hereby vnbeliefe began ſorrow miſeries tribe followed end chapter common tranſlation could driue ſo hebrew better tranſlation addeth another word namely went neither originall ſeemeth bee ſenſe otherwiſe vnperfit thus driue ſupplied went doe whither ſoeuer either go fault whither take thus could euen fault alſo god promiſed although chariot iron yet hee would deliuer hand failed beleeuing god promiſe ioſhua 17 18 ſo going god vnbeliefe god likewiſe went ſo god beleeuing ouercame dwelt mountaines beleeuing god promiſed ioſhua 17 ſeeing iron chariot therfore ouercome vallyes therefore howſoeuer take fault men iuda though may obiected god would giue victory ouer one well ouer anſwere true fault beleeue word promiſed doctrine taught hence though doct 1 god beſtow many good bleſſings vpon v beleeue hauing promiſed euen iuda ſo long hee ſhewes himſelfe v yet wee giue withdraw ſelues vnbeliefe belieued promiſes faile v bleſſings deny v moſt worthy truth much regarded v ſo v men iuda ſaith sauiour man brought ſon healed dumbe ſpirit thou canſt beleeue marke 9 23 thing poſsible belieueth meaning thereby thing agreeable god ſhall granted beleeueth faith ſeeketh nothing contrary reueiled word ſaith saint iames man want wiſdome let aske god giueth iames 1 6 plentifully caſteth man teeth let aske faith wauer ſo ſpeaketh scripture throughout bind ſure lord himſelfe ſaith hebrewes man withdraw himſelfe heb 10 38 ſoule ſhall haue pleaſure beleeue excellent ſaying lord purpoſe chronicle 2 chro 16 7 9 aethiopians lubims great people yet becauſe thou diddeſt reſt vpon deliuered thy hand thou haſt done fooliſhly relying king syria lord therefore hee leaueth thee thyſelfe beleeue ſo driuen diſſwaded contrary yet cauſeth mee oft maruell wee ſo incouraged neither vnbeleeuers doe haſt long thirſt faith though little worth neither yet ſhould bee moſt readie bee brought waite daily conſtantly grow grace beleeuing neither doe although haue obtained alreadie belieue al nouriſh faith taught ſo may abound therein thankſgiuing much lamented ſeeing god v bleſſe beautifie v otherwiſe ſhould neglect ſo great good might get thereby rather others follow fancie reaſon ſloath example beleeue ſee oh wofull vnbeleefe filleſt liues ſo many fretting ſorrowes deadly diſcomforts true many make fault ſmall doe anſwer people liued comming chriſt might much eaſier beleeue wee becauſe reade ſtories ſuch example onely abraham alſo ioſhua ioſhua 6 many people deſtroying iericho haue done ſo prieſts aduenturing ſet foot water beleeuing ioſhua 3 15 ſhould giue place go ouer dry foot god promiſed many like groſſely deceiued thinke ſo euen much ſay dawning morning light man may ſee clearely noonetide ignorant myſtery faith nothing ſo clearely reuealed old teſtament many degree new although ſome chiefe father goe people bee light moſes noah abraham others receiued inlightning god greater meaſure doe theſe day yet church conſiſting common people time hath cauſe great deale beleeue farre eaſily may imbrace promiſes ordinary meanes haue ſay god may ſo liue faith eaſily ſay could doe ſinne ſearch ſelues ſo much ſee whither ſo neither find otherwiſe grieued ſeeke amend occaſion offered ſpeake largely matter many place booke therefore containe ſelfe one thing ſo good occaſion note faith worthy remembrance regard though tribe iuda beleeued lord promiſes one thing therfore valiantly meane expelling canaanite dwelt hill country lord accordingly yet another thing beleeue namely god would expel enemy dwelt valleyes becauſe iron chariot therefore went neither obtaine ſuch thing god whereby ſee may poſſibly beleeue one promiſe yet another doct 2 great maruell wee may beleeue caſe eaſie thing promiſed leſſe difficultie obtaine note otherwiſe euen ſo may beleeue one time yet another reaſon ſeeing wee fickle inconſtant therefore wee fleet change time wee alſo timerous meanes whereof commeth paſſe although may brought belieue thing leſſe moment former time haue belieued yet ſome time another thing haue experience ſtriketh v greater feare faint giue ouer vſe accuſtome aquaint bend ſelues note haue giuen credit ſome thing god may ſame find otherwiſe take knowledge weakeneſſe thinke ſtrength beleeuing great therefore thus ſeeing want therein pleaſe ſelues reſt haue done looke yet done v saint iames ſpeaketh patience ſhould haue perfit worke ſo faith iames 1 4 muſt haue perfit worke alſo thus wee may goe degree apoſtle willeth coloſſians namely abound faith coloſ 2 7 rom 15 13 cannot bee without thankes giuing god much ioy ſelues vers 20 gaue hebron caleb moſes ſaid expelled thence three ſonnes anake verſe 20 giuing hebron caleb repeated giuen caleb moſes ſaid booke ioſhua warres tribe iuda ſet downe chiefe captaine whereof caleb ioſh 14 13 againe ſpoken ſaid citie coaſts thereof giuen namely ioſhua god appointed deutronomie deut 1 36 chiefe matter giuing hebron caleb promiſed holden backe deferred defeated teacheth wee ought wiſe detaine man due doct 1 though bee power doe withhold reward hath deſerued god euery man inioy owne wee would hath beſtowed vpon ſo ſharpely reprooued saint iames maſters towards ſeruants withholding due doth much challenge waightier caſes haue wrought vnrighteouſneſſe againſt thus hee writeth behold hire labourer haue reaped field iames 5 4 kept backe fraud crieth cry haue reaped entred eares lord hoſtes hath pollicie vſed gouernors promiſe great reward ſuch ſhall bewray dangerous practiſes traitor find open malefactor performe good ſeruice againſt enemy church countrey regarded rewarded accordingly ſhall hand men ſtrengthened incouraged doe theſe duty ahaſhueroſh heathen king deliuered treaſon eſter 6 10 two ſeruants intended againſt mordecay detected ſoone vnderſtood forgotten time rewarded faithfull ſeruice moſt ample maner command ſaw effected ſhould rewarded belſhazzar daniel faithfull ſeruice pharaoh ioſeph admirable compare dan 5 7 2 • manner much man owne reſtored pay due time executor borrower right ought doe euen among chriſtians neglect hereof ſhifting many contrary couenant oath promiſe bond calleth profeſſion queſtion among ſuch would gladly conceiue better pſalm 15 4 god meetes ſuch iuſtly neither truſted health yet pitied diſtreſſe beare marke vntruſtines vnfaithfull dealing vnto day repentance graue therfore put truſt defeate orphan whō due alſo thoſe banckrupts inrich themſelues good men giue able pay though haue power diſable thēſelues vnthriftines careleſnes ſuch hold men due belongs ſhal feele god anger bitter maſters ſhal detaine hold backe ſeruants wage doe better claime due elſe bee diſpleaſed prouoke ſute although know iuſt cauſe ſought ſuch caſe meane due obtained either intreaty may bee yeelded agreement compoſition rule mentioned bindeth lawfull irreligious promiſes ſaid 20 verſe caleb expelled hebron three ſonnes anak vnderſtand thoſe three doct 2 mentioned 10 verſe sheſhai ahiman talmai driuing aſcribed iuda general verſe particularly ſaid haue done caleb chiefe worke doctrine gathered hence reade verſe 10 seventh sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges ſecond part chapter vers 21 child beniamin caſt iebuzites inhabited ieruſalem therefore iebuzites dwell child beniamin ieruſalem vnto day followeth ſecond part chapter laieth ſenſe verſ 21 beginning calamity people iſrael end chapter may bee ſeene namely tribe ſuffered nation enemy remaine among contrary commandement god booke number thus ſaith ye come ouer iordan land canaan num 33 52 55 ye ſhall driue inhabitant land little ye driue inhabitant land thoſe ye let remaine ſhall prickes eies thornes ſides ſhall vex land wherein dwell firſt tribe ſaid haue ſuffered canaanite remaine coaſts excepted wee heard iuda verſ 19 caſt beniamin neere ioſhua 15 63 iuda although calling 2 peter 3 17 ſuffer ſelues plucked ſtedfaſtneſſe therein error wicked caught ſnared deceitfulnes ſin ſo rocked ſleepe ere aware caſe ſhall eaſie heb 3 13 matter awake bring ſelues backe againe former good courſe ſo ſhall liue vnprofitable fit onely conſume waſt good benefit god oh death ſloathfull perſon vrged duty hath caſt hath pleaſure ability vnto miniſter preach old age looked youth diet ſhall followeth vers 22 alſo houſe ioſeph went vp bethel lord vers 23 houſe ioſeph cauſed view bethel name citie time luz vers 24 ſpies ſaw man come citie ſaid vnto ſhew v pray thee way citie verſ 27 word text ſet downe ſeuerally verſe 30 ſaid ioyntly together commendation went againſt bethel fell lot lord incourage ſtrengthen ſo feared tried way might moſt eaſily take name citie time paſt called luz reade geneſis iacob geneſ 28 19 went padan aram wrath brother eſau reſting lord appearing comforting called place bethel houſe mightie god goe forward ſent buſineſſe namely tribe ioſeph ſeeing man come citie asked part might ſet vpon ſide going comming thereby appeareth ſhut vp feare iſrael left ſome ſecret way neceſſarie vſe goe thereby promiſing man largely hee ſhewed way entred ſlue inhabitant tooke ſent man away wel rewarded rather indeed baniſhed himſelfe another countrey ſo wealthy hee able build another city called name luz worke houſe ioſeph went namely take citie bethel deuiſion land canaan ioſhua 16 2 giuen god inioyned doth liuely ſet eies doct verſ 22 23 glaſſe dutie god people ſay readily goe ſet vpon worke god hath appointed laid vpon yea done whatſoeuer let diſcouragements may ſtand vp way hinder hath commanded able remooue thoſe impediment rather ſhal hinder worke hand ſeruants beleeuing go forward commit ſucceſſe hath promiſed bring difficulty might hold backe otherwiſe wee looke note god faith let way hindred thereby ſhall caſt commandement god behind backe eccleſ 11 4 obſerue wind therfore ſowe looke much cloud therefore reape ſo feare inconueniences ſhal let paſſe neceſſarie duty againe thriue haue good ſucceſſe bleſſe god merry croſſed curſe diſguiſe ſelues impatience whereas ought enough v god hath brought paſſe either thus otherwiſe beſide authoritie hee hath ouer v bountifull rewarding v ſeruice ought incourage v adreſſe ſelues ſuch worke onely ſo ſeeing commandeth would haue v doe may moſt owne eaſe deut 28 47 pleaſures leaſt ſeeking firſt god kingdome vnder gouernment reſt thing lawfull labour meanes vſing one hardeſt thing faſten though god hath yet promiſed ſuch onely ſhall bee bleſſed ſomewhat hath ſaid added verſe houſe ioſeph went vp againſt bethel lord ſeeing added ſay ſomewhat though haue ſpoken thereof another occaſion houſe ioſeph thus going worke god commanded ſaid haue god worke ſo hee promiſed teacheth aſſurance haue attempt ought commandement hath ſet ſeale ſhall haue ſucceſſe proſper worke ſaid ioſhua firſt going againſt canaanite thee hee belieued ioſh 1 5 proſpered euen ſo innocent man caſe brought ſuch ſtraits godly ſhal able auoid till god ſend helpe wicked ſuch ſtreights come vpon armed man vpon naked ſeeing god hath ſuch vantage v thereby throughout preſent life may moſt iuſtly inflict vpon v ſay oh cauſe haue make precious vſe hereof cauſe ſo neceſſary matter thinke good ſet downe ſome vſes thereof vſe 1 reader firſt one ſhould euery day part iourney home oft wee find ſo acknowledge admiration god goodneſſe ſpareth freeth v ſuch ſtreights ſo alſo ſo many great calamity caſualties kept much life bee freed ſmaller affliction alſo moſt loaden benefit ſpeake deſerts bee alwaies danger feare thus abaſed therfore humbled prepare ſelues daily iob looke change thirdly haue little need vſe 3 note luke 9 23 trouble ſelues ill conſcience manner way ſo procure needle ſorrow wee daily danger ſo great vexation laſtly ſet little beſt thing ſubiect thouſand vſe 4 change lay vp treaſure ſelues ſhall neuer fade taken v obiect vpon ſeeing may fall ſo many great ſtreights prerogatiue haue righteous ſhall doe liuing ſuch eſtate well ſay let truſt god feare ſo may well hath promiſed deut 5 29 ſhall ſo keepe many ſuch calamity giue deliuerance many ſuch difficulty turne thoſe abide vpon ſingular benefit good receiue vnto glory others meane ſhall wit end pſalm 3 25 ſtrangeneſſe plague much worſe bee caſt hell haue learne occaſion man ſpies ſpies offered kindneſſe would ſhew way citie dealt kindly rather roughly cruelly doct 2 ſeeking ſuch matter hand became hee one curſed nation could ye wil aske promiſe mercy obiection though ſo rahab yet ſhe turned religion ſo gibeonites ſerue bondman imbraced religion alſo ſuch thing ſaid man hee went vnto hittite ſeuen curſed nation dwelt anſwere muſt anſwere interpret lawes god againſt canaanite concerning rooting mitigating equity made peace iſrael ſhould roote appeares written ioſhua theſe nation rooted ſeeing none ioſh 11 19 ſaue gibeonites made peace hebrewes ſo teacheth men deale euen bad kindly harmeleſſe toward though haue deſerued puniſhment man citie bethel might good right haue put ſword reſt citie vntil yeelded himſelfe yet much miſery bee pitied vnleſſe fact horrible beyond courſe common treſpaſſes caſe muſt puniſhed authoritie accordingly ſo dealing hope hart may mollified time brought repentance whereas rigor rough handling queſtionleſſe hardened fall magiſtrates hand muſt need fault bee put death enough haue inflicted vpon due though bee purſued crueltie alſo ioſhuas dealing achan yet treſpaſſe muſt bee put death may paterne men teach auoid crueltie ioſh 7 19 ſhew kindneſſe mercie ſuch bee miſerie thus hee ſaith ſinne found againſt ſonne giue glory god iſrael make thy confeſsion ſhew thou haſt done ioſhuas example louing dealing toward offender achan highly commended ſo contrary odious preiſts iewes gotten ſought pilats hand haue sauiour againſt law condemned content moſt cruelly deſpitefully handled mock taunt diſgrace might good might looked hand minding matter dealing kindly mercifully afflicted commeth remembrance among many thing iuſtly wailed lamentable eſtate malefactor ſome place leaſt land miſerable throughout whole life ſo eſpecially death moſt ſeeing condemned goe execution without meanes bring conſcience wicked liues feare iudgement come ſome knowledge hope eternall life whereas pleaſed thoſe authoritie ſome fit miniſter god might appointed take hand adiudged die ſay good might done poore priſoners thereby mine owne part young able trauell dutie myſelfe ofttimes compaſſion miſery ſaw bleſſing labour word preached little time prepare themſelues ſaw ſay apparantly bleſſed god great contentment comfort good hope remember well ſundry time though ſtranger yet god bleſſing brought ſee damnable miſerable eſtate mean ſin ſhewed euen neareſt mercie receiued great liking eſpecially taſted glad tidings goſpell quiet comfort heauie heart yea may truly ſay clearely ſee owne father could haue vnto meſſage brought vnto beſide haue ſaid like meditation vnto eſtate many people land run ſwiftly hell ignorance moſt falſely called mother deuotion rather mother miſchiefe confuſion alſo prophaneneſſe groſſe ſinnes though ſo lyable law man bee puniſhed theſe alſo without miniſter able willing leade better way ſuch meanes might conuert god ſuch good inſtruments might bee incouraged backed labouring reclaime ſhould haue cauſe giue god great thanks perſons alſo ſo well inſtructed comforted ſhould bewaile ſuch alſo taught yet little better cannot chuſe pittie ſeeing goſpell hidden therfore dying ſo ſhal moſt certainely periſh ſay ſhould bewaile theſe far ſhould complaint reach ſhut vp point therfore cōcluding thus oh ſo much hardnes heart many miniſters others might helpe wiſhing little compaſſion sauiour euangeliſt recordeth ſaw people diſperſed ſheep without ſhepheard matth 9 laſt againe oh could deale pitifully kindly louingly miſerable afflicted gentleſt meanes vſed reclaime offender hope ſuch man bethel great diſtreſſe done rarely therfore much hardneſſe heart thoſe neglected wilfulneſſe carrieth profaneneſſe impenitencie thus returne ſpies againe ſeeing hath proued doct 3 ver 24 vnlawfully ſauing bethelite aliue moſt bee ſaid ſo could inconuenience ſeeing gaue token turned religion ought ſee yet ſmaller inconuenience killed ſo haue put ſhifts haue found ſecret way led citie alſo teacheth v good point wee ſee attempting lawfull buſineſſe labor ſome inconuenience muſt need borne leſſer two without ſinne gone vnder ſo may auoid greater want conſideration due regard ſay men ſtand ſmaller auoid runne greater ſinne itſelfe many inſtances may ſhewed among may bee one many man make others priuie ſome dealing ſuch may bring good commodie forbeares doe onely would haue commoditie benefit reapeth thereby knowne ſo great inconuenience knowne ſome faithfull friend falles meane thereby euen much greater want skill vſe dealing trafficke aright beſt manner helpe ſome wiſe friend might haue learned hee loſeth great part commoditie might haue inioyed yea thereby falles offend god impatience murmuring ſeeth commeth ſhort expectation hope many man falling vpon theeues deſperate mood refuſeth yeeld money though vnable reſiſt ſo loſeth money life ſo doe many refuſe ſtomacke agree obſtinate aduerſary becauſe loth loſe forgoe thing whereas ſtanding vtmoſt forgoe little ten time value much like many bodily health doubt leaſt know alſo ſome ſore diſeaſe breeding yet conſult ſome experienced phyſition ſay auoid ſome inconuenience taking phiſick nothing pleaſant ſaue charge becauſe would loſe time following profit falles thereby meane euen greater inconuenience meeteth ſo auoiding ſmall loſe profit life alſo thing bee regarded becauſe wee ſee experience commodity ſo mixed diſcommodities thing indifferent one goeth without true comfort life ſo particularly marriage well going liuing firſt many auoid trouble married eſtate ſmaller put many inconueniences liue vnquietneſſe diſcontentment vnſetledneſſe ſingle eſtate fall fornication ſay prooue farre greater many againe reſolues marrying make themſelues great thereby ſhunne meane low eſtate pouertie thinke doe ſo ſhall void trouble yet looke weary themſelues many ſore dangerouſer trouble though mariage lawful yet ſuch attempting good againe rule among married couple one partie ſhould yeeld without much rigor auſtcritie contending thing indifferent husband giuing libertie wife ſpeak cauſe viſit friend take vſe ſome commodity owne behoofe benefit rather denie becauſe feare ſome inconuenience may come thereby yet certaine ſhall farre greater ſeene fall otherwiſe ſo dealing inconueniences cannot bee ſhunned yet let v ſure labour prayer godly wiſdome auoide hardeſt one ſpeciall good vſe doctrine take heed bee ready iudge neighbour bearing ſome inconueniences forward ready doe muſt doe free themſelues greater ſo condemne ſelues ſeeing wee ſelues ſubiect ſame doctrine alſo haue wee doe iudge brother ſuch caſe haue ſuſtained inconuenience wee may well thinke hath done greater alſo condemneth bee little croſſed ſome hard accident grow deſperate make rent greater raſhneſſe impatience c ſcorning ſtoope neceſſity god hath laid vpon wiſely declining extremity though cannot auoide inconuenience befalne yet ſhould ſhunne ſinne murmuring greater elſe beare burthen cannot goe ſtorie time therefore cut eighth sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges followeth bethlite good verſ 25 queſtion purpoſe enquire heere whether man well betraying city lawfull like caſe concerning ſpies queſtion made drawing man whether well worke aſſigned god deſtroy anſwere thoſe nation therefore vſe meanes going alſo lawfull ſignifying god wil behalfe whether man beleeued therfore whether faith ſaue life friend good vncertaine firſt poſſible probable haue cauſe drew doe laſt moſt likely yet wee may determine except lord went v therefore according thereto act good commendable otherwiſe v caſe ſtandeth farre otherwiſe doct ſ 25 lawfull v yeeld ſuch thing betraying city odious horrible lord ieſus ſpeaking like matter thing moſt monſtrous attempt goe ſaith many ſhall hate betray one another fearefull thing heare much one doe matth 24 10 whole city nay bitter violence cruelty odious v one towards another ſimply without reſpects much ſhal done gaine preferment neither way tolerable ſauing one owne life muſt theſe caſes haue diſcharges warrant god doe rahab hiding ſpies wee ioſh 6 25 hauing scripture moſt clearely direct v action ſuch thing example ſoeuer followed v theſe day neither fact ioel killing siſera iſraelites borrowing carrying away iudg 5 24 exod 12 35 egyptian treaſures thing imbolden v doe like ſhe againſt god enemy canaanite lord appointment word doe euill good may come odious laſtly theſe two verſes good v marke poore doct 2 bethlite inſtrument taking city poore meanes helpes god oftentimes miniſtreth effecting hee commandeth done yea though worke great mean weake vnlikely bring ſuch matter paſſe skilleth theſe thing may ſeene ſtirring vp preparing ſillie woman ioſhuas time receiue lodge ſpies ſent view iericho tooke alſo blowing trumpet rammes horne ioſh 6 16 c compaſſing city iericho ſeuen time make walles fall downe ſeeth theſe poore engins batter walles alſo giue bethlite hand theſe ſpies might helpe eaſily take city god haue worke brought paſſe appointeth meanes alſo ſame purpoſe alwaies knowne ſeldome v ordinarily till meet chance appointment doth often take heart v much diſmay v cheerefull going wee commanded ſo weake faith vnbeleeuing thomas wee doe ſee behold bodily eye meanes yet ſufficient hand god promiſe much behoueth v well acquainted taught v heere ſingular encouragement v wee ſo weake haue hard labour laid vpon v ſee meanes bring paſſe know yet god prouide helpe though wee ſee prouide ſacrifice abraham offer ſtead iſaac indeed ſhould deale v pharaoh iſraelites gen 22 8 enioyned hard taske great worke yet muſt make ſhift effect impoſſible doe maruell penſiue wit end doe god thanked beleeue make eaſie prouide accordingly moſt cheerefully may occupied day day god commandement ſet hand vnto cauſed apoſtle paul ſo diligent vnwearied bringing ſo many nation act 13 10 21 chap preaching embrace goſpell ſaluation thereby yet ſo many great diſcouragements way cauſed thoſe worthy ſeruants god zorobabell ezra nehemiah nehem 2 17 onely returne iudea build city vp againe greatly ruinated euen walles thereof alſo temple hauing commandement god ſo doe beleeued hee would ſhew bee inable though wee ignorant many block maine enemy way hinder wee haue ſtay looke promiſed ſaluation hee hath commanded v liue faith waite hope finde meanes bring paſſe although ſee little many time ſo much oft feare doubt waightieſt caſe euen saint peter alſo ſaith righteous ſcarcely ſaued euen ſo labouring man artificer could neuer bee vpholden 1 pet 4 18 follow calling peace ſhould looke onely hardly like bee maintaine ſhould ſtay themſelues faith god prouide themſelues negligent ſtay v hardeſt condition wherein wee ſet god hee bring v though wee ſee alſo good ſort becauſe hath promiſed remaineth ſee well man rewarded verſ 26 helpe forward god people worke deſtroying enemy ſhewing way city though bee ſet downe mind thus dealt onely ſet free whole family deſtruction lighted vpon citizen alſo ſuffer carrie away wealth yea ſo 35 plague threatned came day ſonnes becauſe repented yet outwardly wherein hee gaue bare ſhew euen ſo doe people good though bee outward action bethlite heere lord people ſhall loſe reward true indeed neither manaſſes deſtroy bethſhean townes taanach townes inhabitant dor townes inhabitant ibleam townes inhabitant megiddo townes canaanite dwelt ſtill land 28 neuertheleſſe iſrael ſtrong put inhabitant bethſhemeſh inhabitant bethanath dwelt among canaanite inhabitant land neuertheleſſe inhabitant bethſhemeſh bethanah became tributary vnto theſe verſes holy ſtory layeth ſinne iſraelites ſenſe beſide beniamin caſt deſtroyed thoſe canaanite dwelt ſeuerall lot according commandement god onely made tributary reſt tribe manaſſe reckoned haue done ſo whereas ſaid ioſhua tribe ſo make tributary ioſh 17 12 ſo vnderſtood ſaid anticipation ſetting downe came paſſe afterward afterward come paſſe time heere mentioned ioſhuas death day ioſhua elder liued ioſh 24 31 people contained themſelues duty reſiſting enemy worthy conducting going departing commandement lord time obeyed ſee declined ſhort time waxed weary obeying namely ſo many teacheth ready men doct theſe verſes generall leaue forſake good courſe although haue hardly much adoe brought embrace faſten vpon much concerneth v marke eaſily deceiued thinke ſelues others beginne diſlike turne away ſome groſſe common fault wee wont commit worſt paſt v wee ought iuſtly bee reckoned among godly whereas nothing ſo yet farre note farre greater matter required endeuour effectuall calling repentance may approued god ſound indeed place haue ſhewed ought try ſearch ſelues cannot luk 14 31 lam 3 40 ſtand although wee truly turned god theſe obeyed god time good heart yet ought feare danger reſpect owne frailty according preſent occaſion wee ſee point theſe tribe came followed lord commendably time beginning caſt nation commanded reaſon wit wee ſhould thus carefully looke ſelues reformed part ſmall part reſpect yet becauſe haue receiued ſome grace able thereby deſire goe doe god ſome ſeruice ſpecially ſome time namely watchfull hold vnder rebellious paſſions aſſiſted grace wee hauing ſea corruption euer flowing v owne concupiſcence beſide outward obiects enticing v contrary way muſt drained purged daily little little note bee let alone v leſt ſhould choake drowne grace haue receiued wee become impotent ſo wee doe onely ceaſe obey wee carried rather ſtreame euill tempted namely one heere mentioned ouertooke theſe tribe wearie well ſo much rather ſeeing ſo many allurement occaſions euery place prouoke v ſet v forward although without helpe naked middeſt theſe ſtormes yet wee know theſe thing yea alſo wee doe reſiſt carefully ſuch euill haue mentioned neither ſtriue nouriſh ſuch ſparkles grace kindled v heart ſet wholly hereupon waightieſt thing haue deale maruell though wee fall goodneſſe wrought begun v ſo become note others ſpeake though muſt nothing watch reſiſt ſome one inticements would grant ſoone waxe tedious v neither impoſed vpon v god know bee aiming one good thing worke goeth well forward ſo wee doe wiſely labour diſcerne among good thing beſt moſt neceſſary bee done time ſinne corruption moſt bee reſiſted thus haue ſtood ſomewhat long point ſhew eaſily may poſſibly fall ſtedfaſtneſſe good courſe care ſhould bee v againſt contrary entred ye may remember ſo good occaſion coldneſſe declining tribe knowne commandement goe forward purpoſe ſhew ſomewhat particularly vſe decline breake good beginning euen theſe tribe began well execute god commandement ſeaſon rooting enemy went forward let v ſee ſome ſort ſelues alſo toward others firſt cannot bee ignorant many v good hope haue ſometimes carefully ſearched ſelues finde ſuch corruption heart haue lam 3 40 brought whole liues frame therein wee haue done god good ſeruice wee haue found careleſneſſe ſlothfulneſſe vncleane deſires worldlineſſe c haue chaſe note hunted diſgracing watching praying heartily againſt matth 26 41 time alſo hath another peece good ſeruice done vnto lord alwaies alike forward neglecting care corruption vntowardneſſe ſoone come paſſe vſe good meanes feruency therein oh haue wee drooped hanged wing yea ſpeedy heed hath taken neare haue brought bondage bee well content let theſe ſuch like ſinnes quiet v without great purſuit offering great violence till haue recouered ſome ſtrength v againe preuailed begun moſt vnſeemely manner maſter v bring forth noiſome fruit euen like themſelues canaanite grow ſtrong mighty againſt iſrael held downe god required ſuffered liue let alone proceed theſe noiſome weed plucked vp good ſeed bring forth fruit may eaſily ſee followeth ſeeing roofe muſt need totter groundſels bee pluckt away therefore ſlothfully ſuffer ourſelues grow point ſeeth offend god ſore grieuouſly prouoke diſpleaſure ſuch diſobedience theſe tribe making league canaanite expelling began ſhould ſtill haue done tranſgreſſion alike one ſame commandements ought haue rooted perſons land ſinnes heart liues thus haue ſhewed like canaanite ſuffering ſinnes ourſelues ſhould haue rooted rather let v alſo ſee ſome particular manner like dealing toward others euen failed ſuffering canaanite remaine amongſt expell ſo doe wee ſuffer little better canaanite behauiour manner abide therein till ſimile corrupt taint dwell among infection diſperſed round poyſon men body people iſrael ſet themſelues ſeeke owne quietneſſe eaſe though broke commandement god letting canaanite liue ſtill abide land point thing come day whatſoeuer god command bee done good wholeſome lawes enioyne againſt many fowle ſinnes yet executing require labour coſt bring toyle trouble hinder men eaſe profit behold lion way take hand prou 22 13 haue begun ſoone waxe wearie worke giue ouer neuer enioying god promiſe harten obeying commandements yeelding owne corrupt reaſon ſo little rooting grieuous diſorders lewdneſſe life towne countrie familie whoring drunkenneſſe gaming ill company ſuch like little purſuing perſons diſguiſe themſelues therewith either church commonwealth greater fault theſe tribe let canaanite remaine expell becauſe ſtrong enough haue done ſtronger much ſhould haue executed god charge ſo ſaid verſe 28 iſrael waxed ſtrong yet expell wholly onely put tribute aggrauateth ſinne time foraſmuch note god hath giuen authority men hand remoue ſuch diſorders greater gift knowledge ability ouermatch ſuch euils would haue bee rooted yet wanteth zeale courage goe though thing ſhall neuer bee brought perfection wiſhed yet much might done vtterly neglected ſaid noted verſes generall tribe mentioned therein particularly ſomewhat bee ſaid manaſſe ephraim alike behaue themſelues ſeuered verſ 27 28 39 ioyned together went one roundly worke proſpered diuided doct verſ 27 28 compared former verſ 22 27 backward ſlothfull ſo let canaanite grow multiply obſerue heere looke heedfully make much godly ſociety labour enioy therefore take good may wee haue much encouragement thereby whatſoeuer good wee goe wherein may bee vſed wiſe man ſaith two better one one lie alone ſhould warme eccleſ 4 11 ſo many good perſons ioyned together good worke like firebrand chimney giue glowing heate laid together one alone ſoone goeth one refreſhed helped hartened ſimile comforted according kind worke take hand ſo one alone much weakened made heauie ſoone diſcouraged moſes hand failed againſt amalek till aaron hur propped vp moſes aanon caleb ioſhuah dauid ionathan ſo much many together employment required doubteth much roundly readily diſpatch worke appointed god diſioyned aſunder therefore doubtleſſe bee many ſound hearted ſeuerall god worſhip like minded vpright hearted lord doubly honoured goſpell graced euen eye wicked aduerſarie ſtronglier reſiſted vnited force beſides ſtrengthening one others hand way happineſſe therefore publike aſſemblies faithfull haue great force quicken comfort people god ſeeing face one another preſent together meet lord farre otherwiſe one alone finde though well minded alſo enioyeth ſuch benefit miniſtry vnleſſe otherwiſe euen ſo chriſtian fellowſhip priuate betwixt people god mutuall edifying comfort haue opportunity enioy many way gainefull though ſolitarineſſe hath alſo kinde ſweet vſe though time alone man deſireth fit vſe yet tied worſe bee bad company euery ſuch vncomfortable eſtate imployment particular calling wherein may beſtow chiefe time note ſhould make life meerely tedious weariſome therfore maruell godly fellowſhip acquaintance ſought made account communion saint one fruit goſpell heartier greater requeſt better vſe made enioyned broken among ſome euery light ſmall conceit teatch ſiniſter report ſlander ſuch like occaſions ſeeing haue ſpoken fellowſhip one thing haue thought good adde bee poſſible let wiſe chriſtian bee neuer ſeeke ſome one faithfull friend leaſt may breake minde note doubtfull caſes communicate neceſſary matter may eye watch ouer another himſelfe comfort let eaſe quiet make league canaanite contrary god commanded ſheweth v leſſe maruell ſee ſo age hath doct 1 ſo age age agreement finne among eſtates yea ſame ſinne mutually reſolue ioyne therein paul 2 tim 3 1 ſpeaking groſſe ſinnes ſhould raigne world latter age chriſt tels v time people ſeuerall age ſhould tainted therewith day lot ſo ſhall bee age following eate drinke marrie made paradiſe haue done liued former time ſo doe doe ſtill ſought matth 24 37 felicity heart deſire heere ſome tranſitorie thing gathering wealth hunting vaine pleaſures ſeeking promotion euen ſo doe many day profeſſe goſpell yet eſtate ciuiler ſort greater abomination theſe way truth haue knowne feare god hath eye done one place another yee aske ſinne heere ſpoken alike ſpread throughout tribe anſwere neuer day therefore meaner ſort receiued word fruit turned ſaith ppophet ieremy mighty learned prieſt c declaring hee looked finde otherwiſe ier 4 behold alike ſaid sauiour day noah ſo ſhall bee comming ſonne man ſaith latter age whereof liue part eat drink marrie giue marriage theſe thing moſt minde ſet heart knew nothing danger till flood came tooke away doe men haue done remembrance former day euen ſo ſame thing pleaſure haue men ſaue eating drinking following delight tribe eaſe pleaſure commit ſinne euery one owne way ſo doe men euery one doth beſt ſerue owne turne effectuall ſauing knowledge god found ſaue heere therein perſons generally goſpell myſterie note pearle hidden one another though bee hidden none ſhall periſh exceſſiue vnſatiable ſeeking 2 cor 4 3 world good age bold prophaning lord sabbath yet hath plainely charged v contrary ſaying remember yee keepe holy ſhould ſet downe agreement betwixt men liues practiſe whether compare day former ſame day one man another yet one would thinke example former time ſhould teach latter wiſedome ſeeing liue may behold haue taken away oft time middeſt delight could keepe themſelues death others therefore ought worthily cauſe looke prepare better enduring inheritance againſt muſt goe hence grow end ſeeing ſo world like itſelfe ſinnes haue entertainment alike moſt part one another ſhew cauſe ſo teach vſe end beſides diuels malice ruleth alike heart child darknes draweth ſame euils moſt place beſides ſay men corrupted hart imagination deſires gal 5 19 gen 6 5 loue euill loath good wherby commeth paſſe ſins one embraceth delighteth alſo hauing ability reſiſt turne drinketh vp fiſh doth water nothing able make otherwiſe one grace regeneration new birth changeth man giues new hart whereby diſliketh former inclination diſpoſition led caried amiſſe hereby deceitfulneſſe ſinfull heart found groweth loue liking deſires came conſequently uill word action proceeded mindeth doth contrary thing thus hee wee ſee turned courſe life different men world becauſe light change grace entreth many reſiſted rather deadly manner euen ſound preaching offered vnto note therefore abide ſame eſtate wherein ſo ſubiect grace ſhould guide neither indeed thus commeth paſſe new borne moſt agree ſame euill heart alike diſpoſed vnto carried whereas perhaps obiected good nature many ſome others good education doe put difference betwixt men well ſanctification changing nature man knowne vnto beſt nature poyſoned enclined note ſinne hath ſeede thereof beſt education ſeaſoned religion worke ciuility man moſt reſtraine ſome outward open wickedneſſe cannot giue new heart neither therefore make new creature conclude vſe doctrine ſuch deſire better guided naturall men muſt ſeriouſly labour acquainted heart ſearching law god depth falſhood euill great much taught bewaile ier 17 9 bringeth forth fruit vnto death till obtaine pardon thereof ſinnes grace receiue ſtrength though weakely liue well pleaſe god yea obtaining theſe let attend ſincere preaching fit ordinarily conſtantly may ſo god draw puddle lie ſtill worke grace whereby ſhall reformed image chriſt head ſimilitude member body vniformely gouerned ſame ſpirit worketh alike fruit onely way come gal 5 22 iam 3 17 another thing noted theſe tribe beſide haue ſaid already ſeeing could chuſe heare one another doct 2 one led example though one eaſily agree another euill haue ſaid yet cannot tell commeth paſſe wee haue example alſo others bad courſe much eaſily riueted thereby nay example ſo much preuaileth although wee haue god commandement neuer ſo plaine contrary threates annexed thereto wee boldly breake onely affect commit ſame former doctrine ſaid wee doe wee beare downe v ſtreame could eaſily haue thought people iſrael one tribe another could ſo many haue ſought owne eaſe making peace nation hauing receiued ſo ſtraite commandement ſhould expell yet ſo handle matter among vtterly forgotten among grew bee confirmed contrary courſe one tribe broke ice another breaking commandement became matter lay dead looked would hardly haue thought saphira could haue brought conſent holding backe ſumme money conſecrated ſo good holy vſe making lye ſtanding ſtifly ſhe knew husband mind goe therein ſo made matter commit ſuch treſpaſſe ſhee emboldened doe alſo example likewiſe would haue ſaid well nigh whole city samaria ſhould haue drawne receiue simon magus ſorceries ſome begun none reproue ſhame reſt fell hauing ſuch example man would wonder ſee ſuch cleare ſtreight charge god hath giuen men departing iniquitie following multitude doe euill ſhould exod 23 2 ſo troden vnder foot caſt behinde men back miniſters commanded ioh 21 15 loue chriſt ſhould feed ſheepe lambes people ſhould giue diligence make calling election 2 pet 1 10 eccleſ 11 9 ſure young men boldly take pleaſure ſpend youth licentiouſly old men ſhould patternes young good life c god might mocked hell agreed withall scripture ſtraitely vrge theſe thing old wiues fable ſo regarded one many either miniſter maketh euer conſcience zealous diligent preaching many ſorts feare commandement depart euill enough haue others goe euils doe euen ſheepe beaſts follow formoſt ranke whitherſoeuer leade euen ſo theſe like beaſts doe thus ſeede ill example ſinne encreaſeth iniquitie aboundeth place till length confuſion thing follow office duty eſtates church commonwealth rather men ſee ſuch goe euill ſeeme haue excellency gift whereby maintaine ſinnes wealth learning authority ſuch like reſpect ſinne tribe iudah greater beleeued god would enable caſt inhabitant valleyes ſeeing chariot iron ſo becomming example brother therein chiefeſt though done commendably expelling many therfore reſt tribe thought ſinne tolerable made leſſe though yet ſo good pretence doings iudah returne ſelues know great boldneſſe follow bad example damnation ſuch ſleepeth let men bee deceiued god hath theſe thing ſuch like regiſtred writen inke paper hope time might bee worne remembrance neuer faileth paul wiſh men follow example ſo rare patterne piety hee followes chriſt ſhall haue anſwere looke ſee others doe ſo odious ſoeuer doings let ſerue v doctrine concerning example foraſmuch leade towle v example cannot helpe v beare puniſhment ſhall intolerable ſeeing company ſhall eaſe torment damned hell howſoeuer heere could ioyne hand hand commit ſinne pleaſure conſent let v bee ſo farre following others doings follow rule ſhould guide v owne light may ſo ſhine men may bleſſe god v learne v ſhall wee ſhew ſelues wiſer theſe tribe whoſe ſinne haue ſeene laid open vnto v bee well fenced againſt danger ill example laſt verſes chapter follow vers 34 amorites droue child dan mountaine ſo ſuffered come downe valley 35 amorites dwelt ſtill mount here aijalon shaalbim hand ioſephs familie preuailed became tributary 36 coaſt amorites maaleakrabbim euen selah vpward ſhutting vp chapter holy ſtory bringeth ſumme tribe dan ſhewing theſe danites liberty tribe yet ſtrength expell canaanite lot theſe couped vp narrow roome vnto mountaines yet ſuffered poſſeſſe neither permitted dwell vallies enemy kept great part poſſeſſions hand force ſee negligence tribe ſuffering forbidden nation remaine waxe ſtrong cauſed theſe brother wronged go without due god allotted kept enemy might haue able helpe tribe dan houſe ioſeph done reſt left almoſt without habitation may ſee men ſinnes doe redound doct owne hurt alſo hurt others whereas none hurt neither themſelues thoſe feare offend god carefull duty may receiue great benefit thereby hurt many well themſelues wee ſee bad parent woe hoard vp vnhappy child ahab like themſelues place giues occaſion ſhew directly conſequent feare worſe ſame may bee ſeene many particular among v alſo touching body ſoule firſt many ſoules doth ignorant idle ſcandalous miniſter deſtroy cauſe periſh many good people doth vngodly magiſtrate grieue diſcourage make faint good duty fleſh vngodly salomon ſaith righteous authority people reioyce prou 29 2 wicked beareth rule people ſigh riotous ill company keeper ſuch giue ill counſell many doe ſpoile epiſtle corinthian reade ſaid euill word corrupt good manner diſcredit godly goſpell ſelfe hypocrite profeſſe 1 cor 15 33 doe bring saint paul declareth ſpeaking thus iewes thou teachest another teacheſt thy ſelfe cauſeſt name god bee euill rom 2 21 24 ſpoken ſo goſpell truly preached alſo practiſed ſome yet ill ſpoken wicked becauſe offence hypocrite giue generally wicked cauſes miſchiefe puniſhment god vpon place liue cauſing earth mourne wearie inhabitant yea god child worſe neighbourhood onely gather infection ſoules ſmart bodily alſo oftentimes publike calamity wicked liues haue cauſed giue briefly ſome inſtances alſo hurt wicked men others thing life would long ſhew large doth gameſter ſpendthrift ſlothfull perſon bring naught vndoe familie well bring himſelfe beggerie doth oppreſſor vſurer exacting agreed vpon hardly ſoeuer yeelded fleece borrower till make skinne grow bone want fleſh many cormorantlike rich men doe like kindes impoſing rent vpon poore tenant conſtraine labour onely prouiding due againſt day cannot maintaine themſelues ſo well ſeruants may ought whereas god alloweth liue bee well maintained labour defraud labourer wage pay liſt yet saint iames ſaith cry entred eares lord hoſts oh cannot expreſſed diſcommodities annoiances ſinnes men wicked liues doe cauſe bring vpon others well themſelues tribe heere wrought woe neighbor theſe danites ſeeing plague miſchiefes euery found bee imputed vnto verifie written woe world becauſe iniquity iam 5 4 ſaid tribe dan reſt remaineth queſtion anſwered ſo end whole obiect theſe verſes ſecond part anſw chapter queſtion ſeeing tribe dwelt canaanite tooke tribute whether bee lawfull godly man dwell bee conuerſant vngodly papiſts c anſwere ſeeing chriſt kept company publican great ſinners ſeeing saint paul would giue leaue beleeuing wife depart matth 9 10 1 cor 7 13 vnbeleeuing husband hee dwell therefore ſimply vnlawfull dwell ſuch godly well ſetled ſound knowledge certaine caution obſerued companying papiſts c ſtrong faith ſo tied communicate falſe worſhip god may yet certaine caution firſt companying intendand endeauour perſwade 1 ſound religion end ſhew themſelues kinde gentle better draw feare danger drawne themſelues ought cut ſuch fellowſhip ſecond thing muſt take heede liue vnreproueably 2 without iuſt blame among otherwiſe ſhall hurt harden rather doe leaſt good thirdly 3 may leaſt matter vnder colour friendſhip mixe themſelues either falſe opinion worſhiping god although ſhould hope thereby draw eaſier embrace chriſt many hypocriticall profeſſors doe thereby couer voluptuouſneſſe couetouſneſſe prophaneneſſe ſhould rather remember may euill good may come laſtly muſt take heede ſeeke owne profit 4 hand companying thē take pleaſure gaming play whereby bewraying weakeneſſe impatience greedieſſe gaine wrangling immoderate ſpending time therein ſhould ſet backe imbracing goſpell therefore theſe caution regarded alſo wee haue hope win wee muſt craue pardon leaue god hauing doe familiar manner neceſſity may poſſibly bee either part neede ſhould bee great way bee relieued v liues ſhould preſerued caſe ought warie leſt intangled alſo may company bee linked bond nature parent brother kinsfolke ciuill reſpect magiſtrates maſters c putting child ſchoole haue obeyed voice haue yee done 3 wherefore ſaid alſo caſt ſhall bee thornes vnto ſides god ſhall deſtruction 4 angell lord ſpake theſe word vnto child iſrael people lift vp voice wept 5 therefore
