pricke conſciences firſt rehearſeth benefit god beſtowed vpon ought rather haue drawne obedience doth firſt verſe ye may ſee ſetteth downe fault hee reproueth one made league canaanite contrary god commandement caſt downe alters expoſtulateth ſame ſaying haue ye done contrary charge lord gaue 2 verſ laſtly threateneth diſobedience ſhould great puniſhment ſaying driue ſhall bee prickes ſides god ſhall bee ſnare vnto 3 verſe remaineth ſpeake particularly theſe order come ſpeake meſſage ſay little meſſenger word meſſenger angel ſignifieth ſometime created nature firſt verſe perticularly heb 1 14 without body hebr 1 angel called miniſtring ſpirits theſe aſſumed ſome forme god commandement time better accompliſh office geneſ 18 sometime word ſignifieth gen 18 2 meſſenger god ſendeth execute reuel 2 3 angell ment miniſter ſent meſſenger god whether theſe ſoeuer ment heere maketh matter particularly expreſſed text ſufficient v wee know miſſenger ſent god therefore ſufficiently authorized thoſe ſent one ought reuerently receiued beleeued let teach v god alwaies vſed doct 1 verſ 1 miniſtry ſeruants reueale hath ſeemed good vnto declare vnto men either generall couenant heb 1 1 grace promiſe ſaluation particular thing hee ſaw cauſe whether patriarkes angel prophet apoſtles age paſt doth miniſters goſpell paſtours teacher vſeth day reueale vnto people declaration word time time highly commendeth great kindneſſe theſe ſent thoſe meſſengers ſeeing wee know hee hath done people age ſo teacheth v others v like wee bound heare act 10 33 lord ſhall ſay v according sauiour himſelfe ſaith heareth matth 10 40 heareth deſpiſeth deſpiſeth ſo much wee heare receiue meſſage readineſſe ſeeing hath 1 theſ 4 8 glorious age ſo moſt latter age wherein reuealed v thing hath performed sauiour appertaine man happineſſe age paſt onely foretold therefore may much fully clearely bee made knowne hearer meſſenges ſhould bring tidings faithfull able doe meſſage caſe wee muſt receiue lord himſelfe word preach word man deed word god ſo may worke v effectually phyſicke gal 4 14 corrupt body make v ſicke recouer heale v againe 1 theſ 2 13 god hauing prouided eſtate ſoeuer people euery one ſhould receiue portion right diuiding word vnto ordinarineſſe meſſage ſhould make either eſa 50 4 miniſtery leſſe ſet rather wee ſhould haue ſo much eſtimation admire therein vnſpeakeable prouidence god loue lord ieſus hee ſendeth v extraordinary meanes ſo yet hath promiſed ordinary vnto church euen end world epiſtle epheſians ſeene epheſ 4 11 duly conſidered doth bewray wofull lamentable eſtate moſt hearer though moſt feareful eſtate heare euen word preached power authority haue ſmall account reuerence ſhould lord doe vnto hoſ 6 4 matth 11 17 hauing thus offered dainty vnto yet ſo ful ſtomacked finde ſauour pleaſure giue themſelues leaue ſo wallow ſenſualities take fill earthly note delight finde ſauour heauenly delicates yea yet ſome ſuch heretofore haue heard ioy yea man might haue thought would haue pluckt eye brought glad tidings vnto waxen full count enemy telling truth ſome thinke themſelues within weekes able teach teacher haue turned zeale lukewarmeneſſe reuerence contempt conceitedneſſe worldlines deprauing scripture ſo like fooles loath wholeſome ſweete manna word life approued truth god reliſh fantaſies haue great taſte delight dreames lie ſomuch would faine himſelfe come dead affirme brings newes thence ſound knowledge faith haue ready receiue oh people infatuated bewitched paul ſaith galathians ſeeking one runneth vpon ſwords point owne deſtruction gal 3 1 theſe enough tenth sermon second chapter booke ivdges ſame text verſ 1 let v marke lord ſending meſſenger people heere fallen laying open verſe couenant hee made moue repentance theſe 3 verſes ſeene heere let v marke ſay god faine preuent meſſenger lay ſins could accuſe themſelues complaine ſaying among themſelues haue done ſo ſeeke recouery fit hardened runne ſtill yea couer ſinnes adam flee gen 3 10 iob 31 33 gen 31 54 god ionas ſit downe vpon hide rahel vpon laban idol bet bethinke themſelues ſhould come ſinnes ſo helpe themſelues danger thereby vtterly ſeeke altogether vnfit may bee likened dauid 2 sam 12 7 hauing lien long two fearefull ſinnes ſo farre repenting nathan faine leaue parable ſpeake plainely could conceiue peter hauing denied maſter mat 26 74 75 power riſe ſinne till lord ieſus looked backe vpon watchword peter called minde together cock crowing word ieſus ſpoken wit ſhould denie went wept bitterly wee may ſee dangerous thing ſinne meane doct 2 onely committing one would thinke feareful enough afterward able riſe lie ſtill yet men thinke repent pleaſure liſt though trouble conſcience raw fleſh doth ſtomacke hardened time eſpecially ſoone committing ſo cannot humble heart bewaile ſinne god come themſelues time yet god preuenting haue ſaid renueth grace relenting remorſe renouncing crauing pardon thereby indeed inabled repent ſo returne former workes wee ſee power able bring heart thereto doe ſuch thing themſelues yet ſay many time haue fallen doe attaine grace neither god brings heare preaching affliction calleth deeper conſideration ſome ſuch like meanes bringeth ſinne light diſgrace theſe people hee heere bochim may bee ſtay courſe returne let well weighed herein diſtraction diſquietneſſe hath lie bound chaines ſins haue cannot helpe themſelues bee ſo bereaued grace god faith hope ioy holy ghoſt feare offending ſuch like lie dead part hauing vſe ſtrengthen note good although themſelues profitable holy vſes whereas meane would loſe ſweet communion god bee wiſe enough conſider ſay though ſhould neuer brought againſt though houre day comfort belonging thereto yet theſe haue ſpoken haue ſinned againſt knowledge doe depriue themſelues whole moneths yeeres doe thus ſuſtained triall god patience commendable poſſible honour thereby ſome commendation hauing owne amiſſe enioying pleaſures ſinne ſhort ſeaſon oh lamentable thinke wiſedome ſhall well beſeeme ſeruants god note giue diligence keepe well well wiſe haue teeth ſet edge deceiueable baites ſinne world ſo greedily runneth foraſmuch ſhall ſee deare ſhall coſt yet let know ſuch ſhall bee onely void forementioned grace ſhall alſo ſmart many puniſhments ſo hard come repentance haue fallen yet enioyed gift ſoundly much neuer haue part neither like haue euen wee ſee daily experience fearefull eſtate liue vnleſſe wait god diligently ordinance preaching attaine wee haue heard god faine prouoke repentance doct 3 verſ 1 could ſet themſelues toward followeth ſee reaſon vrged haue ſaid little place heere mentioned gilgal citie plain iordan farre iericho gilgal meſſenger ſaid haue come bochim place neare adioyning meſſage done people iſrael ſins cauſed called bochim name giuen occaſion fell weeping people ſinnes brought remembrance ſo word bochim ſignifieth namely weeping place therefore returne purpoſe lord told diſobedience beginneth make odious rehearſing benefit great many hee ſhould ſay cauſe haue giuen deale thus vnthankefully diſobediently hath kindneſſe thus requited returne euill good heere ſundry place wee may ſee effect benefit god doe commonly worke men forgetfulneſſe vnthankfulneſſe meane account making alſo boldneſſe ſeeking carnall liberty thereby vnto ſo readily caried prouoke god much neuer enioyed little remembring lord giues watchword ſhould rather looke thing thankefull iuſtly therefore 1 theſ 5 people heere chalenged vnthankefulneſſe cauſe warned ſhould take heed come land promiſe ſhould poſſeſſe great goodly city builded houſes full manner good filled deut 6 10 11 12 wels digged vineyard oliue tree planted eaten ſhould full warned ſay ſhould beware forgot lord brought land egypt c ſignifying vnto wealth eaſe would goe nigh make deut 32 compare v 9 onward verſ 19 forget god mercy deliuered miſeries wee ſee peruerſeneſſe depraued nature turnes wholeſomeſt food poyſon corrupt ſtomacke doth daintieſt meates abhorre hauing receiued freely good turnes benefit forgetteth benefactor hee promoted c yet certaine men worſe god benefit bold ſinning againſt abundance earthly common bleſſings dauid confeſſeth afflicted hee went aſtray ſo benefit pſal 119 67 wee ſee ſo much good chaſetiſements ſo ieremy ſaid vntamed calfe till god corrected wofull experience teacheth rare man may truly ſay otherwiſe wit benefit knit heart neerely god bee taught affliction yet muſt know neither owne nature draweth men loue obey god benefit god worketh grace eſpeciall fauour without whole life meere diſobedience ſay grace guideth v keepeth v within compaſſe eſtates common bleſſings generall thinke ſay belong others well v ſpeciall priuate reape feele ſay bleſſed god wee moſt part knit dutie euer tenne leapets luk 17 cleanſed returned giue thankes ſaue one hee tenne thouſand talent remitted ſhewes fruit thankefulneſſe caught fellow throat owed hundred penny bidding mat 18 28 pay owed heart man naturally puffed vp proſperity vaine eſtimation himſelfe hee prideth ouerthrow waxeth hardened ſo far humility meane thinking himſelfe may perceiue rightly iudge maketh prouder ſcornefull yea vtterly vnlike ſhould diſguiſed yet become great get much vale miſery thing greateſt price asked eagerly doe men runne fiſh follow baite greedineſſe nay laugh ſuch ſcorne find fault ſo doe follow exceſſe let better thing paſſe little worth yea yet doe lawfully come wealth promotion lord giueth proſperity without indirect vnlawfull meanes euen ſuch ſay doe offend like manner exceſſe greedineſſe fall ſame danger thereby others doe attaine ſhifting againſt conſcience ſome perhaps ſay lawfull v enioy earthly obiect benefit god againe none rightly vſe proſperity plenty anſwere god forbid men may ſome doe much good thereby others eſpecially vnder croſſe aduerſitie anſw rare contrary miſchiefe rather proſperity befalleth men moſt part ſuſpect neither feare danger maketh proſperity abuſed groſly forget themſelues abuſe proſperity yet hangeth ouer head moſt hardly auoided moreouer neither 1 doe obſerue themſelues leſt ſhould become drunken 2 neither ſearch themſelues finde offend thereby neceſſary man proſperity doe yea vſe doe ſo daily cutting danger may otherwiſe enſue therby yet beſt practiſes againſt ſinnes yea though neuer ſo conſcionably reuerently put vre doe little little grow note common loſe ſtrength ſo therefore beſides theſe chriſtian man muſt oft iob tell ſeriouſly himſelfe muſt looke 3 change ſay alwaies ſummer thereby cracke iob 14 14 pride life abaſe exceſſe carnall delight proſperity otherwiſe ful ſoone raiſe vp moſt dangerouſly laſt god 4 continue day health welfare ſo ſmartie croſſes kept let croſſe naughty vnruly affection thoſe eſpecially moſt like offend danger chaſing away ſeruent prayer againſt grow fruitfulneſſe thereby receiued fiue talent brought fiue gained thereby theſe thing duely obſerued thoſe moſt neceſſary luk 19 18 mat 25 20 doubt affirme man doth ſo ſhall vſe proſperity well profitable many way thereby yet another man doth ſo cannot warrant nay dare bold ſay hee ſhall ſeeing godly doe rarely thus iudge world vſeth proſperity godly ſo hardly vſe well another thing worthie bee marked heere lord moueth people repentance rehearſing benefit beſtowed vpon doct 4 verſ 1 reaſons ought moſt preuaile god ſeruants diſſwade ſinnes haue fallen raiſe preuent committing like ſay ought moſt preuaile euen often remembrance due conſideration god benefit though griefe may bee ſpoken aduice preuailes little reaſon god vſed heere people conuicted thereby yeelded confeſſed themſelues guilty loue god conſtrained hauing ſhead 2 cor 5 14 rom 5 5 plentifully heart heard ſharpe iuſt reproofe god himſelfe meſſenger ſaw clearly ſinne namely vnthankfulneſſe forgot god benefit trod vnder foote louing kindneſſe moſt precious thing went neare knowing hee done ſo many great good thing remembring benefit ſome perticular manner heard repeated cauſed caſt vp vnſauoury gorge ſo returne deceiueable damnable offence imbrace againe mercy lord firſt husband putting people remembrance many great benefit god doth draw oft place feare hee ſaith deuteronomie thy god haue bleſſed thee thy heart could deſire thus another place alſo hee deut 28 calling people repentance compareth vine labouring eſa 5 2 draw ingratitude putteth mind planted church place moſt plentifull abundant cauſed dauid euermore haue god mercy great remembrance ſet benefit eye hee might ſhame himſelfe ſinne paſſed meanes ſeeke come therefore pſalme 103 though hee thankfull yet excelled men therein quickeneth vp himſelfe thereto ſaying praiſe thou pſal 103 2 lord ſoule within thee praiſe holy name 51 pſalme perſwade himſelfe repentance hee ſaith mercy pſal 51 1 great multitude compaſſions reaſons drawne dreadfull feare god iudgements may confeſſe terrifie time heart god people hold awe violence worke kindly bring dutie cheerefulneſſe though may ſtay euill time till forcibler perſwaſions come ſaid loue god conſtraineth men ſhould liue god 2 cor 5 14 note firſt benefit beſtowed themſelues yet ſay reaſon ſhall alwaies preuaile v although doth wee may well conclude wee much order haue groſly forgot ſelues come particular benefit hee beſtowed vpon doct 5 verſ 1 forbearing repeate euery one together ſeeing may bee read text time ſake one another lie order firſt brought egypt countrie wholly infected ſuperſtition idolatry therefore moſt dangerous dwell benefit bee deliuered thence euen rome another reſpect sodome ezok 20 7 8 muſt haue corrupted peſtilent contagion idolatrie beſide moſt heauie burthen bondage ſtill alſo muſt haue preſſed remained hence almoſt euery scripture mention made god goodneſſe iſrael deliuerance egypt moſt commonly reckoned principall becauſe without bleſſings nothing therefore let v alſo know ſinguler mercy god freed falſe worſhip god idolatry ſhould ſay eſpecially ioyned deliuerance bodily trouble alſo benefit whereof many thouſands land partaker fellow brother nation iſrael egypt iuda babylon oppreſſed idolatry would thinke obtained vnualuable benefit might haue freedome ſo may well thinke oh liberty ſoule body yet may haue farre eaſe without trauell iourney although cannot value ſort according worth haue neuer felt burthen troubled conſcience bodily vexation yet wee haue though bee nothing ſo grieuous note ſay euery day riſe bed doe neceſſarie buſineſſe confeſſe marueilous worke god deliuerance yet deny benefit god bee ſought alſo enioying ſincere preaching goſpell welfare ſoules thing neceſſary preſent life ſo may want encouragement god ſeruice howſoeuer lord ſhould denie v one meane plentie body yet many yeers hath moſt gratiouſly yeelded granted v yet ſhould contend meane ſound ſauing knowledge happie ſound miniſtery meanes poſſibly wee may enioy ſpeake iuſt reproofe ſuch doe onely regard outward eſtate world little nothing looking benefit true happineſſe ſoules welfare forecaſting altogether plant themſelues ther whither hope earthly commodity doth leade though townes family kindred neuer ſo prophane ſuperſtitious make haſt yet little regard ſo commodity honour may gotten common queſtion may looke good dwell liue dei pſal 4 7 match leaue child remaine holding infection popery labouring ſhield vnder ſetled good miniſtery ſo minde ſeeke ſaluation part thought nay bee thouſands land luſt ſeruitude popiſh egypt againe earneſtly deſiring day god turne away lord forgiue sauiour prayed crucified know farre thankfulneſſe freedome voluntary ſlaues vnder pharaoh rome euen owne countrey returne ſo draw end let counted v rare ſingular mercy god free great calamity extremity ſoule body theſe iſraelites deliuered egypt bondage thereof occaſion ſay adde ſuch liue void grieuous paine diſeaſes well egyptian bondage others yea thoſe many god deare child vnder ſtone collicke gowts vlcers griping ſuch like alſo ſuch vtter penury want yoked vnquiet vnkind ſupeſtitious companion marriage vnmercifull land lord cruell ouerſeers gouernours doe make life note weariſome conſume cheerefulneſſe comfort moth eateth vp beauty garment let ſuch ſay beare pettie ſmall diſcommodities trouble viſitations patiently contentedly bee highly thankfull deliuered farre greater yea let acknowledge freedome theſe like hold ſound peace god bee free ſtings euill conſcience alſo enioy peece paradiſe though meane condition let pitie thoſe ſuch depth griefe feruent prayes may moue lord pity alſo let free reſolue themſelues endeauour vſe liberty health poſſible good yet let bee knowne alſo god layeth theſe great burthen vpon ſome hee giueth greater grace goe meekely vnder let v beware leſt ſecurity negligence god may iuſtly note vpbraid v benefit heere doth iſrael hauing elbowroome liberty ſerue god place calling without diſturbe v hold v vnder enbondage ſelues ill conſcience looſeneſſe ſecurity earthlineſſe like euils life ſhould irkſome egypt babell ſecond benefit heere mentioned god beſtowed vpon doc 6 ver 1 ſecond benefit brought fruitful land dwelt farre greater matter former ſhewing plainly thought enough deliuer bondage except hee filled good thing alſo done much hee onely deliuered fearefull bondage though hee left wilderneſſe bring alſo fruitfull land giue oh admirable kindneſſe behold heere great bountifulneſſe god hee well willingly giue abundance child keep great trouble therby waſted diminiſhed bleſſings giuing liberally beſtowing fountain rich neuer drawne dry ſaid poſterity people oh iſrael would haue hearkened haue walked pſal 81 13 way would ſoone haue brought downe enemy would haue fed fat wheat honey rocke neither neede thinke ſtandeth giue v theſe whoſe honour beſtow great thing hath already giuen v greateſt euen owne ſonne therefore much afford v theſe ſmaller benefit rom 8 32 alſo know giue great rich abraham iſaac iob faithfull ſeruants loued dearely wee land haue good proofe hereof deliuerance bondage haue goſpell peace gouernment plentie ſuch like particularly land haue cauſe admire goodneſſe god deliuering v curſed practiſes thoſe ieſuites locuſts beaſt hath ſent forth deſtroy v prince noble magiſtrates miniſters root church policie among v bring darkeneſſe confuſion againe wee owe doubtleſſe great thankes god theſe mercy ſpecially late treaſon iſrael freedome egypt ouerthrow pharaoh purſued common obiection god doth enrich ſo obiection faithfull one latter age obiection many readier put forth queſtions take adſwere ſay though men world haue great ſubſtance ſwim wealth rich yet god people ſeldome ſo held downe pouerty want ſo much one hardly able relieue another thereby alſo ſay doe leſſe good bringing perſwading religion ſeeing goe perſwade doe feare god loueth ſerue ſeeing hee beſtoweth wealth vpon doth vpon others moſt part eſpecially ſome place religious alſo feare themſelues ſhould bee religious euen ſhould become poore alſo ſay trouble many therefore anſwere manner doe good hee ready beſtow rich vpon better anſwere 1 thing alſo ſaid ieroboam ſeruant made king enough would ſaith hee haue giuen thee 1 king 14 bad man hee would haue giuen hee vſed well doubteth would liberally handed deare child good otherwiſe indeed hee thinketh better held backe beſtowed anſwered saint iames asked iam 4 2 obtained becauſe asked amiſſe beſtow thing asked vpon luſts might haue bettered hee would haue liberally giuen vnto anſwered paul hee gaue hee asked yet asked better thing rich grace ſufficient thee ſo denying 2 cor 12 9 faithfull ſeruants giueth grace worketh contentment thereby though outward eſtate bee weake hee yet euen keepes noiſome euils dayes liue ſay anſw 2 anſwere muſt hold truth euery man eſtate wherein god ſetteth ſay hee ſinne hath brought vpon beſt lord prayer petic 4 well taught wee directed aske daily bread euen ſuch ſucceſſe eſtate poore rich heauenly father ſeeth beſt v euen daily bread muſt contented yet added hee hath meate drinke apparell bee counted poore indeed wealthieſt hath neither better ſatisfied hath ſuch one gratious ſuperfluity hath counted glory commonly doe ſee become bane man worſe wealth ſtrong hold maketh pro 18 11 bolder ſinne way moſt carried ſenſuality much poore man dare though god ſetteth vp ſome triall maintaining eſtates preſeruing fellowſhip church common wealth godly ſhould want wealth moſt part vſed many euen ſnare entangle deceiueable world beaſt caught horne buſhes brier man bolt heeles holden running ſo doth hold back running apace heauenly life neither let trouble moſt godly want father vnder law comming chriſt great wealth poſſeſſions yet godly ſaued therefore god loued v would well beſtow vpon v wee muſt know outward ſeruice coſtly required wealth moreouer one vſe rich haue theſe earthly thing god figure thing heauenly earthly canaan hee heauenly ieruſalem earthly countrey promiſed father enioyed liued heb 11 13 ſtrangers thoſe promiſes looked better enioyed hath ſaid may fully anſwere queſtion conclude therefore god freely willingly beſtow liberall portion vpon faithfull ſeruants well keepe great calamity ſee beſt eſtate weake ſeeing like good enioy thinkes good giue let contentedly labour without followeth third benefit heere mentioned promiſed third benefit laying obiect hee would neuer breake couenant heere lord may ſeeme giue great aduantage hee binde himſelfe thus ſuch oft time charged heere haue done breake couenant toward may ſeeme hee tied ſhall neuer breake couenant ſeeing hath promiſed ſo vnto whatſoeuer doe howſoeuer breake behaue themſelues toward abſurd anſwering therefore vnderſtanding theſe word anſw verſe two thing conſidered one couenant hee ſpeaketh ſaith granted vnto would neuer breake whether hee ſpake ſimply vpon condition namely ſhould obey theſe two anſwered make matter cleare firſt wee know couenant heere mentioned hee neither meaneth particular couenant hee entreth faithfull god ſufficient euer hee neuer gen 17 1 goe loueth loued ere loued ſo end loueth neither doth meane generall couenant ſending ioh 13 1 chriſt redeeme world vnbeleefe man could make rom 3 3 promiſe god fruſtrate none effect meaneth couenant enioying land peaceably hee brought commodity therein couenant made conditionally ſhould obedient thing ſaid one two ſerueth better vnderſtanding ſpeech ſaith meſſenger hee made couenant hee would neuer breake ſhould endeauour walke hee would continue good land hee giuen bleſſe therein otherwiſe would bee free promiſe hee would caſt long bearing diſobedience puniſh ſundry way meane ſeaſon euen ſo ſeeing kept couenant deut 28 required bound next verſe ſeene clearing forementioned doubt point thus determined doth miniſter heauenly inſtruction doct 7 ver 1 v faithfully good hart ſet ſelues obey lord yet meane otherwiſe may v performed would doe great thing v euen world would feede v good thing euen bread wheat fineſt hee ſaith pſalme earthly bleſſings anſwerable would ſuffer pſal 81 16 proud domineere ouer inheritance ſoone bring yet wee muſt know owne people ſhall ſinne againſt correct rod often withdraw ſweet fruit fauour light countenance wont refreſh pſal 89 31 comfort ſoules ſo euen priuiledges iſſue couenant may great part great lie drowned ſeeke ioy peace confidence prayer ſuch like temporary benefit vtterly loſt oh therefore notwithſtanding many see doct verſ 5 large great worthie promiſes made v yet wee doe labour faithfull couenant take liberty amiſſe euery one way thinkes good behold ſinnes depriue v many bleſſings might haue enioyed hold many good thing v ieremie ier 5 25 ſaith bring many euils vpon v euen ſo prophet eſay witneſſeth though lord hand ſhortened cannot ſaue neither eare leuit 26 heauie cannot heare yet iniquity ſaith haue ſeparated betwixt god ſinnes haue hid face hee heare eſa 59 1 theſe thing rightly weighed may truly ſaid note ſuffer lord doe v good fill v bleſſings hee ready doe euen ſelues becauſe wee ceaſe prouoke liuely laid prophet amos ſaith rained amos 4 7 vpon one peece ground vpon another wherefore ſinne thoſe poſſeſſe contrary blind reaſon looke sampſon ſhould alway goe well v howſoeuer deale god defraud due breaking couenant iudg 16 ſo sauiour agreeth well ſaith meeke matth 5 5 ſhall inherite earth haue ſhall bee ſweeter great rich vngodly ſhall multiply alſo god ſeeth good might make one maruell ſee counted god people many time run ſo greedily world vaine allurement ſuch wiſe go backe grace faſt though god caring nothing like owne though forgotten promiſeth ſufficient wealth godly life godlineſſe 1 tim 4 8 hauing promiſes thing earthly heauenly yet ſo catch faſteſt imago ſhall ſpeed beſt may ſee ſeeke guided god haue beſt ſucceſſe bleſſing others going without whereas obiect richeſt moſt part ſauour goodneſſe ought trouble man full ſoone ſhall rich iniquity thoſe rich cauſe right ſoone ſay ſhall betake wing leaue reconing behinde bee made haue ill gotten ſpent ſhall little liking know neuer counted bleſſings without grace vſing aright eleventh sermon continved vpon text verſ 2 3 vers 2 ye ſhall make couenant inhabitant land c ſecond verſe followeth wherein couenant behalfe people ſet downe god behalfe verſ 2 3 ſenſe couenant people lord former verſe couenant betwixt two party leaſt point couenant theſe two one ſhould make league inhabitant land ſhould breake altar downe hee findeth fault idolatry wee ſee yet fallen keeping couenant hauing clearly conuinced expoſtulateth asketh done ſo hee ready heare excuſe could alleage ſinne muſt need greater hee proceedeth ſhew puniſhments ſhould bee inflicted three firſt hee would expell theſe nation two aroſe followed ſhould abide ſtill land great hurt annoyance iſraelites dwelt two way haue ſaid firſt ſhould thornes pricke put paine ſhould ſnares ſhould taken caught ſinnes ſhould afterward fal idolatry ſhould moſt grieuouſly puniſhed theſe thing thus ſet downe wee may obſerue theſe foure thing theſe two verſes firſt couenant god ſecondly conuicting angell breaking thirdly lord expoſtulating fourthly puniſhment threatened concerning doct 1 firſt people bound couenant god learne v wee looke benefit god couenant made v muſt enter couenant looke bee faithfull keeping ſpeake though wee may claime thing due deſert thereby wee may know god hath ſo appointed ought performe accordingly though god maketh promiſe earthly benefit yet place couenanteth giue heauenly alſo pardon ſins ier 31 31 life eternall moſt ſurely keepe promiſe although godly bound heere onely ſome particular duty yet generall couenant vrged beleeue thoſe thing god promiſeth alſo walke god continually whole courſe wherein yet failing reckoned againſt frailty offend boldly tempt god careleſſe looking couenant let ſuch know god bee mocked ſinne finde ſo vnderſtand particular couenants ſuch god made heere people hee promiſe bleſſe marriage earthly affaire buſineſſe ſuch like bee faithfull therein couenant faile bee falſehearted god free word promiſe next thing couenant god forbidding fellowſhip doct 2 thoſe nation commanding pull downe altar wont offer falſe god thereby cut occaſion committing idolatry teaching v thereby auoide occaſions euill ſhall alſo kept euils themſelues yea groſſe ſinnes idolatry drunkenneſſe adultery like though prone commit yet contrary ſhunne occaſions meanes leade ſhall vndoubtedly fall take one example moſt common reſt bee fooliſhly vnbeſeeming profeſſion ſnared ſome woman hauing caught eye lid taken precious muſt auoid fowle ſhamefull ſin adultery firſt chaſt iob make firme couenant looke vpon iob 31 5 ſecondly neither talke whereby wee might eaſily nouriſh wicked luſt deſires thirdly come company may godly ioſeph refuſed doe leaſt looke wee gen 39 10 neither let thought linger carrie v way feruent prayer chaſed away farre feare committing ſinne falling danger word lord hath ſpoken might ſay many man might haue eſchewed murther hee could haue withdrawne heart wrath reuenge ſo might many haue auoided oppreſſion miſerlineſſe could haue ſnibbed firſt ſtraying concupiſcence vnlawfull deſires another man commodity propound theſe inſtances among reſt hauing time ſpeake many diuell ſpiteth ſeruants god ſeeketh ſpecially theſe way bring malice paſſe caſting blindneſſe vpon ſhall hardly ſee great danger note till fallen taken baite laid yea wofull experience hath made v ſee true haue broken ſnare know difficulty haue eſcaped common ſort ſhew great religion liues brought ſhame opportunity ſerue ſome theſe way made hang downe head reaſon guilty conſciences ſuch miſchiefe one might haue auoided note namely vncleanneſſe one fouleſt could haue perſwaded ſhunne occaſions thereof keeping company ſuch become beſotted impotent alſo could walke ſoberly particular calling hauing nothing doe may ſee good get dalying vnſeaſonable companying looſe talking vſe woman yet one chiefe delight ciuill ſort men doe take yet would thinke ſhould haue great wrong offered ſhould warned come particulerly couenant head iſrael doct 3 muſt keepe toward lord caſting downe alters hauing fellowſhip canaanite affoord ſeuerall leſſon firſt mentioned may bee learned chriſtian magiſtrates authority pull downe idol aboliſh ſuperſtition deut 7 5 infidel heretickes occaſions idolatry purge dominion iuriſdictions ſuch droſſe abomination hezekiah brake downe braſen ſerpent abuſed called nehuſhton peece braſſe ſo much rather ſeeing god worſhip 2 king 18 4 ſimple vncompounded hee addeth thereto ſuperſtitious ceremony tainteth ſubſtance much lieth chriſtians ought doe ſame priuate houſes place ſubiect field farmes chappels c yet let take heed attempt doe ſo calling men houſes place haue authority meddle vpon deuotion good intent cal either honor god benefit others though winne idolater themſelues courſe onely ordained god winne idolater ſound religion alſo forbidden meanes preaching word conference c appointed root ſame men heart turn ſuch blind deuotion may bee tearmed zeale vnaduiſed corrupt ſinfull neither wiſe chriſtian vſed bee noted occaſion one part people couenant namely muſt pull downe alters wit ſhould haue fellowſhip haue ſpoken chap 1 verſ laſt ſaue onely ſpake particularly doct 4 making marriage idolater yet followeth good neceſſary conſequent priuate chriſtian fearing god may haue familiar conuerſing ſuch much leſſe marriage making neareſt fellowſhip ſo briefly conclude charge giuen lord deuteronomie yee ſhall make marriage deut 7 3 neither giue thy daughter ſonne take daughter thy ſonne meſſenger god hauing told people couenant doct 5 bound ſhewes ſinne broke couenant conuicteth ſaying ye haue obeyed ſo ſpoken could deny scripture teacheth men ought bee conuinced ſinne word god haue ſo proued iuſt prouocations god yet liue may bee able denie end may eaſilier brought repentance onely told preaching ſinne grant muſt done farre may bee bee charged guilty ſo bee vrged haue giuen cauſe ſo farre may pricked conſciences vnleſſe heart flinty ſo ſay heart haue ſinned one principall point preaching aimed god commandement timothy ſaid preach word ſeaſon ſeaſon rebuke 2 tim 4 2 conuince exhort lenity conuincing moſt auaileable god bleſſing among meanes awake drowſie conſcience ſo quiet reforme sauiour foretelleth v saint iohns goſpell ſpirit god power act 2 37 ioh 16 8 word inſpired holy ghoſt preached apoſtles miniſters reſurrection ſhould conuince world ſinne reade ſecond act peter proued againſt iewes conuicted conſciences crucified lord glory conſented thereto ſaid immediately following heard pricked heart thus dauid could eaſily yeeld truth generally ſet downe nathan 2 sam 12 could goe namely ſee himſelfe faulty whoſe ſinne reached heauens prophet nathan conuinced told ſaying thou art man hath dealt ſo cruelly wickedly hee could ſay haue ſinned sam 24 god ſhewed dauid ſinnes 2 sam 24 16 17 numbring people repented yeelded verſ 17 thus paul dealt roman ſought throughly make odious former ill courſe fruit yee ſaith hee thoſe thing whereof ye aſhamed conſciences bare witneſſe none kind dealing people preaching moſt profitable like doe moſt good ſo one hardeſt matter namely rouze vp conſcience conuince profitable ſay awaked pricked cannot acknowledge note ſinne likelihood bleed ſo relent craue pardon abandon direct way whereby holy ghoſt guideth men ſaluation drowſie ſleepy conſcienced ſo moued hearing reproofes doe ſtriue againſt light owne conſcience conuinced wax hardened worſt moſt vnkind abuſing gratious worke god bewaile caſe onely receiue benefit thereby doe waxe worſe ſo depart god ſo ſeldome returne againe moſt ſort iudas ſome others yet theſe ſhifts men vſe conuicted either pricked ſtruggle againſt ſeeke ſhift elſe hardened deceitfulneſſe ſinne ought heb 3 12 moſt carefully taken heed returne therfore profitable hearer oftentimes conuinced otherwiſe miniſtery doth little good ſo alſo hard winde pierce heart ſaid meane bring hearer point ſhall cry ſay euery one owne part haue ſinned concerning miniſters ſhould bee one ſpeciall meanes doe moſt part abſtaine worke altogether either winding vp obſcurity vnderſtood leaſt contenting themſelues bare propounding truth without applying conſcience diſcouering corruption heart ſo hearer may eſcape worke leaue people diſcretion ala ſo farre working word vpon themſelues haue many ſtarting hole excuſes ſinnes extenuate alleage owne infirmity note men example ſo though ſtricken preaching arrow yet harneſſed bumbaced ſuch wiſe ſhift blow bee wounded thereby rather follow owne euill courſes harden heart ſtill may well ſet beſt ſide outward denie carrie faire ſhew though well god knoweth hart let ſure ſinne ſhall find ſhall goe well end vſe ſo looke ſelues whole numb 32 23 carriage liues feare may ſaid v brought againſt v ſo verifying prouerbe righteous bold lion prou 28 1 rather ſeeing wee haue iudged ſelues wee may bee iudged 1 cor 11 31 lord haue kept conſciences pure good end may feare conuincing word god offer violence note offer firſt themſelues eſpecially wilfull offending yet found light ſomethings worthy blamed looke ſo narrowly himſelfe may iuſtly charged wee breake amiſſe dutie deſire word may challenge v euen conuinced let v willingly readily yeeld wherby ſhall free ſelues iuſt blame blockiſh ſleepy ſecure obſtinate hearer paſſe conuincing meſſenger god doct 6 expoſtulating breach couenant ſaying haue ye done ſhould ſay perſon god ye ſhew reaſon yeemay doe thus giue leaue come forth make anſwere people anſwered word token held themſelues guilty teacheth god equall righteous proceeding yea euen toward thoſe haue prouoked ſaith like caſe prophet thoſe poſterity people heere mentioned come let v reaſon together c hee eſa 1 18 doth men ſmite haue done wrong note ſhall know neuer willing come good condition tractable ſoeuer might finde theſe indeed cruell vnmercifull men offer indifferency lord ſay dealeth ſo offer haue dealt trecherouſly broken couenant alleage ſound reaſon doings yea euen himſelfe hee hath dealt hardly hath void compaſſion hee heare giue leaue plead owne cauſe aduantage hee giuing doth ſtop mouthes iuſtified himſelfe word ier 12 1 pſal 51 workes make greatly conuicting ſuch ſay like ezechiel lord way vnequall could haue kept ezek 18 25 ſuch falles dangerous eſtates thereby come vpon yet ſeeth hee hath ſet double hedge ditch betwixt ſinnes nay rather brazen wals end might come neere commit hee hath ſpeake plainely ſent prophet among note gen 2 17 forbid threaten euen hee adam hee ſhould reach hand eate forbidden tree hee allureth ſeeketh win perſwadeth imbrace good way luk 15 come neare way death puniſhment euen hee ſeeketh loſt heare come ſo may ſay ſhall doe people yea may well ſay hee people hoſea prophet ſaid ephraim ſhall doe vnto thee iuda ſhall entreate thee harden heart hoſ 6 4 see iob 39 37 38 ſuch manner charge god ſinnes yet perſwaſions reaſons could bee reclaimed nay maintaining wherof haue ſhewed themſelues rebellious obſtinate know scripture ſuch ſhall remaine witneſſe againſt ſhall neuer bee able finde ſmalleſt eaſe ſuch cauiling whereby doe patching new old make rent worſe may ſee beſt truſt owne imagination follow owne way neither deale adam excuſe iob 31 33 ſelues like goſpell bidden marriage ſent anſwere pleaſed ſo little became thereby wee wade deeper danger luk 14 18 beare away blowes may bee ſaid ſtriue againſt eſa 54 17 chaſtiſements euery tongue ſhal contend iudgement ſhall condemne may ſee wee liſt fearefull example hid talent earth commanded put vſe occupie hee thought hee reaſon enough ſay defence hee knew bee hard man hee receiued therefore would ſure returne owne againe anſwere heard euen take vnprofitable ſeruant caſt vtter darkeneſſe mat 25 30 ſhall weeping gnaſhing teeth therefore ſee alſo text people nothing anſwere reaſon demanded done ſo men haue followed owne ſwinge ſinning haue deſired ſhall neuer bee able anſwere thing owne defence ſoundly iuſtly encreaſe ſinne haue ſaid already ſhall bee tongue tied wherupon followeth haue proued lord hath ſo good right dealeth againſt ſinners entring iudgement hee feareth giue vantage thinke ſerue turnes end ſhall ſee make themſelues thereby guilty theſe meanes giuing people liberty anſwere could ſinne aggrauated againſt hauing ſo much colour defend themſelues ſo let v learne hereby yeeld onely ſilence humbled alſo relent proceed true repentance yea let v beware wee haue controuerſies lord bold offend prouoke thinking though fooliſhly falſly make good end ſure ſhall neuer make part good againſt neither let v ſinne hope wee threatened puniſhment ſame ſhall arraigned ſhall eaſily found guilty lord ſhall iuſtified faire ſhewes muſt vaniſh leauing v brier thus haue heard people reproued ſin threatning verſ 3 ſenſe puniſhment followeth ſharpe ſore ſet three point firſt god would expell enemy hee vpon condition promiſed ſecond remaining ſtill land ſhould thornes ſides third god ſhould bee ſnare catch deſtruction firſt theſe puniſhments namely god ſhould expell firſt puniſhment canaanite well bee weighed meant wee may better ſee puniſhment meaning thus ſpeaking much yee haue ſtood couenant driue nation haue ſuffered remaine ſtill neither ſtand mine conditionally made ſo wheras promiſed ſtrengthen expell haue begun doe doe ſo follow euen doe ſhall able doe ſelues ye weake ye haue good proofe yet caſt ſhall remaine deſtruction lord meant ſaying would caſt firſt puniſhment teacheth v remoue annoiances doct 1 may ſhall able afterward would greateſt annoiances euery man ſpeciall ſinnes euen one note breaking couenant lord wee ſee ſome ſpecialleſt theſe ſinnes eye ſores v heart goe trouble ſorrow bring v yet wee caſt v ſtill retaine ſhall come paſſe afterwards ſhall get ſuch ſtrength v ſhall able depart come wee would ſhall ſo winde themſelues v ſo draw delight eſpecially long lying vncontrolled wee ſhall become drunken beſotted ſo wee ſhall vtterly impotent prayer meanes vſe able preuaile againſt nay ſay god ſhall viſit v ſickneſſe otherwiſe word hath ſpeciall manner wounded conſciences feared note v diſpleaſure yet euen wee ſhall able breake come loue haue ſo ſtrongly forcibly drawne v euen husband naturall man vpon death bed hardly depart wife youth hath dearely loued caſe come ſometimes paſſe ſay wee doe crie ſuch ſinnes anguiſh conſciences thinke ſhall die ſuch affliction ſearch deepe perhaps conſtraine v vtter extremity paine ſome confeſſions diſlikings make purpoſes god hold v racke promiſe proteſtation neuer returne note yet ſhall appeare euen thoſe promiſes wrung v force feare saul confeſſion hee heard hee ſhould loſe kingdome god heauie hand ſhall bee wringing paining either mind body wee ſhall bee ready runne old byas againe ahab raſh haſty putting ſackcloth imbrace thoſe like ſins great liking ſay behold therefore bondage bee deluded ouercome ſuch baſe commander iniurie doe ſelues fall league ſpeciall ſinnes doe wee throughly hartily diſlike ſet againſt bud yet newly ſprung vp v firſt alluring v yea rather rather keep thē firſt ſo might haue ſuch power ouer v hope beginning acquaintance withſtand ſhake wee would ſet ſelues purpoſe doe namely word god teacheth v diligence vprightneſſe knowing wee ſhould loſe labour whereas wee giue place tentations fooliſh allurement doe wiſely ſeriouſly withſtand beginning thereof wee bee danger become ſlaues afterward vnable chaſe away would haue ſaid alſo proſtitute ſelues many companion till wee finde rom 13 13 people found heere expelling canaanite cannot poſſibly rid ſome doe yet exceeding difficulty wiſe giue vp member weapon ſinne rom 6 13 faith ſet themſelues mortifie betimes haue attained ſound hope ſaned knowing otherwiſe ſtrong man satan hold keepe poſſeſſion ſtronger hee come euen lord himſelfe power driue yet bee well begun attempted v thinke caueat watch word vnprofitable neceſſary although wee haue got vpper hand caſt vncleane ſpirit yet ſhall ſuffer careleſneſſe ſloth good worke ſlake bee broken enemie make another aſſault vpon v gather ſtrength recouer poſſeſſion againe though driuen yet hee imbarkes himſelfe get againe laboureth doe ſtronglier keepeth hold double force courage nay ſeuen fold firſt end bee may ſee wit though worſe beginning goe deed yet exceeding difficulty perill though hee expelled hence many day thoſe alſo forwarder ſort haue courage roote ſinne townes family ſeeing entertaine ſame themſelues attempt ſuch thing yet doe faintly ſoone leaue hereof number neuer grow great ripeneſſe religion meane practiſe neither doe euer come ſee tenth part fruit note comfort bringeth becauſe wiſe chaſe away thoſe common ſinnes doe moſt lie open doe dallie neuer oppoſe themſelues againſt thing hartily eſpecially long time together many liue whoredome malice oppreſſion deceiuing reſt moſt part kept reprochfull euils yet liue dead vncomfortable life ſeeing doe reſiſt offer ſinne haue made gedeon kingdome ſeeke hunt rather ſuch life hath ſmall force perſwade others repentance firſt puniſhment twelfth sermon second chapter booke ivdges proceed ſecond puniſhment threatned wit ſhould bee thornes ſides ſecond farre regarding ſuch inſtructions haue giuen ouer themſelues vnto theſe defilement haue ſay found thornes dauid though haue euer thorne plucked fleſh diſquiet meane bee brought ſound kind repentance third puniſhment god ſhould bee ſnares vnto 3 ſnare know ſet take catch bird conie vnawares ſo may killed pleaſure ſet ſo hee ſhewes foreſeeing wiſely rooting theſe nation would proue ioyning worſhipping god ſo would become deſtruction ſo foolithly running ſnare ſhewes ſay ſhould taken therein fall thereby noiſome ſinnes hand lord would ſcourge grieuouſly one generation another till ſhould periſh good land euen ſo came paſſe found true told thoſe enemy moſt wickedly ioyned themſelues league often ſubiection bondage thereby ſpoiled good liberty bleſſings afterward caſt land among babylonian aſſyrians wee may ſee idolatrous wicked company keeping wee haue ſnares ſet v bring v fellowſhip fowleſt ſinnes ſo lord hath ſaid wee conuerſe haue fellowſhip exod 23 32 making marriage eating wee ſhall alſo fall faſhions partake ſinnes people great force friendſhip draw v wee neuer intended nay againſt reſolued keepe ſelues ſtrong enough among v withſtand allurement perſwaſions note carnall friend wee oft company haue ſo many way draw allure v one time ſhall bee conſtrained yeeld ſhould beare al diſlikes frownings diſpleaſures hard handling hee ſhall bee ſet vpon purſued ſee much theremedie refraine company 2 tim 3 5 neare fellowſhip altogether yet although ſo thereby bee free danger ſide yet wee muſt know without great care keepe liues free offence wee ſhall ſome way lie open ſome whereby great danger like enſue gather wee ſhould neither bee idle vnprofitable acknowledgement chriſt wee ſeeke proſper ſeeing behold practiſe vnwearied labour bad popiſh ſort winne men vngodly threat ſhould heere haue ended ſpeech ſeē occaſion propounding obiection doubt taken hence cauſe ſet downe anſwere goe new matter obiection ſeeing meſſenger god mouing repentance doth reprouing conuicting make mention faith may ſeeme faith ſuch price mention made people might driuen deſperation rather brought repentance encouraged beleeue pardon ſin well forſake anſwere firſt could moued anſw repentance encouragement perſwaſion beleeue though hee name faith expreſly yet ſeeing repentance cannot ſeparated neither could repentance therefore vrged vpon without secondly ſay people repent cleere text therefore alſo beleeued thirdly meſſenger repeating god promiſes doth finde fault beleeuing ſame conclude therefore hee moued beleeue chiefe thing turning god ſo let bee perſwaded though bee alwaies expreſſed euen ſaid iaylor hee asked hee ſhould doe bee ſaued beleeue lord ieſus without faith impoſſible pleaſe god ſo let bee act 16 31 34 heb 11 6 looked vnto principally riſe vp lie confeſſed ſinnes cried heard haue reproued god meſſenger craued pardon accuſing themſelues guided therein god prophet hoſea time taught people repenting ſhould take word well haue good heart weeping hee required alſo reſembled peace offering examine theſe thing perticularly doctrine repentance heere occaſion offered ſpeake brieflier paſſe ouer ſeeing haue ſpoken largely sermon though booke ſaue labourer harueſt may bee able fit bring home lord harueſt alſo ſhould doe wee heare ſuch diuine ſermons doctrine meſſenger god heere preached vnto vrge conſciences laying ſinnes doctrine argument grant ought doctrine moued according wee heare occaſion offered either griefe comfort wee ſpecially taught doctrine repentance wee ſhould follow example theſe heere mentioned cried ſinnes mourned deepely craued pardon likewiſe ſame people came theſe heard samuel reprouing lamented god mentioned 1 sam 12 1 booke act peter ſermon pricked heart act 2 37 ſought comfort ſay ſhould wee doe meane ſuch haue repented already renue ſuch alſo yet enter vpon fearefull theſe fruit may ſeene others ſo many among v hearing like ſermons goe vntouched conſciences drie eye hart though theſe ſufficient yet faith commendable secondly principally heere people lifted vp voice doct 2 wept reproued abſe god benefit breaking couenant god meſſenger ſo among good inſtructions infinite ſhould greatly moued ſore grieued wee ſhall heare wee iuſtly charged preaching like fault ill vſing bleſſings god hath beſtowed vpon v breaking couenant wee haue made becauſe theſe two ought ſo thorowly minded v daily wee ſhould giue iuſt cauſe rebuked neglecting either note doe liues commendably theſe two bee wanting neglected v meane doe bind ſelues couenant bee fruitfull dutie cheerefully go ſame ſee god benefit continued v whereby doth hire v thereunto ſecondly make new couenants time time walke conſtantly vprightneſſe rather deſerue iuſt rebuke breaking looking looſely old wee haue due regard theſe time time wee ſhall keepe part liues within compaſſe better alſo ſhall need feare ſuſtaine ſharpe reproofe iuſtly euer vnwelcome fleſh ſame yet ſay ſomewhat perticularly theſe three ſignes repentance muſt know inward grace teſtified outward ſignes thereof heere ſet downe rather ſought v repentance relenting melting heart offending god humiliation faith like outward ſignes themſelues laſt eſpecially offering ſacrifice expiatorie ſeeke forgiueneſſe ſinnes euchariſticall repreſenting thankes meerely ceremoniall proper iewes therefore vſed v yet laudable ceremony vſe expreſſe faith beleeuing chriſt thankeſgiuing doe ſimply offer god without ſaid offering ſacrifice firſt though mentioned laſt two lifting vp voice weeping alwaies bee aimed repentance cannot alwaies attained neither therefore neceſſity bee vrged neither note reſted haue firſt namely lifting doct 3 vp voice prayer confeſſion ſin accuſing ſelues required prophet oſea ſuch could ſhew vrging people time repent ſaying iſrael returne lord thy god hee addeth take vnto word ſay vnto take away iniquity receiue hoſ 14 2 v graciouſly offer calues lip c cannot expreſſe mind word namely ignorant eſpecially ſome ſome bitternes heart powre prayer without word ſome time anna therefore may alſo moſt expedient may helpe quicken v feruency voice 1 sam 1 13 lifted vp alwaies neceſſity inioyned concerning weeping alſo heere ſaid haue adioyned doct 4 degree ſorrow many attaine vnto neceſſity bee impoſed vpon v haue ſaid though repentance could without though accompanieth repentance doth deepely ſearch heart ſatisfie party ſo moued quiet mind troubled vnſetled haue thought good ſay outward ſignes repentance ſeeing ſet downe teſtifie ſame people therefore may ſee repentance muſt euer found v whether ſignes bee preſent point thereof theſe heart bee deepely ſumme repentance briefly pricked ſinne bewaile ſame purpoſing neuer turne like againe bee preſent time bee yet aggrauating ſinne beleeuing according promiſe god freely remitted god chriſt doct 5 leſſe quiteth heart beleeuing wil purge dead workes alſo afterward keepe ſinning ſuch manner former time heart whole man ſanctified already beleeuing ſubſtance repentance practiſe example people alſo many scripture ieremy hoſea diuers ier 31 18 hoſ 14 2 3 obiect heere may doubt ariſe repentance people may ſeeme haue ſuch hath bin ſet downe repented time bring forth fruit amendment whereof one yea chiefe one wit ſhould haue rooted idolatrous canaanite ſo ſharpely reproued done rather made league yet making peace one chiefe ſins laid charge ſound repentance ſins bewailed acknowledged repented muſt need amended wee know perſons anſwere hereto bee thought lord held backe anſw ſtrength courage ſo could fight againſt proſperouſly done day ioſhua end might beare mark ſin diſobedience god according accuſtomed maner receiue fauor repented hee reſtore againe particular gift iuſt deſerts hee taken ſtrength body courage minde hauing abuſed neither neceſſary ſaluation thing moſt needfull v marke great benefit euen ſo dealeth day former time people note hee dealt firſt parent fall though repented receiued againe fauour yet euils diſcommodities brought vpon themſelues mankind lord take away neither quiet ſweet abode paradiſe enioyed time sampſon loſt gift bodily ſtrength time hee ſo greatly diſpleaſed god might ſay many wit loſt vſe ſuch grace enioyed ſo doubtleſſe ſuch commendable profeſſion goſpell truly conuerted god faith repentance fall againe old ſinnes drowſineſſe coldnes ſeruice ſuch ſay haue found receiued like meaſure hand moſt cleare experience hath hereof late deceaſed generation ſome ſtill remaine whoſe firſt zeale loue firſt receiuing goſpell ſlaked hath neuer recouered though haue ſeene falles repented obtained mercy yet lord hath left marke note ſinne behind miniſter people ſo haue rarely recouered former zeale one feruent preaching care taking ouer people cheerefull profeſſion vprightneſſe heart holy walking haue limped ſome ſort afterwards doe come ſhort grace lord hath ſuffered put remembrance ſin euen man hauing fallen high beame tree broken bone though hee get ſimile ſet together againe ſo may ſerue turne ſome ſort yet neuer feeles perfectly cured euer painfull lame afterward much impaired adde one inſtance ſuch truly repented haue fallen adultery ſuch hainous crime though haue riſen againe giuen good teſtimony thereof although come truly perſwaded forgiuen yet vnquietneſſe doe oft finde within themſelues ſhame holding downe head note doth cauſe outwardly men whereby much appalled held backe reſpect might haue good beſides many louers truth ſtrong enough receiue though ſinne doe freely communicate euery way much eſtranged hardly conceiue whereby may bee ſeene credit much impaired thereby among men although bee ſtill fauour god dauid others lord prouidence doth ſuch like keepe awe ſo ready breake againe may ſee god deteſteth ſinne euen owne alſo hee may thereby ſtir vp ſerious repentance conſtant holding courſe bee notled away errour wicked ſuch brought right way already hath ſaid point may teach vſe ought prouoke al ſuch grace god kept ſuch reprochfull ſinnes yeeld continuall thankes god feared much neglected well benefit giue iuſt cauſe doe ſame lie knowne offenſiue crime yet cunningly keepe men eye looke let ſuch note know worſe worſt haue ſpoken whoſe ſins yet haue broken men ſeeing beſt may fall poſſibly dangerouſly ſo ſure ſinne finde ſhall ſmart accordingly let much thinke god vnskirt vnuizor ſhame good time let beſt count loſt needleſſe care keepe themſelues well well meane free notorious knowne ſinnes let endeauour giue good example without wearineſſe ſo may bee free ſuch fearefull offence ſaid people repentance former inſtructions theſe two verſes adde doct 6 bitter weeping people cauſed place take name thence ſo day retained called place weeping ſee long remembrance kept many yeeres doth ſtrongly commend v care ſhould haue liue poſſeſſe generation comming v good example giuen v among liue v may doe good gone either miniſters diligent feruent preaching godly liuing people ordinary receiuing meſſage goſpell thankſgiuing commendable fruit following place ſuch inhabitant whether receiue name ſuch thing done bochim heere ſo materiall bee thought remembrance ſuch good thing done might harten encourage many ſhall come place onely alſo many follow ſuch example whether doe true vile action ſhall bee done leade people god goodnes diſorder meane vnruly behauiour reuell rout keeping example ſhall bee taken vp ſure onely haue ſeene alſo ſhall come hauing heard made cuſtomes petty lawes among themſelues cuſtome ſpending twelue day natiuity c doth truly teſtifie thus end thirteenth sermon booke ivdges ſecond part chapter vers 6 ioſhus ſent people away child iſrael went euery man inheritance poſſeſſe land 7 people ſerued lord day ioſhua day elder outliued ioſhua ſeene great workes lord done iſrael 8 ioſhua ſonne nun ſeruant lord died hee hundred tenne yeeres old 9 buried coaſts inheritance timnahheres mount ephraim north ſide mount gaaſh 10 ſo generation gathered vnto father another generation aroſe neither knew lord yet workes done iſrael 11 child iſrael wickedly ſight lord ſerued baalim 12 forſooke lord god father brought land egypt followed god euen god people round bowed vnto prouoked lord anger 13 forſooke lord ſtrong motiue draw men god yet griefe may ſpoken vtterly wanting among moſt men heart ſet follie vanity hath liued ſee many laid graue hath ſcarce thought hee ſhall follow goe way haue gone heare
