life laſt ſort people affordeth alſo leſſon vnto v doct 3 latter generation moſt part backwardeſt goodneſſe declining former wonder ſo theſe wanted meanes ſo euen enioyed wee ſee thoſe plant flower rare yeeres agoe grow ſimile euery garden one getteth another ſo ſinne growes tradition example daily encreaſeth age adding ſome new till come full meaſure though commonly old thing decay waxe worſe yet old adam older ſtronger sinne hath age growth world growes older ſo ſinners multiply trading note ſinne doe ſtill exceed former age kind leaudneſſe one conſenting exalting follie whether wee conſider number perſons equall compariſon made fouleneſſe boldneſſe ſinne wee muſt looke latter day bee worſer pride couetouſneſſe drunkenneſſe preſentage ſeene forefather dayes nay monſtrous middeſt poperie although extenuateth ſinne euen ſubtilty ill conſcience exceed former age alſo knowledge indeed long teaching hath becauſe men receiue truth loue ſincerity god accurſeth barrenneſſe honeſt ſimplicity tainted craft ſubtilty therefore fitter receiue print goſpell iuſled ſuch moſt part riſen vp prophane filthie ſcornfull alſo hardlier perſwaded goodneſſe former generation though may bee found true generall eſtate toward end mat 24 12 world latter day sauiour foretold ſhould ſo iniquitie ſhould abound haue vpper hand yet perticular generation one another may alſo ſeene bee ſo goſpell bee planted nation countrey towne bee continued one age another though meanes like yet latter generation ſhall come behinde forme feruencie diligence euery way yeelding fruit goſpell commendably reſpect verifie prouerbe new thing dainty old loathſome cannot tell commeth paſſe yee muſt grow glutted word wearie aſhamed ſome ſort godly zeale forwardneſſe haue ſeene others former time receiue goſpell haue done thinke needeth ſtoope ſimplicity bee zealous patternes practiſing perticular doctrine one point well another ſeeke take liberty willing examine vpon good ground doe neither bee forward going one another mercifulneſſe iuſtice ſeeking puniſh notorious fault family townes like good example giuing thereby diſcourage elſe like come forward laid ſuch block way need ſtirre vp ſelues example haue gone v commendably rather pleaſe ſelues doe reſt therein without contending ſtriuing doe better ignorant ſuch eſtate cannot good wee bee aduiſed let v know reward ſhall bee great wee honour lord greateſt forwardneſſe religious duty iniquitie aboundeth world pſal 19 loue many ſhall waxe cold haue ſhewed occaſion people ſinne namely good gouernours dead ſinne ſelfe followeth theſe 3 verſ 11 ſenſe next verſes manner firſt generally perticularly verſe thus euill ſight lord fell idolatry heere ſtay little till paſſe two verſes euill moſt certainly diſpleaſed lord moſt grieuous manner ſame word heere vſed like meant place ſaid king iſrael euill ſight lord ſo contrary thoſe thing good eye lord act many king iuda 1 king 16 2 27 ſaid pleaſe highly god hath giuen v many encouragement 2 king 18 3 ſeruice yet regard bee better maruell hee abhorre ſuch doings make open exclamation againſt doth heere hee hath ſet hedge ditch hold v doct committing alſo hath giuen v many cauſes better teaching v manifold benefit alſo looketh hand ſhould doe ſo although ſinne people manifeſt view world well god yet ſecret hid men euill ſight lord euen ſo ſay ſelues wee minde god matter ſeruice chiefly walke looſely hollowly ſhall iuſtly challenged doe cannot abide howſoeuer men find fault v though degree ſinne one grieuous another yet ſet heart wholly ſeeke lord great care pleaſe thing euen doe euill eye ſeeing eye lord ſearch narrowly ſpie men ſee therefore may ſaid liues greateſt number yet ſome ſuch reproue others many doings charged iuſtly yet bee vpright heart faithfull god one thing well another yet ſo bad doe euill ſight ſeeing man god approueth praiſeworthy therfore ſhall haue ſtill euer againſt euill rom 2 laſt luk 1 6 eye lord commend iob ſaying thus vpright feare god depart euill well thought ſhould ſmal cauſe found tender conſcienced iob 2 3 feare doe euill ſhould ſo ſcornfully ſpitefully railed vpon diſgraced men world dare ſo looſe liues ſhewing thereby abide none ſuch euill ſight lord eleuenth verſe word baal ſpeake next verſe together verſ 12 ſenſe like ſort firſt twelfth verſe holy ſtory ſaith forſooke lord yet god father brought bondage egypt diſpleaſe god ſome particular action leauing true worſhiping god fountaine well dutie life ſo aggrauated fauour benefit heere mentioned wit god done greatneſſe ſinne may bee laid fully comparing peter anſwere sauiour ſaw ſome hearer depart vpon iuſt cauſe onely bare conceit asked peter reſt fellow apoſtles alſo would depart hee anſwered ſaying lord whither ſhould goe thou haſt word eternall life hee ſhould ſay ioh 6 68 hauing found ſo good bountifull already hauing ſuch hope ſtill greater good hereafter knew finde like ſhould haue abſurd depart diſciples ſpeake truth ſay leſſe ſo might people well haue anſwered ſo ought haue ſaid alſo euen peter farre becauſe ſome neuer cleaued lord truth truſted walked hollowly vnfaithfully towards though much worſe doct may ſee fearefull eſtate may grow depth ſinne may fall embrace religion conſcionably euen worthineſſe excellency thereof good haue ought haue gotten loue ſhould beare god hath loued firſt rather began profeſſe paſſion ſome outward mutable reſpects ſuch ſay may like time depart god altogether ſtate without god world men heart become hardened deceitfulneſſe ſinne doe next grow worſe ſo depart liuing god written epiſtle hebrues haue heb 3 12 ſpoke theſe outward profeſſors beſt wickedly ſight lord ſo ſome better among ſo likewiſe may note hereby though beginne wel ſome theſe true renouncing euil yet holding faithfully carefully conſidering duely god goodneſſe toward v zealouſly embracing good meanes may eaſily little little yea ſhall alſo together goe backe euen theſe reuolting ſuch haue ſpoken little therefore followeth ſhew people fell idolatry verſ 11 12 13 ſenſe euen worſhip baal aſhtaroth ſuch idol people nation ſerued dwelt firſt ment theſe name idol heere named baal ſignifieth patrone helper tooke idoll baal aſhteroth god sidonians idoll forme ſheepe worſhipped word baalim heere meant manner idol ſuch worſhipped among point people iſrael come ſeeing would expell thoſe idolatrous nation might neither continued ſerue lord ought haue done behold themſelues departed alſo fell idolatrie beſides may learne auoide occaſions ſinne cannot looke auoide committing ſinne ſelfe doct verſ 11 12 13 14 haue ſpoke former chapter may ſee men forſake lord way haue made knowne vnto fall moſt lothſome ſinnes euen moſt groſſe fowle idolatry yea end ſuch abomination god reſtraine euen ſo lord complaineth ieremie ſaying people haue committed two euils haue forſaken fountaine liuing water haue diged ier 2 13 themſelues pit hold water would neuer haue thought people ſo well prouided liue happily theſe manifold encouragement euen wee haue ſeene ſelues time many haue among v would neuer ſay haue thought ſuch could grow ſo monſtrous prophane none might ſeeme goe beyond therein euen ſo may bee ſaid apply ſelues oh men could ſee god hath done theſe day hee hath granted liue day wherein goſpell hath ſhewed moſt cleare light made manifeſt way eternall life ſat darkeneſſe heerewith hath giuen peace abundance earthly commodity alſo c oh ſay could time ſee theſe thing happy might haue thereby hidden therefore theſe haue yet followed owne heart deſire courſe ſuch know god may ſay ſide oh iuſtly may bee complained leſſe ſhame miſery deſire know idolatry meant ſaid commit let know anſwere doct 2 idolatrie worſhipping idol hath two part outward wee giue proper god either theſe inward wee commit idolatry inward wee truſt pray giue thankes ſubiect ſelues vnto whatſoeuer heauen earth water vnder externall wee manifeſt affection outward thing bowing knee vailing cap proſtrating ſelues vſing ceremony appointed god owne ſeruice whereas vrged idolater time meane pope votary anſwere giue honour worſhip image giue reuerence ſtocke whatſoeuer onely god chriſt himſelfe image let heare ſhame saint paul ſaith corinth image idoll nothing ſaith hee ſay god 1 cor 8 4 vnder ſay ſerue hee repreſented ſuch image worſhip creature whereby wee may truly gather liſt may cleerely ſee bowing proſtrating themſelues groſſe idolatry whatſoeuer pretend haue oft learnedly anſwered ſame may ſaid offering burning light going pilgrimage saint departed ſuch like miracle 2 theſ 2 9 falſe wrought satan god doth ſuffer two cauſes one try whether goe god thereby puniſh themſelues wicked one beleeuing lie cornelius bowing peter iohn angell take god yet becauſe went farre forbidden yet theſe verſes let v note thing two ſeeing doct 3 people ſaw heard god allowed father worſhipping abraham iacobs moſes others yet followed example made ſinne greater father ſuch holy ghoſt heere meaneth followed namely moſes prophet paul act 24 24 act affirmed ſeruing god worſhipped god act 24 14 father followed therein father papiſts would follow boaſt haue father ſide controuerſies matter queſtion betwixt v tranſubſtantiation reall preſence adoration sacrament ſuch like would ſoone end let v ſee retaine true ſeruing god thoſe holy father ſeeing ſuch ſeruice haue heard god pleaſed note miracle egypt repeated applyed heere generation yet done long though doct 4 brought egypt themſelues yet borne end ſhould profit moued wel father note ſay miracle workes god time paſt wrought prophet sauiour apoſtles ought ſerue benefit ought haue vſe well v whoſe day wrought although ſaw done whereupon ſet downe whatſoouer thing written written learning ſhould among vſes bee confirmed rom 15 4 doctrine word alſo looke proofe miracle wrought euery age following reſolued truth let v ſee guided alſo ſaid ſinne generation roſe death good elder puniſhment wrath lord hot againſt iſrael hee deliuered hand ſpoilers ſpoiled ſold hand enemy verſ 14 round ſo could longer ſtand enemy whitherſoeuer went hand lord ſore againſt verſ 15 lord ſaid lord ſworne vnto ſo puniſhed ſore haue heard firſt point foure ſecond part ſenſe chapter namely ſinne people next point followeth ſaid puniſhment lord purſued two fold firſt anger god conceiued againſt ſecond fruit ſet downe heere partly ſpoiling good partly bondage enemy generally god hand againſt ſo able ſtand meanes wherof anguiſh ſtraits knowing behold eſtate changed yea ſo ſoone turned away lord euen ſo ſhall finde come particular therefore ſaid heere god angry muſt ſo take though god ſubiect paſſions men either anger repentance c ſuch ſpeeches vſed one 1 sam 15 30 god anger end fault may appeare grieuous ſaid prouoke ſo hardly moued againe capacity vttered giue v vnderſtand god doth doe ſame thing men angry fault committed againſt doe reuenged vpon offender yet hee free paſſion think heare god angry ſet light moſt yet heare led paſſions troubled becauſe cannot feare god doe ſame v angry man offended doe ſuch prouoke doct verſ 14 ſtronger thinke ſhall eſchew decline danger yet anger compared lion ſeeketh prey doubtleſſe wrath aſſiſted power preſence therefore ſaid pſalme anger bee kindled earth moued foundation hils ſhaken againe pſal 18 8 anger kindled little happie truſt place pſal 2 laſt many ſuch doe liuely ſhew danger prouoke angry iuſtly ſo anger without reſpect perſons parciality declared againſt ſorts without exception prouoke greateſt ſhall well ſmart meaneſt text importeth vſe ſeeing god prouoked ſins ſhould beware offend common manner men doe prophaning sabbath word sacrament ſlander lying diſſembling incontinency vnchaſtneſſe body minde deceiuing oppreſſing thouſand way eſpecially muſt looke liue vnbeleefe diſobedience high degree euen goſpell paul ſaith wrath god reuealed heauen 1 theſ 1 8 ioh 3 laſt wee haue fallen ſuch next heed bee taken v ſleepe vpon tremble know god wrath kindled againſt v knoweth whether vengeance may come forth epheſ 5 6 take hold v heart relent wee meet repentance lion roreth beaſts forreſt quake time v doe like mighty lion tribe iudah moued meet euen child god held awe conſidering god iealous god yea conſuming fire againe cannot tremble behold diſpleaſure ſometime enemy well ſee ſmiling countenance toward owne people much ſhould tremble owne caſe themſelues perſons vpon hee frowneth prince wrath death ſee ahaſhueroſh heſt 7 7 inflamed againſt haman dangerous eſtate moſt iuſtly haue ſtirred vp lord againſt cauſe sauiour ſaith feare deſtroy body feare mat 10 28 caſt body ſoule hell ſay feare man lying known ſinne repenting man miſery hee could ſee howſoeuer hee ſooth vp himſelfe ſoothed mouth lord hath ſpoken haue wondred oft ſo many offending knowne daily doe willingly looſely yea boldneſſe ſo great danger thereby ſundry puniſhments euery note day haue wondred ſay ſo make haſt rid themſelues fearefull condition eſpecially ſeeing ſo many ſmart time time ſame like ſinnes ſwarme yet giue apparant token impenitency infinitely worſe bee gone hence thus much time fifteenth sermon vpon booke ivdges rest fourteenth fifteenth verſes part former text theſe verſes following vers 15 whitherſoeuer went c 16 notwithſtanding lord raiſed vp iudges deliuered hand oppreſſors 17 yet would obey iudges went whoring god worſhipped turned quickly way wherein father walked obeying commandements lord ſo 18 lord raiſed vp iudges lord iudge deliuered hand enemy day iudge lord compaſsion gronings becauſe oppreſſed tormented god anger feare therof firſt puniſhment haue heard followeth next effect angry conſult deuiſe may reuenge themſelues vpon ſuch haue offended 〈…〉 • ffect effect whoſe anger ſet downe firſt ſpoiling 〈…〉 good bondage came enemy farre greater theſe ſorer becauſe god dealt himſelfe gaue ouer men yea cruell men ſuch dauid deſired might fall hand becauſe mercy ſay ſome former theſe two ſuch proſperity know loſſe wealth found experience taken men bee one hardeſt iudgements doe befall reaſon loue money good almoſt altogether well liues yet great puniſhment ſuſtaine lord hath giuen bleſſings loſe right vſe fooliſhneſſe ſinne cauſe moſt part become curſes god wiſedome doth ſend ſuch penalty oft time among many vnto ſaid heere hee gaue hand ſpoilers yet farre worſe muſt goe vnder yet neuer conſider thus puniſhed behold people extreame follie ſinners day though heart ſet vpon wealth commodity yet neuer bethinke themſelues freed danger god wrath often waſteth nothing know therfore decay good barrenneſſe note ground vnſeaſonableneſſe weather debt ſuretiſhip penniewiſe poundfooliſh ſuch like eſpecially miſpending know ſay haue warning thereby ſent v god ſome ill part life ſaid deuteronomie thou wilt obey voice deut 28 15 33 lord thy god fruit thy land thy labour ſhall people thou knoweſt eate heauen ouer thee ſhall braſſe earth vnder thee iron againe nation fierce countenance ſhall eate fruit thy cattell deut 28 51 ſhall leaue thee neither wheate wine oyle neither ſhalt thou proſper thy way text heere ſpoiled good ſhould make v carefull preuent euen verſ 29 iudgement among many vpright walking god harmeleſſe liuing among men fooliſh preciſe ſoeuer courſe life ſeeme many ſo wee haue gone good way fallen gen 17 1 obedience haue couenanted yeeld vnto god ſuſtaine ſuch loſſe thereby aboue thing let v ſeeke finde cauſe thereof ſpeedily ieremy requireth beare loſſe becauſe ier 8 4 mich 77 ioh 5 14 haue ſinned ſinne leſt worſe thing befall v let v count hard fortune fooliſh men tearme none wee ſo waſted good neither pleaſe wee ſelues condemning charging ſecond cauſe thereof whereby 〈…〉 whatſoeuer inſtrument loſſe vndoing ſure lord effecter worker therof 〈…〉 deuteronomie fearfull iudgements 〈…〉 ſent ſhall demanded wherefore hath lord done fierce great wrath ſhall anſwere becauſe haue forſaken couenant lord god father therfore hath lord deut 29 25 wrath waxed hot againſt people bring vpon euery curſe written booke ſame doctrine haue taught ſpoiling men good fruit wrath god ſin excepted lord may impoueriſh people feare fauour mercy ſame may fitly truly ſay bringing ſeruitude bondage vnto vile cruell perſons let one bee vnderſtood ſeeing ſpeake another place obſerue doct 3 another thing heere ſeeing ſaid led bondage ſpoiled good ſo ſmarted may note god ſo dealeth diſobedient time euen hee heere theſe ſins go alone ſo neither doe puniſhments god dealeth ſuch offend one way many puinſh achan ſhame paine ſo pharaoh viſited terrours bodily plague alſo euen ſo many note purſued croſſes good reproch name body paine diſeaſes doth men may know ſhall pay deare ſtolne pleaſures ſweet ſoeuer bee fond account ſo together may hold backe prouoking eſay ſaith one iudgement ſhall ſerue turne eſa 9 laſt ver ioel 1 3 men ſtruggle fight againſt ſtand god hee ſmiteth gently hand bee ſtretcht ſtill looke former hath done latter ſhall make good wee reade ioel fruit one plague conſumed another till vtter riddance follow men bite vpon bridle curſe lucke look themſelues ſo god ſtrippeth men good caſteth bondage hee deale heere hee doth like v one iudgement come necke another v thinke may bee ſaid truly without reſpect damnation wee haue paid deare ſtolne pleaſures bold taking liberty amiſſe ſeeing haue ſpoken particularly going ſeruitude nation hath knowne meaneth ſharpe ſcourge yet ſeeing many fall turke spanyard haue little feared therefore wiſh reade deuteronomie ſecondly conſider eſtate people iſrael egypt laſtly lay ſet deut 28 48 49 50 view eye popiſh cruell tyrannizing ouer ſoules heere owne land day queene mary could enioy liberty word sacrament brother refuſed idollſeruice falſe worſhip tortured tormented bloody perſecutors may men looke hand ſtrangers ſaid bondage added generall text could ſtand enemy ſo weakened good number ſtrength maruell let obſerued god vſeth doct 4 enemy againſt v child prouoke ſins hee vſed nabuchadnezzar againſt ieruſalem senacherib others god putteth new poiſon malice nothing elſe hee iuſtly ſuffereth letteth alone without bridling reſtraining vomit vp venome note cankered hatred letteth looſe satan whereby among many thing may bee learned vncertaine comfort ſome take papiſts hope ſhall neuer preuaile againſt proteſtants popery euer yoke yes god diſpleaſed may plague way raiſing vp enemy againſt eaſily hee heere canaanite againſt iſrael without feare way hee may meet ſundry ſorts little comfort may ſee daily ſinnes remoued ſight ſo prophet ſpeaketh ſhall though eſcape lion beare ſhould amos 5 19 meet went houſe leaned hand wall ſerpent bite wee haue heard puniſhment people appeares doct 5 load enough vpon one would thinke yet though bin enough ſaid hand god againſt holy ghoſt addeth heere whitherſoeuer went forth hand lord againſt ſhould bee ſaid whatſoeuer tooke hand went proſpered croſſed therein whereas godly reade firſt pſalme contrary ſaid ſet pſal 1 3 like ſpoken prophet azaria people iuda ſecōd booke chronicle though ſeene many marked 2 chron 15 6 diſobedient therefore complained yet miſery therefore greater ſeeing goe brutiſhly foole ſtocks oxe ſlaughter till dart pierce liuer ſome feele perceiue pro 7 23 god angry hand againſt experience witneſſeth though deale ſo much apparantly againſt enemy bodily ſpirituall plague doe many loden ſorrow miſery crieout god fighteth againſt though outward puniſhments bee ſeene vpon neither proſper enioy inward peace weariſome themſelues curſing lot wiſhing themſelues world nay laying violent hand vpon themſelues anguiſh heart madneſſe thinking falſely ſo eſcape miſery heauie thing thinke wee eſpecially know remedy thus euen ſo god hand euer faithfull ſeruants way god hath ſet like tree planted riuers pſal 91 11 pſal 1 3 water bringeth forth fruit due ſeaſon whatſoeuer ſhall proſper indeed leſſe ſeene becauſe finde ſo hard thing middeſt ſo many diſcouragements continue vprightneſſe may ſee marke oft vnſetled broken burthen fleſh innocency elſe forced much adoe recouer themſelues fallen great heauineſſe thereby god vpholdeth grace hee doth alſo make well liking proſper yea weakeſt eſtate reſpect recouer whereas added purſuing lord doct 6 ſet hand vnto ſworne teach v could otherwiſe ſeeing god ſpeaketh nothing vaine much leſſe ſweare according samuel word ſtrength iſrael 1 sam 15 29 lie one iot tittle word cannot faile farre firme mat 5 17 law medes perfians yet altered lord ſpeake word ſweare except conditionally whether threatening ſuch prouoke promiſe good thing ſuch truſt ſhall moſt certainiy come paſſe attempt ſoeuer contrary daily ſeene therefore wondred men ſo little moued thereby threat go forward bad courſe till euill threatened doe come vpon cauſe crie euen god ſeruants alſo doe ſmart promiſes certaine beleeued matter oft occaſioned bee ſaid people ſinne puniſhment followeth text vers 16 notwithſtanding lord raiſed vp iudges deliuered hand oppreſſors 17 yet would obey iudges went whering god worſhipped turned quickly way wherein father walked obeying commandements lord ſo 18 lord raiſed vp iudges lord iudges deliuered hand enemy day iudge lord compaſsion gronings becauſe oppreſſed tormented follow thing mentioned ſixth ſenſe verſe laying point ſecond part chapter lord raiſed vp deliuerers oppreſſions cried vnto called iudges cannot bee vnderſtood one time ſeeing ſent many iudges among time affliction therefore hee ſheweth heere end chapter condition people iſrael change diuerſe courſes time iudges word thus cried lord oppreſſions pitied grones raiſed vp iudges deliuerers ſaid bleſſe yet turned away againe ſo prouoked go againſt afreſh ſet downe latter end chapter ſome verſes follow firſt ſaid eighteenth verſe theſe three verſes verſ 18 bee ioyned read together groned lord vnder oppreſſions ſaw nothing amiffe themſelues muſt teach v doct calamity ſearch ſtirre v vp griefe make mone note god anguiſh heart careleſſe iollie ſoeuer wee haue wee boldly prouoked wee haue ſo careleſſe headſtrong nothing could ſerue plucke downe ſtomackes yet ſore trouble haue broken heart neuer otherwiſe therefore word preuaile lord faine euen maiſter men ſtrong hand leaſt hee may tame violence cannot bow repentance euen men handle horſes ſuch beaſts cannot rule caſt keepe vnder binding ſo may worke pleaſure wilde aſſe muſt taken moneths ſhe cannot reſiſt courſe iob 33 15 lordis driuen take v wit make heart ſmart loade ſorrowes elſe would bee rule v thus ſay faine take v downe according ſaid pſal ſmote ſought yea ſought early pharaoh himſelfe pſal 78 34 felt ſmart plague egypt ſought moſes pray lord long men fitted framed heare lord ſpeake vnto bitten ſorrow glad see hoſ 6 1 compared cap 5 13 14 cling ala commeth moſt theſe correction ſharp dealing ſuch nay ſay moſt doe bow time bulruſh winde goodneſſe morning dew ſo goeth away cry onely rod held ouer afterward returne againe old byas ſo theſe heere ſo doe many ſeeke lord time yet turne aſide againe broken bow ſuch thus caſt downe theſe god afflicteth ſo one would think would neuer lift vp briſtles againſt theſe ſay doe yet waxe bold kicke vp heele againſt ſhall thinke relent euill doings god heauie hand vpon harden hart dog biteth ſtaffe beateth yee aske bee done groning vnder men burthen ſinne puniſhment haue good effect remedy heere men ſuch caſes finding ſins doe alſo ſeriouſly conſider fouleneſſe woe bring ſo tread alſo vnder foot beleeue better thing bee comming god toward euen mercy forgiueneſſe onely able cruſh ſinnes peeces afterwards well make kindly truly acknowledged cried ſmart taketh hold noted groning behold lord thus complaine cry verſ 16 18 compaſſion raiſed vp iudges ſhould deliuer hand oppreſſors ſpoilers ſo repented ſo ſuffered oppreſſed doth oft ahab pitty ſinners ſmarting fault cry doth receiue mercy except truly forſake ſay inſtruction wee may know lord eaſily entreated v waiting indeed repentance giue ſignes diſliking ſinnes time note ſtayeth heauie hand purſuing v would hee doe thinke came home heart ſo muſt know ſide hee ſo dealing v heapeth hot cole vpon note head add maketh v vnexcuſeable wee hauing ſuch faire encouragement hand ſhall yet keepe loofe ſhew vnfaithfulnes haue made couenants amendment heere commeth miſery verſe bee ſeene verſ 17 heere ſet downe yet pitying ſhewing ſo great kindneſſe toward yet iudges called idolatry heard regarded conſidered benefit enioy ſuch although cried anguiſh heart helpe trouble common thing deliuerances thus vnthankfully deale lord obeying iudges ſo charged heere haue done chapter following ſeene ſo briefly let v learne men rarely better deliuerances trouble howſoeuer crie god middeſt whereas man would thinke ſhould thing moſt regarded ſhould oft conſidering irkeſome vncomfortable lay affliction paine body ſickneſſe diſeaſe purſuit enemy diſtreſſe alſo gracious liberty eaſe deliuered yea ſhould yeeld rare thankeſgiuing god ſame eſpecially ſeeing end deliuerance euen greateſt withall may ſerue lord euer without feare luk 1 74 againe another thing bee omitted verſe ſtead hearkening obeying god iudges fell againe directly idolatry ſo forſooke god father moſt brutiſhly bowed themſelues idol block could doe nothing deceiueable pleaſure tooke therein man nature prone ſerue god groſſe falſe manner yea holy ſtory ſheweth quickly fall turne way teach v ſoone well ordered courſe good thing forgotten laid aſide may bee obſerued people ſoone waxed wearie good beginning ſo alſo apparant others come though haue good example eye goe therein yet ſoone carried another way eſpecially chiefe perſons gone delighted well yet lay ſinne ſet forth apt fit ſimilitude fornication euen holineſſe god scripture oft time compared chaſtneſſe marriage whoremonger drunken beſotted lewd companion ſo regard counſell neither ſee diſcredit linked ſuch one neither moued waſting good cauſed thereby euen ſo ſpirituall whoremonger idolater blind idoll cannot bee diſſwaded image crucifix ouerſwayeth worſhipping god ſpirit truth tedious vtterly vnſauoury reaſon haue ſaid ſuch day aggrauate ſin like manner men regard nothing eaſe vain pleaſure haue conſciences performe promiſes vowes made god time affliction againe either void faith vtterly hauing receiued ſome ſmall meaſure ſlow negligent note meanes vſing daily duly whereby ſhould confirmed hauing alſo others ioyne keepe company eaſily commeth paſſe ſo ſoone decline promiſe made god repentance doth vaniſh like ſparkles sixteenth sermon vpon second chapter booke ivdges verſ 19 20 21 vers 19 yet iudge dead returned worſe father following god ſerue worſhip ceaſed owne inuentions rebellious way 20 wherefore wrath lord kindled againſt iſrael ſaid becauſe people hath tranſgreſſed couenant commanded father hath obeyed voice 21 therfore caſt nation ioſhua left died 22 may proue iſrael whether keepe way lord walke therein father kept 23 lord left thoſe nation droue immediately neither deliuered hand ioſhua followeth laſt branch ſecond part verſ 19 chapter ſay iudge died people worſe father ſet downe verſe whereupon wrath god kindled againſt appeareth twentieth verſe fruit namely god puniſhing ſet downe verſe 21 end ſo 22 proue therefore ſaid laſt verſe god left enemy land ſtill ioſhuas time caſt theſe lie order ſhould bee thus people verſe ſaid cleering text leſſe lamentable wonderfull god pitied groning ſent iudges ſhould deliuer oppreſſions likewiſe deliuer indeed bleſſing would haue ſaid would haue proued rare people thankes obedience vnto god therefore turned another way iudge dead ſent deliuer kept couenant made god rebelled againſt trercherie end ſinne aggrauated verſe wit worſe father following owne inuentions euill way gathered doct verſ 19 lightheadedneſſe inconſtancy men haue ſometime made earneſt profeſſion amendment alſo lewdneſſe accompanieth ſame ſet worke heereupon good exerciſes prayer purpoſes good life ſoone forgotten worne memory many ſimple minded man would thinke hath ſo much knowledge people ſhew good conſcience going doe cauſe confeſſion ſinne accuſation themſelues breaking forth ſolemne proteſtation couenan •• turning god heart would thinke ſay ten twelue yeeres abſence ſhould returne againe hee ſhould finde rare profiting chriſtian trade leaſt much forwardnes knowledge good duty ſo ſetled therein could remoued people much bee lamented might looke ſuch thing ſhall like rather finde farre otherwiſe much worſe wee ſee heere theſe ſtead growing knowledge grace leaſt ſetledneſſe ſtedfaſtneſſe good beginning ſhall found reuolters ſame rather goeth men adaies haue deuiſed themſelues conſulted others new way courſes life cleane contrary fall papiſt ſectaries bee drawne whoredome vncleanneſſe greateſt part depth worldlineſſe ſutes vncharitable contention like though fearefull heare yet common eaſie found euen good exerciſes preaching ſome good neighbourhood continue bee enioyed therefore much ſhall found ſuch good meanes wanting oh goodneſſe preuaile haue vpper hand yea loued good reaſon ſay ſhould aſhamed ſeeke meanes aduance honour end may know worthineſſe price without reward euen world regard doe worthily put reproch ſhame heere beſide hath ſaid good occaſion offered doct theſe verſes together theſe verſes together wee may gather good direction great part life well affliction come time deliuerance come god giueth v 1 leaue ſerue cheerefulneſſe ſweet portion life ſhould greatly labour keepe well well doe people wit prouoke god puniſh v ſinning againſt world doth negligently wittingly secondly haue al 2 heed taking broken againſt conſcience without good heed taking may full eaſily ſhould cry god fall vnder note burthen tarrying till driuen extremity theſe heere cry wee ſhould wait patiently rather becauſe haue ſinne prouoked againſt v till god deliuer v thirdly ſeeing moſt certainly helpe thus ſought let v beleeue perſwaded hee heare v graciouſly wee ſee 3 pſal 50 15 heere yet great offender thus let v ſtrengthen inable ſelues patience confidence fourthly wee 4 deliuered let v afterward oft remember conſider vncomfortable eſtate good gracious lord hath v bring v ſuch aduerſity daily thankes cleaue yet neerely wiſe prouoke renewing pſal 89 31 ſinnes theſe heere monſtrous owne coſt well aſſured ſhall thus carefull doe ſhall goe well v good day ſhall ſee may looked ſo bad 5 world ſuch haue thouſands gold ſhall bee able buy purchaſe abundance deut 5 30 note paſſe next verſe hauing ſpoken reuolt people verſ 20 former verſe beſide direction occaſion ſet downe holy ſtory goeth heere ſhew lord people thus turning good beginning death iudge ſore diſpleaſed anger kindled againſt ſay ſame god anger needleſſe thing note heere hath doct ſeene ſo whole book appeareth vſuall lord doe thus namely men ſinne angry men angry otherwiſe wee haue penting whereas loue god grant ſhould bee ſufficient conſtraine v duty thing god 2 cor 5 14 ſhould alwaies bee angry man doubtleſſe one could bee perſwaded ſo affected onely whole life ſhould bee daily deadly vnquietneſſe ſhould alſo ouerwhelmed thought driuen deſperation yet may know hath ſaid god hath iuſt cauſe doe leſſe let anger burne fire againſt ſuch prouoke indeed hee oft deferres declaration wrath giuing men time liberty thereby repent doth ſhew many time hee often prouoked hereof god iuſtly diſpleaſed yet men doe meane repent turne humbly ſeeking mercy hee doth afterward declare manifold ſorereuenges hee long prouoked anger iuſtly offended wiſely bee marked v though owne people ſinne none ſinneth wit ouerſight infirmity vnauoidable ignorance 1 king 8 46 note pſal 130 3 ſuch like whereas hee doth ſuffer anger breake forth reaſon hath ſaid himſelfe wil looke ſtraightly done amiſſe beſide ſee haue fallen ſo riſe againe daily ordinarily returning againe caſt themſelues true humiliation meditation application work redeemer chriſt ſo lord pacified againe therefore ſuch wiſe bee moſt carefull keepe away occaſions god diſpleaſure ſeeing lord anger conſuming fire prouided againſt men may poſſeſſe heb 12 29 ſoules peace may goe daily good liking comfort thus much god angry againe puniſhment followed vpon god thus diſpleaſed ſeeing ſo ſhamefully verſ 21 tranſgreſſed broken couenant made father therefore hee hee ſaid caſt nation ioſhua left behinde although iſrael oft deliuered hand ſundry iudges alſo many ſlaine yet vtterly rooted poſterity ſprung vp againe afterward multiplied land great diſquieting vexing annoying people ſay puniſhment ſore may bee thought theſe nation left among deſtruction verſe 3 haue ſeene wee heard ſame puniſhment threatened angell bochim repented doubt god accepted hee promiſed grieuous afterwards poſterity worſe reproued threatened making couenants canaanite theſe falling flatly idolatry heere beſides wee may men concerning outward benefit life ſtand couenants haue made bee owne people hee puniſh offence pſal 89 31 rod iniquitie ſtrokes though hee take mercy vtterly much leaue helpeleſſe ſhift themſelues ſo fal depth euill might haue thriued proſpered bleſſings yea might haue bin good hope haue embraced couenant grace mercy alſo many brought god temporary benefit ſeeke ſpirituall ſo might theſe haue done alſo therefore little doe men know vexation bring vpon themſelues waxe careleſſe couenants keeping haue entred god leauing ſome groſſe ſinne forſaking ill company worldlineſſe ſuch like offence ſo forgetting themſelues fall againe afterward ſhall ſurely runne euill worſe deale ſo god ſmaller puniſhments greater iudgements ſo little cauſe ſhall haue reioyce glory winning thereby beſide manifold puniſhments cannot bee reckoned vp breake couenant lord ſhall alwaies haue ſome ſpeciall eye ſores left vexe theſe nation iſrael worthily layeth forth forementioned puniſhment verſ 15 hand lord ſore vpon people euen ſo wee ſhall finde vnfaithfull couenants either ſtubborne diſobedient child none leaſt plague ſhall riſe vp make liues weariſome v salomon ſaith ſhall corruption bone prou ſutes controuerſies ſo one theſe ſuch like wee ſhall haue comfort thing beſide many diſeaſes collicke ſtone burning ague conſumption wee ſhall bee conſtrained cry ſay wee haue pleaſure liues yet lord fighting againſt making league follow good forefather done might reape fruit therof meane lord promiſe wit would aſſiſt enioy land heart deſire ſhould otherwiſe ſhould declare thereby ſtrength neuer great fainted tried beſide muſt beare burthen ſhould light prou 24 10 may learne god hath end afflicting may haue exerciſe grace patience faith hope doct verſ 22 ſuch like found furniſhed therwith might giue god praiſe themſelues might reioyce might humbled contrary ſhould ought reſolued trouble euen cannot finde ſelues particular ſin lord afflicteth v wee bee farre wide offer ſelues great note iniurie doe reſolue god afflicting v tryeth v ſo may behaue ſelues accordingly ſame may bee ſaid hereſies ſpring vp among v god tryeth v doe saint paul ſaith muſt bee hereſies euen among approued 1 cor 11 19 ſound religion godlineſſe long experience may bee reuel 13 10 knowne ſhould teach v ſeeing god doth ſo alwaies haue heart carefully ſet vpon tell oft ſelues whatſoeuer bayts ſinne ſet v cup pleaſant wine well coloured yet mixed poyſon wee ſhould meddle reach hand note thereto bold buſie ſoeuer behold bee ſnatching greedily deuoure yet may bee enticed looke god doth trie v well haue brought vnder reſt teacheth v haue eye god workes thing doth reſolue ſelues ſeeth alwaies good reaſon thereof follow direction leade v ſee much good grace v iuſtifie doth ſay people goſpell hath done thing well yet ſo whether affirme ſeeing wee grauelled amazed many workes ſeeing reaſon rather ready reaſon againſt rebell croſſeth v attempt doings often one thing many apparantly ordinary manner good bargaines health like heere therefore ſay humbly ſubmit ſelues doth though bee pray daily doe thy bee done v oh thing well beſeeming v yet duty thus wee ſhould ſay goe liking god doth hee much diſquieted affliction wee doe otherwiſe notwithſtanding corrupt nature doe carrie v much rebell againſt ſame haue learne repeating thoſe word verſe namely ſaid god left nation land trie people iſrael trie whether would keepe commandements moreouer muſt marke ſet downe firſt verſe doct 2 verſ 1 lord ſaid haue held theſe nation ſtill land exceeding ſore vexing people teach v raizing remaining euill city trouble lord haue amos 3 • ſent otherwiſe beſt people worſt ſhould affliction wit end wee may therefore reſt ſelues note ſecond cauſes neither vexe ſelues doe oft ſpurning againſt lord patiently beare ſeeing whatſoeuer inſtrument bee certaine lord ouerruling cauſe howſoeuer euident oft time wee cauſe bring ſelues therefore ought bend ſelues earneſt manner patience ſo much rather ſeeing hee certifieth v hee doth beſt ſuch feare ſo wee doe encreaſe note ſorrow impatience encreaſe ſinne therefore prouoke trouble commeth almighty power caſt hell alſo feare wee doe euill ſight euermore wee may auoid aſcribe vnto deliuerances alſo ſeeing ſuch deliuerances lord hee may haue due praiſe v verſ 1 2 ſenſe end verſe ſecond ſaid god left nation ſtill land might teach generation iſrael warre neither father time paſt knowne another reaſon thoſe nation driuen cleare meaning lord trying found though neuer ignorant would doe made manifeſt impiety idolatry people iſrael themſelues tooke away ſtrength war withheld aide hee time paſt giuen father battell enemy ſo went warre owne power lord withholding knew warre meant knew lord fought hee gaue ſtrength terrified enemy weakened gaue good ſucceſſe iſraelites left ſhift themſelues therefore wee ſee meant knowne warre yet broken couenant god fought knew meant goe warre lord fought begin learne heere may ſee god kindnes many goodneſſe toward v ſpeake praiſe deſire may neuer ſee contrary compariſon world meane ignorant prophane ſort deſire acquainted lord way may truly bee ſaid wee haue ſeene many good day chiefe care hath liue vnder gouernment wee haue failed ſome time others frailty forgotten ourſelues hee hath mercifully quickened brought v backe againe ſo moſt part wee haue knowne ſorrowes world meane worſt day haue haue forgot ourſelues forſaken good right way walked ſtepped aſide note byway hath taught v wofull experience ſorrowes vexation meane example haue ſimplicity heart ioyned ſweet doctrine goſpell preached vnto v haue minded chiefly beſt treaſure wee haue well feared offend lord thoſe thing haue liked v beſt prouoking one another loue good workes oh hath hee made v proſper hath frowned vpon v haue peruerted way verſe nation reckoned lord would haue remaine land among people iſraelites muſt dwell verſ 8 5 reade text muſt dwell theſe wicked nation doct wee taught one puniſhments among many diuers kind ſinne draw vpon v euen becauſe muſt ſometime dwell wicked though muſt haue elſe muſt goe world yet ſpeak 1 cor 5 10 another matter dauid dwelt among hater peace holy pſal 120 5 6 land church pergamus whoſe habitation satan throne god triall dwelling iſrael babylon father among egyptian dwelling theſe heere mentioned among philiſtims canaanite heuites theſe habitation ſay god puniſhments curſes euen fruit deſerts grieuous ſinnes vexed many way hornet ſhould haue ſtung becauſe ſuch dwelling brought vpon men owne prouokings god ſundry way therefore beſide ſmart ſuſtaine outward trouble haue added thereunto cannot meekely quietly beare wound haue made conſcience knowne ſinnes moſt grieuous vnto ſeeing muſt cannot remember iuſtly ſuſtaine one example time alleage two perſons yeoman wife might bring many theſe two dwelling among ſundry good neighbour religion becauſe like minded becauſe diſtaſted goſpell tooke ſore pritch againſt without iuſt cauſe giuen therupon wilfulnes remoued dwelling going away enioy better neighbour bring world commodity thereof faſter ſhort ſeeing yee long doubt heare end ſo enioyed ſought went wealth waſted neighbour neuer known ment neither learned vſe neighbourly dealt roughly ſore vexed wearied vpon lord viſited great ſickneſſe euen together leiſure bethinke themſelues change made eſpecially minde done cry doings behalfe fell preſence ſome firſt dwelt among ſent vpon occaſion though dwelt twentie mile diſtant ſparing charge themſelues deepely ſhew great repentance raſhneſſe wilfulneſſe remouing euen man died woman maruellous manner bewailing offence compounded many day day time fell eye eare witneſſe much ſay shee little recouered ſo farre ſhee might bee carried thence ſo ſhee returned firſt dwelling friend could perſwade contrary neuer recouered health within died owne houſe acknowledging bewailing ſin neighbor viſited bearing ſhame meekely contentment example thought ſeaſon make mention ſo good occaſion admoniſh ſome make better reckoning good neighbourhood ready vpon tetch taken eaſe themſelues thinking recouer dwelling beſides let v ſecure dwel care place ſoeuer becauſe ſome doe otherwiſe laid vpon bee yeelded meere neceſſity though bee god triall ſome haue iuſt puniſhment yet make wee account chriſtian peaceable habitation common benefit yet ſuch muſt know alſo muſt keepe themſelues tentation diuell cunningly deceiue making ſeeme greater kindled againſt caſt downe deadly blow thus ſay doe caſe till god put away feare ſeeing theſe two contrary wit bee turned god feare vnbeliefe returne come home neare vnto againe faith ſeeing meet ſo neare together one perſon ſo one oft time immediately ſucceedeth therefore poſſible ſpeed care bee vſed feare accuſation conſcience taketh blockiſhneſſe herein wee bee ſo hardly brought vpon knee haue ſinned againſt god wee know thought meet vtter knot difficulty doctrine namely god found hee ſought vnto heare prayed moſt cleere well approued truth none faile helpe ſuch doe either heartily ſeeke know elſe ſuch ignorant doe haue ſaid repenting returning god wee ſee ſome ſpeciall fault committed either negligence wilfulneſſe wit ſhould ſolemne manner thus cry vnto god haue taught euen ſo ought doe though apparant wilfulneſſe ſeene daily ſlips infirmity offer vp god daily ſutable repentance ſame ſo may bee time long leaſt manner eſtranged abſent god continually goe day ſo life long paradiſe felicity world ſaid firſt three example occaſion hath offered tenth verſe nineteenth sermon third chapter booke ivdges haue heard god raiſed vp ſauiour deliuerer people iſrael cried verſ 10 oppreſſion euen othniel ſhewed fitted furniſhed ſo great worke thus othniel priuate man one meaneſt father houſe ſomwhat enriched marrying ackſah calebs daughter man ſome courage perſon lord ſtirred vp purpoſe many ability hereunto ſaid lord gaue ſpirit meaning fruit ſpirit knowledge iudgement vnderſtand matter god thing moſt requiſite gouernour gaue alſo encreaſe courage ſtrength wiſedome warre beſides certified ſpirit called god ſuch ſeruice thing thus appointed god ſaid heere iudged iſrael hee executed office taking vpon protection people wherein lord hee reſcued bondage liberty againe gouerned reſtored pure worſhip god among particularly concerning ſubduing aduerſary iſrael ſaid lord ſtrengthened againſt cuſhanruſhathaim meane gaue hand cleerely teacheth v gift ſpirit excellent doct effect therof none lord giueth diſtributeth pleaſure ſee heere ſpirit lord came vpon othniel whereby hee brought paſſe great thing whatſoeuer note man price exceliency god commeth meere bounty ala bird ſtripped note feather bare naked man himſelfe void goodneſſe hath hath receiued inſomuch iam 1 17 hath glory ſinne moſt holy approued truth giueth god due layeth man colour hee nothing elſe robbe god honour pranke vp himſelfe gift nothing elſe ſay naked poore mirrour miſery saul king iſrael wrought ſo great deliuerance iſrael againſt ammonite moſes ioſhua mighty preuailing againſt heathen nation ſpite teeth proudeſt yea salomon royalty commend ſet themſelues withall gift god furniſhed doe number iet vp downe vaunting themſelues hauing ſome gift giuen god farre end vſe namely honour themſelues doe neuer thinke ſuch matter dare boldly ſin againſt otherwiſe durſt doe becauſe hee hath beſtowed ſome gift vpon perſonage beautie ſtrength wealth euen one ſhould ſtrippe poore body ragges put coſtly comely apparel vpon though men earth wormes meate yet doe ſet vp themſelues ſome high aduancement ſome rich yet borrowed painted ſheath till take honour god yea petty god themſelues onely bee called god oh admirable pride blindneſſe forgetfulnes fleſh oh great patience long ſuffering god beare hand yet haue ſaid denie hee afford theſe gift farre greater could giue due thereby vſe ſet forth goodneſſe meete ſame might ſay learning gift god lord beſtowed pleaſure puffe vp haue loue humility ſhould vſe 1 cor 13 1 good others much ſupernaturall gift ſpirit godly zeale care pleaſe god ſuch like ought vſed ſame end proceed god giuen ſpirit othniel ſaid hee point 2 iudged iſrael valiant captaine pull ſeruitude take yoke bondage neck reſtore true worſhip god gouerne ſo land reſt ſuch like befell god anger turned away repentance people bondage miſery would haue ſaid could eaſily ſhort time haue remoued eſpecially ſuch change might haue ſeene teacheth god doct 2 anger remoued people perſon thing goe well puniſhments turned bleſſings great heauineſſe ioy comfort euen cloudie darke tempeſtuous day forgotten cleare faire ſunſhine ouerſpreadeth beautifieth earth like ſimile two great men ſtrife contention diſquieted againe made friend reconciled people towne reioyce hold vp countenance ſaid heere people hauing brought ſuch extremity eight yeeres god ſent othniel deliuerer iudge gaue courage wiſedome ſo brought enemy ſubiection people reſt deliuerance theſe ſignes fauour god declared anger remoued euen ſo ſhall ſee good day take heed god prouoked anger v though anger kindled yet cry grone vnder burthen lift vp heart beleeue mercifull vnto v moſt certainly turne away wrath diſpleaſure v fauour life louing countenance ſhineth vpon v thing ſhall turne v beſt lord doth either remoue outward puniſhments v elſe vphold v ſo grace beare patiently meekely ſhall burthen matter comfort vnto v oh ſhould note ſo wiſe preuent one thing namely wrath god might kept ſoules body ſhall want looking ſay yea meaneſt haue care skill tempeſtuous vnſeaſonable weather commeth ſhroud themſelues beware doe annoy heere eſtates people ſet downe together bondage freedome reſt trouble time one time holy ghoſt ſay ſetting downe together doth teach v conſider like caſe one well grieuouſneſſe calamity meditate thus oh ſhould wee haue done wee ſo long continued note eſtate wee ſay mercy god haue enioyed much peace plenty commodity enemy euen ſtrangers brought v ſubiection ſhould haue borne burthen likewiſe deliuerance wee ſhould meditate god goodneſſe v trouble enemy bethinke v ſeldome done v great fauour god vnto v paine penurie like taken v prize ſame high reckoning deſireth ſtirre vp himſelfe true thankfulneſſe god ſuch change deliuerance doe thus hee ſeeth good cauſe hee ſhall beſt manner performe ſuppoſing simile beſt eſtate contrary would diſtaſtfull painfull irkſome vnto v yet might haue oppreſſed v yet exceeding goodneſſe paſſed away v behold light ioy come place light eſteemed darke faire weather welcome v tempeſtuous vnſeaſonable time euen ſo conſidering ſore trouble lately oppreſſing v eſpeciall meane bring proſperity high reckoning v man would ſay wee need doe ſhall obſerue ſoone make common thing little worth rather abuſe owne great hurt detriment concerning time people reſt vnder othniel euen fortie yeers verſ 11 take true meaning ſtory agreeable originall howſoeuer interpreter differ beſt tranſlation maketh ſtory ehud verſ 30 god ſhall ſaid vſe ſhall alſo added othniel hauing ſerued time gathered father looke waite ſame like ſeruice place firſt example three mentioned verſ 12 child iſrael againe committed wickedneſſe ſight lord lord ſtrengthened eglon king moab againſt iſrael becauſe committed wickedneſſe lord 13 gathered vnto child ammon amalek went ſmote iſrael poſſeſſed city palme tree 14 child iſrael ſerued eglon king moab eighteene yeeres followeth ſecond ſumme whereof people verſ 12 ſumme part 4 31 verſe iſrael prouoked god anger againe ſinnes othniel dead god ſtrengthened king moab againſt moſt wicked confederate oppreſſing ſore long time cried lord done hee ſtirred vp another ſauiour one ehud deliuered grieuous bondage according briefe laying ſtory part may diſcerned foure former eaſie bee perceiued ſtand ſet downe ſpeake lie order firſt thing heere noted people againe wrought euill doct verſ 12 ſight lord done ſhewes broke othniel liued elſe nothing ſhould haue ſaid day whoſe time though commended yet neither diſcommended therefore ſay nothing either ſeeing haue ground let obſerued whereof text giueth iuſt occaſion prone ready break aſſoone haue opportunity oh fleſh ſoone wearie pending well fenced againſt falles good teaching company muſt need ſay much better v eaſilier kept great offence heere land eſpecially wee haue purity goſpel true worſhip god eſtabliſhed among v groſſe indeed fall good courſe preſent alſo godly magiſtrates v encourage v othniel liued groſſe men note let looſe themſelues time ſinnes thereof ſuch helpes faile haue ſpoken care ſoeuer hath among honouring god former time ſoone carried away euery man diſpoſed owne corruption one ſome ſinne another another yet forementioned outward helpes eaſily brought make common thing falſe heart ready breake faſten delight ſome ſinfull pleaſure ſtrongly held grace bridle whereas ſhould rather grow vp ſtedfaſt hope curbing vp vnmortified affection ſo might vnoffenſiue chriſtian courſe better able helpe ſhelter weake brother ouercome led away ſtrong tentations rather ſelues haue taſted good bountifull lord plunged depth occaſions ſoeuer great offence haue oft lamented ſtill doe lamentable caſe wofull eſtate ſuch eaſily readily deceiued bait ſinne ſee ſhamefull ſhiftings bondage bring themſelues yeelding thereto might haue walked great liberty toward god much comfort life muſt confeſſe ſhould much better done euery ſide diligent teaching ioyned good example chiefe giue light encouragement meaner ſort godly magiſtrates according duty encouraging good ready keepe vnder bad diſobedient oh many ſorts diſcouragers yet without reſpect thereof euery particular perſon ſhould looke owne way promiſing himſelfe ſuch helpes euill world euer hand ſaid people prouoking god againe breaking death othniel thing might noted heere hauing already ſpoken forbeare ſay place throughout booke puniſhment god inflicted vpon people renued ſecond point verſ 12 ſenſe ſinnes ſecond thing example followeth next two verſes king moab aſſiſted held bondage eighteene yeeres tooke iericho called city palme tree ſet aide oppreſſe iſrael ſeeing paſſage ouer iordan toward moab ſee againe ſhall waxe bold ſinne againſt lord hee ſmite haue heard come ſooner come later hee ſaid ſtrengthen moab furniſh againſt owne people wicked idolater againſt true worſhippers onely breaking forth time heere mentioned offend lord commonly may ſeeme ſomewhat ſtrange theſe ammonite amalekites moſt vile enemy god groſſe idolater doct haue v know doth often puniſh owne people worſe ſee ſendeth theſe curſed nation vpon ſo need doubt hee ſend papiſts little many looſe proteſtants feare vexe v prouoke euen hath done heretofore ſinne men knowledge leſſer ſo lord ſpeaketh deuteronomie becauſe ye haue prouoked god prouoke deut 32 21 ye haue deſpiſed people harſh thing ſuffer meanes ſuch worſe ſelues child beaten ſeruant god ſuffer partly becauſe hee knowes way abaſe men partly becauſe enemy ſet purpoſe let looſe hurt malice euen father diuell doth god would haue owne learne ſmart ſuſtaine trouble ſinne farre odious account yea whip becauſe haue taught know lord couenanted ſerue ſtrangers vnacquainted way well marked becauſe errour ſticketh faſt deepe mind ſome wee need feare papiſts spaniard ieſuites ſuch heretikes becauſe profeſſe true religion hate worſhip chriſt ieſus diſhonour therefore hauing good cauſe ſay ſhould feare god fight v anſwere muſt haue good cauſe good conſcience alſo elſe may truly ſay god ſuffer good man true robbed theefe hurt witch scripture experience doth ſufficiently confute god exerciſed holy iob diuel iob 1 2 head ſo doth deare one witch wicked people member hee ſuffereth hee ſeeth cauſe worſe people owne domineere ouer egyptian tyrannie ouer iſrael canaanite cruelty example nation booke againſt god people experience age ſufficient teſtifie cleare enough let v ſee reaſon thereof god meaning therein doth puniſh owne people wicked enemy becauſe better account neither put hope ſhall goe vnpuniſhed end becauſe hee vſeth ſeruice satan againſt iob try becauſe hee hereby manifeſt great finne abuſe liue vnworthy goſpell therefore beginneth firſt viſit owne people oft time euen afterwards amos ſaith viſit damaſcus moab amos ammon make drinke dreg hee doe greene tree compariſon much withered lord auenged enemy ſo hee hath corrected owne againe returne therefore church brought prophet micha ſay thus reioyce ouer mee mine enemie mich 7 7 though fall yet ſhall riſe againe prophet ſpeaks meaning lord would finde time take correction yet pitifull againe euen father burne rod child relenteth promiſeth amendment wicked ſee chaſtizeth euen owne hauing ſinned againſt knowne truth therefore hee much haue day pay full manifold long continued rebellion ſay regard let god ſeruants profit euery way iuſtly viſited ſinnes alſo free know hee doth vſe begin iudgement owne houſe 1 pet 4 17 may thereby returne vnto beſides hath ſaid theſe nation lord ſtrengthened verſ 13 againſt iſrael ſo wee may note heere confederate together againſt god people wherby may learne wicked ſeldome agree together betwixt themſelues league ſoone broken yet eaſily ioyne together vexe god people thus theſe three nation conſent one ſmite euen reade herod pilate enemy one made friend ioyning againſt chriſt two dog fight bone yet ioyne biting paſſenger simile theeues conſent rob true man though cannot agree diuiding ſpoile diſagree becauſe want true band vnion conſent come mutuall hatred vertue feare leſt owne kingdome ſhould ouerthrowne finde true theſe day cannot brooke one another haue ſharpe contention broyles betwixt themſelues yet free conſent band themſelues againſt god ſeruants leaue repent god giue grace one would thinke ſhould make v cling cleaue faſt vnto lord yet may haue ſides ſtand v againſt whenſoeuer ſhall ſtrengthen one another moleſt oppreſſe v alſo maintaine chriſtian amity brother ſtrongly breaking contention eaſily ariſe leſt child world condemne v puniſhment bondage former generation verſ 14 ſenſe king aram ſo bondage moabites time continued double reſpect former euen eighteene yeeres people brought bondage though neither former calamity yet reſt growne vp time ſeene workes god receiued religion father therefore ſmarted iuſtly reſt ſinned wee learne doct prouide ill themſelues make ſlight vſe god former correction ſinne thereby bring pull downe vpon themſelues greater iudgements chriſt ſaid man healed goe thy way ioh 5 14 ſinne left worſe thing befall thee threatened leuiticus leuit 26 18 amend former puniſhments hee would adde ſeuen time pharaoh finde mocking god hardening heart againſt confeſſed god iuſt ſending vpon ſo grieuous iudgements firſt prouoked ſend many vpon afterwards day haue deliuerance trouble ſinnes procured brought vpon v haue good proofe ſay ſmart ſinnes thoſe renue daily note former euen renued wound ſmartie dangerous ſtands righteous iudgement god ſhould ſo meet ſhould tempt god ſuch manner wee ſhould beare marke v fleſh conſciences ſo doe ſay nothing thoſe ſinne willingly clearely verified appeareth weaker ſort god child euidently ſinne negligence ſome careleſneſſe rather wittingly ſmart alſo ſame beſide outward note croſſes oft doubtings alſo ſaluation whereof yet haue aſſurance many great feares haue oft time well godward moſt part come ſlight ſlendervſe make deliuerance firſt feare trouble minde ſuſtained would much appeare many others latter trouble beare ſmart latter new prouokings god farre grieuous former farre hardlier recouer burie remembrance willingly forget hardening heart yet could confider aright euen greateſt puniſhment although riſe againe time afterwards yet done confuſedly ſee ſinne repent good ſpace ſo much time hath leaſt loſt vnprofitably paſſed ouer whereas puniſhment caſt vpon bondage forraine nation cruel idolatrous oh yoke moſt vnwelcome ſo account whenſoeuer whomſoeuer v ſhall fall vpon subiection child parent ſeruants maſters ſubiects prince naturall kind ſuch thing bondage ſtrangers fearefull tedious haue heard oft time ſome perſons heere among v haue taken turkes yea dunkirk wofull ſtate haue brought although god hath mercifully perſwaded nation ſelfe yet know danger haue eſpecially spaniard namely yeere 1588 let v ſenſeleſſe hearing careleſſe theſe reuoltings better ſort prophaneneſſe many particular ſinnes common ſort continue lord puniſh v one kind note may ſure ſome one ſhall roome yea blind beholding plague dearth hath already ſeazed vpon many thouſands whatſoeuer behind arreſt ſuch remaine verſ 15 chilhren iſrael cried vnto lord lord ſtirred vp ſauiour ehud ſonne gera ſonne iemini man lame right hand child iſrael ſent preſent eglon king moab third point fourth ſecond example follow namely ſenſe cry people teſtifying repentance lord mercy pitying ſent another like othniel ſhould deliuer man named deſcribed text firſt ſlue king moab ten thouſand men ſtrong good warriours ſo deliuered iſrael bondage followeth ſtory neceſſary mention heere ſeeing otherwiſe ſending preſent king moab people iſrael verſe ſaid haue done ſhould haue hard vnderſtand end ſet downe whereas ſending men iſraell meane killing king moab pretence couer intent afterwards word text come ſhall offer occaſion let v handle point verſe lie order time ſhall able firſt ſaid people cryed lord vnder ſore doct verſ 15 bondage wherewith oppreſſed better haue without haue ſerued lord comfort othniel liued ſo ſhould haue needed cry cry ſigne repentance haue largely ſhewed former example verſ 9 may ſerue note cry beſt end pleaſures ſinne howling cry though heere accompany repentance ſeldome doth yet painful without dreadfull note deadly neither doe many meet ſaid though many haue part time follow ſinne done ended like time committed full ſmart ſorrow taken vp deceiueable pleaſure conſider giuen appetite haue pleaſure ye come howſoeuer lord forbids deare ſoeuer coſt ye may end cry yet ill note away hunt vaine pleaſure meane companion repentance ye haue infinitely thanke god aſſure ye ſhall ſpeed ſo well haue ſo good end thereof may iuſtly feare hundred one painfull cry maketh way perpetuall howling gnaſhing teeth ſinnes haue great ſo ſhall cry great ſaith lord namely doth abraham rich man sonne thy life time thou enioyedſt thy pleaſure thou art tormented lamentable might liue comfortably luk 16 25 enioying health peace liberty welfare god good liking oh wofull none benefit precious ſoeuer commonly accounted v according value wit thankfully vſed ſoberly aright ſo inforced cry laſt leaſt haue cauſe ſo doe abuſing cannot iot tittle god word fall ground ſaith reioyce young man eccleſ 11 9 thy youth let thine heart cheere thee day thy youth walke way thy heart ſight thine eye know theſe thing bring thee iudgement cannot goe whole verſe time thus much third point beſide haue ſpoken elſewhere twentieth sermon third chapter booke ivdges followeth fourth point example god mercy people cried vnto gaue another deliuerer ehud name family iemini pertained tribe beniamin lame right hand doct 2 verſ 15 appeares god hand ſhortened raiſing vp one deliuerer another ſo may ſee good kinde lord hearing cry grones people often time euen againe againe make complaint vnto hee doth well daily pardoning infirmity innumerable reckon alſo ſuch falles grieuous repent v heart willeth v doe hoſea doctrine warily receiued wee ready fall hoſ 14 1 2 extremity ſides ſome doubt feare god receiue againe though returne remembring former ſhamefull wilfull tranſgreſſion errour muſt amended ready heare god receiuing ſinners graciouſly againe againe lamenting ready note ſay thinke ſhall eaſily bee forgiuen without remorſe pricke conſcience ſinne groſſe abuſing god patience readineſſe receiue ſinners haue offended differeth much ſay let v ſinne grace may abound middle way betwixt ſafeſt goe wit caſt away confidence vnfainedly turne god yet take arrogate themſelues beleeuing pardon continue bold ſinning without broken relenting heart note leſſon learned v god teacheth hath himſelfe giuen example vnto v ſound certaine rule guide v toward neighbour haue offended v ſay embraceth forgiueth ſinners returning vnto ſo ſhould bee cruell hardhearted toward readily receiue ſubmit themſelues according sauiour anſwered peter aſked oft ſhould forgiue brother vnto ſeuen time anſwered mat 18 21 ſay vnto ſeuen time ſeuenty time ſeuen ought therefore forgiue tranſgreſſion god law cannot doe none forgiue ſinne god wrong iniurie mat 9 3 done vnto v euill minde beare toward v ſay wee ought profeſſe fifth petition remit ſatisfaction haue taken away good may remitting doe repentance ability partie ſhall giue occaſion ſo ſay puniſhment hath deſerued haue hurt v body name otherwiſe yet bee expedient wee ſuſtaine great detriment note thereby may remit yet ſome caſe though forgiue wrong yet wee may vrge partie culpable ſatisfaction puniſhment according law god nation wee liue left men ſhould emboldened ſinne thereby yea ſometime wee wronged ought ſo doe neceſſarily otherwiſe ſhould ſin againſt god commonwealth thus achan ioſua theefe ioſh 7 25 croſſe iuſtly puniſhed put death god law man elſe broken haue ſaid matter luk 23 41 ſome difficulty may ſee wee bound remit vnto neighbour farre thing verſe ehud giuen doct 3 deliuerer ſaid haue bin lame part body euen right hand member might worſt miſſed eſpecially valiant captaine man war called ſhew ſtrength skil wherin ſay leſſe god doth ſtrange maruellous eye ſheweth v hereby pleaſeth moſt commonly vſeth weake meanes effect bring great matter paſſe glory may eaſily ſeene giuen vnto yet fleſh carnall reaſon yeeld eaſily thereunto proofe doctrine looke baſe weake inſtruments lord vſed vexe mighty king meane pharaoh namely frog louse locuſts ſuch like ionathan armorbearer flew many philiſtims dauid goliah prophet ioels time lord plague drunkard ſinners land ſo iolly hauing fruit earth plentifull manner ſerue turne though none could haue reſiſted ſay plague ſtouteſt mightieſt like weake meanes ſpoiling thereby fruit earth without iollity muſt fall ground thus prophet ſpeaketh heare ye elder hearken ye inhabitant world whether ſuch thing hath day ioel 1 3 day father left palmer worme hath graſhopper eaten reſidue graſhopper hath canker worme eaten reſidue canker worme hath caterpiller eaten ſee mighty hand god matter farre exceede theſe god doth often ought cauſe v therefore bee ſlight meanes vſing ſerue prouidence hee apoſtles ſimple men great account world yet hee miniſtery weake preaching accounted ſubdue proud ſtately world obedience goſpel euen paul one man many city yea country bring darkeneſſe light power satan vnto god inſomuch whole aſia filled doctrine iewes grecian heard word lord ſo act 19 10 day hee hath perſwaded many become true chriſtians miniſtery labour ſmall reputation world bringeth light ſuch excellent tidings kingdome glory ſo weake meanes saint paul ſheweth reaſon theſe word haue treaſure earthen veſſels ſaith excellency power • cor 4 7 might god v therfore deſpiſe weake god worketh neither let ſuch diſcourage themſelues grace humility meekneſſe loue ſuch like ſmall gift ſhall edifie build vp church chriſt knowledge bare letter ſuch thereby puffed vp ſhall doe little good miniſtery 1 cor 13 1 2 ſo ſhall ſeene people true godlineſſe accompanying knowledge chriſt though ridiculous among men ſhall much perſwading drawing many loue goſpell fellowſhip therein greateſt ſo doubtleſſe rareſt thing ſeene among people example woman samaria ſeene brought neighbour chriſt conuerted ſelfe yea may bee ſeene ſtill day euen priuate perſons truly religious ſhall humility diligence loue doe much good haue variety knowledge vtterance deſtitute thoſe grace though bee little accounted vſe haue ſaid point haue work god meanely ſoeuer accounted ſpecially worke grace men wee haue ſay moſt high reuerence compariſon gloriouſeſt act men foure point ſtory 12 verſe namely 1 reuolting people god 2 lord puniſhing 3 cry god 4 ſending deliuerer thus much matter theſe foure thing ſecond ſtory thus ended remaineth ſence remaineth 15 verſe ſomewhat verſe hath yet ſpoken much whole chapter occaſion laſt point meane ehuds deliuering proceed firſt part 15 verſe remaineth word theſe child iſrael ſent preſent eglon king moab heere trouble largeſt part ſtory remaineth behinde vnhandled wherefore ſhould bee ſo ſeeing foure materiall point part chapter haue wee haue ſeene handled already anſwere behinde 31 verſe doth iſſue grow occaſion laſt point 4 namely deliuerer god raiſed vp people meane ehud ſet downe illuſtrate amplifie deliuerance people ſhall appeare euen god deliuered bondage moabites gaue reſt perſon ehud hath ſaid ſtory ſhewes hee wrought deliuerance thus firſt ſlaying king moab himſelfe reacheth 27 verſe killing ten thouſand men moab 30 verſe followeth ſubduing moabites deliuerance reſt people 31 firſt theſe firſt place namely killing king laying forth wee conſider firſt thing went namely meanes hee wrought ſuch great worke ſet downe 21 verſe act ſelfe 23 thing followed 27 thing went meanes worke double going iourney ehud king moab firſt hee deliuered preſent onely nineteenth verſe laſt act ſelfe 21 firſt iourney note theſe three thing one occaſion carrying preſent ſecond furniſhing himſelfe deed ſhort ſharpe dagger deliuering preſent thus ſtorie ſet downe large text haue laid forth ſeuerall part ſo farre place expedient better vnderſtanding reader let v go order firſt whereas ſaid latter end 15 verſe child iſrael ſent preſent ehud king moab ſo indeed word hebrew 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifieth tribute ſaid occaſion went ſo preſent king moab blind folded hee might ſuſpect ſuch matter afterward bee intended ehud hee attempted went fact deed though lawfull iſraelites goe kill yet nothing meet ſhould vndiſcreetneſſe giue occaſion ſuſpect doct 4 verſ 15 allowed may ſee lawful diſpleaſing god good man danger diſpleaſure another namely ſuperiour remoue gift preſent know preſents may lawfully ſent reſpects namely ſhew thankfulneſſe kindneſſe receiued know alſo gift ſomtime ſent helping forward bad matter corrupting iudgement moſt odious neither theſe meant heere get fauour namely better ſuch meanes know bee like preuaile nothing againſt wee may ſerue god prouidence way remouing diſpleaſure ſo father iacob ſeeke gen 32 13 put away wrath brother eſau procure fauour although receiueth doth oftentimes offend therein hee ſhould yeeld fauour without yet giuer wee know salomon ſaith gift ſecret pacifieth wrath doth well pull downe heart ſendeth mollifie receiueth farre better either ſhould ranckle bee inflamed againſt may ſuffice haue ſaid matter ſo whole 15 verſe verſ 16 ehud made dagger two edge cubit length gird vnder raiment vpon right thigh 17 preſented gift vnto eglon king moab eglon vnry fat man 18 preſented preſent ſent away people bare preſent 19 turned againe quarry gilgal ſaid haue ſecret errand thee king ſaid keepe ſilence ſtood went 20 ehud came ſat alone ſommer parlor ehud ſaid haue meſſage thee god aroſe throne ehud god giuen people deliuerer conſent choſen goe preſent king moab knowing deliuer people hand thus goe namely prouide ſharpe dagger ſpeedy expedition thereof girded ſame vnder right thigh might leſſe ſuſpition intended though danger could great notwithſtanding doubted good ſucceſſe god yet caſt himſelfe many great peril going might wiſelier auoid confeſſe act intended doe namely kill king moab ſecretly thus prouide couer preſent hee offered confeſſe ſay god called ſet action many reſpects odious highly condemned god raiſing vp ſuch end hee approued therein encouragement emboldening god called accompliſh worke heere note haue ſaid doct verſ 15 16 muſt encourage v difficulteſt matter taking thē hand ſet worke god know pleaſed thing goe ſay muſt perſwaded wee haue v end wee may cheerefully goe looke wee carefully wee ſhall proſper make common practiſe affaire ſhall throughout ſee good day haue allowance doubtfull caſes much ſuch haue apparant ſhew euill may enterprize ehud might heere without warrant wee haue commandement take hand thing indifferent let v know liberty wee doe wee perſwaded doth pleaſe god beſt ſo wee ſhall haue peace wee goe little regarded men take hand thing doe owne head owne liking ill ſucceſſe haue ſuch action lamentable behold ſo refer reader deſirous know chap 1 verſ 19 22 haue ſaid ſaid firſt thing three ſending preſent ſecond three thing went ſo well appointed let doct verſ 16 v marke ehud ſure good ſucceſſe great worke god would hee idle careleſſe greater regard goe beſt manner furniſhing himſelfe prouiding weapon purpoſe wherein againe wee muſt learne behoueth v vſe good meanes diligence prouidence wiſdome well bringing paſſe euen thoſe thing wherein god hath promiſed good ſucceſſe bee v yea doe readineſſe cheerfulneſſe ſee haue good cauſe ſo wel encouraged ſo may ſee ſelues may know goe worke men world doe meane coldly deadly onely hope profit pleaſure ſuch like whetting v motiues perſwaſions earthly minded worldly men haue buſines grace bleſſing earthly buſineſſe common workes wee may bee ſo heauenly minded much may looke hope well aſſiſted workes wee goe heauenly thou maieſt reade chapter 1 verſe 4 third thing three followeth preſenting verſ 16 17 gift carying offering preſent eglon king moab ſeemed ſuch heare matter commendable ehud ſhould kill vnder pretence kindneſſe yet hee intending doct 2 matter thereby ſhewed wit deliuering god people killing enemie onely lawfull alſo praiſe worthy act teacheth doe ſuch thing beſt note moſt commendable eye men ſuch ehud ſeemed yet lawfull allowed god ſhould may intend ſome better thing thereby ehud although haue effect preſent time meane good purpoſe aime yet wait opportunity bring ſo paſſe wil better vnderſtood laying particular example man company bad perſon ſelfe credit yet vnlawfull man giue almes poore man hath goodnes may thought ſome maintaining theſe caſes like ſpeake ought haue reach meaning deſire endeauour party good admoniſh reproue ſhall cauſe ſeene exhort ſeeke draw ſhall ſee beſt opportunity repentance thereby ſtay taking offence thereat ſo ſay ſuch action heſter reade bad haman enemie god people banquet like ſauour heſt 5 5 ill godly ſhould heare firſt comming thither though ſhe ſpake nothing againſt haman king yet ſecond banquet ſhee obtained deliuerance god people appointed haman bee ſlaine beſide ſhee procured ouerthrow ſhe made way bidding firſt banquet entended though ſhe made ſhew ſuch thing sauiour eate mat 9 10 luk 19 7 drinke publican ſinners hardly thought phariſies ſought conuerſion therefore ſuch action haue beſt ſhew goodneſſe end may bring violence conſciences diſquiet godly better alſo ſtop mouthes others ſhall bee meete v aime intend better thing ſeene firſt ſhew may bee truly ſaid contrary doe thing ſhew ſcarce honeſt haunt ſuſpicious place company thoſe ill note name yet meane worſe ſeene namely practiſe whoredome fall drunkenneſſe ill rule may ſay truly bee affirmed ſuch vile note perſons bad indeed moſt ſhew ſignes goodneſſe loue friendly familiarity ſobriety religion yet ſpite v holy profeſſion behinde backes carrie themſelues leaudly worſt returne like ſee iehu although ſeemed cruell view world murthering houſe ahab yet hauing eye calling god went courage 2 king 10 commended heere muſt bee caueat obſerued man preſume theſe example enterprize ſuch like matter without warrant god alleaging himſelfe end good profitable go worke head yea call euill good doe euill good may come man priuate caſe take vpon reuenge owne wrong belongs magiſtrate lord warrant man ſincerity intention goe forward thing lawfull ſee act two tribe halfe building altar ſo haue word beare v runne ioſh 22 30 lapſe offend againſt expreſſe prohibition scripture thou ſhalt thine owne whereas written mat 6 10 petic 3 1 theſ 5 ſhould auoide appearance euill vnlawfull ſimply good man bee company one euill excuſeth obſerueth circumſtances herein ſhall aſſociate himſelfe ſuch bad note gaming drinking haunting ſuſpected place haue ſaid although abuſe extraordinary fact heſter example sauiour pretend ſome good party ehud appointed preſent gift king moab ſo ſaid heere hee wee know great honour credit vnto worthie afterward aduenture ſo great danger god alloweth ſerue high place performe great duty church commonwealth hee alloweth much credit honour dignitie one prince noble perſons ſuch dauid salomon hezechia ioſia moſes ioſhua others haue enioyed ſame reſpect ſome great godly euen ſo v truly honour fauour learning good miniſters make much feare lord reſiſting oppoſing common aduerſary highly honoured church god ſo alſo place doe ſeruice god liues place employment ſo greater account ſet well worthy doe ſo care faithfulneſſe trauell honour god much lord hath promiſed honour honour leaue without honour ſo heere ehud great honour appointed deliuer preſent eglon king moab worthier beſide many worthy act people peace deliuerance among would haue aduentured liues reſt may bee ſaid pharaoh ſaid ioſeph directed prouide ſeuen yeeres gen 41 38 plenty ſeuen yeeres famine wiſe man ſhould bee fit buſineſſe pharaoh ſaid ſeruants ſhall wee finde man vnderſtanding like let bee ſet ouer land egypt worke heere holy story ſetting downe ehud preſented gift doct 2 verſ 17 eglon addeth fat man may ſeeme vttered end ſeeing neither ſet downe commendation diſcommendation mentioned may ſee reaſon 22 verſe commended diſcommended ſo occaſion heereof ſay fatneſſe body bee thought thing neither man againſt ſelfe ſome diſpoſed thereto naturally though haue one diet alike kinde eaſie life euen ſee one tree waxeth great tall ſame ſoyle another ſmall low one oke compariſon another men naturally apt thereto good keeping doth ſet one forward therefore maruell ſo ſuch liue deliciouſly eating drinking vſing liberty pleaſure may bee ſpoken without vſe profit let v learne ſuch either miniſters giue ouer themſelues let bridle looſe exceſſe eating drinking ſleeping playing idleneſſe eaſe ſuch like get fat way may little reioyce ſhall wiſh labour calling good meanes taken themſelues downe paul chaſtized body leaſt haue good teſtimony haue growne point owne ſinne tit 1 12 therefore prouerbe vſed paul againſt going eglon deliuer preſent ſecond followeth ſlue wherein may obſerue ſumme verſ 18 19 20 firſt conueighing home men came brought preſent deliuered might perill ſhould doe worke god ſo full difficulty danger secondly came backe againe eglon telling ſecret errand meſſage remoue company attended king place preſence thirdly hee obtained hee repeated word adding meſſage god ſo king might attend reuerence hee token thereof ſtood vp might leſſe ſuſpect danger ehud might haue aduantage thereby eaſily diſpatch thus much theſe three verſes concerning firſt ſending away people verſ 18 vnto quarry place ſtones digged vp neare gilgal city iſraelites neare iordan followed preſent deliuered till paſt danger reſpected many thing namely might bee freer care alſo leſt tarying ſtill while went worke might haue meanes bewraying loth bring danger hee muſt need theſe reaſons moued ſend people away tended quiet peace conſcience example herein ought bee doct verſ 18 inſtruction wee may learne goe waighty matter poſſible deepe due conſideration wiſedome warineſſe ehud heere ſufficient ſelues hereunto take wee aduice thoſe wiſer purpoſe salomon ſaith without counſell thought come naught multitude counſellors prou 15 22 ſtedfaſtneſſe muſt bee ſure ſpeciall care bee vſed haue ſaid great waighty buſineſſe impoſed vpon v poſſible regard ſee well brought paſſe gone leſſon ill learned peter chriſts beloued apoſtle may warne v exceeding danger befell thereby put better practiſe chriſt told moſt waighty matter namely hee ſhould denie peter moſt ſleightly regarded anſwering raſhly without conſideration ſo little feared chriſt told luk 22 32 ready goe priſon death ſo reſting bold anſwere deceiueable confidence owne ſtrength want aduiſed deliberation fell ſinne maſter foretold ſmall occaſion denied indeed ſo example ſet downe left v learne wiſedome thereby moſes otherwiſe farre better told muſt ſent pharaoh lord doe meſſage vnto ſeemed ouer exod 3 13 difficult waighty yet conſidering thereof aduiſedly ſaw impoſed vpon lord hee ſtouped fitted himſelfe accordingly well diſcharged proſpered let theſe two example bee duely weighed regarded v though contrary one vrge v practiſe doctrine otherwiſe let v maruell thriue waighty attempt god reuerently harkened vnto watchword warning moſt meet duely attended vpon v generall particularly let teach v thoſe action ſpecially tend glory god haue eye alſo good brother let v carrie ſelues ſo zeale toward god meane ſeaſon wee neglect dutie toward men neither cauſe loue towards brother bee called queſtion build heauen pull downe faſt vpon earth ehud heere farre otherwiſe highly commendable paul became well deſired king agrippa conuerſion without act 26 29 enioyning benefit owne band becommeth v ſo wiſely feruent god cauſe yet wee would willingly hazard ſafety liberty credit wealth welfare others zeale ſuffering nay rather becauſe redeeme freedome owne damage detriment many prepoſterous opinion becauſe thinke themſelues ſtrong enough vndergoe trouble reproch goſpell good cauſe therefore looke zealous perſons ſhould doe ſo ready cenſure ſharpely themſelues ſeeme regarding weakneſſe finding themſelues fit beare burthen ſhould bee pitied behalfe elſe thinke diſcredit good cauſe ſuffer alone thus winde dangerous ſnare themſelues drawing promiſe vndertake vnfit whereas reade ſome ancient ſome late martyr wiſely charitably tendring peace good weake brother reſolued beare brunt themſelues counſelled prouide conſcience flight perſecution felt themſelues fit goe vnder reſt looke next sermon one twentieth sermon fifth third chapter booke ivdges ehud followeth ſtill conueying away men doct 2 verſ 18 preſent deliuered inconuenience might bee auoided part let v learne onely bee warie wee bewray ſecrets vndiſcreetly hee wiſely preuented ſending away therefore much many alſo ſo let v doe agreeing rule charity namely danger trouble ſorrow muſt need enſue follow ſuch thing wee goe muſt need take hand yet let care trouble bee muſt need danger heauines take hold muſt neceſſity haue part therein ehud ſaw burthen lay vpon hee might hee would haue laid vpon beſide himſelfe wiſe hee would doe ſent reſt
