whole family neighbour thereabout faith child reſtored aliue vnto againe griefe care muſt need light ſhe ſuſtained ſelfe would haue ſorrow troubled ſinne thing great wee might little trouble ſelues free eaſe many yet wee raiſe procure alſo yea wee bee note ſatisfied vnleſſe ſmart well farre regarding ſeeking peace would liue peaceably v example commonly ſeene many rough boyſterous husband grieue diſquiet wiſe family loud vnbeſeeming well vnſeaſonable complaint outcryings whereby diſquiet whole family ſome ouerſight eſpy yea haue oft time cauſe doe ſo leaſt iuſt cauſe grieued yet little patience bearing treſpaſſers cauſe requireth ſober kinde telling might haue done farre good haue kept whole family quiet ſame may ſay wife ſhe giuen waſpiſhneſſe bee ſhrewiſh hot wrathfull thereby troubleth husband whole houſe accuſation reacheth yet euen ſpitefull malicious onely oft iarring ſtrife neighbour vpon ſmall occaſions ready ſue law euery trifle ſo trouble themſelues alſo whereas vertuous queene heſter beholding ſhee onely hope helpe vnder god heſt 4 16 church deliuerance haman plot deuiſing waſt deſtroy vtterly tooke vpon going though moſt likely perill life without hurt one beſide ſaying ſo doubtfull caſe periſh periſh yea saul himſelfe yet commendation ſtory vprightneſſe goodneſſe would ſuffer murmurer repiners againſt entring bee puniſhed firſt comming kingdome ſome would haue 1 sam 11 13 choſe rather put vp diſgrace ſaying ſhall man die day day lord hath ſaued iſrael occaſion ehuas ſending people away went firſt three thing mentioned contained theſe 3 verſes followeth ſecond thing wit ehuds ſecond going eglon verſ 19 20 ſenſe ſaid hee returned haſt place neere gilgal land iſrael whither hee conducted people could bee farre place king eglon lay hee hauing brought iſraelites ſubiection cleere thot lay neere border better ſee kept vnder comming told hee meſſage ſecreſie doe vnto whereat king required ſtay vttering till company ſtanding commanded place hee hauing ſo lately receiued preſent hand ſuſpition trechery intended company gone ehud admitted come neare vnto telling meſſage god hee ſtood vp doe reuerence name ſo meanes way made eaſie better opportunitie doe worke went theſe two verſes may ſee conſidering lord called ehud worke deſtroying people enemy deliuer hand elſe moſt bloody trecherous act may ſee ſay courage confidence aduenture great danger hee going kill eglon king attempt detected found put doubteth moſt extreme torture among enemy friend ſtanding preſence hee vphold himſelfe great difficulty fearfull danger truſt god confidence hee laid worke vpon would bring well yet hard thing ſeeth rightly conſider difficulty great ſtraite hee beleeue god would make way enable ſuch worke likelihoode thereof taken away teacheth drowned man reaſon iudgement faith made peter bold pronounce lame diſeaſed euen lay viſited pronounce ſay hearing act 3 6 9 34 ſtood ſaw likelihood thereof appeare ieſus chriſt maketh whole ariſe walke hee beleeued chriſt ſaid ſhould worke miracle whenſoeuer expedient faith made bold ſay ſo whereas immediately done indeed foreſaid ſhould come paſſe party ſhould bee healed ſhould haue vtterly theſe word weepe ye thus rend heart reſolued ready bee bound onely alſo die ieruſalem name lord ieſus euen ſo taught writing timothy therefore ſuffer becauſe 1 tim 4 10 beleeue liuing god ſauiour eſpecially beleeue ehud theſe two verſes word ſpoken king ſuch aske deluded king lie hee went kill ſeeing hee vttered meſſage yet hee told hee meſſage god vnto anſwere word tranſlated meſſage errand doth onely ſignifie word meſſage mouth alſo thing deed ſuch vnto ſent god kill euen among latines verbum re quid hoc verbi eſt quid hoc rei eſt one followeth third thing 20 verſe namely ehuds vnfolding latter part verſ 19 20 laſt word king immediately killed eglons behauiour thereat heere ſet downe let v conſider ſay ſhould ſo ſimply hearken beleeue admit ſecret parlour ehud ſtranger ſhould neither ſuſpected ſearched manner great reaſon hee ſhould haue acceſſe king none king attendant ſhould aduiſe ſuch matter hee ſhould bee ſuffered ſtand foot king ſuſpitious rather commanded bee vpon knee hee ſhould cauſe owne company goe place leaue two onely together eſpecially let ehud depart ſaw wel theſe ſay ſuch like lord blinded caſt myſt could neuer haue paſſed may ſay much like reade abner captaine saul hoaſt men wit 1 sam 26 15 imagined dauid purſued ſought life ſhould therefore haue ſpecially watched attended king perſon time yet euen armie ſhould aſleepe together lay ſo much dauid challenged abner admirable could haue ſo reaſon except god caſt ſleepe vpon end dauids integrity innocency toward saul might knowne ſeene way ſhew ſaw would might haue killed saul hereby let v learne god haue worke wrought doct verſ 19 20 thing brought paſſe glory good church deſtruction enemy hauing many way bring paſſe effect infinite difficulty without troubling ſelues prouidence alway miniſtreth make way purpoſe till executed dauid ſo coped saul one time ſeemed hope eſcape lord whiſtled away ſet buſineſſe let diſcouragements thinke wee noah hold great worke building arke preſeruing gen 6 13 14 world church god leaue conſideration reader rather ſpend time laying forth bringing paſſe god promiſe ioſeph dreame long time effected euen well nigh twentie yeeres vnlike meane many difficulty raiſed ſet way fruſtrating malice enuie brother ſome intending ſeeking kill company conſenting ſhould ſold ſtrangers farre whence thought gen 37 21 22 ſhould neuer haue bin ſeen neither dreames come paſſe impriſonment alſo falſe accuſation whoriſh miſtriſſe would haue ſaid meanes theſe ſhould haue vtterly depriued benefit promiſes god made could preuaile iot god word gen 42 21 made voide ſo came paſſe cruell malice haman eaſily auoided plotting deſtruction iewes god people day thereof appointed heſt 7 50 king perſwaded let hee would haue friend ſheep appointed ſlaine great danger themſelues ſay heſter mardocai ſhee queene hope vnder god ſhould goe helpe danger ſhe brought ſelfe thereby preſent perill life yet becauſe could poſſible church god ſhould ouerthrowne moſt ſtrangely deliuer let paſſe example scripture euen thus lord hath doth vphold church heere time againſt enemy let doe till hath accompliſhed made vp number wee ſee continueth fauour ſpecially place people many trial let v ſay lord hath done great maruellous thing note need acknowledge kindneſſe profit common manner leſt account harder made men come ſhew particularly ſo conclude point euery priuate perſon concerneth could weigh difficulty tentations diſcouragements god hath brought hold keepe faith good conſcience beginning middle part combate conflicting day ſpecially hath well nigh runne race finiſhed courſe ioy oh thankes would render lord ſuch may well note remember oft haue ſaid within themſelues ſhall neuer ſtabliſhed perſeuere end promiſe heauen made good true yet god hath ſo mixed power weakeneſſe ſo vpheld beyond expectation hee hath brought ſafely feared oh cannot ſufficiently magnifie commend goodneſſe lord withall glorious worke faith wonder effect yet little known asked ſeeing arme lord ſhortened time paſt doth great thing beleeue day let v alſo learne dauids leſſon commit thy way lord ſaith beleeue pſal 37 3 effect doe deed without needleſſe indirect trouble fretting care thine beleeue deny may ſee eliſha told prince iſrael mordicai heſter 2 king 7 2 heſt 4 14 god promiſes performed others hee made vnbeleeuing prince ſhall haue part therein ſelues cauſe ſound reioycing thereat much exerciſe faith beleeuing therefore worthily deſerueth hand child god fruit doctrine hath meaſure granted haue proofe faith al leaſt yeeld lord thus much bee thankfull yea euen admiration conſider hee hath brought matter paſſe beyond hope ſo arme themſelues beleeue ſtill aſſuredly god able willing make way deſires diſtreſſes without yet ſhal loſe benefit power loue occaſion ſhall offered eglons riſing vp mention god though hee reuerenced doct verſ 20 next thing followeth text howſoeuer vſed doe ſo time heathen king baalam balak king moab came prince aske god anſwere baalam ſay ſpake thus vnto ariſe balak heare god voice giue reuerence concerning riſing vp ſay naming god wee may make ſome good vſe wee ſure ſerueth conuince atheiſts prophane one farre yeelding yee ſay reuerence gaue ſeeing idolater naming god whether true god iehouah ſay ſufficient condemne theſe ſome make ſhewes reuerence truth offer diſgrace reade phariſies proued blind man chriſt opened eye ioh 9 24 could abide heare would take knowledge though might boldly freely detract hated ſo gaue word honour god bewrayed hypocriſie would ſeeme holy therefore ſaid giue glory god wee know man ſinner ſo bewrayed religion yet would ſeeme goe others therein ſeeing true hee honoureth ſonne neither doth hee honour father let ſerue ſhame brutiſh prophane perſons yet viſible church aſcribe ſo much word preached neither regard meſſage god ſo much reuerence heathen eglon token thereof ſtood vp ehud told meſſage god leaue theſe let bee watch word v profeſſe true worſhip god pleaſe ſelues worke wrought meane giuing outward bodily worſhip god mat 15 9 calling father ſeeing neither draw neare body onely doe pleaſe neither ſay lord lord ſhall enter mat 7 21 kingdome heauen doth wil father heauen 2 tim 2 19 againe ſeeing written call name lord muſt depart iniquity let v regard duly without wee ſhall haue commend v god heathen king enough cap 1 verſ 4 followeth verſ 21 ehud put forth left hand tooke dagger right thigh thruſt belly 22 haft went blade fat cloſed blade ſo could draw dagger belly dirt came ehuds intent preparation kill eglon king moab wee haue ſenſe doctrine theſe two verſes heard followeth execution iael ſtrengthened god deſtroy kill sicera captaine iabin king canaan ſo lord ſtrengthened ehud heere bring downe eglon king moab iſrael people cried vnto might bee deliuered bondage brought thus god moment tooke doct verſ 21 away life honour together one deadly blow wherin hee would ſhew v wofull eſtate thoſe haue nothing world end may come euen heere know ſoone ſuddenly beſide irkeſome deſolation ſhall meet goe hence oh baſe lothſome death god would haue brought vnto yet flouriſhing eſtate ſo far likelihood change decay wee regard thing wee conſider example infinite thus belſhazzar herod taken downe middeſt iollity adde theſe nabal vncomfortableneſſe 1 sam 25 37 38 death zimri burned himſelfe burne king pallace tirza ſo died ioaſh king iuda 1 king 16 19 ſlaine ſeruants iezabel whoſe blood without compaſſion 2 king 12 20 daſhed againſt ſtones euen ſo doe wee daily ſee flouriſhing luk 21 6 eſtates men turned moſt deſolate decay ſo much bee iuſtly reproued making paradiſe word sauiour theſe thing ye looke alſo hee luk 29 42 bewailed died without hope heere ſo fit occaſion offered ehuds killing eglon king moab thinke vnfit place way pope diſpleaſure ſo though would helpe lord cut ſuch flouriſh proſper rather mention becauſe defend themſelues fact ehud ſuch like moſt impudently abiurdly couer horrible treaſons murthers two laſt king france thus handled fact doer highly extolled theſe hartened thereto oh villaine intolerable whereby perſecuting goſpell moſt liuely ſhew themſelues bee vtter aduerſaries chriſt bee moſt neare akind commit ſinne againſt ſhould pray cannot bee forgiuen leaue god alloweth bee inſtruments ſuch bloody act trecheries let v returne perſons mentioned liued heere pleaſures ſinne ſeaſon without god world ſoone periſhed miſerably theſe many mentioned scripture later chronicle ſpeake chiefe greateſt perſons ſeeing doe moſt moue affection ſo highly aduanced world yet ſo ſoone ſuddenly ſpoiled bereaued honour excellency haue ſaid change baſe death worſe eſtate afterwards doe liuely ſet eye miſery ſuch looke brauerie iollity vaine pleaſure large poſſeſſions neither keepe deadly blow giuen dreadfull woe commeth ſo might bee comfort loſe part haue time thinke thereof without deadly diſlike moſt bitter vexation may worthily warne ſuch high degree much v inferiour perſons therefore ought firſt ſtoope conſider prouide ende muſt departhence time moſt vncertaine may bee prepared die happily prouide receiued heauenly habitation wee ſee pitifull dangerous thing reſt vpon enioy heere eſcaped seirah thing followed action pertained according diuiſion made end fifteenth verſe ſet downe theſe foure verſes tend end ſhew god made way ehuds ſafe eſcaping therefore firſt note ſomewhat generally particularly afterward comming forth none king ſeruants hand goe king parlour preſently attending yet ſhould ſo negligent forgetfull goe forthwith tarrie till ehud might gone paſt danger haue bewrayed himſelfe eaſily palpably bee ſeene iudas betraying maſter cried owne fact ſaying mat 27 4 haue ſinned betraying innocent blood may teach v greatly quiet excuſing conſcience innocent king followeth ending making vp story verſ 31 firſt ſhewed ehud bringing paſſe thing ehud went whereby ſo many moabites ſlaine iſrael deliuered theſe three firſt hee valiant man ſo comming place heere riuer reſcue fellowes purſue iſrael ſlew alſo till ten thouſand men good courage cut done moabites ſo inraged againſt done king made ſpoile hauocke whereas ſubdued obtained long time reſt themſelues thereof moſt true formoſt many v come profeſſe goſpell indeed imbrace commendably hearing ioyfully conuerſing god people kindly forſaking many part former bad liues wee ſhould hold good manner ſearch ſaying bee valiant good courage ioſh 1 3 haue giuen whole country canaanite thy hand ſo ſpake ehud heere vnto men ephraim name god authority theſe perſwaſions like preuaile ſay faithfull onely may bee theſe force moue euen alſo throughly perſwaded thereof without faith doe much moue mind rather example better themſelues alſo doe cauſe enquire ſuch thing ſhould bee done till grow acquainted ſo may time beleeue ſo doe faith alſo let ſay bee better conſidered two thing one promiſes eternall life thoſe belong preſent life firſt god ſhall ſome faithfull meſſenger aſſure hungring ſoule man afflicted 16 33 likewiſe meane temporary promiſes preſent life one ehud heere offered ſet people promiſe bleſſing good ſucceſſe ſuch obey god walking diligently particular calling promiſe good end iſſue trouble commit way god well occupied vnder note meane ſeaſon theſe ſay forcible ſuch promiſes power haue vphold heart ſuch comfortable expectation thing promiſed whereas without nothing could doe ſame oh therfore good may godly miniſter euen ſuperiours alſo eſpecially men indued gift ſpirit continue loue put poore people daily remembrance theſe thing middeſt manifold change life therefore god ſhall impart man miniſtery otherwiſe light wiſedome experience grace either beleeuing obeying muſt hee apply himſelfe enlighten aduiſe ſtrengthen thoſe god hath ſet ouer purpoſe knowing euery man caſe able miniſter vnto himſelfe aduice direction though much deſired eſpecially matter difficulty doubt conſcience tentation vnder croſſe peter therefore betruſted office confirme brother man thouſand dauid pſal 51 vndertooke himſelfe firſt well learned better able performe neither let man thinke diſgrace himſelfe thus ſee walke eye vpon foot others man wiſedome great portion god receiue direction ſuch meanes heere ſtay twentie three sermon third chapter booke ivdges goe forward valiant warriours ephraim encouraged thus ehud helpe called together therewith haue heard keeping paſſages fro betwixt iſrael owne ſide moab ſide iordan killed moabites offered themſelues ſtirre helper time great calamity abaſement wherein loſt king theſe ſay ehud drew together ſo beſtirred themſelues ten thouſand beſt warriours moabites put ſword thus moab weakened ehud people iſrael preuaile ſee time affliction calamity people god beene heere iſrael haue prouoked god ſinnes haue made naked lord ſay deſtitute voide grace helpe god ſaid father made calfe exodus ſay ſuch time ſo time againe deliuerance ioy people riſe ſinne penitently ſeeke lord whole heart hee moſt graciouſly returneth againe whoſe fauour life comfortable eſtate may wee enioy time time haue lord louing countenance ſhine vpon v far delightfull ſoule faireſt ſweeteſt weather bee creature earth • like preferre beſt hauing note obtained grace doe ſo ſhall goe ſtep thinke beſt wiſedome continue ſo wee ſhall abide god fauour ioh 15 10 alſo keepe ſelues well wel happineſſe life enioyed lord doth ſtint tie v time may haue peace ſee good day would wee ſhould liue ſafety vnder protection day long ſo deut 33 12 time time may haue proofe good bountifull hee waily inconſtant abuſe lenity kindneſſe toward v hee onely holdeth many trouble generation following ſtories doe teſtifie deut 32 15 kicke vp heele againſt lord hee yet feede fat wheat make drinke ſweet reuolting worketh ſuch change beſt ſtates ſeaſons cauſeth complain cry let therefore cauſe v bee reſolued vpon due good conſideration ſo wee may conſtantly hold ſame wit wee deſire ſee good day heere enioy long life lord hereafter ſay wee flie euill follow good 1 pet 3 11 heerein let v ſee wee deale hollowly lord occaſion ſlip fall forget ſelues people heere verſ 7 note yet let v take heede harden heart ſo lie ſtill beare mica 7 7 puniſhment contentedly becauſe haue ſinned make ſpeed turne againe lord firſt husband receiue v graciouſly hath ſmitten v ſo heale v hee comfort v ſo reſtore ioy gladneſſe v time paſt done daily ſmaller ſlips ſhall eaſilier gone greater fals ſhall alſo meane keepe v yea doubtleſſe lord doe great thing v hee abaſed enemy people moabites heere ſo hee bring wicked vnder v leaue afflicted ſcourged roome prou followeth third laſt thing mentioned latter part verſ 30 vnfolding ſtory reſt good long time peace lord granted could willingly affoord one giue long time thereto ſhort great bleſſing ſo promiſed indeed lord ſaid would giue moab hand people enioyed fruit faith laid hold god promiſe heſides lengthened time reſt hee promiſed teach v god neuer commeth ſhort behinde hand v performing promiſes giueth v good meaſure heaped vp doct verſ 30 running ouer thereby ſheweth hee liberall bountifull toward v vſuall manner dealing giue luk 6 38 aske looke receiue hee giueth hee himſelfe promiſeth prodigall child asked hee might granted alſo bad take ſhe would euen father iacob feared hee ſhould neuer ſee ioſephs face thinking deuoured ſome wild beaſt yet ſee childrens gen 37 33 34 compared 48 11 child beleeued able make liues comfortable ſay truth welfare according faith yet lord giueth fartee aboue beleeue therefore ought encourage note v labour giue credit ſeene impoſeth vpon v requireth v wee vnderſtand ſee reſt perſwaded haue v goe may know reward ſhall exceeding great ſo let v inſtance two three particular ſhall finde ſame haue done v marke may perceiue haue ſomtime affliction beſought lord ſome eaſe mitigation force whether ſickneſſe paine diſeaſe ſuch like hath deliuered v altogether beſides bleſſed v abundantly ſo ſhew particular great ſorrow hath riſing toward v hath oft time turned ſorrow ioy euen ſo longcontinued peace people vnlooked deliuerance ſubiection moabites would haue ful welcome though ſhort time might haue ſome breathing bondage ſo lord dealeth v whereas ſome trouble haue feared hezechiah wee ſhould neuer fee light good day yet note lord exceeding goodneſſe hath reſtored v former ſweet eſa 38 11 liberty long time oh might ſaid argument although muſt alſo know hee ſeeth reaſon ſometime good cauſe hold v deferre v chap 1 ver 2 heere end ſtory verſ 31 shamgar ſonne anath ſlew philiſtims ſixe hundred men oxe goade alſo deliuered iſrael▪ ſhort ſtory shamgar third laſt iaw bone aſſe ſlew thouſand men iael bare naile killed siſera valiant captaine iabin king canaan ſo great act shamgar ſo weak inſtrument lord pleaſed giue victory truth ſhould wee ſee verified clearely euer would hold ſure conſtant wee deare vnto ſecondly feele outward oppreſſions diſcouragements inward infirmity feares tentations ſay wee looke weake wee ſelues vnfit wade beare forgetting god power ſerueth 1 sam 30 6 vſe comfort weake ſeruants made knowne infirmity euen ſo wee ſee dauid namely ſore diſtreſſe 2 chron 12 9 comfort himſelfe wearied saul purſuing yet grace may ſee hee time forgetting himſelfe ſore combat brake thus raſhneſſe ſaid ſhall one time fall saul wee ſhould looke 1 sam 27 1 ſtrong lord loueth v alſo lookes downe heauen ſee weake may ſtrong indeed wee 2 chron 16 9 ſee owne impotency ſhould lift vp heart cauſe v reach hand god mercy readineſſe v able helpe v ſhould bee enough v vnable ſoeuer wee bee beare burthen ſelues wee haue learned beleeue pſal 27 1 ſpeake lord light ſaluation ſhall feare lord ſtrength life ſhall afraid remember wee alſo apoſtle ſaid able doe thing maketh able againe phil 4 13 2 cor 12 10 reioyce mine infirmity weake ſtrong euen ſo fainting many trouble faith drawing deriuing god power vnto v haue good leaue yea commanded himſelfe doe may reſt quiet god diſappoint v reſpect apoſtle iames wille •• v bee greatlieſt comforted fall diuerſe tentations faith may tried ſound better gold bringing patience yet iam 1 3 lord v wee cling faith munition warlike furniture needed ſtrongeſt ſureſt helpe time peace ſhall able doe v good deliuerance reſt verſes end chapter firſt part chapter relapſe ſaid ehud dead though shamgar betwixt moſt likely hee ſhort time deliuerer vnto yet ehud deliuerer people though ſhort time appeareth laſt verſe former chapter firſt foure thing meane ſinne people iſrael verſ 1 againe committed ſo ſaid heere againe euill ſight lord vnderſtand ſeene former deliuerance alſo poſterity enioyed bleſſing phraſe manner ſpeech vttered holy ghoſt wit euill ſight lord ſpeake hauing handled twice ſinne let v conſider abuſed long enioyed peace reſt vnder ehud ſumme leaue right way ſeruing god encreaſed ſinne ſundry way indeed diſpoſition common practiſe doct verſ 1 men led gouerned god grace better proſperity much worſe aduerſity held downe diſabled much ſinne ſo reſtrained leaſt ſo way ſhut vp thence affliction ſo appetite much abated thereby alſo liberty peace abundance god benefit eaſily led enticed ſo ſet open doe readily walke vngouerned ſoone let looſe muſt know thus wicked onely euen ſuch haue ſometime vnder god direction euen ready forget themſelues yea moſt doe waxing bold breake meanes proſperitie ſame manner ſo fell dauid himſelfe hee ſubdued enemy vnder almoſt euery ſide euen heart deſire fell moſt dangerouſly great prouoking god iehoſaphat otherwiſe 2 sam 11 4 godly king hee lifted vp made drunke company fellowſhip wicked ahab ſore forget himſelfe ſo faine reproued lord prophet lamentable caſe bee ſo ſore oppreſſed either enemy 2 chro 19 2 croſſes life waxeth weariſome diſtreſſed eſtate cauſeth looke pity lord ſhall miſery haue compaſſion ſet large lamentable caſe ſay ſhould become ſo groſly vnthankfull forget late aduerſity ſoone manner god hath enlarged benefit ſhould thus vnnaturally may ſay diſguiſe themſelues euen would ſet themſelues grieue lord gladding comforting may thinke bee watchword v take heed vſe proſperity teach v make ſmall haſt made great world god preferment great wealth note commodity vnleſſe lay faſter hold grace wherby may vſe rightly bee humble vnder thereby forward fruitfull good may let v take heed ſeriouſly wee count happie ſelfe liue delicately ſeaſon whence commeth corrupt nature wee contemne others giue ſelues vanity pleaſures wantonneſſe delight ſome v alſo profit ſeeking gaine though neuer ſo filthy groſſe chiefe treaſure whereby godlineſſe decayes vſe leaſt power good meanes ſhould wee doe yee aske god giueth v ſuch wealthie comfortable outward eſtate ſay ſhould rich good 1 tim 6 12 tit 3 8 workes doe workes neceſſarie vſes oh men ſo well prouided good might bee done owne ſoules ſoules body brother point ala thing come may ſay griefe haue mind vſe liberty aright almoſt doe good duly conſidered ſhould cauſe wondrings ceaſe ſo godly chriſtians enioy great portion outward bleſſings compariſon ſo euen becauſe lord prouideth better thing hee giueth mediocritie maintenance credit account fauour better mixeth houre ſunſhine cloudy vnpleaſing weather keepe affection growing ranke intemperate containe within bound condition beſt fitteſt ſerue lord without loathing note wearineſſe earth ſtrong luſty runneth vp weede ſimile ſtalke well tilled compaſſed bringeth forth plentifull crop rare man whoſe fruites gratious conſtant moderate eſtate mighty cauſed wiſe man ſay neither much lord neither little ſhall runne extreame pro 30 8 vnthankfulneſſe diſcontentment doubtleſſe proſperity groweth ſo piety encreaſed withall loue giuer waxed ſtronger gift multiplyed waxe greater god would ſtint men hee doth cleare men beare exceſſe abundance kinde without notorious defect decay godly duty outward welfare body like ſplene cauſeth leaneneſſe euilfauouredneſſe ſoule moſt men vſe matter ſaid firſt foure thing contained chapter namely ſinne twenty fovre seron vpon fovtrh chapter booke ivdges ſecond part chapter firſt thing foure contained chapter haue heard followeth ſecond puniſhment verſ 2 ſo prouoked lord namely gaue ouer aduerſary fierce furious former one iabin king canaan raigned hazor ye may obiect ſuch one reſpects ſlaine ioſhua obiect much aboue hundred yeeres agoe thus wee reade booke ioſhua time ioſhua returned tooke hazor burnt ſmote ioſh 11 10 king thereof wit iabin edge ſword hazor time head city thoſe kingdomes anſwere ſo indeed anſw another name kindred riſen vp builded city againe growne ſtrong populous preuailed againſt iſrael held greater bondage cauſe euen might reuenged vpō predeceſſor father ioſhua others waſted ſlaine therefore oppreſſe much ſorer thought good ſay clearing difficulty proceed iabin king canaan deſcribed chiefe captaine siſera great warrier terrible whereby may know eaſe iſraelites reſtleſſe ſeruitude hope deliuerance deſperate new calamity thus brought vpon people omit ſaid puniſhment former example man would doct verſ 2 haue looked may obſerue ſee thing ſeeme quiet peaceable v think ſafe euery ſide ſo hurt befall v yet lord haue controuerſie v hee doth maruellous manner raiſe vp ſome great trouble againſt v yea ſparckles former affliction ſuſpect none hee heere thought haue quenchedlong agoe bringeth fire flame burne conſume v men thinke bee ſure god raiſeth vp vexation way one would looke amalekites taken ziclag lay drunken wallowing like beaſts fearing danger 1 sam 30 16 ſuddenly come vpon ſlaine apoſtle ſaith men cry peace thing ſafe ſhall ſudden deſtruction come vpon 1 eheſ 5 3 aware like trauell vpon woman child ſhall bee able auoide thus god ſeeth good tame raw licentiouſneſſe pride men maruellous ſay hee ſhould doe ſo liuing v one another beſt towne country would kicke vp heele yea notwithſtanding hee thus pluck downe note pride one euery day yet ſuch ſpared bee neuer better long viſitation plague hath ſwept away many thouſands moſt part better irreligious boldneſſe many age bee fauour better whoſe breath yet noſtrels haue wealth aboue common ſort nay bare health doe abuſe little doth good teaching diuerſe example god iudgements vpon ſundry others preuaile becauſe feele day reckoning put farre dreame haue priuiledge aboue others till effect confute v caſting downe babell drowning pharaoh army thruſting zimri cosby tent ſwallowing vp chorah company earth thouſands age paſt cut fearefull maner ſeuerall rebellion againſt lord lamentable ſpeake little abatement ſinne yet doe worke moſt nay worſe worſe liue theſe latter day haue heard ſeene iudgements former time therefore let ſuch v cannot confeſſe god hath done much v watch beware leſt like looſeneſſe bolddeſſe found v lord awake v hee ſeaze vpon v ſame plague theſe yet ſeeing quiuer full arrowes ſorts kind iudgements reſerue ſome v hath done others v come vpon v ſuddenly like manner iabin chiefe captaine armie siſera heere named opening latter part verſ 2 ſaid haue abode haroſheth gentile ſo called countrey full wood ſo word ſignifieth whereto vnto moſt ſafe well fenced place canaanite gentile fly repaire dwelt ſafely therein ſo many ſlaine ioſhuas day remained grew vp ſtrengthened themſelues vnto time heere mentioned thus growing vp cut god commanded people iſrael doe ſee vexation euen one generation canaanite corner land vnto beſide many diuers part ſee miſchiefe woe wee prouide ſelues doct 2 verſ 2 euen ſuch cannot bee knowne till come neglecting duty commended people iſrael heere ſuffering euill perſons foule vice grow vp among v might eaſily time haue ſubdued brought vnder ſay ſuffering wee haue full willing nouriſh could bee brought offer violence vnto haue cauſed ſorrow vpon ſorrow moſt weariſome vncomfortable day vnto v come would haue bought much coſt could thus anger impatience wrath vncharitableneſſe reuenge teachines frowardnes note lewd luſts vncleane deſires many like though wee haue thought worthie rebuke neither could bee brought deface diſgrace owne ſelues ſo might haue ouercome weakened v euen theſe haue maſtered v waxen ſtrong v enough disfigure godly life v marre beauty profeſſion beſides theſe ingender v bring forth litter open outward ſinnes al may eaſily know meane farre ſhamefull monſtrous themſelues third part chapter followeth third thing story namely repentance verſ 3 people ſet forth former chapter cry reaſons thereof added two one becauſe siſera nine hundred iron chariot wherwith continuall egreſſe regreſſe vexed ſore done thus twentie yeeres cry ſignifying repentance haue ſpoke alſo repentance father offered god afflicted conſidered heere ſpoken like occaſion ſaid twenty yeeres bondage doct repented turned god may behold monſtrous poyſoned diſpoſition nature ſtoope bow lord true humiliation vntil driuen maine force euen till ſhut note euery elſe wee ſee child ſtubborne nature neither checke rod breake ſtomacks nay ſtripes make cry rougher handling forced roare ſullennes til ſee remedy muſt receiue correction euill doings multitude ſtrokes ſmart feele breakes heart length make yeeld euen ſo v ſhould bee much wiſer whereas wee ſhould ſtep aſide little chriſtian courſe ought like willingneſſe mind ſtrayed returne riſe vp againe ſo prophet ieremy complaineth doth man fall ier 8 6 riſe againe goe way returne rebelliouſneſſe bad diſpoſition wicked onely leſſe bee maruelled let well conſidered ſhall found ſuch haue ſometime ſerued god truth loſe hold haue ſuffered wicked fleſh ſinfull nature get vpper hand againe oh hardly put poſſeſſion againe diuels ſaid sauiour chriſt thou art come torment v mat 8 29 time euer ſoone impriſonment wicked fleſh brought vnder lord wing againe put yoke though eaſie ſaid cauſe licentious diſſoluteneſſe ſo great account day ſorts ſo dimme light ſhineth ſhould bee light ſhould demanded god people keepe ſo long vnder gouernment ſo loth returne againe vnder anſwere partly confuſed knowledge ignorance forgetfulnes returne euer well grounded one cauſe partly lothneſſe vntowardneſſe fleſh bee pent ſeeking liberty rather amiſſe euen thus men haue ſhelter rotten helpeleſſe ſoeuer flie god much ſhifts ſerue muſt returne againe lord firſt husband ſaid hoſea let bee wiſe ſpeed returne hoſ 2 7 1 tim 6 6 make godlineſſe indeed greateſt rich chiefe ſtay ſeeing alwaies onely comfortable pſalme day pſal 84 11 better therein thouſand elſewhere ſeeing wee miſeries trouble people heere often fall ſighing ſorrowing yea murmuring fretting yet turne god ſinne bite bridle puniſhment yet laſt muſt bee brought vnwillingneſſe therefore ſhould take heed keepe profeſſion hope firmely wee may ſo yet wee haue fallen let v deſpaire yet delay turne god ſooneſt haue ſaid againe people many may learne good held vnder vnfolding part verſ 3 purſued nine hundred chariot iron alwaies going among vexe oppreſſe euery ſide plague great enough one would thinke euen mercy ſuch cruell prou 12 10 yet worſt befell god alſo againſt ſold hand thus ſo great miſery ſhould doe yet twentie yeeres eſtate ſhould able abide fearefull example theſe yet ſome belonging god good v take occaſion conſider eſtate vnder ſundry ſore great calamity lord ſending rebellion grieuous prouokings himſelfe frowning vpon ſhould haue comfort trouble oh ſhould grieue v behold perplexity vexation men otherwiſe haue god againſt alſo commeth neare ſaying woe alone herein dauid ſhewed himſelfe wiſe hee eccleſ 4 10 heard god meſſage lord concerning chuſing puniſhment anſwered let fall hand lord men 1 sam 24 14 reaſon becauſe knew himſelfe haue repented therefore iudgement lord would remember mercy oh terrible thing fall hand god enemie hand men hath giuen v vp pleaſure handled wee deſerue euery affliction ſharpe heauy god make ſo ſetting edge vpon preſſing downe conſcience vnder loade wrath conſider ſome particular example pouerty penurie many thouſands ſame poore knowledge god grace others marriage vnquiet thruſting one another doores note child cry neighbour diſquieted among going hauocke family god meane time alſo enemie heauie calamitie behold others bee taken captiues forren enemy sampſon put grinde worſe iudg 16 21 gallies worſt haue god flie diſtreſſe yet caſe many haue held head full high alſo farre enough owne conceit ſuch eſtate oh wofull ſore diſeaſed ſicke pained perſons ſhould bee added theſe miſerable one yet without god world theſe thus bee diſtreſſed haue mentioned ſuch like almoſt without number oh lamentable thinke whereas ſome theſe bee god child muſt know doe enemy make ſomewhat like bearing marke ſo wicked flie god hate ſmiting ſin ſo owne child hauing likewiſe prouoked ſhall oftentimes make ſlow haſt ill conſcience telling welcome till come another manner wit vnfained repentance haue ſpoken double end one perſwade labour aboue thing make god friend ſeeking reconciled thus trouble may haue refuge fly comfort moue ſuch free kind miſeries pitie vnder conſider ſeeing may goe lord without feare daily courſe life alſo ſuites c therefore ſhould deadly abhorre ſinne themſelues onely make feare power iuſtice much euer reioyced fauour ſo mourne whoſe miſery haue mentioned eſtate dreadfull damnable ſaid firſt three part chapter theſe three verſes wit ſinne people puniſhment repentance fourth part chapter fourth part ſtory followeth god deliuerance verſ 4 ſumme generall end hand siſera vnto end chapter deliuerance wrought ſaid helpe miniſtery chiefly three perſons mentioned afterwards chapter debora barak iael debora though woman ſtirred vp lord iudge iſrael declare god time extreame calamity vnto people anſwere doubt ſhould doe bee chiefe meane deliuerance counſell giuing encouraging barak reſt barak ſhould leade army purſue enemy ſmall armie people ouercome deſtroy iael killing great captaine enemy meane siſera owne hand due commendation among reſt diuerſly employed yet helping forward execution god iuſtice charge vpon huge armie canaanite people deliuerance bee ſaid generall whole worke followeth ſpoken chapter goe particular verſe verſe begin debora verſe 14 ſee ſhe firſt holy story deſcribeth verſe next secondly ſaid child iſrael came vp iudgement verſ 5 thirdly ſhewed ſhe ſaid barak hauing ſent verſ 6 7 ſhee anſwered barak ſhe ſaw forward verſ 9 laſt ſhe encouraged battell prepared themſelues ſides ſhewed verſe 14 deſcribed firſt extraordinarie place ſhe ſet wit ſhee propheteſſe ſecondly condition mariage ſhee wife lapidoth thirdly calling ſhe iudged iſrael fourthly dwelling vnder palmetree betweene ramath bethel mount ephraim woman two perſons mentioned haue ſaid god gaue new great deliuerance vnto people twentie yeeres bondage vnder iabin king canaan vnſpeakeable doct verſes following generall goodnes lord paſſing ſo great foule indignity ſo oft time wrought committed againſt doth yet better better confirme v haue taught lord ſo tenderly affected people hee cannot turne away eare prayer grones vnder heauie burthen pitie deliuer prophet ſaith mother ſhould forget bee hardhearted owne child yet lord cannot bee ſo doth iuſtly lay eſa 49 15 charge wilfulneſſe ſtifneckedneſſe many heape hote cole vpon head ſeeing may haue eaſe helpe oppreſſions miſeries asking praying without charge trouble cannot bring heart chuſe rather wilfully frowardly lie ſtill ſorrowes humble heart ſeeke god deliuerance god kinde ſo ſetteth himſelfe ſo end may harten embolden v beleeue ſame wee greateſt need moſt hardly perſwaded ſo doe great vnbeleefe v alſo ſheweth ſuch compaſſion v another reſpect euen wee ſhould alſo learne ſhew like goodneſſe kindneſſe brother calamity may ſo much better reſemble heere end twentie five sermon fovtrh chapter booke ivdges proceed beſides wee haue heard wee may note hereby weake vnlikely meanes god doct 1 verſ 4 deliuereth pleaſeth hee raiſed vp ehud man lame right hand deliuer people shamgar weapon ox goade thereto ſo vſed woman ſhee wife one lapidoth inſtrument effecting ſo great worke ouerthrow iabin ſhew power tied valiant mighty men leſt glory ſhould giuen alſo ſtrength force though hee allow vſed yet truſted wee put confidence ſtrong rocke againſt ſtrongeſt enemy prouerbs 18 10 prayer auaile much bee feruent iam 5 16 requireth ſtraitely beleeued v ſo hee vſeth doe 2 chron 20 alſo deliuerance people ſoules bondage satan hell meane men thoſe bee great note wealth preferment hee ſubdueth heart mighty piercing breaking powerfull force preaching wil
