husband doubt man good note though v vnknowne theſe thing ſay ſeeing nothing ſet downe vaine holy story may ſeeme vſe time wee ſee may truly ſay many thing therein contained ſhould ſomewhat ſatisfie reader hee ſeeth ſo much ſome place doth another yet holy ghoſt ſets downe many circumſtances oftentimes fuller credit hiſtorie eſpecially elſe might ſeeme queſtionable time place name c ſo giue light thing handled onely let content v dwelling allowed though ſhe propheteſſe married doct verſ 5 perhaps ſome note expreſſely ſpoken ſet downe ſo may ſerue aſſure v god doth ſame ſuch day ſame condition ſeruing honeſt good heart miniſterie meane hee alloweth place liue good contentment euen ſuch hee ſeeth fitteſt though popiſh clergie ſome alſo count vnmeete liue rather worthie rooted earth thus much ſaid child iſrael went vp iudgement doct 2 verſ 5 meane debora ſpirit prophecie anſwered doubt determined controuerſies declared god might better doe duty concerned conſider louing kindnes lord might euen oppreſſion king canaan haue one anſwere doubt troubled ſo age much hath prouided ſuch make queſtion thing troubleth may anſwered ſatisfied ſhe one perſon woman accounted ſingular fauour god deny mercie god v haue ſolemne publike aſſemblies one place land many ſinne ſome perſons ſhould haue throughout place teach god wilfull negligent may learne know lord greateſt leaſt alſo thing belong peace thus ſay may priuatly vnburthen ſelues doubtfull dangerous opinion trouble conſcience wee may god thanked many way oh priuiledge theſe thing ought ſo much moue v admiration loue god giuer becauſe falſe religion worſhipping god papacie ſuch thing looked enioyed ſeruing god compact fancy dreames lie inuentions men dunghill full filthines droſſe relieuing conſcience ſuch diſtreſſed diſquieted much comfort miniſtred either parſons directorie meditation frier granatenſis yet ſauour moſt reſt pietie poore traytor iudas found hand prieſts complaining cry ſinned betraying innocent blood anſwered vnmercifull manner ſuch looke thou ſhould haue ſaid though ſet worke ſhift thy ſelfe comfort thou ſhalt haue v returne though god hath euery way prouided well v inſtructed ſoundly graciouſly relieued comforted haue ſaid yet lamented many v glutted good meanes wee haue ſuffer lie v ruſting euen thereafter good fruite bring foorth liues thereby verſ 6 ſhe ſent called barak ſonne abinoam kedeſh naphtali ſaid vnto hath lord god iſrael commanded ſaying goe draw toward mount tabor take thee ten thouſand men child naphtali child zebulon verſ 7 draw vnto thee riuer kiſhon siſera captaine iabins armie charets multitude deliuer thine hand verſ 8 barak ſaid vnto thou wilt goe goe thou wilt goe goe verſ 9 ſhe anſwered ſurely goe thee iourney thou takeſt ſhall thine honour lord ſhall ſell siſera hand woman debora aroſe went barak kedeſh haue heard deſcription debora ſhe followeth meaning theſe foure verſes ſhe went worke great buſineſſe lord againſt iabin therefore god commanded ſent barak deſcribed text ſonne abinoam hee ſhould goe furniſh himſelfe tenne thouſand men aſſured god would giue victorie ouer siſera captaine iabins armie ouer multitude barak firſt feared beleeued went forward worke ſeeing afraid vnbeliefe therefore refuſed goe without ſhe found fault told god would puniſh ſo ſhould haue honour otherwiſe ſhould haue barak debora went kedeſh together thus much meaning theſe foure verſes theſe debora barak order firſt meſſage ſixth ſeuenth verſes followed vpon two following debora firſt holy storie ſetteth downe ſhe ſent meſſage particularly ſixth ſeuenth verſes god barak adding thereto promiſe victorie ioyne together ſeeing wee may cleerely ſee wee haue learne thereby point ſpeech namely commandement god barak promiſe good ſucceſſe ioyntly giue reader marke theſe two thing principall motiues reaſons perſwade leade v moſt action doct 1 verſ 6 7 end may rightly effect bring paſſe namely commandement god promiſe bleſsing ſay moſt principall reaſons leade v moſt action action much ſome free indifferent done left vndone v thus guided namely vſe part libertie thing indifferent ſhall due conſideration find tend moſt glorie god owne inward peace edifying leaſt offence god people otherwiſe haue ſaid thing forbidden commanded god let v take direction accordingly haue heard harten ſelues ſhunne forbidden obey contrary incouraged promiſe bleſſing annexed moſt bleſſed comfortable direction god ſeruants day ſhall likewiſe end world hath carried father forth moſt difficult workes part liues moſes going pharaoh fetch people iſrael grieuous bondage pharaoh would agree exod 3 11 12 encouragement hee hereto verily euen god ſaid goe haue commanded thee againe thee bring paſſe ſame ioſhuas authority hartening guiding ſame people land promiſe rooting idolatrous nation euen word lord ſpeaking thus vnto ariſe goe ouer iordan thou people vnto ioſh 1 25 land giue moſes ſo bee thee leaue thee neither forſake thee paul vpholding ſtay throughout place whither went preaching ſo corinth hee great danger thus lord ſaid viſion night feare paul ſpeake hold thy peace thee act 18 9 man ſhall lay hand thee hurt thee haue much people city ſame may ſay many ſame commandement promiſe god wee guided ſtill proſper like well life way life faith ſo highly commended scripture note ſaid iuſt ſhall liue faith wee ſubiect ſame diſcouragements heb 10 38 like age paſt ſo may ſee wee haue ſame need bee ſtrongly vpholden ſoundly encouraged though bee doubted many doe ſee haue learned thus guided action liue comfortably ſo much bee lamented infinite perſons know ſuch eaſie plaine way guide neither bee brought led carnall reaſon prophane cuſtome action life neither bee brought ſtoop note ſubmit themſelues ſuch gouernment god hath ſeene beſt meanes whereof going liketh beſt looking god requireth doe good thing promiſeth therfore doe ſo pleaſed therewith wit becauſe hee commandeth note much leſſe end ſuch mind ſhould bee done encouraged promiſe therefore haue many plague liues following owne deſires way falleth better proſper world yet haue ſound comfort thing doe apply affaire men calling therfore ſay one thing thee whoſoeuer thou art wouldeſt liue comfortably try working doctrine thee looke one weeke thy calling faithfully diſcharge duty conſcionably note ſo farre thou haſt knowledge endeauour obey commandements god firmely perſwaded promiſe god thee thou art ſafe ſo walking hath annexed promiſe bleſſing obeying euery commandement yea hundred fold thou forgoeſt thereby thou wilt aske ſhalt thou know god doth reward thee ſo anſwere bee thou iudge thy ſelfe deale ſo thee example let caſe thou wilt ſay thou wert tied ſo ſtrictly obey god thou couldeſt take thy pleaſure merrie company benefit thy ſelfe men doe gaine get commodity whereas thou tied make conſcience dareſt doe ſo muſt loſe forgo much thereby heare thee heare thou likewiſe thou confeſſeſt profit pleaſure thou forgoeſt obeying god vnlawfull againſt conſcience otherwiſe holdeth note thee put caſe thou haſt ſo gotten god vrge cauſe thy conſcience prick thee thou beeſt wounded therein ſtingeth worſe hornet ſo god doth one time make men ſinne ſmart ſting committers moſt painfull ſort worſe leaues hardened thou knoweſt meaneth beleeueſt ſay thee wouldeſt thou giue healed intolerable paine euen thou haſt much ſoeuer ſigne thee loſing thy ſoule vtterly thou perſiſt therein ſhall profit man winne whole world loſe ſoule mat 16 26 thou fiſheſt golden hooke loſt recompenſed thou catcheſt therewith anſwere mee haddeſt thou voide rid terrour taſt hell thou haddeſt auoided reſiſted thy ſinne mighteſt thou haue quiet merrie god ſeruants thou haddeſt obeyed lord tell would thy mirth quietneſſe haue hundred fold better welcome thee thy profit pleaſure hath brought thee helliſh torment conſcience wound ſting taketh away delight thee ſo deliuerance thou wouldeſt giue thou haſt therefore know god giue hundred fold profit eaſe pleaſure thee euen life thou obeyeſt doeſt thing ſake ouer thou ſhalt find making thy beſt gaine thy ſinne muſt remember ſelfe haue bin long point mat 19 29 adde bee bewailed heauenly wiſedome ſo little note entreth men preuaileth ala haue leiſure thinke reckoning middeſt iollity alſo worthy noting siſera flouriſhing doct verſ 7 iollity lord threatens take downe bring low ſaith lord barak draw vnto thee chiefe captaine iabins army chariot whole hoſt riuer kiſhon deliuer thine hand oh fearefull eſtate god enemy euen ſuch euill worker ſet againſt god people middeſt pompe pride lord hath taken name though another manner another end name recuſants taken anſwere euen may reuenged hath common vſe ſuch chorah naball iezabell many others walked heere earth liberty deſtruction told heauen bee hand ſummoned appeare eccleſ 11 1 arraignment ſome neither many doe know commeth neither dreame ſuch thing feare yet ſeeing euer comming hauing threatened ſo hangeth ſword point continually ouer head oh vncomfortable thinke vpon oh therefore alwaies vnder wing abide loue ſo may euer horrour feare god doth marke v enemy miſerable condition vnbeleeuers alwaies vnleſſe hardened far worſe ſaid anger kindled little euer toward great deale pſal 2 12 happie feare would therefore bee bad perſon way ſhun euen cauſe whereas yet terror heere glimps thoſe follow afterwards contrarily note ſhould godly content beare ſome hardneſſe heere ſeeing freed greateſt terrours know liberty heere heereafter ſomewhat like ſpake eglons example ſhould proceed ſpeake barak hauing begun debora ſaid occaſioned text ſhould haue time thereto ſermon therefore end heere twentie sixe sermon fovrth chapter booke ivdges haue heard deboras meſſage barak two verſ 8 former verſes followeth baraks anſwere meſſage eighth verſe ſaith hee thou wilt goe goe elſe anſwere ſeemes yeeld little god commandement ſent deboras miniſtery neither aſcribe thing god promiſe therefore ſhewes profited thoſe two ſtrong peſwaſions leade duty mentioned proues hee aſcribed preſence god promiſe could leſſe great blemiſh heb 11 32 may bee ſeene amending fault afterwards whoſe faith ſo highly renouned among worthy epiſtle hebrues beſide ſhe offended ſo anſwering therefore doubtleſſe infidelity bee asked hee afterward ſo highly commended faith anſwere meſſage came firſt thing enioyned god deboras meſſage ſeemed moſt full difficulty commanded make commotion rebell againſt king ouer wit iabin great mighty alſo charged gather armie men together though hee priuate man himſelfe theſe thing therefore take hand againſt ſuch fierce ſtrong captaine siſera made afraid ſet vpon ſuch worke eſpecially vnexperienced ſo great triall difficulty cauſe hee could beleeue except ſhee went god would deliuer men warre hand afterward weighing better commandement god promiſe god ſpirit aſſiſting hee beleeued word debora obeyed ſo obtained victory faith ſaid forementioned place hebrues vſually falleth commeth paſſe euen godly firſt doe ſtagger doubt ſoone faith quailed beleeue ſtrong reliques old adam man god hath proofe yet afterward ſtrengthened ſpirit god recouer themſelues againe note beleeue confidently apparent dauid euen beleeued ſaying lord waſh mee throughly cleanſe wholly filthy pſal 51 2 10 againe create new ſpirit old vtterly loſt alſo moſes firſt commanded goe pharaoh fearefull exod 3 11 compared 10 26 hearing meſſage hee ſhrunke backe afterward boldly execute ſame deliuer vnto euen note ſo beſt v heare death deare friend great loſſes befallen v alſo beginning great ſickneſſe paine arreſting v oh doe faint diſtruſt ſhall neuer ſubmit ſelues yeeld obediently though god command v ſtraitly pſal 37 3 doe ſo caſt eye burthen croſſe thing ſeene apoſtle ſpeaketh wee 1 cor 4 laſt yet come ſelues looke vp god confidence thing ſeene eternall weigh come loueth v therefore cannot intend hurt ſubmit ſelues god ſtay vpon grace go vnder waite patiently good iſſue becauſe heart ariſe oft time againſt brother ſee theſe weakeneſſes begin iudge thinke hardly ſame lord therefore letteth v ſometimes ſee ſame ſuch ſelues ſo wee may learne beare infirmity wee haue experience cauſeth v bewaile tenderly gal 6 1 weakneſſes ſee brother ſpirit meekneſſe helpe hold vp rather cenſure ouer ſharply ſame deepely bewailed ſee farre many duty behalfe though otherwiſe religious ſuch loue truth frō herts ouercome deadly cōceits againſt brethrē ſee haue fallen infirmity ſtrongly incenſed againſt note leaue thē themſelues neuer telling kindly ſee thē ouercome impatience teaſtineſſe anger zeale feruency ſeruing god ſlaked abated offenſiuely taken vp carried away world theſe like confeſſe ruſt cauſes raiſe griefe v much diſliked v eſpy ſuch well thought v blemiſhes borne allowed yet wee ſhall ſee ſuch thing wee muſt beware wee cenſure hardly hath giuen v authority iudge cry vncharitably religion though cannot bee denied diuell hath watching opportunitie got aduantage ouer yet vntractable deceiued ſo offending yet part liues holding care pleaſe god labouring keepe good conſcience muſt ſome one ſuch weaknes fall ſuch hard iudging depart vtterly againſt charitie dutie think ſo many ſnares intangle men may eaſily enough ſo wee may ſee ſelues blinded ſelfeloue like trial doe without ſpecial grace heed taking auoid like falles therfore muſt hope may yea ſhal doubt god helpe ariſe grow good ſort againe yet doe ſpeake though would iuſtifie ſuch offence liues god people though went ſalue vp gentle word know ſuch breach ſuffered paſſe liues otherwiſe religious doe much hurt example themſelues quenching ſpirit ſpecially defended continued long vnconfeſſed renounced may forgiuen yet behold muſt wiſely ſhun extremity iudging one ſide well haue ſaid condemne perſons allow ſins common profeſſors ſee ſuch frailty appeare forwarder ſort chriſtians begin pleaſe themſelues therein condemne good part ſay ſtumble thereat themſelues walke groſſenes ſhall time ſee themſelues guiltie farre greater horrible ſinnes ſtill goe forward condemning inſulting ouer ſhall doe owne confuſion occaſion baraks diſtruſt particularly alſo let baraks anſwere clinging ſo debora teach god people wiſdome ouermuch giue place affection doct 1 verſ 8 euen thing lawful ſubmit themſelues god pray ſtrength reſt therein ſeemed equall commendable requeſt barak deſire companie aduice direction debora ſo generall hee ſaw god hee ſhould depend immediatly vpon ſucceſſe ſaw againe weaknes ſo much depend vpon preſence although ſo commendable thing men cleaue miniſtery aſſiſtance faithfull guide continue among yet eſpieth owne weakenes childiſhnes cleaueth neere vnto thinking without hee ſhall miſcarrie cannot bee vpholden without let checke himſelfe labour ſuch ſtrength knowledge faith may inable go vpon owne feete liue owne faith depending directly vpon god promiſe vholding preſeruing middeſt diſcouragements feares weaknes without ſuch meanes may enioy ſome barak aſcribe much miniſter god true many deſpiſing nothing regarding miniſterie men grow ſhiftles ſhameles farre hope happineſſe voide grace goodneſſe followeth ſpeech debora barak made forementioned anſwere vnto wit would goe vnleſſe ſhe went verſe 9 ſhe ſaid go thee ſhall thine honour wherein ſhe findeth fault tels hee ſhould ſuffer puniſhment infidelitie glorie might otherwiſe haue thereby ſhould giuen woman meaning iael leaſt part ſelfe whereby ſomewhat may noted generally particularly firſt may learne may v much good wit god puniſh v ſome way vnbeliefe doct verſ 9 wee ſee god doth put vp men hand ſuch ſinnes named former verſe eſpecially come knowledge frailtie ſee doe amiſſe yet note blind ſelfeloue finde fault ſelues ſame extenuate hide ſinne god therefore ſpared zacharias vnbeliefe though otherwiſe righteous man made dumbe luke 1 • ſeaſon telleth v much pſalme ſaith mine owne child breake ſtatutes keepe commandements viſite pſal 8 • 31 tranſgreſsion rod iniquitie ſtrokes although take louing kindneſſe like ſeene moſes becauſe diſtruſted lord ſmiting rocke bare ſcarre thereof death denied entrance land canaan ioaſh diſtruſting eliſhas meſſage ſmiting earth thrice rebuked 2 king 13 prophet would haue found fault bidden ſmite oftner thou ſhouldeſt ſaith haue ſmitten fiue ſixe time ſo thou ſhouldeſt vtterly haue deſtroyed aram thou ſhalt ſoile thrice ſo ſhall get ſtrength againe reuenge themſelues euen ſo doe ſuch feele finde regard lord ſaith vnto neither giue credit word much ſuch giue bridle groſſely vnruly paſſions ſhould man would thinke cauſe v ſhunne ſuch boldnes god prouoke make v ſmart ſame alſo ſhould make v beare infirmity brother much wee ſee god correcteth ſame ſhall wee alſo adde ſorrow ſorrow wee ought rather haue compaſſion pitie noted generall particularly ſeeing barak puniſhed loſing glorie doct • verſ • ſhould haue vnbeliefe teacheth v glorie good name report reckoned among good thing godly perſon may deſire glad enioy nay hee ſhould enſue becauſe token god approbation people report well v ſeeing taught ſame ſpirit diſcerne like therefore iohn probable argument proueth demetrius • ioh 11 good man becauſe good report bee lamented god alloweth doe deſire alſo deſerue fruites loue toward church note arrogant diſſolute perſon ſcorne good opinion brother conceiue euen precious oyntments knowne ſmell ſo godlie chriſtian ſauour good name eſpecially place dwelleth beſt knowne indeed principall care ſhould giue lord due praiſe elſe beguile deceiue men cauſing thinke well v much doe dangerouſly deceiue ſelues well regarded looked vnto next place let care church god may giue v allowance ſee iuſt cauſe report well v ſaid zacharie wife luke 1 6 iuſt god toward men vnreproueable therfore good report cornelius good name among iewes glorie act 10 22 good name certaine good opinion eſtimation conceiued man well thoſe thing good men doe vertuouſly well doe purchaſe commendation glorie vnto end ought vſe direct good report namely aduancing name god alſo giue good example following v end good ſo good alſo procured therefore although good name bee bee ſought ſelfe though thing wee chiefly intended reſted yet deſpiſed thoſe end haue mentioned namely glorifying god edification brother end verſe let briefly added debora yeelding doct 3 verſ 9 helping weaknes barak going teacheth v thus regard helpe incourage weake brother counſell trauaile example verſ 10 barak called zebulun naphtali kedeſh hee went vp feete tenne thouſand men debora went vp verſ 11 heber kenite child hobab father law moſes departed kenites pitched tent vntill plaine zaanaim kedeſh verſ 12 ſhewed siſera barak ſonne abinoam gone vp mount tabor verſ 13 siſera called charets euen nine hundred charets yron people haroſheth gentile vnto riuer kiſhen theſe foure verſes holy ghoſt ſheweth ſides prepare army barak siſera accompanied debora kedeſh gathered together ten thouſand men tribe naphtali zebulun mount tabor writer called alſo ithaberins farre kedeſh went foote place neere border aſher naphtali zebulon mount hath neere riuer kiſhon prophet elia killed prieſts baall note better vnderſtanding ſtory al place mentioned wit kedeſh plaine zaanaim mount tabor neere ioyning together riuer kiſhon barak siſera hearing preparation bazak alſo make ready armie mentioned ſaue nine hundred charets yron ioſephus ſaith thirtie thouſand footman tenne thouſand horſemen canaanite three thouſand charets howſoeuer ſure hee made mightie preparation therewith came riuer kiſhon preparation ſides mentioned theſe foure verſes briefe ſtorie put dwelling heber kenite ſonne hobab moſes father law pitched tabernacle god prouidence come dwel nigh riuer kiſhon part border kedeſh brought ſhall appeare better afterward verſ 18 chiefe thing verſe bee noted faith wherein theſe agreed conſented ſpoken mentioned meane barak armie debora tooke hand moſt hard work againſt ſo fierce captaine siſera ſo well prouided appointed iabin king ouer canaanite would haue ſaid preparation againſt iſraelites muſt need reaſon man haue wrought vtter ouerthrow ſure ouercome handfull many weake alſo enemy ſtrong bin moſt cruelly barbarouſly handled notwithſtanding perſwaded ſet worke god ſo power went tooke hand caſting eye vpon difficulty diſparagements way againſt god beleeued would ſtand giue victorie indeede doct verſ 10 right propertie faith thus doe look vp god hath commanded take hand promiſed bleſſing thereto ioh 14 1 meanes abraham father beleeuers forſooke owne heb 11 8 countrey went whither god ſent kindred knowing ſhould finde place whither went moſes choſe rather ſuffer affliction people god wilderneſſe heb 11 24 enioy pleaſures ſinne ſeaſon houſe phaeraos daughter scripture ſaith faith thus walles iericho ioſ 6 20 fall downe god promiſed ſeuenth day end people beleeuing ſhould ſo compaſſing time blowing trumpet rammes horne god commanded ſhould intend looke doe goe faith alſo theſe worthie perſons name commended commendation ſaith eleuenth hebrewes able carrie v well euer difficulty haue eye charge giuen v promiſed reward although ſee nothing bodily eye againſt v matter diſcouragement ſo apoſtle iohn ſaith ſaith ouer commeth world euen difficulty 1 ioh 5 4 faith ſetled great promiſe ſaluation afterward fitter apprehend lay hold theſe temporarie promiſes life iewell inualuable price occupied exerciſed ſo conſtant care wee matter leſſe waight needleſſe vnprofitable ſhould able ſay much benefit commeth haue neere acquaintance god helpe faith ſeeing haue ſpoken matter bee briefer though wee cannot heare often good ground word occaſion offered while thus commending bararks faith thinkes heare ſo obiecting laſt thing ſpoken ninth verſe vnbeleefe hee therefore ſay ſo ſuddenly brought ſuch change anſwere though barak hindred vnbeleefe yet afterward hee recouered himſelfe wee ſee heere god giuen better conſideration charge enioyned promiſe made vnto haue failed beleeuing difficulty wee ſee raſhneſſe yet let v weigh god promiſe duly ſo beleeue hartily better ſtayed good conſideration end let none ſit downe like tyred perſon giue ouer hold hope ſaying ſee good precious mee enioy ſhould neuer able beleeue c ſo let thy want encreaſe thy thirſt dauids pſal 51 deſire bee enlarged pſal 51 2 3 pray lord helpe vnbeleefe remember weakeneſſe may forgiuen ſtriuing againſt wilfulneſſe prepoſterous inuincible vnbeleefe damnable god lookes bee credited ioh 3 1 • vpon word promiſe oath beſides many experiment haue ſelues yet men weake became ſtrong god bare baraks infirmity heere yeelding debora ſhould goe ſo tender helpe weake faith many way ſee encourage v thus much ſaid twentie seaven sermon fovrth chapter booke ivdges let v note verſe ioynt agreement doct 2 verſ 10 theſe heere mentioned meane debora barak ten thouſand zebulun nephtali eſpecially ſo needful ſhould ſo conſent together good worthie thing ſeruants god ioyne bee like minded good thing though doe directly tend owne profit earthly benefit ſo much common good behoofe al people many town family commendation gift free conſent together many good people clearely ſeene apoſtles thoſe kept company ſaid altogether one mind cauſed saint paul make ſo earneſt requeſt philippian act 2 10 remoue contention pride whereby conſent agreement eaſily broken wee know eaſie matter many ioyne agree together reaſon ſo much contrariety men mind one ſo ready croſſe withſtand eſpecially good thing satan ſubtill malitious policy working therewith gaineth much diſtraction diſagreement paul barnabas may ſeene therfore ſought laboured alwaies loue wiſedome godly teacher doctrine perſwaſions good example doe much helpe heereto thus debora barak preuailed theſe ten thouſand drew worke ioyntly two perſons oh agreement good thing like either beauty delight pſalmiſt ſpeaketh behold good pleaſant thing men dwell together pſal 133 1 godly vnity experience teacheth ſame many vniting force couroge wiſdome one doe eaſily reſiſt common enemy harder owne corrupt paſſions rebellious nature euill miſchiefe carryeth infinite broyles ſutes quarrel controuerſies almoſt place truly teſtifie louing kind agreement betwixt themſelues doe ſubmit themſelues word god whereby become meeke humble ſo eaſily conſent good want godly agreement contrary readineſſe men breake one againſt another hath oft cauſed mee bewaile ſeeth great cauſe ſo boyſterous fierce contention many thoſe onely common ſort moſt part rude ignorant alſo counted brother yet doe ſo readily let looſe heart bitter contention raſh iudgings brother doe worſe yet greater madneſſe ſmail cauſe doe diſſent opinion iudgement one another thing indifferent wherein follow light knowledge whereby giue great teſtimony little know themſelues aright haue full ſlightly ſearched themſelues ſee many ranke corruption ſelfe loue priuie pride frowardneſſe impatience vncharitableneſſe ſuch like ſwarme beare ſway beſtow ſmall coſt vpon themſelues time find fault owne doings wit farre rule charity ſo may become humble peaceably minded toward others nay worſe hold vnchriſtian conceit iudgings brother ſo ſtrongly wilfully verifie prouerbe making bitter contention like bar palace cannot bee broken like city ſtrong well fenced cannot eaſily bee beaten downe farre godly agreement prou 18 19 conſequently harty louing together ſhould bee like threefold cord eaſily broken sauiour ſaith ſure eccleſ 4 12 token diſciples indeed agreement euill ſuch pſalme hurtfull odious ioh 13 35 pſal 2 1 2 common though hand ioyne hand wicked ſhall eſcape vnpuniſhed prou 11 21 ſo leaue adding agreement euill leſſe committed therefore wee need pray lord ſend ſpirit diuiſion among ſuch betwixt phariſies sadduces ſo much miſchiefe may preuented rather ſtabliſhed preparation debora barak made followeth come siſera ſhort ſtory heber huſband verſ 11 vnfolding iael put way wit poſterity hobab moſes father law remoued kindred brother ſaw cap 1 verſ 16 come kedeſh dwell barak aſſembled men warre place god prouidence directing ſent appeares afterward verſ 17 thereby hee might iael hebers wife cut great enemie siſera may learne right profitable leſſon goe heere ſimplicity earthly dwelling ſerue god prouidence word doct verſ 11 leadeth v god moſt caſuall action direct regard bleſſe v ſo time ſhall ſee ſo though knew ſhould come paſſe heber remoued dwelling kindred hatred ſaw moſt conuenient though true intended thereby deſtruction siſera neither came ſuch thing mind lord purpoſed appointed meanes comming dwell ſhould brought paſſe heber onely conſidering aduiſedly bethinking himſelfe beſt ſetling dwelling ſeeking liue among god people looking ſelling ioſeph ſtrange countrey thing likelihood gen 45 8 tending vndoing yet manifeſt hee told brother god ſent preſerue poſterity aliue iacob ſent away rebecca mother padan aram auoide gen • 8 2 • wrath brother eſau cauſe good hee went vncertaine ſhould befall ſtrange land therefore hee thought vowed might haue bread eate clothes put god would keepe iourney ſhould god meaning ſhould bee ſtrongly confirmed ſo counting therefore god guided iourney bleſſed greatly ſo returned hee remembred god benefit hee ſince beſtowed ſaying came ouer iordan ſtaffe poore gen 32 10 without prouiſion haue gotten two band moſes married iethros daughter liuing obſcurely wilderneſſe ſuffering affliction people god would haue thought good ſhould haue come thereby yet beſide admirable deliuering iſraelites pharaoh bandage alſo meane draw iethros poſterity religion true worſhip god thereby euen ſo offer ſelues vnder god gouernment thing ſhall bee time directed good end though ſee yet wee ſhall ſo wee may bold ſay bring ſo paſſe bee knowne wander heere earth yet darkeneſſe others neither caſt orphan left deſolate god careth 1 pet 3 2 1 tim 4 10 v faithfull one otherwiſe doth reſt world ſo v though wee ſee mind purpoſe god toward v particular firſt fall courſe liues yet wee ſure ſpeciall prouidence watcheth ouer v good ſo need doubt god directeth thing end wonderfull ſtay beleeuing people without faith ſound knowledge vſe thereof god doings ſtrange v ſee iſſue ſometime afterward alſo namely croſſes affliction diſtaſted v vtterly vnwelcome ſo benefit neuer receiued v good ſort right end namely make v truſt firmely cleaue conſtantly whereas ſhould much moued hereby commit ſucceſſe vnto till experience haue brought rom 5 4 hope ſhall make v aſhamed need bee doubt watcheth v thus clinging ſleepe vpholdeth v prou 6 22 wee walke propoſeth good towards v euen wee ſee likelihood thereof thus v vnprofitable conſider ill goeth thoſe reſt vpon blind fortune call goe ſtrength carnall wiſedome looking great matter vaine little nothing acquainted god prouidence lamentable ſee ſuch toſſed vexed vnſetled care ſorrowes moſt vncertaine doubtfull affaire alſo thoſe ſure certaine thinke imagine beſides vnprofitable v marke another thing ſhort doct 2 ſtory ſeeing heber remoued dwelling apart reſt brother kenites vpon good conſideration otherwiſe holy ſtory would haue found fault reſt departing iericho dwelling tribe iuda iudg 1 16 border heard chap 1 ſay heber thus yet cleare ſtory offend god therein wee ſee vnlawfull people god ſettle dwelling apart neighbour kindred brother profeſſion may fal meet ſo god hath appointed faithfull ſhould dwel together neither ſometime ſundry conſiderations reſpects reade abraham lot reaſon great abundance cattell want paſture departed one another euen poſterity grew multiplied one familie married diſperſed diuerſe many thing doe cauſe indeed wee may dwell together god people place beſt choice neglected deſired hartily many ſhall hindred neceſſity liberty may bee enioyed v let v make pretious reckoning ſet ſelues liue together kindly profitably peaceably many regard doe cannot bee without great inconuenience let v ſtriue againſt god gaine nothing thereby know god hath appointed done v another place may bee wee may bring ſome god remouing bee ſeated among ſuch ſhall bee like ſelues may good conuerſation ſhall ſee turned vnto v two thing ſhould principally aime endeauour vnto muſt change remoue dwelling followeth ſhort degreſſion haue heard verſ 12 13 barak prepared furniſhed himſelfe warre ſo told siſera done hee prepared army likewiſe hee heard barak done ſo power meane great feareful haue ſhewed already haue heere principally note addreſſing himſelfe battel difference betwixt one ſide debora barak thouſands prepared themſelues warre ſee theſe went god commandement hee pride owne heart without god truſted promiſe god victory owne ſtrength note great army went againſt god enemy againſt god friend yea againſt god himſelfe whereby may ſee much auaileth haue doct verſ 12 13 good cauſe maintaine haue god goe v therein many example scripture teſtifie warres godly king idolater good cauſe defence goſpell true worſhip god chriſtian prince againſt ſuch would force poperie falſe worſhip open warre alſo maintaining owne dominion bound right great waighty matter recouering vniuſtly detained chriſtian prince theſe ſuch like caſes may make warre command people againſt enemie ſo may ſay like leaue inſtance lay doctrine another familiar common ſort manifeſt like found among v peace wit haue good cauſe controuerſies bad manifeſt ſay one ſort hath great encouragement goodneſſe cauſe follow rather hath none much againſt theſe encouragement moſt barak haue ſpoken animate men duty ſo ſay ſucceſſe bleſſing particularly ſhall follow vſe ſhall moſt certainly reape great fruit thereby abundantly one way therefore good reaſon ſuch ſhould doe lord worke diligently contrariwiſe could bee made conſider goe following bad matter ſhould neuer dare hold proceed doe wit ås siſera defend ill cauſe would feare goe forward deſiſt attempt good bad goe worke alike theſe heere outward preparation like manner like minde like end although siſera wilfully pride heart gone againſt iſrael becauſe god people pharaoh although hee bee properly charged conſulting god weighin cauſe going againſt god people ala heathen therefore ignorant ſuch matter yet ſpeake beſt may ſaid hee truſted chariot horſes ſouldiers munition thereby purpoſing maine force reduce rebellious iſraelites hee counted yoake obedience knew alſo god people indeed wonder tooke courſe curſed canaanite ſuch one leaue come nearer ſelues admirable among v viſible church ſhould bee found ſome enterpriſes life dealing maintaine euill cauſe one againſt barak siſera though action ciuill religious exerciſes ſame outward reſpect appeare little difference ſome yet ſo prophane vnconſcionable many hold righteous abomination deface phariſies chriſts beſt action ſee difference betwixt owne others pleaſe themſelues thus ſay tuſh preciſe ſeeme▪ doe follow trade buy ſell eate drinke marrie c reade pray heare word receiue sacrament c oddes therefore betwixt v yes ſhall two field mat 24 40 mill yet one receiued forſaken one reprobate choſen surely differ end ſo differ meanes vſing leade thereto though differ dying outward manner yet differ one dieth happily miſerably ſo doe affection differ deſires hope encouragement ſucceſſes one asketh ſhew pſal 4 7 8 v good prayeth lord lift vp light thy countenance vpon v v abundance light knowledge direction grace aſſiſtance thereto godly man walketh looking promiſe lawfull attempt knowing alſo lord light guide bee defence alſo vphold proſper pſal 84 13 bleſſe walkes darkeneſſe led erronious opinion ſenſe example nature ſometimes ſhame feare proud confidence himſelfe therefore goeth many danger ſmarts ſorrowes whether croſſed whether haue deſire hee reeleth alſo ſtumbleth egyptian darkeneſſe ouerſpread iſraelites walked ſafety liberty word one ſerueth god diuell one cheerefull patient confident contrary minde carriage therefore let euery man deſireth approued god iudge himſelfe others ſuch haue ſpoken doe ſame action though wee know mind let v conceiue beſt ſo farre charity may yet let v ſuſpend ſentence allowance till longer triall knowledge acquaintance conſider yee reade ſay lord giue vnderſtanding haue ſaid wicked incenſed againſt righteous deed good owne euill conſiſteth great difference betwixt true chriſtian counterfait lay ſorts together good conſideration ſhall appeare scripture heere end twenty eight sermon fovtrh chapter booke ivdges verſ 14 debora ſaid vnto barak vp day lord hath deliuered siſera thine hand lord gone thee barak went downe mount tabor tenne thouſand men verſ 15 lord deſtroyed siſera charets hoſt edge ſword barak ſo siſera lighted downe charet fled away feete verſ 16 barak purſued charets hoſt vnto haroſheth gentile hoſt siſera fell edge ſword man left haue heard former verſes ſides barak ſumme theſe three verſes meane siſera addreſſed themſelues battell theſe come neerely intent fourth part ſhewed whoſe victorie namely baraks verily debora incouraging aſſuring euen ſame day wherein ſhe ſpake ſhould bee obtained gotten beleeuing went downe men warre though meeting siſera band mount tabor ſaid matter deſtroyed charets horſemen man left either drowned riuer kiſhon ſlaine mount tabor purſued charets horſemen ſo put ſword siſera himſelfe driuen flie away feete vaine oh wonderfull deliuerance god gaue vnto people day ſet downe third ſpeech debora vſed barak verſe 14 vnfolding verſ 14 mount tabor though laſt yet leaſt mightie forceable due ſeaſon appeareth text barak ſaw siſeras huge army diſmaied therfore ſought fitteſt place mount tabor fureſt ſhrowd himſelfe violence rage siſera fainting ſhe perceiuing called backe ſtirred vp fight word perſwaſions ſaying power man great fearfull ſoeuer ſhall able hinder thee obtaining victorie lord hath purpoſed giue thee day ſpeech hee animated tooke heart went battell haue heard preuailed moſt notably ſet downe one meanes whereby power doct faith ſtrengthened whereby wonderfully drawne contemne ſet light diſcouragements breake thorow leaſt whereof without would bee ready ſet man wit end deboras heartning perſwaſion barak god voyce animate therefore much auaileth heare god promiſes oft time publike miniſterie effectually publiſhed fitly applied vnto v fitteſt manner may bee ſickneſſe temptation time fainting man much weakened diſmaied note haue barak debora ſuch forcible liuely quicknings beſt man able himſelfe doe dutie himſelfe prayer faith ſtrengthen himſelfe ſuch time need oh many ebbing faintings liues euen good ſtrength refreſhing haue ſometime good patience hope vnder croſſes another time wee feare greatnes ſwallow v vp eſpecially common againe wee ſometime purſue finne haue chace preuaile ouer hath ſore laid v wound v farre draw liking conſent v vnto ſometime carrieth v maine force hath relieued v ſuch time truly euen haue able beleeue god ſtrengthen v againſt hath promiſed ſo doe alſo prayer fained wee haue ſet faith worke though hath lien almoſt dead euen thus grow weaken liking ſinne v feare danger ſhame world dull edged tooles cut head ſuch monſter although wee brought oft time point doubt yet ſhould alſo ſtriue faith prayer againſt ſhall vaine doe ſo ſame wee ſhould doe feare affliction commeth heauines come know thing eſtate chriſtian know many time great feare falling ſome finne yea perhaps foule odious though vſually ſo doe call minde god hath promiſed ſtrength againſt ſuch aduerſarie power weapon warfare carnall ſpirituall wee ſhall able beate downe ſuch ſtrong hold prayer faith need requireth ſet ſelues ſo doe ſhall ſoone perceiue loſe ground grow weake barak yet ſtrengthened againe debora ſo hee moſt valiantly afterwards ſo much renowned among worthy reported haue obtained victorie faith hearing deboras word went downe mount tabor men neere riuer kiſhon againſt siſera incouragement debora fruite barak followeth lord gaue barak victorie rare marueilous verſe 15 16 victorie ouer god enemy lord waſted huge armie siſera howbeit fighting barak men againſt ſuch haſted flight toward haroſheth gentile ſafetie whence came ouer taken alſo put ſword ſo none eſcaped siſera driuen ſo great ſlaughter battell ſo ſore forſake charet wherein hee rode eſcape foote might among common ſouldiers conſidered meanes great victorie gotten tenne thouſand vnexperienced ſouldiers going againſt ſo many thouſands horſemen footman yron charets lord ſaid gaue barak victorie man doubteth ſeeing harder queſtion barak obtained god faith barak got ſtrength courage againe deboras perſwaſions ſhe ſelfe conſtant faith went mount tabor men meete siſera afraid looking downe thence vpon huge armie ſaw barak armour proofe defend euen faith cannot bee cleerely enough ſeene ſtorie fetch cleere proofe ſay another ſcripture thus writeth author epiſtle hebrewes ſet downe faith ſundrie perſons abraham moſes adde ſhall ſay gedcon barak c heb 11 32 waxed valiant battell faith turned flight army aliants wee may ſee againe mightie force power faith doct firme ſtrong great thing bringeth paſſe marueile though ſaid apoſtle faith ouer commeth world 1 ioh 5 4 euen greateſt difficulty therein hardnes doth man goe thorow whole life like vnto mentioned ouercome alſo vnleſſe thus euen helpe power faith note giue credit god ſpeaketh wee ſee ſuch thing likelihood rather contrary many time bodily eye euen thus hath god magnified word age men haue found euery part true faith hath pleaſed make men ſee vnſpeakable kindneſſe beleeue promiſe offereth vnto faith alſo day haue ſure hold forgiuenes eternall life euen ſo many wearie note ſinne thirſt becauſe iudge faithfull hath promiſed perſwaded good end day becauſe phil 1 6 1 theſ • 24 god hath ſaid hath made good beginning thereof ſaith apoſtle faithfull calleth alſo doe thing poſſible vnlikely ſoeuer beleeueth cauſe ſome eſteeme price faith gold periſheth declare cannot doe much come retaine euen bee laughed ſcorne wicked world think meere fooliſhnes doe ſo noah preacher righteouſneſſe time beleeuing vniuerſall ſlood ſhould come prepared arke herein might wade infinitly confeſſe howſoeuer forbeare ſpeake moſt thing twice yet profeſſe ſpeake oft ſhall haue occaſion thing itſelfe ſo excellent ſo neceſſarie yet ſo difficult ſee thorowly require may weigh power truth god word end may ſtay ſelues vpon word man wee count faithfull doth much perſwade v great difficulty quickeneth hee bring v good tidings great heauineſſe beniamin came ioyfull tidings father iacob full heauineſſe ioſeph thy ſonne yet aliue ruler ouer egypt heart iacob reuiued gen 45 26 ſo giuing credit man confidence ioy like worke beleeue glad tidings may bee many thing ſent v god doubtleſſe hereby weake knee ſtrengthened ſorrowfull heart comforted expreſſed wiſh therefore vnto v concerning faith iames patience wit may haue perfect worke ſo ſhould wee ſure want nothing good next thing victorie ouer siſeras armie ſee extremity himſelfe leader chiefe captaine brought vnto faine leaue charet defence ſhift himſelfe foote among common ſouldiers might ſaue life poſſible ſay remaineth 15 verſe added fitteſt place think good note becauſe former doctrine one contrary cleering barak debora faith ſo great thing ſo ſmall weake meanes ſo siſera wanting heathen canaanite could ſo much taſte wiſedome policie power waſted put flight al troupe band brought deſtruction verified ſaying horſe pſal 33 17 vaine thing ſaue man likewiſe another ſcripture ſaith put truſt charets ſome horſes remember name lord pſal 20 7 god brought downe fallen riſen ſtand vpright therefore referre reader gather infinite annoyance vnbeliefe therewith great benefit faith former doctrine conclude without faith impoſsible pleaſe god ſo god heb 11 6 againſt deſtitute enemie looke ſtand againſt fall bee confounded finde daily one though little marked ſoone forgotten another generation riſing vp roome know workes god yet haue time alſo ſet wherein ſhall finde like true greene tree much withered vnbeliefe euen righteouſeſt finde matter ſuch difficultie ſaued attaine ſhall become 1 pet 4 18 vnbeleeuer altogether particular defect faith coſt moſes barak diſaduantage diſhonour ſhall end numb 21 12 ſuch neuer surely wrath god abideth vpon ſo ſhall doe euer ſhew ſelfe farre terrible manner iohn 3 36 haſte ſo attaine ioh 3 another thing marked god doth bleſſe doct 2 blow vpon men furniture furtherance taketh part againſt thē euen theſe thing armour defence caſt away burthen impediment siſera driuen leaue charet ſo purſued enemy yet counted houſe defence vnto god haue v know fauour toward pleaſant ſunſhine earth creature therein maketh pleaſant beautifull note ſhould ceaſe ſhine earth therein ſhould ſtinke come naught euen ſo god turne away louing countenance man frowne vpon precious vnpleaſant euen moth conſumeth beautie garment ſaid ieruſalem god diſpleaſed pleaſant lamen 1 10 thing matter ſighing ſorrow vnto whence many man great poſſeſſions yet finde ſauour relliſh eſpecially affliction trouble vpon heart ſo locked vp cannot ioy commoditie wife child wealth fauour ye know reaſon becauſe firſt outward thing ſo farre ſweete lord ſweetneth otherwiſe enioyers thereof find taſte ſweetnes haue vſe god pſal 119 59 man portion portion enioyned without loue ſo turne gall bitterneſſe nabals wealth achitophel wiſedome haman fauour ahaſhueroſh abandoned haman ſtead wife friend former fauour ſtand wrath king blaſted theſe froſt eaſt winde doth tender bud nabals heart ••• one preſaged euent followed achitophels wiſedome brake necke againe wicked force themſelues finde deceiuable ſweetneſſe theſe tranſitorie thing without god therefore iuſtly depriues thereof turnes kinde ſo although hee hath ſuffered flouriſh take pleaſure yet haue long ſurfetted poyſon yea ſhort time alſo ſeeth good vſe wee account fauour god v wee haue ſhining vpon v glorie earthly prerogatiue honour beautie wealth whatſoeuer elſe many vaine people world doe finde coſt wofull experience haue ſpent whole life precious time get may truly ſay alſo haue loſt heauen yet finde ſay vexation enioy though would make others beleeue paradiſe vnto bee ſure cannot keepe god pluck ſee two rich men goſpell daily experience enough wiſe men luke 12 20 proue little occaſion siſeras loſing luke 16 23 verſ 17 howbeit siſera 19 ſaid vnto giue pray thee little water drinke thirſtie ſhee opened bottlell milke gaue drinke couered 20 againe ſaid vnto ſtand doore tent man doth come enquire thee ſaying man heere thou ſhalt ſay whereto ahab anſwered true king thine ſame benhadad ſo boaſting braging ouer afterward himſelfe brought point ſame ahab hee looſing two battels good two hundred fiftie thouſand men beſide chariot horſes driuen flie horſebacke ſecret chamber yet euen great feare life alſo ſo ſtories reported darius perſian king flight purſued enemy great thirſt paſſed lake hee tooke vp puddle water hauing drunke hand proteſted hee neuer dranke ſweeter life ſuch mighty one may ſinnes bee driuen ſuch ſtraites ſhifts meane perſons much eaſily ſoone depriued haue many way therefore wee wiſe liue ſhall come v howſoeuer wee enioy much wee learne wee haue oft heere taught put truſt vncertaine 1 tim 6 17 rich liuing god neither high minded humble lowly knowing change ſubiect eſtate danger wee miſcarrie daily ſilly worme trod beaſt ſlaughtered fed euen paſture onely god forbearing v ſaid heber peace iabin scripture ſets downe manner therefore occaſion peace like ſeeing ſome might moue queſtion allowed according ſay let inſtruction ciuill league betwixt true worſhippers god idolater keeping enioying ſeuerally ſafely quietly diſliked godly heere deſire dwell alone world neither chuſe know danger ſee followeth ver 21 duely conſidered thing ſhee mentioned text cauſeth queſtion bee made whether iael well thus deceiuing queſtion eaſily anſwered ſhee enemy god one god people ought vertue fitteſt bring aſleepe well drunke forgets danger ſuch paſſed might ready aske therefore hee diligently inſtructeth carefull euery way preſeruation ſafety giuing drinke might fall aſleepe ſo ſhe might conueniently diſpatch ſo good opportunity ſhe ſhewed readines help cut god enemy therin wel ſerue church well appeareth theſe three verſes thing generall wee doct verſ 19 20 21 bound follow though prouidence counſell ſuffereth chuſe courſe follow liues action proues vnhappieſt euen worſe oft time greateſt enemie could take againſt may ſay pharaoh wilfull ventering ſea follow iſrael exod 14 28 enemy could ſo much haue hurt himſelfe wicked man neuer ſure peace ſafety beſt lord able defeate firſt laſt euen many way peace vngodly prophet faith neither counſell againſt eſa 57 21 lord iehouah againe hee truſted ſo lord made deceiue diſappoint doe confirme v hath ſaid teach v pleaſeth hee leaueth wicked deſtitute helpe fruſtrate hope ſucceſſe put friend yea hee make creature worke againſt therefore ſpeake creature ſenſibly ſuch iudge hee baalam opening mouth note numb 22 28 dumbe aſſe cauſing ſpeak ſeeking wage iniquity would haue heard lord ſpeake enclined heart obey thus doth god fearefull death ſhall ſweepe away carrie laſt vttermoſt ruine note ſome wofull iudgements hang ouer already vpon ſo many particular ſet downe might bee intolerable moſt terrible paine damned one would fountaine ier 9 1 teares might weepe bitterly woe loſſe ſo many people ſeeme ſtrange hath ſaid multitude ſhall periſh rom 9 27 mat 20 16 mouth lord hath ſpoken though iſrael bee ſand ſea yet remnant ſhall ſaued although cenſure men miſchances called befall indeed iuſt iudgements god vpon ſithence neither wicked men thus puniſhed thus handled wicked men yet ſeeing lot vngodly portion cup wicked life hath brought vpon let none eaſe ſtomacks charging god neither waſh cry hard fortune hap count onely hope beleeue bewaile neither let godly call queſtion prouident care louing father becauſe ſee oftentimes theſe caſualties calamity betide cleaue firmely promiſes whole truth word beleeuing ſeeing amity peace lord hee make creature inſtruments good onely friend faithfull heauen earth yea enemy bee one truſtie one another god thus tender whole perſon ſoules pretious eye body man doubteth alſo regarded ſafe vnder protection mat 4 6 ſpeake little iaels faithfulneſſe though like point obiect hath handled yet action alluring siſera tent promiſe ſhould ſafe bidding feare yet murthering afterward ſo cruelly ſeemeth ſay beſide haue ſaid thought ſo farre truſtineſſe ſhould bee vndertake ſafety thoſe receiue houſes counted rather barbarous cruelty trechery vrge anſwere hereunto obiected hath alwaies well care credit ſuch take ſtrangers cuſtodie ſee thē ſafely kept houſes annoyance danger iure hoſpitij ſay gen 19 8 right due thoſe receiue example lot alleaged defence thoſe ſtrangers turned vnto offered much inconuenience himſelfe daughter hee might free ſtrangers receiued iniurie like ſaid care iudg 19 23 old man mentioned hereafter booke leuite concubine receiued ſtrangers houſe hereupon like concluded vniuerſall law promiſes made ſtrangers ſafety ſhould bee inuiolably kept barbarian ſhewed much kindnes like caſe wee reade act 28 10 booke act paul company entertaining kindly yea alſo vnto laded neceſſaries departing hath ſaid faithfulneſſe bee ſhewed ſuch anſw promiſed iael anſwere ſame mind ought ſo scripture doth ſtraitely vrge ſame yet wee muſt know band familiarity equity ſo neerely ioyned together ſo iuſt god cauſes beſt knowne command otherwiſe bee broken ſo may ſeeme bee act iael ſeeing lord curſed commanded deſtroyed theſe canaanite siſera captaine therefore neither ſhee might heere take vpon ſaue ſpare doe god directed ſo ſhe thus leuites followed exod life ſhall goe life therefore returne iael foraſmuch ſee lord gouernour worke commended next chapter debora yea pronounced bleſſed action killing siſera ſpoken therefore conclude ſhe certainly perſwaded god wil ſhe commanded god ſo doe deceiuing hope ſince abraham attempt kill ſonne leuites ſleying kindred idolatry anſwering queſtion doctrine hath taught already wee haue authority vſe anſwere follow example word wherby action muſt guided rule example without thus wee haue ſeene ſaid beginning chapter lord barak debora iael ſubdued siſera huge armie followeth verſ 22 behold barak purſued siſera iael came meete ſaid come ſhew thee man thou ſeekeſt came tent behold siſera lay dead naile temple verſ 23 god brought downe iabin king canaan day child iſrael verſ 24 hand child iſrael proſpered preuailed againſt iabin king canaan vntill destroyed iabin king canaan ſhewed iael came meete barak finding ſenſe theſe 3 verſes siſera among thoſe ſlaine followed ſhe told ſhe done vnto thus ſhe preuented barak leſt hee ſhould wearie himſelfe ſeeking bee grieued found hee came tent found ſo baraks purſuing appeareth siſera deceiued hee feared warned iael preuent likewiſe appeareth lord deliuered people hand iabin deſtroied let v note two three thing ſo come end whole chapter firſt though iael muſt imbrace hold peace iabin yet wee ſee heart doct went neither ſhe like crueltie oppreſſion god people ſought turne away ſhe reioyced ſee people god preuaile helpe ſhe could nehemiah eſter vſing fauour found king end teacheth godly doe giue good teſtimonie diſlike wicked doct verſ 22 23 rule haue hand iael worthie helping beate downe iabins siſeras power salomon ſaith beare rule people ſigh contrarily ioy haue god giues godly guide make proſper ſuch moſes ioſua prou 29 2 aduance lord true worſhip became themſelues ſo meaner eſtates haue great cauſe praiſe god feebleth diſgraceth vngodly proſpereth enterpriſes ſeruants place ſuperioritie gouernment ſo meaner condition let ſuch vnder glorifie god bringing foorth much fruite enioy ſuch liberty let feruently intreate much good may iohn 15 9 done ſuch time lord otherwiſe change remembring written pſalme pray peace ieruſalem pſal 122 62 ſhall proſper loue thee procure thy peace c may learne barak purſuing siſera commanded doct 2 theſe verſes obtained great bleſſing god ſo ſhall incline heart follow commandements god pure heart fruit god promiſe pleaſed wee walking wiſely diligently pſal 19 11 calling doe beleeue ſame vnbeleeſe wee depriue god honour ſelues owne due hee hath freely graciouſly bequeathed v contrarily giuing credit god walking good courſe frailtie permit may reuerence yet confidence looke ſurely bleſſing either outward leaſt inward ioy good conſcience continuall feaſting alwaies companion ſuch caſe therefore great pitie wee ſhould owne folly time depriue ſelues ſuch benefit eſpecially bleſſing wee may enioy faithfull diſcharging duty barak heard iael good tidings concerning siſera ſhe ſlaine euen ſo much good ſhall wee reape member church gladding heart one fruites well followeth ſhadow doth bodie good report ſucceſſe thing incouragement goe forward whereas way crooked euill ſight lord wee may looke better place come heare ſting v coales iuniper hence many cry complaint heare men ill doings rung eares reproch threatnings ſuch like doe make take little ioy liues contrarie many ſhall bee comfort doe well iael little glad heart barak telling death siſera chiefe enemie god people hee purſued ſo part dutie god people bring ioy gladneſſe brother able keepe ſorrow griefe meanes occaſion ſhall offered ſhould one ſpeciall fruite communion fellowſhip god ſeruants earth much barak purſuing siſera yet ſlew himſelfe iael barak ſaw doct 3 word god liuely verified debora ſpoken vnto 9 verſe wit honour victorie ſhould go woman ſee iael euen ſo marke ſhall cleerely ſee ſame haue offended againſt lord one chaſtiſement ſhall meete v ſeaze vpon v v haue ſinned arrow ſhould pearce thorow liuer prou 7 23 ſorrow wee conceiue wee well aſſured behinde come meane one time wee ſhall carrie ſome marke diſobedience barak word lord ſhould ſo debora ſaid goe thee honour victorie ſhall thine hath noted vſe thereof laſtly may ſee ſubduing siſera deſtroying mightiē doct verſ 24 armie eaſily lord breake force enemy pull downe turne away wrath rage people man would turne riuers water way liſteth cut perſons earth ſo good man could liue comfort may god people lord cut enemy due ſeaſon hard conceiue conſider ſcourge plague one man oft time another inraged incenſed euen wolfe nay diuell waight little behold time arrow god deliuerance ſhame confuſion vpon impenitent implacable enemy except rather bee deſired change heart largely verſ 15 thus much chapter end sermon beginning next fifth chapter booke ivdges verſ 1 ſang debora barak ſonne abinoam ſame day ſaying verſ 2 praiſe ye lord reuenging iſrael people offered themſelues willingly verſ 3 heare ye king hearken ye prince euen ſing vnto lord ſing praiſe lord god iſrael ſumme chapter praiſing god debora barak ſumme part chapter victorie part three firſt one point ſong conſiſting offering praiſes god verſ 14 ſecond laieth goodneſſe god iſrael ſundrie way battell namely three firſt ſhe bringeth helpe verſ 19 occaſion whereof mention made ſuch helpe secondly ſhe ſheweth vnproſperouſly fell againſt canaanite battell verſ 23 thirdly hinderers victorie iſrael curſed iael helpe get pronounced bleſſed verſ 28 third part chapter ſheweth ſong mocked boaſting siſeras friend verſ 31 ſo addition thereto ſhut vp ſong prayer 31 verſe firſt part chapter leaue two laſt part bee conſidered due place come firſt ſong containeth three thing firſt ſong exhort iſraelites praiſe god thoſe offered themſelues willingly battell two firſt verſes king gouernours ſtrangers heare ſaid third verſe ſecond part next verſes following ſet downe lord mercy long powred father lately deliuerance people eighth verſe exhort praiſe practiſed luke 17 17 though like manner moſes miriam full ſolemnely exod 15 1 drowning pharaoh charets ſo woman many victory god granted iſrael came foorth ſinging manner saul hath killed thouſand dauid tenne thouſand likewiſe ezechias 1 sam 18 6 recouerie anna mother samuel many iſai 38 9 c vſe practiſe god ſeruants penne ſongs often repeate quicken memoriall god benefit kindnes owne heart knit themſelues neerely part ſeruice performed chriſt ieſus according agreeable exhortation apoſtle thing thankfull 1 theſſ 5 18 god mercy renued euery morning ſo good reaſon lamen 3 23 thankes ſhould alſo acceptable god ſo ſmall benefit redoundeth thereby ſelues drieth vp bitternes readie riſe vp v occaſion god afflicting v crucifieth ſcattereth ſuch like poyſons lie lurking heart thankfulneſſe ſay note chaſeth away ſuffereth haue place indeede proper god people offer dutie euen ſaid sion god praiſed hypocrite phariſie gloſingly vttered theſe pſal 65 1 luke 18 11 word lord thanke thee men cannot praiſe conſent mindes heart ſanctified ſweete harmonie note muſicke onely doe teach others skill doe alſo therefore thankes moſt men wanting feeling god loue bleſſings meere diſſimulation taking god name vaine ſo much lamented better ſort would become ſo well ſtirre themſelues vp ſo little ſlowly hereto thankſgiuing confeſſion ſupplication ſhould ſeaſoned accompanied feruencie companion amplifieth debora make ſongs bleſſings others paſſe ouer ſilence beſides affection ſelfe inlarged common manner eſpecially quickned ſhe ſome new rare teſtimonie god loue either bodily ſpirituall mercy deliuerances euill ſorts may ſay plenty make v barren though haue ſo much cauſe thankes looke ſide wee may ſee many ſo much bound ſhew thing yet moſt men know neither begin make end giue thankes word want wing lift vp heauen meane faith feruencie loue beſt thinke enough mumble little inward thankes ſometimes ſome bleſſings man many make thankes breake ſongs song common praiſes chriſtians ſhould haue two bookes one record fault falles regiſter god benefit ſhould ſerue ſet worke confeſſion thankes thankes neuer goe alone without grace thankfull heart patient alſo humble faithfull note conſcionable dutifull thankſgiuing quicken vp faith zeale feare god renue couenants daily wee diſhonour profeſſe ſelues infinitly beholding beſides iuſtleth iangling contention ill ſpending time ſo drieth vp froth euill heart fretting diſcontentment impatience hardneſſe heart ſame kinde haue ſaid word praiſeth god aright worſhips aright ſee pſalme ſo pſal 50 23 ſay much one word thankfull good chriſtian oh let v looke better make amends arrearages herein hee lookes wee ſhould bee thankfull affliction holy man iob much man would thinke lookes ſhould ſo bleſſings moſt iuſtly many degree chalenge let euery one iſrael god ſay mercy lord continue euer let ſeeme tedious recount old mercy greateſt redemption leſſer preſeruation yea helpe ſelues forward mutually barak debora ſing conſort doubtleſſe vnthankfull life note ſottiſh helliſh life ouergrowne naught therefore lothſome chriſtian ſaith would could doe euery duty well thankes foole knowing ſaith prate like parrot thankfulneſſe without godlineſſe cannot well proceed time thirtieth sermon fifth chapter booke ivdges haue heard largely thankeſgiuing former ſermon cauſes manner neceſſity thereof doct 2 verſ 1 beſide action thankeſgiuing haue ſpoken circumſtance time alſo bee marked ſay ſame day ſo ſet downe holy ſtory ſang debora barak ſame day teacheth v make delay good thing vſe opportunity due ſeaſon ſo need take vantage againſt bad memory blockiſh heart ſuch meanes although ordinarily ſhould performe dutie three time day ſolemne manner namely morning euening noone tide yet otherwiſe beſide pſal 55 17 god ſhall giue v occaſion common benefit deliuerances ſhould prouoke ſelues hereunto namely saint iames ſaith note one merrie diſpoſed ioy let ſuffer affection vaniſh expreſſe vtter god ſinging praiſes ſo afterward ought continue memory infinite mercy throughout whole life end write whereas grow multitude time cannot alwaies remembred bee wiſhed ſome ſort yet leaſt wiſe wee reade ouer wee may readily renue ſhall ſee cauſe thankes god great men blockiſhneſſe haue ſaid endleſſe wandring ſwarmes cogitation thing hinder wherby ſee cauſe hereof doe yet ſlothfulneſſe ſuch delay deferre pay due god till appetite gone afterward let hinderance comming way breake ſo cannot performe ſaid thankes ſecond verſe ſhee ſhewes god ſhould bee praiſed one cauſe verſ 2 auenged enemy behalfe people ſakes though hee long vſed executioner wrath againſt diſobedient people yet ſinne come top people ſin repented therfore turne come brought puniſhment another cauſe thankes people zebulun naphtali willingly offered themſelues follow barak againſt siſera although hee authority ouer theſe expreſſed verſe theſe word praiſe ye lord auenging iſrael people offered themſelues willingly heereby wee learne firſt god reuenger doct verſ 2 iniuries wrong people euen hee himſelfe ſaith vengeance rom 12 19 mine repay ſaith lord yea hee doe due time luk 18 7 right ſoone ſo ſaith need marke ſaith vnrighteous iudge doe right poore widow leſt ſhee troubling oft ſuing vnto ſhould laſt weary ſhall god auenge elect cry day night vnto yea though bee long tell 2 theſ 1 6 hee auenge quickly recompence tribulation trouble apoſtle ſpeaketh waite therefore hee hath forgotten himſelfe wiſe man ſaith thou ſeeſt oppreſsion eccleſ 5 7 poore greater oppreſſor though might much ſaid point like purpoſe yet beleeueth theſe thing according word sauiour ſonne man commeth ſhall luk 18 8 finde faith earth teaching v hardly men ſhould beleeue though hee gaue therein fearefull watchword thereof ſhould come child giues v ſo faire ſtrong encouragement let v paſſe next point verſe thing doct 2 verſ 2 verſe people ſhould praiſe god thoſe offered themſelues readily willingly purſue god enemy teacheth ſuch doe worke god ſhould goe willingly cherefully loueth chearefull giuer ſo doth cheerefull doer 2 cor 9 7 command contrarily curſed doth lord buſineſſe negligently therefore highly bee reioyced god much ier 49 2 praiſed men forward god matter waightier excellent bee courage delight men note haue taking hand among reckon preaching goſpell profeſſion duty particular calling ſuch like wherin forward cheerful people hay harueſt going market faires honoureth god highly ſuch behold ought praiſe god heartily giuing ſuch gift men rarely ſeene among doe ſo ſhew plainly looke reward god goe roundly readily buſineſſe men ſo aukely goe moſt part men forward ready leaud company keeping ſins time workes fleſh ſhould obey lord bee ſet good worke eſpecially whereof profit like redound goe moſt aukely vntowardly euen euill debter worke creditour pay therefore fearefull grieuous ſinne thoſe looſe liuers bee forwarder zealouſer god matter duty ward mocke diſcourage yet ſinne grieuouſly companion thine father kingdome power glory euer leaſt iot praiſe thereof due god honour make inſtruments therein furniſh gift purpoſe meane doe ſeruice yet though abſolute power themſelues forgetting lord aduanced aſcribe great act victory themſelues senacherib againſt hezechia benhadad againſt ahab yea 2 king 19 36 1 king 20 3 got victory tarrie till conquered enemy crow ouer yet great ſinne prided themſelues done nabuchadnezzar babell therefore put ſhame moſt worthily themſelues brought vnder manner fit ſuch bragger would thruſt lord helping nay rather challenged euen oppoſed themſelues againſt ſeene ſtory therefore one battell benhadad loſt hundred ſeuen twentie thouſand men ſo hee euen left conſtrained flie battell wherein many men ſlaine hee brought greater ſhame abacement laſt refuge wit ſeruants goe king iſrael rope neck entreate liues senacherib angell lord flue hundred foure 2 king 19 35 ſcore fiue thouſand one night ſuch ſucceſſe leaſt end haue ſuch like hence scripture bewraying pride vanity ſuch vſeth theſe phraſes lord ſmote beniamin iſrael lord fought iſrael againe ſtand ſtill behold ſaluation lord c among exod 14 13 name lord called ſtrong battell lord hoſts ſurely ſparrow fall ground without wil neither lot without diſpoſition much doe euents hazard warre depend vpon prouidence oft time matter great weight alteration kingdomes eſtates come prince muſt know victory honour giuen god much inferiours ought learne well beggers haue nothing nay wee worſe nought rather wee haue ought glory would ſoone appeare could brought conſider aright euen infection v taint poyſon action lord ſhould thruſt v euill deed euen little finger beſides verſe debora declareth ſhee yea repeating doct 2 word ſhe praiſe lord whereby appeareth ſhee called barak ſelfe ſheweth ſhee ſo liuely quickened ſtirred vp feeling god goodneſſe declared vnto ſhe would doe dutie whole church god fared better victory ſo ſhe acknowledged ſelfe part haue receiued great benefit thereby alſo therefore ſhe formoſt onſet ſo ſhee firſt thankeſgiuing put duty reſt people rather go therein indued ſo god worketh oft time ſeruants ſo rauiſhed thinking vpon louing kindneſſe note cannot bee ſatisfied prayer praiſe giuing god publike among muſt doe alſo themſelues alone dauid ſaith praiſe god congregation wil praiſe ſecret ſo bent vnto ſhould yet themſelues many prouoke noble man ioſhua ſaid al run ioſh 24 15 idolatry mine ſerue lord conſider well weigh god goodneſſe publike bleſſings late diſcouerie treaſon although many praiſe god openly faſhion ceremony ſhall find needeth practiſe duty alone ſelues apart reade tribe oft time well among others elſe would sauiour haue willed v goe alone euery one himſelfe chamber pray iſaac alſo field little ſoeuer many mat 66 gen 24 63 acquainted therewith therefore finde leſſe benefit prayer thankeſgiuing make others great likelihood made hypocriſie others make euery man owne ſoule beſt knowes cauſe hee hath thankes better others accordingly let profeſſe though bee many brought deboras firſt word ſong wherein ſhee ſtirred vp iſraelites praiſe god reaſons thus much ſaid verſ 4 lord thou wenteſt seir thou departed field edom earth trembled heauens rained cloud alſo dropped water 5 mountaines melted lord sinai lord god iſrael 6 day shamgar ſon anath day iael high way vnoccupied trauellers walked way 7 townes inhabited mercy one example forefather people iſrael ſhewed long latter two ſhee maketh mention goodneſſe toward time preſent great deliuerance mentioned former chapter particularly ſpeake begin firſt fourth fifth verſes know ſtory mentioned containeth act done lord brought people iſrael beyond mount seir iſrael 38 yeeres going egypt deſert come neare land canaan namely wonderfully lord tooke part people ioyned himſelfe vnto againſt enemy going pillar fire cloud terrifie enemy ammorites ſuch wiſe though iſraelites vnexperienced warre ſtrangers weake vnfit alſo ſuch worke yet enemy could reſiſt onely ſo ſhe ſaith lord caſt ſuch feare vpon earth trembled great ſtormes tempeſts caſt downe cloud mountaines melted ſhaken theſe allegoricall ſpeeches ſhe deſcribeth feare ſmitten amorites iſraels comming neare lord brought egypt ſhee addeth ſame end euen mount sinai ſo muſt bee vnderſtood though word like bee expreſſed lord comming downe vpon ſhaken moued ſo nation comming iſrael feare terrified laying god kindneſſe thus towards father long ſhewed commonly reckoned one brought aegypt thorow fearefull wilderneſſe canaan many ioſh 24 2 c iudg 2 1 place scripture meaning declare hee ſhewed
