mention made nation earth affaire bent wholly ſtreight line directed church vſe benefit either puniſh bleſſe people ſake church workes loue mercie iuſtice wiſedome prouidence referred though god sauiour yet eſpecially faithfull church whence wee learne god hath age bin bountifull gracious church well euen forefather day ſo age age written mercie endureth euer hath deare ſpouſe bride bridegrome loue hath hot fire cannot quenched much water end hee hath ſo affected might know loueth hee ſaith exodus ye diligently attend voice keepe couenant ye ſhall chiefe treaſure earth though earth mine doctrine moſt exod 19 5 needfull made vſe among v ſeeing people deare age paſt neuer ſo cleerely teſtifie loue church generation heretofore ſince chriſt hee hath done beleeued wee throughly perſwaded nothing like draw v neerely chriſt ſet heart delight vpon oft due meditation thinking whether ſpeake thoſe chriſt alreadie ſuch lie yet vnbeliefe draw perſwade theſe ſhould better incouraged many degree labour taſte good lord haue alreadie begun ſhould breake let difficulty doe much hold backe farre eaſily doe vnited neerely vnto head whereas may ſpoken griefe ſtead hereof many profeſſing well euen god loue made knowne doe cleaue pleaſures ſin profit preferment howſoeuer come rather ſtriue enter ſtreight gate beſt backward conſidering haue treaſure heauen heart muſt need alſo ſet heauenly thing mind earthly thing aboue ſhould doe ſeldome thinke rightly either yet would thought doe otherwiſe beautie blemiſh chriſtian life oh lamentable ſo many ſtill remaine old world arke latter world commonwealth iſrael ſo theſe euen aliants church though crie church church becauſe heare mercie bleſſing ſaluation church yet baptiſme ſufficient ſeeke priuiledges church effectuall calling faith charitie ſanctification fruites thereof therefore ſtill little better ſcumme ofſcouring common band wicked hauing title promiſe god hope god precinct gouernment therefore wee may ſay theſe church wanting church god mercie whatſoeuer excellent reach ſuch priuiledges appertaine vnto becauſe ſeparated wicked ſoule lord abhorreth againe god made enemy afraid doct 2 people comming thither great loue toward honour ſo highly among thoſe contemned hated hee ſo fauoured taken part vtterly diſcouraged ouerwhelmed would teach v thereby though child baſely eſteemed contemptible among prophane worldling buſily ſet follow pleaſures profit ſcorning religion baſe yet make oft afraid pleaſeth conſciences doe accuſe ſeeing way euill others good pleaſe ſhall come iudgement ſhall lift vp head reioyce herefore ſaid herod feared iohn baptiſt mark 6 20 beheaded yet hearing chriſts fame great little hee afraid iohn riſen againe dead reuenged iudgement god fell vpon ananias saphira diſſembling people ſaw god honour act 5 11 12 apoſtles magnifie miniſterie among many ſaid great feare came vpon wicked knew liued apoſtles doctrine neither liked courſe inſomuch durſt accuſing conſcience ioyne themſelues god honoured feare leaſt ſhould haue brought foorth openly bewrayed ſome iudgement god halting ananias felix though paul iudge yet trembled afraid hee heard act 24 25 boldly preach iuſtice temperance meete place farre iudgement come yet paul himſelfe without feare thereof sehon og trembled afraid ſee high hand outſtretched arme lord wherewith iſrael carried naught lord expoſtulated ſo man came among thoſe bidden feaſt hauing wedding matth 22 12 garment ſaying vnto doeſt thou without man euen ſpeechleſſe could feare aſtoniſhment vtter word lord haue ſuch know companie faithfull people prophane ſcorners example many ſuch hath put bridle mouthes many though deſpiſe god people yet ſhall without feare therfore caſt dread people vpon ſaid hath ſeene late perſecution note proteſtants land time poperie ſome yet aliue teſtifie true many perſecutors terrified hearing anſwers beholding boldnes courage martyr themſelues terrified ſentence death read pronounced againſt leſſe aſſured many ill diſpoſed people would wiſh neither god iudgement better liuers themſelues yet conſtrained time ſay godly life beſt yet fret ſee practiſers void themſelues oh therefore happie people whoſe god lord iehoua bleſſed haue king let vphold content delight ſuch though ſeeme vileſt moſt miſerable god forget longing diſſolued know doe ſo worſt day week ſhall farre better others beſt yeere howle ye deſpiſers tremble vaniſh away ye ſee great act 13 41 portion ye hate almightie ſelues caſt fauour habitation euen ſo aduerſitie day god viſiting diues hell ſenſe thereof ye doe acknowledge old world ſcoffed noah building arke till flood came former preaching terrified like manner ſay walked innocencie vprightnes reuerence among men lord would worke aſtoniſhment wicked reprobate godlineſſe people ſhould conuince amaſe beholder contemners pharaos troopes ſaid lord fighteth exod 14 25 v iſrael next verſes referre handled next sermon thirtie one sermon fifth chapter booke ivdges goe forward theſe two next verſes verſ 6 7 cleere meaning thē ſixth ſeuenth wherein ſet downe late receiued fauour god two former verſes loue old father hath ſpoken theſe two end deliuerance lord may ſeene greater loue ſhe laieth deſolation victorie one contrarie might better ſeene holy ghoſt therefore ſheweth afflicted ſtate church god reaſon ſinne death ehud till debora got full victorie though shamger iael worthily valiantly place yet iſrael ſore oppreſſed death one great act ſo paſſage high way traffique iudgement habitation village intercepted vntill iſrael conſtrained keepe themſelues ſtrong well fenced city vnleſſe would become prey canaanite oppreſſion continued iabin till debora raiſed vp god till gouernment began iael reade great thing ſhe neither like ſhe done becauſe ſhe peace iabin siſera alſo fled truſtie friend therefore like ſhe named shamger honour ſake becauſe ſhee liued theſe troubleſome dangerous time becauſe ſhee one worthy peece ſeruice afterwards heere theſe calamity people iſrael deſolation doct good liberty pleaſant thing taken right worthie conſideration thinke fauour god together true preaching goſpell forementioned commodity enioyed v namely outward peace land may dwell ſafely vnder vine figge tree may 1 king 4 25 nehem 8 10 eate fat drinke ſweet wee may ſafely trauell paſſe throughout place country dominion protection good lawes haue exchange commodity benefit good neighbourhood husbandry preſeruation liues maintaining family c theſe people depriued whereas want would ſoone driue v complaine heauily cry oh little conſider deepely yea note infinitely wee bound lord theſe liberty great good wee may reape enioy thereby yet theſe many good thing lord hath vſually beſtowed vpon v daily doth bleſſed bee holy name therefore wee thinke becauſe land enioyeth well ſelues wee owe ſpeciall duty acknowledging ſee moſt doe worth ſpeaking nay looke due good right worſt many ſpend waſtfully maintaining encreaſing diuers ſinnes among durſt wealth quietneſſe wanting ſo truly wiſe man ſpeaketh one rich man rich prou 18 11 ſtrong city high wall imagination word haue ſo little leiſure thinke god goodneſſe abuſing benefit wee haſt bring vpon ſelues ſame miſery theſe vnder eſpecially shamgar god ſtirred vp debora among oh doe prouoke good god caſt v ſome fore calamity heere might cry feeling ſmart thereof ſome daily doe god would haue bee example reſt leſt many ſhould taſt diet fearefull ſee better iudgements god bee vpon themſelues behold others ſame ſinnes commit boldly runne till courſe come ſuffer yet worſe heauier thing god hand wee cannot amend others let v bewaile right property true loue praying alſo owne part let example theſe calamity ſo many grieuous haue ſpoken cauſe v account god goodneſſe ſo highly withholding v may make v fruitfull thereby euery good worke eſpecially ſeeing wee haue many good encouragement thereto alſo wee want ſay wee doe little good without ſhe addeth till euen debora aroſe muſt take farre otherwiſe ſoundeth aſcribing word paſſion womaniſh impotencie clearing next part verſe boaſting much leſſe contempt barak inſtrument victorie well ſelfe heauenly exaltation ſpirit lifted vp pathetically praiſe lord great deliuerance wrought ſee like dauid pſalmes paul others doct 2 deliuerance wrought debora teacheth al forementioned calamity remoued people gouernour time teacheth ſay great thing lord worketh magiſtrate gouernour ſhee time ſame people euen iudge iſrael indeed done eſpecially zealous god matter doe duty place haue ſpirit affection euen mother like vnto people ſhee gaue counſell inferiours mother child propheteſſe deliuered enemy iudge ſet ouer guide magiſtrates ſhould bee vnto committed charge euen like minded wit haue care may taught though themſelues prophet ſuch furniſhed god purpoſe motherly care protect iniurie wrong turne edge ſword againſt enemy thus much god mercy old lately ſhewed people theſe 4 verſes hath declared followeth verſ 8 choſe new god warre gate ſhield ſpeare ſeene among forty thouſands iſrael 9 mine heart ſet gouernours iſrael willing among people praiſe ye lord 10 speake ye ride white aſſes ye dwell middin walke way 11 wife archer appeaſed among drawer water ſhall rehearſe righteouſneſſe lord righteouſneſſe towards townes people lord goe downe gate holy ſtory hauing ſet downe people deliuerance ſenſe eighth verſe great calamity oppreſſion siſeras army goeth eighth verſe ſheweth cauſe caſt vpon idolatry meanes whereof ſaid heart take vp weapon throughout tribe againſt enemy next three verſes ſorts ſtirred vp called praiſe god ſumme generall three tooke benefit victory deliuerance ſhall bee particularly ſhewed ſhall come vnto order text begin eighth verſe barak debora vtter part ſong warre began oppreſſe iewes enemy beſiege city gate held iudgement ſeates turned idolatry ſo cauſe grieuous puniſhment may ſee greatly god diſpleaſed men doct verſ 8 runne ſins haue forewarned commanded take heede euen ſinnes ſoule abhorreth iſrael oft time admoniſhed idolatry lord put vp hand denie ſtandeth moſt ſound reaſon men vile wormes ſhall thus boldly kicke vp heele againſt maker ſhould ſmart ſuffered commit ſuch inſolencie againſt vnpuniſhed therfore gaue v example hereof apoſtate angel kept place iude 6 ſet therefore threw downe diſobedience firſt parent hee draue paradiſe gen 3 24 note hauing ſo great liberty might haue eaten fruit garden except one tree yet counted little reſpect forbidden ſtood thornes till caſt behinde commandement god eaten forbidden fruit alſo god ſpared angel firſt parent innocent fall may offender looke whoſe ſinnes haires head number dealeth thus wilfull tranſgreſſors day ſhould vniuſt carnall ſo beareth much may eaſily ſee patient toward end may thereby bring repentance abuſe pay rom 2 4 2 pet 39 boldneſſe end ſo much hee ſpeedeth beſt ſhall haue ſmall cauſe brag winning yet ſhoaleth ſome one note hundred heere many indeed compariſon thoſe haue offended kind ſtriketh deadly blowes ſetteth ſtage publiſh wofull example reſt though bare longer ſome cauſe alleaged might doe yea perfect iuſtice execute vpon therefore let wiſe take warning hold good courſe continue haſt ſpeedily vnto let none tempt god boldly doe forbiddeth mocked ſhall pay deare ſo yet though god ſpare outward warre iudgements time yet prophet eſay ſpeaketh peace vngodly ſo may ſure ſhall haue warre mind let praiſe god giueth heart ſhunne euill ſinnes time liue idolatry church rome may ſay moſt papiſts doe wilfully malitiouſly erre againſt truth ſome pompe bellie many doe meere ſuperſtition blind deuotion cuſtome receiued forefather ſeeing leaſt offend therein among reſt doe put chriſt office ſeruice giue honour king crowne thornes ſcepter reed hand bee knowne vnto damnation ſleepeth wee hand may partly gather vncomfortable yea fearefull death many papiſts great maſters maintainer popery boldnes life time whereby beare matter yet muſt die ſome cry vndone cry religion hardneſſe heart would ſeene maruell ſeeing try eſtate obſerued greateſt offender among ſhall ſmart moſt yet ſay deuotion faſt cleauing church rome pleaſe god might bee brought heare ſermons learned religious preacher admit conference many would renounce trumpery ſtanding vpon rotten prop embrace truth goſpell ſtabliſhed ſo ſtrongly ſaid could take vp weapon againſt enemy heart handle ſhield ſpeare becauſe ſinne idolatry enormity plainely ſhewes men doct 2 ſinne turneth euery thing courſe againſt contrary nature vſe end created appointed god euen people durſt take weapon hand fight liues conſciences accuſing god would againſt wherefore weapon ordained man defence againſt enemie hath god giuen courage man ſuch time meane warre neceſſity might put vſe behold heere neither imployed ſet worke achan troubled iſrael taking execrable thing lord tels ioſhua therefore could ſtand enemy ioſh 7 12 note much themſelues ſinned oh men ſinnes turneth plenty want courage timerouſneſſe fainting heart light darkeneſſe kind behold ieroboam hee 1 king 13 4 ſtretched arme againſt prophet god reprouing idolatry bethel arme immediately withered dried vp could draw againe gehazi taken moſt wickedly 2 king 5 25 money raiment naaman syrian pretending maſters ſending returne anſwered maſter eliſha lie maruellous ſay againſt nature ſound reaſon man iudgement came vpon euen leproſie forthwith ſo went leaper white ſnow band prieſts iewes ioh 18 6 ſouldiers came garden apprehend take sauiour chriſt ſo boldly trecherouſly yet ſuddenly went backe like drunken men fell ground aſtoniſhed vnfitted vtterly ſuch purpoſe lay hold one word ſpoken sauiour yet terrifying manner might haue done ſaying man ſought ſeeking luſty ready lay hold yet found could doe nothing ſinne taken power ability able reckon vp many way god hath viſit aſtoniſh terrifie men ſinne therefore among puniſhments deuteronomy threatened one trembling heart ſorrowfull mind deut 28 65 feare day night lord ſhould handle ſome thus would bee afraid would abuſe maieſty yea faithfull people alſo much groſly would tempt god dare doe though euen many doe boldly forget themſelues hypocrite goe verie farre ſinning boldly doe like therefore many apalled among v ſome hauing wit reaſon taken ſome become fooliſh ſome madde men note againſt nature laying violent hand vpon themſelues ſeuerall ſinnes doe though reaſon man ſeeth doe ſay driue another fruit ioyned former ſinne bringeth forth true indeed lord dealeth thus kind ſinners nay wee ſee impudent braſen faced moſt bee leaud courſes ſet vp buſtles againſt ordinance god though forehead bee braſſe yet heart glaſſie conſciences would yeeld water powred forth haue true lion like courage boldneſſe iollity would haue thinke haue ſin hath infeebled cannot abide force ſting conſcience fall downe cowardlike ſmiteth neither ſinne abide hand god euer readie reached foorth againſt ſo ſo indeed ſoone diſmaied nabal heard ſhould dye true ſet good face vpon matter openly bragging bracing haue ſaid conſcience goe hand hand doth ſeldome neceſſitie armed man vpon white liuerd heart doe vtterly faile yet ſuch checkes word conſcience feare many arreſtings god doth complaine crie eſtate ſo ſeekes ſtrength recouerie faith peace confidence true deteſtation ſin like witch ſo inchaunteth diſableth courage boldneſſe turnes coward weakling men doe perceiue might eaſily blindfolding themſelues hardning heart cauſe thereof debora turneth ſelfe diuers kind men diſtinguiſheth verſe 9 10 11 laying open theſe verſes one another exhorting ſhe ſelfe praiſe magnifie god lay open plainly ſomewhat hard otherwiſe ſome reader vnderſtand diſcerne ſame firſt verſe ſhe beginneth chiefe army thoſe offered themſelues willingly battell next verſe ſhe ſpeaketh rich merchant rode coſtly beaſts hee calleth white aſſes ſuch ſat iudgement thirdly ſame verſe alſo ſhe ſpeaketh meaner perſons trauailed foote ſeeing libertie paſſe fro high way ſhe moueth theſe ſay magnifie god euen ſorts people went gate citie buſineſſe profit pleaſure neceſſarie vſe ſecond verſe ſhe nameth boyes girles could ſafely goe draw water without danger archer lay waite ſecretly ſhoote ſo put perill ieopardie liues ſore wounded theſe might ſhe ſaith fetch water without feare hurt ſhe calleth dwelt village vnwalled townes danger hauing great ſo driuen away houſes telling might returne home againe dwel quietly time paſt laſt ſhe ſpeakes thoſe wont meete gate citie open place iudgement theſe ſhe moue praiſe lord one deliuerance victorie ſet libertie peace make profit theſe verſes particularly examine doct verſ 9 begin ninth whereas ſhe ſaith verſe heart ſet gouernours iſrael one heart toward prouoke meaning cauſe ſo great ſhould praiſe god ſhe could chuſe ſpeake ſhe ſhould ſay ſhe deſired moſt earneſtly chiefe armie gouernours captaines thereof great men ſhould praiſe god reaſon becauſe barak chiefe buſineſſe going ſhould eaſiler drawne example follow liuely teacheth ſetteth chief doer ſuch martiall affaire alſo wealthie head ſocieties ought firſt giuing good example praiſing god commendable part chriſtian dutie greateſt haue greater portion god bleſſing deliuerance meaner haue meane enioy much haue much loſe therefore owe much enioy peace ſecondly goodly ſight behold captaines warre gouernours magiſtrates diſcouraged backwardnes haue need ſetting forward incouragement good example eaſily brought therefore lord giuing charge family ſhould remember keepe holy sabbath beginneth gouernour command 4 thereof ſaying firſt thou ſhalt doe hee goeth forward ſonne daughter ſeruant euen ſo contrary much greateſt perſons goe reſt ill example ſee readily follow wee reade prieſts leuites guide ezra 9 2 people god thanked ſome ſort wee ſee chiefe men ſocietie forward ſeeking knowledge zealous flying euill reſiſting place giue leaue following good courſe care labour vaine good purpoſe guide miniſters maſters family chiefe townes prophane lewd ill company keeper idle gameſters makebates contentious ſlanderers yee may bee ſure finde led depend vpon ſutable otherwiſe ſee winde blowes againſt hang downe head nipt bloſſome containe themſelues ſee note difference betwixt godly lewd one ioſhua vndertaketh himſelfe ſerue ioſu 24 15 lord like thoſe phariſies onely ill diſpoſed themſelues doe alſo pull backe pluck downe many beſt order company men muſt liue ſuch rare ſuch caſe law himſelfe keepe reſolution rather ſerue god alone giue ouer want companie better diſpoſed among muſt fetch light place moſt part elſe bee danger companie come loſe little haue led darkneſſe debora hauing ſpoken chiefe doth occaſion deſcend opening part verſe doct 2 name mention meaner ſort armie wit two tribe naphtali zabulon willing take worke hand againſt canaanite eaſily drawne put helpe appeareth chapt 4 10 therefore ſo forward ſo good cauſe thereby reaping ſo happie fruite labour victorie ouer enemy euen ſay honour regeſtring memorie euen ſo nothing loſt doe god commandement ſake plentifull paimaſter rewarder chiefe meane praiſe god victorie ſhe calleth thē renouncing owne ſtrength boaſting owne arme poſſibly might haue done aſcribe god indeed ſhe might well two heb 26 doct 3 verſ 9 meaneſt tribe zabulon naphtali able doe againſt entire force mightie armie iabin euen ſo forward god buſineſſe vnleſſe groſſely forget themſelues readie honour praiſe cannot without owne comfort theſe two agree well together readineſſe obey god like praiſing abaſing ſelues alſo accompanied ioy heart heere debora ſo ſhe ſought haue ſame ſee dauid hee aduiſed ahigail ſhed innocent blood eaſily perſwaded counſell forbeare ſo praiſed god highly arrogated naught himſelfe following aduice ſhe ſo wiſely ſo good ſeaſon miniſtred vnto wee may ſure without owne reioycing oh well becommeth v bee forward god matter yet proud ſo come worſe end thereof thankes god hath vſed v inſtruments comfort ſelues wee may truly ſay doe thankfully ioyfully partake word sacrament haue moſt profit receiued goſpell moſt zealous welwillers religion whereas ſlothfull vntoward thereto neither finde taſt ſauour therein moſt diligent promote ill cauſes ſhall ſtead prerogatiues haue iuſtly deſerue reproch vexation puniſhments god euen life therefore let humility bee carefull ready bee imployed god buſines ſeruice arrogate ought themſelues onely ſweet life deſired herein heauenly father glorified forth much fruit verſe ſhe ſpeakes vnto rich wealthy honour ſake ioh 15 9 verſ 10 rule ouer people ride coſtly beaſts reade chapter 10 4 12 verſe 14 theſe whether liued land meaning firſt part th • verſe doct 1 reuenues traffique merchandiſe much hindred enemy enioying commodity paſſage cut ſea land might freely enioy ſame againe therefore come forth ſhe ſaid giue thankes god great enlargement liberty thus wee ſee lord haue duty praiſe hudled vp groſſe though word faſhion might ſerue turne perticular haue ſorts feele benefit ſweet comfortable diuerſly ſo make new amplification hearty repetition goodneſſe ſo ioyning conſort together muſicke may ſweeter praiſe may fuller one condition people could poſſibly haue laid forth benefit deliuerance commodity liberty peace reſtored manner ſorts might together merchant could record owne priuiledge hee enioyed thereby better husbandman ſo euery one ſeuerall place anothers reſpect ſhe requireth namely ſtand forth together take occaſion ſhew one worke god goodly thing ſorts people praiſe god ioyntly together deliuerance victory doth conceiue heauenly ſight like might prophet apoſtles martyr saint bleſſed company ſay ſolemne ſight ſhall bee thinking ſuch thing ſhall bee greateſt note comfort heere enioyed next vnto celeſtiall ioy itſelfe would depriued wee wiſe loſe part therein muſing often tranſitorie vaniſhing ſo euer account make know better returne rich great men debora verſe doct 2 verſ 10 moueth praiſe god let rich ſuch enioy wealth great commodity doe ſame acknowledge benefit whether bee great merchant buy vtter ware maintenance encreaſe wealth could bee muſt need faile lay dead liberty trauelling ſafely free contract hindred whether otherwiſe great rich reuenewes let doe likewiſe greater perſons bee either kind let ſeeke excell themſelues duty praiſing god forward may inabled doe good workes neceſſary vſes may alſo ſee god alloweth wealthy men occupie proſper calling commandeth walke calling till come teacheth diligent hand maketh rich need bee queſtion made lord allowes men ſhould encreaſe rather diminiſh prou 10 4 haue auoide burthenſomneſſe ſupply others ſo practiſe godlineſſe therewith equity truth ſincerity innocency patience ſuch like haue good incouragement haue liberty follow courſes dealing alſo ſeeing godlines hath promiſes preſent life 1 tim 4 8 come ſo men debarred traffique vſe calling theſe rich men mentioned heauie croſſe ſeeing way ſpend vpon ſtocke till waſted ſoone done renued ala ſhall family maintained charge defraid freedome gathering men commodity dealing bee taken doe wee ſee weather little ſickneſſe diſabling man worke cauſeth complaining much liberty wholly interdicted yet god doe ſomtime bleſſe men may looke haue alwaies one ſame courſe thriuing proſpering howſoeuer bee let bee highly thankfull may vſe benefit traffique improuing commodity theſe let fruitfull welldoing would readily promiſe bee againe vnder croſſe ioyfull vſe preaching sacrament duty true praiſe god expecteth ſuch depriue themſelues benefit thereof owne default haue much anſwere idle perſons ill husband call ſuch lord ſomewhat alter courſe taking gaines come ſhort therof ouer ſomtime fret complaine trade naught ſhall vndone much like hauing got trade well conceale eſtates faine themſelues bankerupts defeat others good ſuch caſt burthen vpon thriftleſnes improuidence vpon trade dealing blindfortune forgetting god ſomtimes bleſſed therein therefore let v know whatſoeuer bad practiſes men great fauour god people may haue free recourſe market faires like place buying ſelling commodity euen want thereof ſore puniſhment people neither know ſhould vtter commodity buy whereof ſtand need conſiſted maintenance ſaid yet lamentable ſee abuſe corrupt cuſtome time hath brought liberty vnto many doe onely ſteale away god due meane sabbath doe worldly buſineſſe whoſe common trade practiſe prophane manner harbour theeues receiue ſtollen ware entertaine drunkard become baud adulterer ſpend day leaud vnſeemely meeting matchmaking ſtageplayes reuell rout vnder honeſt colour exchanging commodity maintaining charge ſtead thereof men woman ſet ſale good name chaſtity ſobriety whatſoeuer elſe ſhould bee pretious godly vnto theſe mentioned greater wealth place whereas ſome thinke next word ſhee ſpeaketh men meaner ſtate opening another part verſ 10 doct 3 ſuch ſaid dwelt middin place ſay met vſually mart exchange ware place intercepted enemy free haue recourſe paſſe fro high way ſhee exhorts repaired thither praiſe lord opinion gainſaid pureſt tranſlations beſide one thing ſhould bee vnderſtood place wit tra •• ique merchandiſe ſo word middin taken heere proper name place ware ſold word dwelling middin bee tranſlated thus ſitting iudgement ſhe ſhould ſay let men authority rich lawyer may ſit iudgement ciuill cauſes let ſuch praiſe lord becauſe may doe ſafely honour credit peace benefit magiſtrates learned counſellors alſo welfare people place iudgement iuſtice frequented vpholden ſee heere england terme time weſtminſter terme place equity right maintained wrong iniurie puniſhed oh time full deſolation famine plague • ection ſuch place muſt lie vnoccupied time ſhould frequented ſet worke deciding cauſes helping innocent right weeding euill doer whereby may gather heauy time thoſe iudgement ceaſed open place iuſtice miniſtred laid waſt left voide therfore reade former chapter people could enioy liberty publike iudgement ſeates driuen go priuately debora iudgement dwelling ſumptuouſly palace caſtle famous reſpect iudg 4 5 honourable obſcure vnder palme tree therfore might againe boldly freely ſit iudgement heere called praiſe god ſuch perſons v enioying ſuch priuiledges ought call themſelues duely daily zealous thankeſgiuing ſuch duty accompany ſame yea whole life ſhould ſauour thereof ſhall haue much anſwere god otherwiſe people duty owe enioying benefit ſhew fitter occaſion next verſe let theſe goe haue ſpoke verſe becauſe debora doct 4 verſ 10 heere ſpeaketh alſo ſuch went walked way ſhould cauſe ſuch goe fro buſineſſe pleaſure neceſſarie vſes trauellers praiſe god highly ſuch liberty ſe • ing little high way lay vnoccupied ſpeake benefit thereof one another praiſe trauell fro rude prophane looſe manner gabling like wild geeſe vnciuill rude ſort though enioyed ſuch liberty offend god much ought behauiour communication bee ſober chriſtian like goe houſe god bee edified word prayer sacrament alſo returne home againe word walke harmeleſſe place behauiour much vſe land yet god bee thanked altogether ſome place heere end time thirtie two sermon fifth chapter booke ivdges proceed reſt haue begun withall verſ 11 heree debora ſpeaketh ſeruants going forth draw water neceſſary vſe free archer ſhot put much paine trouble danger feare leaſt thereby 1 sam 16 11 ſee meaneſt place ſeruice bee ſuffered enioy liberty liue idly imployed occupied dauid young kept father ſheep ſet worke may maintained thereby ſuch ought thankfull may goe peace ſo bee admitted alſo taken number worſhip god aſſembly therefore ought duly bee brought thither gouernours taught know euen ſuch cut wood draw water droyles houſes called doe moſt ſeruile workes therefore ſome country ſuch keepe ſwine note ſheepe cattell baſe ſerue onely euen theſe ſay redeemed precious blood chriſt well ſhould taught honour god aright liue vnder gouernment therefore ſuffered liue brutiſhly ſome place doe brought forth parent ruler congregation faithfull learne thoſe thing concerne happineſſe peace preſuppoſed ſhall taught ſpeake ſhame ſuch maſters gouernours neuer regard ſuch matter neither conſider owe education ſeruice doe vſe make moſt owe band tyed god commandement whereas life ſuch miſerable ſoule vnder turkes gallies body yea euen aſſes ſpend day toyle thruſt night emptie ſtables ſo ſent tedious brutiſh ſeruice vnto wofull home laſt hell heauie recompence labour fie therefore vpon ſuch tyrant yet ſome maſters conſcience commandement doe ſome may doe giue libertie goe aſſemblie worſhip god yet oft time another euill way come haue nothing taught ſo one meanes liſt may ſee die miſerably ſort oh number great thus much theſe next ſort ſpoken verſe dwelling village opening next point verſ 11 vnwalled townes left deſolate driuen habitation laid waſte rifled robbed left ruinous enemy meaning ſecond point verſe appeareth cleerely beſt tranſlation theſe ſhe ſaith might ſafely returne habitation townes make vp ruines breach dwell againe therefore acknowledge goodneſſe god reſt yet beſide driuing owne home alſo much impoueriſhed ſuſtained great loſſe beſide feare trouble thereby beſides dutie thanks ſafe conuenient dwelling harbour ſhould teach v bee highly contented doct 2 verſ 11 patiently beare impaired decaied eſtate god prouidence without fault negligence falleth ſo ſeeing cannot ignorant god people haue part ſuch aduerſities v alſo loſſes fire water ſpoyling waſting good ſmall likelihood could ſeene thereof theſe thing fall like change god ſinne men couſonage deceit ſecuritie hypocriſie wilfull ignorance worldlineſſe idleneſſe delicacie exceſſe c god curſeth ſometimes beggerie raſh truſtings ſuretiſhip c ſhould beare puniſhments becauſe haue ſinned repentance god mich 7 7 hath ſtaied plague ſhould thankfully without murmuring receiue remnant commodity remaine wee reade men beniamin deſperatly impatiently leaue iudg 21 23 ſixe ſeuen becauſe ſee themſelues diſabled euer recouering former eſtate ſigne proud heart refuſing ſcorning ſtoope lord hand viſitation iob himſelfe whoſe loſſe yet know exceeding great oh madnes men iob 1 21 occupied commodity croſſed contrarie expectation wit end lord hath taken lent dreame eternitie note haue well feathered neſt ſay thinke well many yeeres oh death vnwelcome art thou ſuch nay ſmalleſt loſſes doe cauſe rage crie lord therefore ſeeing pulleth one another acquaint change teacheth thereby remaine ſomewhat plentie ſometime enioyed ſo haue vnthriftily waſted themſelues ſhould thankfull theſe willed full gladly came againe ruinous dwelling driuen force enemy whoſe heart cannot bow yeeld affliction meekely patiently doe rebelliouſly brutiſhly harden againſt god iuſt correction ſhall gaine thereby haue iudas broken peeces mallet terror deſpaire vtter confuſion oh full little doe ſuch know themſelues ſpurning againſt god kicke againſt prick god mercie prophet ſaith lamen 3 22 conſumed much giue breathing liuing therefore ſhould humbly receiue god correction laſt ſort ſhe calleth praiſe god came together gate city iudgement ſeates appointed theſe meeting ceaſed broken preuailing enemy deliuerance frequented againe puniſhment great calamity common wealth haue execution law iuſtice left laid downe tending ſo neceſſarily ſafegard men eſtates maintaining thereof cutting malefactor doer iniurie robber ſuch like great plague ſay well know ignorant whole ſafetie manner commonwealth maintained vpholden ſuch due execution law iudgement benefit may come ſelues doct 3 verſ 11 liue church commonwealth peace welfare haue cauſe magnifie god exceeding goodneſſe one reſpect hereby liue ſafe quiet houſes enioy good commodity greateſt may better haue libertie benefit true ſeruing god maketh reſt liberty ſauourie particular commodity enioyed v hereby bee acknowledged bee great bountifull rather ſuch common bleſſings vſually enioyed ſeldome reckoned v thanke worthie among thoſe went gate may vnderſtand either paſſed profit pleaſure neceſſarie vſe cauſe libertie may conceiue great therefore enioy ſame libertie muſt hold ſelues infinitly bound praiſe god behalfe haue heard debora hath called ſorts praiſing god euen ſuch benefit little account v thought great let warne v one common fault mindfull hereafter god goodneſſe miniſtring vſe daily benefit beſtoweth v preſent life wont ſunneſhine raine peaceable following calling within doores without vttering exchange commodity ſafe dwelling danger enemy benefit mill market ſhall ſay elſe freedome forrain enemy trauel without danger place place innumerable though haue thē great part common vnreaſonable creature yet without know life ſhould deadly weariſome v yea none al ſay certaine theſe common bleſſings many ſuch acknowledged number ſeuen yeers together ſhould bee remembred one meane oft time euery day ought theſe common benefit mentioned yet tranſitory cauſe apoſtle reſpect together ſerue life come charge v thing bee thankfull 1 theſ 5 19 ſorts heere ſpoken propheteſſe teacheth ſorts men particular perſons among know muſt anſwere god themſelues thankes euen elſewhere euery man commanded walke particular calling duty therof ſo ſaith apoſtle firſt epiſtle corinthian let euery man abide ſame vocation wherein hee called followeth 1 cor 7 20 text verſ 12 vp debora vp ariſe ſing ſong ariſe barak leade thy captiuity captiue thou ſonne abinoam 13 remaine haue dominion ouer mighty people lord hath giuen dominion ouer ſtrong debora hath called people iſrael thankeſgiuing ſenſe theſe two verſe 12 13 victorie three former verſes ſhee ſtirreth vp ſelfe twelfth verſe elegant figure might bee whetted example doe ſame ſhe calleth barak triumph certaine pompe make ſhew enemy captiuity conqueſt great honor god might vnderſtand canaanite moſt part ſlaine remained aliue priſoners hebrues moſt like little chopped piece god enemy 13 verſe ſhe amplifieth victorie another compariſon conquerers thoſe conquered theſe hauing valiant wiſe well prouided ouercame namely iſraelites remnant yet baſe contemptible ſumme theſe two verſes prouoking ſelfe praiſe god ſhee much doct 1 verſ 12 behinde dutie yet ſhe commendable therein wee haue heard alſo vrged thereto wee may ſee hath manner courſe god people thinke could neuer enough praiſing god haue entred ſeriouſly conſideration goodneſſe euer thought themſelues cold backward reſpect ought haue doubtleſſe due weighing cauſe made ſtil ſee god admirable kindnes till ſhe aſhamed vnthankfulneſſe ſome ſay cannot debora well thankfull prouoked others ſay good meanes word c anſwere cleare indeed wee come behinde duty enough moue v equall yea excell therein shee thus thankfull victorie wee haue need cauſe fight ſhee praiſeth god peace recouered hazard danger ten thouſand men enioy without putting queſtion ſhee bodily bleſſing haue infinite maintenance health welfare could ſhee haue preſent life beſides many ſpirituall ſeaſon yet wee come ſhort thankfulneſſe neuertheleſſe haue ſaid debora ſame may ſee dauid anna others hee pſalme hauing none equall performing duty affirming hee would doe three time nay ſeuen time day hee would doe openly congregation priuately himſelfe yet though hee much forgot himſelfe waxen dull behind therein hee quickeneth vp himſelfe ſaying ſoule praiſe thou lord al within pſal 103 1 praiſe holy name hee ſtirreth vp himſelfe wee ſee bee feruenter yet forward ſpeake god beſt ſeruants moſt feruent feele oftentimes kind ſleepy deadneſſe good duty remiſſeneſſe ſpirit creeping vpon certaine doe ſeeing carry corruption oft cauſe wearineſſe well time hauing greater power grace working ſubdue gather vp ſtirre themſelues againe ſuch occaſion earneſtneſſe ſo finde themſelues refreſhed new meditation ſlackneſſe double courage ſet vpon duty end helpe ſharpen themſelues dauid debora ſometime ſupported ſee moſes weake hand faine exod 17 12 holden vp aaron hur againſt amalek ſee manifeſt difference betwixt wicked though ſay like well prayer hearing thankeſgiuing yet profeſſe cannot endure away ſuch continuall ſeruice affirming vrged men ſhall neuer haue done beleeue greatly beholding god goodneſſe charge themſelues vnthankfulneſſe euen forwarder moſt conſidering vnprofitable ſeruants ſo ready poſt others teſtifying thereby beholding god hold themſelues thinke euery little bee enough doe god yea word away may ſerue turne euen froth offer mocking ſacrifice heart neuer enclining cannot ſuch thing rom 8 7 another thing verſe concerning barak hee ſhould ſhew ſolemne pomp ſet conqueſt victorie elearing next part verſe god giuen ouer enemy though victory warre vſed bee done heathen ouer ſuch conquered priding themſelues vttermoſt diſgrace ſubdued yet ſee ſpoken propheteſſe end god might haue honour therby one end ſhe propounded act owne giuing honour lord ſeeking man owne glory glory taking prou 25 27 doct 2 verſ 12 god prouoking thereby nay men would thinke due deſert yet euen let beware take let v acknowledge god goodneſſe thankfulneſſe vſe ſeruice honouring name fleſh pride ſelues yoking ſubduing enemy better act adonibezek moſt cruelly cut thumb hand foot ſeuenty king made dog eat bread vnder table hee might glorie extreme reproch ſhame act triumph common people god heathen done ſo prophane common manner hath war ſo like ſome ſort ſee day time peace tehre al ſorts hauing ſutes controuerſies depending betwixt get day aduerſary doe bring one meane poore eſtate ſpeake ſuch contend lawfully hauing good cauſe right ſide preuaile order iuſtice one againſt doe certaine manner triumph thereby one beareth hee graciouſly ſeaſoned another lowly mind remembreth though haue better hand wealth beſide whence hee came ſet vp glory fooliſhly welfare ouer aduerſary thankfull god therefore moderate ſober vſe ſuch liberty fruitfull good vſeth pride himſelfe ſcorne others boaſt ſucceſſe impudent prophane lawleſſe theſe triumph ouer aduerſary one good manner glorying hath gotten victorie himſelfe owne ſtrength moſt vnbeſeemingly ſlaue peſant vnbridled luſts glorying pride life reaſon honouring god debora barak meane verſ 13 ſet downe verſe ſeeing lord wrought wonderfully giuen many men euen huge army hand valiant noble warriers cauſed ſubdued weake meane though ſhee aſcribe firſt part verſe vnto perſons yet may know ſhe ment inſtruments onely appointed god get victory therefore latter part verſe ſhe maketh lord cauſe ſaying made able obtaine ſo preuaile ouer ſo dearely beloued like falleth v god ſmall meanes worketh great thing v let v learne ready ſee acknowledge example lord ſhall aſſwage extremity note ſeruants either paine ſickneſſe feare vtter vndoing cruelty enemy whereas none ſaw might bee like recouer themſelues helpe hope manward paſt ſay ſhal ſhew helpe likelihood haue looked time behold great goodneſſe wonder due praiſes preuenting notorious gunpowder treaſon remouall many great enemy people death onely like haue done god knoweth remembrance ſince entering late deceiſed queene bleſſed memorie king maieſty god inable tread vnder foot thankes doe theſe worthily require v moreouer ſee fruit goſpell moſt part ſo contemptible world great thing doth ſubduing ſtony heart many vnto power changing though great cumpaſſe land long time hath bin preached may ought lament hath preuailed yet grace ſincere preaching hath wrought many thouſands remembred thought vpon acknowledged god eternall praiſe euen age god hath done wonderfully meane great thing ſmall meanes caſting downe walles iericho ſeuen day compaſſing blowing trumpet rammes horne alſo inabling gedeon text 19 verſe ſecond part diuided three bee ſeene firſt entrance chapter firſt brought ſong firſt commended debora helpe warre 14 part fifteenth verſe occaſion mentioned next ſlothfulneſſe reproued tribe helpe battell done part fifteenth verſe 16 17 ſhee commendeth zebulun naphthali ieoparded liues brother eighteenth verſe meaning theſe verſes may ſee throughly looke yet muſt acknowledged difficulty ſome therfore cleare able labour remoue doubt may raiſed trouble reader end wee muſt remember ſaid debora firſt ſpeaketh ſecond part chapter helpe warre ſhee beginneth ephraim whereas ſome expound root ephraim roſe againſt amalek ioſhua beniamin vnderſtand ſhould fight againſt afterward ſay saul ſo indeed true theſe ſaid haue gone againſt amalek purpoſe heere part ſong debora ſignifieth fought againſt canaanite time therefore rather likely root ephraim ſhe could meane ioſhua dead long ſhe meaneth ſelfe one chiefe perſon tribe appeareth ſhee ephramite ſaid ſhe iudged iſrael dwelling vnder palme tree ramath bethel mount ephraim ſure charge authority battell taken hand ye obiect warre heere mentioned ſaid haue againſt amalek canaanite grant figuratiue ſpeech amalek vnderſtand canaanite alſo thus much anſwering firſt doubt theſe word ephraim roote aroſe againſt amalek next word follow immediately ſame verſe theſe thee beniamin fought againſt thee amalek heere vnderſtand word amalek beniamin ſhould vnderſtand saul tribe ſenſe saul yet vnborne certaine tribe beniamin appeareth theſe word text ſome tribe beniamin alſo adioyned themſelues debora firſt beginning battell though thought compariſon word 14 verſe haue meaning theſe firſt machir came ruler heere named machir noble family halfe tribe manaſſes came certaine worthy men helpe battell laſt word verſe theſe zebulun came handle pen writer haue meaning learned skilful lawyer exerciſed handling pen helpe might fitlieſt employed vſed whether weapon counſell firſt meaning verſ 15 16 part fifteenth verſe concerning iſſachar hath ſenſe tribe highly commended chiefe conſented debora alſo place barak ſent mount tabor ſo ſeemeth prince iſhachar ſent valley footman perill ieopardy iſraelites enemy ſet vpon great courage behaued themſelues valiantly therefore highly commended thus ſhe hauing mentioned helped battell ſhe turneth occaſion thoſe helpe beginning 15 verſe tribe ruben tribe reproued held backe great griefe brother fighting among ſo great danger come foorth helpe tribe dwelt beyond iorden fat paſtures appeareth much minding care cattell commoditie thereby neglected care commonwealth ſaid great thought heart reubenites diuiding themſelues brother whether meaning word theſe thought great loftie ſcorned goe deboras commandement woman whether thought wondring lamenting brother came well others helpe battell repetition word doth giue warrant take latter ſenſe lamentation ſhould ſaid oh reuben ſhould come ouer iorden helpe moſt tribe oh wondred much lamented beſides charge tribe proud inſolent wee may ought doe vpon vncertaine ground requireth good proofe auouching reuben reubenites came deſcribed calling trade keeper cattell place dwelt namely among goodly paſtures added ſatteſt thou among ſheepfolds heare bleating flockes ſo taken reubenites abode remained ſtill cattell danger declare thereby ſet pitie brother going helpe 17 verſe gilead like manner complained abode ſtill dwelling meaning verſe 17 place beyond iorden reubenites dwelling neere vnto brother iſraelites great ieopardie fighting enemy commeth another great doubt anſwered obiect ſeeing machir noble familie tribe manaſſe ſaid come helpe brother poſſeſſed gilead ſay gilead bee commended come reproued comming doubt anſwered thus manaſſe two ſonnes machir iair anſw came two great family poſſeſſed gilead therefore thoſe gileadites came machir could bee reproued came helpe familie iair alſo dwelt gilead came next reproued tribe dan reproued ſimply trauailing ſhips vpon ſea blamed remaining ſhips time whether ſo ſhelter themſelues thereby enemy ſea trafique rather goe helpe reſt worthie found fault ſo though ſtriken ſuch feare heard army enemy ſinne haſted reſt againſt enemy aſſiſt put themſelues ſhips ſo might paſſe eſcape follow owne priuate buſineſſe thing vtterly vnbeſeeming therefore worthily iuſtly reproued haue ſaid laſt tribe found fault tribe aſher excuſe themſelues abſent brother partly dwelt farre partly townes city ruinous well fenced therefore ſaid tarried home leſt enemy might haue taken occaſion abſence ſpoile ſaw might eaſily haue done doubt grieuous theſe tribe thus rebuked holy ghoſt would haue done partly owne cauſe might ſee great fault going helpe brother lightly ſoeuer accounted alſo might repent partly reſpect others ſhew come doctrine ſaid tribe commended reproued except two tribe zebulon naphtali ſpecially icopard liues brother followeth next verſe ſhe commendeth high manner though ſome ſenſe verſe 18 chiefe men tribe zebulon ſhe praiſed forwardnes againſt god enemy ſo great perill haue heard ridiculous thing iudgement men ſuch ſmall number goe againſt ſuch huge army valiant ſouldiers addreſſed warlike furniture might haue ſwept away leſſe houre preferred god word owne liues high place mentioned mount tabor ſignified appointed ſtand behold multitude canaanite yet flying away marching toward faith appeared bee ſo much greater therefore thus commended thus much meaning theſe fiue verſes haue cleered needfull made plaine doct verſe 14 15 ſtorie ſome difficultie therein next thing ſeeke benefit firſt commended yeelding helpe great worke lord ephraim beniamin iſhaker mentioned 14 15 verſes may ſee ſuch doe ſet themſelues god people ſeruice ſhall vnrecompenſed forgotten theſe regeſtred praiſe neither thinke labour trauell ſo beſtowed vaine whereas ſome obiect scripture finiſhed therefore man obiect looke ſame particular reward theſe enioyed meane chronicled monument thereof yet let know anſw faithfull conſtant end lord hath written name another booke farre durable euen booke remembrance wherein writeth workes saint may euer reward honour men angel though vſuall matth 25 34 men doe butler ioſeph meane let goe vnrewarded many kindneſſes duty done neighbour yet god leſſe bound beſt due deſert free promiſe gracious fauour ſay doe ſo one offer cup cold water vnto name diſciple becauſe mich 1 42 ſo lord leaue vnrewarded therefore woman goſpell powred ointment head sauiour ſaid mark 14 9 whereſoeuer goſpell ſhould preached act ſhould bee remembred ſpoken much ſhall honour god fruitfully faithfully may aſſure themſelues great reward hee ſhall forſake thing ſake ſhall receiue matth 19 29 hundred fold euen life beſides happineſe abideth life come oh therefore blockiſhnes vnbeliefe greateſt part euen chriſtendome deſiring enioy good day liue doe carefull manner take way thereto ſhift baddeſt ſort take part ſinfull pleaſures life meanes whereof though thinke themſelues ſurer hand play part wiſe men yet truth neuer finde quiet ſweete fruite goſpell yet many profeſſe euer attaine happie life looke oh thing preſent doe ſo dazle eye deceiueable beauty heart ſo hollow inconſtant vnfaithfull tickled loue liking thing pleaſeth humour diſhoneſt yea filthie ſoeuer drawne ſilly fiſh bait maruaile doe beleeue labour lord ſhall rewarded chuſing rather abide affliction embrace ſhort pleaſures ſinne oh number great malach 3 14 follow deuices deſires owne wicked heart vpbraiding godly ſmall gaine get zealous profeſſion religion indeed thing impoſſible vnbeleeuer ſee either vnfruitfulnes owne eſtate gaine contrarie wee ſee malach 3 aske plaine termes vaine ſerue god profit commeth thereby c ought trouble righteous ſee 16 verſe ſame chapter frailtie ſlip temptation dauid pſal 73 let doe pſal 73 13 verſ 17 enter sanctuarie god change opinion faſt one ſeeth another taken away fearefull manner death ſome haue liued feared neither hell iudgement day yet one hundred remaining behinde ſtill brought thing neerer chriſtian life thereby particularly theſe machir manaſſes zebulon doct 2 verſ 14 15 iſſachar chiefe men tribe yet forward readie ioyne reſt againſt god enemy wee learne mightieſt wealthieſt ſhould come behind others part god ſeruice put foorth themſelues theſe ſo doe ſo muſt ſee ſhall haue reproch negligence ſloth ſhall renowned god himſelfe wee ſee theſe enough put heart courage ſort men particularly ſinne haue plucked ſpeake place occaſion therefore ſay debora paſſeth theſe ſhe commended turneth ſhe diſcommendeth theſe verſes whereby may ſee verſ 15 16 17 great reproch thē helpe god houſe ſet forward worke ioyne ſeruants therein ſuch diſcourage brother let worke lie raw vnperfect fleſh aduerſaries god knoweth whether would alſo turne ſides ſhould tryed wherein amiſſe obſerue plaine dealing holy ghoſt narration ingenuouſly yeeldeth teſtimony praiſe well deſeruing ſo hee conceileth ſhame careleſſe ſlothfull rebuke without reſpect perſons dealing ſheweth courſe take ſolemne day wherin iudge world equity ſo ſhould driue fooles theſe conceit whereby beguile themſelues ſaying ruſh god doe neither good euill hee ſmite ſhall eſcape better others c errour till found contrary would neuer perſwaded eſtate good ſaying lord lord c though thereby ſhould haue entred kingdome true generall ſo particular bodily ſpirituall though corrupt practiſe wicked world ſee euery one himſelfe prouerbe ſpeaketh poſting regard needy others yet enter lord ſanctuary looke required word wee ſhall finde odious vnnaturall highly diſpleaſing ſight god compaſſion one another care one ouer another equity band duty requireth ſhould warme heart brother relieuing readily bodily neceſſities danger ſo ſhould comfort ſoules likewiſe holy inſtruction ſpirituall refreſhing good occaſion opportunity may theſe ſhould haue done warre ſo ought well peace dutie owe ſuperiours either nature age place gift inferiours backe encourage inſtruct equal admoniſh comfort viſit ſupport reſtore one meekeneſſe ſhall cauſe miniſters duty alone others practiſed wee might ſay indeed great benefit chriſtian fellowſhip whereas men looke vpon one another knew lieue haue roome company bee looked god ordinance whereby hee hath prouided duty caring one another ſhall bee nouriſhed contemned ſet naught yet would thus bee vnderſtood though men ought breake leaue lawfull calling ſeeke ſome ſay occaſions good conference c ſome idle phantaſticall perſons glad pretend ſuch thing end may liue idely held within bound yet may fall called neceſſarily ſome ſpeciall duty viſiting one another ſickneſſe eating drinking together time vpon ſome ſuch waighty iuſt occaſion may otherwiſe faithfulneſſe diligence attend vpon lawfull vocation vnleſſe conference good communication ſuch like god may duty calling alſo trauelling iourneying together buſineſſe may gathered reproofe tribe generall mentioned theſe three verſes let v marke ſomewhat perticularly 2 reuben gilead expreſly ſaid neglected duty owne profit bent ſeeking lend helpe owe found fault withall euen sauiour found like fault inuited luk 14 18 vnto another duty euen great ſupper theſe fight againſt god enemy excuſing abſence owne priuate advantage euery one way one hired farme another bought ox muſt euen go trie another married wife may bee added third ſort hearer mentioned sauiour whoſe ſinne ſame kind care world thornes rich choke ſo ſeed ſowne brings forth good fruit worldly minde ſloth men preferre owne mat 13 22 profit god buſineſſe far waighty god wiſe abide yet common ſinne worſt ſort profeſſors onely ſee martha loſt beſt part chriſt houſe cumbring ſelfe needleſly owne priuate commodity neglect paſſe duty god brother thoſe waighty puddle earthly pearles forgoe peerleſſe pearle faith regeneration could ſee farre gaineful beſt merchandiſe infinite degree excelling let v take heede ſeeing commonly ſo falleth wittingly careleſſe ſome duty forward waighty ſoeuer ſo v aime heauen ſome waighed downe bolt vpon heeles depth earthlineſſe ſo make dwelling vnder earth perpetuall darkneſſe occaſion ſin theſe two tribe bewailed debora ſpeaking ſong one thus diuiſion ruben diuided himſelfe brother great thought heart much maruelling lamenting ſo thus gilead remained beyond iordan ſhe ſhould ſay euen brother fighting enemy gilead ſat ſtill home yet buſineſſe concerned much themſelues lamented lamentable haue ſpoken one ſinne ſame may ſaid reſt much bee bewailed namely theſe neere akind euen ſo good men theſe techineſſe conceit ſiniſter corruption ſeparate men brother thereby make backward helping forward good thing otherwiſe might bee keeping vnruly order within compaſſe helping bring ſound good miniſtery commendable thing care induſtry oh ſhould grieue v wee ſee backward good thing ſhould bee forward indeed diuell hath ſo fare wound men diuide brother ſtand ſtifly defence ſo little doth greeue pierceth heart godly reſpect wrong done themſelues ſcandall offered others alſo becauſe deſerue thereby former forwardneſſe fruit ſhould bee called queſtion demas made light going paul hee writes mournfully timothy manner demas hath forſaken hath imbraced ſay hee 2 tim 4 10 reſteth preſent world maruell truth better man property lamentable perſonall blemiſhes euen man comely good ſhape part perſonable body hath wooden leg ſome groſſe disfiguring men obſerue commiſeration pity dan ſeuerally ſhe complaineth tribe fled away doct verſ 17 feare enemy dwelling place alſo worldly profit reuben haue heard expoſition verſe theſe another way another reſpect deſerue blame wee ſee namely feare enemy whereas ſhould haue rather vnderſtood behoued haue taken part brother ſo ill fauouredneſſe could bee ſeene eye vnſeemelineſſe teacheth ſlauiſh affection feare timerouſneſſe burthen god ſeruants faith damped hindred cannot haue proper worke harten encourage bee forward zealous worke lord ſhiftingly prouide themſelues therefore reuelation ſpirituall fearefulneſſe threatened ſeuerely reuel 21 8 adultery murther therefore doubtleſſe leſſe great blemiſh ſay men ſhamefull ſinne content ſhall beare brunt themſelues goe free ſhall ſmart wounded deeply ſhall reioyce howbeit adde fearefulneſſe comming falſe heart deſtitute loue god faith damnable diſobedience god trechery men ſo yet becauſe may infirmity cleaue right good ſeruant god muſt wiſely diſcerne cauſe whence ariſeth therefore muſt count alike haue good warning peter example meere frailty feared confeſſe maſter went himſelfe wept bitterly whereas whoſe feare riſeth falſhood meere carnall reſpects onely ſeeke groſly auoide danger relent ſinne therefore muſt waile pity haue ouercome frailty commend eſtate god giue ſtrength courage daring bold cenſure ſo farre ſay chriſt denie father farre falſhood malice reſolution chriſtian magnanimity yea much let v rather thinke ſtand beware fall theſe ſhe ſpeaketh men aſhur excuſed doct 2 verſ 17 comming forth helpe againſt enemy meanes weak defence home farre diſtance howſoeuer thought good reaſon abſence ſee alſo reproued ſpirit god debora teach v ſhall little boot v make defence ſinne wee cannot hide god hee looketh another thing hand wee ſhould refuſe obey word though ſome danger refuſe theſe heere diſpraiſed ſharpely reproued ſo ſo day iudgement ſhall onely put ſhame rebuke ecouerable loſſe ſlight gaine excuſe making alſo ſhall caſt god preſence euer thus wee haue heard ſhee hath commended tribe fight againſt enemy diſpraiſed thoſe refuſed hath ſaid nothing iuda simeon leui gad therfore neither haue thing ſay muſt haue ground ſpeake word remaineth firſt point ſecond part two tribe zebulun naphtali middeſt earthlineſſe feare pretence brother wee haue heard expoſition verſe put liues danger fighting enemy although haue ſpoken ſufficiently doct verſ 18 yet adde cauſe ſo require ſhould ready giue liues brother saint iohn meant ſaid wee ought ioh 3 16 lay downe line brother euen ſauiour leauing v example caſe falles ſeldome ſo yet doth ought ſeeke readineſſe willing minde ſeruice conſidering neuer like yeeld liues better maner vnleſſe 〈◊〉 lord cauſe goſpell directly manner one ſee ſome ready doe ſo ſome benefactor hath bountifull toward paul ſaith good bountifull man perhaps ſome die wee ought hold rom 5 7 liues condition beſide many caſualties whereto ſubiect ought alſo bee ready bee offered pleaſure god thing elſe enioy wee may ſee wiſe part wedded wee haue heere lent v heere liues themſelues rather sauiour profeſſeth ſaue life ſhall loſe priſing ſo high reckoning wee doe namely count paradiſe chiefe cauſe doe ſo dote vpon alſo ſo meanely eſteeme make account life come heart little long conclude oppoſition theſe forementioned tribe let v learne wiſedome iudge righteous iudgement let v marke repugnant example ſorts men zealous according knowledge one ſide careleſſe alſo action affection reward obſeruing lord honoureth encourageth recompenſeth one loue people maine bleſſings brandeth blacke cole infancy ſhame like abhorre portion ſo may like grace one abhorre practiſe followeth thirty fovre sermon fifth chapter booke ivdges verſ 19 king came fought fought king canaan taanach water megiddo receiued gaine money verſ 20 fought heauen euen ſtarres •• courſes fought againſt siſera verſ 21 riuer kiſhon ſwept away ancient riuer riuer kiſhon ſoule thou haſt marched valiantly verſ 22 horſe hoofes broken beating together mightie men theſe word contained ſecond point branch ſenſe theſe foure verſes ſecond part chapter wherein debora ſetteth downe manner battell behalfe enemy namely came ſolemnely fight well prouided accompanied king canaan country furniſh adorne army yet fought vnproſperouſly vnhappily hard ſucceſſe lord fought againſt heauen riuers water ſwallowed vp ſwept away horſes vnhoofed fought againſt theſe way ſcattered fell iſrael wonderfull manner multitude ſhew vnproſperous fighting ſet firſt generally 19 verſe particularly next three ſhall appeare come 19 verſe thus figure whereby without bitter vpbraiding ſhe intimateth ſhe expreſſeth receiued gaine money nay ioſt iſrael enioyed rich ſpoile like figure vſed pſalme broken heart thou wilt deſpiſe thou wilt make pſal 51 17 great account phraſe ſelfe vſe nipping ſcoffe much ſhe ſaid might put gaines eye c verſe alſo ſhe ſheweth pompe multitude enemy verſe 19 filled plaine betwixt mount tabor townes taanach megiddo euen riuers running called ſame name ſay debora doth well declare ill ſped namely got ſought looked meane ouerthrow ſpoile iſraelites nay rather miſerably ſpoiled diſtroyed themſelues two thing may noted one wee may ſee glorie wicked men floriſhing like greene bay tree ſay wicked men otherwiſe grant godly perſons may honourable great may ſee alſo glorie reacheth cloudes wee reade pſalme yea pſal 37 35 time warre yet wiſe ſhew time peace may yea glorie may ſholed prince almoſt companion king theſe ſay ſuch like may poſſibly ſee terror daunt grieue v aduancement heauineſſe matter hanging downe head righteous w •• may ſay may bee ſeene ſhall thus▪ surely god people may haue eye dazeled pompe glorie ſhall ſee pulled may hereby weaned eſtranged dangerous poyſoned baites would hurt haue done faith • ee downfall euen middeſt glorie heart deſire enioy outward thing becauſe lord ranke enemy secondly may cleaue god faithfully alſo waite conſtantly ſee glorie ſuch turned ſhame preuent repentance let vſe firſt thing vnto v ſecond note according prouerbs wicked doe alwaies roſte get hunting 2 prou 12 27 doe alwaies attaine promiſe themſelues earneſt deſire heart whereof haue great likelihood well hope god cutteth great vexation diſappointment yea godly ſhall ſee triumph debora iſrael ouer pharao though true fatted haue might looke yet haue deſtruction yet righteous may enuie ſee lord take part againſt leſt proud themſelues ſhould thinke god ſeeth croſſed purpoſes many time hope would moſt willingly enioy lord fruſtrateth mocketh king aram 2 king 6 12 ſecret plot purpoſes againſt king iſrael bewraied prophet eliſha hee ſheweth thereby haue alwaies commandement neither goe attempt without ſufferance may verified none elſe yet euen god reſiſteth proud lord thus matcheth diſappointeth ſeemeth good common dealing attaine aime looke ſo eſpecially fight againſt god play giant againſt heauen like nebuchadnezzar inſolencie vttereth ſelfe againſt poore church god many chuſe fitteſt obiect vomit poyſon vpon lord anſwerable manner riſeth vp ſcatters lookes downe heauen laugh ſcorne ſcatters banded themſelues againſt annointed example ſake though scripture full ſuch let theſe two time ſuffice one would build citie ſhould gen 11 4 reach vp heauen get name lord ſet himſelfe againſt caſt downe building called name thereof babell confuſion pride like haue growne god let alone ſuffered worke goe forward example haman ſo inward king eſter 7 10 aduanced looked yet riſe higher vnlooked caſt downe dignitie ſhame made ſutable note glorie thus fared siſera ſtead great ſucceſſes increaſings purpoſes dignity defeated thereof faine loſe enioyed lord making ambition next meane ouerthrow god deales many ſome riſing dunghill great wealth honour ioynted otherwiſe oftentimes want nothing life length day enioy floriſhing eſtate ſtill behold euen way meeteth death ſomtime reprochfull enough ſure paine woe enough beſides going hence hee cut iolitie one blow fearing god might haue liued could haue prolonged day ſaid 19 verſe generall ill proſpering againſt verſe 20 iſrael fighting particularly debora ſheweth verſe euen heauen higher region aire ſtarres planet raiſed raine winde face yea haile tempeſts fight againſt siſera ſo thereby god ſhewed himſelfe againſt preparation furniture charets horſes men ſeruing purpoſe diſappointing teacheth v god heauen earth power ſhall fight againſt doct verſ 20 leuit 26 19 exod 14 28 god enemy euen plague written booke god doe commandement ſeaze vpon torment haile aboue ſlew god enemy sunne ſtood ſtill end ſo froſts ioſh 10 11 12 flood plague tamine ſuch haue time fought againſt god haue handled point largely onely anſwere one obiection place obiected godly obiect ſuſtaine forementioned iudgements like well wicked therefore ſhall wee able proue ſay lord lay vpon enemy aimed alone iob ſheepe ſeruants burnt vp deuoured fire heauen satan would iob 1 16 thereby haue perſwaded god himſelf made warre thence body alſo ſmitten ſore byles ſole foote vnto crowne head tooke potſheard ſcrape anſwere god ſendeth theſe like child trial correction anſw heale ſome dangerous diſeaſe pride looſenes worldlineſſe c enemy ſcourges wicked liues begin helliſh torment euer true ſo ſinnes manifeſt wee may ſo iudge particular offender meaneth leſſe toward without feare iniurying vnleſſe repent next particular aſſiſtant iſrael ſaid haue fought againſt verſe 21 siſera riuer kiſhon though vſually deep yet water roſe higher ouerflowed bankes ſpred becauſe army met therefore deſcribed riuer mettings namely army word better tranſlated ſo ſome doe tranſlate anctent riuer elegant repetition word ſheweth drowned carried away many enemy euen duſt filthineſſe ſwept houſe broo • e ſlaine way could men many place large many flying deſtroyed thing neither feared enemy made reckoning god people doth worthily teach v walke vprightly god cauſeth many thing lend helpe v wee neuer thought looked onely perſons kinde v alſo commodity comfort incouragements meete v yea place dwell whither come ſame thing haue fatall deadly enemy others helpfull made friendly vnto v iacob thus faithfull lord hee inriched greatly ouer hee euer looked ſaw likelihood rather contrary ſo dealt father iſaac among ſtrangers land ſo prouideth many deare ſeruants comming ſtrangers note place little likely get either grace knowledge commodity hath yet giuing honeſt good heart bleſſed otherwiſe loue fauour beſt ſweete life inward peace growing goodneſſe fruite prayer holy labour contentment ſuch like may euer worthily perſwade get god ſeruice vpright hearted toward ſeeing godlineſſe 1 tim 1 12 bringeth ſo many great commodity ſpake ſomewhat alſo contrary may ſaid men ſeeke lord heart neither carefull way may pleaſe proſper long yet like attaine moſt loſe euen toſſed many calamity greateſt god frowneth vpon beleeue danger whereof may eaſily gathered drunkard prouerbs ſtricken ſaid ſinne fruites whoredome ſuch like hee ſicke prou 23 35 beaten hee knew therefore would follow ſinne yet ſtill ſpeech vttered debora ſoule thou haſt marched valiantly 2 hebrew ſoule thou haſt trod downe ſtrength namely enemy know great wee take firſt ſenſe ſhe triumpheth generall manner courage furtherance god gaue latter ſame particularly ſhe ſpeaketh ſoule reioycingly ſhe trode vnder foote might ſtrength ſeeing god armed power againſt ſo great enemy ſhe ſhould ſay therefore ſhe need feare power none hereafter god ſtill affoord worthie inſtruction wee haue ſeene god hath giuen v great deliuerance wee truſted ſhe heere wee ſhould euerafter promiſe ſelues 2 chron 16 8 hee doe like v ſtill ſeeking like manner ſo note rom 5 4 may harten ſelues beleeue agreeth saint paul doctrine experience bringeth hope practiſe ſaying god hath 2 cor 1 10 deliuered v doth deliuer v wee truſt yet hereafter alſo hee deliuer v doubleſſe experience proper fruit faith bringeth forth without life wee freed affliction becauſe haue eſcaped one remaine ſtill ſubiect ſame like ſhall boot v haue ouercommers one foiled another may eaſily euen leſſer without armour vnbeleefe faith wee ouercame greater surely ſhould haue booted dauid haue killed beare ſlaine lion philiſtim therefore learne hence though ought beleeue promiſe ſake yet much better doe ought doe haue pawne lying v meane experience truth hard caſe haue neither third thing made canaanite fight vnproſperouſly againſt verſ 22 iſrael breaking horſe hoofes oft beating together mighty horſe hoofes naturally moſt ſound ſtrong ſo eaſily cleft aſunder broken ranne heere ſuch violence skirmiſh ſaue themſelues ſo ſmote one againſt another broke hoofes caſe wee know could neither ſit horſes purſue enemy neither ſhift themſelues flying moſt liuely teacheth v man ſhould truſt owne ſtrength ſtrength horſe charrets rich prince power earthly thing whatſoeuer eaſie lord leaue men diſappoint vaine confidence young yeeres great wealth hope long life ſuch like plucke pharaoh chariot wheeles heere breake horſes hoofes canaanite ſo bring vpon deſtruction thereby thus haue heard ſecond branch ſecond part chapter hard ill ſucceſſe canaanite battell verſ 23 curſe ye meroz ſaid angell lord curſe inhabitant thereof becauſe came helpe lord helpe lord againſt mighty 24 iael wife heber kenite ſhall bleſſed aboue woman bleſſed ſhall ſhe aboue woman dwelling tent 25 asked water ſhe gaue milke ſhe brought forth butter lordly diſh 26 put hand naile right hand workemans hammer hammer ſmote ſhe siſera ſhe ſmote head ſhe wounded pierced temple 27 bowed downe feete hee fell downe lay ſtill foot hee bowed downe fell ſunke downe lay dead theſe verſes part ſong followeth third laſt ſenſe theſe 5 verſes branch ſecond part chapter wherein debora firſt ſetteth downe wrath god againſt ſuch refuſed helpe worke lord merozites ſhee doth 23 verſe ſhe declareth fauour god toward helped therein beſides thoſe battell iael ſhe doth 4 verſes particularly 23 verſe ſhe calleth ſong curſe city neare place battell yet inhabitant thereof refuſed helpe brother called thereto requeſted tribe mentioned ſome kind excuſing themſelues neither deſired though knew theſe beheld yet would ſet hand helpe therefore thus dealt ſeeing might thought come ſtomacke reuenge ſhee pronounced ſuch ſharpe threat againſt therefore ſhe ſaith angell god bad ſing ſo thereafter learne may doe cursing verſ 23 ſort lawfull v curſe man ſatisfie owne reuenging mindes deale owne matter muſt loue enemy sauiour teacheth bleſſe curſe v god mat 5 44 time ſhew hee haue bee deſtroyed know approue ſame harder learne becauſe corruption lurketh v chained vp notorious breaking willingly ſeeking opportunity pretence zeale ſhrowde ſelfe vnder euen ſecret traitor ſeeing dore open leadeth prince chamber dare goe alone waiteth till ſome noble guard paſſeth company cunningly conueyeth himſelfe worke miſchiefe pray grace therefore watch dore lip many good word bleſſing paſſe let v beware curſed ſpeech paſſe alſo vnder colour ſoeuer thus dauid directed god faithful curſed god iam 2 10 11 enemy pſalme yet otherwiſe kind affection ſame euill bewaile samuel ieremy pſal 109 6 c sauiour bewaile weepe deſtruction wicked men wherin haue doubt pleaſed god ſuch demand ſhall doe vexe godly rage againſt goſpell anſwere pray god change mind weaken power may able doe euill would granted wee muſt craue ſtrength beare wee muſt goe vnder heere wee muſt learne contrary example theſe meroz obey god calling v duty followed debora barak helpe thoſe want need eſpecially follow calling contrary theſe men meroz people peniel succoth ſeuenth chapter denied refreſh gedeon men purſued enemy theſe pitifully handled men meroz curſed helping brother thinke ſhall done onely helpe ſeruants chriſt vexe grieue oppreſſe thing diſſwade ſuch courſe yet let themſelues euer like daily bee taken hence death ſhall note come account ſee euery ſide many vnlike remaine ſhall haue god againſt hath profeſſed hee bee enemy thoſe enemy meroz briefly ſo long worke vnwilling repeate ſame thing often ſhe calleth god people bleſſe wiſh well iael one verſe 24 bleſſed among woman linage kindred dwelt tent kenites repeateth word force thus lord would haue commended vnto poſteritie rouzing vp ſlack backward good thing ſhall ſee god doth ſo highly account readineſſe ſome buſineſſe may quickned ſame care well deeply imprinted men heart throughly perſwaded thē often thought god knoweth workes plentifull rewarder heb 11 6 ſeeke pleaſe would much forward euery one thing commanded haue ſpoke alſo occaſion offered debora commendeth wiſedome iael ſuch proceeded verſe 25 faith ſhe called siſera tent couered gaue drinke fit caſt ſleepe ſaid ſhe gaue butter alſo lordly diſh likely ſhe offered food might drinke liberally theſe ſhe made way eaſily ſhe afterward brought paſſe example taught wiſe circumſpect thing goe though requiſite bee lawfull yet wee bee circumſpect doe forecaſt inconueniences doe ſeaſon fit time good manner right end may much griefe diſcommodity inconuenience follow much diſquiet v raſhnes improuidence wee may bring ill end yet lawfully taken hand v men embrace religion yet walke looſly lightly rebecca ſhe ſaw iacob deare ſonne deadly hated gen 27 43 brother eſau hee ſought opportunitie kill onely keepe way ſo might one time haue cain brother abel auoided many danger ſending far countrey father houſe whence ſhe came dwell though hard forbeare ſight long time euen brother laban padam aram ſhe knew ſpace wrath brother would abated ſhe alſo ſaid wiſe part therefore weightie matter wiſedome abigall preſeruing houſe fooliſhnes 1 sam 25 28 nabal otherwiſe deſtroyed commendable ſuch wiſedome preſerue liues good credit grace inward peace therewith preuent danger auoide many needleſſe trouble great furtherance liue well make liues fruitful comfortable ſelues onely take wee heed aſcribe naught note wit perke aboue meete humilitie ſerue god prouidence ſo ſhall finde ſmall benefit free careleſneſſe raſhnes fooliſhnes throughout life cauſe much euill griefe vnwelcome ſee chapter 3 15 debora addeth wiſedome iael courage fortitude verſe 26 ſenſe point courage woman ſet vpon ſo valiant captaine siſera take naile one hand hammer ſeemeth weapon hand aduenture ſtrike temple head lay though aſleepe might hee firſt blow haue ſtarted riſen vp paine ſo haue ouerthrowne rage great deale likely haue receiued deadly wound hand forme therefore fortitude manniſhnes ſtoutnes courage nature ſay nothing faith laſt verſe third point ſecond part chapter ſenſe verſe 27 hee almoſt ſlaine debora ſetteth downe certaine motion appeare ſuch haue deadly blow violent death ſo wounded body extremitie paine bowed twice thrice went riſe hauing ſtrength fell downe againe lay miſerably feete iael thus god brought proud siſera ſhame fearfull end though ſo valiant captaine hand woman ſhall wee ſay surely teacheth god doe ſome great thing alſo fit inable thereunto euen saul himſelfe heart giuen furniſhed gift gouernment god called moſes hee ſhould ſent 1 sam 10 9 exod 3 11 10 26 pharao carrie people iſrael egypt hee complaine diſable himſelfe god furniſhed hee waxed bold virgin mary word brought ſhe ſhould mother luke 1 35 sauiour anſwered aſtoniſhment thing ſeeing know man told angell holy ghoſt ſhall come vpon thee power moſt high ſhall ouer ſhadow thee therefore alſo holy thing ſhall borne thee ſhall called ſonne god mary ſaid behold ſeruant lord vnto according thy word example infinite may brought purpoſe containe ſelfe adding onely one ſhould apoſtles poore fiſhermen doe ſo great worke ſubdue greateſt part world doctrine man would haue vndertaken tame wilde beaſts wilderneſſe chriſts ſending moſt powerfull gift holy ghoſt confirming faith increaſe knowledge courage paine taking withſtand enemy gift tongue working miracle wee ſee came ſo paſſe though ſuch thing wrought theſe day neither neceſſarie ſuch ſhould wrought yet many ordinarie workes god haue done latter age great paſſed ouer ſlightly vnlike thing priuate man woman haue outward gift god ſpeake onely reade scripture owne language vnlike ſay ſuch liuing among people moſt prophane bad behauiour ſhould bee note tainted defiled toucheth pitch nay baited diſgraced ſcorned many place ſhould faint diſcouraged driuen hope profeſſion ſhould walke vprightnes heart innocencie hand ſo farre ſo long till light ſo ſhining doth lighten ſome theſe hated ſat long darknes cauſe embrace conuerſation ſuch deadly enemy ſay thing wondred euen ſee lambe lion feede together yet god bee eſay 11 6 bleſſed ſo day ſome place ſo hath bin former time men way haue pleaſed lord hath cauſed prou 16 7 enemy one alſo heart intirely knit yea many ſillie perſons ſo furniſhed grace god haue forced great one wiſh heart wealth power like yet miniſter goſpell challenge openly keepe commandements ieſus name reuel 12 17 rebuke threaten worker iniquitie though louing iohn 16 8 1 tim 4 16 kinde preacher done ſaue ſoules turning euill way ſuch miniſter ſay hated good counted enemie telling truth alſo accuſed gal 4 16 purſued alſo ſuffered quiet among yet ſhould conſtantly hold labour life vnoffenſiue work god thinke like continue ſo gracious courſe middeſt ſo many diſcouragements whereof haue mentioned lord ſhould giue faith beleeue loue ſhould feed lambes ſheep ſo ioh 21 15 aſſure themſelues ſhall plentifully rewarded end giue ſhoulders meane courage beare ſo great heb 11 6 burthen theſe ſmall thing yet god worketh among v may ſee regardeth v ſome former time laſt thing noted ſecond part siſera lord pulled downe caſt ſo great honour valiantnes verſ 27 great abaſement ſuch nimrod driuen ſo great ſtreight lurke another man houſe daring peere foorth ſillie bird beaten buſh hawke ſo yet farre baſer fall hand feete woman let v learne lord bringeth naught high haughtie vtter doct verſ 3 27 ſhame ſo great proud ſtrange thing scripture finde thus though fooles wonder learne inſtruction lord caſteth mightie ſeate witneſſe abimilech deſperate mood ſtriken head milſtone iudg 9 54 woman called page bid runne leſt ſhould ſaid woman ſlew yet ſaid reprochfull enough wit baſe page ſlew agreeth well point hand thus abſolon ſtomacke riſe againſt father ſo kinde brought baſe reprochful death fit ſuch one 2 sam 18 15 thruſt ioabs common ſouldiers iezabel ſcorning god prophet according foretelling lord made dogges meate dung vpon earth throwne window 2 king 9 37 royall palace proud ſtout iewes railed peter calling deſpitefully drunken man ſo terrified ſin act 2 37 glad ſeeke comforted euen ſcorned well whoſe pride lord reſiſteth mercie good hee paul appalling firſt ſending poore ananias comforter prey god preuented reſt haue mentioned excepted alſo ſecond act ſay reſiſted coſt vtter vndoing ſo fooliſhnes preaching pleaſeth 1 cor 1 21 world call humble ſubmitting themſelues holy doctrine ſaued muſt attaine generation viper phariſies glad come iohns miniſterie ſo tooke good therefore humble meeke graced 1 pet 5 7 finde fauour proud reſiſteth ſetteth himſelfe againſt till confounded ſo abide brought naught therefore let ſcorners enemy taunt mocke ſimple profeſſors truth like edomites ſhall one day wiſh like iudge happie themſelues diues ſuperfluitie wiſh might haue eſtate lazarus ſaw hope attaine thouſand part euen might dip finger cold water quench thirſt yet might granted therefore let v ſtay containe ſelues wee ſhall ſee theſe boaſters contemners need hold courſe wee ſhall ſee ſay ſwept away ſhall ſo little cauſe ſhall ſee hauing teeth water dainty wiſe iolitie proſperitie enemy church ſee ouerthrow faith count floriſhing bragges vaine crake thus pſal 73 18 19 much ſaid ſecond part chapter thirtie five sermon fifth chapter booke ivdges third part chapter verſ 28 mother siſera looked window cried latteſſe charet ſo long comming tarrie wheeles charets c verſ 29 wiſe lady anſwered yea ſhe anſwered ſelfe owne word verſ 30 haue gotten diuide ſpoile euery man hath maide two siſera hath prey diuers coloured garment prey ſundrie colour made needle worke ſides chiefe ſpoile verſ 31 let thine enemy periſh lord loue ſhall sunne ariſeth might land reſt fortie yeeres theſe word contained third laſt part ſenſe theſe verſes ſong debora ſo chapter hath two member firſt ſhe bringeth boaſtings woman enemy god people siſeras deare friend derides firſt three verſes laſt member ſhe oppoſeth propheticall prayer againſt boaſtings wiſhing therein remainder god enemy deſtruction iſraelites increaſe good thing increaſe ſhe laieth compariſon sunne riſing noone tide euen ſuch ſhe wiſheth particularly come firſt point ſhe ſaith siſeras mother looking 28 particularly longing ſonnes retune great ſpoile bootie fearing yet hardeſt becauſe tarried ſo long till ſhe anſwered lady ſo anſwered herſelfe buſie diuiding ſpoile place laieth exceeding care parent haue welfare doct verſe 28 child thought take likelihood danger betwixt hope feare long ſight much penſiue troubled within themſelues eſpecially perill ſetting apart odious 1 sam • 5 2 sam 18 33 fact siſera commendable mother according rule nature hope long proſperous returne feare contrarie saul king iſrael knew father affection ſo tender ouer ſent ſeeke aſſes tarried long 1 sam 9 5 finding haſted home leſt father ſhould turne care recouering aſſes care ſonne iob though farre better reſpect feared euen ſonnes feaſted together increaſe loue leſt ſhould offend god dauid charge ioab abounding tender loue toward ſonne abſolon hee made warre againſt ſtreightly command intreate gently paul teacheth ſhould haue care owne well becommeth 1 tim 5 8 contrarie vnnaturall whether wee reſpect neglect bodily maintenance ſo leauing ſinke
