though knoweth wofull brought vp idle without lawfull trade life deſtitute neceſſaries vnderſtand salomon teach childe c elſe may teach thee gallowes prou 22 6 ſinne defect vnnaturalnes parent child allowed ſo much siſeras mother 2 tim 3 3 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 laſt mentioned ſo exceſſe another ſinne farre common parent fond ouer child cannot abſtaine ſhe wing affection toward without diſcretion wit vnruly diſobedient ſubtill wilfull well ſimple timerous tractable religious whereby giue occaſion nay incourage abuſe boldly ſaucily ſmall reſpect winde way liſt thus dauid adoniah ely ſonnes found ſmarted accordingly whereas men ſhould hold child godly awe keepe within compaſſe authoritie god hath giuen ouer yet rigour neither voide parentlike kindneſſe want regard parent toward child ſides great inconuenience note falleth ſome handled oppreſſed vnſeaſonable ſeueritie deſerue cockered much indulgence lenitie till made much worſe much vnlike laſt mentioned affection parent rather branch ſome deceiuable humour deale loue child vnequally yet cariage themſelues equally deſerued affecting one ſome outward reſpect priuate conceit iſaac eſau dauid abſolon thought ſuch another found yet another error parent toward child farre carried affection becauſe permitted vnto nay commanded prouided therefore runne moſt troubleſome penſiue care prouide thereby fall moſt noiſome temptation ſnares diuell benefit whereas ought haue well learned leſſon affection toward ſhould offend god ſakes neglect loſe grace neither leaue worke charitie mercie vndone ieopard owne ſaluation wounding conſcience manner way ſhould conſider ill pitie towards child make impious againſt god iniurious againſt man moſt againſt themſelues nay rather torment ſhall note conſciences vnleſſe worſe remember haue increaſed childrens portion complaint poore worldlineſſe muſt goe ſuſtaine endleſſe woe thus ſpeake ought child marked affection parent according nature rectified ſanctified toward child though weaken eſtate preferment haue noted fact calebs endowing daughter ought ſufficient motiue perſwaſion child euer ſhew reuerence obedience thankfulnes though many parent mother eſpecially moſt hardly bee brought keepe within bound toward child may come yeeres diſcretion iuſtly complaine haue ſhewed loue leſſe ſet regarded oh haue obſerued ſeene ſpeake one two another occaſion may giuen ſay another place siſeras mother affection siſras mother ſpeech haue heard much longing returne followeth verſe lady among verſe 29 30 meaning wife thought anſwered ſuch wiſe appeareth text ſhe ſorrowful ready take comfort word euen heauineſſe vnwelcome ſelfe would willingly eaſily brought deſire comfort yea though miniſtred good ground aright ſumme comfort doubt queſtion made siſera got victorie ouer enemy tariance ſuch caſes falleth diſtributing bootie ſpoile taken therein euery one according labour condition worthineſſe ſaid much great value ſo noble conqueſt could ſhort time diſpatched conceit falſe perſwaſion lady wherein reſted comfort themſelues long tariance ſetteth worthie inſtructiō v namely readie people carried away vaine doct verſ 29 conceit vngrounded hope comfort eaſily deceiue themſelues therewith whereas ſhould looke haue good warrant wherein take comfort elſe thing common prouerbe ſpeaketh namely building caſtles ayre euen hee dreameth ſleeping imagineth waking thing hee deſireth ſhall euen ſo come paſſe hee would haue fooliſh pleaſe one ſelfe thinking may finde ſuch maſſe gold aduanced ſuch ſuch honour thereupon take pleaſure promiſing himſelfe pleaſant life hee leade fooliſhnes thus deceiue man ſelfe much greater wiſedome better ground hath wiſe men world called doe make common practiſe yet doe ſcorne fanſies dreames haue naught reckon long ſhall liue eſtate hope come better make account great bargaines note ſhall haue great gainings commings plentifull increaſe corne cattell commodity ſhall bring foorth others another kinde euen beſt liketh humour doe ſeriouſly beate braines may reuenged vpon deadly hate meanes way vſe bring low haue another ſort reſolue merrie mate companion drinking whoring ſundrie kindes play paſtime whereas many time cut hope come laſteth theſe ſuch like agag merrily promiſed himſelfe al feare death paſt hand warrant haue theſe conceit fond deluſions dangerous dreames iames mocketh one ſort ſaying goe ye ſay morrow goe ſuch place c iames 4 13 againe salomon challengeth ſorts asking boaſt prou 27 1 morow cannot tell may fall ere morow ſuch changeable world alteration may come obſerue may ſee daily iuſt condemning ſuch meere fooles reſt vpon ſuch bruſed reedes broken hold yet goe wiſe men many haue made account theſe way haue mentioned haue fulfilled vexe god people heart threatning roote haman iewes yet haue themſelues note reckoning accompliſhed brought paſſe ouerthrowne laid duſt ſuch wormes looke haue lord commandement appoint hee ſhall rule world diſpoſe thing ſerue turnes yet abſurd thing one among many aſhamed boldnes folly wearie repented doth take better courſe ſeeketh haue warrant good aſſurance comforteth himſelfe many take example whit wiſer better ſight folly theſe men make appeare groſſe let v put caſe theſe future ioyes vncertaine ſeene found ſure enioy pleaſures profit iolities make account alſo long ſenſe ſtrength would ſuffer gotten muſt ſoone forced old barzillai age giue 2 sam 19 35 ouer ſay diſcerne betwixt good euill haue taſte eate wee drinke wee heare voyce ſinging men woman although theſe dangerous error ſay leſſe yet ſay particuler aberration action while many haue taught doe profeſſe better gouerned whereas another kind conceitednes wit erroneous iudgement leſſe common farre dangerous becauſe directly concerneth hope eternal life content fixe men opinion renouncing pure word god light direction whoſe liues cannot poſſibly pleaſe god haue faith beleeue promiſes vnſauourie damnable doctrine rome whoſe light darkneſſe beſt comfort deadly ſtrong error blaſphemous deluſions others meere ignorance ſuffer themſelues led fooles paradiſe conceiuing ſtrangely good caſe becauſe falſe perſwaſion god mercifull none worſt ſort god trow neuer made damne meane well ſay heare pray receiue sacrament loue honeſtie thouſand ſuch worne reaſons yet error ſo ſtrong eſpecially kinde euery man cleaueth conceit prouerbe wee eaſily beleeue wee would haue ſo whereas god knoweth end hope ſhame mother siſera neuer notably diſappointed hope expectation theſe fooles ſhall looke effect thereof ſpiders web ſwept downe moment returne little digreſſed meane men putting confidence thing changeable tranſitorie much haue ſpoken vaniſh ſhort time ſo wiſedome hunt ſuch thing child doe butterflye make felicitie god appointed better thing attained come nay ſeeing muſt giue account note theſe doings ſhall neuer able doe comfort one among thouſand wiſedome counted muſt pleaſures ſinne enioyed ſo little muſt ſay heare ſentence pronounced vpon depart ye louers pleaſures god endleſſe woe weeping luke 13 47 2 tim 3 4 gnaſhing teeth ſhall would needes preferre ſhort ſmall folly happineſſe eternall therefore let v learne firſt ground opinion word ſure wee well iuſtifie hope conceit reioyce theſe thing ſtand v whereof haue good warrant god owne mouth cannot deceiue v fruſtrate hope yee aske reioycing meane anſwere know luke • 0 20 name written heauen endeuour haue alwaies good conſcience god men haue ioy holy ghoſt act 23 1 perſwaded crowne glorie laid vp v wee ſhall lay 2 cor 1 12 2 cor 5 1 downe tabernacle body ſhall haue finiſhed courſe manner word ioy ought lord alſufficiencie let v ſtead boaſtings make vaine vncertaine deceiuable hope ioy theſe heathen prophane lady might haue waited hoped siſeras ioyfull returne till eye fallen head could haue enioyed looked farre firſt particularly 30 verſe debora propheteſſe laieth verſe 30 doct ſong lady deſcant diuiding ſpoile theſe two point beſides good euery ſouldier got maide two siſera precious thing namely garment diuers colour wrought needle coſtly firſt muſt need ſo immodeſtly vnchaſtly breake foorth debora ſaith ſpeaking common ſouldiers euery one got maide two pleaſure ſo vnmeete talke woman haue mouthes ſheweth true knowledge god word whoredome paſtime maygame matter laugh euen among woman well men yea euen aged themſelues ſhould goe others ſobrietie ſhall behold yet delight ſpeake ſee heare vncleane action report euen weightie matter alſo lightly ſet leſſe marueile ſo euen goſpell preached may ſeene ſo ſo much may praiſe god highly haue receiued light conſcience make difference betwixt good euill abhorre haue deteſtation vngracious rotten kinde ſpeech beſeeming chriſtians ſuch curſed workes darkneſſe doe farre liue darkneſſe walke vnbeliefe theſe lady aſcribe siſera coſtlieſt beſt thing haue heard beſides wee ſee ſuch deceiued themſelues erroneous conceit hath ſhewed ſo wee may ſee thing beſt account ignorant vnbeleeuers note iolitie earthly glorie thing coſtly precious eſtimation men thankes god receiue making heauen treaſure portion ſuch matter acquainted doe almoſt dreame ſtill teach god ſeruants great portion haue thing greateſt price world reſt treaſure thing durable eternall acclamation ioy debora concludes ſong praying verſe 31 siſera triumphed ſo might al god enemy meaning deſtroyed ſo like enemy god might contrarie loue lord may preſerued multiplied beautified good thing euen sunne groweth beautie noonetide firſt siſera ſhamefully ſlaine returned home victorie mother alſo feare much let v learne euill wicked feare ſhall light vpon feares many scripture teſtifieth feare ſhall vpon euery ſide euen ſorrowes alſo many whereas pſal 32 10 noted doe pleaſe themſelues greatly hope obiect beſt thing ſome may thinke contradict ſelfe ſaying afraid fearfull anſwere may haue feare meane hope diuers anſw time yet neither good hope deceiuable feare troubleſome beſide wicked perſons ſame kinde feare ſeene moſt leaſt euill boldnes worſer ſort wicked men incline feare properly naturally companion ſinne ignorance vnbeliefe hope preſume wilfully 1 ioh 4 18 labour expell feare though great part doe indeede yet becauſe violent thing continuall therefore oft time miſtruſt feare ſuſpition trouble come place againe may ſee liſt marke ſo balaam wiſhing hee might numb 23 10 haue died death righteous feared ſhould doe ſo ſame may ſay many running deep debt god conſcience accuſeth ſhall one time called vnwelcome account ſo thing feare ſhall 1 cor 11 31 come vpon yet come agreement god iudging themſelues ſo may bee iudged bee free feare frailtie permit iudgement therefore refuſing ſo doe feare iuſtly falleth vpon ſaying salomon proueth haue many feares hee ſaith wicked ſlieth man purſueth feare prou 28 1 may ſeene haue poſſeſſed phariſies yet bare moſt boldly men word nicodemus bewraying fellow phariſies ill conſcience feare ſaying chriſt know thou art ioh 3 2 teacher ſent god acknowledge thy great miracle hee ſhould haue added though wee knowne ſuch thing men yet thus v wee meete talke thee together afraid ſome aske ſhall doe ſuch ſhall aduiſe ſhake feares plucke vp heart againſt doubtleſſe fight againſt conſcience make impudent hardned much worſe whereas accuſe cannot preuent ſuch feare remouing cauſe thereof ſinne let next perſwaded repent reade third captaine came e • beholding 2 king 1 14 two fellowes deuoured fire heauen meſſage prophet ſo imperiouſly boldly came ſubmiſnes entreated come downe king euen ſo come ſelues aske thy conſcience make thee feare thou findeſt lord hath controuerſie thee depending thou canſt quiet goe ſeeke agreement captaine follie ſtand lord thy conſcience accuſe 1 ioh 3 20 thee greater knowing much againſt thee thou canſt come lord ſay truth thine heart lord feare leſt ſinne ſhould bring ſome ſudden deſtruction vpon haue peace within without becauſe thy diſpleaſure goe continually hazard ſome fruite thereof beſides eternall therefore ſay lord humble cauſe feare ſinne puniſhment turne terror broken heartedneſſe ſin ſo bring peace quietnes againe ſoule doe thus ſay thy feares ſhall vaniſh otherwiſe ſhall pitie thee thou pitieſt thy ſelfe taking way remoue purpoſe aske prieſts goſpell meete feared chriſt would need crucifie might rid roſe againe bring greater feare vpon laſt firſt would wiſe feare ſinne higheſt yet ſee conſtrained feare ſo doubt ſome hardned doe put feare away hauing conſciences ſeared hot iron whoſe damnation yet ſleepeth neither ſhal eſcape feare ſeaze vpon would wheras may ſaid godly much afraid ſometime well anſwere true tendeth good end haue taken libertie amiſſe rather ſtolne breake good righteous way couenanted walke cannot bee afraid come againe themſelues ſee haue offended mercifull father therefore cannot quiet till bee fauour againe let know euen ſo much muſt wit falles feare take reſt peace themſelues elſe time commeth feare ſhall alſo fall vpon conſider duly eſtate may time trouble come turne foot againe way god teſtimonies god burie indignity haue wrought againſt receiue graciouſly hoſ 14 3 firſt branch propheticall prayer enemy 2 god might siſera ſhe hauing warrant ſo pray became ſo ſhall wee doe ſhall doe ſo vpon ſo good ground warrant otherwiſe take heed wee pray againſt faire pretence ſoeuer wee haue doe ſo god hath reclaimed bad one ſo know wee may call home among v haue ſpoken part deboras prayer louers god may proſper 3 abundance good thing grow therein sunne doth ſtrength noonetide let bee noted prayed loue lord onely bleſſing ſecond commandement loue teſtifie doe ſo keeping commandements prayer made faith obtaines much asked therefore ſhe prayeth one ſhe affirmed ſhall ſo namely loue lord ſhall want nothing good ſo dauid ſaith good experience lord withholdeth good thing ſuch pſal 23 1 pſal 84 13 keepe heart pure good none doe loue yea marke ſhe ſaith ſhall grow therein euen ſtrength ſtrength sunne doth euen full beautie ſpeaketh salomon prouerbs way righteous ſhineth light ſhineth vnto perfit day ſignifying thereby prou 4 18 godly herein reſemble lord ieſus himſelf increaſed ſtrength luke 2 52 body addition grace fauour god men ſo alſo increaſe daily knowledge grace vntill bee ioyned chriſt head ſee lord sion holineſſe behold ſingular priuiledge louers god doe enioy looke carefully conſtantly preſerue vphold loue god euen thereby grow grace knowledge god chriſt come haue neere acquaintance haue proofe fatherly kindnes toward ſo haue ſtronger hope ſhall yet better afterward obedience paſſed yeeldeth courage ſtrength go forward good courſe conſider miſerable courſes many want gracious gouernment god runne kinde ſinne fearefull puniſhments wicked waxe worſe worſe ſome euen god deare ſeruants declinings careleſnes ſmall time ſee many ill day ſhould make account precious libertie bequeathed vnto v behalfe ſuch looke maintaining loue god nouriſhing note thankfull acknowledging euer flowing kindneſſe toward ſpeake great thing neede feare worſe eſtate godward haue enioyed alreadie euery day looke better better greater faith better obedience cannot wanting note v wanting ſelues failing loue god yet meane perfectiō cannot vſe ſinceritie feruencie god ſeruice euen ſuch hath alreadie liſteth reade growing grace ſetting downe may reade twelfth chapter ſixth treatiſe book meane ſeaſon let ſpeech debora make ſuch looke better farre thriuing growth grace fruite deſire honour fauour god voide let know cauſe thereof loue god whatſoeuer pretend contrarie without welfare ſoule cannot proſper rather decaieth man ſicke deſperate diſcaſe growes worſe worſe till vtter conſumption death ſelfe doe follow therefore worke ſmall weight trie ſelues whether loue god quite coſt abundantly get wee thriuing hand feare wee ſhall doe well wee giue good proofe thereof wee loue deſire well brother nothing deare himſelf ſtill earneſt thirſting thing grow haue appetite growth theſe ſay common care honouring god place liue daily longing home vprightnes conſtancie euidences loue god cannot deceiue affection wee well aſſured breake ſuch fruite haue mentioned ioſephs vnto brother gen 45 1 ſong debora holy ſtorie addeth god gaue people victorie fortie yeeres reſt quietnes great bleſſing euen ſo know benefit great deliuerance paine ſickneſſe priſon bondage penurie like miſerie eſpecially long continuance much ſweete peace conſcience paſſeth vnderſtanding ioy holy ghoſt long continuance trouble minde feare damnation ſometime alſo elſewhere ſomewhat hath ſaid thirtie sixe sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges verſ 1 afterward child iſrael committed wickedneſſe ſight lord lord gaue hand midian ſeuen yeeres verſ 2 hand midian preuailed againſt iſrael becauſe midianites child iſrael made dennes mountaines caues ſtrong hold verſ 3 iſrael ſowne came vp midianites amalekites eaſt came vpon verſ 4 camped deſtroyed fruite earth euen till thou come vnto azzah left foode iſrael neither ſheepe oxe aſſe verſ 5 went vp cattell came tent graſhoppers multitude ſo camel without number came land deſtroy verſ 6 iſrael exceedingly impoueriſhed midianites therefore child iſrael cried vnto lord chapter ſhewed iſrael againe prouoked lord ſumme part chapter 4 wickedneſſe verſ 1 lord puniſhed midianites verſ 6 cried vnto lord reproued verſ 11 laſtly called gedeon prepared deliuer end chapter firſt part chapter begin ſinne appeares grieuouſly prouoke ſumme firſt part lord ſometime done third fourth chapter appeares puniſhment likewiſe long time continued vpon yet death debora barak valiant deliuerers hand canaanite againe depart good courſe wherein liued fell againe idolatrie ſinnes ſaid ſinne may gathered firſt verſe 25 begin benefit inſtruction take hence ſeeing ſtories ſet downe well puniſhing iſrael begin thus child iſrael againe euill ſight lord ſeeing ſay thus may learne naturally ingrafted heart man though bee holy affection kindled ſome good meanes yet time dye wane away ſtead heart carried againe euill moſt deſireth thus haue ſome goodneſſe beginning faith faire ſhewes hypocrite beſt morning dew though men may perhaps ſerue god hoſ 6 4 good manner yet gone wee aware waxing wearie prouoking god afreſh ſicklenes inconſtancie ſo deeply rooted thereupon falleth carried away error wicked inticements world good courſe faſhioned like men though groſſe abſurd fall great reaſon hereof beſt renewed part much corruptiō remaineth purged thē requireth taking vp thought care meet ſhould take knowledge ſo may ſee haue worke enough haue little note cauſe idle waxe wearie meane beſide many duty croſſing ſubduing euill heart eſpecially ſeeing reward ſo great ſo yet griefe may ſaid age perſons church little conſidering haue fallen courſe complaine pſalme ſtarted aſide like pſal 78 35 broken bow people exodus like abſence moſes day fell moſt ſhamefully idolatrie people exod 32 6 mentioned iohn counted iohn baptiſt burning light ioh 5 35 time reioyced whereby yee may gather time theſe many long ſtood vpon doe ſhew ſoone men decline good courſe wel v latter age looked better ſelues well perſons family almoſt whole townes wanze waxe cold ſeruing god yet ſometime forwarder ſort profeſſors god reſerueth deſire keepe firſt loue goſpell brother may ſeed note euery corner land almoſt teach generation come world continue feare lord aright hee hauing appointed remnant remaine church though ſmall vnto world end ſo teacheth beſt v need haue deſire enioy beſt meanes namely ſincere preaching goſpell whereby may grow grace knowledge chriſt cleaue neerely conſidering oft wee haue god gracious working v reuiued refreſhed thereby dead good duty wee vnprofitable conſciences iudges without well winde poiſoned baites laid v firſt foure part chapter haue ſpoken former part verſe ſomewhat alſo chapter people ſinne ſecond part chapter followes ſecond puniſhment followed ſinne cried lord vnder theſe ſixe verſes puniſhment ſeuen yeeres oppreſſion midianites verſe ſeene manner oppreſſing ſet downe fiue verſes following oppreſſion midianites let verſe 1 doct 2 verſ 1 lamen 3 40 teach v iuſt becauſe ſinned god ſcourgeth men iuſtly without due deſert man ſuffereth ſinne prophet ieremy ſaith ſhould thinke hardly handled puniſhed god let proue themſelues without ſinne elſe let hold peace nay yeeld ſo let able proue haue offended infirmitie rather wilfully knowledge ſhall either freed altogether great vexation liues elſe ſhall freely without conſtraint confeſſe god hath dealt iuſtly yea mercifully ſo viſiting rather hath done wrong thus much god puniſh men prouoke tranſgreſſions may learne haue place ſhewed manner midianites oppreſſing people iſrael verſe 2 ſenſe ſpoiling victuall namely corne cattell ſpace ſeuen yeeres without could liue corne deſtroied ſowen field driuen make cabin hollow place earth vnder hils rock hole creuiſes let light defend themſelues field lower part earth made dennes darke place fit habitation might ſafely lay good ſubſtance hide midianites made alſo high tower ſtrong might ſee farre could beaten eaſily theſe ſhifts faine make enemy graſhoppers face earth camel beaſts deſtroy fruites iſraelites almoſt without number theſe midianites ſtocke came neceſſarie inquire ſeeing ſet downe though ſome writer ſay beginning thus one abraham ſonnes begat wife ketura builded citie beyond arabia south deſert called saracen called name midian madian people called midianites madianites ſuppoſed kenites came theſe brought amalakites men eaſt helpe grieuous ſore affliction thus driuen extremity deut 28 33 eſay 17 10 11 want food yet long threatned among many come vpon apoſtacie idolatrie though heare conſuming people iſrael battell yet beſide could many ſlaine ſo long violent aſſaulting ſo death cruell liuing famiſhed miſerie life greater ſeeke foode hardly come yet bee reſerued ſcarcely fit preſerue life therefore contrary wee may ſee benefit god land city townes village people may fed fit condition inuaſion forraine enemy ſpoile deſtroy fruit earth whereby inhabitant preſerued famine iudgement god iuſt cauſe complaining ſtreetes know great famine mentioned scripture yea ſmaller famine owne remembrance cry lamentation haue day abraham iſaac chiefly iacob gen 42 2 forced ſend egypt corne time elimelek naomi driuen dwelling bethelem ruth 1 1 iuda goe ſoiourne land moab want food day ioram king iſrael men way 2 king 6 25 preſerue liues eating againſt nature yea yet could hardly come woman eate child alſo laſt beſieging ieruſalem roman end ſpeake ſhould lift vp heart feruently oft thankfull god one benefit plentie although ſeeth indeed one many yea infinite wee receiue doth god euen end men doct verſ 2 3 4 5 may follow calling diligently conſcionably cheerefulnes ſame minde walke feare lord continually therefore euill example life abundance god earthly bleſſings doth flow euery drunkenneſſe laſciuiouſnes doth draw vpon men greater plague want famine leanenes ſoule blindnes vnbeliefe hardneſſe heart impenitencie ſpirit prophet wee ſhould deeply bewaile leaue ſuch adde quickning vp beſt fit note grow meane common eſteeming theſe benefit god ſuppoſe themſelues put caſe want penurie euen ſtate people god oppreſſion midianites like haue ſowne ſeede ſhould ſpovled face ſo ſhould eate prouiſion haue made liues ſhould carried away enemy taken famiſhed want would make better value prize ſuch benefit yeeld lord holy fruitfull vſe whereas commonly men doe ſo till driuen want decay ſubſtance ſay oh plentie god benefit enioyed another thing theſe verſes marked bring double vexation vpon ſelues ſinning againſt lord ſeeking haue doct 1 againſt word god one affliction ſent vpon v ſinne ſtirring vp midianites againſt people iſrael tranſgreſſion loſſe good diſeaſes ieopardie liues c vexation proceedeth former many ſorts may liuely ſeene preſent ſtorie namely theſe verſes toile time coſt beſide diſquietnes went therewith driuen beſtow may include much word defend ſaue themſelues vtmoſt hurt danger wrought intended againſt ſhifts faine make preſerue liues ſaue good enemy hand yet done could able doe hurt cattell corne commodity ſuſtained onely puniſhment deare paying pleaſure took ſinne note bondage could doe nothing elſe watch ward liues build botch digge delue beate braines deuiſe hide commodity ſorrow vpon ſorrow one vnquietnes vpon another heape vpon head till loſt welfare liues manner made weariſome vnwelcome death ſelfe fruite ſinne good bringeth committers thereof yet ſhould lay fruit ſinne cain eſau abſolon could ſtaied committing better thing could ſay better fruite could proue yeeldeth committers baite pleaſant poore fiſh biteth caught hooke bringeth paine torture wearying ſelfe ſaue life ſo needes taſte pleaſure ſinne haue ſaid great good intendeth againſt ſuch follow one kinde tooth naile alſo lie ſucking draw pleaſure childe doth breaſt let taken condemned fooles maſters profeſſion vpholders trade occupation yea let bee reckoned number prouerbe ſpeaketh foole beleeueth euery prou 14 15 thing againe ye fooles long ye loue fooliſhneſſe prou 1 22 haue choſen way ſeemeth pleaſant iſſues thereof way death doe moſt certainly take paine goe hell righteous doth heauen reuolting brought vpon miſerie ſo let thoſe haue falſified promiſe broken ſolemne couenant god ſeeking zeale greater fruitfulnes watchfulnes care let ſay alſo feare euill conſcience wil draw vpon one accuſation trouble another decline greater ſorrow bring vpon themſelues haue brought point haue made queſtion whether might lay violent hand vpon themſelues auoid terror minde alſo obſerue ſhifts chuſe make rather doct 3 would ſeeke god humiliation repentance releaſe loue freedome well hauing citie beſieged enemie till extreame famine compell eate dogges cat ſuch vermine noiſome nature yet chuſe endure ſuch difficulty rather yeeld ſo doubtleſſe loue luſts well ſuffer themſelues bee made ſuch ſlaues drudge theſe rather would abandon returne lord vnfained renouncing ala muſt leaue ſhame double repentance length haue wearied themſelues theſe till owne rod hath made ſmart may tell vnfruitfulnes toileſome trade toileſome may truly ſay conſidering great adoe bring ſinne ripenes perfection ſhifts vndergo winde themſelues woe miſerie ſtead fruite ſinne brings vpon good piece life adulterer firſt compaſſe fulfill vncleane luſts hath done couer keepe himſelfe ſhame make faire weather againe ſo thriftleſſe ſpendgood adoe make ſcrape together ſomwhat maintaine riotous humour brought beggerie muſt caſt afreſh hee may defray auoid gallowes baſe wretched life word true salomon ſaith eccleſiaſtes ſinner god giueth paine eccleſ 2 20 giues ſowre ſauce ſweete meate painfull ſeruice ſweet luſts yet without god ſpeciall goodneſſe neither theſe ſhall preuaile lewd perſon pull loue liking though coſt ſo deare though beare bring foorth paine ſweate face found hiel build iericho though hee knew coſt neuer ſo dearly therefore happie god hath entertained houſe hold vnder gouernment becauſe neither word tedious matth 11 laſt commandements grieuous trouble befall ſo firſt know ſting borne good cauſe ſhall goe vnder without diſquiet vpholden grace count great ioy ſuffered people iſrael haue heard former verſes kindly ſhew verſe 6 doings nature diſpoſition ſinful wicked perſons little truſt god trouble forgot flie ſuccour refuge earthly helpes ſtaies tower dennes munition defence forſaking holy ſtorie ſheweth verſe none preuailed neither preſerue although ſhifting ſaued liues got ſaued foode much adoe kept ſtaruing yet ſeeth miſerie indured extreame pouertie bondage feare euen ſo wee muſt know enough wicked perſons beware enemy fence themſelues common trouble world firſt chiefly ſhould preſerue themſelues wrath god like fooles doe preuenting auoiding ſame ſeldome eſcape free therefore lord prophecie habakkuk laugheth ſcorne ſuch made defence men obedia lord ſaith ſuch habak 2 5 6 obediah 3 4 thou dwelleſt cleft rock whoſe habitatiō high ſaiſt thine heart ſhall bring downe ground though thou exalt thy ſelfe eagle make thy neſt among ſtarres yet euen thence bring thee downe ſaith lord doe ſee god hath thouſand way fight againſt plucked pharaos charet wheeles broke horſes exod 14 25 iud • 5 22 eſter • 10 2 chro 20 22 hoofes siſera drew vp great lord haman gallowes tooke heart ammonite moabites ſtead fighting againſt iudah fell vpon ſlew one another weakened zenacherib ſo ſlew angell one night hundred foure ſcore 2 king 19 35 fiue thouſand armie doe ſee ſay thus ſhew might againſt theſe mightie one many way beſide hath done like alſo fruſtrate attempt hope theſe day alſo ſpirit ſlumber caſt vpon blindneſſe hath taken hold cannot ſee beleeue like iudgements ſhall meete till haue felt ſmarted therefore let men make peace god firſt turne ſins may alſo turne fierce wrath elſe make reckoning peace proſperitie length day deliuerance enemy trouble contrary euils fall vpon note preſently yet hand alwaies iuſtly feared come oh proofe haue wee ſeene ſay former age haue done alſo many might haue done well proſpered carefull reconciled god leane owne deceitfull dreames vaine hoping life ſhould ſtill haue granted laſted thought paradiſe welfare ſoone cut reaſon men goe worke without god neither ſeeke fauour direction either action affliction therefore enterpriſes either croſſed elſe curſed vſe enioying trouble ſeeke either abide get good manner thus wicked man vnhappie way whether hee proſper either hee feares change elſe feare commeth vpon armed man therefore conſider thinke beleeuing chriſtian twice happie euen iudged miſerable men world becauſe hee hath choſe good part mary hath ſought haue god ſide doth keepe fearefull iudgements ſure defence time need maketh portion enioy ſweete ſauourie bleſſing vnto yet haue farre greater rich thoſe thus much puniſhment ſecond part chapter third part chapter third followeth ſixth verſe namely people repented doct 2 verſ 6 turned god ſaid teſtified declared ſigne thereof cry inſiſt vpon ſame thing place haue done note hence ſeeing ſought laſt ſhould haue firſt refuge may note another point vnthriftineſſe fooliſh dealing men world needes goe trie maſteries neceſſitie calamity truſting broken hold vaine helpes owne deuiſing ſmart haue ſaid laſt ſhame muſt faine ſue repaire god receiue falleth ſometimes bee ſo prouerbs becauſe would heare called ye ſhall crie prou 1 20 heard whither goe doe farre fetched iourney haue taken yea full vexation weariſome beſides note haue loſt former labour conclude therefore aduice warning ſuch haue eares heare seeke lord may eſay 55 6 found driue day day leſt come ſuddenly none turne away heauy wrath meane happie doe ſo ſo ſhall doe people flie rock hide themſelues caues earth build tower ſafe enemy theſe midianites yet ſafely keepe defend flie ſafe rocke tower defence wiſe man calleth meane name prou 18 10 lord euen lord hoſtes moſt ſtrong place refuge righteous flie thither ſaued thirtie seven sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges verſ 7 child iſrael cried vnto lord becauſe midianites verſ 8 lord ſent vnto child iſrael prophet ſaid vnto thus ſaith lord god iſrael haue brought vp egypt haue brought houſe bondage verſ 9 haue deliuered hand egyptian hand oppreſſed haue caſt giuen land verſ 10 ſaid vnto lord god feare god amorites whoſe land dwell haue obeyed voyce whether cried lord firſt anguiſh verſe 7 8 9 10 heart cauſed force calamity neither pleaſing god neither could obtaine thing vnleſſe come faith probable whether cry lord ſent man god mentioned vnto cannot certainly ſaid ſure god great mercie ſent prophet preach bring true repentance ſpeaking much like meſſenger ſent father bochim repeates god benefit iudg 2 3 deliuerances chargeth diſobedience alſo theſe word wee may ſee fit time preaching worke verſe 7 8 men inwardly ſtung ſmart affliction appeareth theſe man god ſent preach vnto • n ſuffer themſelues eaſily reproued ſinnes cauſe themſelues ſee cauſe word receiued doct 1 heart readily whereas otherwiſe moſt commonly hardned hate reproued yet men come prepared daily ordinarie preaching profiteth nothing danger like quench ſpirit dull edge ſuch good beginning grace moſt certainly come paſſe carefull ſtirre vp daily men haue elbow roome thinke preacher yea god himſelfe muſt beholding hearing god hath cooped narrow compaſſe roddes held ouer preacher welcome yea ſought earneſtly god plied confeſſions prayer ſee though griefe haue great experience practiſe ſecure irreligious ſort though mind god yeere long yet fall prayer deuotion ſome great thundring lightning tempeſt doth aſtoniſh likelihood death vpon word heare daily without great reuerence terrible workes ſeene felt though ſeldome make hide themſelues corner feare whoſe example ſee need lord hath bore eares ſoules terror amaſing iudgements iob ſpeakes chap 33 becauſe word wound men finger made iob 33 16 confuſed noiſe many water ſound beating aire going one eare faſt let ſuch boaſt themſelues ſpared except applie themſelues hearing god voyce miniſter skill doe meſſage regard earneſtnes either behind belong god muſt haue ſomewhat quicken appetite thereto make ſinke deeply heart worke vpon powerfully good elſe woe vnto lord likelihood hath caſt taketh pleaſure greatly feared affliction ſhall come vpon yet reaſon former vnbeliefe contempt inſtruction ſhall doe little good thing ſhould doe lord laieth hand vpon let examine themſelues touching affection word little moued time health proſperitie ſo may eaſily finde blockiſhneſſe careleſſe vnprofitable hearing deadnes fulnes ſtomacke ſuch like earthlineſſe wearineſſe wandring drowzineſſe c haue cauſed lord ſend ſuch trial vpon inward outward might grinde flat note blunt edge ſet ſharper keener vpon deſire meeknes may embrace word finde ſauourie taſte till haue wrought vpon ought euen caſt mould let ſuch know affliction tame meeken ſpirits vnder hand god fight againſt pharao ſee vſe well ſeaſon offered deliuered againe may haue ſound preaching high reuerence let know ſay caſe wofull deſperate lord ſaith like caſe prophet people ſhall intreate thee ſhall doe hoſ 6 4 vnto thee may ſay vnto hath phyſicke word mercy chaſtiſements none breake heart helpe hope ſhould vſe extraordinary courſes looke hee ſhould preuaile prieſts going againſt conſciences bringing chriſt death moued reſurrection therefore wiſeſt put lord extremitie hearken ſpeaketh offereth faire voyce meſſengers deferre till affliction ſecond warning ſent vnto leſt alſo found alike vnprouided hardned leſt god ſhould vouchſafe mercie mollifie ſoften truth tempt ſo farre preſumption doe eaſily recouer themſelues though god doe viſit correction iudgements rather moſt part go increaſe rebellion whether theſe men cried forced thereto many doct 2 ſore affliction ſure man god deliuered meſſage ſhewed vnthankfulnes god many deliuerances conuicted diſobedience crie token great griefe offending god father done repeate ſame thing noted like word vttered bochim marked lord ſent meſſenger call people conſideration themſelues doings ſee need thereof generation declare wrack ruine come helped due time ſeaſon wholeſome inſtruction god righteous ſmiting may fall hand vngodly rung pſal 341 5 vtter ſhame reproch ſo fall iawes diuell vndone without recouerie lord dealeth ſo graciouſly may enioy benefit ſound teaching let beware harden heart hearing oftner heare happier meekenes receiue may bring foorth fruite plentifully euen eternall life prophet ſent vnto put firſt minde god verſe 8 9 benefit many deliuerances enemy next thing conſidered v theſe word 8 9 verſes beſide haue heard like occaſion record keepe memoriall ſhould haue done reproued deliuerances trouble calamitie ſaw might yea muſt haue lien ouerwhelmed drowned lord good time brought v theſe deliuerances ſay bondage priſon ſickneſſe paine body anguiſh torment conſcience like oft haue enioyed v comfortable welcome vnto v ought daily remembred acknowledged heartie praiſes god well benefit hee marketh ſhall finde many great beſide thoſe common ſo may truly ſay god hath deliuered many death becauſe people forgetfulnes former age ſee oft put minde one deliuerance bondage egypt therefore prophet dauid holy penman pſalmes behalfe people doe ſo often call minde ſometimes admiration aſtoniſhment god former deliuerances whole 124 pſalme witneſſeth thus lord ſide may iſrael ſay men roſe vp againſt v ſwallowed v vp quick water ouerwhelmed v c oh forgetfulneſſes like kindneſſe god enough accuſe godward though wee ſinnes ſeeing wee cannot ignorant danger depth ſorrow haue ſometime note plunged wee lay cry complaining perhaps praying alſo vnder burthen would haue bin thought could euer haue forgot lord kindneſſe ſhould euer haue brought v yet hath done ſo yea againe againe done ſo haue pharaos butler nine leaper forgot gen 40 23 whereas haue learned many yeeres euen long wee reape benefit ſuch deliuerances yea euen till death ſhould praiſe god ſame according taught father pſalme let iſrael ſay long deliuerance god gracious pſal 118 2 mercie endureth euer haue ſpoke thankes deliuerance trouble adde benefit innumerable required v leſſe thing alwaies wee ſhould thankfull bewraies blockiſhneſſe 1 theſſ 19 ſuch vrged giue thankes aske wherefore haue wee receiued others enioy part common bleſſings moſt doe c thankfulnes ſome extraordinarie dutie lying onely vpon ſome perſons rarely fauoured god lord requires thee doth equall thee nay inferiour thee benefit thou like ſwine takeſt commeth regarding whence ſo thy turne ſerued thus deuoureſt many bleſſings thy brutiſhneſſe godly chriſtian would make matter daily praiſe inlarge greatneſſe muſing vnworthie leaſt ill ſhould goe caſe ſuch want lord ſhould exerciſe ſuch vnthankfull blockes diſeaſes many deare ſeruants ſuffer paine colique strangurie burning feuers stone giue portion penury cleanenes teeth nakednes ſicknes c would ceaſe extenuating god benefit cōparing themſelues ſuch inriched greater themſelues yea would thinke freedome chaſtiſements great cauſe thankes though wanted many bleſſings full ſtomacke hony prou 27 7 combe ſweete others thinke dutie diſcharged haue tongue tipt formall word bleſſing thankes though heart loue ſet vpon bleſſing beſtower therefore ſame fountaine commeth bitter well ſweete curſe god eaſily leaſt thing croſſeth bleſſe hee pleaſeth humour ſeaſonable weather plentifull crop good ſucceſſe affaire c whereby bewray thankes froth prophane perſons comming luſts ſatisfied euen prayer alſo trouble extremity saint iames ſpeakes third ſort better former iames 4 3 yet cannot brought ſeaſon whole life thankſgiuing paul requireth neither yet thinke themſelues worthie reproofe vnthankfulneſſe ſay hope neither lying whoring wronging c ſuffer afflicted alwaies thankfull ſinne make cannot repeate ſay ſame word ſo often anſwere ſay vnthankfulnes indeed direct ſinne againſt man farre greater high degree wrong offered god neuer goeth without heart life tainted many lothſome euils corruption therfore let theſe example rule god people follow let whole life honouring god thankſgiuing becauſe beholding maieſtie farre greater fauours ſtrangers ſo let prayer otherwiſe vſuall practiſe entertaine dutie alſo daily companion token vſe god bleſſings boldnes looſenes wantonnes licentiouſnes get ſtrength againſt ſo life may fare better thankfulnes ſuch good meanes indeed thankfull man weigh aright onely good chriſtian life voide goeth much diſobedience ſhall ſee next doctrine tenth verſe man god telleth lord charged verſ 10 ſhould ſerue god amorites yet obedience like thankes neglected ſo ſhall need proofe like liues witneſſe wretched people wee receiuing charge hath done v good could neuer haue deſired v yet though tyed bond dutie refuſe ſubiect obedient thing command v heathen centurion could ſay haue ſouldiers vnder ſay one matth 8 9 goe goeth another come commeth ſeruant doe doth haue ſolemnely couenanted lord haue may ſay hired bleſſings ſerue wee turne backes vpon owne benefit ſtrengthen ſelues grieue breach sabbath leauing cold vſe prayer vncharitablenes reuenge breach particuler commandements ſuffered fovrth part chapter verſ 11 angell lord came ſate vnder oake ophrah pertained vnto ioaſh father ezrites ſonne gedeon threſhed wheate wine preſſe hide midianites verſ 12 angell lord appeared vnto ſaid vnto lord thee thou valiant man verſ 13 gedeon anſwered ah lord lord v come vpon v miracle father told v ſaid lord bring v egypt lord hath forſaken v deliuered v hand midianites verſ 14 lord looked vpon ſaid goe thy might thou ſhalt ſaue iſrael hand midianites haue ſent thee verſ 15 anſwered ah lord whereby ſhall ſaue iſrael behold father poore manaſſeth leaſt father houſe verſ 16 lord ſaid vnto therefore thee thou ſhalt ſmite midianites one man wee haue heard third part chapter turned lord reproofe man god though bee expreſſed appeareth god ſent tidings deliuerance fourth part followeth wherein victorie ouer midianites promiſed promiſe amplified foure way firſt naming perſon ſhould deliuer gedeon verſe 17 next granting ſigne whereby hee might know hee ſpake verſ 25 third charge caſting downe idolatrie giuen lord verſ 33 laſtly gedeon attempted warre idolatrie deſtroyed god granting double ſigne whereby might know ſhould haue victorie end told ſatisfied 17 let v looke theſe verſes neerely ſaid 11 verſe angel lord came people repentance verſe 11 12 ſate vnder oake place ophrah ioaſh dwelt familie abiezer tribe manaſſe father gedeon might preſerue life thereby liues thoſe ſpeech angel gedeon told ſhould deliuer people hand midianites 11 verſe note diuers thing firſt men wealth doct verſ 11 place gedeon ſo meane tribe though hee father mentioned scripture writer time free either religious ciuill affaire imployed cattell corne would ſpend precious time eating drinking play idleneſſe abhorred euen religiouſer yea ciuiller ſort gentrie alſo doe take vpon honeſt imployments one ſort reading diuine bookes chronicle ſtatutes whereby may benefit themſelues others knowledge god law man haue read matter helpe gouerne doe good commonwealth although little looke religion haue recourſe huſbandrie namely firſt ſort abraham iſaac iacob others gedeon whoſe father ioaſh ſome authoritie among people yet ſonne contemned practiſe husbandrie may ſpoken iuſt charging many age bee borne worſhipfully thinke baſe meane ſoeuer wealth either ſet appoint themſelues time reading haue skill honeſt ſtate husbandrie ſaue onely take rent eaſe taking play idleneſſe like prophane behauiour much leſſe tollerable meaner perſons ill imployed beſide ſeeing ſo fit occaſion lead ſpeake therefore ſay little vnprofitable common ſort people moſt part ſetting aſide skumme townes meane vnthriftie riotous godleſſe poore liue vpon ſweate others may ſay take paine enough man ſhall need ſpend much time perſwading worke hardly beaten obſerue due manner working end ground whereupon motiue penurie end couetouſneſſe manner brutiſh want would haue defray hard world beſtow vpon luſts maintaine themſelues pride life neither worke becauſe thinke ſin fellowſhip god neither doe hinder preſence comfortable v ſame may ſaid calling themſelues ordained bee meane baſe waightie therefore lord iacob gen 28 20 iourney way hee going brother eſaus wrath rage ſo hee made goſpell effectuall lydia paul preaching ſhe ſeller purple rich yet truly conuerted god lord bleſſed two tribe calling habitation ſaying reioyce zebulon thy going thy proſperous voiages word ſtay comfort many weake chriſtians thinke much letted duty godlineſſe euen vſing calling becauſe ſpirituall prayer like exerciſes end let vſe hath ſaid thus much vnto v wee note euer labour ſo innocent well gouerned al earthly buſineſſe workes calling may driue lord v haue alwaies v ſpirit truth direction comfort haue heard hath gedeon earthly affaire vſing aright kinde next thing verſe though lord ſent angell gedeon owne reliefe comfort alſo people yet wee ſee done till brought neere extremitie helpe man paſt refuge vnder god prouide themſelues flying dwelling ſaue liues example gedeon whoſe father ſome authoritie therefore none pooreſt yet point euen thraſhing little corne aide nouriſhment wherof might flie midianites farre laſted carrie learne god ſeeth expedient wiſdome ſometime leaue godly long vnder croſſe put end trouble ordinarily vſeth doe according ſaid pſalme heauineſſe may endure night ioy commeth morning pſal 30 5 againe commeth come tarrie knoweth heb 10 37 hoſ 6 4 well vſeth ſo doe wee commonly conceiue hope thereby affliction ſickneſſe diſeaſe loſſe ſuch hold v long therefore deuotion ſhort cold ſo neither honour god haue proofe faith patience neither experience another time beare trouble aright note cauſe lord ſometime diſappointeth falſe hope putteth v greater plunge holding v longer affliction end may ſearch ſelues deeplier may throughly touched feeling ſinnes rebellion ſo turne faith amendment cauſe lord holdeth v ſometime racke longer paine ſickneſſe penurie alſo bondage ſuch haue ſuperioritie ouer v vſe great diſquiet wearying v pray long deliuered lord ſeemeth heare v pray letteth burthen remaine ſtill vpon v wherefore thinke doth ſo profeſſeth afflicteth willingly neither delighteth therein lament 3 39 yet lie paine griefe anſwere lord ſeeth wee yet tamed humbled ſufficiently great hath pride heart inconſtancie vnfaithfulneſſe vncharitablenes alſo ſinnes mindes ſet world exceſſiuely wandring diuers luſts like returne theſe courſes againe ſet libertie ſoone deſire therefore doth ſeeke weane v theſe like continuing ſuch vnwelcome croſſes vpon v wee ſame cauſes depriued oft time deare companion mariage great part death ſelfe driuen owne habitation fearefull priſon taketh much delight liuing yea tried ſudden dearth oft time exceſſiue raine wet ſometime drouth gedeon hard caſe driuen flie owne dwelling manner famiſhed theſe like god leaueth ſeruants cauſes haue mentioned alſo end deliuerance eaſe giuing may precious commeth hauing ſo long deſired thirdly end holdeth roddes longer ouer v patience may haue perfect worke v himſelfe haue whole praiſe example hath ſaid wee haue ioſhua 7 ioſhua 7 5 people hauing promiſe god aſſiſtance went againſt men al making queſtion ſhould ſpeed well done iericho loc ſudden ſmitten enemy aſtoniſht till lord tels ioſhua cauſe ye looke ſaith lord ſhould ye time ſee cauſe contrarie looke well matter ye ſhall find ſacriledge among ye therefore ye cannot ſtand enemy though worke god yet becauſe found infection made lord croſſe hope ſo might purge ſinne goe worke better manner many wonder lord ſaieth long vpon ſicke bed whereas health ſay ſhould worſhip publike priuate cheerefulnes wheras lord aimeth matter would purge coldnes hypocritie careleſneſſe ſinnes accompanying euen good duty ſo may returne thereto reuerence conſcience reade paul great lifting vp heauen buffered vnwelcome temptation though hee prayed might rid yet lord ſuſpended helpe paul might humbled fitted vſe knowledge fruitfully followeth ſalutation angell lord thee thou valiant verſe 12 man marke ebbe low eſtate gedeon haue heard wonderfull heare newes brought lord note lamentable ſee diſtreſſe hee heard word meſſage vttered much angel ſaid lord loueth thee one deare one thee euen comfort preſerue thee euen thy oppreſſion therfore none ſhall againſt thee hurt thee much ſaid ſuch time calamitie ſuch afflicted perſon yet wee muſt know yeeldeth v like inſtruction euen great outward trouble inward diſquietnes minde body would thinke god good men aduerſaries yet god v hath made couenant yea loueth careth v deare precious vnto euen chriſt ieſus ſonne loue though without beautie among men withered branch deſpiſed eſay 53 eſay 53 2 therefore ſpouſe canticle ſaith blacke comely ye daughter cant 14 c meaning lord ieſus husband eſteemed whit leſſe neither ſhe whit leſſe amiable eye tanned ſunne ſhe perfect beautie indeede ſinne cauſeth lord afflict odious affliction ſelfe argueth make much v becauſe thereby would purge v miſliketh affliction hath wrought kindly lord ſoone change hew reſtore former beautie iobs example witneſſeth reaſon hauing teſtified loue freely vnto v effectuall calling ſhedding plentifully heart rom 5 5 holy ghoſt ſaying ſoules ſaluation exceeding great reward god alſufficient binding v beleeue gen 17 1 ſame remaineth like himſelfe changeth therefore hee requireth wee ſhould doe ſame faith hold faſt perſwaſion doth ſo lord ſo affected v depth affliction freed middeſt proſperitie hardly beleeued time croſſe oppreſſeth v vſe labour aboue thing iudg 19 builded vp moſt holy faith wee ouercome difficulty 1 ioh 5 4 world ſo may thereby ouercome feare doubt alſo middeſt calamity namely tribulation wee may ſhrinke backe perſwaſion theſe yet god v according holy man ſaith pſalme yet god good pſal 73 1 iſrael euen vpright heart though outward ſhew might ſeeme otherwiſe againe deepe meant ſorrowes cried pſal 130 1 vnto lord heard deliuered make one point two ſame vſe ought make word angell calling valiant man true becauſe god ſaid yet gedeon vnlikely ſo yet found afterwards ſo let teach v giue god due namely beleeued al ſaith yea ſaith vnto v though able ſee feele ſo much preſent time neither gedeon point worthie marked ſeeing god giueth note good teſtimonie fauour reuealeth thing readie ioyne moſt part doe faint doubt becauſe wee ſee bodily eye thomas deſired doe thing promiſed would whereas troubleth many wicked take occaſion hereby deſpiſe ſee god ſeemeth regard hee ſo abaſeth let ſuch know miſtaking matter falſe ſurmiſing god good meaning ſhall hurt fixe eye mindes vpon god vnchangeable conſtant al way alſo learne eſteeme themſelues according knowledge inward feeling haue god ancient loue regard time paſt ſo enemy ſcorne neerer lord take away reproch well cleerely laid next verſe therfore paſſe verſ 13 appeareth verſe neere god gedeon yet ſaw concludeth ſeeing people land vnder ſuch oppreſſion midianites could well neither could beleeue god confirmes himſelfe therein reaſon though ſtrength thus god indeed father ſaith brought egypt wrought many miracle hee ſo people therefore could thinke ſaid god ſpake gedeon heauie heart euen angell ſent directly glad tidings let v examine word make benefit ſaying lord could doct midianites ſo oppreſſed ſhewed great weakneſſe ſaid former verſe affirming could beleeue hee ſaw ſo whereby may ſee hardly faithfull perſwaded lord affliction ready ſoeuer bee acknowledge time ſpeake though none dan 3 21 three child caſt hoat burning furnace daniel lyon denne haue left moſt worthy teſtimonie inuincible dan 6 16 faith great extremitie many age paſt among v yet time calamitie muſt need ſaid eſpecially belong ſmartie corrupt nature vntoward hardly ſuffereth v giue credit god promiſes furtheſt letting v ſee beleeue diuell readieſt worke vpon weakeneſſe ſuch time take opportunitie thereof feare terrifie v fiery dart vnbeliefe pierce heart whereby v oft vſually gedeon ſo much lord euen neare v promiſes comfort incouragements ſufficient content ſtay v yet wee ſee neither thinke ſo ſeeing giue ſelues ſtudie note conſider aright point diſtruſt vnbeſeeming v burdenſome v remedie muſt ſpake ſhall haue cauſe mention againe reſt vpon word promiſe god though ſee preſent helpe chriſt ſaid martha tell thee thou ſhouldest ſee glorie god thou canst beleeue ioh 11 40 profane perſons want faith wonder meaſure god loue preſent flouriſhing liuing eaſe wealth enioying theſe outward thing whereby luſts may bee ſatiſfied wonder iudge impoſſible deepe diſtreſſes croſſes euer ſhould wade wee reade prince iehoram iſrael fore famine hearing prophet meſſage god touching ſuddaine plentie ſhould bee next day hee ſaid though lord would make windowes heauen powre downe 2 king 7 2 corne prouiſion yet thing could come paſſe elſe bold preſuming great blindeneſſe hee apprehended deriſion prophecie like ſee daily ſuch brutiſh people hearing v preach doctrine depending vpon god ſufficiencie faith euen affliction doe little better ſcoffe giue v wealth ſay corne wine giue v fill meate pſal 4 6 7 drinke money faith take whoſe therefore proſper merry nabal god giue ſuddaine blow ſtrikes downe flat neither haue armour beare dint thereof neither faith beleeue ſhall euer better much worſe euill conſcience make feare trouble diſgrace either ſickneſſe loſſe vndoing haman friend comforted ſo doe themſelues heſt 6 heſter 6 13 thus thou ſh • lt ſurely fall yet iollitie haue ſuch apparance hope ſo great confidence eſtate ſhall continue better better looke feare change till come ſay vnbeſeeming beleeuer ſhould haue ſo much tang ſtrong vnbeliefe deepe ſorrowes wit onely wiſh otherwiſe ſome ſort diſalowed eagerly deſire redreſſe impatiently beare burthen ſinne hath brought vpon little vpholden god god vallies well mountaines loue ſame 1 king 20 23 trial alſo appeare greater proſperitie vnwelcome croſſe ſo ſweete contrarie fleſh men haue eares heare doctrine beleeue god neare vnto yea euen middeſt ſufferings looke onely proſperitie god eſtate contrarie therefore god abſent therefore man hand promiſe health fauour reliefe ſickneſſe trouble loſſe lift vp eye open eares voice though come man like themſelues god hath promiſed bee thee leaue thee forſake thee cannot bee comforted ſaying ſtill looke full heauily ſwearing gedeon euery one himſelfe oh lord bee ſo thou art euill trouble come vpon euer promiſe thee ſaith ioſhua 1 5 aduerſitie ſhould betide thee nay rather haue ſent euill thou mighteſt therein haue good proofe loue toward thee vpholding thee therein learne leſſon yet better yeſterday day ſame euer odious v heb 13 8 doe onely faile thus great ſearching trouble ſuch euen ſmaller alſo yet v ready accuſe iſraelites queſtion moued calling fleſhpots garlike wilderneſſe ſometime egypt murmuring foode manna wanted water thus tongue ready deſcant others cenſure goe vpon ill becommeth thoſe ſhew fainting vnder lighter croſſes ſtrength faith ſmall time peace libertie freedome affliction though could ſay aloude open mouth knew god beleeued loued noted v gedeons firſt word verſe much occupied remembring ſpeaking forefather counting happie myracles god wrought reſpect himſelfe hereby wee ſee common ſinne amongſt v wee meaſure happie eſtate god ward preſent ſenſe meane god bleſſings correction vpon v ſeeth ioh 14 2 vnequall rule goe let v marke gedeon much occupied prerogatiues doct 3 iſrael egypt wit god ſhewed himſelfe preſent working miracle deliuerance thing done though hee ſhould ſay happie wee die want helpe marke ſay ſpeaketh word bondage hardnes ſuffered wilderneſſe well ſaw miracle ſo doe haue peace proſperitie welfare prerogatiues many god ſeruants haue namely condition meanes thereof ſay thinke preſent wee account ſelues forgotten neglected god compariſon note yet wee little know want ſufferings outward inward ſuch iudge bee ſo happie god bee preſent neither doe wee heare ſorrowfull complaint thus wee iudge ſpeake becauſe preſent proſperitie wee ſee yet apparent wee ſelues deſtitute great bleſſings ſome way great infirmitie doubtleſſe much greater v haue taught oftentimes many worthie ground holy scripture wee ſhould iudge ſelues others ſeeing wee know eſtate doe owne certaine haue many great calamity vpon euen iudge ſo happie doubt thinke ſame v ſome good thing ſee v want voide haue ſurer rule goe cannot deceiue v lord louing v doth thing beſt v ſo forget meaſure eſtate men becauſe wee haue ſo vſually comfort faith preſent ſenſe feeling thereof yet dare denie haue grace god v workes thereof inſeparable companion wee doe offend much wee bee readie iudge conclude haue faith count happie reſpect ſelues yet little know want complainings thereof ſaid beſides ſheweth enemie corrupt nature vnto v well bearing trouble ingenious skilfull wee catch vp ſhould hurt v child doe handling kniues ſuch like turne edge euery thing againſt ſelues godly dexterity hādled might ſingularly benefit v oh ſlow dull taking hold vpon ſuch thing might ſtay v quiet reſolue comfort v rare man hath learned wiſedome giueth place diuell whoſe malice temptation thing ſeeme contrarie becauſe looke vpon troubled eye falſe glaſſe inſtance vſed gedeon meete haue confirmed faith rather haue weakned taken aright trouble wilderneſſe outſtretched arme lord ſaued euen miraculouſly whoſe worthineſſe yet little deſerue could hence follow ſhortned weakned ſo could helpe preſent vphold againe let men learne wiſedom vſe example men ſides ſtrike lord vnthankfulnes salomon ſaith say day paſt better preſent follie oh ſay men day eccleſ 7 12 forefather plentie ſeaſonable time happie liuing ſo yet ſo wanted many thing precious nature enioy part croſſes famine yet people peſtilence ſword warre eſpecially alſo ill ſeaſons drought wet vnleſſe murmuring againſt god multiplying mankinde cauſe haue elſe open mouthes complaine vnthankfulnes wee enioy cauſeth v diſcontented ſelues want grudge againſt god partialitie whereas compared thing equally ten time cauſe preferring preſent condition taking hardneſſe denied much ſo oft time doe poore grudge againſt wealthy rather againſt lord made prou 22 2 salomon ſaith one repines hee rather tenant landlord vnderling rather commander deformed perſon meanly accounted behind hand diſeaſed rather ſuch ſuch wealthie men great perſonable honourable hand healthfull conſider wel want endowment grace part vſe make account muſt make trouble alſo accompanie well gift bleſſings ſo thou ſhalt ſee thy ſelfe equall god author ſuch inequalitie great wiſedome yet leaſt ſo much inferiour bee ſure haue cauſe thankfull laſtly omitted gedeon asking miracle doct 4 father told doth ſhew father according commandement god declared child wonderous workes done ſeemeth alſo learned know beleeue muſt parent child doe one ſhould able tell doe ſo ſo liniall deſcent knowledge feare god may deriued poſteritie lord goodneſſe may perpetuall remembrance let child ſee minde god matter leſſe cheerefulnes regard haue done worldly affaire let parent traine elſe ſee light creuiſe wee know quickly prick thorne framed vp manured firſt ſo ſoile either beare thornes briar good fruites thirtie nine sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges followeth third point diuiſion theſe verſ 14 ſenſe ſixe verſes word angell gedeons ſorrowfull anſwere thus whereas thou ſaiſt god ſhewed power father deliuering miracle go thou armed like power thereby deliuer thou iſrael hand midianites thereby thou ſhalt know god able doe great thing well yea doth like maner people euen age paſt make word authoritie addeth interrogation haue ſent thee muſt know calling iudges ſo diligently deſcribed may vnderſtand priuate men able take hand ſuch great workes without authoritie god gather army take vp weapon againſt mightie matter great difficultie danger therefore god authorized gedeon ſo hee others giuing credit thereto might heartned therefore ſaith haue ſent thee returne gedeon thus angel proued god made able deliuer iſrael doe leſſe worke miracle feare god taught time ſo hard affliction take either helpe neerer v aware gedeon make note trouble ſeeme greater ſelfe aggrauating yet wee might ſee either ſo great ſeemes might many way greater haue greater comfort elſewhere able aſſwage ſorrowes wee ouerwhelme heart immoderate heauineſſe driueth away comfort v therefore wee ſad heauy want croſſes leſſon ſhould well learned v lord v good v euen ſo haue good father v perſwaded affliction though haue end ſuch languiſhing feares dolefull doubt troubleſome thought yet time note part ſtill haue ſhall haue end reſt doe hath temptation taken v ſuch appertaine man 2 cor 10 13 god faithfull ſuffer v tempted aboue able euen giue iſſue temptation wee may able beare therfore sauiour ſaid apoſtles heart troubled beyond meaſure bodily departing let heart troubled beleeue god beleeue helpe ioh 14 1 ſtill ſo ſhould wee doe looke eye vpon affliction one eye vpon conſtant loue aſſured note promiſes yea ſettle hope therein throughly ſaying god commandeth hath bidden v doe ſo euen angell ſaith gedeon conquering midianites haue ſent thee two diſciples went ieruſalem emaus sauiour went companie way bewraied vnbeliefe concerning reſurrection day day ſay hee ſhould haue riſen againe becauſe heard think ſuch thing luke 24 21 sauiour ſhew fault ſo ſaw knew euen ſaid ſhould haue riſen againe day mary martha like may ſaid beleeuers ioh 11 39 chriſt beloued yet chriſt went raiſe vp lazarus end asked laid ſhew thought could done therefore anſwered lord time ſtinketh hath dead foure day yet might ſee weaknes beleeuing chriſt raiſed vp thought impoſſible theſe gedeon wee may cleerely ſee face glaſſe croſſe eſpecially bee thing ſmartie ſharpe although gaue teſtimonie faith ioyfulnes yet triall v poorely wee armed goe perſwaded good iſſue doe hang downe head note faint ſay within ſelues croſſe vndoing againe cannot turne good neither could haue ſo vnwelcome v example wee depriued deare companion mariage loſe ſome round ſumme money otherwiſe impaired wealth vnder ſome ſtrange paine doe ſay time peace meeknes ſpirit lord loueth v hath done good euen cannot ſuffer winde blow vpon v hath ſent doe ſay muſt thus expedient v long firſt feare full faintly done doe length attaine thereto yet doe wee ſee theſe like marueilous hand god hee ſendeth light darkneſſe ioy heauines life death doth god bring v otherwiſe wee looked doth make v ſee afterward acknowledge ſuch affliction good v euen ſaid gedeon doth midianites oppreſſing ſeeme impoſſible auoided behold euen thou ſhalt doe ſeemeth impoſſible ſhalt ſubdue ouercome thus wee ſee ſhould make profit anſwere gedeon receiuing anſwere angell ſhould deliuer iſrael verſ 15 ſenſe doth fourth point aske angell meanes hee ſhall ſo great matter theſe word diligent himſelfe ſeeing rich power authority eſpecially required thereto asked whither gedeon offended eſay 36 5 mouing queſtion ſeeing sarah zachariah reproued like queſtion asking ſure ſo abraham virgin mary asked like reproued neither gedeon neither mouing queſtion found fault doubtfull minde moued therefore two doubting found fault zacharias sarah abraham mary neither therefore gedeon appeareth anſwere angell reproued anſwered queſtion may learne queſtions moued doubting doct scripture reſolueth v euill ſo moue queſtions ignorant weighty point would reſolued commendable matter tends edification moſt thoſe moſt neceſſary paul himſelfe iailer conuerſion began looke ſaluation ſo wit asked queſtions ſlacke backward ſeeking reſolution ſuch caſes ignorant haue cauſe inquire aske wiſe liked rather threatens great hurt danger whereof might ſaid occaſion hath bin already offered ſpeake duty ſeeking relation doubtfull caſes opinion conſcience angell anſweres without rebuking protection helping hand outward trouble may ought beleeue doe hee hath promiſed ſhewed himſelfe manner ſo hee vndoubtedly v age helpe deliuer giue ſucceſſe v hath alreadie done greater thing v yet ſeeing vſe look narrowly god outward promiſes performed v full readie complaine therefore know doe faile point wee looke promiſe conditionall ſupplie ſuch want grace ſpirituall ſo wee beleeue patience great end mentioned meane bring many chriſt act 26 epheſ 4 act 26 18 epheſ 4 12 denieth calleth beleeue neuer ſhall able compaſſe ſhall moſes apoſtles place occaſions offered require ſo may ought wee perſwaded vnfit vnworthie ſoeuer feele ſelues lord call v eſtate dutie arme v againſt difficulty toile tediouſneſſe therein lord doth lay heauie burthen vpon men giue weake ſhoulders dealeth euery member meaſure according vſe ſeruice belongs double ſpirit eliſha aboue eliah according double neede euen ſee gift ſtrength giuen armes ſhoulders man body becauſe ſerue ſtrongeſt vſe ſo becauſe knoweth difficulty within without godly chriſtian ſhall meete therefore leaues ſinke vnder giues faith enables ouercome one world sauiour 1 ioh 5 4 matth 6 30 ſpeakes hath lord ſo clothed graſſe creature much prouide people like argument hath god giuen euery creature euen beaſts ſome one gift according neede thereof preſeruation ſwiftnes ſmall ſtrength great ſome one kinde armour ſome another proportioned worke ſeruice exacts vantage hath one talent doth another hath fiue ſecond obiection many whoſe gift great obiect 2 anſw doe little good anſwere ſinne greater hinders doctrine though god ſets worke ſhall bee fitted yet contrarily appoint worke neither call verſ 17 anſwered pray thee haue found fauour thy ſight ſhew ſigne thou talkest verſ 18 depart hence pray thee vntill come vnto thee bring mine offering lay thee ſaid tarrie vntill thou come againe verſ 19 gedeon went made ready kid vnleauened bread ephath flower put fleſh basket put broath pot brought vnto vnder oake v verſ 17 doct man pleaſure example led proue thing waights sanctuarie word god ſo wee may ſatisfied mouth two three witneſſes bee confirmed brought vnto v wee reſt ſhould enough v miracle ſignes truth taught v ſeeke aske like doe trouble feares fetch comfort conceit ſpirit without word thing elſe falſe ground wiſe regard gedeon deale ſure ſo weightie caſe raſhly depend vpon bare man word effecting ſo great work hee knew none god could enable vnto laieth greatly charge matter farre greater weight doe yet deale farre looſely ſlenderly wiſe man ſaith foole beleeueth prou 14 15 euery thing▪ meaning euery thing hee deſireth would faine haue beleeueth eaſily perſwaded ſo would haue though haue nothing moment good ground ſhew among men counted ſigne great folly deale thus rawly thing onely concerning temporall eſtate reſt vpon euery man word report yea though ambigious obſcurely vttered reaſon good ſo doe ſo giue euery man aduantage ouerreach abuſe deceiue wrong beſides great controuerſies contention ſuites charge procure themſelues needleſly thereby ſpeake weightier matter one among many counteth folly hold ſaluation vpon ſandie ground euidences vpon owne good meaning deſires vpon good opinion others conceiue vpon ſome ſlight ſorrow ſinne confeſſing god alſo vpon hearing word vpon blinde hope vpon ſome good yet common fruites hearing good ſpeech ſome place vpon taking liking good people liking miniſterie lending giuing ſome thing poore diſtreſſe theſe thing good indeed perſwaded found yet theſe taken infallible token nay concerning waightie matter men willing build hope ſaluation vpon bare word miniſter though hee neuer ſaw ſound reaſon ſo ſpeaking aſſuring thereof haue baptized doe liue viſible church neither haue thing word god quiet reſolue themſelues whereas triall man ſtate godward ſtands scripture proue himſelf happy perſon becauſe word hath humbled changed reformed wrought faith promiſe earneſt longing promiſed waiting till enioyed without wearineſſe heartie deſiring ſo likewiſe ſuch much written proceed gedeon hauing deſired ſigne confirming verſe 18 19 ſenſe faith thinking haue ſaid man god deſired ſtay till hee went prepared abraham done like caſe ſhould refreſh himſelfe purpoſed talke ſigne thing prepared fit eaten nouriſhment alſo ſerue ſacrifice though word ſignifieth gift offering proofe gedeon brought theſe thing foorth man god hee tooke ſacrifice might refreſhed hereby may appeare neither ſet vp altar afterwards offer peaceofferings thereon reade verſe 24 neither hee take man god conſume fire haue ſet downe meaning verſe weighing take trueſt yet denie angell vſed meate beſide expectation gedeon vſed ſay ſacrifice appeareth 21 verſe thereby gaue ſigne asked come one end ſacrifice ſigne gedeon whether firſt laſt thing gedeon brought named 19 verſe according ſetting downe theſe thing wit gedeon manoah offer refreſhing meſſenger know men god former time ſo great account people glad might receiue manner make ſtay eate abraham ſaid like euen ſo lot alſo loſt nothing gen 18 3 19 2 thereby may reade ſtorie ſame gedeon thought holy man therefore deſired take ſome repaſt hoſpitality vſed godly dogges dwelleth apoſtle ſpeaketh loue god hereby approue raſhnes 1 ioh 3 17 auoide vncharitablenes vnmercifulnes put difference betweene ſuch harbour relieue apoſtle preciſely warneth v galath 6 10 aime eſpecially gal 6 10 ſame houſehold body moſt concernes v looke hauing charge ſuch poore giuen v chriſt obſerue light vppon good perſons haphazard ſay moſt part doe caſt away bread vpon water many glozing hypocrite counterfeit face letter teſtimonie ſome pretence honeſtie doe abuſe good people repent often forwardnes receiuing ſuch ranger locuſts miniſters others beſides gift haue drawne cunning flatterie lend money ſhew curteſie anſwerable yet deceiuers haue left lurch teach wiſedome againſt afterwards like may ſaid raſh suretiſhips commendatorie letter like ſuch haue pledge vſe salomon phraſe let chriſtians learne wiſedome vnder colour pitie become prey ſuch hypocrite make benefit themſelues ranging courſe readie recompenſe nought deriſion ſcorne ſimplicitie though confeſſe ſafer extreme two neerer charity credulous ſuſpicious vnknowne ſtrangers learned former point truſt ſelues without good proofe ſo trow much leſſe others approued theſe two verſes declared gedeon rewarded kindnes verſ 20 21 ſhewed man god tooke ſeeking carefully know god much concerned whereof hee doubted hee well ſatisfied comforted thereby meate gedeon brought man commanded laid rocke diuine power brought fire rocke burnt vp conſumed fleſh vnleauened bread euen eliah called fire heauen 1 king 18 38 conſumed burnt offering conuicting baalites cleerer manifeſting miracle powred much water receiued offering ſignified ſame god vſed doe conſuming gen 4 like miraculous burning heb 11 4 gen 4 4 gedeon confirmed meſſage brought deliuering iſrael true hee knowne bee lord iehouah brought let v learne firſt earneſt ſeeking gedeon know god doct verſ 20 21 hee ſo anſwered ſatisfied wee neuer ſeeke lord vaine deſiring heartily bee reſolued doubt eaſed conſciences true praying theſe thing apoſtle iames ſaith prayer righteous man auaileth much iames 5 16 ſeruent oh depend god difficulty doubtfull caſes vſe beſt meanes confidence humble quiet ſpirit much aduantageth v contrariwiſe may troubled long enough ſhall finde eaſe either vſe indirect vnlawfull meanes vſe beſt commit way god depend vpon dauid 73 pſalme complaines greatly pſal 73 13 14 temptation grew vpon ſtrongly aſſaulted wit becauſe feared god proſpered outwardly himſelf therefore eſtate ſo good beloued god ſo much wherein god ſhewed iſſue ſo vnable time ſtay himſelfe wearied diſcomforted thereby hauing good aduice weighed matter ballances sanctuarie laying eſtates together ſignification giueth ſatisfied quiet minde cleerely ſaw owne follie grudging poore happineſſe rather daintie miſerie ſo man recouered frantike paſſion new come himſelfe freely doth ſhame himſelfe calling himſelfe foole ignorant beaſt ſo iudging deſcry dangerous condition vngodly ſet ſlipperie place floriſhing great ioy god people conceiue hauing conflicted note long doubt minde ſorrow heart either forgiuenes enioyed flee god either prayer hezekiah hearing eſay 38 2 word reading communicating feares griefes ſuch quiet pacifie conſcience example cornelius ſending peter eunuch communicating philip went away reioycing ſundrie others doe witneſſe ſhould ſufficient incourage ſuffer theſe ſores feſter inwardly concealing ſo preuaile againſt thē negligence fainting vnder make caſes knowne time neither prayer faſting hearing c find comfort againſt heauineſſe reſolution doubt ſtrength againſt ſinnes direction particuler duty like laſt refuge muſt repaire doe part ananias paul angell gedeon meane bring mind ſomewhat might ſpeake heart reſtore good health comfort againe doubtleſſe temptation could feele folly men baſhfulnes ignorance great denie themſelues libertie god alloweth ſo procure ſorrow themſelues ſpeake ſuch may haue reſolution ſeeking whereas thouſands cannot full gladly would make benefit thereof time make end fortieth sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges gedeon anſwered ſatisfied doct 2 verſ 20 21 ſigne asked wee haue heard note wee bleſſing reward obtained god kindneſſe curteſie ſhewed man thought whereby wee ſee god rewardeth thē receiue make account true ſeruants meſſengers gedeon though driuen midianites euen neere famine ſore oppreſſed thē ſo forgoing little time need extremity thouſand time much time plentie yet euen withhold liberalitie meſſenger heb 13 2 god loſt nay infinitly gaine abraham dutie receiued good men angel god poore widow yeelding mite prophet god ſomewhat 1 king 17 13 euen little ſhe receiued great abundance sauiour ſaith agreeably whoſoeuer ſhall giue vnto one theſe little one matth 10 42 meant ſuch beleeued ſight world abiect drinke cup cold water onely name diſciple verely ſay vnto ſhall loſe reward dutie adde way remembrance thereof intertainment part liberalitie fruite spirit refreſhing heart god saint worthie worke ſhall regarded god acknowledge men muſt doe may continue duty impoſed vpon fleſh philem 7 familie yet muſt vnder colour cold backward dutie loue neglecting letting paſſe ſuch opportunity good offered vncertainties come waſte much vpon lewd companie play gaming whoring drinking ſhall one day know coſt laſh ſpend good bleſſings god ſuch vnprofitable hurtfull manner whereby ſo many member chriſt might relieued intertaining beſtowing good part men good ſuch manner ſpeake commended gedeon receiue men mutuall good edification euill carnal end therfore chriſtians ſelfeloue worldlineſſe ſhould faſt handed ſcantie nigardly towards poore brother ſauours ſmall liking ioy haue communion saint fruite profeſſion whatſoeuer loue god pretend practiſe loue mercie muſt approue godlineſſe ſound frothie yet apparent many man ſaueth vpright conſcionable walking feare god hee made conſcience miſpend vpon luſts many doe would well ſerue allot applie good vſes returne angell thus reſolued gedeon ſigne mentioned departed cleerely ſheweth end came vnto falleth oft time god ſeruants end one trouble verſ 22 23 24 briefe meaning ad larger vnfolding 22 verſe beginning another ariſeth new trouble gedeon deliuered former doubt danger next verſe ſhewed hee brought 24 hee giueth god thanks trouble ſeene angell god therefore feared hee ſhould die maruell wee ſhall reade many place old father ſeene god might ſeene angel ſore terrified afraid ſhould die vnperfit ſpeech ſaying haue ſeene angell god hee ment alſo muſt ſupplie thus ſhall die iacob awoke geneſ 28 16 perceiued lord preſent place lay dreamed night afraid ſaid lord place aware hauing wraſtled angell thinking man maruelled liued manoah knew angell lord ſpoken iudges 13 21 ſaid wife wee ſhall ſurely die ſeeing wee haue ſeene god people ſaid moſes mount sinai god came exodus 19 deut 5 25 27 downe ſo afraid deſired moſes would intreate lord ſpeake manner leſt ſhould die reaſon feare ſinne made adam afraid gen 4 10 god voice ſinned reioyced aboue thing heare thus darkeneſſe came ſinne able abide light god preſence conſciences draue flie god almighty holy pure abide vncleanneſſe mortall men full ſo euen tainted wilfull ſinning againſt god eſteemed preſent death haue god preſent good prophet eſay teſtifier • ſaying woe vndone becauſe mine eies haue ſeene lord hoaſts though confeſſed hee man poluted lipp • neerer men come god leſſe blemiſhes ſmaller ſee eſai 6 5 themſelues yet know indued grace others came iuſtly troubled conſcience vnſound vnpure ſeeing god himſelfe nature author life comfort therefore feared ſo appearing gedeon place full mercy goodneſſe many thing decclared ſame vnto though knew lord euen brought himſelfe ſaying ala becauſe haue ſeene angell lord face face teacheth high reuerence ought haue god oft doct verſ 22 come preſence hath promiſed eſpecially appeare preſent namely aſſemblies people bee otherwiſe affected wee thinke pray vnto yet without terror conſequence euery becauſe haue learned euery rather wee ſhould follow example ſeruants god reuerence god yet learning reſiſt immoderate feare becauſe contrary lightneſſe boldneſſe many point doe thinke god ſort highneſſe maieſtie doth require yet ſpeake euen ſuch worſt ſort prophaneneſſe brutiſhneſſe ſome contrary extremity gedeon walke reuerence god proceedeth farre worſe cauſe moſt imagine wit meere groſſe ignorance infidelity appeareth behauiour publike place god ſpecially preſent priuat whither reſort pleaſure buſineſſe one paſſe time ſleeping prating laughing gazing wandring mind like vnreuerence drunkenneſſe wantonneſſe gaming rotten curſed ſpeech behauiour cauſe extreamitie theſe ſo great vnreuerence haue ſaid leaſt ignorance meane prouoketh ſee deuotion though poperie ſhameleſſely calles mother thereof diueliſhneſſe length deſparation contrary exceſſe gedeon aroſe beholding god amiſſe much obſeruing glory without goodneſſe ſo reuerencing god either word work fruite meere blindneſſe darkeneſſe vnbeliefe returne ſeruants god ought carrie themſelues high reuerence place ſpecially worſhip prayer word sacrament ſo indeuour doe thus yet deepely thinke conſider owne vileneſſe wretchedneſſe god greatneſſe glorious maieſtie fleſh humane nature chriſt without applying ſufferings obedience v faith cannot without danger ſenſe ſwallowing vp gedeon ſo oft time ouercome almoſt ouerwhelmed doe beſt wee thinke chriſt able ſo eaſily led carried ſpirit bondage feare therefore may thinke ſuperſtition poperie hath cauſed people ſuch carnall feare god ſlauiſh terror ſeruile worſhip bane poiſon infinite thouſand people becauſe doctrine driueth diſpaire leading men horror god wrath ſheweth way eſcape ſtand ſtead iuſtling aſide vnfained faith onely knit v god chriſt cauſes v pray draw neere without aſtoniſhment yea much comfort leaue returne people god grant want weakeneſſe faith ſaid ſuch want weakeneſſe oft time beſt v leaſt may ſo priuiledged argueth great ſinne corruption faith neuer perfect beſt view ſenſe experience hereof feare frighting notably clearely diſcerned v thunder lightning ſome apparent danger preſence god glorious maieſtie preſſeth v neerely though latter age world
