extreamitie ſides eſtate driueth away lightneſſe ſo may aſſured bee beſt manner freed feare god wrath iuſtly deſerued ſins hold faſt confidence aſſurance pardon thereof continual keeping vnder forgiuen wherby ſhal freed alſo ſuperſtitious carnal ſuperfluous feare whereſoeuer doth little diſtemper mind make vnfit dutie iohn 14 1 beſides ſeeing gedeons doubt anſwered doct 2 verſe 22 angell new trouble aroſe immediately feared hee ſhould haue died ſeeing angell god ſee one trouble griefe commeth necke another god ſeruants ſhould haue deliuerances accordingly ſhould faint able goe vnder euen reade iob one meſſage ended loſſe cattell iob 1 18 another commeth throwing houſe wind killing child although intermiſſion trouble god prouiding people may diſcouraged ſhould come muſt need yet frailtie ſo requiring 1 pet 1 6 note ſeeth beſt rod held ouer euery ſometime make ſmart little inough hold within bound may euen beſt ſay prophet afflicted pſal 119 67 went aſtray kept thy word vſe hereof firſt ſeeing ſubiect lye open trouble ſo many way wee neſtle ſelues earthly delight ſo vnwilling heare change rather looke armed againſt ſo ſmart commeth thereby ſhall ſting aſtoniſh v otherwiſe ſecondly ſeeing god ſeeth meete wiſdome exerciſe v many affliction ſeeing 1 pet 1 6 haue need end ſo may better hold v vnder moſt abſurd ſhould ſort ſeeke fulfill luſts heart whereby wee multiply bring trouble vpon liues thing therefore may note gedeon doct 3 ſoone faith ouerwhelmed affliction though angell prooued good contentment man ſhould deliuer iſrael oppreſſion midianites yet though ſuch thing ſpoken beleeued ſoone perceiued angell ſpake thinking man god behold troubled afreſh although theſe two troubled contrary wit promiſe god firſt hee doubted feare laſt ſeeing angell ſtay ſeeing point hand know could deliuer iſrael told beleeued ſhould muſt die time came yet conſidering ſaid affirmed reſolutely hee ſhould die yet iſrael deliuered euen ſo much dazled vnſetled affliction much like martha brother lazarus dead ieſus come thither ſhe came mourning ſaid lord thou hadſt ioh 11 22 brother dead know alſo ſaid ſhe whatſoeuer thou askest god giue thee wherein ſhe teſtified could pleaſed raiſe vp againe yet marke ieſus went graue raiſe death bad take away ſtone martha ſtood forgetting ſhe ſaid anſwered ieſus belieuing could raiſed life lord late ſtinketh alreadie hath dead foure day doth find true haue ſaid namely faith well grounded worketh comfort loue ſhall eaſily found languiſh waxe faint doubting feare affliction come way trie v ſo prone vnbeliefe doe firſt triall alwaies ſhew bewray yet oft time doe yea trouble come ſee likelihood ſhall leaſt doe long held vnder affliction eſpecially great matter ſome ſore loſſe paine like without eſpeciall cauſe commanded apoſtle bee rooted alſo bee confirmed abound faith col 2 7 thankſgiuing let v conſider end fruit corruption thus feare doubt wee ſhould beleeue reaſon againſt god promiſes affirming cannot performed wee ſee likelihood contrary yea though doe bad meaning neither gedeon yet great ſinne offer god ſuch diſhonour let v ſtriue rather beate downe fooliſh feares paſſions ſeeing moſt like ſure ſpeede worſt thereby giue place paſſions ſhall coſt although repent sauiour ſeeing martha ſudden feare diſtruſt checkes ſaying ſay vnto thee thou couldeſt belieue thou ſhouldeſt ſee glory god ſhould ſay looke word looke vnlikelihood manoahs wife ſtronger gedeon husband like caſe god would haue ſlaine v ſaith ſhe would haue ſaid ſhould haue ſonne ſo ought gedeon haue reaſoned god kill ſeeing muſt deliuer iſrael theſe contrary thus manoahs wife ſaw one muſt need falſe ſhe rather confuteth husband meſſage angell concludeth doubtleſſe ſhall liue die word god worth reſting vpon owne conceit thus ſhould bee v note alwaies carried full ſaile faith caſt downe neuer men fickleneſſe vnbeſeeming v men wiſh alwaies alike yet find contrary becauſe kept eie fixed vpon promiſe daily renewing hold therein ſtedfaſtly time conſidering sun alway ſame whither ouer caſt cloudes ſhine forth clearely ſo chriſt ieſus yesterday day ſame euer vnchangeable himſelfe wee change perſwaſion vnbeliefe verſe ſhewed gedeon thus perplexed verſ 23 ſenſe feare lord comforted hee free might better goe appointed know dangerous hindrance faith feare therefore hart could hee haue belieue hee ſhould worke ſuch deliuerance feared death euery minute howre angell put away feare promiſing good ſucceſſe quietneſſe mind ſhould dye doct great goodneſſe god long leaue faithfull people pinching feare penſiue heauines good time deliuereth leaſt ſhould much caſt downe diſcomforted ſo scripture teſtifie god would haue people left troubleſome paſſions feare ſorrow troubleſome experience teacheth ioſhua ſore troubled people iſrael fell ioſh 7 7 10 men ay god ſoone put likewiſe good woman goſpell ſore afraid reaſon earthquake appearing angell bid afraid euen ſaith matth 28 5 gedeon peace thee thus meet poore troubled conſciences mark diligently comfortably god ſpeaketh ſhould put away needleſſe ad hurtfull feares griefes cauſe lord willeth doubling word eſay 40 1 afflicted people ſhould comforted thus ſaith alſo many place comfort ye comfort ye people ſhould ſay comfort eſay 40 1 euen heart aduice ſo much neede bee receiued becauſe begin heauy forget euer comforted paſſe bound heauineſſe ſuch diſtempered perturbation ariſe v diſquiet v euill conſcience meanes ſome offending god willingly negligently care might haue auoided caſe wee haue warrant take comfort ſelues neither doth god time vſe comfort v therein courſe taken ſolemnely proſtrate ſelues accuſing ſelues bewailing ſinne broken heart mercy well looke deliuerance returne v moſt graciouſly powre oile wine wound moſt ſauourily eaſe griefe readily feare ſhall driuen away doe well saint peter ſaith ſhall feare v ezekiah 1 pet 3 13 notable example ſickneſſe troubled feare vntimely death whereby feared iuſtly church god might ſooner infected idolatrie yet well ſetled true worſhip god throughly purged made heauie complaint appeares eſay 38 hee deſired life ſimplie ſelfe eſay 38 10 good church going lord prayer perplexitie recouery lord ſtaid mind ſent prophet encourage promiſe miracle beare word hee ſhould recouer goeth vp houſe lord make ſolemne thankſgiuing recouery ſeeing many euen god deare one doe either know repaire god manner doe yet cannot humble heart therefore trouble themſelues ſuffering ſting ill conſcience pricke continuance time forgotten kindly healed ſoone breake againe ſo make life vnprofitable beſt till caſt vp vnſauorie gorge ſome great outward affliction ſearcheth deepe ſome agonie mind whereby brought helpe note ſome wiſe experienced miniſter true repentance come better eſtate followeth gedeons thankſgiuing clearely prooueth hee verſ 24 ſenſe receiued comfort well ſtaied angel word vnto whether take thus tranſlated tremelius builded altar lord pronounced peace whether thus geneua tranſlation read builded altar lord called iehouahſhalom lord peace ſay whether ſoeuer theſe take thanks god yea ſolemne manner called lord peace giuen double peace wit freeing dreadfull doubt firſt afterward alſo feare ſo gedeon leauing remembrance thankful hart vnto poſterity may ſee ſolemne thanking god ſame end tendeth ſaid built altar token thanks god quieted mind deliuerance iſraelites rage midianites alſo feare ſeeing angell god therefore action gedeons learne take good occaſions doct thanks god onely ordinarily daily benefit priuately ſelues well openly alſo god ſhall giue v occaſion ſuch mercy beſtowed vpon v ordinarie gedeon moſes ioſhua debora others doth note oft time v yeere ſeuen yeere deliuerances protection vnlooked mercy benefit hee ſolemne manner ſo ought much v lieth left teſtimony thanks thoſe came long thankſgiuing haue ſpoken fortie one sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges vers 25 ſame night lord ſaid take thy father young bullocke bullocke ſeuen yeeres old deſtroy altar baal thy father hath cut downe groue 26 build altar vnto lord thy god vpon top rocke plaine place take ſecond bullock offer burnt offering wood groue thou ſhalt cut downe 27 gedeon tooke ten men ſeruants lord bad becauſe feared doe day father houſhold men city night 28 men citie aroſe earely morning behold altar baal broken groue cut downe ſecond bullocke offered vpon altar made 29 therfore ſaid one vnto another hath done thing inquired asked ſaid gedeon ſonne ioaſh hath done thing 30 men citie ſaid ioaſh bring thy ſonne hee may die hee hath deſtroyed altar baal hath alſo cut downe groue 31 ioaſh ſaid ſtood ye pleade baal cauſe yee ſaue contend let die yer morning god let pleade himſelfe againſt caſt downe altar 32 day gedeon called ierubaal let baalpleade himſelfe becauſe hath broken downe altar ſecond branch fourth part chapter haue heard gedeons asking ſigne followeth third containing charge god gaue 33 verſe haue heard begin generall ſumme theſe verſes warre hee commanded deſtroy caſt downe idolatrie ſet vp true religion worſhip god theſe word caſt downe altar baal cut downe groue erect another offer god thereon gedeon accordingly 28 verſe yet perill euen life appeareth verſe 30 god ſtirred vp ioaſh gedeons father againſt men citie deliuered hand ſee 33 verſe verſe 26 particularly lord deſtroying verſe 25 26 ſumme theſe two verſes particular •• idolatrie bid gedeon take father young bullocke euen ſecond bullocke ſeuen yeeres old kept offered baal thoſe ſuperſtitious ſpared coſt ſeruing luſts lord hindred held ſacrifice baal commanding alter caſt downe alſo groue cut downe ſuch place pleaſantneſſe people vſed choſe worſhip meane ſuch place beſet wood groaues ſuch place vnder tree hilles called high place deut 12 2 3 c father alſo delighted offer lord forbad mooued thereby meditation heauenly thing rather idolater like vnto idol theſe offering baal ſuperſtitious opinion ſuch place fitteſt ſtirre vp deuotion therefore god commanded caſt cut downe altar deſtroyed god command gedeon doe another bee builded ſecond bullocke appointed baal bee offered burnt offering lord wood groue cut downe inſtruction theſe two verſes worthily doct verſ 25 26 c noted god time went deliuer iſrael bondage midianites hee would yet haue idolatrie firſt ouerthrowne leſt ſhould afterward returne againe teaching v thereby nothing goeth forward happily commonwealth except good order taken firſt walfare church namely rooting caſting downe idolatry ſuperſtitious worſhipping god ignorance planting ſtabliſhing true preaching goſpell teacheth magiſtrates firſt done people committed gouernment alſo priuate men vaine ſhall looke either one proſper liues meane enioy god bleſſing cheerefulnes ſound comfort god vpright heart firſt honoured ſerued euen let looke manner worſhipping god alſo namely hearing let take heed heare chriſt teacheth caſting away guile maliciouſnes c receiue word ſo may ingrafted meeknes luke 8 18 iawes 1 21 teachablenes becommeth beleeuers another place meane haue ſaid idolatrie ſo ſay ſinnes let v learne therefore commanded put away idolatrie ſinne could doe god true ſeruice way ſo ſay let v learne offer god acceptable dutie put away ſinne whatſoeuer riſeth vp way neuer ſo liking well pleaſing v doth choake ſmother grace god v euen briar bramble doe corne cannot ſpring vp proſper rule bee obſerued v firſt time god counteth v faithfull 1 tim 1 12 putteth v ſeruice time following wee haue ſtepped aſide thus eliah reſtored ſound worſhip god deſtroyeth 1 king 18 40 baalites ſame courſe tooke al good king reformed church iehoſhaphat hezekiah ioſiah 〈…〉 charged iſraelites deſtroy roote canaanite firſt entring vpon poſſeſſions wee haue heard booke foretelling otherwiſe would draw true worſhip iacob therefore went vp bethel worſhip god commandement gen 35 1 cauſe houſehold thoſe lately come padan aram laban put away idol clenſe themſelues ſo might worſhip lord good ſort manner muſt purge old leauen become new lumpe apoſtle ſpeaketh 1 cor 5 8 fareth v herein ſtomacke though receiue neuer ſo good meates yet bodie proſpereth ſimilitude full corrupt humour doe thriue good action wee take hand goe fraught clogged ſins knowne ſuch ſuſpected v till moſt filthie corruption purged therefore alſo saint peter requireth men put away maliciouſnes guile ſuch like annoiance firſt new borne 1 pet 2 1 2 babe deſire ſincere milke word may grow thereby ſore wound bodie though neuer ſo good ſalues laid thereto healed thereby vnleſſe corruption hurtfull humour ſimilitude firſt drawne ſo v onely true generall reformation church alſo particuler member perſon order lord vſeth fitting people vſe firſt mortifieth quickens neither could lord ieſus haue riſen againe iuſtification rom 4 25 firſt died ſins tranſgreſſion let would haue ſound comfort dutie firſt learne obedience ſubdue bring ſubiection rebellious euill heart luſts 〈…〉 thereof ſhall proceed roundly without impediment good doctrine god hath ordained ſweeten 〈…〉 ſoule furniſh life alſo helpe benefit praier sacrament loſe •• leaue fruite v behinde wee loden euery one foule loathſome ſinnes hee hath liued bee purged true repentance eaſie perceiued ſeene perſons ſo euery place towne church houſe forementioned meanes vſed among v haue experience haue marked many neede aſhamed ſay themſelues whatſoeuer rule good inſtruction well guiding liues haue bin giuen learned v benefit sabbath prayer publike priuate ſuch like haue come ſmall reckoning doe v little good haue let venome rancour ſpite deſire reuenge vncleane luſts worldlineſſe like haue ſeated ſpread heart caſt vp filthie vomit noiſome fruite thereof liues cauſe day ſo little profiting ſo ſlender fruites preaching complaine iuſtly inueigh againſt bitterly people point doe haue done retaine note ſinnes time paſt haue walked delighted yet haue daily earneſteſt manner wee could diſgraced made odious moſt fearful ſharp threat god adioyned thereto yea contrariwiſe make right kinde vſe miniſterie ſeeth thoſe waxe aſhamed themſelues haue ſeene face glaſſe god law ephraim bemoned themſelues bin confounded becauſe beare reproch iere 31 18 19 youth old rootes haue thus bin decaied new ſprigs grace haue ſprung roome haue begun lament god magiſtrate miniſter maſter family priuate perſons well aduiſed ſpeake thus yea finde true 25 verſe ſaid ſee god appeared doct verſ 25 gedeon night might haue ſeemed neglected forgotten euen gaue weightie charge vnto whereby taught god watcheth ouer doe good ſleepie minde nothing reade samuel salomon 1 sam 3 4 1 king 3 5 pſal 121 4 faithfull ſeruants keepeth iſrael doth neither ſlumber ſleepe meaning waketh watcheth continually keepe danger cauſe ſaid apoſtle peter eye vpon mother vpon young childe ſtanding ſee take hurt pſalme lord keepe citie watchman watch vaine god take part ſtrongeſt enemie ſhall able hurt ſaid peter act 12 6 ſlept betweene two ſouldiers night bound two chaines angell lord came vpon ſmote peter ſide ſo chaines fell deliuered herod see alſo pſal 4 lay act 12 6 〈…〉 owne take reſt thou lord vpholdeſt ſeeing pſal 4 8 • e keepeth bad alſo ſome perhaps ſay therefore might •• great matter keepeth watcheth ouer faithfull anſwere ſay apoſtle god ſauiour men 1 tim 4 10 outward trouble eſpecially beleeuers preſerueth ſoules euill vnto ſaluation ſaid keepeth ſaueth fatherly care affection wicked though keepe yet doth ſo iudge keepeth aliue euill doer vnto deſtruction people verified written salomon watcheth ouer ſleepe communeth awake prou 6 22 walke doth gouerne guide hereupon god care thus ouer night ſeaſon well part liues hereupon ſay reioyce lord alwaies ſet hand vnto day ſo haue fruite night alſo meditate make ſongs louing kindneſſe dauid ſaith himſelfe would praiſe god night pſal 119 62 ſeaſon haue terror bad doings imagine euill bed draw vpon greater ſpeedier iudgements theſe verſes together note enough gedeon ouerthrow altar baal vnleſſe builded another doct 2 verſ 25 26 lord build one lord vnleſſe caſt downe idolatrous altar euen ſo enough ſhunne euill except doe good therefore ſufficient couetous perſon except man bee mercifull enough bee innocent except man alſo fruitfull good one god commander true ſpeech negatiues conclude nothing eſpecially true therefore let ſuch whoſe goodneſſe outward action witneſſe ſuſpect deceiue themſelues reforming hart ſurely heart purged bee fruitfull againe inough forſake poperie c vnleſſe pure goſpell bee imbraced let one abandon dagon arke could ſtand together make hotchpotch abomination lord may learne two religion land though one tolerated onelie two contray diuers way meane worſhipping god ſtand together chriſt belial lord would haue ſpared gedeon labour enioyned goe warre ſettle ſound religion letting idolatrie alone falſe religion canker ioſh 7 24 true execrable thing tooke hold vpon whole ſubſtance achan ſo doth bring curſe vpon returne whereas lord bad bullocke dedicated baal offered burnt ſacrifice himſelfe anſwer lord might turne vſe pleaſed followeth without commandement may take vpon v iumble together god worſhip ſuperſtition cauſe ſometime commanded gold thing vſed idolatrie ſhould paſſe fire ſo might vſed ſo ſomtime commanded ſhould vtterly deſtroyed returne therfore word point ſee blemiſh gedeon done one part charge another like saul 1 sam 15 15 26 buſineſſe amalakites ſo way teacheth god alowes ſeruice duty done halues ſhould ſoundly one part point another indeuored neither doth hee allow v bee owne caruers take pleaſeth v turne backe may ſee clearely example one guiltie fault iehu reported ſlaine curſed poſteritie ahab deſtroyed prieſts baal purging falſe worſhip great part yet whereas part ſetting vp true worſhip ſhould haue followed text make ſtop ſets downe manifeſt ſeparation betwixt thus ſinnes ieroboam ſonne 2 king 10 29 nebat iehu departed nay golden calues bethel dan deſtroy baal surely carried common gift holy ghoſt euen feruency worke made inſtrument purpoſe true deteſtation ſinne manifeſt hee would haue abandoned alſo haue reſtored pure worſhip ſtead ſhould teach v holy inſtruction ſo oft general commended v haue hated pit hell ſo word ſignifieth place euill neglect doe good rom 13 nay cleaue rom 13 9 thing cemented glaſſe windowes word pithy ſaith apoſtle let ſtole ſteale yet ſufficient epheſ 4 28 man thiefe therefore addeth worke hand doe thing good good token reformed commonly scripture ſhall ſee order obſerued vnto prohibition firſt ſet downe added commandements dutie though two firſt hardeſt purge corrupt habite leaud qualitie yet god haue appeare ſo new contrary practiſe former worke may ſound perfect neither doth command men clenſe euil ſo keep themſelues void empty barren grace ſet vp neutralitie rather chriſtianity wil haue men ſeaſoned grace ſtabliſhed heb 13 9 hebrewes commandeth v ſow among thornes weedes giues v libertie neglect planting haue rooted vp cutting downe groues time gedeon doct 2 verſ 25 deut 12 3 charged commanded ſo god deuteronomy argueth greatly abuſed way ſo worſhipping ſtrange god true old father forbidding thereof worſhip god vpon high hils pet 4 17 thus god beginneth iudgement owne houſe thus ioſhua ioſh 24 15 reforming whole congregation profeſſe moſt worthily houſe ſerue lord ely iudge alſo gouerning houſe ſtaying outrage ſonnes ſeuerely threatned good reaſon ſithence next ſelues muſt firſt reformed el zeale ill becommeth v argueth hypocriſie next ſay kindred family therefore wee muſt without partialitie firſt ſet vpon ſo may appeare deteſt ſinne heartily cannot endure thoſe loue beſt others may aſhamed ſtand owne defence feare offend father firſt begin child ſhall ſeruants looke eſcape followeth gedeon god commanded verſ 27 ſenſe ſeeing appointed time hee ſhould doe therefore diſpatched night feare leſt done day might haue withſtood father ſeruants men citie yea himſelfe haue ſlaine obeyed lord teſtified faith hee blood god commandeth ought vnto v beare downe let ſtand vp way hinder v obeying friend counſell giuers againſt count chriſt peter hee diſwaded matth 16 23 going ieruſalem ſuffer death people hee wiſdome deliuered houſe salomon ſaith wiſe woman mentioned 2 sam ſaued whole citie child generation 2 sam 20 16 teach v herein therefore pray ſpirit wiſedome doe commanded ſtudie beſt ſort yet alwaies wee may ſee good reaſon faine vſe beſt ſureſt meanes effecting ouerthrow idolatrie firſt ſeeing ſtabliſhed among taken roote therefore could little enough throw downe alſo people ſo ſuperſtitiouſly firſt deepely idolatrie ſuperſtition falſe worſhip rooted people heart ground faſt bee ſeene theſe theſe ſtories thoſe booke king philiſtims blind deuotion dagon people fond mad zeale maintaining falſe worſhip baal ahab time offering bowing downe praying man might haue eaſily plucked heart belly haue diſſwaded alienated loue reaſons firſt becauſe ſinne ſo error ſtrong plauſible deceitfull secondly god accurſeth hearken truth ſo ſhall belieue lie bewitched 2 theſ 2 10 therewith see conſider end eſay 44 19 thirdly worſt eſay 44 19 weed haue deepeſt root corrupt cuſtomes opinion becauſe agree man bad nature eaſily rooted whereas thoſe good commendable like precious plant flower hardly take roote may pluckt vp two finger day curſed reliques heatheniſh popiſh faſhions hardly laid downe looke ſome vaine fooliſh cuſtomes • ond deuotion ſuperſtitions yeere long kneeling ſtockes ſtones ye may eaſily gueſſe hard thing remooue expel like gamaliel ſaid doctrine apoſtles actes 5 34 god ye ſhal need oppoſe wil fal ſelf muſt know god working miracle satan complices theſe day trie vttermoſt vſe meanes ere come paſſe yea may ſee grow experience pollicie ſtrength reſolution alſo vphold rotten building vntill death ſure ſhall fall vpon ſhoulders whereas true pure worſhip god authoritie credit heartie loue doth find obtaine hand moſt profeſſe nay haue ſoone inough many reuolt fall retaine doe moſt part moſt dead cold manner inſomuch diligenteſt preaching earneſteſt perſwaſions doe ſcarcely preuaile ſo farre men get ſo much name good religion place dwell yet ſo zeale neither grounded vpon knowledge ſome yet ſtabliſhed ſetled therein yet note euen hold conſtantly good conſcience profeſſion hope ioy vnto end although good conſcience bee farre idolater time onely come ſaith chriſt aſſurance fauour whatſoeuer blind zeale deuotion yet therein doe ſaid giue aſcribe much corrupt religion falſe worſhip coſt time ſpending ſame feruencie therein aboue number v went vpon good ground promiſe god ſo might haue reioyce aboue many v ſuch ſelues compare comming ſhort zeale ſhal ſpeed alike meane papiſts haue caſt teeth required hand againe let ſet worke pay wage profeſſion ſhall ſaid people draweth neere mee body matth 15 8 heart farre therefore vaine doe ſuch worſhip yet adde ſeeing haue ioyned theſe popiſh worſhippers idolater ancient time affirming like zeale ſay adde concerning deuotion theſe day like thē former age though blindfold men eies goe currant bee zealous profeſſion yet manifeſt number moſt ſubtill hollow hearted diſſemblers deceiuers grant ſome ignoranter ſort feruent falſe religion blind deuotion yet moſt reſt deceiue world ſo zealous wilfull ſpitefull malicious doe doe partly belly partly though againſt conſcience vphold religion tradition cannot scripture end may much lieth receiued truth rather proteſtants deadly hate abhorre hope merit zeale doth ſet forward bee granted much whetted thereby though deceiued ſhould promiſes god freely made v good thing much animate harten v another thing note ſoone earneſtly inquired 2 ſhould deface baal ſtrippe ornament whereas god word may lie vnpreached many occaſions long inough asked fault lieth complained bewailed neglect thereof ſought remedied poperie man ſhall ſpeake againſt maſſe breaden god diſpraiſe yea leaſt part traſh trumperie ſhall cruelly handled blaſpheming higheſt degree appeares ſuch time perſecution owne land attempted zealouſly deface idoll put moſt exquiſite torment euen gedeon purſued moſt hereticall ſeditious diſturbur called put death offering reproch vnto baſe idoll baal oh happie time men zealouſly bent againſt atheiſme ſuperſtition idolatrie adulterie ſuch like many zealous holy heauenly thing account requeſt many open apparent ſinnes thus day doe moſt men ſtorme rage miniſter god god ordinarie inſtrument gedeon extraordinary ſee content dally good earneſt ſtriueth pull ignorance formall could worſhip god vncleaneneſſe whatſoeuer ſinne cleaue vnto theſe idoll baal ſerue poore man gedeon adoe ſaue himſelfe furious eager multitude miniſter hath many place goſpell hath preuailed defend himſelfe ſwarme hornet flie eares ready ſting might rather haue ſaid wild beaſts deuoure curſed reprochfull ſlanders virulent tongue caſting baal ground alſo appeareth many gedeon vpright hearted men ſuch openly ſhew diſlike idolatrie becauſe could ſo eaſily find light vpon guiltie partie counted ſo ſlight inquiry eminent pietie saul ſtature taler people could lie hidden odious man many hee yet could haue ſeene beholding alſo grone wracke periſhed wee ſee eieſores odious ſome one good profeſſors goſpell companie prophane hickeſcorners troubleſome life leade amongſt baited vexed pleaſure made laughing ſtocke sampſon philiſtims whoſe ſake yet ſuffered lord liue may come repentance neere inough likelihood vtterly deſtroyed brought naught may reade ſtory geneſ 18 32 geneſis ten righteous men sodome city conſumed yet though haue ſuch benefit ſticke ſweare might liue merrily without diſturbance therefore god hath prouided better people muzled mouthes ſuch tiger beares theſe ſo may profeſſe goſpell without danger feare purſuit ſcorne better commonly wing protect inferiour ſort baſe ſpitefull perſons let ſuch ſee acknowledge great libertie releaſe vſe wiſely inioy church samaria iudea actes 9 31 galilee booke act leſt god take prop ornament protector make ſay many doe full heauily would gladly zealous fruitfull profeſſion ala cannot ſo ſoone peepe doores pelted againe beaten back frownings diſgraces opppoſitions ſuch mightier ſelues point anon thus farre outrage people anſwere ioah verſe 31 32 ſenſe next two verſes wiſe magiſtrate firſt ſuppreſſe bridle rage people becauſe ſaid ground groue altar bullock pertaine ioaſh cleare alſo vpheld idolatrie ſhould thus lightly ſuffer act ſonne gedeon paſſe vnpuniſhed ſome man perhaps aske ſhould find fault people ſeeking puniſh treſpaſſer againſt baal anſwere ioaſh certified god likely gedeon ſonne sampſons father marriage ſought philiſtion woman lord howſoeuer hee doth ſhew god ſtirred vp fauourer ſonnes hee doth three reaſons driue people hold beates backe purpoſe attempt firſt reprooues boldneſſe priuate men without calling take vpon bee reuengers baal quarrell contrary god ſecondly threatens feare god iudgement preſently thirdly ironicall ſpeech againſt baal ſaying god let pleade himſelfe ſhameth driues enterprize ſaid layingout 31 verſe 32 giues ſome name according anſwere hee made people name ierrubbaal generall occaſion offered conſider ſtrangely god doct verſe 22 wrought gedeon againſt enemy beyond al expectation ſtirring vp ioaſh aſſiſt oppoſe would haue ſaid people would haue borne downe gedeon backed ſo ſtrongly hauing idolatrous magiſtrate ſide behold lord turnes heart pleaſeth make ſtand defenſe ſonnes act whoſe cruell iudge like bee condemne death theſe mad people required looked wee muſt thinke ſmall courage doe thus though magiſtrate concourſe people ordinary iudiciall manner mutinous vnlike demetrius caſe dianaes worſhip ſame god hee ſaw meet cauſed lyſias heathen captaine become protector paul againſt iewes paul himſelfe preacher goſpel perſecuted alſo hand yet ſhortned like good church incouragement people according ſaying wiſe man man way pleaſe lord make enemy prou • 6 7 friend conſequent thoſe thing moſt feared like worke moſt againſt make worke contrarily euen moſt good furtherance beſides god turnes heart men riuers water example haue cyrus reſtorer iewes worſhip god pilate wife achiſth dauid c way onely particularly may ſee ioaſh idolater inſtructed god againſt wickedneſſe ſoone hee able reſiſt ſtand againſt teacheth ignorance vnbeliefe cauſeth many practiſe maintaine either falſe worſhipping god like wickedneſſe though denie ſome doe worſe though know euill yet doe ſo wilfullie better hoped lord vouchſafe mercie ioaſh ſhall ſoone bee changed former ill courſe abhorre ſtand againſt moſt deadly maintained practiſed therefore deteſtable ſtate liue popery ſo much ſeeke brought hearing goſpell preached therefore lie ſtill therein confuſion ſuch doe like vnto whereas many kind ſinne brought preaching turned god true repentance agreeable whereunto paul perſecutor blaſphemer 1 tim 1 15 c lord mercie vpon becauſe ignorantly noting one cauſe ſect conuerted becauſe sauiour ſaith ioh 9 41 knew euill therefore ſinne remained incourage liue ignorance leaſt puniſhment condemnation men preferre ioh 3 19 darkneſſe light whatſoeuer cauſe chriſt ſaith matthew 2 iudgement tyrus zidon ſhall bee eaſier corazin matth 11 20 bethſaidah day god comming repented inſtructed vſe comfort ſuch affect ignorant hoping thereby eſcape god wrath whereas rather ſhould conſider ignorance wil procure yea chiefe cauſe ſinne cauſeth yea becauſe eaſie hard matter ſuch ſimplie wilfully ignorant get knowledge faith would applie themſelues hearing therefore ſeeing perſiſt blindnes cauſe inuincible ignorance grow vpon themſelues ſhal ſeuerely puniſhed obſtinate diſobedience contempt let ſuch god hath mercifully enlightned conſider pitie thouſands lie darkeneſſe praying god preuent light wondering iohn 14 22 god ſhould reueal himſelfe rather world alſo may learne hence god ſheweth mercie one doct 2 kindred family oft redounds many reſt one raiſed promotion reſt fare better god reuealing himſelfe gedeon father ſo familie brought knowledge true god reaſon whereof double firſt god bleſſing vpon ſeed ſtock righteous secondly becauſe god hath wrought graciouſlie ſome one kindred family commonly wrought great deſire doe good reſt great tenderneſſe loue paul profeſſeth roman heart deſire iſrael may rom 10 1 ſaued although doe alway preuaile becauſe ſaluation followeth god election nature yet often doth otherwiſe iuſter condemnation proofe sauiour chriſt himſelfe may bee example brought diſciples ſome kindred religious hath taught v goſpell compared leuin ſpreaddeth thus ſome one god hath well ſeaſoned grace many reſt haue like manner made partaker ſame grace ioyfull ſight behold would ſo poperie one draw many wiſhed might ſeene common receiuing goſpell effectually reſt familie affinity ſo ſay often ſeene though commonly one city two tribe prophet ſaith meaning yea often ſeene godly abigail coupled nabal iob fooliſh woman truly ſaid many good parent child vngratious tell samuel face yea many parent alſo badly diſpoſed 1 sam 8 5 euen child ſhall riſe vp againſt condemne go knowledge feare god wedded take ſcorne learne nay well would learne good teacher abuſed authoritie curbe diſcourage child third ſort moſt wofull eſtate like father like child head ſo foote ignorant brutiſh vngodly eſay ſaith ioaſh anſwer let v conſider ſome thing people occaſion offered ſpeeches vſed note doct 3 verſ 31 property worthie magiſtrate wit defend god true worſhip caſt downe idolatrie oppoſe himſelfe againſt ſeditious cauillers wicked men euen vnto death countenance courage power beſide affection ought manifeſted magiſtrates defence ſtabliſhing god ſeruice ſo ſhould alſo meaner men commonneſſe euil ſtrength hath got al place dulleth edge moſt theſe day ſlackneſſe matth 24 12 coldneſſe magiſtrates truly cauſe iniquitie ſo aboundeth ſo euill hauing vpper hand doe cauſe publike officer iuſtice priuate perſons vnable reſiſt ſo vnwilling goe puniſh may thanke themſelues dauid profeſſeth himſelfe betimes would cut pſalm 101 8 houſe god wicked ſcorners maligner ſound worſhip worſhippers god oh wiſhed indeed pray earneſtly ſuch wee iuſtly complaine gouernours dauid minde ſo reſt might liue vnder authoritie honeſt quiet life free noiſomnes ſuch goates horne ſtinch peſter ſheepe would faine liue peaceably ſerue lord common ſort ſee ſwearing blaſphemie contempt sabbath drunkenneſſe abomination ſwarme many place ſeeth dare boldly doe ſame ſhall ſcorned grieued ſee may note ſinne ought ſo odious ſo vile doct 4 account ſhould much grieued behold maintaining ſtand ioaſh himſelf armed againſt idolatry demaunds blind people would ſtand plead baal yet might haue replied plead thou thy ſelfe haſt done lately whoſe groue baal placed caſe altered ioaſh euen paul preached goſpell perſecuted notable token repentance men affection deſires quite changed euill thing could drawne yea 2 cor 7 11 breake holy indignation themſelues ſins committed againſt god although know forgiuen ſurely vpright hearted man would thinke ſhould abhorre ſin hateth grieueth ſee another deceiued held ſnare himſelf hath bin holden therfore count abſurd ſhould maintaine delight whereas contrary day may bee ſeene hee diligently marked ſtand againſt ſo ſo well minded may ſoone noted ſhamefull boldnes likewiſe marked word ioaſh ſaying ye plead baal doth ſo let die morning although ſaw magiſtrate againſt yet ſo blind ſtood defence idolatrie euen ſo may ſay great boldnes growne vp age doe euils openly men woman former age haue bluſhed ſecret ſame ſinne zimri cozby like alſo ſuch dare reuile raile vpon thoſe ſpeake againſt lewd doings theſe truly verifie ſaying wicked men deceiuers 2 tim 3 13 waxe worſe ſhould laſt day ſhould ſo perilous time day world groweth neerer end ſo ſinne waxed meaſure ſinfull number ſinnes ſee new addition faſhions daily meaſure alſo meane greedines impudencie pertinacie ſinners aſhamed euils harlot prouerbs wipeth ſelfe cleane filthineſſe ſhe virgin wee ſee whore growne time degree boldnes tamar iudged whore father becauſe ſhe couered face gen 38 15 maske long agoe pluckt onely bee occupation moſt ſpirituall adulterer day ſo farre aſhamed ſhew face thought maſters trade dare ſpit face modeſtie reprouers ſaid aged men wealth haue ſomewhat beare euen youthes ſexes whoſe honour ſhould bluſhing euen heathen called colour vertue braſen faced inferiours al ſorts take vp curſed ſpeech lord pſal 12 4 ouer v oh doth ſee lord marke ſet vpon ſhame ſorow belliesful miſeries come daily euery one courſe wofull end furthermore well anſwered ioaſh let baal plead himſelfe doct 5 meaning need cannot ſhame pleade ſuch god could plead owne cauſe elia alſo like 1 king 18 caſe ſaid blind people ſo may ſaid maintainer idolatrie ſuch like abomination idol god worſhip let keepe themſelues fire need thinke doings good maintaining reaſoning ſuch ſtockes let waite ſee end thereof come well ſet worke plead ſo farre helping neede hee could reuenge owne cauſe againſt ſuch would deface ſo like ſuch maſter ſerue laſtly verſe 31 former gedeon ſeruing god ſo doct 6 commendably commanded alſo hee name commended worthie perſon beleeuer yet called ſeditious heb 11 32 themſelues ſo indeede therefore hee counted worthie die yet meane whereby liue note wicked charged neuer ſo iuſtly euill doings yet euer returne accuſation vpon accuſers example doctrine god word preacher thereof doe god bleſſing become meanes outward inſtruments much good ſome turne euill way thereby diſſenting among reſt ſee ſuch wiſe fall commonly exclamation teacher ſuch follow doctrine troubler people themſelues haue done euill euen papiſts crie ſide diſturbed diſquieted may ſuffered ſerue god would bee glad doe prieſts ſet foorth pedlary ware ſale ignorant ſuperſtitious ſometime deceiued fellowes many place ſtill doe leſſe palpably simon magus people samaria ſorceries bewitched theſe ſuffer idolatrous worſhip hand bee ouerthrowne ſay people ſaid ieremy worſhip queene ierem 44 19 heauen moone ſtarres fooliſh people epheſus cried mad mood great diana epheſians act 19 34 yet vnlike make tumult ſedition accuſed paul companie leaue theſe returne began thus crie wicked lewd doings bee reproued iuſtly pulpit preacher ſeditious make ſtrife tumult come draw people whereas quiet well enough draw euen thoſe forſake companie ſpeake leaue curſed manner behauiour ſo depriued therefore make part good againſt cry ſeditious thus elia charged trouble land taught true ſeruice god reproued idolatrie ſhewed troubler land liſt know euen ſuch obedient commandements lord may ſee ſuch charged troubleſome perſons whoſe preaching bewraieth bad ſort therefore incenſed againſt becauſe euill deedes brought light neither obey doctrine though bee hated greateſt part ſaying sauiour teacheth came ſend peace earth ſword debate againe matth 10 34 come ſet fire earth deſire alreadie kindled luke 12 49 ciuill diſtenſion trouble follow vpon preaching profeſſing filthie heart rebellious ſort ſtinch commeth dunghill away better ſauour ioaſh called ſonne ierubbaal baal ſhall contend againſt doct verſ 32 reproch memoriall brought idol contempt hee called ierubboſheth 2 sam 11 21 ſheweth ſo farre aſhamed owne ſonnes fact reioyced idolatrie foile meanes well minded people ſhould doe like proceed fortie three sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges verſ 33 midianites amalekites eaſt gathered together pitched valley izreel 34 ſpirit lord came vpon gedeon blew trumpet abiezer ioyned 35 ſent meſſengers manaſſeh alſo ioyned ſent meſſengers aſher zabulon naphtali came vp meete followeth laſt point foure fourth part ſumme theſe 3 verſes chapter noted 11 verſe ſhewed gedeon midianites gathered themſelues together prepared warre againſt hauing deſtroyed idolatrie ſet vp true worſhip god thus people might ſee done ill might haue vndone againe profitable gedeon done ſo though may remember trouble ſtirres raiſed againſt could bring paſſe oh mercie god midianites held bound hand feete till gedeon brought ſo worthie worke paſſe euen none able reſiſt euen lord omnipotent ſumme theſe three verſes lord gaue occaſion gedeon bringing midianites aſſiſtants land preuaile againſt get victorie ouer truſting word god lately ſo well ſtrengthened prepared goe againſt lord armed drew helpe together tribe neere vnto ſeene text ſo iſrael againe reſtored great multitude thus trouble gedeon otherwiſe feare doct verſ 33 midianites prouoking iſraelites battell many hurt thē yet god would ſee haue true worſhip ſet vp idolatrie caſt firſt haue heard wiſe men world though allowed would yet haue deferred till victorie note hereby much pleaſeth yt ſhould poſt great waighty cōmandements worſhip ſeruice earthly affaire bodily buſineſſe though waighty time enough diſcharge lay aſide exerciſes praier hearing reading like owne pleaſure ſelues may ſee meete expedient ſhould ſo cheerefully may goe one wee haue well diſcharged whereas deferring leaue vndone altogether ſometimes appetite much quailed returne therfore reade great neede make poſſible ſpeede reſcue church great diſtreſſe time yet heſter ſought lord faſting heſter 4 16 prayer ſhe went king went great courage helpe preuailed otherwiſe v moſt part firſt ſerue ſelues though thing lawfull ſeeke owne profit pleaſure great ſinne yet hauing ſo done alſo leaſt occaſion eaſily brought omit lord due altogether many time haue ſaid leaſt performe ſlackly coldly halues ſo good vndone appeareth true common courſes men many dealing worſt namely one haue ſet order praying houſes perhaps ſome doe omit altogether afterwards yet moſt part meete performe dutie god haue ſerued ſelues filled belly firſt caſe wee commonly oppreſſed note drowſineſſe ſleepe man would think vtterly vnmeet accompanie god ſeruice therfore little pleaſing farre better diſpoſe fitter time buſineſſe yet thing bee left vndone wee muſt take heed ſpeake like take hand leſt giue iuſt ſuſpition thinke thing good enough lord publike worſhip god church hath giuen better example doe duty god refreſh ourſelues abraham ſeruant hauing meſſage maſters doe ſo diligently follow executing hee would take owne neceſſarie repaſt gen 24 33 hunger wearineſſe till faithfully diſcharged buſineſſe iehoſaphat neerely driuen moabits ammonits firſt ſeeke lord faſting prayer would take weapon hand let marke loſt thereby whether hee could poſſibly haue found like helpe ſo preſent ſpeedie following buſineſſe policie power hee could haue made yet adde becauſe would lay burthen needleſly conſcience man neceſſitie cannot auoided man may omit greater dutie leſſe could elſe done ſo opportunitie watched taken doe afterwards conclude matter let practiſe gedeon teach v rule wit giue precedencie alway thoſe duty beſt price withall greateſt neceſſitie call neceſſitie commanded abſolutly alwaies ſo ſinne neglect omit watch beleeue repent c may left laid aſide cauſe heare word ſeaſon ſeaſon commanded alſo doe earthly buſineſſe ſixe day yet omit ſome time ſin becauſe commanded ſome time done may ſome caſes time diſpenſed omitted euer neceſſarie humbled ſin beleeue god alſo loue feare god patient ſome like duty firſt commandements theſe abſolute duty charged vpon v generally alwaies buſineſſe may preferred theſe whatſoeuer delay admitted though vnder colour moſt ſerious returning thereto afterward take libertie ſelues theſe caſes god curſeth v satan get ground v worke lay aſide commonly naught worth done beſt manner therefore wee ſee felix pretending would heare paul againe leiſure thoſe thing terrified conſcience durſt heare longer preſent neuer leiſure heare againe ſeeing ought might ſecond ſort duty prayer familie priuatly ſelues like although duty ſo ſimple neceſſitie action may euer hinder yet let haue ſolemnely couenanted lord vſe ſeene great cauſe thereof fruite thereby beware winde themſelues courſe vpon vnwarranted occaſions ſo ſhall neuer want ſome one ſhift ſalue matter till breach growne ſo great ſlender patch mend nay griefe ſlight repentance ſcarcely repaire wee ſee cloſe ſmooth lid frame warpe eaſily brought leuelnes againe god ſhall teach wiſedome caſes lawfull omiſſion ſuch leane ſo much ſo long owne till haue laid themſelues vnderfoote chiefeſt duty thing rightly conſidered ought haue ſaid preferred word sauiour patterne prayer matth 6 clearely ſhew mentioneth matth 6 9 10 petition tending good ſoule body hee command v aske thing concerne glory god ſtands comming kingdome poſſible good might aske pardon ſinne deliuerance euill neceſſaries life without reſpect god might bee honoured theſe great ſinne ſo doe ſaluation man ſoule hazzarded neglected might bee rather ſhould ſtand compariſon moſes paul requeſt people forgiuenes conuerſion may appeare secondly midianites banded themſelues againſt iſrael doct 2 like haue ſpoiled liues good almoſt done ſhould conſider change eſtate ſubiect euen vnto looſing good thing god hath inriched v make liues comfortable oh health peace abundance well married feare god accompanying doubtleſſe little paradiſe wee liue earth wee note may looke compariſon may ſee moſt enioy liue among wiſe acknowledge giue god praiſe bringing foorth much fruit yet god affoord v could vſe well good ſeeing men neſtle iohn 15 9 themſelues vpon theſe vncertaine thing little wiſdome doe ſo bold tempting god ſee ſtrange alteration fall liues eſtate changeth ſay men age ſickneſſes diſeaſes onely ſubiect towardneſſe hope likelihood goodneſſe ſometime therefore ſhould haue rooted growne forward therein ſuch neuer waxe much worſe worſe affliction much diſguized time cruell enemy domeſticall forraigne meane world haue oppreſſed may eaſily bee ſuites debt note ſuretiſhip priſon haue moleſted commonly fall vnrulineſſe diſobedience child vnfaithfulneſſe leaudneſſe ſeruants vnpeaceableneſſe vnappeaſableneſſe neighbour landlord great iniuries offered ſhall vexe together ſickneſſe calamity meet ſay ſome theſe mothes garment haue eaten beautie eſtate decaied conſumed theſe caſes ſay altered changed neuer perſons elimelech famine conſtrained change dwelling good dauid owne ſonne almoſt driuen kingdome euen ſo much ſundry forementioned way ſhall afflict bad men doe ſhew vncertaine hold haue yet haue hold better thing greateſt price heere among men together reproches diſgraces befall ſay nothing ſundry kind death cut ſufficient proofes ſay haue good cauſe beare low ſaile note euen higheſt thinke haue little haue moſt looke change proſperitie make heauen habitation againſt go hence earth pompe beautie ſmall vncertaine rich indeed glory theſe thing muſt haue end yet commonly god prouoked much vnſeaſonable change men proſperitie miſery kindly inioying god good liking though ſometime god afflict thus end iob c becauſe many god deare one prouoke turne bleſſings delight temporall wife child good beautie ſtrength c ſorrowes puniſhments muſt ſo elſe would bee worſe let alſo beware breake againſt leaſt ſinne wilfully committed repented ſpeedily cauſe procure themſelues roughly handled commonly euen like men particularly groſſe abuſe theſe outward thing themſelues ſubiect bee deformed diſguized ſtrange rare affliction god hath good thing ſtore alſo ſoone ſtrip thereof ieremie ſaith perſon iewes lam 1 12 euen hee withholdeth altogether ſome thought good ſay though ſomewhat argument hath ſaid followeth god furniſhed gedeon gift ſpirit wiſdome courage whereby according hee ſaid goe thy power thou ſhalt ſaue iſrael hand midian new fitted teacheth god appointeth ſeruants charge buſineſſe hee inableth goe miniſtreth helpe accordingly paul ſaith farre greater 1 tim 1 12 worke gedeons god counted faithfull put ſeruice appointed thereunto saul choſen king gift giuen gouerne god making thereby text ſaith another man lord dealeth thoſe hee maketh miniſters goſpell ſhall doe meſſage people faithfully diligently plainely powerfully iuſt challenging boldly take vpon ſo waightie calling doth concerne ſauing deſtroying ſoules men hauing furniture preaching goſpell ſoundly clearely neither care looke way grace beſtowed vpon god worke onely ſome great ſeruice gedeons fight paul preach moſes deliuer iſrael egypt euen liue married eſtate walke calling publike priuate much profeſſe name chriſt condition ſoeuer ſpeake god calling man worke meane ſenſible calling voice gedeon extraordinarilie man entreth theſe eſtates function action direction warrant lawfulneſſe neceſſitie thereof word ordination church vſing alſo holieſt beſt meanes obtaine faith knowledge wiſdome conſcience diſcharge well ſuch ſay god wanting although may thinke caſe gedeons yet need bee weaker faith lower brought ſeely priuate perſons yes god ſo bleſſe proſper lawfull enterpriſes yea though deeme themſelues vnfit vndertake ſuch workes vnable goe ſo ſhall haue cauſe bleſſe lord wonder loue faithfulneſſe goe ſame obſerue aſſiſteth bleſſeth ſide relie vpon head pollicie ſhall wanze come nothing reſiſted reade ſuch commanded goe againſt canaanite see reade num 14 verſ 40 45 refuſed would need goe fight againſt forbidden therefore ſore diſcomfited haue ſpoken gedeon thus furniſhed couraged go againſt god enemy verſe 34 35 ſo much ſeeing ſuch ſucceſſe promiſe angell note well thing proſper v goe forward certaine ſet worke lord particularly furniſhed faith promiſes preſent time come heartned experience god helpe time paſt nothing lord meaning ſet worke greater ſeruice gaue good proofe firſt owne weakenes ſo aſſiſtance leſſer meane deſtroying baal point hereafter god theſe worke vpon mightily ſo wee eſpecially conſciences witneſſe v haue caſt purged ſuch ſinnes wherein liued oh ſay goe roundly readily duty wee take hand ſo contrary doe crop preſent ſlight diſlike ſhall ſenſibly eaſily feele awkelie vntowardly wee goe worke iſraelites againſt beniamites iudg 20 cap 20 point often occaſion blowing trumpet draw call together companie doct 2 ſhould aſſiſt marke ſaid follow battell euen abiezer meaning people tribe familie ſo furiouſly bent ſet againſt ouerthrowing baal alſo would haue put death ſame may bee maruelled ſee ſo turned vnto lord doubt changed heart againe ſaw hurt fell gedeon baal barbarian paul viper verily looked act 28 5 many doe iudge profeſſors god worſhip according outward bleſſing ſucceſſe eſpecially beginner yet time note grow ſee matter better ioh 4 told woman ioh 4 42 though drawne heare yet beleeued vpon better ground owne knowledge returne againe men runne vaine idol ſerue god amiſſe word would conſider get thereby euen leſſe nothing deceiued wherein put truſt would ſeeke ſerue lord onely alſo according word vpright heart knowing bountiful rewarder heb 11 6 pay maſter yea godly would take hart themſelues god buſineſſe conſidered lord cauſeth many reſiſters enemy goodneſſe turne practiſe cleaue vnto reuel 3 9 profeſſion worſhip feete ſerue god worthie fruit innocency though procured onely good report ſome generall allowance draweth others heartie intertainment truth loue thereof much noted ſomewhat point ioaſh vpon entrance ſtorie elſe reſt tribe zebulon aſher naphtali followed verſ 35 though lord called gedeon onely yet could alone fight againſt enemy faith god doth exclude helpe men ſecond meanes may lawfully conueniently bee inioyed god ſeruants led faith tempt god ſerue prouidence wiſdome learne doe one eſpeciall cauſe god furniſh hee calleth becauſe hee giueth grace ſeeke aſſiſtance enterpriſes ſerue prouidence ſo one bound helpe another need requireth tribe gedeon reade chap 2 verſ 3 fortie fovre sermon sixth seventh chapter booke ivdges vers 36 gedeon ſaid vnto god thou wilt ſaue iſrael mine hand thou haſt ſaid 37 behold put fleece wooll threſhing place dew come fleece onely drie vpon earth ſhall ſure thou wilt ſaue iſrael mine hand thou haſt ſaid 38 ſo roſe vp earely morrow thruſt fleece together wringed dew fleece filled bowle water 39 againe gedeon ſaid vnto god angry may ſpeake let prooue againe pray thee fleece let drie onely vpon fleece let dew vpon ground 40 god ſo ſame night dry vpon fleece onely dew ground gedeon prepared go warre againſt midian haue ſenſe theſe verſes heard former 3 verſes began 4 point 4 part chapter according diuiſion made eleuenth verſe whereto wee may remember adioyned asking double ſigne theſe word holy ſtory ſheweth furniſhed lord gift haue heard hauing gathered army together gone meete enemy pitched theſe verſes ſay followeth deſired god firſt ſigne hee might bee confirmed concerning victorie ſigne asked putting fleece wooll threaſhing flore dew might come fleece onely might drie vpon earth wherein maruelled promiſe god confirming ſhould doubt aske ſigne anſwere vpon due conſideration thing though may like inough hee altogether void blame yet hee herein tempt god ſome asked ſigne chriſts authoritie deſired onely haue faith confirmed thereby would otherwiſe haue wauered man goſpell beleeued yet prayed lord helpe mine vnbeliefe ſo gedeon beſides lord granted mar 9 24 requeſt without reproouing like hee would haue done gedeon doubted laſt rather thus perſwaded becauſe reckoned epiſtle hebrewes among heb 11 32 commended faith herein conſider weakeneſſe beleeuing occaſion doct verſ 36 37 38 gedeons asking double ſigne louing kindneſſe lord pitying v therein bringing v euen yeelded ſelues may ſaid though wee beleeue god promiſe yet ariſeth naturally v daily continuall weakeneſſe faith partly yeelding much carnal reaſon partly ineuitable frailty note fleſh fighting againſt ſpirit v hereof faine wraſtle battell cumbat daily vphold preſerue weake faith otherwiſe would ſoone faile giue ouer experience haue oft found ſelues example peter comming water chriſt martha raiſing lazarus dauid complaining ſadnes heauines heart diſciples much aſcribing chriſts bodily preſence hundred scripture doe teſtifie much may ſame ſaid ſelues yet feare frailtie againſt ſuch aſſaults haue cauſe daily doe learne reſt god thoſe deare ſeruants god wee much ſtaied heart well eaſed thereby reſpect former time ſay little particuler contrary wee haue obtained god gift beleeuing freed condemnation wee ſhall haue eternall life reſt looke daily reuiue heart hearing word often whereby feeling god fauour reuiued quickned alſo remembring applying god promiſes day day time time labour alſo reioyce therein ſo may kept holy compaſſe thereby wee ſhall euer flitting ſtand vncertaine ſtay ſhall onely firſt beleeuing leaſt doubt euen haue ſtabliſhed ſetled therein firſt aſſurance eaſily obtained ordinarily till haue ſome experience god louing note kindneſſe towards v owne vprightnes euen ſo may ſay ſame beleeuing god promiſes temporary thing ſhall faint therein without forementioned exerciſe hardly beare croſſes goe vnder ſome paine ſickneſſe haue victorie ouer ſome ſpeciall ſinne mortifie ſome corruption hath much preuailed v theſe purſued earneſtly promiſes grace bee oft vſually recorded feruent prayer god ſtrength denied much fruite ſhall follow ſhall ſenſibly perceiue wee get ground ſelues behalfe grow neerely acquainted minde god grant v preuaile againſt ſuch difficulty yet wee grow thinke ſhall neuer obtaine grace againſt corruption outgrow diſcouragements well beare croſſes finde bleſſing calling notwithſtanding vſe publike priuate meanes yea wee doe minde looke theſe thing ſlightly alſo may well know fruit expected come thereof cauſe ſome deſtitute true faith often time new begin theſe thing long going ſtanding ſtay ſmall profiting ſubduing ſtriuing againſt vnbeliefe commeth barely▪ altogether frailtie would gladly preuaile cannot great part yeelding temptation occaſions drawing v violently▪ ſinne againſt conſcience cauſeth man hold vpon promiſes faile exceedingly much giuing place carnall reaſon perſwadeth wee neede note giue ſuch attendance theſe thing meane wee ſee greatly ſet backe thereby manifeſt without diligent heed taking ſtrengthening faith eaſily grow diſtruſt god promiſes much hearken ſuch voyces ſhall oft heare ſounding eares neede take ſuch paine haue head beaten occupied whereas diligence giuen thereto attaining ſo excellent gift moſt willing offendings god weaken ſelues ſmall need haue may eaſily ſee conſider wee fall doubting vntowardnes heart without adding ſinne faith fitly compared fire may well goe negligence adding thereto wilfulnes quenching thereof ſinne ſo hardly giuing credit god aggrauated hereby deale men great matter wee eaſily ſatisfied beleeue wee haue word writing manifeſteth plainly diſtruſt towards god nothing inough ſtay v vnleſſe thomas may groſſely feele ſee deſire nay ſay compaſſe matter owne pleaſure profit preferment oh bold full courage although muſt goe vnder perill loſſe ſuch like thing obtaining ſame ſuffer difficultie danger ſo much ſtretch faith beleeue hope waite god hath promiſed though hee giue v neuer ſo great cauſe incouragement good euidence teſtimonie note former experience others ſelues yet wee haue heart therefore wiſe let v much ſtronglier built vp confidence god fauour promiſes take paine abide therein pray watch againſt occaſions vnſetling chaine vp ſo great aſcribing haue done ſenſe reaſon ſo ſhall ſee ſelues well propped vp vpholden though haue promiſe miracle doe gedeon one ſignes gedeon asked wee haue heard followeth gedeon deſired one ſigne fleece might moiſtened dew ground drie deſired dew verſ 38 39 40 earth fleece might drie ſignes asking god yeelded would haue eaſily done approued teach weaknes timourouſnes wee wiſedome repaire god make mone feeling burthen ſay confidence lord ſtrengthen faith ſhould ſtaied eaſed ſo diſtempers whatſoeuer ſhould left ſelues forſaken many ſaid haue learned doe therefore whole life conflicting doubt feares riſing anew mindes endleſly malice diuell diſquieting moleſting hindring reſolution holy boldneſſe god alloweth commandeth whereas enemie buzzeth preſumption hold promiſe forgiuenes life otherwiſe doubtingly fact gedeon ſo earneſt doubled requeſting ſtrength confirmation god ſhould daſh quench ſo proofe god anſwering prayer one time wee ſhould learne vſe ſame meanes againe like manner often neede ſhall require another time knowing god honour beleeued promiſes ſo ſtands good liking often ſue giue v ſome cleere inſight belong v though wee tye certaine meaſure ſo may ſtaied neither omitted gedeon ſecond ſuit commeth deprecation owne boldnes importunitie god muſt warily vnderſtood hereby followes god angrie gedeon bold making requeſt gedeon ſinned highly knew would anger god rather moſt inward feeling vnbleefe hee deſired forgiuen ſupplied confidence alſo deepe humilitie conſidering great libertie ſillie worme might ſpeake ſo freely almightie admitted ſuch familiaritie maieſtie vttereth ſpeech full reuerence angrie thy ſeruant hee ſhould ſay iuſt thee bee diſpleaſed weakneſſe beleeuing lord pardon bee angrie ſeeing craue ſtrength againſt thou giueſt leaue doe let deſire granted infirmitie couered reſpects named saint god scripture haue euer vſed themſelues thus reuerently humbly lord ſo reſpectiuely gedeon doth example abraham ſhewes praying gedeon wiſe able vſe ſuch priuiledge ſhould al ſeeke knowing baſe mettle euen duſt wormes priuiledge ſay yet admitted preſence god glory ſhould admire humilitie giues v acceſſe oh ſhould affect v yea reuerence ſhould draw v euen poore man come often ſame friend borrow money come ſaucily looſely common matter little beholding caries thanks reuerence countenance behauior ſtory gedeon purpoſed ſay concerning ſelues 3 haue ſay lord namely reſpectiue child ready eare giueth prayer yea particularly point ſtrengthening faith gedeon twiſe deſired ſigne confirme god granted ſhew haue ſaid could pray long grace precious ſhould granted v would bee glad inioy weakneſſe fainting doe plie god feruent requeſts may note ſetled belieuing either power ouer ſpeciall ſinne ſhal giuen v hope patience beare ſome trouble oft god behalfe earneſt wee ſhould finde god would furniſh v accordingly aboue wee could looke thus abraham dauid paul others grew ſtrong faith whole chapter seventh chapter booke ivdges verſ 1 ierubbaal gedeon roſe vp earely people pitched beſide well harod ſo hoaſt midianites north ſide valley hill moreh 2 lord ſaid vnto gedeon people thee many giue midianites hand leſt iſrael make vaunt againſt mee ſay hand hath ſaued 3 therefore proclaime audience people ſay whoſoeuer timerous fearefull let returne depart earely mount gilead returned people mount giliad two twentie thouſand ſo ten thouſand remained 4 lord ſaid vnto gedeon people yet many bring downe vnto water trie thee ſay thee man ſhall goe thee ſame ſhall goe thee whomſoeuer ſay vnto thee man ſhall goe thee ſame ſhall goe 5 brought downe people vnto water lord ſaid vnto gedeon many lap water ſaue three hundred backe againe many battell verſe 9 ſecond god aſſured againe victorie dreame one enemy interpreting another gedeons hearing 16 verſe third victorie ſelfe ouer god gaue end chapter firſt part chapter come firſt part difficultie hee ſenſe firſt part pitched army ready goe meete enemy lord cauſed ſend away excepting three hundred leſt ſhould giue ouercome midianites owne ſtrength thoſe three hundred hee alſo appointed taking ten thouſand remained ſending two twenty thouſand away gedeons drawing neere enemy armie wee may ſee ſenſe firſt verſe doctrine note hee confirmed faith hee ſhould obtaine victorie whereabout doubted ſo much although grant meet ſhould ſtaied ſo great meanes god vſed purpoſe yet ſee faith commonly failes moſt triall greateſt danger neereſt therefore heartned incouraged ſaw great number midianites himſelf ſmall armie compariſon meete fight cleare well perſwaded truth god promiſe caſt himſelf confidently thereupon thus faith grew doct verſ 1 ſhewed ſelfe apparantly ſhould haue much laboured belieue preaching goſpell haue ſelues alſo much occupied attaining thereto ſhould ſay look fruit thereof namely haue proofe faith indeed common difficulty wherein time paſt wee haue bee foiled found almoſt impoſſible ſometime leaſt vnlike ſhould preuaile faith euen ſay ſhould looke haue ſome ſtrength thereof otherwiſe former time example man ſeeth ſinnes guilt though truly humbled euen lift vp hand faith heauen lay hold mercy god chriſt alſo time temptation reſiſt temptation beleeuing god wil giue v victorie againe man muſt loſe good life hee hath goſpell elſe forſake cleaue faſt vnto beleeuing ſhall great gainer thereby ſo man wanteth meat drink apparrell yet euen acknowledge god prouidence though weake meanes reſt peaceably like manner hauing long heard word ſhould make profitable ſelues belieuing ſhould grow point ſhould wearie rouing wandering ſleeping diſcourſing diſputing againſt like vnpleaſant fleſh ſay samuel speake lord thy ſeruant heareth ready reſt thy whither reproouing commanding incouraging yea vpholden guided reformed kept within compaſſe whither terror commandements promiſes ought part dutie readie ſay euery one himſelfe lord haue learned ſhould worke note calling vſe peace proſperitie behaue ſelfe ſecret others walke throughout life innocently fruitfully belieuing ſhall loſe fruit labour bleſſe thy name ready bee put triall altogether time past occaſion offered thy maieſtie welcome incouraged ſtoope meekely vnder mine affliction ſee thou haſt ſent belieue thou art readier aſsiſt mee bearing thou wilt giue good iſſue therefore farre ſo plunged note amazed trial haue euer learning neuer come knowledge yea alway child going helpe others neuer alone propertie changeling thus wee ſhall find good martyr found god called ſtake endured fire though hee could endure flame candle ſinge ſo much finger theſe ſuch like haue proofe faith thing much bee reioyced good ſigne faith groweth ſtrengthened otherwiſe hath time paſt according ſaying apoſtle coloſſians rooted grow coloſſ 2 7 faith ye may abound therein ſo might ſay many thing particularly impatience anger wrath vncleane vnchaſt deſires exceſſiue feare trouble conceit terchineſſe raſh iudging many haue purſued chace diſliking condemning long time oft praying againſt ſhould looke ſome victorie ouer faith prayed reſt perſwaded ſuch meanes ſhall bee vſed v vaine looke rootes faſt ſetled heart looſened v dailie ſhall ſo appeare euen new occaſion ſhall bee offered ſhall prouoked offend liuely ſhew though wee ſhall neuer vtterly void reliques ex himſelfe complained diſtreſſe low brought ſo one would thinke vnfit inongh aſcribe ought themſelues ought rather hauing brought ſuch bondage yea might alſo eaſily haue ſeene cauſe giue glory god two thirtie thouſand eſpecially ſo many thouſands fainthearted ſouldiours ſubdued hundred thouſand perſons odious people becauſe would haue abhorred ſuch leaud conceit quality themſelues remained vnder bandage yea asked feeble reſpect enemy lord would deſtroy midianites would thinke god fought mightily oh would haue confeſſed leſſe ſeene cauſe great thanks true till victorie gotten themſelues foiled midianites may saul ieroboam vnderlings would haue counted greater priuiledge themſelues highly indebted god hee would haue beſtowed leſſe matter kingdome vpon got ſhewed vnable made partaker ſo great felicitie wee ſee fit haue ſo weighty glorious matter kingdom committed vnto euen wee ſee meane beggarly perſons neuer knew belonged wealth dignitie yet raiſed vnto cannot beare nay ground cannot beare bee ſet horſebacke ride reaſon euen till breake owne neckes whereas ingenuous welbred nature aſwell carry themſelues ſuch condition eſpecially education grace meet together pooreſt bace ſimple ſurely many v hardly beare little wealth ſmall reuenues hundred nay note ſcores saul could kingdomes though ere wee lowly meane owne eies fellowes therefore ſaid may ſee ſoone abuſe god benefit ſuch good liberty beſtoweth vpon v rich health promotion credit would might ſay ſpirituall gift alſo euen pharaoh princely eſtate greatnes rich man goſpell wealth herod luke 12 19 actes 12 23 praiſe loue v ſeeth better way taken v good take away ſuch liberty againe v let humour ſeeing breed pleuriſie v croſſe v leſt ſhould ſteale away heart ſo driue ſay benefit people many muſt make fewer elſe wil glory multitude greatnes euen ſo cauſe lord ſay v saul bad perſon haue much note wealth muſt plucke ſome haue health long muſt abridge haue many benefit eaſe credit countenance c vnleſſe could vſe better muſt ſaith lord neceſſitie take cauſe lord hold many vnder commonly haue great matter put hand much croſſed thoſe earthly commodity loue beſt leſt ſhould worſe rarely ſeene euen better therefore except god ſhall beſtow vpon v humble wiſe heart well ballanced grace account theſe thing wit tranſitory ſoone flitting away valew heauenly treaſure faith godly life aboue earthly rich let v way alſo vaineglorie ſaid people mentioned would haue done therefore holy ſtory addeth reaſon lord would haue ſo many goe battell leaſt ſhould ſay preuailed owne might ſo ſhould haue taken god honour themſelues wee learne god denieth doth giue v attempt many great meanes ſometime doe yet good ſucceſſe leaſt hee wont doe although man reaſon bee likelihood enough yea great becauſe ſhould man would ſtrange whereas wee pretend wee might partake ſuch ſuch bleſſings wee would bee much thankfull ſeruiceable lord ſhould conuict v diſſimulation falſehood telling v know owne heart wee would bee proud bold vainglorious lord ſhould bewray v poiſon lurkes v ſhould thinke himſelfe great wrong cutting many ſhort deſires might like doe ſeruice enioying whereas ala knowes ſo hee loſeth honour himſelfe ſo dealing men nay hee hath much adoe ſuch meanes keepe men deſtruction leaſt deepe diſhonouring returne moſt true god denie much vainglorious perſons deſire would neuer giue due take themſelues inſomuch wee ſee ſuch doe onely vaunt wealth birth ſtrength ſuch like haue onely ſome good qualitie prouident husband keepe promiſe pay due owing glorie thereof diſgrace faile therein though moſt doings may caſt dung face ſhame giue vnto god due promiſe ſelues nothing vpon condition god acknowledge wee giuer one hath right diſpoſe hath giuen v denied ſucceſſe wee hope bring paſſe let v token confeſſe lord may iuſtly ioynt v fume fret raile curſe much leſſe vtter ſo much word others thinke accurſed wee ſee ourſelues croſſed beare wee meekly patiently greater gift haue receiued humble fruitfull dutifull manner let v ſhew ſelues vſe gedeon bidden ſend away many people verſ 3 haue heard let v ſee exempted warre ſent backe ſort two twentie thouſand text noteth bee thoſe fainthearted timerous ſo god commanded deuteronomy ſuch ſhould ſent backe leſt deut 20 8 ſhould diſcourage conſidered gedeon captaine thought meet warre god called alſo place duty giuen gift purpoſe though waxed timerous faintheartednes ſloth vſe employ gift ſhame ſin though god ſent backe ſpeake owne edification benefit many exempted god battell yet thought fit meete men doe well beſtow vſe theſe common gift spirit skill knowledge manuary thing pertaining bodie preſent life much may thinke excellent gift spirit illumination matter belonging life come men doe deceiue expectation thoſe liue meane farre worſe goe oh true many note perſons goe ſight men good yet lord doth account ſo exempt militant church euen ſhoaleth great many theſe ſouldiers faint vnfit warre ſhould come fight enemy yet gedeon thought meete perſons yet know wee much eaſilier deceiued iudging theſe looke therefore thing infinite degree precious god iudgeth v hang wee vpon opinion men hee allowed men one 2 cor 10 18 ſelfe praiſeth god praiſeth therefore account among v profeſſing goſpell though branded notorious ſins ſound hearted good chriſtians though know till god make manifeſt theſe kind v iudge time howſoeuer men iudge ſuch feare god depart euill himſelfe commended iob ſuch one ſure accepted ſpecially applie oddes betweene fainthearted valiant ſouldiers great euen three one yet went ſeruice god outward ſhew ſo great diſproportion among ſuch worſhip god betweene lukewarme indifferent ſort chriſtians feruent heartie zealous worſhippers indeede god rom 2 28 cōpared reu 3 16 doth inable allow v ſeuer one ſo wee may determine farre number one exceedes gedeon wofull proofe bewraieth leſſe haue ſaid yet diſmiſſed theſe whiteliuered ſouldiers armie gedeon onely accepted ſeruice theſe three hundred hee fitted purpoſe faith reſolution alſo exclude hollowhearted lukewarme temporizing chriſtians hauing part among ſuch honour ſo farre bee honoured meane chriſtians ſhould bee martiall men fit field god worke diuers ſo diuers kinde ſpirit hee requireth doe gedeons men courage might chriſtians feruencie reſolution walke god though wee haue midianites fight withall yet haue worſe enemy within v without therfore haue need ſpirituall magnanimitie vſe ſpirituall weapon againſt though warrefaring men yet wee waifaring chriſtians need feruencie ſpirit generall command rom 12 feruent hot ſpirit command rom 12 11 iames 5 16 iames 1 19 matth 11 12 ſame prayer iam 5 ſaying feruent therein likewiſe hearing ſwift heare telling v violent ſnatch kingdome c like affection alſo muſt haue duty though deede danger trouble befall men profeſſion ſpeciall occaſion offered expreſſing courage wee nouriſh grace daily duty ſhall hand haue greateſt need ſpeake becauſe ſee ancient heauenly fire appeared moſt worthily many entrance progreſſe good courſe pietie good conſcience turned aſhes extinct burnes ſo cloſe feeble hardly diſcerned ſtead thereof either blockiſhnes deadnes note come vpon men fainthearted remiſneſſe indifferencie men cared greatly whether profeſſed ſaue name ſake many could content without well enough ſuch diſgrace farre aboue theſe ſouldiers gedeon ſinne theſe onely ſent backe lord vomit mouth god goodneſſe euen gedeons three hundred looke spirit good cauſe temper chriſtian ala beſides diuell ſtead grace brought franticke ſort furious perſons whoſe zeale depart church returne ſtorie wee haue heard two twentie thouſand ſent backe ten thouſand left goe doct 2 againſt hundred thouſand yet lord ſaid euen many teacheth would haue v learne depend without meanes hee ſee expedient ſo otherwiſe thoſe weake yet would haue v perſwaded regardeth ſeeketh good euen hee doth ſo ſaid moreouer gedeon hee would trie theſe ten thouſand verſe 4 ſhew fit himſelfe might ſee men dull dimme eyed behold god ſecret power doe good giue eye faith behold ſhould ſeeme ſtrange lord ſhould doe wee ſee wee ſhall ſee likelihood thereof power goodneſſe bee admired magnified ſheweth ſo manifeſtly weakeneſſe euen men ſee ſaw mightie pharaoh siſera midianites ſpoken like brought ſuch downfall enough god ſaid therefore sauiour matth 4 tels v man liueth bread onely word god matth 4 4 like manner man thriues wit prouidence care onely bleſſing god riſing early late going bed pſal 127 2 eating bread ſorrow ſhall auaile maintaine god plucke backe hand bleſſing apparell heates ſelfe power word promiſe indeede outward meanes men ſee taſte handle therefore groſſe manner reſt diſcerne ſuperiour power god much leſſe beleeue worke without ſo meanes faile health ſafetie ſucceſſe giue ouer hope eſpecially ſee ſome great outward barre let ſtops way whereas yet three child tell king babel beleeue god ſerue deliuer onely without meanes contrarie meanes doubtleſſe scripture wee haue watchword giuen v ſinne euen matter ſaluation ſelfe although none ſeede abraham ordinarily elected ſaued though extraordinarily ſome comming chriſt yet onely relied vpon theſe outward meanes heard ſpoken say within ſelues haue abraham father god matth 3 9 able ſtones raiſe vp child vnto abraham becauſe men ſeparate matter happineſſe true meanes appointed god end deſire meane faith repentance humiliation election ſaluation iuſt god alſo meete kinde ſeparate carnall end meane wealth proſperitie like meanes vſe vnlawfully diſhonour gedeon told hee muſt take none thoſe doct 2 god appointed thoſe hee muſt take teacheth v god word muſt direct v action peace warre ſame neuer ſo meane baſe whatſoeuer face wee ſet matter yet light ſteps walke darkneſſe take hand ſo many thing day ſo throughout life wee chuſe ſerue owne fantaſies wee haue col 3 16 light plentifully dwelling v guide v wherein hard thing ſee god hath much againſt v oft time beſt ſeeing man call tell error action life oft hee pſal 130 3 pſal 19 12 offendeth hee ſhould looke ſtraightly done amiſſe ſhould able ſtand ſtay time fortie sixe sermon seventh chapter booke ivdges heere lord ſhewes gedeon verſe 5 6 ſhould goe warre led water thoſe three hundred lapped water hand theſe induſtrious fit buſineſſe drunk kneeling downe like haue vnprofitable burden reſt multitude might haue giuen aduantage enemy vnreadineſſe delay occaſion ſhould haue offered thing lord teacheth v hereby although wil haue none truſt themſelues yet would haue ingenuous induſtrious men fit imployed thing requiſite calling buſineſſe men bee willing diligent skilfull profeſſe take hand good conſcience may performed ſo contrary chriſtians auoided whether miniſter magiſtrate priuate perſon husband diligent handed wife huſwifely none lazie idle careleſſe ſpake ſtory othoniel caleb chap 1 lord ſaith thoſe three hundred men hee would deliuer verſe 7 iſrael another ſtrong confirmation gedeons faith perſwaded obtaine hee already begun belieue ought bee well marked v thing wee haue great note need ſo ſtedfaſtly belieue ought hold conſtant therein daily continuall meanes lord doth much reuiue quicken faith hold hope confidence two grace wee muſt haue well ſetled v faith ſtrengthened v ſo theſe two excellencie hope ſeene epiſtle corinth theſe word god hath deliuered v ſo great death doth deliuer 2 cor 1 10 v hope alſo deliuer v price worthines ſeene clearely epiſtle hebrewes thus caſt away confidence hath great recompence heb 10 32 note reward theſe two faith confidence make whole life ſweet ioyfull dauid ſaid confidence fruit faith heart fixed ſing giue thanks vſe hereof wee looke well wee find part theſe oft hearing manner repetition experience god promiſes concerning fauour time time toward v therewith marke often faintings doubt feares yea one ſame action may ſee cauſe better fortifie ſelues againſt ala marke ſuch thing meane euen thoſe may take good thereby capable ſhrinke hearing hardneſſe comming toward ſo gather experience faith hope confidence againſt new trial come weaknes impatiently note goe vnder affliction ſo ready faint vnder burden afterward god great mercy theſe three hundred ſo willingly verſ 8 ſenſe readily follow obey gedeon according word god alſo heard grant yet god perſwaded inwardly beſides would haue departed reſt 31700 would haue grudged liberty diſmiſſed haue refuſed beare burden alone yea would haue forſaken looked vnto god ſhould note duty doct required god muſt regard forwardneſſe backwardneſſe others ſo much doe god looketh hand thus caleb ioſuah encouraged people goe forward againſt canaanite looking backwardneſſe ſpies god word authoritie haue inough perſwade v ſo numb 13 28 29 33 looke way men example iſſue conceit diſcouragements wee may bee ſure eaſily coole diſmay note v therefore ſay practiſe theſe diſcouers great ſinne many haue burden laid vpon grudge ſhould free matter priuiledge honour grudge ſhould partner theſe ſee exemplified apoſtles chriſt diſciples iohn apoſtles ſeeing one caſting diuels none maſters follower indignation complained sauiour thought none chriſt themſelues worthy ſuch office iohns diſciples grudged chriſts becauſe faſted often chriſts faſted thought wrong others note held hardly cauſe former eſpecially pride vnthankfulneſſe latter either ignorance worſe euen boldneſſe therewith ſee rare perſon equanimitie endure ſhould excell gift body mind eſtate grace bleſſings accompanying nay many melancholike fooliſh nature becauſe themſelues giuen penſiuenes ſadneſſe c enuy cenſure ſuch take libertie mirth recreation company diet though paul ſaith may pleaſe god without condemning another diſeaſe looking narrowly doe god hee requireth ſelues mixture many humor ſelfeloue curioſitie diſtruſt others diſeaſe ſay wee may ſee haue peter looking iohn chriſt ſaid nothing hee laid heauie burden vpon peter himſelfe asked chriſt ſaying master iohn 21 21 ſhall man doe like bee ſeene mentioned goſpell ſaw fauourablie dealt themſelues ſaid grudgingly haue borne burthen day c elder brother prodigall repined ſee ſo well entertained many theſe may ſee ſo ill minded way may boldly ſay ſingular grace god duty throughout
