ſaid ſhould ioſhua 24 15 beſt way ſerue lord himſelfe regarded owne proſperitie welfare ſo wilfull forſake owne mercy learned follow better maſter reſolued iona 2 8 conſult neither fleſh blood neither cleaue lying vanity make ſtraight ſteppes commandement god indeed exodus 23 2 ſee others readier wee dutie willinger beare reproofe forwarder well mercie loue meekeneſſe zeale ſtronger endure affliction burden vnwelcome fleſh doe wee doe yet looke ſo much god obedience euill follow multitude moſt alwaies worſt beſt differ varie among themſelues ſo except men goe leaden rule word god muſt bee eternall vnchangeable canon dutie canon ſhall iudge action men either approouing condemning ſhall bee follie run croud ſay ſhroud themſelues vnder couer others whoſe company ſhall aggrauate rather extenuate puniſhment following example haue ſaid ſecond part chapter verſ 9 ſame night lord ſaid ariſe get thee downe vnto hoaſt haue deliuered thy hand 10 thou feare goe downe goe thou phurah thy ſeruant hoaſt 11 thou ſhalt hearken ſay ſo ſhall thy hand ſtrong goe downe vnto hoaſt went downe phurach ſeruant vnto outſide ſouldiers hoaſt 12 midianites amalekites eaſt lay valley like graſhoppers multitude camel without number ſand ſea ſide multitude 13 gedeon come behold man told dreame vnto neighbour ſaid behold dreamed dreame loe cake barly bread tumbled aboue hoaſt midian came vnto tent ſmote fell ouerturned tent fell downe 14 fellow anſwered ſaid nothing elſe ſaue ſword gedeon ſonne ioaſh man iſrael hand hath god deliuered midian hoaſt 15 gedeon heard dreame told interpretation ſame hee worſhipped returned vnto hoaſt iſrael ſaid vp lord hath deliuered hand hoaſt midian lord taken away ſtrength power gedeon ſumme theſe verſes meane whole armie well nigh hee knew full well would worke mightily vpon weakneſſe diſmay therefore ſecond part chapter ſhewed god incouraged prouided remedie weakneſſe ſtrange manner done euen enemy god bidding goe downe midianites tent dreame one interpreting another ſhew gedeon hee ſhould haue victorie ouer hee heard hee anew confirmed faith concerning victorie notwithſtanding ſmall number men firſt let v ſee god bringeth gedeon neerer neerer ſenſe doctrine verſ 9 brunt triall haue goe campe enemy doe come neerer danger gone ſo lord alſo adde new comfort vnto triall note greater hee ſaith deliuer thy hand though danger feare might like ariſe thee thereby may ſeeme greater may appeare next verſe gedeons feare greater increaſed lord ſaith thou feare goe downe c ſheweth v ordinarily neerer triall ſore affliction feele doth come toward iſſue worketh vpon v reaſon becauſe affliction far ſenſe prouoked imagination ſo much whē draweth neere threatens v commonly minde multiplieth greatneſſe feare diſciples greatly troubled maſters departure iohn 14 1 till ſaw remedie muſt needes forgoe teacheth ſuch feare hangeth ouer v ſhould onely firſt hearing frame ſettle heart againſt ſudden diſtemper aggrauating fooliſh conceit bee patient willingly ſubiect hand god therein weigh owne weaknes wee may wiſely beware fainting ſo wee may pray god ſtrength alſo daily oft continue ſuch exerciſe neerer iſſue feruently like sauiour agonie feare comming iudas reſt take feare indeed readie moſt aſſault v faint may know ſtrength neuer great prou 24 10 iames 1 4 patience ſhould haue perfect worke helpe v beare affliction vnto end come vpon v ſo wee ought giue patience perfect worke come keeping downe painful feare till come note hath ſaid matter former proceſſe hiſtorie may ſee wee muſt oft much ſtrengthened againſt feare riſeth trouble come ſmart cauſeth come till danger paſt ouer good ſigne affliction commeth ſhall much diſguiſe aſtoniſh v weaken terror manner often meditating certaintie deliuerance preparing affliction accordingly come otherwiſe come vpon v armed man againſt reſiſtance ſeeing god fortified gedeon new promiſe helpe euen ſhould goe downe armie enemy hee came neerer doct 2 verſ 9 perill ſo may learne trouble ſhall ariſe god people euen ſo ſhall comfort alſo increaſe according apoſtle god 1 cor 10 13 faithfull ſuffer tempted aboue ye able trouble encreaſe ſo ſhall conſolations hee giue iſſue temptation ye may able beare though one ſame word promiſe yet hath force one time well another ſtrengthen v wee haue faith lay hold lord dealing v minſe meate v diet like v coſt willing neede complaine ſuch manner oh trouble intollerable draw foorth heart blood ſhall ſinke note vnder c required v ſtand owne ſtrength deriue chriſt head promiſes god ratified loſſe friend good life likelihood thereof affliction euer fit remedie ſtay v vp comfort v cannot tell would looke god hand vnleſſe wee would deſire angel heauen certifie v minde alloweth v age looke becauſe hath oft entreated ſpare wilderneſſe long linger daintines quailes ſee couetous man neuer ſatisfied gold triall ſerues bring commoditie greater price ſaid gold ſerue feede apparell v except wee abuſe pride life make v thinke haue kinde abundance ſtore much triall therefore rather let v learne count great ioy iames ſaith many trial fall vpon v ſnuffe againſt god cared iames 1 2 note little grace ſo might haue eaſe condemnation vtter abiection god yea would haue yeelded themſelues willingly paine damned ſome hundred yeeres ſuch deſperate eſtate ſo might haue recouered ſaued afterward ſelfe haue heard ſome ſay confirme gedeons faith conſequently fitted purpoſe performed ceaſed dreame diuine dreames interpret diuinely ſee beſtoweth excellent gift grace vpon bad aſwell vpon good gift either meerely naturall giueth faith vnto regeneration euen viſible meanes leading thereto baptiſme miniſterie common becauſe ſubordinate end theſe gift ſerue generall thoſe ſpeciall gift ſerue therefore ſee many well fitted naturall ciuill morall miniſterially ſpirituall diuine end yet fit maine end meane godlineſſe ſaluation wanted becauſe ſpeciall end ſo large vniuerſall common end yea doubtleſſe wicked oft time excellent gift yet men account meane thing meane god quicken gedeon comfort euen wee ſee heere god vſeth meaneſt thing men iudge thing nothing worth welfare ſeruants god manna vnlike thing meane becauſe iob ſaith euen ſtones field ſhall iob • 3 league thee beaſts thereof peace thee doctrine ſeemeth ſort contrary former 〈◊〉 wicked may take comfort gloriouſeſt thing concerning preſent life yet behold view creature workes god may doe great matter thought yet ſweet meditation haue god ſeruants thereby comfort lo bleſſed part liues feare god may find thing ſift fearch throughly marke god promiſeth accordingly ſo yet meane peace vngodly neither creature league eſa 48 22 may ſhall god annoy manifeſt iezabel whoſe neere attending ſeruants eunuehes 2 king 9 33 caſt downe headlong ſtones window ſecret hand god perceiued hath ſaid dreame ſaid end ſhould attribute thing vnto dreames common v naturall although god ſaid dreame gedeon ſhould comforted fortie eight sermon seventh chapter booke ivdges followeth fruit namely gedeons thankes god reuerence hereby much reuiued verſ 15 himſelfe ſurred vp ſouldiers ſo likewiſe heerein wee may notwithſtanding imperfection wee haue heard clearely ſee faith hee went hoaſt god willed beleeuing hee ſhould bee comforted thereby hee ſurer hope thereof interpretation dreame god told hee cheered beleeued thus behoueth v grow beleeue note reioyce ſometime wee could faith one promiſe may bring breed another ſo may confirmed v ſo wee rooted faith wee may apoſtle willeth grow abound therein thankeſgiuing coloſ 2 7 beſides may learne thankes ought renued benefit daily beſtowed vpon v euen wee made prayer 2 well benefit paſt bee neglected thing little worth bee duly ſpeedily regarded euen duty done time ſeaſon poſted omitted euery trifle herein gedeon hath giuen v example ſoone receiued promiſe victory made god interpretation dreame hee returned beleeuing gaue praiſe god delayed herein come farre ſhort alſo taking opportunity doe duty ſpeedily ſeaſon time fitter record god mercy morning perfectly awake conſidering preſeruation night paſt danger thereof goodneſſe renued vpon v ſtill lam 3 23 time come guard bleſſe v former time therfore time ſay fitter ſtirre v vp thankes alſo renue ſuites lord continuance fauour watcheth take opportunity hereunto letteth paſſe rather ſloth worldlineſſe frowardneſſe c ſame may ſay careleſneſſe note thing haue leiſure opportunity renue couenants lord bee armed reſolute throughout day againſt euery euill prouocation ſinne day ſo wee might walke liberty peace yet regardeth rather trifleth time way elſe doth worſe rather ſet heart beſt way duty haue elſewhere ſpoken largely wee may note property force faith wit cheere heart quicken ſtrengthen ſo farre meaſure layeth hold receiueth promiſed ſaid laſtly experience imboldeneth v cauſeth v prouoke others beleeue ſerue lord together ſelues make ſtrong cheerefull comfortable alſo end experience vſe wee ſhould make toward others pleaſeth lord well wee ſhould doe ſo wee ſee gedeon ſouldiers third part chapter verſ 16 hee diuided three hundred men three band gaue euery man trumpet hand emptie pitcher lampes within pitcher 17 ſaid vnto looke doe likewiſe come ſide hoaſt euen doe ſo doe 18 blow trumpet blow ye trumpet alſo euery ſide hoast ſay lord gedeon 19 gedeon hundred men came vnto outſide hoaſt beginning middle watch raiſed vp watchman blew trumpet brake pitcher hand 20 three company blew trumpet brake pitcher held lampes left hand trumpet right hand blow withall cried ſword lord gedeon 21 ſtood euery man place round hoaſt hoaſt ranne cried fled 22 three hundred blew trumpet lord ſet euery man ſword vpon neighbour vpon hoaſt ſo hoaſt fled bethb • ſhittah zererah border abelmeholah vnto tabbah 23 men iſrael gathered together nephtali aſhur manaſſeth purſued midianites theſe many trial followeth iſſue manner ſence theſe verſes ſet downe firſt gedeon made haſt meanes came vpon midianites ere aware deferred time middle watch little midnight ſo much behoued come vpon fearefull time night deep darke gedeon men could ſeene ſo comming hee willed men hee diuided three band take emptie pitcher lampes trumpet hand blowing flighting frighting enemy ſtrange vnlooked noiſe thereof might breake pitcher alſo hearing might ſeeme ſpeares broken fighting lampes ſuddenly appeared aſtoniſhing midianites giuing light themſelues thus ſouldiers likewiſe though might haue thought bee ſmall purpoſe effect thereof onely wiſe wonderfull gouernment lord one midianites ſlue another broke aray fled away cry much like done chap 3 chap 3 27 ſcattered ſlaine purſued iſraelites taken theſe verſes three thing generall wit direction gedeon gaue men following laſtly effect enſued ſo let v conſider particular firſt begin theſe three verſes together let v note gedeons doct verſ 15 16 17 ſpeed made taking opportunity fit ſeaſon doe thing haue heard teacheth chriſtians doe ſame namely take time euery thing go ſeaſonable afterwards late time reape ſow doe thy buſineſſe eate time ſleepe trauell light sauiour directeth eccleſ 9 10 ſaying twelue houres day duty chriſtianity ioh 11 9 giuing poore doe need ſeeking lord goe may found ſo auoiding forſaking ſinne reſiſt eſa 55 6 beginning helping puniſh wickedneſſe preuenting god wrath doe accordingly fit due ſeaſon time rich man might haue ſuccoured lazarus hee lay gate lazarus dead time gone luk 16 25 time wherein fiue fooliſh virgin might haue prouided oyle lampes bridegroome came matth 25 12 come doore ſhun time paſt time men may repent may ſaued god ſendeth meſſengers call let ſeaſon paſſe day youth time age ſickneſſe death eccleſ 12 1 commeth thouſand one time gone late beſide many thing way hinder none leaſt late repentance dangerous oh hath loſt paſſing fit time ſeaſon lamenting deepely sauiour people ieruſalem doth ſhew hee ſaid thou eſt luk 19 42 euen knowne leaſt thy day thoſe thing belong thy peace hid thine eye therefore saint paul told corinthian acceptable time might heare day ſaluation sutable unto 2 cor 6 2 apoſtle epheſ 5 redeeme ſeaſon exhortation epheſ 5 16 teacheth although time ſhould bee ſpent vnprofitably yet ſeaſons time hauing ſome ſpeciall fitneſſe aboue others doe receiue good muſt carefully obſerued yea redeemed dedicated holy vſe forgoing ſomthing pleaſing fleſh purchaſe onely workes vnlawfull needleſſe euen lawfull time neceſſary muſt giue place fit ſeaſons becauſe god offereth occaſion ſome ſpirituall gaine time cannot bee obtained sabbath ſeaſon inſtruction edification one day ſeuen ſixe haue occaſion opportunity hath god ſendeth publike priuate iudgements vpon land perſons ſeaſon faſting humiliation renuing couenant contrariwiſe ſpeciall bleſſings deliuerances opportunity thankſgiuing reioycing others iames teacheth iam 5 13 v man afflicted let pray ſo merrie let ſing theſe occaſions worth taking alway occurrent therefore god diſpoſeth v ſo let v apply ſelues improue ſeaſon beſt vſe ſuffer ſelues vaniſh away abuſe follie vnſeaſonableneſſe ſione common euen among better ſort ſuſpect ſuffer themſelues paſſe ouer beſt occaſions vnfruitfully whereas ala ſhall ſpend whole time well ſpend beſt ſeaſons badly wee know morning body mind beſt time meditation fruitfull exerciſe periſh without fruit whole day moſt part otherwiſe barrenly weariſomely paſſed men worke vpon trade ordinarily ſee trade bee vp ware make doe take great price quicker ſale time beſtirre themſelues ſet euery one worke come riſing early going late bed word vnwearied ſeaſon ſay buſineſſe houſholder lay aſide market day may vſe ſeaſon furniſh himſelfe whole weeke prouiſion thinke merchant game play drinke ſleepe trifle ſeaſon matth 13 45 merchandiſe hee come place trafficke beyond ſea sam 13 14 head oke thus might goe infinitly god hath many way ſcourge enemy hath deliuer comfort people peace vngodly ſaith god oh fearefull wicked man god anger kindled little happie eſay 48 22 feare haue controuerſie men againſt oh pſalm 2 12 terror euery like fall till confounded obiect many wicked perſons walke ſecurely merrie void feares beſt anſwer firſt although god meetes ſuch bodily feares amazed theſe heathen withall yet within commonly euen middeſt merriment cauſeth heart heauie preſage good vnto length ſay ſuch hardned expreſſe bitter ſorrowes check feares feele carrie ill conſcience purſues ſleeping waking church onely euen calling company feaſtings pleaſures others thinke full little themſelues wiſh could make truce therewith might furtheſt poore chriſtian would willingly change meanes wrought verſ 21 22 holy ſtorie ſetteth downe verſe whole campe aſtoniſhed feared cried fled caſe let man thinke theſe meanes alone apart god work great force feare eſpecially hurt enemy blowing world accounteth yea fooliſh alſo prayer ſinceritie patience hope like bring great thing paſſe yea faith ouercome world without thing whatſoeuer still ſay therefore ſaid bleſſed people whoſe god lord iehouah occaſion hath offered ſpeake almoſt euery chapter 20 verſe people iſrael crie noiſe made vttered theſe word ſword lord gedeon therein doct 2 verſe 20 omitted due place teſtifie god chiefe dauid mentioneth rom 15 4 ſtory ſo doth eſay ſpeaking zenacherib god ſhall ſaith raiſe vp eſay 10 26 ſcourge like midian ſo came paſſe propheſied whole armie king ſlaine god euen midianites followeth another thing mentioned verſe verſ 23 moſt ſlaine iſraelites gedeon purſued followed reſt note wiſedome foreſeeing preuenting danger come ſcattered might haue gotten ſtrength againe afterward ſo haue troubled another iabin king canaan aroſe preuented warre meet iudg 4 2 done againſt enemy bodily ſpirituall satan throwne laboureth sauiour ſaith enter againe alſo neceſſarie matth 12 45 euery calling prouident keepe away danger want oppreſſion concerning body ſoule great wiſedome follow herein vniuſt steward namely prouiding luke 16 8 time ſhould come follow example fiue wiſe virgin ſo prouided oile lamp fooliſh want therof ſhut bridegroomes comming matth 25 10 entred wedding wee ſhould deale ſurely preuent diuel world al offence might break v owne corruption ſo fooliſh bring needleſſe ſorrow vpon owne head neglecting meanes might remoue yea one chriſtian another muſt faine forced deale circumſpectly ſo many weakeneſſes v ſhifts deceiue leſt breake fellowſhip wee ſee daily perfection men haue brought trade eaſily thriue carefull marking remoouing ſeuerall inconueniences thereof vſing beſt prouidence note opportunity making gaine predeceſſors knew ala raw rude yea bungler men trade trade beates braines attaine gift readineſſe dexteritie therein ſeekes bring excellencie thereof view world vpon owne proofe experience teach others next directeſt way walking chriſtian becauſe men wiſe follow trade without breaking many onſets turneagaines neither ſearch vſe beſt meanes may make expert bring gaine learne wiſedome preuent diſaduantages annoyance temptation therefore worke go forward skill trade come ripeneſſe behold thinke ſerue god commendably ſome duty apply mind growes noiſome luſts vnſeene vnrepented theſe make new begin ſet ſo much behind hand againe almoſt deſpaire euer recouering forwardneſſe neglected beniamites reade 20 booke met brother iudges 20 40 field ſtoutly lo euill behind aware till flame ſmoke aſcended courage cooled teach v proſper make cleane worke v leaue ſomething vndone ſloath coſt v double trebble afterward bee wiſe let v learne gedeon vſe keepe victorie well get clenſe euill prone ſome duty like leſt according prouerbe flieth eſcapeth returne fight againe whereas might haue ſlaine right downe firſt paſt danger furthermore noted commendable gedeon doct 2 gotten victory hee willing ſhould haue part glory thereof wit theſe tribe nephtali aſhur manaſſe yet could helpe little comming gedeon gotten victory great danger example ſhould teach v vſe gift god ſo ſhould ſeeke glory deſire alſo might exerciſe haue vſe gift benefit church miniſtery eſpecially ſhould doe wee may bee able ſay moſes ſaid would god people could propheſie yea end numb 11 29 let v rather giuing honour euen ſtriue goe yea meaneſt may ſooneſt eaſilieſt thinke themſelues neglected deſpiſed excellent therefore practiſe chriſt iohn baptiſt though admired diuers ſorts people ſuch wiſe carnall emulation betweene diſciples yet alway ſo carried themſelues one honoured fulfilled righteouſneſſe yea iohn middeſt flouriſhing yet ſtill acknowledged himſelfe ioh 3 30 ſhadow chriſt ſubſtance himſelfe herold chriſt prince muſt decreaſe ſaith chriſt encreaſe example ſucceſſors well regarded satan ſo ſoone corrupted miniſtery church ſchiſmes faction fruit pride arrogancy grow cauſe example gift grow grace let v diſciples contend ſhall bee chiefe greateſt though haue theſe gift like glorifie giuer reſtraine hold ſelues vaineglory yet wee gape satan deluding v lamentable behold ſo wee haue praiſe men ſhould looke god ſay cannot get leaue labouring ſit ſtill cauſe ſome well miniſtery people doe part breake fellowſhip one another ſee ſomwhat eighth verſe chapter verſ 24 gedeon ſent meſſengers mount ephraim ſaying come downe midianites take water vnto bethbarah iordan men ephraim gathered together tooke water vnto bethbarah iordan 25 tooke two prince midianites oreb zeeb ſlew oreb vpon rocke oreb ſlew zeeb winepreſſe zeeb purſued midianites brought head oreb zeeb gedeon beyond iordan verſe holy ſtory ſheweth gedeon ſent inhabitant verſ 24 mount ephraim meet midianites take vp paſſages went ouer water euen bethbara bethabora iordan men ephraim ſo ſo hee made partaker alſo honour victory tribe ſumme verſe make vſe wiſhed age theſe ciuil action religion guide v helpe needed required one another likewiſe willingly readily performed namely aiding widowes fatherleſſe poore oppreſſed much wiſhed ſo ioyned together church excellent profitable matter begun willing haue coadiutors fellow labourer finiſhing perfiting ſame wee rather oft time greatly lamented ſinnes iuſtly deſeruing ſame doe hinder one another whereas ought bee regarded haue good mind worke god doe labour though bee equall ſome euen god hath inabled fit doe alſo humility ſhould reuerence elder gift yeeres readier learne pearke ouer ſinne forwarder ſort miniſters people ancienter younger ſort ſuffered grow want loue ſo one doth dutie toward hath cauſed lord ſeuerely puniſh diuided thereby ſeebled good hindred croſſed ſo alſo verified saint paul writeth galathians one galat 5 15 biting deuouring another conſumed one another leaſt third ſort yet fault procuring haue ſpoken firſt chapter ephraim tooke two prince midian oreb zeeb whoſe puniſhment verſ 25 iuſt iudgement god agreeable ſinne one namely oreb ſlaine rocke mountaine called ſame name oreb conſtrained people god hide themſelues ſought kill zeeb ſlaine threſhing place winepreſſe called zeeb thoſe place ſpoiled victual famiſhed manifeſt god forgetteth neither winketh cruelty enemy due time place pay home ſo may ſee god hath left vnrecompenced either ſame puniſhment adonibezek ſame time iudas betraying maſter death died firſt himſelfe heere oreb zeeb euen ſame place miſchiefe among v wilfull murtherers ſuffer made ſpectacles hanging chaines paſſe neere place committed murthers none theſe way hee puniſh yet ſome ſuch may ſigne god reuenged ſuch blood abell ſo doth gen 4 10 cry vengeance woe therefore bloody perſecutors cruell perſons god ſinne ſhall find therefore let know fall hand ſuch leſt ſhould bee diſcouraged leſt ſhould thinke theſe prince fight themſelues againſt iſraelites warre men doe reade malice cruelty pſal 83 9 11 12 pſalme 83 god iuſt puniſhing enemy according ſin haue ſaid enough chapter 1 booke fiftieth sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges verſ 1 men ephraim ſaid vnto hast thou ſerued v thus thou calledſt v thou wenteſt fight midianites chode ſharpely 2 ſaid haue done compariſon gleaning grape ephraim better vintage abiezer 3 god hath deliuered hand prince midian oreb zeeb able doe compariſon thus ſpoken ſpirits abated towards admirable victory god gaue gedeon hath largely ſhewed former chapter followeth ſumme chap part 3 purſuit reſt midianites gedeon firſt another thing occaſion victory heere ſet downe ephraemites quarrelling ſumme part chapter ioyne together may well conueniently theſe firſt contention ephramites gedeon calling warre verſe 4 ſecond point chapter men succoth penuel denied victuall gedeon hee purſued followed reſt enemy puniſhment together putting death two prince midianites zeba zalmunna 22 verſ third containeth certaine perticulers concerning gedeon offering kingdome ſonnes iſraelites refuſing gedeons ephod danger came thereby whereto added ſinne iſrael end chapter firſt part chapter begin firſt part ſaid men ephraim contended ſumme 3 firſt verſes ſore gedeon fell called battell againſt midianites appeareth firſt verſe whereto milde anſwere gedeon bee marked ſet downe ſecond verſe thirdly appeaſed wee reade third theſe let v heare perticularly lie order heere firſt ſome man might thinke vnſeaſonable accident verſ 1 vnfolding befell gedeon euen chiefe ſpring glory meane necke victory ſhould come vpon ſuch croſſe blow turne ſolemnity honour great act ſubduing midianites reproch abaſement moſt wiſe god beſt knoweth keepe owne child compaſſe ſeeth corruption carry meanes whereof cannot beare great bleſſing proſperity without ſwelling pride ſay doth commonly ſo diſpoſe note rare ſpeciall liftings v heightenings doct verſ 1 either grace wealth honour ſucceſſe like hee matcheth mixeth ſome great cooling buffeting keep falling dangerouſly ſo ſlppery place ſtand gedeon cannot certainly ſay thing iuſt reproofe groſſe manner great infirmity wee haue heard therefore doubtleſſe hee man hee might haue puffed vp vpon ſo great ſucceſſe god great vnwelcome croſſe preuented iphta comming freſh great conqueſt ſuddenly quailed iudg 11 35 onely daughter iob middeſt flouriſhing proſperous eſtate heares child ſubſtance deſtroyed ſpoiled likewiſe dauid victory lord ſent cooler vpon rebellion abſolon curſing shemei inſurrection sheba death ammon ſlaughter abſolon doubtleſſe enough purge ſuperfluous humour might riſe vp ſo keepe ſober temperate within holy compaſſe ſo ſtrange lord ſhould thus phyſicke ſeruants already note ſurfeted exceſſiue ſinfull abuſe proſperity great mercy ſhould ſo diet theſe potion may preuent ſurfeting reaſon becauſe firſt wiſedome ſame phyſitian giue preſeruatiues well purgation againe ſinne eaſilier kept entring thruſt doores gotten lord foreſeeing rather chooſeth little hardſhip patient violent extreame courſes preuent matter diſeaſe rather heale diſeaſe truth eaſier man bee dieted purged meane beare affliction commeth ſpirit conſcience wounded ſinne followeth ſin deſerued puniſhment point hand let v firſt learne leaud nature v wee cannot haue little health welfare preſently diſtemper ſelues ſo wee muſt faine phyſickt leſt wee ſhould endanger life meane wee enioy good bleſſing forget ſelues cauſe lord allay ſweetneſſe ſome bitterneſſe except ſuffer v turned quite ouer againe enioy bleſſing let v meaſure ſame pleaſure content giues nature euen ſting ſecretly hurt v ſober humble note thankfull affection wherewith wee imbrace bleſſing let v know onely enioy kind entier otherwiſe halues ſcarce ſee god ſauceth dainty ſoure hearbs let v thankfull ſay lord elſe fed much diſh till ouerlaid ſtomacke euen child finding hony eate much therefore bleſſed thy name ſuffered ſicke rather thou ſhouldeſt let alone ſhould bee prouoked vomiting worſe bee noted lord ordering action theſe ephramites gedeons good yet theſe ephramites ſhew many foule fault action contending fault ephramites firſt verſe firſt vnthankfulnes gouernour deliuerer vnthankfulnes expoſtulating without cauſe diſſimulation faine themſelues haue willing haue gone warre yet would might haue done euen ſaw danger warre bee paſt ouer honour giuen gedeon done whereas ready hee loſt victory haue much caſt teeth proſecute theſe little particularly vnthankfulneſſe firſt doct 2 verſ 1 great iniurie hee ſuſtained thereby ought haue much honoured induſtry labour highly accounted ſame ſo vnthankfulneſſe ſo great towards manner behauiour thinke wee would haue vſed ſuſtained wrong violence hand deale thus vndutifully nay rudely rebelliouſly yet hauing receiued ſo great deliuerance meanes ſo picking matter quarrell good turne benefit may note vnthankfulneſſe men yet haue iuſt cauſe ſhew contrary duty may ſeene many namely abſolon father hee deliuered death iuſtly deſerued hee ſought father life get away kingdome alſo ſo wee may vnkind recompence gaue gedeon famous act hee wrought eaſe peace wee ſay ſhall gratifie men may learne duty thereby beſt neither ought wee looke reward commendation well manner way men reſt god knoweth workes enough ſure ſhall receiue reward according reuel 2 2 word apoſtle ye ſtedfaſt beloued brother 1 cor 15 58 vnmoueable alwaies abounding worke lord much ye know labour vaine lord men oft time diſgrace well done v reuile yea hate v eliab dauid ſhewing himſelfe forward 1 sam 17 28 againſt god enemy philiſtims name great champion goliah hee ought haue encouraged rather highly commended ioſeph preſerued land egypt time famine long afterwards yet king pharaoh roſe vp land ſome yeeres ſay ioſeph exod 1 8 knowne regarded ſo text ſaith came another pharaoh knew ioſeph though welfare aroſe vnder god wel predeceſſors liued eſpecially verified sauiour chriſt light gentile glory luk 2 32 people iſrael vnthankfulneſſe people ſpitefull dealing againſt faine ſay anſwere thus many good workes haue done among doe ſtone heathen ioh 10 32 ſtories reade ſtrange ingratitude people victorious gouernours eſpecially grecian romane one dead vpbraiding epitaph engrauen vnthankfull countrey thou ſhalt ſo much haue honour bone men liuing church ſhould ſhew ſuch brutiſh ingratitude ſhould beleeue ſees moſes conducter people egypt neuer quiet conſpiracy murmuring againſt prophet apoſtles matth 23 37 painfull propheſyings trauels preaching reward found theſe ephramites recompenced gedeon labour paine iſraelites alſo looke end ſtory ſo worthy ſeruants chriſt magiſtracy miniſtery find like greeting courteſie thankfulneſſe hand ſhould beſt fauourers encouragers againſt aduerſaries yea find people gouerne teach vpon beſtow liues ſtrength candle giueth light till die goe requite ſmall reuerence leſſe countenance note maintenance leaſt fruit true piety godly care labour ſeaſon ſeaſon beſtowed among vſe ſhall make hereof shall deſiſt good beginning giue ouer ſuch may bee like teach fearing would learne loue make account firſt let looke vp god acknowledge iuſtice ſo trying puniſhing ſome ſinne anſwere themſelues prophet eſay haue laboured vaine manward reward eſa 40 10 62 11 god therfore muſt forſake ſtanding leaue calling hold courage conſtancie vnto end fully ſtory iephta vſe ſo let v take bee diſcouraged conſcience conſtancy ſeruice god diſcourteſies ill dealing men god looke reward yet muſt ſay without eſpeciall grace hard doe thus reſt contented god plentifull rewarder ſeeke come withall beare indignity offered v men secondly ſeeing world dealeth thus vnkindly god ſeruants heb 2 6 let brother feare god bee encouragers comforter may hold good courſe men therfore haue need encouragement weakeneſſe requireth ſhould bee ſo dealt let ſuch liue place miniſters profeſſors freedome way much note good liking mutuall conſent encouragement bee highly thankfull god ſuch vnwonted fauours friendly dealing men knowing portion moſt world find enioy peculiar indulgence fauour god ought ſtirre vp aſtoniſhment god kindneſſe therein pride inſolencie ſin ſpeake let v count vnthankfulneſſe taking ill part good action god people let v ſay count bitter fruit naughty proud cancred heart whereſoeuer wee meete behold thereafter let thinke themſelues ſhew offer note another fault theſe ephramites againſt gedeon 2 fault ephramites wit enuie enuied honour got victory whereby though ſuſtained hurt neither worſe better yet could beare gedeon ſhould haue glory may ſee foule property enuie greefe enuie ſadneſſe proſperity namely ſuch bee equal poore man enuieth king hee may bee grieued himſelfe wanteth ſuch good thing king hath enuie may note difference betweene hatred malice one ſide enuie end wee haue heard one ſo may word hatred therefore greefe conceiued againſt one ſome cauſe leaſt thinke ahab hated micaiah becauſe 1 king 22 8 hee propheſie good euill tooke ſame appeareth alſo contrary theſe word holy scripture hated without cauſe ſay enuie greefe equal eminency proſperity haue aboue v meane ſuch kindred eſtate yeeres dignity gift like v cauſe enuie wee troubled though hurt danger comming towards v enuie another affection wit feare cankred ſtomacke cannot beare ſuch one note better ſelues ſhould bee lifted vp ſo high commended ſo farre aboue v curſed mind v wee cannot bee willing another ſhould fare well neuer worſe wee ſhould haue euill eye ſhould reioyce ſo mary luk 1 41 42 elizabeth mutually reioyce one welfare bleſſing god ſo much deteſtable affection whereas ſome partly naturall nay bee taken good part euer euill meere corruption contrary loue loue enuieth 1 cor 13 4 paul plainely forbiddeth galathians hee alſo ſheweth cauſe namely deſire vaineglory ſo ſaith deſirous galat 5 laſt vaine glory prouoking one another enuying one another heere ſeene ephramites deſiring glory victory themſelues enuie gedeon affection ſheweth ſelfe ſuch thing deſire excell yea beſt euen gift ſpirit therein would haue none account aboue v appeareth preached chriſt enuie repined fellow philip 1 15 comming eleuenth houre hee pennie well himſelfe matth 20 12 though worſe proſperity neither doth diminiſh thing good eſtate yet enuious man thinketh gift himſelfe darkened blemiſhed thereby vnleſſe haue eſpecial grace abate mortifie ſuch thought therefore aggrauate ſinne know enuious ſad proſperity another ſo worſe made ioyfull diſgrace abaſement phariſies crucifying sauiour ioſephs brother ſold yea ſo curſed humor enuie ſo oppoſite loue whereas hee loues vnfainedly would part euen moſt precious iewell ſake loueth enuious perſon would willingly pull one owne eye vpon condition might loſe grudgeth vnfitly paul ſpeech fornication may applied enuie ſinnes without man enuious ſins againſt owne body health proſperitie thereof god iuſtly plaguing kinde while pine eminencie another reflecteth beateth backe hurt vpon ſelfe feedeth vpon moſt precious ſpirits ſoule life conſumeth ſeldome harme fretteth heart blood bowel ſelfe enuie remedied ſhaming ſelues wee cannot abide brother ſhould haue doe good god gift conſidering alſo thereby hinder god glorie alſo ſhall looſen rootes enuie thinke meanely ſelues god onely wiſe denieth iuſt cauſe vnto v wherewith bleſſeth others thirdly ſhall helpe weaken wee conſider god hath rather deſerued infinite thankes v granting v bleſſings thoſe perhaps may want reſpects wee enuie great mercie lam 3 22 wee conſumed one wee ſee wee behold much whereas eye ſeeth worſe becauſe anothers ſeeth better much leſſe another kinde ſee well doth foote enuie eye becauſe ſeeth eye foote becauſe goeth contrarie vertue ſpake twice gedeons ſouldiers gedeons communicating nephtali ephraim victorie becauſe ſpeake ephramites thinke amiſſe third ſinne ſin father doct 4 adde father ephraim younger preferred iacob elder brother manaſſe ſtocke ofſpring exalted themſelues ſince age age noted oft time hiſtorie old teſtament ioſuah reade among diſcontented portion twelfth booke poſteritie contended iphia calling battell againſt ammonite ouercome euen theſe ephramites gedeon eſau himſelfe deadly hating brother deriued ſinne poſteritie edomites ſo ahab idolatrie generation came hereby may learne force ſome blemiſhes corruption ſtocke kindred haue infect almoſt whole poſteritie god iuſtly thus puniſhing ſinnes father vpon child many generation puniſhing ſay ſinne ſinne example kindred bee proud haughty ſtomackful boaſters giuen adultery hollownes heart flatterie lying mocking ſtealing reſt ſame ſtock guided grace moſt part ſuch euen bodily diſeaſes runne blood poſteritie wee ſee noble ſtocke ſtained treaſon may eaſiler reſtored blood ciuilly indulgence prince reformed naturally reduced loyaltie fidelitie ſo truth moſt forcible meane outward meanes ſcarce able expell • eint onely grace doe although euen grace ſelfe often time ſcarce roote ſo ſome ſprigs old ſtock appeare grafted another ſtocke yet one thing note theſe ephramites namely ſlights fourth ſin ſl • ghtnes ſubtiltie doct 5 ſubtilties doublenes hollownes lie hidden men heart till haue occaſion ſhew grace repent theſe would ſeeme haue great iniurie called battell whereas owne ſin went forbeare feare danger willing ſtand lying winde waite iſſue gedeon brother iſraelites ioyned loſt day blame ſhould haue bin laid vpon theſe ephramites got victorie god direction bleſſing complaine ſide iniurie thēſelues ſaid bidden helpe battell wherein wee may behold deepe ſubtiltie hypocriſie farre ſuch ſimplicitie plaine dealing according prouerbe howſoeuer world goe ſaue one howſoeuer fall prouide themſelues one harlot pleaded salomon againſt fellow twelfth book 1 king 3 22 iudg 12 1 2 iphta ſet vpon ammonite ſought aide hand men ephraim would help afterward fighting againſt ammonite preuailed ouer ephramites came make warre becauſe called goe againſt ſinne adaies common practiſe namely bargaines gaine ſo certaine play hand cunningly ſo couenant generall doubtfull manner hit fall well ſhal bargaine readie challenge make claime ſlightly ſoeuer couenant made fall ill againſt picke quarrell ſay meant ſo taketh therefore ſuch make bargaines plaine couenants ſure certaine ſlightly conclude though agreed one depart one another breaking ſuch like word ſhall agree vpon vncertaine termes let man loueth peace buy note ſell deale world goeth except hee willing ſtand hardeſt take meaſure ſhall offered willingly partnerſhip alſo many ſecret ſubtill deceiuings one another yet good ſhewes equitie ſhall ſeene ſelfe full pretended like vnto theſe ſuch promiſe great friendſhip man perceiue better brooke perſon frowne vpon ſhew kindneſſe muſt diſhoneſt manner finde ſome fault alſo alleage cannot therefore ſhew kindnes doe promiſed prouide thing honeſt men ſuch dealing apparent diſhoneſtie aduerſitie diſgrace right good men ſhall iuſtled wall yet againe reſtored former eſtate accounted fauour better ſhall ſought vnto regarded iphta theſe like diſſembling ſeene theſe ephramites manner dealing contrarie ſimplicitie plainneſſe good chriſtians maine blemiſh nay ſtaine vtterly remoued abandoned bad enough euen ciuill dealing appeares matter religion farre worſe infinite degree deteſted whether ſhewed toward god men meane ſubtill politique manner feare frailtie ſo groſſe though euill men abſtaine conceale affection goſpell till ſee whether time bee like fauour note frowne vpon meane carrying ſuch darke ambiguous countenance man tell make yet cannot carrie matter thus plainly bewray opinion iudgement counted foole ſhiftleſſe perſon indeed hee worldward nothing elſe regarded poſſible make true cognizance theſe temporizer coate moone ſerue belly ambition purſe theſe leade ſo follow god ſerue none religion onely ſtalking horſe play part cunningly till turne ſerued ſame ſay committing ſin toward men odious man ſhall promiſe pretend loue faithfulnes neighbour yet meane intend ſuch thing practiſe contrarie gedeons milde anſwere followes conſidered maketh verſe 2 quarrell expoſtulating ephramites hee anſwered fooliſhnes like giuen good brought broile thinke would haue betweene hee defend anſwering hee ſtrong enough himſelfe neede helpe like prouoke againſt neither commended owne labour care induſtrie could willingly haue heard neither yet vnuizer telling quarrelled without cauſe againſt ſought helpe way exaſperated contrariwiſe yeelded much truth good conſcience hee might neither hee interpret contentious word come bitter enuie gaue cauſe rather hee hath left moſt commendable example meeke patient ſeruant god reſpects theſe honeſt lawfull emulation teacheth right worthie matter doctrine vnto v namely wee ſhould deale ſuch inſolent contentious fierie ſuch thinke though neuer ſo vntruly haue wrong hand ſuch caſes muſt well ſtaied ſee giue men ful due wit croſſe prouoke exaſperate thē doct rather ſeeme ſee roote bitternes breaketh containe ſelues till fitter time ſeeing caſe told make beſt euery thing aſſwaging gentle anſwers eſpecially equal inferiours one word anſwere foole according fooliſhnes prou 26 2 giue ill meaſure bringeth leſt wee like remember taught another place prouerbs namely man glorie ceaſe ſtrife conſider alwaies bearing minde better rule owne heart ſubdueth prou 16 32 citie except thus giue place ſuch many euils like follow fall againſt v church commonwealth familie courſe life yet hereby may doubt moſt part bee auoided leaſt wiſe bee ſmaller fewer therefore let yonger ſort herein learne yeeld elder inferiours better though deale ought ſhould ſeeing wee ſee gedeon afterward iphta ſuperiours forbeare deale inferiours might haue done iuſtly prouoked doe yea let one learne take leſſon toward another manner haue ſet downe husband wiues maſters ſeruants peace holineſſe may preſerued among heb 12 14 yet ſheweth foorth meekneſſe wiſedome bee ſeene common iarrings quarrel men moſt count glorie boaſt afterward word bee fierce ſtinging fellowes come furnace ſeuen time hotter ſaith thinke would turne face put downe word trow gaue full meaſure hee brought yea tenne one ſpared whit loe fooles ſome froth owne ſhame whereas salomon ſhewes face glaſſe doe ſo ſaith angrie man ſtirs prou 19 22 vp ſtrife multiplieth tranſgreſsion prou 29 indeed honour man depart ſay ſee frame anſwered angrie word therefore durſt ſtriue outſhoote diuell owne bow hee thinkes commeth count reproch profeſſe fight againſt corrupt nature therefore let dead burie dead meane fit nothing elſe let giue taunt taunt ſcorne ſcorne free righteouſneſſe bondman owne luſts haue learned rather repay good euill euill yet ſo taken though thing ought yeeld froward peeuiſh perſons owne priuate caſes onely lawfully may caſes matter contrarie god preiuditiall honour example theſe ephramites would haue ſet vp baal altar againe ſort tollerable gedeon ſhould haue borne hand much leſſe haue yeelded ſuch thing noted anſwer worthie example whereof wee haue paul reſiſted peter gaue galat 2 11 place point colluſion iewes followeth fruite meeke milde anſwere vnto verſ 3 wit anger thereby alaied agreeth well salomon prouerbs milde anſwere putteth away anger againe meeke tongue breaketh band ſecond blow make fray prou 15 1 25 prouerbe ſaith reaſon thereof double firſt becauſe wrath wanteth matter worke vpon oppoſed secondly meekneſſe ſhameth anger euen humilitie make pride hang downe head muſt ſome odde man rage fiercenes otherwiſe thus dauid abigails mildnes ſtaied bloodie attempt nabals boyſterous roughnes prouoked vnto grace meeknes mildnes chriſt pronounceth bleſſed haue matth 5 5 matth 11 29 philip 2 7 actes 8 32 numb 12 3 wils v learne meeke lambe ſhearer ſo opened hee mouth thereby abraham preuailed lot moſes ſo excelled vertue ſaid meekeſt man vpon earth contrary cured contrary wee know phyſitians cure hot ague inflaming aſſwaging skilfull fencer doth ſcape many blow foile aduerſarie declining giuing backe oppoſing body weapon vnto cannon ſhot batter note downe caſtles wall yeeld rebound ſoft packe wooll giues place reſiſts lightning paſſeth ſlight ſlender obiects conſumes deuoures ſolid well compact ſubſtances ſo haue experience may ſee fruite wee might reape yeelding good name report better ſiluer would bring v ſcripture cited appeares beſide many prou 15 1 worthie fruites regard practiſe yea doubtleſſe meanes wee might euen open mouth hotteſt aduerſarie heate ouer commend v confeſſe owne folly great wiſedom ſtopping much ſinne thereby ſo might learne meeknes v dauid bleſſed abigaile meane inferiour perſons 1 sam 25 32 ſtoope inch equanimitie wherewith great worthie perſonages haue furniſhed wife oft time ſhall bee found iuſtly conuicted crontrary fault ſhrewiſhnes ſnappiſhnes ſeruant ſtout ſturdie giue place maſter learne meeknes cauſeth finde like offer euen rough curriſh vnkinde dealing filleth world contention vnquietnes whereto grant many prouocations muſt obey lord wee ſhould ſhew meeknes tit 3 2 vnto men ſome ſay booteth vſe meeknes either word deedes toward ſuch vnreaſonable perſons obiect gentlier entreated play vpon aduantage inſult ouer others yea yeelding furie incencing addeth oile flame anſwere roughnes towards ſuch bad anſw baſe nature meete kindnes ſo man keepe meaſure vnder colour reſiſting ſin another diſobey god thus eliſha willeth elder anſwere iehorams ſeruant perſons ſuch 2 king 6 32 cannot ſafely ſo controll though lawfully let v ſay good prophet lord ſee iudge lord rebuke aſſure ſelues god hath way enow hamper tame ſuch wolues tygers iulian vſed ſcoffe chriſtians thus oh maſter ieſus galilie bid turne cheeke ſmites c god made yeeld ſay thou art hard haſt gotten vpper hand thou galilean end pluckt fellow throte matth 18 28 would heare meeke plea end rough boiſterous proud ſpirits ſo much ſhall ſuffice time fiftie one sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges ſecond part chapter verſ 4 gedeon came iordan paſſe ouer hee three hundred men wearte yet purſuing 5 ſaid men succoth giue pray morſels bread vnto people follow mee wearie may follow zebah zalmunna king midian 6 prince succoth ſaid hand zebah zalmunna thine hand ſhould giue bread vnto thine army 7 gedeon ſaid therefore lord hath deliuered zebah zalmunna mine hand teare fleſh thornes wilderneſſe brier 8 went vp thence penuel ſpake vnto likewiſe men penuel anſwered men succoth anſwered 9 ſaid alſo men penuel come againe peace break downe tower 10 zebah zalmunna karkor hoſts fifteene thouſand left hoſts eaſt ſlaine hundred twenty thouſand men drew ſwords 11 gedeon went dwelt tabernacle eaſt ſide nobah iogbehah ſmote host hoſt careleſſe 12 zebah zalmunna fled hee followed tooke two king midian zebah zalmunna diſcomfited hoſt 13 gedeon ſonne ioaſh returned battell ſunne yet hie ſecond part chapter holy ſtory former digreſſion ephramites contending gedeon ſenſe verſ 8 proceedeth orderly ſet downe end battell namely midianites eaſt ſlaine one another reſt remained fled away fifteene thouſand men gedeon purſued ouer iordan three hundred men wearie faint hauing laboured night comming succoth city succoth meane tribe gad another place called succoth deſert mentioned 6 number hee asked ſomewhat refreſh ſouldiers men succoth ſhould haue helped gone purſue midianites iſraelites neighbour moſt vnkindly denied giue brother ſo much bread anſwered gedeon contemptuouſly cauſe hee threatned ſhould returne victory hee nothing doubted ſo tels deale thereafter euen teare fleſh brier wilderneſſe heere gedeon followed theſe fifteene thouſand midianites doct verſ 4 eſcaped greateſt number ſlaine already ſhewed wiſdome godly care preuenting euill danger might haue come vpon people afterward thoſe fifteen thouſand ſuffered runne away without purſuing might doubt would haue renued power haue come againſt againe afreſh yet gedeon wiſely preuented teacheth v ſingular good leſſon wee haue well diſcharged dutie enioyned v gedeon done yet ought labour hold haue receiued wiſely may preuent whatſoeuer might ſtand vp way fruſtrate ſame ſo cauſe v loſe former labour fruit hope euen gedeon heere purſuing fled midianites inſtances wherein might bee laid innumerable onely alleage two three briefly man ſhould enter league ſound friendſhip another neuer ſo ſtrongly entirely moſt ſolemne manner dauid ionathan betwixt themſelues whereby one 1 sam 18 3 doth repoſe himſelfe reſt vpon yet renue couenant loue oftentimes two confirme ſtrengthen againſt might annoy breake wil fal ſo many occaſions weaken yea make vtterly void alſo ſuch report carried fro betwixt abſence one another ſuch ſtrangeneſſe ariſe thereby eſpecially ſuch conceit tetchines taking thing ill part raſh iudgings former kindneſſe forgotten league ſo ſoundly made neuer broken let ſay bee vnderſtood couenant made marriage ſelfe ſo farre theſe thing mentioned may fall therein ſo teſtimonies true loue mutually declared euen betwixt couple need daily ſhewed ſtead renuing couenant elſe loue fall ground alſo paſſe another inſtance man yea let bee good man entring affaire world diſliking bad courſes taken men commonly get wealth doe purpoſe againſt heartily diſlike ſame yet let look daily performe hath purpoſed ſtand firme therein let watch pray againſt prouocations contrary diſgrace owne eye note vnlawfull courſes dealing may bring commodity contemne filthie gaine feare danger ſoule vſuall many dealing world yea though lawfull let ſay thus go worke looke himſelfe without queſtion like grow ſame point moſt wit become worldly minded man moſt drowne religion earthlineſſe ſame ſay ſicknes hath made many great promiſes amend life recouer neuer liue ſo badly afterward done ſay hee renue couenant lord day day remembring conſidering made promiſe note earneſt maner man ſhall reuolt good mind fall old byas againe though hath purpoſed dauid pſal 119 106 ſonilitude yea ſworne yet ſhall keepe righteous iudgements hath neglected care therefore faileth purpoſe keepeth houſe reparation ſmall breach muſt pound charge ſhilling would haue ſerued bin taken hand time ſo wracke ruine ſhall befall good purpoſes doe looke daily carefully maintaining hath ſaid point hand may iudge inſtances haue done duty well gedeon heere yet preuent danger wee loſe fruit hope former labour haue ſaid matter better marked becauſe ſuch care thing thing liues vpholding practiſe chriſtianitie point haue ſaid vpon like occaſion chap 7 verſ 23 another thing gedeon worth marking followed reſt midianites whereas might haue bin like haue neglected doct 2 worke needfull haue reuenged vpon ephramites ſo vniuſtly prouoked ſo hee would haue done doubt hot haſtie man giuen appetite follow priuate affection moſt men giuen doe counted ſmaller matter croſſe owne corrupt nature leaue purſuing common enemie wee taught wee may haue peace land gedeon ſought vanquiſhing remained midianites fled obtaining ought meanes maintaine peace priuately home neighbour yea gladly take occaſions procuring thereof gedeon ephramites reaſon maintaining peace agreement home priuat requireth neither loſſe liues good religion note onely corrupt affection forgoing ſome ſmall thing peace ſake may lawfully yeeld vnto debters rebellious nature ought profeſſed enemy againſt ſame rom 8 12 againe haue peace abroad ciuill forraine diſſention oh benefit may ſee reade firſt booke king day salomon euery one liued ſafe vnder vine vnder figtree contrary warre 1 king 4 25 perſecution oh feare danger ſpoile men good yea hauocke thing therefore muſt needes ſay vnto cannot loue enemy boile ſwell one againſt another may liue quietly euery day weeke yet note ſcarcely one haſte warre vpon ſelues yea long groane ſome plague lord would winck allure neerer yee ſelues tempt lay load ſuch ſay griefe cannot tell inioy peace make vſe whereas well conſider yee would ſeeke yea inſue peace ſo far ye might attaine holineſſe meanes ſuffer go ye would ſo yeeld luſts carnal affection heb 12 14 fauouring nouriſhing ſatiſfying whereof ye depriue ſelues ſweete infinite fruit common peace diſtemper vnrulineſſe found familie betwixt husband wife part familie bewailed ſay nay monſtrous oh good might done time peace church find act 9 31 act ſhould doe wiſe ſo god commandeth much lieth haue peace men yea though coſt v rom 12 18 ſomewhat abraham loſſe procured betwixt lot himſelfe geneſ 13 8 ſuch vexed ſtrangers diſquieted let conſider iuſt god puniſh ſo haue broken peace yea deſpiſed neighbour kindred wife owne home ſaid laboured til faint wearie doct 2 ſee earneſt following duty make v oft time neglect forget ſelues bodily eaſe woman samaria ſo rauiſhed chriſts ſweet communication ignorant ſhe firſt met well yea ſaucie ſcornefull iohn 428 great defire ſhee heare ſhe forgat ſelfe neglected care bodily buſineſſe abraham ſeruant ſo minded geneſ 24 23 dutie enioyned maſter although hee need hauing trauelled farre yet hee would eate till diſpatched went thus peter actes 10 heauenly intention act 19 10 mind ouercame hunger ſo thing could made readie traunce ſo paul whoſe watching faſtings place ſet downe haue ſo many neglect ſleepe repaſt troas feruency ſpirit cauſed preach till midnight epheſus vſually three yeeres exhort night well day aboue sauiour chriſt earneſtneſſe zeale many time holy ſpeech communication woman ioh 4 forbeare meate forget eate alleaging meate eate knew iohn 4 31 verſ 34 euen ſo mind ſet ſeriouſly vpon duty prayer reading good company following calling c many time little mind thing belonging bodily welfare crowne ſo farre good occaſions remember gedeon haue done ſo indeed play pleaſure ſeeking commodity world caſe cleare many haue ſwet doe continually forget diſguiſe themſelues ſo neither cold hunger heate vnſeaſonableneſſe hold backe hinder god matter worſhip thing tend owne ſaluation hunting purging ſome ſpeciall ſinnes alſo furthering bringing one another faith good duty note ſo ſeeking moſt good poore member chriſt oh bee found doe thus yet neither ſpare labour time coſt thing elſe owne matter whereas ſhould bee ſo taken vp god matter owne euen lawfull might bee moderated leaſt thus marie ſat feete chriſt attention preaching neglected leſſe neceſſarie work preparing though euery example bee law bind euery man like yet ſee ſo agree doctrine word ſuch example muſt inſtruction may well gather ſingular affection loue god ioy ſeruice ſo concernes v much follow much may conclude men hearing word prayer c doe ſo wander ſo weary euery minute houre vnto euery houre ten till al done ſome wil endure whole time depart ſerue appetite follow worke theſe may ſure little affected action ſince thing predominant giue place euen moſt religious duty hand man trade muſt looke yea worſhipfull eſtates feare god end meere conſcience may obey god ſeuerall calling place thus ioſhua went night long helpe ioſhua 10 9 gibeonites gedeon neither hunger wearineſſe held backe purſuing midianites vſe hereof warrant ſelues greateſt delight ſeruing lord one part life another chiefeſt god ſo next particular duty calling painefully euery eſtate degree faithfully ſo take reſt refreſhing recreation yet ſhould follow come theſe goe gedeon wearie men asketh bread owne countrey verſ 5 men whoſe peace purſued midianites well reaſon twofold one becauſe wearie becauſe purſued enemy ſafetie iſrael god people neceſſity diſtreſſe though otherwiſe wanted may note may poſſibly caſe god people deſtitute neceſſaries life brought ſtreights wāt food doct alſo calamity dauid fleeing saul ſo diſtreſſed men victual faine eate shewbread caſe neceſſitie vnlawfull ſaue prieſt eate appeareth sam 21 ionathan people euen 1 sem 21 3 readie faint yet might without perill life taſte ſo much little honey top ſpeare ſaue preſerue life euen ſo v gedeon whole day two wee wanted food reliefe ſhould find ſmall matter thought much life worth daily experience ſheweth v ſame falleth ſea land caſe many yet good wealth likely come ſuch need want yet ſo wee ſee come paſſe one reaſon becauſe thing preſent world changeable beſides god correct ſome way trie others iob vſe hereof wee ſhould pleaſe ſelues thing account ſoeuer neither reſt depend take much comfort outward preſent eſtate health wealth wit learning worſhip credit c wee ſhould ready helpe ſuch ſtand need ſeeke hand theſe tranſitory comfort god hath giuen v sauiour ſaith make yee friend vnrighteous mammon luke 16 10 ye ſhall want may receiue euerlaſting habitation grudge many doe mercifull ready thereto phile 7 matth 7 1 ſam 2 13 chearefulneſſe meaſure meate ſhall meaſured v againe iudgement ſhall bee without mercy ſhew none chiefly ſhould bee done poore want worke corne ſuch like neceſſaries remembring nabal ſped churliſhnes point way ſeeing ſhall meete like againe reaſon faint following midianites 1 reaſon doct 2 night may note neede commeth faintneſſe labour brother honeſt cauſe ſeeke aske v relieue euen neceſſitie god laieth vpon ſickneſſe age c yet want commeth idlenes liuing without labour ſo counted ſhall ſhewed next point relieuing poore indeed laid vpon v lord telling v wee ſhall haue alwaies among v deut 15 11 may doe good vnto wee haue world good 1 iohn 3 17 ſee brother hath need ſhut vp compaſſion loue god dwelleth v word ſuch like ſhould mallet break hard heart ſo great need ſeene townes little mooued compaſſion towards needy god furniſheth v euery yeere new ſtore ſo wee ſhould hold mercy ſtill long remaine among thinkes ſhould readilie willingly giue god commanding ſeeing maketh v able ſo doe whoſe hand whoſe pleaſure take v giue ſo wee might bee driuen ſeeke reliefe ſought v iuſt reproofe ſuch ſpeake thinke little belly feeling men want getting fearefull ſentence pronounced againſt omitted mercy compaſſion well wrought iniquitie goe ye curſed euerlaſting fire matth 25 42 hungry ye gaue meate naked c reaſon fought ſafety iſrael wee ſecond doct 3 taught ought haue reliefe alſo euen ſaid lawfull honeſt aske haue imploied againſt god enemy defend v rage tyranny conſidering carry life hand danger ſpending blood cauſe god peace land whileſt wee may ſit quiet home liue free ſuch feare although perſons themſelues leaud yet regard ſeruice ſhould ſee prouided paul teacheth ſaying doth man goe warfare owne 1 cor 9 7 2 sam 17 27 cost 1 corinth 9 ſinne haue ſhould driuen goe begge ſo become rogue contrary god commandement ſaith ſhall beggar iſrael good order taken cut rogueing place place without certaine habitation ſetting poore worke miniſtring neceſſities want able maintaine charge labour good order faithfull chriſtians vpholden ſo great ſinne many ſtead thereof doe nouriſh rogue indeed notwithſtanding bee ſtraightly commanded hee labour ſhould eate ſooner moued 2 theſ 310 compaſſion toward toward pooe neighbour whoſe need behold daily eye men succoth anſwer anſwere prince succoth heere followeth gedeons verſ 6 word againe like ſuite carried anſwere returned gedeon meſſengers ſheweth fault people anſwere gedeon manner denie bread giue alſo rough ſcornefull word therefore gedeon vpon priuate reuenge one authoritie doe ſeeing fault redounded hurt commonwealth committed onely againſt gedeon men anſwered would auenged wiſe would haue relieued alſo ſo good cauſe neede haue gone let v examine word zeba zalmunna thy hand alreadie ſhould haue ſaid would haue giuen thanke owne benefit credit honour ſeeing hand vncourteouſly barbarouſly denied brother doct verſ 6 ſubtiltie leſt ouercome midianites ſhould haue hardlier dealt withall prince midian hearing relieued enemy ſubtilty ioyned ſelfeloue two ſtrings men bow ſhoote moſt action arrowes good moſt doe done commandement conſcience note ſake ſelfeloue owne priuate benefit hoping gainer thereby may done heathen religion feare god hold back good conſcience ought doe euill minde hold back theſe men succoth feare leſt ſhould doe ſome ſhould fare worſe hand theſe men succoth like point whereunto obſerued men ephraim hereby wee may ſee barbarous rudeneſſe theſe 2 yet brother countrimen iſraelites gedeon gouernour vpholden peace middeſt laſt worke purſuing midianites reſcuing iſrael ſhould ſhew themſelues ſo barbarous voide humanitie houſe top fire nether part ſhould lie ſtill though fire could hurt man ſtanding vpon onely bough high tree thereby kept danger falling ſhould hatchet cut downe fall breake necke rudeneſſe irreligiouſnes many brutiſh people day onely helper want neceſſities god people either ſoule bodie hinderers yea gripers senſeleſſe blok neither heare ſee ſauour good towards nabal gaue thing dauids men rated railed thereby caſting miſt vpon vnmercifulnes might ſeeme tollerable may note falſehood ſubtiltie 3 daſtardlineſſe ſought ſaue liues wee might marueile ſee ſome readie betray forſake yea lend helping hand perſecute natiue prince countrey brother yea religion ſelfe broken ſhiuered hope tranſitorie life ſafetie yet miſſe alſo oft time ſeene ſpeech mordecai heſter remaine danger doeſt thou looke beſafe god reuengeth ſuch falſehood cowardlineſſe sauiour ſaith ſaue life ſhall loſe vſe though matth 10 39 life ſweete yet preſerued ſubtiltie falſehood prepoſterous feare lord haue bee brought triall requireth note hand euen ſo thing ſubteltie daſtardlineſſe auoided ſimplicitie courage practiſed god willing conſpiracie men schechem abimilek gedeon threatneth men succoth barbarouſnes verſ 7 boldnes towards deliuerer iuſtly deſerued euen teare fleſh thornes deſert iuſtly magiſtrate sauiour teacheth hee ſcorneth brother neighbour worthie higheſt degree puniſhment much committed againſt gouernour might thus met requited threatning wrath vpon good conſideration deferre ſpeaking puniſhment till inflicting mentioned let marked gedeon euen ſpeake preuailing againſt zeba zalmunna without feare alreadie ſubdued therefore ſaith lord hath deliuered hand doubting would teare fleſh brier meane time let v marke hee left greateſt moſt neceſſarie dutie muſt neceſſitie preſently done wit purſuing midianites namely puniſhing men succoth done alſo might better bee deferred wiſedome diſcretion learned v duty done v euils auoided danger puniſhment followeth doct firſt done neceſſitie muſt firſt yet neglected omitted due ſeaſon regarded alſo inſtances may theſe bee many viſit parent great ſickneſſe requireth preſent duty without delay preferred performed rather iourney profit though lawfull alſo may well done another time alſo preferre hearing sermon common buſineſſe greater hurt c ſay onely common action muſt giue place ſeaſons euen one ſeaſon another beſt rule wee preferre ſeaſon occaſioneth worke preſenteſt vſe although ſome dutie higher nature offer ſelfe yea obſerue euen ciuill ſeaſon may ſometime bee preferred religious example falles man offered ſome fauour hope releaſe ſome trouble reconciliation aduerſarie mightier himſelfe vſe ſome preſent helpe elſe cannot enioy may hath ſumme money pay vpon ſet day vpon great forfeiture ſent vpon errand life death ſay fetch chirurgian let maſter parent blood deſperate caſe otherwiſe commanded ſerue prince c againſt theſe commeth ſome opportunitie hearing word prayer familie theſe bee neceſſarie kind due time wiſe ought iuſtle aſide needfull done time theſe may attended vnto leiſure giue leaue tide ſtaieth man therefore muſt beware leſt ignorance though cloaked honeſtie neglect eſpecially wilfull contempt leaue greater leſſer cauſeth partie ſo offending ſhame ſorrow oft time ſhall anſwere follie neglecting phyſitian caſe ſaid ſhall thereby finde wife father maſter dead paſt recouerie caſes may one wee ſhould meaſure reſt paul vpon ground omitted opportunitie good aſia act 20 21 hee act 20 16 21 13 might goe ieruſalem let v ouer much iuſt eccleſ 7 wringeth noſe forceth blood prou 30 ioyne caueat prou 30 33 vnder colour preferring greater dutie wee take occaſion neglect ſmaller afterward doe wee ſhall bewray ſelues rather ſubtill ſhifters diſpenſers duty boldly looſely wiſe redeemer time example publike worſhip god fall vpon time ordinarie priuate worſhip let yeeld howbeit ſo wee readily returne priuate againe due place time pretend diligence one way colour negligence another way feaſt better ordinarie feaſt may better ſpared man ſhould depriued ordinarie ſo ſtarue weeke adde becauſe ſo prepoſterous nature whereas one dutie ſhould make v fitter another wee rather neglect one hearing conference meditation prayer ſucke poyſon ſweetnes waxe auke vntoward yea wearie priuate becauſe wee thinke wee haue ſufficiently quit ſelues publike dutie either preaching hearing like manner vnlawfull man preferre companie choice ſeruant god either one may haue benefit thē calling attending family bee carried ſo ſhould grow diſtaſte neglect calling duty god priuate ſeruice moſt inconuenient yea argueth ye diuel hath blinded v deluſion ſtrongly either ignorance ſimplicitie worſe becauſe weary moſt neceſſary dutie continuance vnder colour zeale thoſe fall ſeldome preferred leſſe needfull dutie needfull ſo hee leaue meane purſuing reſt midianites though hee might eaſily haue diſcouraged vnthankfulneſſe brother ſcoffing many would haue done ſuch caſe men vnthankfulneſſe diſcouraging v ſcoffes doth cauſe v many time breake good beginning whereas neither men ephraim theſe succoth put courſe ſhould teach v haue warrant god goe auoid regard ſo regard temptation diſcouragements hindered broken good courſe neither eliſha mocking note 2 king 2 sauiour apoſtles oppoſition found 2 king 2 25 nay rather incouraged ſo paul diſſwaſiues others actes 21 dauid michols ſcorne wee ought likewiſe ſo act 21 13 2 sam 6 22 ſee feweſt countenance aſſiſt v ſaying yet vile lord ſake reward ſhal common ſhall counted medlers buſibodies anſwer let god v men whoſe commandement meddle call aduiſed perſwaded ground haue ſo may reape good comfortable vſe thereof receiue fruite promiſe men succoth fiftie two sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges goe forward reſt text remaineth verſ 8 eight verſe theſe word went thence penuel ſo forth read laſt sermon may ſee another diſcouragement repulſe gedeon ſuſtained men penuel ſouldiers faint weary denied bread thē succoth wee haue ſeene men penuel alſo appeareth verſe went faintnes wearines himſelf ſouldiers repulſe whereby might eaſily haue tempted brought thinke feare god approue iourney ſet himſelfe againſt ſo note wont conclude ill ſucceſſe haue euen good attempt eſpecially let forcible many diuers one necke another iobes affliction among hard meſſages brought calamity befalne one fire god fallen heauen burnt vp ſheepe ſeruants god againſt may learne thing ſometime may goe ſo contrary deſire liking expectation duty god requireth haue done v v againſt v yea hee would croſſe v ſet purpoſe dutie looke god bid v doe man god ſent iuda ſhould haue done drawne old prophet bethel contrary god commandement eate indeed caſe alway alike ſuch difficulty befall v ſometime 1 king 13 19 may clearely ſee cauſe thereof may bee ſame man caſe one time doe good action yet euill inconuenient manner another time well occupied take good thing hand doe good manner kind may fall hath many diſcouragements thing ſucceed whē goeth beſt manner latter theſe two may lord trie faith patience ſo croſſing firſt kind much may ſay maruell lord croſſe hath done good thing bad manner end may call himſelfe due examination himſelfe amend amiſſe ere take hand ſuch holy duty god wil eleuen tribe ſhould fight againſt beniamin perſons true repentance iudg 20 fit buſineſſe yea zeale wanting principall wit faith god would bee goe worke amiſſe great cauſe therefore lord ſhould fight faſt againſt driue repentance reuoltings fought againſt beniamin teach wanted meekeneſſe loue diſcretion temper feruent reuenge withall ſo might doe holy worke god holy manner therefore ſuch caſe let men contented nay glad god croſſe may better ſpie poyſoneth beſt duty deſires pride raſhnes boldneſſe learne hereby meekeneſſe humilitie repentance feare c god doth iuſtly ſuffer many diſcouragements vpon ſuch alſo oft time deale ſo iſraelites going vp canaan egypt exod 3 may ſtay courſe euill exod 3 19 attempt proceed aduiſedly commendably doings falleth ſometime ſaid ſore great difficulty ſtand vp men way vnlike gedeons wherein lord deales ſending iourney would make heauen earth againſt trauels greatly admiration aſtoniſhment would haue ſaid dauid choſen god king yet promiſe thereof oft renued confirmed ſeeing diſcouragements ſo many ſtrong met whereas saul came kingdome eaſily without trouble ſuch caſes wherein haue ſo much diſmay v yet satan euer hand alſo worke vpon weakenes ſet v much backward eſpecially wee ſhall bee brought thinke god deed ſeeme contrary word promiſe death shunamites child yet bin giuen vnlooked bleſſing pleaſeth god trie v ſeeming ſet ſuch barres way v wiſe inough ſee leaſt rightly conſider thus v god ſuffereth thing ſo trouble v though wee thereby iuſt cauſe complaine expoſtulate note begin doubt wil make good promiſe v whether may go forward good courſe haue begun yea impatient perhaps much diſquieted leaſt doe alſo fret fume ſo diſcouraged good beginning whereby may ſee froth rather faith ſeemed bee good ſubſtance feele ſtinch vnſauourie heart vpon ſmall occaſion caſt ſuch euill ſmelles yet herein wee differ gedeon found diſcouragements croſſes farre greater courage confidence wee ſo triall great matter trifle moſt part onely wee bee croſſed hindred good action thus haue ſome one let way euen common buſineſſe ſuch diſtemperature haue ſpoken ſhall poſſeſſe v haue loſt ſomething though ſmall valew yea though miſſing way hindred weather ordinary oft falleth raſhneſſe note 〈…〉 ſtumble hurt foot againſt ſtone ſhould bee like going duty ſhould haue ſo many great let way croſſings v may eaſily meet v thoſe alſo ſent god reſiſt v therefore ſingular onely grace god inable v belieue bee perſwaded hee doth oft time ſuch thing trie v may ſhew foorth grace faith patience v therefore hold peace ſeeing hath done ſuch hinderance croſſings fall ſometimes going prayer priuately familie hearing word preached receiue ſacrament c wiſe body ſay ſhould withdrawne pretence though wee pleaſed god therein ſeeing euen ſome let riſe vp way hinder v like may obſerue thoſe diſcouragements within ſelues example miniſter courſe preaching ſhall find ill meaſure hand others whoſe good moſt ſeeketh ſee purpoſe god toward moſes iſraelites firſt ſent vnto exod 6 ſhall exod 6 9 deſpiſe god prouidence toward phariſees ſaid haue luke 15 12 done thinke like worke vpon ſhall feele within himſelfe great vnfitneſſe moſes exod 3 exod 3 10 ſome vnwillingneſſe deadneſſe drouſineſſe want aſſiſtance god diſcharge worke miniſtery great dampings man hath vſed beſt meanes furniſh himſelfe knowledge conſcience yet euen beſt ſometimes haue proofe hereof themſelues thought thinke like ariſe ſuch caſe therfore man looke theſe reſolued hand ſuch quailings may fall alſo hee armed againſt temptation may ariſe therefrom wonderfull diuell may weaken faith zeale ſlacken purpoſe diligence lord worke ſide ſuch caſe hee able ſtay himſelfe conſidering ſuch trial vſual leſſe beſt ſeruants miniſters god alway haue haue ebbing aſwell flowing eliah paul yea sauiour himſelfe ſtrong diſcouragements ſingular benefit much hauing ouercome firſt onſet ſhall ſecond place meditate end lord hath abaſing thus occupied god owne worke hee may teach humilitie yea flee himſelfe depend immediatly vpon lord ſufficiencie aſſiſtance truſt wit ſtudy memory tongue gift others make onely refuge therefore often diſappointed oh gaine ſhall reape thereby ſay paul neuer fitter god ſeruice loweſt mine owne opinion hereafter therefore boaſt wil boaſt mine owne infirmity apoſtle ſpeaketh glory god moſt perfected aduanced 2 cor 12 9 verſ 9 gedeon receiuing like diſcourteſie rude anſwer men penuel men succoth doth like manner threaten throwing downe tower ſo much gloried threatning ſeeing afterward put execution croſſe diſcommoditie needleſly owne ſin bring vpon themſelues may ſee many author cauſers owne ſorrow trouble need haue ſinne ſtoutneſſe wilfulneſſe ſtiffeneckedneſſe vndutifulneſſe rude behauiour doe ſay bring vnſeaſonable affliction vpon themſelues euen theſe men succoth penuel wee know peace men liue without feare great benefit ſoone loſt hardly recouered men wolues lionlike one another eſpecially prouoked moſt haue authoritie ſuperioritie one ouer another ſo may iuſtly vexe ſhal fal hand wicked deſerts leaud behauiour therfore ſhould take heed prouoke one another leaſt maner gal 5 laſt theſe lamentable moſt men make breach peace loſſe commodity rigour crueltie high mind proud heart bearing leaſt iniurie bending themſelues reuenge looking good meaſure bee offered others yeelding little kindneſſe againe peruerſeneſſe alſo euen betwixt many couple married eſtate cauſeth continuall iarring vnquietneſſe whereas peace man would thinke fitter ſeene betwixt ſpeake commanded ſeeke men much lieth yea purſue follow though flee yea buy peace though heb 12 14 coſt ſomewhat ſel hand much leſſe trifle thus better heartned againſt affliction get ſtrength hope note rom 5 4 experience time come ſee ſoone moſes ioſhua gedeon grew ſtrong faith day going many yeeres ought humble v ſo farre behind ſo incourage v looking duly vnto graciouſlie god aſſiſted ſo apply sacrament haue communion god chriſt therein much confirmed thereby couenant hath made v diligence faithfulnes preparing ſelues thereto beleeue think abſurd need looke conclude point ſeeing haue ſhewed neceſſitie euill hurt falleth contrary meane looſenes idleneſſe vnbeliefe chriſtians many occaſions heretofore adde cauſe ſo great difference degree meaſure grace goodneſſe wee obſerue many profeſſors ſome painfull hearing vſing good companie marking heart deeply ſet vpon ſame remembring making vſe knowledge watching thereunto prayer c whereas others note comber thēſelues ſo much matter roome leiſure left theſe looke thriue ſpiritually whether take paine ſleeping working true ſaying father fit vrged vpon ſuch made thee without thee ſaue thee without thee ſaue thee thy labour ſake thy labour gathered manna fellowes got nothing thereby fareth otherwiſe gather much haue much labour little haue little euen apoſtle ſpeaketh another thing contrary ſoweth ſparingly ſhall reape ſparingly mete lord ſo meaſure v againe laboureth eate •• laboureth much enioyeth fruite thereof ſome thirtie ſome ſixtie ſome hundred fold euen diligence oh ſtrange ſee men ſet themſelues work earthly buſineſſe wherein yet haue abſolute note promiſe thriuing becauſe faith chiefe help wanting lord hath tyed himſelfe bleſſe labour abundance men haue liſt ſtirre mediocritie wealth contenteth maketh ſo endleſſe reſtleſſe deſires traulles commonneſt meaſure grace pleaſeth beſt becauſe gotten leaſt trouble fearefull men ſhould doe ſo much fulfilling luſts battels laboured therein faith promiſes followeth 14 tooke ſeruant men succoth enquired hee wrote prince succoth elder thereof euen ſeuentie ſeuen men 15 came vnto men succoth ſaid behold zeba zalmunna ye vpbrayed ſaying hand zeba zalmunna already thy hand ſhould giue bread vnto thy wearie men 16 tooke elder citie thornes wilderneſſe brier teare men succoth 17 alſo brake downe tower penuel ſlew men citie theſe verſes following ſhewed gedeon taken verſ 14 15 16 17 prince midian returned succoth ſeeks diligently know name chiefe men elder thereof brought ſhewed prince zeba zalmunna vnto hee kept aliue make boaſt might ſhew god deliuered hand hee made doubt thereof ſo might aſhamed accuſed done men denying bread thereupon hee vnto threatned tare fleſh wit succoth thornes brier wilderneſſe ouerthrew tower men penuel ſlew citizen either becauſe inſulted arrogantly men succoth elſe becauſe reſiſted gedeon truſting tower ſo ſlaine whether succoth died paine puniſhment moſt like whether fleſh onely torne yet life remaining though ſtorie doth declare yet cannot ignorant ſore extreame paine kinde execution done vpon men penuel themſelues putting death ſtorie ſetteth downe ſure ſlaine ſo without good probabilitie torne death alſo gedeon meeting young man cauſeth ſet downe name cleering verſe 14 chiefe elder gouernours succoth writing might name alderman citizen would truſt 3 23 doct harlot teach v dutie point fall hand corrected v wee doe time haſtily angrie mood without due conſideration vſe correction weigh cauſe rightly reuenge ſelues ſatisfying brutiſh affection bridle anger r • ſh outrage one among reſt told ſeruant ſurely beaten thee angrie doctrine applied magiſtrates parent schoolemaſters ſuperiors namely ſtepmothers ſuch haue rule ouer poore orphanes little becommeth excuſe corruption fault deſert partie guiltie though hee haue due yet puniſher fit perſon reuenge intemperate heate may deſerue greater puniſhment god hand euen murtherer heart brother ſee effect ſuch ſeueritie make partie corrected contemne waxe deſperate penitent peruerting right end correction gedeons ſhewing theſe prince men succoth penuel verſ 15 ſhame aſtoniſhment comfort owne people ſo abuſed wronged theſe mocked gedeon liuing walking according life faith going lord worke carefully hauing ouercome midianites thereby theſe wicked mocker put ſhame paine yea
