mordecai faithfull ſeruant god appeare thus often time euen heere world much comming ſolemne great day god ſhall iudge ſee lord draw himſelfe people neuer ſo little wherein hee doth ſonne well pleaſed • behold ſome diſgrace abaſement world inſult crow ouer babylonian curſed edomites ouer iewes captiuitie beyond expectation ſee deliuered pſal 137 3 7 yea lord graceth giues fauour reſtores libertie bleſſeth many benefit ſay turne ſcornes admiration aſhamed vnreaſonable diſgracing note beſides lord ſhall pluck themſelues downe humble like affliction wiſh themſelues caſe euen hardeſt worſt condition haue good cauſe abundantly contented ſeeke liue faith ſonne god truſting cleauing word aboue thing eſteeming ſelues farre rich thereby euen wee counted moſt fooliſh vile ſcornefull world floriſhingeſt eſtate condition reſt god waite hope hauing ſide diſappointed pſalm 20 7 caſt deſperate dicer blinde hope likelihood haphazard ſo deceiued expectation haue time boaſting note glorying deceiueth maketh thinke iollitie proſperitie laſt alwaies yet changeth weather continueth one eſtate haue wiſedome conſider end ſhall worſt god people haue time mourning pſal 126 6 end ſhall reioycing gedeon bringeth vpbraiders zeba zalmunna triumph glorie may alſo ſee euill either doe dreame thinke farre make mocke neere vnto according apoſtle ſaith theſſalonians men crie peace peace commeth ſudden deſtruction 1 theſ 5 3 vpon euen ſorrow woman trauell chorah companie benadad many example hereof heed taken iocond aloft haue heart deſire neither neede afraid beholding greatnes euen abideth departing ſtandeth eccleſ 5 8 falling beſt greateſt greater working ouerthrow warned others woe briefly becauſe often gedeon hauing well ſhamed theſe men succoth penuel doth verſ 16 17 threatned verſe 7 9 • e fleſh men succoth thornes caſt downe tower men penuel euen ſtrong hold gloried caſt downe ſay ground ſlew might theſe puniſhments haue auoided thinke yes ſo owne ſinne meane vndutifulnes boldnes ſtout ſturdie ſtomacks ſlineſſe hoping midian preuailed haue gained vnnaturall dealing brother denying bread vnto oh therefore lamentable ſee men bring ſhame ſorrow doct deſtruction vpon themſelues wicked quality bad behauiour wilfulnes proud ſtomackes crueltie curriſh vnkinde dealing ſuch without might haue enioyed peace welfare euen heart deſire good contentment yea note fauour god alſo nothing men ſin keepeth many good thing heapeth many contrarie euils vpon achan ſtealing dathan rebelling againſt god faithfull ſeruant moſes iſrael oft reuolting god falling couenant whereof booke plaine proofe againſt ſome among v vndone idlenes vnthriftineſſe needleſſe ſpending ſome vnfaithfulnes deceitful dealing loſe credit truſted come naught ſome oppreſſion ſundry way death bed ſo terrified whereas making reſtitution ſhilling noble pound valew ſhould haue done might haue brought great eaſe would note terror reſtore ten one yet cannot quieted neither ſome adultrie brought ſhame worſe ſhould bee due ſpitefull malicious reuenging ſpirits make themſelues odious procure ſmall ioy themſelues adde ſomething touching particular ſinne theſe men politike ſhifting ſubtelty playing newters battell depended vncertaintie iſſue ſay kind offender theſe ſlie wily companion leaſt pitied men lord entrappeth owne ſnare sooner would man let looſe lion durſt pit danger wherein foxe becauſe beſides hurtfulneſſe hath ſo many ſhifts conueigh ſelfe danger ſo hardly catcht pitieth theſe men succoth penuel becauſe ſeeking ſubteltie preſerue liues iuſtly beaten owne rodde loſt whereas falles danger either good quarrell ſimplicitie either ſaued god pitied ruine men double miſerie men diſtreſſe heare others ſay well ſerued heathen haue obſerued cowardly ſubteltie ſubtill hee moſt fearefull euer vnproſperous ſeldome euen forren diſſentions king state haue ſped well haue held plaid ſpectators men ſucceſſe whoſoeuer hath got vpper hand haue ſmarted denied ſuccour made prey forſooke yet ſmart alſo onely forbeare ſakes actually helpe vnnaturall counted common calamitie betray one enemie another helpe able ſpeake excite men part taking alway men iarres ſhew iuſtly theſe handled craftineſſe denying helpe ſtrangers owne captaine euen ſo odious doth god make newters temporiſers religion hated papiſt proteſtant curſed hanged betwixt heauen earth touching vſe abhorre ſinne reade 2 doct 6 verſe theſe like puniſhments like iniquity doe light vpon plaine vpright mercifull word religiouſly circumſpect carriage make conſcience way doe deny beſt doe oft meete ſharpe perſecutions good cauſes elſe trouble fatherly trial correction good ſo peter ſaith ye ſuffer righteouſneſſe ſake bleſſed yee 1 pet 3 14 17 againe god ye ſuffer better ye ſuffer weldoing euill ſee ſuch haue beare ſharpenes painefulneſſe ſufferings reioycing lord bleſſed eſtate whereas haue puniſhments forerunner greater euen hand apoſtle ſaith indeed full often confeſſe ſhelter themſelues menward greatneſſe ſhift well inough meane perſons go wracke according prouerbe great men dote poore men ſmart god higher salomon ſaith calleth thē account competent iudge haue broken iudgements fauor feare bribe great fly breake copwebbes meete match ala ſeeth way bring diſpleaſure prince faction partakings treachery challenge highneſſe ſpirits owne engliſh chronicle theſe 2 300 yeeres plentifully witneſſe lord ſpare great one let fawning flatterer ſeeke ſuch willingly offer themſelues inſtruments oppreſſion cruelty wrong becauſe looke ſafe vnder wing puniſhment ziba ſuch like let ſuch feare ſay patron ſhall ſhelter themſelues howſoeuer doubt thinke otherwiſe ſaid point fuller handling noted vpon 9 verſe ſame purpoſe may particularly marke executing puniſhment vpon theſe chiefe men citie rather vpon common citizen greateſt place authoritie haue many priuiledges aboue doct 2 verſ 16 17 meaner perſons credit wealth eſtimation commanding others ſo lord brings foorth terrour inferiours lie open greater danger hurt loſſe thereby others doe time breaketh appeareth doe ill behaue themſelues place great cauſe men aboue ſhould carrie themſelues humbly proudly many doe alſo looke well themſelues euery part dutie time note come ſhall pay eſtate ſhall ſuch meaneſt vnder would full loth roome ſuch ſay dauid pſalm 2 wiſe therefore ſerue lord feare kiſſe pſalme 2 10 ſonne yee mightie one leſt cruſh peeces happie trust wrath kindled alſo inferior ſhould learne murmure againſt becauſe ſo farre aboue ſometime goe vnder ſore heauy puniſhments themſelues doe yea though behaue themſelues commendably place yet god oft correcteth ſome others leſt ſhould kick vp heele againſt meanes wealth greatneſſe common thing ſuch god hath number among eſtates high low ſo nurtureth affliction according heauenly wiſdome may ſafely appointed time gathered father fit place make end ſtay time fifty three sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges verſ 18 ſaid zeba zalmunna manner men ye ſlew tabor anſwered thou art ſo euery one like child king 19 ſaid brother euen mother child lord liueth ye ſaued liues would ſlay 20 ſaid iether firſt borne ſonne vp ſlay boy drew ſword feared becauſe yet young 21 zeba zalmunna ſaid riſe thou fall vpon v man ſo ſtrength gedeon aroſe ſlew zeba zalmunna tooke away ornament camel neck done followeth according ſenſe diuiſion chapter beginning gedeon executed puniſhment vpon two king midian hee ſhewed prince succoth penuel hee purpoſed puniſh firſt ſeeing great men ſhewed courteſie entring ſpeech though hee needed ſo haue done asked manner men ſlew mount tabor anſwered like ſo goodly well fauoured king ſonnes whereby appeareth gedeon man ſingular fauour perſon thoſe men ſlaine ſtorie ſetteth downe ſeeing midianites inuaded land iſrael harueſt time euery yeere like anſwered killed would haue ſaued aliue commanded eldeſt ſonne fall vpon durſt yet young likewiſe ſcorned bad doe himſelfe gedeon enquiring act mentioned gedeon might ſee iuſtly ſuffered notwithſtanding might ought haue put death god appointed thereto grieuous enemy church killing two prince oreb zeb yet ſlew brother commended pſalme therefore ought haue ſlaine euen cauſe pſalme 83 2 ſpeech therfore would haue killed ſlew brother though pitifull yet ſudden paſſionate cannot iuſtified howſoeuer might haue pleaded themſelues otherwiſe ſure mouthes ſtopped could aske fauour reſpect ſeeing ſlaine brother enquiring action commendable proceeded ſo diepely engaged himſelfe oath one thing bee noted gedeon meete doct verſ 18 puniſhed ſhould ſee iuſt cauſe thereof examining cleare haue ſuſpected done ioſhua commandement god achan ſo innocent ſhall haue cauſe complaine good therfore reſpect may feare ſhall bee purſued without cauſe alſo let guiltie ſee ſhall dealt wit ſhall brought ſhame puniſhment openlie partialitie muſt farre anger al euill affection remooued ſpecially conſidered ſuch ſhall execute puniſhment vpon malefactor vſe correction towards prerogatiues haue aboue men fauour birth manhood honour wealth yet haue hold yea rather depriued houre though hoped pleaſed themſelues looking continuance many yeeres may ſeene theſe ſlew ſlaine siſera ſoone cut eglon iezabel many others lie open many danger meaner perſons eſpecially wicked haue ſaid wiſe therefore beware pleaſe themſelues reſt earthly thing vſe ſoberly owne good others like changeable world change alſo daily pompe glory turne vanitie middeſt painted felicitie world happy onely glorieth reioyceth lord doctrine confeſſe often iterated conſider great neceſſitie thereof contrary moſt men practiſe thereto conclude wiſdome spirit god giue occaſion ſame almoſt euery ſentence ſometime oft ſome chapter end commonneſſe ſin might bee ſomewhat checked often repeating reproouing therof ſo becommeth wiſe iudge prepare appetite holy ghoſt hath prouided ſauoury meate inſtruction wearie hearing wearie teaching fitteſt place let v behold theſe deſperate prince brought forth anſwere fact little dreamt ſhould euer heare againe anſwer namely killing thoſe men ſlew mount tabor tuſh iollitie put ſword reſt company reſpect perſons nay like rather becauſe ſeemed bee note worth make boaſt gallant ſpirits victorious braue proud ſtomacks vnlike whoſe glory cut thumbes ſeuentie iudg 1 7 prince put like dogges vnder bord gather crummes touching abuſe men proſperitie haue oft ſpoken right vſe thereof one word particularly let adde warne men ought demeane themſelues place reaſon either great ſucceſſe vnlooked preferment occaſion ſoeuer corrupt fleſh might take forget themſelues ſay let men beware iolly luſty merry moodes 3 doct ver 18 thinke haue world ſling none may controll euen ſay let controll themſelues take heed leſt inſolent diſdainefull cruell iniurious word deed breake ſuperfluitie note pride brauerie hereafter either god man might bring forth againſt ſhall bee abaſed meaner condition counſell giue theſe pang know little bootes tell drunken man haue done drunkenneſſe repent ſober arme men againſt ſuch vnlawfull occaſions moſt ſeeke end may vtter ſtomack gaming drinking challenge quarrel contention ſuites law c alſo againſt corrupt abuſe euen lawfull bleſſings man warie tickle pricke forward one time ſome odious carriage himſelfe afterward may remembred againſt reproach loſſe ſhame yea ruine heere ſee theſe euen heathen haue prudently obſerued wiſe man carrie himſelfe otherwiſe proſperous one conſidereth one day may miſerable indeed ſuch iolly fellowes need warrant euen manward ſhall neuer fall decay eſtate ſeeing elſe ſeeth fruite reape ſcorne pride wit vnderfoot men reioyce ruine make paſtime none pitying taking part whereas others lamented reliued miſerie pitieth herod eaten vp wormes becauſe would ſo proudly exceed bound ouer v thou thy ſonne thy ſonnes ſonne thou haſt aeliuered v hand midian 23 gedeon ſaid vnto raigne ouer neither ſhal child raigne ouer lord ſhall raigne ouer third part chapter laſt part chapter follow certaine particular concerning ſenſe doct verſe 22 gedeon firſt ſet downe offering kingdome gedeon poſteritie men iſrael reaſon render ſo refuſing theſe two verſes generall act people good ſhewed themſelues thankfull great deliuerance obtained god inſtrument oppreſſion midianites enemy bindeth like dutie haue receiued kindneſſe kindred towne countrey ought ſhew kindneſſe haue receiued ſome great good benefit thus pharaoh aduance ioſeph brother father hee preſerued land famine complained aroſe another pharaoh exod 1 8 afterward know dauid remembred ionathans geneſ 47 6 kindneſſe dead good 2 sam 9 7 cauſed salomon vtter prouerb thine owne friend thy father prou 27 10 friend ſake thou ſo deſcend ſmaller kindneſſe betwixt one neighbour another thankfulneſſe ought bee ſhewed fruit bee continued betwixt may bee peace good otherwiſe moſt part baniſhed men vnleſſe couered diſſimulation one ſcorneth owe thing profeſſing liue without backward loue whereby might winne neighbor nouriſhed betweene ſtrangeneſſe ſuſpition vncharitableneſſe diſcord ſuch curſed effect fruit thereof laſt matter thankfulneſſe bee due outward fauours good turnes much ſhould bee ſhewed greateſt one man hath induſtrie labour loue bin inſtrument meane ſaluation many reſpect paul wrote philemon thus philem 19 ſay though might thou oweſt euen thine owne ſelfe ſo ſuch may ſay haue receiued like kindneſſe v deliuered wrath come teaching though little appeare requital loue kindneſſe againe meane procure ioy reclaimed ſhining light afterward hath ſhewed large verſ 1 haue ſpoken generall act iſraelites toward gedeon 2 doct ver 22 may ſee haue commendable thankfull though without ſome weakenes ſo yet particular act offering kingdome farre allowance vtterly vnlawfull power therefore offered ſhall better appeare gedeons anſwer next verſe ought beware liberall another man right good giuing belongs v many loue name credit liberall ſhall ſtolne one men good euen ſo ſhew another kind neither may man giue ſoule diuell witch coniurers many though ſo apparantly doe bought price body defiled redeemed made temple holy ghoſt need long ſtanding vpon taught ſinne great oppreſſors gripers gameſters inioy owne benefitill gotten good reſtore ſo neither ought receiue man owne ill come wee certainly know otherwiſe receiuer excuſed ſimplicitie doth preſume charitably giuers proper good hee knoweth certainly haue badly gotten neither ſhall ſimple affection receiuer acquite ill conſcience giuer whoſe ſinne herein double hath attained wealth vnconſcionably plaid part achan couering ſtealth though vnder faire pretence religious deuout liberalitie doubtleſſe ananias guiltie ſacriledge detaining himſelfe part hee actes 5 3 alienated himſelfe conſecrated lord vſe much firſt rob others feed lord ſpoile lion doe whelp haue ill gotten caſt many caterpillar haue ſucked drawne blood others life like horſleaches ready burſt ſatisfie villany paying tithe ſome ſhred vnrighteous mammon vſe lord church whereas ſanctifieth reſt behind maketh good execrable till reſtitution made either kind poore true heires ſuch good cannot otherwiſe pleaſing god fruit vnfained repentance man ought buy hire paſſed ouer another couet wife ſeruant good another man nothing elſe taking right receiue ſtolne good aduantage neither ſhould pope vſurpe dominion peter 1 pet 5 3 whoſe ſucceſſor ſaith forbidding dominion ouer flocke hath ſuch authoritie neither hath beſt miniſter chriſt gedeon anſwereth god ſhal raigne ouer holy ſpeech verſ 23 ſhall found refuſe thing much leſſe kingdome offered nay greedily would many haue faſtened vpon matter ſmall valew offered kingdome ſome aske might god raigne ouer though hee alſo ſay yes neither anabaptiſts opinion thinke ſuch ciuill gouernment ſubiection people king repugneth chriſtian liberty god raigned ouer people yet saul dauid raigned ouer alſo meaning order god ſet gouerning ſuch continued gouernment ſhould ſtand peruerted contrariwiſe power would hinder god raigned indeed commonwealth iſraelites floriſhed gedeons time wherein elder choſen common conſent ſome eccleſiaſticall giue meaning law others ciuill temporall men call rule people thereby office well carrie themſelues puniſhed put place warre fell lord himſelfe ſtirred vp guide iudges choſen men appeares chapter 1 1 neither child ſucceed thus lord peace warre ruled ouer ſo gedeon meant office iudge ordinary magiſtracy ſuch king temporary occaſionall much like dictatorſhip roman reſpect vſe wherto ſerued although otherwiſe diuine election immediatly men anſwere ſingular modeſtie religious ſtaiedneſſe good gouernment gedeon appeareth hauing occaſion ſo fairely offered poſſeſſing inioying kingdome refuſeth reſolutely offered earneſtly hee indeed ſtrong man ſtandeth ſtoutly brunt commeth gedeous ſinceritie courage tryed plaieth part truly heroicall captaine reiecting tentation ſet great force batter beate flat although meane perſons cannot eaſily conceiue whoſe thought reach ſo high yet comparing great thing ſmall may wel ſeeme forcible ſeeing little preferment fauour commendation reward doct verſ 23 doth ſo bleare eie choake conſcience many profeſſors petty paradiſe one inſtance conſider ſay gedeon refuſed whole kingdome offered moſt deſire vnlawfully ſmall commodity neighbour compariſon kingdome houſe ground wife ſeruant denied yet many bold perſon would bee ready ſay euen gedeon foole refuſe neglect ſuch aduantage doubtleſſe note feare conſcience owne inſufficiency hee man fir place office lawfull reſpect god commandement meere cauſe mooued denie refuſe worthy paterne indeed man truly fearing god making conſcience offending ſo commeth v ſinnes groſſeſt kind adultery murther oppreſſion feare god doth beſt moſt ſafely keepe v ioſeph ſaith alſo geneſ 39 9 matter man priuate gaine yea higheſt degree kingdome becommeth v ſay keep conſciences pure good yet ſmalleſt theſe many man otherwiſe vertuous would cōmon ſpeech ſtraine ioynt think kingdom might venture diſpenſe equity conſcience doubtles great trial man grace matter commodity promotion honour like greateſt valew cannot ſurpriſe conſcience ſo neere euery man himſelfe indeed theſe temptation aſſaile vtterly vnlike himſelf time example gedeon moſt properly taxeth ambitious aſpiring ſpirits wel popiſh ſuch abſolons immodeſty onely inſolencie alſo intemperance cauſe confuſion euery ſtate eſpecially ioyned diſcontentment emulation bee wiſhed men greater hope little meaſure gedeons grace rather led ſpirit theſe haue mentioned wit meaner matter leſſe valew hardly containe keepe themſelues within compaſſe coueting laying claime men commodity ſupplying owne want ſeeke increaſe haue looke thing tends loſſe hurt liued contentedly ought ſo liuely glaſſe behold honourable grace gedeon reſt ſatiſfied eſtate thinking beſt befitting hee might enioy god good liking quietneſſe owne mind endleſſe wiſhing coueting inhaunſe himſelfe moſt men ſinne hee got victory ouer himſelfe behalfe thinke greater honour conqueſt ouer midianites ouerruling himſelfe vaineglorious affection ſhame many proteſtants adde one example euen heathen might ſet v ſchoole dutie hauing ſubdued enemy battell returned home triumph preſented ſome great maſſe gold repelled thē anſwer rather rule owe gold lord owner gold rather ſeruant ruled poſſeſſed oh well v holy gouernment hart affection ſo pretious v chriſtians many heathen whereas drawne pride ambition praiſe leaſt bare loue vertue contemne ſuch offer religion hope farre greater matter greateſt earthly kingdome alſo particularly teacheth muſt endeuour doct 2 calling place god may raigne heauenly ordinance ſo eſpecially gouernment church land citie towne houſe ſay onely muſt ſtand oppoſite muſt fall pſalm 2 religious pſalm 2 1 gouernement ſought yeelded vnto imbraced contrary limites bound god holy word kept preſerued neuer repugneth ciuill gouernment lawfull magiſtrate confirmes rather ſo god may bee obeyed equitie iuſtice maintained preſeruation outward peace order thing ſo might ſay particularly euery condition ala care rather iuſtled aſide men pleaſure though wee pray daily god may bee glorified comming kingdome guiding v might note take place bleſſed thing ſee ſuperiors inferior degree eſtates liue together vnder gouernment one god mutually commanding obeying lord yet wee ſee quite contrary men practiſe true law man ſtoppeth much diſorder could men inioy ſafe peaceable dwelling without lord ſhut conſcience word faithfull miniſter god deſpiſed many place none awake prepare people life come ordinance god magiſtracie ſerueth backe authoriſe word vphold good order little bee regarded alſo little put practiſe reſtraine euill atheiſme prophaneneſſe great ſinnes ſlightly puniſhed c behold euery man runneth owne courſe wedded owne wilfull humour without feare puniſhment walketh frowardneſſe atheiſme prophaneneſſe ſcorne religion crueltie oppreſſion contempt sabbath ignorance c ſaying pſalme tongue owne wee doe liſt ſhall controll pſalme 12 4 v surely none ſinne diuell rule raigne pleaſure lord word doth iuſtled aſide let v mourne thoſe thing till lord amend meane ſeaſon let v ſure guided ourſelues whole courſe elſe hold peace concerning others paſſe ſecond thing concerning gedeon fiftie fovre sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges verſ 24 gedeon ſaid vnto would deſire requeſt would giue euery man earings pray golden earings becauſe iſma • lites 25 anſwered giue ſpread garment caſt therein euery man earings pray 26 weight golden earings required thouſand ſeuen hundred ſhekels gold beſide collors iewels purple rayment king midian beſides chaines cammels neck 27 gedeon made ephod thereof put ophrah citie iſrael went whoring became ſnare vnto gedeon houſe victory ouer midianites gedeon deſires ſenſe leaue monument memoriall thankes god ſame great deliuerance iſrael thought meet ſhould ſome valew price therefore ſeeing people ſo affected could willingly richly ſet forth called ephod worne vpon apparrell monument would haue remaine token thankfull heart ſet vp place citie ophrah becauſe forme coſtlineſſe pertained prieſts ſeruice god religious vſe grew worſhipped god iuſt iudgement iuſtly puniſhing idolatrie poſteritie following deſtruction gedeon houſe ſo eaſily ſoone idolatrie ſuperſtition ariſe vp among againe firſt thankfull mind bee commended imitated v doct verſ 24 thus ought heart benefit inioy leade v vnto god fountaine good giuing saint iames ſaith point hath iames 1 17 largely handled reade note vpon 5 chapter elſe occaſion like scripture againe may learne willing pleaſure one another doct verſ 24 25 26 without taking gratuitie againe doe wee may bolder ſue ſomewhat bee put good vſes gedeon intended doe though hee deceiued asking earings make monument thanks god eſpecially ſay wee haue refuſed take owne priuate vſe commodity hath offered v hath thought haue deſerued gedeon ſuch caſe may deſire ſomewhat bee imploied ſeruice glory god offer v relieuing poore good end alſo hee deſerued commendation bee followed v people yeelded good vſe end ſo good chriſtians ought readineſſe doe like toward relieuing helping needy lending giuing friendſhip yeelding conſidering saint paul ſaith free giuing liberalitie hath great force worke men bountifull perſon ſaith may ſome man die ſo one much good bodily helpe themſelues thankfull god alſo ſo bountifull penury want doubtleſſe honouring god v predominant v ſhould mind aime action purchaſe glory ſo infinitely beholding inioy angell appeared manoah though wil acknowledge lord iehoua author thoſe gift ſo admired reaſon hereof exod 32 paul moſes engaged ſaluation procuring honour rom 9 3 god ſaluation church much wee bound ſeeke forgoing ſuch fauour may well without need accept beſides wiſdome ſhould chriſtians vſe euery opportunity may poore church god eſpecially ſeeing ſuch occaſions befall often ſorts men kind need good diſcretion ſhould perſwade men conuert ciuill kindneſſe offer friend religious vſe chriſtians ſithence may thinke either vnſeaſonable meerely loſt drawne beſtow vpon ſuch matter except themſelues firſt perſwaded loue religion delight saint god pſal 16 2 pſalm 16 therefore knit next verſe ſumme thereof belongeth ſame end let ſorts learne dutie benefit others without hope requitall let doe make others obliged bound ſeruants vnderlings vſe intereſt credit loue haue haue opportunitie perſwade loue good workes draw god bee ſtrangers truth firſt ignorant folke drawne ſuch inducement otherwiſe alreadie chriſtians let labour draw neerer haue ſaid ſaying thus euery man may preuaile thing ye would gratifie preferre god fauour yourſelues exhort ſo commend godlines alſo poore member chriſt make much delight excell vertue earthly commodity gratuitie let needie diſtreſſed partaker let take part ſhall bleſſe god pitie bountie ſhall yeeld tenne fold better requitall one doe bee ſaid pleaſure without looking requitall againe receiue benefit acknowledge haue pleaſured owe duty againe offer accepted partie let fooliſhly draw backe hand altogether euery good vſe ſaying seeing hee receiue diſcharged free vnthankfulnes others regard ſauours ſiniſter meaning chearefull heartie thankſgiuer ſuch one good naaman 2 king 5 theſe mentioned readily 2 king 5 15 anſwere gedeon asking earings good end hee intended wee willing name place calling houſe god lord promiſed ſafe deliuerance wrath brother eſau whither went bring ſafely backe againe euen like mind gedeon ſhew deſiring keepe remembrance god deliuerance making ephod ſigne thereof gedeon vnaduiſed dealt without due good conſideration ſo weightie caſe ſo dangerous conſequence meete hee firſt conſulted lord ſo according reſolution hee ſhould haue receiued haue done wit haue abſtained ſuch worke vndoubtedly muſt would haue done god bin conſulted might haue ouerruled fruite raſhnes careleſnes whereas ſmall matter might haue preuented ſay better gedeon inconſiderate though meaning good god ordained ephod ſuch end onely prieſts weare tabernacle offered ſacrifice permitted men follow therein neither make one ciuil vſes charitably thought gedeon committed idolatrie himſelfe throwne downe altar baal deteſtation cut downe groue howſoeuer certaine v yet ſeeing hee otherwiſe ſetting vp ephod god commanded hee fell kinde idolatrie leaſt great occaſion thereof ſo lord offended puniſhed iſſue poſteritie rewarding vnthankfulnes people alſo crueltie abimelech though gedeons meaning otherwiſe yet diſpleaſed doct verſ 27 lord conſulted ſtrange work tooke hand therefore ſee enough haue good intent call ſerue god knowledge muſt goe word warrant vphold v attempt doings whatſoeuer faith ſinne wee happie rom 14 23 good thing ſo firſt know ſuch indeed otherwiſe iſrael zeale according knowledge rom 10 2 1 sam • 5 dauid would haue builded god houſe could haue gone better thing men account iudgement god reproued nathan yet himſelfe conſented worſhipping god receiue word power thereof work vpon effectually ſo may caſt mould thereof faſhion order ſake againe gedeons ſetting vp ephod occaſion people 2 falling commit ſpirituall fornication letting alone worſhipped father braſen serpent therfore ezechia commanded taken downe gedeon done well therefore ſo ſerued ephod alſo ſaw ſuperſtition ariſe occaſion beſt fruite ſucceſſe blinde ignorant deuotion draweth ſome miſchiefe alway groſſe abſurdities poperie ſpake aroſe firſt vpon ſuch beginning thing theſe caſes bee done ſuperſtition implement thereof held church chriſt haue ſuffered remaine next ſoone may remoued god ordinance ought bee turned kinde right vſe ſeruing ciuill caſes ephod appointed gedeon make playes offer ſuch abuſe word sacrament paſſe another thing concerning people laſtly ſundry people fell idolatry ephod worſhipped god aright vpright heart plague 3 god fell vpon note haue receiued knowledge truth doe fall idolatrie doe neuer eſcape deſtruction lie ſtill therein ſome fearfull plague although riſe againe depart salomon witneſſe hereof himſelfe poſteritie whoſe puniſhment famous harkning idolatrous wiues lord profeſſeth himſelfe caſe iealous man taketh wife ſpouſebreach moſt certainly ſpare offender prou 6 34 verſ 28 thus midian brought low child iſrael ſo lift vp head countrey quietnes fortie yeeres day gedeon 29 ierubbaal ſonne ioaſh went dwelt owne houſe 30 gedeon ſeuentie ſonnes begotten body hee many wiues 31 concubine shechem bare ſonne alſo whoſe name called abimelech theſe foure verſes another thing concerning gedeon ſet downe firſt ſhewed midian • h • multitude glorie thereof ſenſe theſe foure verſes brought low whereby may noted ſorrow ſuch liued ſhame confuſion liuing dead fruit thereof wit finall ſuppreſſion enemie long peace fortie yeeres reſtored life gedeon secondly three particular concerning gedeon added firſt commendation hauing done ſeruice lord extraordinarily called willingly yeelded himſelfe priuate life againe profeſſed againſt contrarie verſe 22 two latter blame firſt polygamie verſ 30 secondly yeelding vnlawfull deſire concubine shechem making way thereby miſchiefe inſued firſt theſe text ſaith midian ſubdued brought low doct verſ 28 c vnderſtood multitude teacheth proueth ought looke alwaies end thing beginning floriſhing eſtate doe scripture calles ſound wiſedome thinke godlieſt thing greateſt account pleaſure pompe dignitie wealth building purchaſes ſolemne marriage ſuch like grant moſt men reioice pleaſe themſelues vainely fooliſhly time gotten paradiſe may ſee fade daily enioyers thereof change corruption wiſe man dare pleaſe himſelfe reſt could make happie ſeeth end therof ſo enioy thē god thing decaying tranſitorie ye perhaps ſay ſhall glad delight till doe forgoe till end come anſwere ſay ſo hee ſhall know end come manner note vſing ſeeketh theſe fruitfull dutie god workes loue men take boldnes ſin rather occaſion man may know end ſhall bee good reſpect thereof hee may vſe comfortably ſeeing hee vſeth warily aright god directeth doth ſo god alſo bleſſeth exceedingly bleſſing attaine thereto lord brought moſes deuteronomy bemoning want deut 32 29 practiſing point wiſedome men ſaying oh people wiſe would conſider end apoſtle asketh queſtion romanes fruite pleaſure euer end rom 6 21 brought ſhame wiſe fooliſh virgin giue cleere proofe mat 25 3 4 c vnto fooliſh contenting themſelues bee without oyle lampes walke ſecurely therefore ſhut wiſe waiting oyle lampes till bridegrome came therefore thus watching end taken receiued readily looke vpon hee heſter 5 11 compared 7 9 yet himſelfe little boaſt end greater ſhame beſt glorie looke vpon young man salomon ſpeaketh reioyced eccleſ 11 9 ſhould neuer old mee • e worſe cheare iollitie mirth told ſhould come iudgement better end delicious life found rich man goſpell torment luke 16 25 thus might heape vp example infinitly scripture experience gotten much many number al age thus midianites ſpeake greatnes time talke world yet hauing ſure hold heauen part happineſſe tranſitorie came naught worſe nothing ſo one may ſay chriſt ſaid iudas good neuer borne therefore conclude bleſſed man hath eye end action thing beholdeth vnder ſunne ſo dealeth hee may finde enioy thereby good end life therfore holy ghoſt hebrewes commended faith ſome willeth reader conſider hath bin end conuerſation hebr 13 8 ſuch pſalmiſt ſendeth v end godly marke ſaith end righteous end peace theſe pſal 37 37 merrie otherwiſe howſoeuer goe worke end note heauineſſe according word sauiour woe luke 6 25 laugh fow ye ſhall howle weepe ſaid fortie yeeres peace ſubduing doct 2 midianites great benefit god beſtowed vpon ſo enioy great part ſhall ſee cauſe ſay reade conſider bondage woe men enemy ſtrangers deut 28 48 therfore ſhould carefully looke good may done ſuch time note libertie freedome great diſturbance eſpecially wee haue generally peace land priuate breach neighbour home familie quiet life peace good conſcience godward chiefly aboue thing procured looke large chap 5 elſewhere followeth concerning gedeon verſe verſ 29 ſaid victorie gedeon liued ſort priuate life proue make manifeſt deſired told empire contrary god ordinance ſome office among v annuall temporarie hee priuacie liued idlely wickedly one done enough waxt weary would haue ſet downe fault wee haue learne ſo vſe authoritie countenance preferment ſuch libertie doct common remember muſt laid downe againe haue end alſo perhaps life therefore ſwell neither puffed vp thereby neither forget wee haue ſuch like promotion aduancement borrowed nothing common ſee age abaſed little regard ſo minde ſaying yea ſuch minde ſuch man elſe ſhould priuiledge godly man reſpect life death may better haue thouſands vſe ſoberly ſome hundred make proſperitie heauen cannot thinke contrarie bee miſerie vndoing neuer ioyed much neuer laid neere heart loſt forwent ſpeech foole ſay moſt miſerable haue bin happie wiſe man neither ſo lifted vp inioying knoweth vaniſhing mutable happines ſo deiected forgoing loſt hope paſt immoderate deſire minde like hauing vſed body plenteous delicate fare afterward compelled ſtreighter allowance pineth alteration full fat comely ſtrong body thinne meager pale decaied ſheweth change diet hath made vnlike himſelfe whereas ſober minded reſembleth tieth himſelfe ordinarie moſt agreeable health ſoundnes although hee come extraordinarie diet yet law himſelfe eateth many diſhes one mendeth ſo appaireth thus ſaith chriſtian apoſtle haue learned abound philip 4 12 haue learned alſo want diuers eſtates ſame euen contented thankfull rare portion aboue al earthly treaſure ſuch needed aſhamed confeſſe learnd borne ſuch priuiledge free citizen rome told lyſias taught spirit god wee haue great need note many office place authoritie ſuperioritie miniſtery magiſtracy haue doe daily forget themſelues eſpecially great wealth accompany ſame yea ſometime great matter perſons cauſe therefore god ſhall blow vpon eſtate caſt downe conſtrained come abaſement old condition againe wherein liued ſcorne caſt ſhift vnlawfull meanes wind themſelues running debt men neuer meaning pay appeareth many seruingmen souldiers haue place better borne common ſort many ſay steward digge cannot begge aſhamed luke 16 3 liue muſt ſome way neuer fall worke thing beſeeming maintenance hunt pleaſure harlot dice card robbing couſening ſimple beguiling ſillie maides matron enrich themſelues c againe ſheweth follie ſuch great perſons truſting greatneſſe wealth ſtrong hold prouide little owne change hardneſſe may befall child bring vp ſoftneſſe delicacie ſo much inuring labour exercizing body wit induſtrie action wherby commeth paſſe eſtate decline left deſtitute ſhiftleſſe vrged vnhappy neceſſitie owne procuring vſe indirect meanes maintenance another thing concerning gedeon followeth ſetting verſe 30 • 1 downe many wiues great blemiſh teacheth v well fault blemiſhes god ſeruants ſet v scripture vertues reſpect scripture vnlike ſtories writing men carried partially hatred flattery obſcure truth dauids sampſons peter fault infirmity ſundry approoued ſeruants god yet done holy ghoſt wee ſhould ſeeke libertie follow many ſorrowes ſhall ſuch teach wee euen beſt ſhould ſuſpect pſalme 32 10 ſelues full ſelfeloue hide winck corruption bad quality therfore keepe diligence heart hardly brought doe though meaſure deceitful neither abide reprooued ſhamed ſame ſeeing god hath ſundry cauſes diuers reſpects left infirmity blemiſhes god ſeruants ſet downe scripture three firſt blemiſhes ſeruants ſcripture knowne v briefly note ſet downe ſome hauing ſo good fit occaſion offered ſo may profit accordingly hath done partly benefit partly teach v dutie benefit thereby twofold one time ſhould fall ſome grieuous ſinne deſpaire god mercy thereby yet wee may ſtay vphold ſelues example gedeon ſuch fearing god yet fall dangerouſly recouered themſelues againe knowing may like caſe receiue hope pardon likewiſe call ſelues home againe repentance ſuch caſes exhorted god faithfull miniſters caſt away confidence though haue ſo offended wee ready obiect thus oh neuer god child fell ſo offended haue done ſo may iuſtly feare remiſſion pardon v hoped therefore wee ſhall heare note infirmity godly cleere knowledge much auaileth ſtay v diſpairing therefore imbolden v example ſinne though yet ſtand grace god free reprochfull euils vphold v haue alreadie fallen dangerouſl •• wee faint altogether ſay ſerueth preuention deadly • eare ſinne cauſe preſumption ſinning abuſe knowledge licentiouſneſſe hoping pardon heare others haue obtained ſinned like manner themſelues haue done let know god meet boldneſſe requireth terror within ſhame without till ſhal wiſh bin better aduiſed may iuſtly complaine ſinned wilfully purpoſely saint god ſpeake many ſo may feare ſhall ſo eaſily find mercy forgiueneſſe found one cauſe concerneth v much lord hath left fault godly manifeſted scripture wel vertues another wee hearing ſome rare people age paſt ſecond cauſe haue falne ſhould ſuſpicious ſelues wary wee ſlip common euils time wee liue ſeeing wee note much weaker faith grace therefore like eaſily forget ſelues fall grieuouſly vnleſſe count happineſſe oft tell ſelues labour endeuour meanes perſeuere vprightnes vnto end therefore wee like find hard recouer ſelues againe indeed bitterneſſe taſted falles enough deterre v following though ſure ſpeed length aſwell looke bitter ſweet onely ſo deceiued another cauſe god hath made knowne blemiſhes faithfull third liued former time teach v duty towards brother heare haue falne grieuous offence afterward commeth remembrance take ſuch deep conceit ſo diſpleaſing god lay ſo neere heart feare cannot forgiuen ſay thus falleth taught dutie conſidered scripture wee haue conſolation hope farre v ſay nay hee fallen let ſhift himſelfe better opinion hee deſerued ſee hypocrite demas reuolter oh man way thee procure thy ſelfe compaſſion others thou ſhouldeſt fall ſo hadſt like need thou ſayeſt god forbid ſhould ſtand ſuch need anſwer thee thou ſhalt doe wiſely preuenting ſuch occaſion done highminded conceit ſuch thing ſhall befall thee rather feare thy ſelfe thy frailtie neither thy tenderneſſe others ſhalt thou made ſubiect fall watchfull againſt falling leſt thou ſhouldeſt ſay ſhall fall heare apoſtle ſaying leſt thou thy ſelfe preoccupated doe like gedeon fallen wee haue heard followeth wee ſee one particular blemiſhes many wiues doct 2 mentioning ſonnes ſelfe neither againſt ſpoken make way next chapter poligamie wiues prohibited law ſuch licentiouſneſſe anſwere yes much true polygamie men hart ſtolne god ſingle lawfull marriage alſo ſame may bee haue ſaid yea moſt certainly men giue themſelues bridle conſider one end thereof bee reſtraining ſtrange luſts liue holily ſo made fit marriage ſeuerall duty moſt doe regard vnſeemely ſpeeches offenſiue behauiour towards woman doe apparantly teſtifie liue vnchaſtly end chapter anſwere obiection marueiled obiect god ſuffered idolatrie ſuperſtition ſo long vnpuniſhed ſuch obiect thus thinke fell little victorie ſure gedeon asked people earings made ephod victorie whereas yet gedeon continued fortie yeeres anſwered auſtine ſuch caſe article faith anſw may haue iudgement approoued receiued likely anſwered scripture ſaith though gold gathered ſoone victory yet ephod made long wit end gedeons life made ſooner yet abuſed till toward death vncertainties ground inſtruction therefore end fiftie five sermon continued ninth chapter iudges verſe 1 abimelech ſonne ierubbaal went shechem mother brother communed familie houſe mother father ſaying 2 say pray audience men shechem whether better ſonnes ierubbaal ſeuentie perſons reigne ouer either one raigne remember alſo bone fleſh 3 mother brother ſpake audience men shechem theſe word heart moued follow abimelech ſaid brother 4 gaue ſeuenty peeces ſiluer houſe baalberith wherewith abimelech hired vaine light fellowes followed 5 went vnto father houſe ophrah ſlew brother ſons ierubbaal ſeuentie perſons vpon one ſtone yet iotham youngeſt ſonne ierubbaal left hid himſelfe 6 men shechem gathered together houſe millo came made abimelech king plain ſtone erected shechē ſumme chapter firſt ſet downe vſually doe together ſumme part chapter part three firſt namely abimelech ſeeking kingdome hauing got men shechem ſide killed ſeuentie brother except one ſeuenth verſe ſecond heauie prediction ouerthrow one brother iotham eſcaped bloodie hand denounced deſtruction men shechem 22 verſe 3 threatned foretold iotham ſon gedeon remaining aliue came paſſe fulfilled concerning ruine ouerthrow abimelech men sechem mutuall hatred vexation aroſe betwixt end chapter thus chapter deuided firſt ſpeake former part lieth order handle two due place firſt part conſider firſt part abimelech death father wounde men shechem make king purpoſe ſlew brother ſaue one 7 verſe effecting ſaid abimelech went mother kindred ſaw loſt labour attempt ſo horrible fact father friend helpe ſubtiltie flatterie wonne heart willing hearken vnto nothing reſpecting common benefit land owne priuate commoditie ſo helped forward money much aduanced purpoſes thus fleſhed ſecure enioying inboldened kil 70 perſons ſaue one brother thought coaſt cleare theſe shechemites went make king performed accordingly thus houſe gedeon ouerthrowne moſt deteſtable vſurpation tyranny abimelech came firſt may note abimelechs going mother kindred doct verſ 1 went miſchieuous intent ſeeking king note ſay caſt wicked men compaſſing deſires intend euill wil repaire ſuch place company thinke purpoſe haue conuerſed better yet take pleaſure company longer neuer goe bad company goe ſome eſpeciall euill meat drink paſtime conuerſe ſuch themſelues neere may cont •• nally forted education cohabitation occaſions better themſelues come paſſe oft time yet euen grow affect ſet heart ſome particular miſchieuous practiſes wont time paſt poſſible giue ouer companion meet breake companie conuerſe thoſe bee owne diſpoſition like themſelues reaſon onely wearie good company ſee cannot follow bad purpoſes ſo currantly bee among neither looke aide thereto hand doe know ſhall bee ſuſpected diſſwaded hindred broken ill purpoſes maruell changing company good bad ariſeth vpon ſmaller occaſions vpon minding intending ſuch miſchiefe abimelech went ſixth iohn taken pritch againſt sauiour iohn 6 66 ſaid walked much ſooner men doe purpoſe wickedneſſe abſolon therefore 2 sam 15 10 intended rebell againſt father got away gathered companie fit ſuch purpoſe father houſe priſon weariſome vnto iudas went betray maſter forſooke left company apoſtles went phariſies moſt deadly enemy chriſt lincked himſelfe moſt clearely ſee like fact adoniah 1 kin 1 reported nathan dauid manner ſaith hee thy ſeruant zadocke 1 king 1 25 prieſt salomon thy ſonne hath called tooth ioab captaine abiathar prieſt ſome younger brother men fitter ambitious humour hath hee called crie ſay god ſaue king adoniah euen ſo ſtill day haue ſaid many bad mixed good company ſiniſter reſpects ſome benefit looke credit thereby ſafety yet ſee time wind ioyne companie much like simon magus ſaw apoſtles ill ſigne doe ſo meane forſake ſocietie fellowſhip good people company bad though great hope ſome beſt meanes calling imployments ſorted company godly becauſe pleaſure delight rather heart farre euen place moſt neere yet way good wrought vpon drawne one time abode ſuch place company god pleaſed worke leaue forſake ſo bewray themſelues colour though ſhould meane worſe woe commeth vpon wrap themſelues deepely miſchiefe miſery little hope recouery getting againe yea ſtopped bad courſe yet ſay ſuch keepe company thoſe religious take good deepely bewitched couering hypocriſie cloake good companie chriſt told anſwered luke 13 26 eaten drunke company although moſt part prooueth true man ſpie leaudneſſe allow euill courſe tell away forthwith count enemy wearie ſuch without iuſt cauſe ſo muſt know depart wearie good cauſe deſire may doe lawfully haue good hope reclaime depart alſo moſes hee able iudge heb 11 24 hee houſe pharaoh daughter salomon counſelleth v doe caſe much like ſaying seeſt thou man prou 14 7 lippes wiſdome depart vſe godly ought make learne ſuch wiſer kind alwaies carefull vſe delight godly company doe contrary meanes depart forſake whereby onely may ſhew giue proofe ſelues warpe neither imagine ſet heart euill company cleaue faſt good alſo godly inſtructions counſell reproofe example wee ſeeke get poſſible good company ſhould time decline ſome occaſion yet labour bee brought backe againe right way ſo continue therein fellowſhip leaud let v odious bee pſalm 15 4 haue noted bad alſo may make vſe profit doctrine manner let wholly paſt hope walking vp downe pſalmiſt ſpeaketh counſell vngodly yet pſalm 1 1 vnreſolued let ſuch ſay haue care themſelues draw gather good company want whereof contrary grow leaud perſons drunkard whoremaſters theeues idle one ſuch like haue noted bad man hee may better doe euill departeth good ſo true alſo much becauſe man draweth neere good therefore eaſilier carried naught iuſtly ſuſpected badlie diſpoſed caſt good company haue ſeemed imbrace ſo pitied exhorted frequenting good want altogether haue fallen bad company bin ſeduced thereby faultie though former latter latter would glad ſuch ſimpler ſort bee aduiſed profit much wholeſome counſell former haue enioyed already wearie ſeeke ſhake latter although flexible eaſily drawne away ill example yet contriue miſchiefe themſelues moſt part whereas former ſecret lingring luſts doe need others alwaies call themſelues rather poyſon like abimelech draw others companion proouing ſo leaud breake good thirdly let among good ſo placed god prouidence acknowledge bee great mercie beware ſubtiltie falſehood heart whereby depriue themſelues fruit let ſay thus credit gaine commendation fauour may obtaine cleauing godly ſeeme ſo much deſired much deſirable good man himſelfe bee deſired meane grace may well goe ſo make companie alway precious much eſteemed contrariwiſe make man count good men odious surely bad purpoſe miſchiefe leſſe make rather heart whither luſt carry bodily preſence conſider odious thing cauſeth ſuch odious effect foule part depart good much flee aduerſe partie meane tent vngodly moſt cauſed theſe luſt heart bad quality indeed deſire man good euill man prou 18 1 ſeparate himſelfe meaning might hinder gehazi couetous deſire withdraw himſelfe maſter demas paul c yea ſurely ſins ſake man deuide himſelfe father mother kindred chriſt ſaith odious much odious man wil thus great cauſe meditation becauſe ſome knowing thēſelues ſo euil indeed ſuſpect temptation euill ere aſſaile therefore ſooner tempted alſo foyled hazael came prophet 2 king 8 13 eliſha reuerence acknowledge ſo farre hee ſaw well inough good might haue taken time framed himſelfe diſlike euill prophet told ſhould worke yea deteſted afterward plaied cruell tyrant againſt church god ſhooke due remembrance owne word good euen many doe like caſe wonder falſehearted neuer loued ſo hee might hate much time ſerued laſtly ſuch boaſt company good bad apply themſelues like fiſh colour keepe bad purpoſes themſelues let ſuch impious fellowes farre worſe former feare leſt found abimelech ſinne let eſcape ſcotfree inferiour touching infection bad company elſewhere ſhall ſpoken fit place ſonne concubine ye haue heard went among verſe 2 likeſt preuaile end might made king father vtterly refuſed himſelfe yet monſter borne time regarding neither god father moſt impudently ſought kingdome againſt liking yea againſt right followeth deuice reaſon shechem get one better alone ſhould king ſeuenty brother might haue anſwered neither needfull lawfull hee ſhould reigne ouer people ſecond deuice ſhift publike hee neere fleſh third ſeeing would told bee priuate benefit pretended kindred hee would chiefly ſeeke peace profit preferment couſonage ſubtiltie flattery wicked inſtrument ſonne good man roſe vp doct 1 attempt worke miſchiefe father abhorred wee may ſee wicked poſteritie come oft time godly ſeed vnlike parent goodneſſe whereas one would thinke ſhould rather labour reſemble like thoſe godly parent leaſt generation ioſhuahs time degenerated ely samucl dauid moſt good prieſts prophet king wicked child euen ſeene age reaſon firſt want good education vntaught ill gouerned secondly beſt corne breedes chaffe ſo godly beget child godly men naturall ſinfull neither god grace tied abſolutely parent ſake thirdly pride ſtubbornneſſe wilfulneſſe ſeeking libertie youth among reſt leaſt multitude bad example meane fit enough poyſon beſt nature though haue inſtruction outward gouernment many leaud youth trained vp great coſt parent yet loſe hope alſo child walking ſteps oh multitude ſuch age yet done making good eſpecially ſome place hath former time though rare offend herein euen ſight others thing much lamented ſee ſo many youth vnlike good parent none weake meanes vſed make better marueiled woe knowne cō monly note til ſo felt paſt remedying beholding contrary rare ſo goodly beautifull great cauſe death childrē come proofe ſhould borne patiently ſeeing doubted moſt taken away beſt knoweth woe might brought ſhould liue lamented example good parēts ſo yet euen theſe ſpeake preuaile child whence common complaint ſorts samuel good father 2 sam 8 5 child walkes ſteps infinite bad parternes gouernours generally embraced none fearing follow haue led dance though bee deſtruction beaſts forreſt ſhould follow tract fellow den lion becauſe till within den paſt recouery appeares footſteps danger ſaid iacobs ewe beholding pilled roddes laid watertroughes conceiued particoloured lambes forthwith ſo man would thinke ſo neere domeſticall example good parent child nouriſhed grow vp warmed heate nathan ſpeakes poore man 2 sam 12 3 ſheepe yea haue benefit familiar inſtruction conuerſation ſuch owne diſpoſition nature man would thinke ſay ſuch ſhould take grace doe reſemble viſage naturall property man would thinke ſhould mutuall feeling ioy good parent hath wiſe child ſorrow contrary ſhould alſo reioyce following goodneſſe thus wee might thinke thus ſhould god ſecret iudgement prepared ſome euen alſo euill day ſaid elie child hearkned 1 sam 2 25 father becauſe god determined deſtroy wit expiable offence cauſed people polluting holy thing god ſo alſo pitifull thinke ſort poſteritie bad parent dare venture ſo confidently goe anceſtours haue gone taking ſinne tradition yea filling 1 pet 1 18 matth 23 32 vp meaſure attained sauiour ſpeaketh manner generally ſeene otherwiſe another father euen father chriſt hath reuealed heauen fleſh blood hath taught dregge poperie naturall without teaching make ſtrong piller man religion • forefather haue done ſtory church reported▪ certaine heathen prince hauing receiued ſo much light true religion hee content bee baptized yet hee came water ſtopped asked miniſter queſtion whether haue anceſtors vnbaptized gone heauen hell hell ſaith miniſter ſaid refuſed chriſtianitie vrterly yea doubtleſſe nature teacheth better euen rather go hell parent heauen without theſe ſay lamentable vſe ſorts make thereof ſhall need inſiſt vpon hauing oft vrged place ſhifts put together breuitie ſake matter ariſing vnfolding ſecond verſe ſo plentifully marke fraud goeth inſinuating king ouer ſeuenty brother muſt reigne together thought would neuer allow conſent secondly hee telles better ſo reigned vntrue alſo beſt alwaies god appoints deteſt thirdly ſetteth himſelfe though hee ſhould ſay firter benefit ought haue knowne creating magiſtrates publike priuate commoditie reſpected haue tolearne hereby ſhifts ſubrile doct 2 practiſes ready hand intend miſchiefe goe lying cogging falſhood lord dealing muſt ſtand ſame reaſon ierem 17 9 heart men euill aboue meaſure deepe hath many abomination deuiſe goe worke without ſee likewiſe thereafter proſper theſe way bee added ſome profeſſe goſpell ſhould aſhamed found ſo groſſely degenerate vſe like practiſes though couered ſome fairer ſhewes caſt god ſay heart depart v iob 21 14 deſire haue acquaintance thee theſe ſhal one day know coſt ſhould haue example vnto good life profeſſe without ſhall ſurely come naught beſides ſubtiltie hart another cauſe euen craft satan rule child teaching contriue warpe ſubtile ſhifts policy atchiue euill purpoſes defend brought paſſe ſome ſchollers finding trade follow hand deſire make chiefe worke inuent euill miſchiefe excuſes couer withall would otherwiſe occupied mother geneſ 3 12 13 eue learned beginning father ſhifts lie goe together poſteritie though ſome ſeeme haue entailed vnto aboue others almoſt ſo ſuddenly come vpon hath ſhift readineſſe though bee like plauſible yet prouerb bad one better none let none thinke policie forbidden nathan bathſheba plotted wiſe courſe great good church modeſtie yea honeſtie alſo regarding thing fleſh take part matter moue neuer ſo bad example parent blinded child carried almoſt perſwaſion without chriſtian wiſedom regard ſometime incenſed againſt neuer put god beſide ſhame befalleth men without vnfained repentance common thing world yet accounteth paſſe theſe otherſome ſo vile irreligious monſtrous another maner yea euen yet beare among men benefit commonwealth groſſe villanies rooted among common vertues practiſed outward worſhipping god peace men yet theſe scripture teſtifieth farre happineſſe hath noted ſay partly leſt theſe men diſclaimed others adultery▪ boaſted themſelues free ſay god faine doe crie hollowneſſe ignorance vnbeliefe euill heart ſo conuicted hath laid dirt theſe ſinnes neither would brought thinke ſo whereas haue occaſioned v ſpeake neither ſhall bee needfull make ſet diſcourſe vpon place onely adde word two touching tooke theſe peeces treaſury baalberith whether tooke treaſure appointed idolatrous vſes god profeſſe themſelues ieopard ſaluation vpon promiſe yet farre behind theſe idolater thing venture caſt good vpon ſafegard thinke lord meet truſtie keeper wealth put hand willing loſe ſuch may ſay much beholding whileſt hath giuen liuing temple ſtone temple baal owne making euen poore member lord ieſus theſe commandeth caſt ſuperfluities ſome ſubſtance hee promiſeth ouerſeer ſteward treaſurie reckon returne againe ſuch beneuolence double trebble vnto yea tenfold vſe gaine enough nay hundreth fold rewarding euerlaſting habitation hath vndertaken become surety haue ſaid repay ſuch loane againe abundantly wee thinke theſe bee word keepe principall faſt let intereſt goe v theſe temple count sepulchre deuouring al asking giue giue neuer returning ought againe eccleſiaſtes thinke loſt caſt vpon water well beſtowed theſe idolater confederate baalberith ſhall ſtand foorth witneſſe eccleſ 11 1 againſt ſuch ſhame thus helped forward may ſee maner doct 2 verſ 4 perſons hired prouided note cauſes ſo one wit may ſee iuſtice ſhould done executed ſuch liuing idly moſt part need muſt muſt worke ſhould laid late yeeres honourable counſeller worthie memorie kept ranging ſeeing ſeldome hanging men debt secondly malecontents owne penury welfare others yea state ſelfe often commonwealth wherein liue thirdly ſuch ruled reaſon much leſſe religion diſpoſition run head bee ſet gadding rouing c wherefore ſtay waite euen ſuch troubleſome time theſe ſome tumult inſurrection may fiſh troubled water deſiring change preſent condition theſe peaceable time fit occaſion practiſe ſet work diuelliſh diſpoſition peace gouernment empriſoned ſome ioyning themſelues vaine looſe perſons like themſelues wandring fro imployment home forren country deſire getting knowledge experience much trafficke maintenance trie fortune prophanely ſpeake wearie owne countrey wherein defamed leaudneſſe prodigalitie needleſſe debt diſhoneſty others readily hired ſort themſelues ſuch rifle men houſes companion helping make head none theſe hit ſay come paſſe fall robbing high way ſuch dangerous diſeaſed member haue alwaies al commonwealth booke act two three chapter act 17 5 8 19 29 • 4 iewes got ſuch hang bies make ſtirres tumult city charged paul author yet danger life make ſeeme ſeditious raiſer trouble came euen ſo ſuch day idle companion cannot chooſe like vulture cormorant pray vpon men good might eaſily haue ſtaied theſe courſes young ſuffered haue owne ſo farre til trade miſerable yet becauſe ioyned eaſe waxed ſweete vnto againe ſaued kept priſon correction ſo iuſtly deſerued correction ciuill magiſtrate headborrowes townes wherein lurked neglected yet owne parent kindred ſhould haue ſeene executed deut 21 19 ſuch worke ought eate ſuffered whoſe 2 theſ 3 10 life idlenes let ſuch therefore purged among v place let prouiſion made idle vagrant reſtrained ſet worke though haue ſomewhat owne ſo nill doe good may bee compelled ſtoope good order held miſchiefe leaſt euil may ceaſe threatneth ſo great danger church commonwealth muſt need ſay hard doe conſidering ſuch perſons flocke together ſuch place land populous frequented may harbour ſafer ſearch puniſhment cannot amend let v lament bleſſe god free ſuch moleſtation place dwell abimelech ſaw bold ſhameleſſe deuices attempt verſ 5 proſpered thriued waxed much bolder tooke heart goe fall vpon innocent brother ſlew compare act 12 2 eccleſ 7 15 herein verified salomon eccleſ 7 wicked man ſaith continueth malice meaning becauſe proſpereth reſiſted thus adonibezek chap 1 ſtaied till ſerued ſeuentie prince iudg 1 7 ſhamefully cruell humour fleſhed ſucceſſe horrible vnnaturall bloodſhedding crueltie wee may ſee monſters world worthily driuen frō amongſt men made ſpectacles gazing ſtocks open moſt ſharpe puniſhment inflicted vpon athaliah haman abſolous wrought bloodie maſſacre france chiefe doer perſecution england may remembred ſome yet liue gunpowdertreaſon come nothing behinde ſay much cruell murther many ſoules want due foode touching ſinne crueltie haue ſpoken chap 1 7 chap 8 20 forward let reader ſupply place thence many ill minded deſire know god doth ſuffer ſuch abomination obiect anſw anſwere god knoweth cauſe ruleth iuſtly godly father ſpeakes ordereth euill appetite wicked fulfill prouidence though infuſe euill wrought ſaluation elect fall adam treacherie iudas yet wee neither ought bee altogether ignorant god doth wee appoint lord gouerne world glorified may marueile god patient toward bad thinke himſelfe good ſuffer deſerts inſtruments neuer ſo euil sauiour ſuffered v without cauſe v bee without danger hurt ſuch wicked perſons one god ſcourges correct v let v reckon among great bleſſings god vſe accordingly verſe let v proceede abimelech conſidered verſ 5 doct 2 ſeuentie brother might like hinder reſiſt therefore hee reſolued diſpatch ſo hee except one hainouſnes fact deterred going ſtitch would leaue halues nay could quiet till euery obſtacle hindrance remoued eyeſore taken away bewraieth moſt fearfull propertie worker euill cannot deſiſt leaue till haue brought vngodly attempt full perfect end wherein godly ſeldome match contraire action man would haue thought theſe ſeuentie men great blocke vſurpers way keepe proceeding currantly bad courſe abimelech ſaw yet barre ſtrong enough keepe villanie broke peeces rather ſhould ſtand vp way hinder purpoſe reſolued goe forward therefore whatſoeuer oppoſition ſhould come againſt hee would beare downe flood windes pull downe hils bankes bridge gate tree whatſoeuer come way yeelds woe meetes beare robbed whelpes yet better ſo croſſe vſurper ambitious deſire although theſe brother croſt ſilence ſitting ſtill ambition raging monſter ſee although thirſt honour yet ſeldome aſſwaged without blood occaſion opportunitie ſerue nothing ſo holy ſo pretious ſo neere prophaneth defloureth deſtroyeth euen owne ſonne hee ſtood way taſted ſame ſawce brother reported herod great maſſacre infant matth 2 became well enough keepe himſelfe villanie hee inuaded wickednes euen ſucceſſors day theſe italionated diuels diſciples machiauel practiſe defend according rule kingdome gotten force muſt preſerued alſo violence againe rule muſt ſtand nicely vpon vertues occaſion ſerues play lyon foxe worke enemy fraud crueltie way ſo doe againe let ſtrike abiſhai ſaid ſtrike home kill ſtand way ſit light kill often odious make riddance roote branch ſuch policie neceſſitie pardonable thinke fact abimelech could thus reſemble theſe monſters lately offered giue v experiment like enterpriſe powdertreaſon age euer matched ſo age ſhall euer forget eternall ſhame lord endleſſe praiſe abimelechs ambition crueltie ſo lord made abimelechs confuſion abimelechs ioy laſted hope yet made aſhamed lord ſent ſpirit diuiſion betweene shechem ſo hee betweene theſe one betrayed let thine enemy periſh god c therefore let wiſe men iudg 5 laſt verſe great one circumſpectly take heede beware ſinnes reſolue commit ſurely whatſoeuer giue ouer themſelues vnto make bone neceſſarie attendant thereof neuer ſo hideous horrible hard ſay whether parricide ambition greater ſaue onely former ſerued latter men little dreame deeply plunge themſelues vndertake ſinne themſelues often aſtoniſhed themſelues haue begun muſt play men going forward ſhrink herod himſelfe willing behead iohn ſaid word muſt goe backe thought credit ſake therefore hee went hee might thanke luxuriouſnes iollitie cauſed oath oath murther ſaith apoſtle becauſe men ſet downe rich meete match fall 1 tim 69 many temptation ſnares c tuſh tell trifle lyon way buſie purſuing game get whatſoeuer coſt haue ſo decreed ſet downe well learne reſolue onely vpon lawfull ſo free great inconuenience goe commendation reſolution diueliſh would bee larger followeth ſixth verſe doctrine much differing argument bloodie act abimelechs one brother eſcaped doct 3 hand one preſerued crueltie kept reach done god ſpeciall prouidence hold feare ſeeing hee kept aliue lawfull ſonne gedeon borne lawfull wife abimelech himſelfe comming concubine alſo good daſhing ioy moreouer wee ſee good vſe lord ſauing aliue one brother iotham meane becauſe prophecie vttered therein foretelling deſtruction abimelech teach v although committers euill haue humor ſatisfied turne ſerued thing fall euen would wiſh yet ſhall euer ſomewhat reſerued vex pay home euen world giue taſte torment example better ſucceſſe haman yet mordecay place ſtand croſſe ioy quailed rather ſhould none reſiſt yea vnlike came vpon mordecaies counſell well handling matter haman ouerthrowne eſter 7 10 9 10 whole houſe herod herodias nothing troubled iohn baptist yet taken iohn way sauiour chriſt role vp herod conſcience put feare kept marke 6 20 ſtay could bee quiet ahab heart eaſe 1 king 22 8 eliah yet afterward michaiah vexed much gehazi ſped well length maſter daſhed ſauour 2 king 5 25 woe come vnleſſe teared driuen bad courſes thereby ſo humble themſelues ſeeke mercy third captaine ahazijah eliah ſeeing danger thus god feareth 2 king 1 13 whole rabble vngodly terror alſo word wil doe workes ſhall euen thereby meane caſting downe law liuely preached feare death iudgement day hell hee doth ſo torment many man ſhiftes deuices cannot deliuer therefrom neither al hee hath able comfort cry downe voice miniſtery although worke true feare god repentance onely awake aſtoniſh true ſome though bee apparantly croſſed god yet feele dead palſey ſee nabal hardned worſe caſe god dealeth thus commonly wicked ſhall haue ſomewhat make leſſe eager pleaſures either paine ſickneſſe ſome ſuch thing elſe inward feare like although ala although ſhould neuer interrupted ſhould yet caried hell merrily others goe mourning god ſeruants fall like ſinne neſtle themſelues deceiuable inticements world hee giueth like medicine cure diſeaſe ſhal euer haue one thing hold vnquietneſſe feare note euer like light vpon vexe ſting ſhall dare delight themſelues euill thing reſt tranſitory ſo goe lord feare loſing good wife neareſt companion partake commodity delight croſſes decay world make eaſilier borne affliction diſquieteth much dampeth earthly repaſt alſo exerciſeth weakeneſſe body meannes eſtate petty loſſes c al weane thē breaſt ſucklings laying ſuch bitter diſtaſteful correction vpon vſe reſt ioy heart nothing vſe ſee delight bee fauour feare lord continually one thing though may make two neceſſarie prou 24 27 luke 10 42 nothing rouſe v ſpirituall ſlumbering earthly proſperitie peace wherein lie ſenſeleſſely ſottiſhly haue one foot hell already let doe wee know ſoone wee muſt leaue al goe iudgement yeelding vp account yet lord croſſe v enterpriſes bee euill may know worſt meaneth toward v would ſtop v race toward deſtruction miſery may come vpon v abimelech ſo vnnaturally ſlaine brother ought verſ 6 ſenſe haue ſtricken ſuch terror men shechem ſhould haue abhorred purſued openly calling reſt tribe ioyne therein till receiued due puniſhment ſo ſubtillie woound ſo credulous beleeued hee would deale well hee promiſed therefore proceeded fearefull ſpoken vndertooke make king place pertained none tribe either called made acquainted matter yet farre greater ſtroke therein muſt need raiſe great diſſention deuiſion betwixt regarded ſeeing taken hand effecting ſee one ſinne intended man committed goeth doct 1 alone draweth many companion neither brought paſſe without helpe neither man take pleaſure without company ſinnes ſeekes king many ſinnes doth adioyne effecting vſed fraud flatterie couſonage roſe vp drew band ſeditious hangbies ſlew brother made king contention cauſe among manifeſt ſinne ſolitarie bird euer ſeene rom 13 13 company euen paul teacheth roman ſtrife carrieth enuying gluttony draweth drunkenneſſe chambering wantonneſſe marked becauſe wicked perſons alleage themſelues reprooued fault al men ſinners yea ſome ſinne groſſely many kind themſelues ſay hope haue done amiſſe yet may borne ſeeing one treſpaſſe ſay euery one himſelfe man hath blemiſh ſuch one haue ſome one ſo may haue anſwered one chiefe ſinne committed many handmaides accompany ſinne achan dauid ananias saphira many others ſeene therefore thinke ſhame v charged note many take heed one goe alone thinke ſmall matter bee rebuked one know certaintie one bring draw many happy wiſely taketh heed doctrine haue handled therefore leſſe ſhall ſerue looke backe chap 1 verſ 7 moreouer let fooliſhneſſe theſe men shechem beleeuing abimelechs faire word went made king let ſay teach v wiſdome ſingular good watchword chriſtians doe regard ſo much ſpeeches vaine looſe perſons note weigh compare action one another may profit beguiled prouerb ſaith ſhould hearken word ſee deed contrarie vile horrible ſaw therefore ought haue regarded word faultie great matter bee truſted ſmall example text teacheth man vnpitifull owne abimelech certainly without pitie compaſſion howſoeuer vaine glory may ſhew pitie ſometime ſome caſe hold neither reſted vpon one ſwallow maketh ſummer one contend fall diſclaime deceiue neere friend let ſtranger truſt though ſuch one bee fauour yet may twentie way eaſily eſtranged one another ſee commeth daily paſſe man liue peaceablie kindly wife hee may ſay hee agreeing others longer corrupt inconſtant humor bee pleaſed liue kindly none dauid aimed meant anſwer 2 sam 1 16 4 12 brought tidings murthering saul iſhboſheth likelyhood gaue fidelitie time ſhould haue ſerued proſecute point particular wherein truth doth beſt appeare let v deceiued wiſe ſee man faithfull god let v thinke bee v one helpe poore neighbour need ſmall liberalitie neighbourhood time man beſtow sabbath godly exerciſes religious duty ſure doth little way day doe yet knowledge conſcience whatſoeuer doth without nothing worth man cannot appeaſed ſmall matter let ſay ſure hee much leſſe bee great yet men commonly ſay thing would doe could yeeld vnto yet ſmall matter requeſted enlarge argument greater likely leſſer thou canſt truſt thou haſt long knowne faithfull note though thou getteſt many new friend thou ſhalt neuer bold ſoundly reſt vpon alſo man ſeeme repentant leaue il outward qualitie hath certainly yet begun 13 25 35 bad ieroboams hard others puniſhment ſure hath giuen v chriſt greateſt gift much giue ſmaller ſought like mind thus may take good abimelechs word bee bold ſay hee ſet men shechem brother whatſoeuer ſaid one thing adde repeate rather hauing handled doct 3 chapter large meane touching theſe men shechem went made abimelech king abomination ſaw hee wrought ought rather haue purſued fearefulleſt death haue ſaid whoſe practiſe wee may clearely ſee none ſo vile odious perſons ſhewing openly wickedneſſe world applauded approoued ſome odious bad practiſes none ſo godly ſhameleſſe beaſts openly wil defame ſpeake maliciouſly yea need face reaſon commend maintaine theſe vngodly one vile bad themſelues prooued apoſtles word proofe ſay rom 1 laſt let conſidered iudas hee betraied moſt kind louing maſter yet hee incouraged rewarded luke 22 5 thē went maſters iſrael euen chiefe pillers viſible church yea teacher light others though fact afterward cried traitor himſelfe ſaying haue ſinned betraying matth 27 4 innocent blood experience aſwell scripture prooueth truth point ſhewes full ſinne euill doings time yet applaud ſuch goe honeſt citizen townesmen till bee bewrayed lord till wickedneſſe breake foorth euen others doth rightly verifieth prophecy sauiour foretold theſe latter day abundance iniquitie matth 24 12 ſhould bee ſuch ſhould cauſe loue many waxe cold conclude happy wiſe turne away abhorre ſinnes time liue eſpecially abhorre ſin themſelues ſecretly may farre committing openly feare offend god loue beare leaue reſt next sermon fifty seventh sermon ninth chapter booke ivdges verſe 7 toldit iotham went ſtood top mount gerazim lift vp voice cried ſaid vnto hearken vnto mee men shechem god may hearken vnto 8 tree went foorth annoint king ouer ſaid vnto oliue tree reigne thou ouer v 9 oliue tree ſaid vnto ſhould leaue fatneſſe wherewith honour god man goe aduance aboue tree 10 tree ſaid vnto fig tree come thou king ouer v 11 figtree anſwered ſake ſweetneſſe good fruit goe aduance aboue tree 12 ſaid tree vnto vine come thou king ouer v 13 vine ſaid vnto leaue wine whereby cheare god man goe aduance aboue tree 14 ſaid tree vnto bramble come thou raigne ouer v 15 bramble ſaid vnto tree yee indeed annoint king ouer come put truſt vnder ſhaddow fire ſhall come bramble conſume cedar lebanon 16 therefore ye doe truly vncorruptly make abimelech king yee haue deali well ierubbaal houſe haue done vnto according deſeruings hand 17 father fought aduentured life deliuered hand midian 18 yee riſen vp againſt father houſe day haue ſlaine child ſeuentie perſons vpon one ſtone haue made abimelech ſonne maid ſeruant king ouer men shechem becauſe brother 19 yee haue dealt truly purely ierubbaal houſe day reioyceye abimelech let reioyce 20 let fire come abimelech conſume men shechem houſe millo alſo let fire come forth men shechem houſe millo conſume abimelech 21 iotham ran away fled went beer dwelt feare abimelech brother ſecond part chapter haue heard abimelech men shechem proſpered ſumme 2 part chapter pleaſed themſelues done reſt chapter firſt ſecond part 22 verſe ſhewed god would haue blancked damped midſt doings firſt iotham one reſerued purpoſe therefore knowne iotham youngeſt ſonne gedeon eſcaped bloodie hand abimelech men shechem gathered together make king hee waited opportunitie god directing ſhould meete together came place hee might heard mount gerazim neere shechem top whereof hee ſtood tell doings ſhould ſpeed came thither god inſtinct three reaſons doe proue alſo iothams word 7 verſe firſt went ſafe away reaſon likely secondly came paſſe hee prophecied thirdly thing good good vſe found fault reprouing denouncing againſt plainnes ſet parable giuing vnderſtand truth thing imagined maner ſpeech plauſible perſwaſiue made direct inuectiue againſt herein firſt let v ſee meaning ſome thing ſcripture opening parable hard vnderſtood proceed parable know muſt preciſe agreement truth looked euery circumſtance ſenſe wrung euery word ſcope ſubſtance muſt bee looked regarded oliue therefore vine figtree briefly hee meaneth ſuch gedeons familie might haue profitably employed tree ſeeking king hee meaneth shechemites bramble abimelech good nothing bramble one worſt ſhrubs field ought taken aboue beſt tree principall vſe moſt fit bee burned neither ought abimelech haue preferred gedeons ſonnes yet would raigne therefore abimelech choſe ſhould deſerued euen worthily cut ſcripture two thing one preface deſiring hearken reaſon leſt part two parable god hearken ſhould hearken wit laying ſinne verſe 16 puniſhment denounced againſt verſ 22 iotham hee knew certainly premiſſes ſtirred vp doct verſes generall god went thereupon told men shechem doings denounced iudgement god againſt ſame teacheth pleaſeth god ſet aworke iniquitie ſhould laid open committers thereof reſiſted ſpeedily may place calling giue leaue ought ready goe againſt purſue miniſters zealous teaching deface magiſtrates puniſhing gouernours family place theſe bound preuent take order leſt ſuch euill thing ſhould come paſſe ſo roote reforme come thus church commonwealth ſhould preſerued vſe hereof manner firſt three doctrine vſe noted touching contrarie fact kindred abimelech men shechem doe euill ought iuſtly feare god hath ſet many purſue yea euen owne kindred though eſcape one way ſhall taken another wilt thou liue without feare euery way feare god doe well ye doe thing pſal 112 1 8 good ſhall harme eye lord apoſtle ſaith 1 pet 3 12 13 mother vpon child may take hurt ouer righteous eares open prayer face lord euen anger againſt doe euill hearken ſpeech iotham note inſtructions warning verſ 7 ſent v god ought hearkened ſo particularly reuel 2 29 doct verſe 7 prou 17 15 heare crie innocent wronged ſhall crie themſelues heard note againſt monſtrous oppreſſors hard dealer time letting lending regard neither equitie common benefit perſons caſe poore wring hand vſe liſt iudgement ſhall without mercie ſuch ſo mercileſſe conſider iames 2 13 geneſ 37 28 plunge ioſephs brother brought vnto two three time crueltie ſhewed moſt vnnaturally ſold thither whence hoped ſhould neuer returne trouble god man ſhall leaue ſuch moſt miſerable diſtreſſe deſtruction ieruſalem death saul iudas may ſee mercifull ſhall finde mercie iudgement god meaſuring ſuch meaſure mercileſſe haue met haue oft matth 7 2 obſerued paid haue cruell body ſo ſoules men pleaſure depriuing many hungrie note food life haue bodily abundance dyed miſerably darknes without comfort inſtruction ala beleeueth report till ſee verified men laugh ſport themſelues haue ſcraped together wee haue coffer ſay v god tuſh hope neither good euil hope neuer put ſuch plunge ſpeak others indeed haue found truth wofull experience v hope morrow ſhall day feare oh wretch lord mercie cull ſome one many wonder example reſt ſparing others whileſt doeſt thou ſo abuſe patience thy condemnation thou odde perſon god ſet vpon ſtage might adonibezek haue ſaid thou put caſe thou eſcape plague men god bee cruell cruell well froward froward pſalmiſt ſpeaketh match full wilt thou vrge deale thee engroſſer griper arming mouse rat oppreſſe ſea land till eaten fleſh bone note without pitie hee done many men thou ſaieſt rare like befall thee well yet one way behinde ſhall ſurely meete thee thou canſt ſhunne ſay scripture fable thou art hell thou ſhalt crie diues luke 16 24 woe paine deſiring reliefe ſhall anſwered thee remember time thou felteſt miſerie oppreſſed thou crieſt thine anguiſh none heareth thee diuers occaſions ſpoken handled booke conclude therefore word two touching another kinde oppreſſion haue obſerued ſome proteſtants haue dealt hardly vncharitably defamed others euen men ſame religion aggrauateth ſinne ſuch knew durſt giue meaſure backe againe offered theſe men afterward falling hand papiſts men another diſpoſition cruell like lyon ſtinging ſcorpions haue ſo vnpleaſingly deſpitefully handled ſlanderous railing ieſuites rabſhakees haue vexed euery veine heart would haue bought blemiſhes ſcarres price could penne tongue enemy haue defiled thē ſparing neither age perſon gift place al teach thē deale gently innocent lambe would auoide tongue teeth woluiſh aduerſaries lyon come parable tree ſeeking king meant verſ 8 ſaid shechemites ſlipperines inconſtancie could content god gouernment gouerning done many raiſing vp iudge trouble nation deliuer would yeeld gouerned one haue king euen ſometime whole nation iewes follow 1 samuel 8 1 sam 8 5 contrary god appointed practiſe teacheth v ſoone grow wearie god yoke ordinance pſalm 2 3 obeying yet wee might doe well wee could ſee loth wee god ſhould raigne ouer v indeed ſay word luk 19 14 ſeeme pray otherwiſe ſecond third petition thy kingdom come 16 19 meete together ſeeme merrie ſeuerall companie yet greater oddes betwixt man would imagine vngodly man mirth bred tongue countenance therefore controlled heauie ſad heart tels conſidered aright matter hee hath ſmall cauſe merrie turne meriments heauineſſe godly man ioy heartie entire ſound therefore laſteth cannot checke himſelfe iuſtly except ſo merrie ought iotham ſaith wicked though reioyce together yet adde ſound onely frothie deceitfull ioy fellowſhip reaſon becauſe ground ſocietie euill godly ioy ſecret god fauour happie eſtate good duty doe appeareth going performing fruite bad example abundance iniquitie temptation let ſuch man know euen ſorrow good ground reioycing ſeeing ſorrow good ſorroweth euill ſee ſo abound ſorrow euill conſcience ſtill good ſo long ioy
