miniſter god himſelfe may ſtand vp againſt lawleſſe exempted perſons oh man conſider thine enemie ſhould wiſh thee ſhrewd turne could inuent greater thou ſhouldeſt want admoniſher warne thee refuſing thou hurteſt thy ſelfe thy greateſt enemie hurt thee lord threatens againſt iewes hee denounceth moſt ſeuere puniſhments againſt therefore thou maiſt reproued eſpecially publike man priuie matter thy ſelfe think greater portion many farre higher place enioy profit thou thou wiſe accordingly might think iotham ranne away becauſe ſaid durſt ſtand muſt know put life god hand hauing diſcharged duty auoided much could lion mouth danger bound put finger fire wilfully yet like afraid thereof god giuen enemy hand called ſeale truth blood therefore let none condemne ſuch raſhnes cowardiſe hauing rebuked ſinne ſuch boiſterous malicious ſhift themſelues prouide may owne eſcape ſafetie rather condemneth cruell diſpoſition reproue cannot iuſtly conuince ſuch error ſlander raſhnes like haue owne conſcience condemning ſame offence yet ſuffer thoſe liue peace haue done duty diſcharged conſcience iuſtly reprouing ſhall ſuch brought conuicted ſo may relent amend cannot endure accuſed mercie god conſidering ſpitefull nature wicked godly iotham miniſter word may bee ſuffered keepe ſtanding awake admoniſh vnruly hee may ſaued compelled flee runne away feare oppoſites hee hath reproued although hee hath told truth good benefit kinde manner god muzzle doubtleſſe hard iotham euery lewd offender might haue ſome place ſuch beare much ſway deterre miniſter weake fearefull medling challenging ſinnes place laying hard againſt offender yet god hath charged ſtreightly denounce againſt doe ſuch hinder courſe miniſterie verily becauſe themſelues may ſleepe ſecure ſinnes herod thought doe iohns mouth ſtopped fiftie eight sermon ninth chapter booke ivdges third part chapter verſ 22 abimelech raigned three yeeres ouer iſrael 23 lord ſent euill ſpirit betwixt abimelech men shechem men shechem brake promiſe abimelech 24 crueltie toward ſeuentie ſonnes ierubbaal blood might come laid vpon abimelech brother ſlaine vpon men shechem aided kill brother 25 men shechem ſet men waite top mountaines robbed paſſed way told abimelech followeth third part chapter ſenſe abimelech men shechem deſtroyed occaſions meanes thereof two firſt diſcord betwixt diſſenſion ſecondly open warre made way thereunto theſe 42 verſe deſtroying one end chapter firſt ſaid lord ſent euill ſpirit betwixt euen ſpirit satan therefore muſt need diſcord betwixt theſe verſes appeares 26 thus diſſenſion prouoked fight till ſlew haue ſaid enter lay open theſe thing conſidered firſt ſaid abimelech ruled ouer iſrael three yeres word preparatiue followeth thus taken theſe word iotham thus vttered abimelech raigned three yeeres notwithſtanding men shechem made ſhift hold together ſo long man would haue thought iotham parable dreame deluſion three yeeres ſhort time ſpeake king enioy crowne come lord threat began take effect ſhould otherwiſe though little deferred time long men might eaſily haue forgotten iotham within three yeeres thus fulfilled might remember prophecie note accompliſhment thereof thus lord haue iudgements ceaſe vpon enemy ſo ſee may ſay caſuall miſchance hath befallen hand god purſuing manifeſtly ſuch ſuch tranſgreſſion ſaid hee iudge ouer iſrael raiſed vp god hee ruled vſurped tyrant vſe doe begin firſt doct verſ 22 proſperity god gaue ſhort time inioy deſire dominere teach v doth ſome little time giue wicked men longed deſires yet applaudeth therein may haue time repent bethinke themſelues haue done haue gone worke many way haue prouoked god refuſe ſo may ſee iuſtly reiected god pleaſure greateſt floriſh zimry cozby chorah haman rich man goſpell others many ſhort time worke accompliſh deſires take pleaſure enioy luſt heart indeed ſo ſhort time need bee well improoued laſts time ouer paſt heare yee euen folly nay ſhame madneſſe manifeſted ſpoken place neither ſhould reproch downefall haue ſo notable proudly paſſed bound carried themſelues loftily many way wee ſee god hath deſtroy ſuch sometime ſuffers plant themſelues croſſes enterpriſe abſolon adonija ſometimes hee ſuffers take deepe roote giues long time much vexation vnſetling pharao ahab otherwhiles let flouriſh ſhort time pul vp ere bee halfe rooted abimelech whether keepes attaining ſeeke keepes vnder pluck vp againe let learne wiſe knowes handle ſhelter owne annoyance dauid pſal 37 ſpeaking third ſort flouriſhers pſal 37 35 36 compare greene bay tree though barren yet keepes colour winter sommer addeth ſuddenly horribly conſumed argument many pſalmes ſumme iobs friend ſo much inſiſt vpon though apply prepoſterouſly happineſſe wicked ſhort wee muſt wonder plie worke apace take vttermoſt libertie diuell teacheth ſo doe rageth violently knowing tied ſhorttether doubtleſſe ſhortiolitie vantage church hath many breathing betwixt while diſcontinuance euen wee ſee suſhans perplexitie vnder haman malice turned ioy ruine naturall philoſophers obſerue creature moſt noiſome hurtfull ſome way ſo reſtrained either paucity ſhort life like cannot doe harme would god reſtraine men wel beaſts would waxe monſtrous wiſe though world bee ſet wilfulneſſe miſchiefe let teeth water dainty beſt whereof ſhort flouriſhing tickle fooles deſire like ſee day comming vet hand like whirlewind tempeſt ſcatter pleaſures glory like fire deuoure conſume moſt fearefully painted eſtate may ſee farre grace lord wiſheth people ſaith oh wiſe conſider end yet worſt end deut 32 29 ſeene god mercy great cutting ſo ſoone elſe ſhould liue beſides preuenting much iniquitie would make account heauier one followes ſteppes another child come father place beginneth firſt weigh ſhortneſſe life ſoone ſhall father cut al ſo might apply heart wiſdome taketh poſſeſſion place riuited perpetuity pſalm 90 12 ſo much thinke change remouall thence goe forward euill ſpirit ſent betwixt firſt occaſion ouerthrow diuell whoſe malice verſ 23 ſubtiltie ill hatred kindled betwixt yea inflamed breaking promiſe doth ſhew v clearely doct league friendſhip wicked ſoone broken hath good ground although ſome outward thing vphold hope profit pleaſure preferment ſeruing one anothers turne although ſay theſe ſuch like patch vp agreement betwixt yet heart inconſtant many thing fall breed alienation affection one another pritch ſoone note taken many conceit ariſe report carried betwixt reckon vp yet cauſe hereof yet daube vp friendſhip vntempered morter falleth away inough ſpoken god ſend ill ſpirit betwixt euen moſt ſtrongly combined knit together cauſe breake promiſe one another iarre diſagree although bee great reproch contention ſhould break knowne conſent together ſmite righteous therefore wicked policie doe hide yet otherwiſe diuided ſtrongly incenſed one againſt alſo breaketh ſometime ſo confirmeth truth though ſeemed glued friendſhip familiaritie together make men belieue loue firme yet league rotten grow bee defiance one oft time betwixt themſelues ſecretly breake foorth ſight men vſe whereof make ſuch wicked curſed league vſe secondly account otherwiſe made spider web ſoone ſwept downe thirdly praiſe god highlie wee ſee broken turneth great benefit church diuers member reade diuiſion phariſies sadduces turned paul deliuerance rage let act 23 10 godly continue league loue may ſtrong threefold cord eaſily broken neither let neglect mutuall example eccleſ 4 12 profit thereby rather aſhamed heauen ſhould tie together faſter hell tieth vngodly yea let bee aſhamed ſay euen ſmalleſt trifle conceit one againſt another enough eſtrange often falleth ſet defiance betwixt themſelues till wicked laugh profeſſion ſcorne whereas theſe curſed league malignant hold ſometime longer though bound together rotten thread wicked policie reneweth except lord diſioyne ſeparate eſpecially concord agreement oppoſing innocent ſeeing god curſeth ſcatters theſe combination wicked faſt vnite ſtrengthen themſelues pſalm 2 ſaying pſalm 2 1 iacoh simeon leui curſed rage curſed counſell let geneſ 〈…〉 godly ſo much feare banding faſt knitting themſelues together looke patiently till curſe moth conſume iehoſhaphat 2 chron 20 ſeeing moab ammon seir confederate deſtroy 〈…〉 feared firſt ſaw ſword againſt till made riddance comforted euen myſterie late matchleſſe treaſon deepe ſecrecie carried ſtrongly complotted firmely agent thereof vnited euen firmely oth vow sacrament abuſed might knit lord bleſſed euer name ſent ſpirit diuiſion betweene detected diſcouered ſaid lord ſent euill ſpirit betwixt wee doct 2 may note though god author euill ſome would perhaps ready gather yet ſinne wicked hidden heart neuer ſo ſecret bringeth forth pleaſure let breake commandement ruling ouerruling ſame nouriſh themſelues doe giue vent repentance may euer iuſtly feare doe ſometime truly find water pent breakes violently ſome place euen ſo ſinne intertained note men heart ſhall one time breake ſhame liues ſtinke dunghill riſeth sunne aſſure ſelues doth ſinne proceed god alſo diuiſion betwixt may note god ſuffers doct 3 diuiſion among wicked euill ſpirit way leade puniſh leaud fellowſhip reuenge ſinne part make others executioner yet oh ſweet libertie thought inioy fellowſhip ſuch ſee thatcht houſes simile ſtand cloſe together though fence violence weather time yet one fire ſerueth haſten conſumption ſo knot ſo wickedly knit betwixt men laſteth bringeth grant ſome benefit confederate lord hath diſſolued band greateſt vnion turnes moſt deadly enmitie diuiſion brother prou 18 19 ſtronger braſen barres palace citie gate firſt grudge ſecretly conceiued nouriſhed iealouſies ſuſpitions exaſperated daily iniuries till breake hatred end extremitie theſe thing commonly ſeene beholdeth god iuſtice therein thereby flayted feared hauing thing doe ſuch made wiſe lay better foundation amity friendſhip furthermore god would haue blood innocent verſ 24 ſonnes gedeon reuenged vpon abimelech men shechem hee teacheth v hee reuenge innocent cauſe ſo made blood abel cry vengeance lord bleſſe bleſſe geneſ 12 3 curſe curſe greater perſons wrong done god pay home guiltie tranſgreſſion ſpite againſt lord annointed ſtricken lawfull king god faithfull miniſters cauſe ſaith touch mine annointed doe prophet harme pſalm 105 15 therefore thoſe runnagate ieſuites roote kil chriſtian prince ſubuert kingdomes ſo farre lieth hath lord branded mark perpetual infamy iuſt diſpleaſure gallowes though brazen faced hardhearted cannot meanes brought repentance iudas hath left behind ſufficient teſtimony wofull eſtate thoſe hurt innocent word theſe deſpaire perplexed conſcience haue ſinned betraying innocent matth 27 3 blood therefore ſeeth ſo many ſtudie hurt ſuch would liue peace murthering robbing oppreſſing vexing harmeleſſe doe cauſe talke euery goe lord threat reuenging bring alſo moſt certainely vpon owne head ſay point haue elſewhere entreated alſo ſaid men shechem ſtrengthen abimelechs doct 2 hand giuing money hire baſe fellowes kill brother ſay ſuch liued citie ſhould haue helped ſettle ſee good order kept yet ſuch euill men euen incouragers furtherers vnto murther ſee city townes ofttimes vile perſons couered vizor honeſt citizen inhabitant worſe account many goe bearing office puniſh beate downe diſordered perſons diſturbers yet themſelues bad noiſome admoniſheth ſuch liue ciuilly townes ſearch themſelues may bee found faithfull alſo reſt opinion conceiued place ſee theſe may farre worſe baſe ofskourings fall hand puniſhed keepe open ſtaines yet another thing bee looked wit heart good alſo point repeate ſame thing handled diſſention ſo hot betwixt brake ciuill warre verſ 25 meanes whereof none could paſſe ſafetie wee cannot ignorant dangerous thoſe time may ſee trouble danger robbing one another high way one vile perſon may raiſe vp may fitly compared firebrand caſt barne corne euen ſuch miſchiefe wrought abimelech one abſolom thoſe caitiffes ſlew two french king ſame may ſaid author gunpowdertreaſon torture great ſuch deſperate perſons diuelliſh ſhould bee cut firſt bee found ſuffered liue doe greater miſchiefe touching benefit peace like publike bleſſings ſee chap 5 elſe hiſtory verſ 26 gaal ſonne ebed came brother went shechem men shechem put confidence 27 therefore went field gathered grape trod made merry went houſe god eate drinke curſed abimelech 28 gaal ſonne ebed ſaid abimelech shechem ſhould ſerue hee ſonne ierubbaal zebul officer serue rather men hamor father shechem ſhould wee ſerue 29 would god people vnder hand would put away abimelech ſaid abimelech encreaſe thine army come firſt occaſion abimelechs shechemites deſtroying one ſenſe another next occaſion miſchiefes followed ſet downe namely thus incenſed one againſt fall open warre ſet forward came way one gaal men shechem hired captaine againſt abimelech helpe went gathered grape otherwiſe durſt haue done made merry curſed abimelech boaſter gaal hardned againſt affirming thraſonically would put downe men shechem knew scripture ſets downe whence came behauiour bewraied ſay knew fooliſhly receiue reſt vpon ſtranger though boaſter know madneſſe take truſt though ſtranger yet boaſter howſoeuer ſinne great intertaining yet indeed god hereby haſtned deſtruction ſhould light vpon ſuch captaine themſelues ſuch ſouldiers might well goe together wonder boaſters ambitious ſo eaſily accorded although giuen vp themſelues would haue truſted thus men shechem prouided themſelues abimelech like followes men shechem fooliſh dangerous doct prooued ouerthrow ſo giueth warning receiue beware reſting vpon rotten hold broken ſtaues ſort many men deceiued groſſely shechem folly caſt welfare vpon boaſter pſalmiſt mentioneth ſome theſe ſaith put trust pſalm 107 chariot ſome horſes prophet ieremie teaching men ſhunne ier 9 23 ſawe danger ſaith let wiſe man glory wiſdome ſtrong ſtrength rich rich let glorieth glory hee knoweth ſaith lord may reſt men much leſſe weaker ſtaies ſome doe preſent eſtate peace wealth habitation wife friend health like ſame prophet ſaith curſed maketh fleſh arme truſteth ier 17 5 man heart departeth god prophet dauid crieth ſaying truſt earthly prince cannot ſaue others themſelues pſalm 146 3 king aſa ſaid becauſe thou truſtedſt king aram 2 chron 16 7 lord hence foorth thou ſhalt haue warre god onely truſt muſt repoſed salomon ſaith otherwiſe may vſe man helpe prou 3 • pſalm 127 2 meanes vaine vſe doctrine ſhould retaine danger trouble hope confidence god promiſes ſlippery helpes comfort thereafter wee reſt appeareth clearely greater matter doe ſo doctrine hath diuerſly occaſioned one thing adde anſwere ſuch might ſay theſe shechemites ſhift ſhroud themſelues vnder ſome ſuch like defence therefore blame ſought ſhelter againſt tyrant could get anſwer ſeeke ſuccour againſt vſurper lawfull ſo meanes according vſurper ſet vp themſelues neither greater violence therefore ſay might thanke themſelues brought wilfull bondage vpon themſelues indeed caſe ſtood either muſt fence citie people brought ſnare led againſt abimelech elſe yeeld periſh curſed thing men either vſe vile perſons patron deſperate quarrel elſe bring themſelues point might come vpon one ſought waited deſtroy therefore let men defend ſins plea driuen ſtraight haue remedy fall vpon ſmaller inconuenience may auoid greater brought wretched choice vpon god alloweth child walke large vnder gouernment keepes ſuch ſtreights theſe cooped ſo narrow roome surely owne ſinne men haue liberty wearie till beſtreightned driuen ſhifts therefore defence bad crime ſelfe men haue fallen extremitie one ſinne muſt redeeme auoid another doe euill ſuppoſed good may come humble themſelues firſt ſinne caſt themſelues vpon god hand iſtue danger ſo auoid ſecond dauids example excellently ſheweth 2 sam 24 17 hauing ſinned ſhould ſcorne beare ſhame eſpecially extremitie auoid bee onely puniſhment bodily cōmonly ſtreight men ſeeke ſhun ſin doubly prouoking god indirect meanes al ſaue themſelues frō momentany trouble danger indeed two euils temporall leſſer may choſen auoid greater two euils morall mortall ſinnes much leſſe one temporall euill morall meanes adulterer may ſay haue way ſhift one buy ſhame except would bee ſhamed euer thou wofull man thou haue deſerued beare god haue laid vpon thee church micha ſaying beare puniſhment mich 7 7 becauſe haue ſinned thinke ſuch ſhift eſcape ſhame guiltie vnleſſe thou fall greater without recouerie shechemites ſo afraid abimelech durſt gather verſ 7 grape harueſt therefore hired gaal helpe ſee ſedicious boaſter deceiuer conduct goe foorth field great laſciuiouſnes reioyced temple curſed abimelech among manifold diſcomforts warre place obſerue let one numbred yt men thereby cut 〈…〉 doct earth harueſts liued ere ſpoyled farre life death yet worſe death lie feare pinched penurie could goe doores reape fruites till made ſhift gaal yet neither ſafe houſes theſe beſides many like effect warre moſt frearefull ſuch time brought againſt • warre ſet vpon man would thinke knoweth ſuch preſerued like ſore oppreſſions would binde themſelues liue ſubmit themſelues god dutie moſt willingly doubt ſo would moſt readily couenant doe vnder ſuch oppreſſions vpon condition might obtaine promiſe deliuerance ſheweth good cauſe ſhould doe ſo ſay marke men doe thus ſmaller trouble ſee ala contrary remember ſaid pſalme lord ſmote people ſought yea ſought pſal 78 34 earely found came triall falſe heartednes vnfaithfulnes vtter griefe knowing commonly offended wee doe heare ſuch thing meane warre throughout booke ſtories ſee long continuance peace wee ſay doe weigh greatnes benefit ſuch vnthankfulnes ioyned blockiſhnes abuſe peace ſenſualitie thus deale god many thing hauing oft obſerued bewailed follie men place ſeeing followeth expreſſely reſcued gaal gathered fruites note hence behauiour therein thinke verilv moſt brutiſh vtterly vnbeſeeming ſuch euer ſerued lord like mad men eate drink made merrie without meaſure curſing enemy praiſing idol teacheth v hard ſay whether 1 sam 30 16 wicked pitied miſeries calamity deliuerances held ſome awe note feare ſet free moſt diſſolute vnruly offenſiue exceſſe therein impatience vnquietnes calamity greatly pitied although bodily eſtate lamented greatly yet farre worſe ſoule manifeſt breaking ſo fearefully damnably manner ſinne greedineſſe inſtances hereof condition many ſuch haue ſome religion becauſe note haue ſtore ſeeth euer moſt looſe ſecure forgetfull moſt heart eaſe badder ſort manifeſt quailed croſſes held downe much euill bee heart eaſe oh looſenes ſawcines quarrelling laſhing needleſſe great expences rioting ſwearing may ſeene ſcorning thoſe ſeeke reclaime though ſuch ought heare owe duty vnto therefore ſhould readily heare whereas regard nothing proſperitie curſe bleſſe one mouth may ſay almoſt one breath leaue theſe let beſt looke well themſelues herein meane eſtates may yeeld another manner fruite peace proſperitie bee carefull haue good conſcience argument ſeeing much ſpoke occaſion former proceſſe ſtorie ceaſe ſay proceed theſe two gaal shechemites hauing heartned helped forward defiance abimelech feaſting iollitie great meanes yea oyle flame prouoke proud ſtomacke man well heat meate drinke preſumptuouſly aske abimelech may ſay truly verſ 28 doe wicked make end goe one ſinne another one runneth downe hill ſtaieth reſt boaſt againſt defie deface abſence teacheth vnmeaſurablenes vnſaciablenes wicked doct ſinning goe one another neuer willing make end ſtead repenting former adde greater ſinnes vnto courſe harden heart manner euill bee able greedineſſe ſo grow paſt feeling vnto vtter impenitencie many haue done euill haue ſome remorſe brother goſpell obeyed father ſending work matth 21 31 vineyard refuſed hee afterward bethought himſelfe went prophet ieremy wondred offended relented ierem 8 5 6 men goe one ſinne another caſt vp gorge almoſt paſt hope reclaime eſau ſold birthright ſigne eternall life one would haue thought ſinned gen 25 31 fearefully enough ſo yet could ſtay muſt alſo iuſtifie wicked fact hee done ſaying valew birthright vnto ſinne reſted onely ſuch haue ſpoken wee feare god might ſure could committed v ſee peter taken ſnare ſinne againe twice denied maſter ſwearing curſing himſelfe knew ready haue done hundred time occaſion offered may beſt v feare falling thus giuing place little ſome thing taking libertie goe againſt conſcience next way goe wee haue heard beſt remedie againſt may preuent ſo farre ſuch courſe rather feare trembling make end ſaluation philip 2 14 haue already fallen ſoone riſe gaal wiſheth king muſt know men shechem one minde meaning phraſe ſpeech vſeth ſaying ſhall giue people mine hand verſ 29 like ye may reade pſalme giue wing doue pſal 55 6 oh euen ſame abſolom wiſhed caſe much like abimelechs oh made iudge land thus 2 sam 15 4 gaal noteth pride ambition baſe fellow boaſting farre ſinnes like abimelech brought paſſe people deſtruction teach v beware ſinne theſe particularly ambitious doct pride boaſting like wrapped vp come full growth irrecouerable miſchiefe committers intertainers ſinnes doe threaten better ſpeedily broken repentance whereunto god deare ſeruants ſubiect pſal 32 10 euen ſome haue tried found ſo alreadie great ſorrowes haue accompanied long time fruite ſuch ſinnes dauid sampſon others ſo remaine taught wiſe auoid carefully beginning occaſions euill ſo ſhall ſure free great woe boaſting ſuperfluitie corrupt proud ſcornefull heart ariſing alway ſome worthineſſe eminencie bare windie conceit ſomewhat ſee body gall full ouerfloweth coloureth face ſimilitude excrement humour inward part tainted outward full breaking ſores ſo pride full ſwelleth breaking heart vtters ſelfe mouth behauiour put caſe ſome excellencie boaſteth doth boaſting beſeeme ſuch man nay doth impeach worthineſſe therefore auoid boaſting let ſoberly thinke vſe god gift inward outward knowing whence receiued naked hee without hee hath borowed himſelfe naked deſtitute neuer humble man boaſter except boaſting paul infirmity gift honour giuer diſgrace enemy god glorie touching particular point ambition preſeruatiue againſt let reader ſee former chapter gedeons refuſing kingdome alſo chapter iothams bramble aſpiring bee king ouer tree therefore end fiftie nine sermon ninth chapter booke ivdges verſe 30 zebul ruler citie heard word gaal ſonne ebed wrath kindled 31 therefore ſent meſſengers abimelech priuily ſaying behold gaal ſonne ebed brother become shechem behold fortifie citie againſt thee 32 therefore ariſe night thou people thee lie waite field 33 riſe early morning ſoone sunne vp aſſault citie people ſhall come againſt thee doe thou canst 34 abimelech roſe vp people night lay waite againſt shechem foure band 35 gaal ſonne ebed went ſtood entring gate citie abimelech roſe vp folke lying waite 36 gaal ſaw people ſaid zebul behold come people toppes mountaines zebul ſaid ſhadow mountaines ſeeme men vnto thee 37 gaal ſpake againe ſaid see come folke downe middle land another band commeth way plaine moonenim 38 zebul ſaid vnto thy mouth ſaid abimelech ſhould ſerue people thou haſt deſpiſed goe pray thee fight 39 gaal went men shechem fought abimelech 40 abimelech purſued fled many ouerthrowne wounded euen vnto entring gate 41 abimelech dwelt aranna zebul thruſt gaal brother ſhould dwell shechem theſe 12 verſes ſhewed broile grew hotter betwixt abimelech men shechem warred fought one againſt whereby deſtruction drew neerer firſt zebul heard boaſting gaal ſent word abimelech therof hee officer gouerne citie abſence gaue aduice thought beſt done ſet downe foure firſt verſes next foure ſhewed abimelech according zebuls counſell came men neere shechem lay wait gaal retinue thus matter went forward deſtruction ouerthrow men shechem abimelech haue ſaid third part chapter foretold verſes following doth clearely appeare laſt foure verſes ſhewed gaal abimelech met together farre gate citie many followed gaal ouerthrowne wounded himſelfe caſt citie let v purſue theſe verſes particularly firſt muſt knowne men shechem hired gaal bee captaine ſo zebul abimelech deputy lieutenant ſet hold people ſubiection rebellion mutiny ſaid firſt zebul could beare inſolency gaal againſt ſumme theſe ſoure verſes ſpeciallic abimelech vnder alſo ſaw bragging ſhamefull inſolent wrath kindled againſt hearing proud word crackes gaal ſore troubled increat ſent word abimelech thereof hence let ſome thing noted one boaſting gaal meere froth word without ſubſtance ſo groſſe zebul ſeruant abimelech could beare wee may ſee ſhamefulneſſe ſinne bragging cracking none abide heare willingly doct theſe ſoure verſes boaſters doe conſider make good ſay pride heart ſpeak ſo get praiſe thoſe heare vrged ſtand word ſhame driuen run away goe word alſo afterwards gaal elſe lord himſelfe diſableth performe boaſt would doe hee benhadad hee braggingly 1 king 20 3 1 sam 23 7 challenged ahab good saul vaunting dauid ſafe enough hand hee incloſed citie gate barres god man enemy boaſting man ſay onely religious euen ingeneous ciuill abhorre ſhame ſuch delight perſwade fit learne better thing practiſe lowlineſſe humilitie ſtead ſuch diſguiſedneſſe bee ſaid zebuls wrath kindled againſt gaals boaſting followeth thing zebul incenſed againſt gaal doct 2 becauſe bragges againſt abimelech maſter therefore ſent word thereof yet ſuch conſent wel grounded loue betwixt ſet zebul ouer city abſence outward fauour ſoone changeth eſpecially betwixt ſuch man ſeemes diſcreeter politicke ſome act zebul could beare defiance gaal gaue againſt abimelech maſter ſay teacheth much leſſe ought chriſtian heare god diſhonoured prince railed bee rebelled againſt popiſh enemy leaud ſubiects heart ſhould riſe againſt ſhould ſpeedieſt manner bewray ſeeke remedie thereof feare law holdeth concealers thereof acceſſaries much conſcience ſake euen naturall child cannot beare heare father reproched therfore blaſphemies againſt god giuen forth atheiſts malicious enemy ſuch thoſe curſed rabſachee againſt moſes chriſt scripture worſhip god ſuch phariſies ſaid man reſtored ſight know iohn 9 24 man meaning ieſus ſinner finally whatſoeuer ſuch many kind fit ſpoken chriſtian eares intolerable yea meaner reproches giuen againſt ought ſuffered ſwearing forſwearing filthie talking like rather ſhould honour god body ſoules god 1 cor 6 20 becauſe hee loueth begat loueth begotten alſo therefore let naturall affection kind god honour deſcend meaneſt saint yea let make eares cheekes glow burne hit ſuch company make game paſtime deride traduce know zealous ſincere preacher profeſſors god holy truth let lord example teach v profeſſeth liefe men ſhould touch apple eie ſo touch holy one wee find ſuch reproches touch v quicke ſearch v ſo ſtep foorth ſtand defence ſuch innocent cauſe ſecretly willingly giue way ſuch ſpeeches diſpleaſed v beare yea brooke wee better falſewitneſſebearers againſt neighbour exod 20 ſhew ſelues ſay weake feeble exod 20 16 may feared none rotten member body feele neither troubled whit hacked lanced wounded torne tongue teeth dogges ſwine therefore dauid called ziphims ſtrangers becauſe falſehood though otherwiſe iſraelites ſo theſe indeed forrenners vnnaturall men another houſhold familie although otherwiſe may outward profeſſion dwelling neighbour brother moreouer faithfull aduertiſing maſter treaſon wiſeſt way oppreſſe teacheth faithfulneſſe betwixt religious doct 3 friend need well witneſſed leſt dutifull loyaltie zebul towards maſter abimelech put downe condemne know ſuch truſtineſſe among chriſtians abideth rare yet ſome particular caſe falles men ſtrangers religion goe farre one another ought prouoke v haue better reaſons ſhew brother ſo eſpecially occaſion offered let innocency faithfulneſſe appeare bee ſeene prou 3 29 alwaies prouide loue bee without diſſimulation ſo may bee ſafely reſted time need depend vpon v rom 12 9 touching dutie faithfulneſſe loue fruit let reader ſee hiſtory caleb elſewhere theſe foure verſes ſhewed abimelech ſtrengthened himſelfe clearing verſ 34 42 aduice zebul officer meſſage ſent prepared foure band men lay waite al night men shechem farre citie gaal comming foorth ſame citie goe heare ſeeke abimelech pretending would ſet vpon inuade zebul came together though ſubtiltie conſpiracie intended end gaal might ſuſpect nothing earely morning yet cleare light gaal hauing ſome ſhimering abimelechs band ſcouts ſoone ſuſpecting feared hee bewraied much zebul hee ſaw men lie waite yet knowing nothing zebul ſide bare hand draw feared without cauſe tooke ſhadow mountaines men vnlike farre dawning morning vnto gaal replied otherwiſe afraid indeed meane light clearely comming gaal abimelech neerely approching one toward army gaal could goe backe conuenience hee gladly would haue done whereupon zebul caſt bragges teeth gaal challenged contemptuouſly ſpoken ſaying abimelech ſo muſt need goe forward comming neere abimelechs band ſore chaſed gaals returning toward citie ſhelter thence ſhut zebul meanes whereof abimelech preuailed exceedingly ſlew many men shechem ſo iothams prophecy began bee verified ſhould deſtroy note ſome part ſtory firſt readineſſe doct verſ 34 abimelech put execution zebuls counſell may ſee ſelues taxed double fault firſt ſhooke al tediouſneſſe toile bare vncertaine hope preuailing againſt gaal enemy whereas hauing ſure hope bleſſing plentifull wee obey lord obeying great reward yet ſlow pſalm 19 11 backward whereby verifie prouerb lyon way ready faint iuſt reproch bad men ill caſe prou 22 13 ſhould forwarder good hauing yet ſo great large incouragement reward promiſed v behalfe former hiſtorie haue largely ſpoken example iuda simeon 1 chapter ſince diuers occaſions ſecond thing bee noted abimelech zebul officer diſdained aduiſed furniſh himſelfe againſt gaal yet zebul hauing familier talke hee might haue like enough haue vnfaithfull abimelech maſter ſetteth doct 2 many v ſchoole learne refuſe better aduice matter greater waight nay wee ſcorne oftentimes bee counſelled though good beſt thing eſpecially inferior folly naaman committed done owne vtter vndoing 2 king 5 13 body ſoule bethought himſelfe taken better aduice firſt receiued prophet anſwere ſo ill part loſt dauid hearkning counſel woman nay bleſſed god highly himſelfe afterward ſuch fooliſh 1 sam 25 32 pride men onely matter world euen ghoſtly heauenly thinke bee vtter diſcredit ſhame confeſſe ourſelues defectiue vnable mannage euery buſineſſe pertaines v well ſufficiently whereas knoweth euery foole eaſily runne himſelfe breath hee need wiſe man ſhould ſtop bad courſe ſettle himſelfe againe good order frame without helpe counſell nay prodigall licentious perſons imbezle weaken eſtate credit health good poſteritie oftentimes ten wiſe men turne hand reſtore redreſſe againe caſe ſoule indangered deeply satan hell among hundred ſuch willing aduiſed time till thrift ſtocke hope helpe quite paſt recouerie indeed bottome yea worſe men aske enquire thrift sobrietie diſcretion oh much better ſuch haue admitted counſell againſt irrecouerable miſchiefe counſell euent counſell either lamentable pitie bitter rebuke wiſhed folly bound heart youthfull rehoboams although euen ſhall finde ſharpe enough taught miſtreſſe experience well ancienter yeeres whoſe commendation ought bee ſhew foorth example ſtaiednes wiſedome younger ſort neither able aduiſe themſelues willing aduiſed remaines euen heathen poet condemne miſerable therefore glad counſell ſoule body make much time may come precious deſired want body turned priſon beggerie rag ſoule many grieuous plunge hell paul aduice ill pilot reiected end become ſhould haue ſcorned beholding act 27 meane yt ſailed remember therefore wiſe man ſaith eſtabliſh thought counſell peace happineſſe haue ſaid example gedeons haſtie purſuit medianites though earely vp yet appeareth ſtorie neuer doct one theſe verſes neere end teach v earely riſing late going bed care may taken proſper long neither abimelech long yet greater ouerthrow pregnant example hereof iehoram father ahab another 1 king 22 1 king 39 c intending voyage againſt enemy aram moab hauing rebelled failed outward preparation politike deuices ouerthrow enemy prouided themſelues men munition confederated themſelues ſtrongly againſt neuer conſidering thēſelues rebelled againſt greater lord euen lord hoaſts went headily fearing controlement nay thinking god pinned yea bound one found coſt hee went worke againſt edge deſperatly though ſpared time notable ruine came paſſe afterward yet hee found himſelfe plunged driuen extremitie want water threatned loſſe beaſts owne people deſtruction enough proue played foole getting two king ſide god ſhut ſought laughed ſcorne enemie oh heart people according deſire therfore thriue neither proſper would mad men impatient outragious ſpeede better haue good ſucceſſe praiſe owne wiſedome good hap fortune ſtead god looke largely handling point likelihood danger aroſe appeared vnto looking ſoone able diſcerne dawning perceiued band companie men farre better diſcerne afraid ſo ſaid much zebul enemie thereby bewraied daſtardlines vnto heard great brag boaſting againſt abimelech whereby wee may cleerely doct glaſſe obſerue propertie diſpoſition boaſters prate bragge great matter effect ſmall rather none like benhadad triumphed ouer ahab arrogating himſelfe glad ſend men left two mightie army rope neckes ſue life owne vnto ſame ahab exceeding great ſhame ſmall hope obtaine example laieth boaſter colour noting one vainglorious frothie humour vndertakes great matter performes nothing leſſe therefore ſtead honour purchaſeth himſelfe ſhame folly commonly boaſter bodie triall like vnto torrent ſtanding water winter ſwelleth ſimilitude runneth maine vſe ſommer drought ſhould coole refreſh ſhould ſtand man ſtead faileth drie impotent nature man boaſteth gift god inward outward interuerting holding backe thankes god preſumptuous bragging ſelfe moſt part theſe gift rather ſuppoſed indeed boaſter therefore triall come thraſo bragger ridiculous beholder amaziah boaſted valour greatly prouoked iehoaſh without cauſe needed hee ſped thereafter ſore foiled late miſcreants meane powdertraytors boaſted deuice almoſt vpſhot god man ſay letter haue decreed ouerthrow theſe engliſh heretikes c god decreed contrary turned boaſting profeſſion trade another ſelling deare buying cheape croſſing aduerſarie matching c boaſting hath ſo ſmall acquaintance men thinke yea need man prouoked little bragge pride bluſh ſay better though haue ſo good purſe thou yet haue proud ſtomacke thou thine heart euen thus may ye heare poore man contending rich earth earth earth conſider thou iercm 22 29 braggeſt euen thy glory thy ſhame thine owne mouth ſhall condemne thee profeſſeth reſiſt proud boaſt worſe matter ſay quench zeale theſe preciſe one 1 pet 5 5 terme honeſt men wearie purſue till haue made eate word renounce preciſenes pſal 2 pſal 2 3 theſe ſay neere lord deſpight diſappointment reſt therefore ſcoffeth boaſts ſuch enemy caſting brag teeth ſaying tell tower gate ſee walles sion c ſhould ſay haue caſt downe theſe looke well conſider yee ſhall finde ſtone thereof remoued bad member wee ſee tongue boaſteth great thing ſmall purpoſe therefore make vſe hereof let wiſe ſtrong rich boaſt ierem 9 23 wiſedome ſtrength wealth hee boaſt let boaſt knoweth ſaith lord boaſt ſhall note feare arrogancie ſeeing knowledge god euer ſeaſoned humilitie loue let v conſider ſinne boaſting ſeldome goeth without vſurping god honour man ſelfe lying moſt capitall crime againſt firſt ſecond table groſſe rich man boaſt worth wealth man borow man iob 31 25 great ſummes boaſt well monied abſurd able ſay need vtter thy well vſing thy gift thou regardeſt much elſe thy craking gift themſelues ſhall witneſſe againſt thee giuing vp thy account yea rather let beſt ſay v lord belongeth ſhame confuſion face haue ſmall cauſe conſumed lam 3 22 rather boaſt thing aboue reach abſurd ill beſeeming euery way eſpecially odious dangerous vſed againſt people god iezabel againſt elia rabſakee 1 king 19 2 railing heathen againſt good king ezechias men boaſting 2 king 18 27 threatning diſcourage true ſeruice god haue ſaid gaals boaſting zebuls anſwere zebul abimelech ſaw boaſtings gaal againſt verſ 36 38 abimelech ſent word thereof heard hee might prepare himſelfe come forward fight ſo heard himſelfe fleſhed matched another kinde wit ſubtiltie diſſimulation yet ſpake faire ſeemed friendly wee ſee hee went citie end might ſuſpect nothing yet giuen warning abimelech lie waite againſt time hee ſhould come foorth readie ſet vpon middeſt feare danger gaal zebul ſubtilly deceiued bin cauſe feare egging drawing ſubtilly ſo could ſhame yet full faine would haue broken away beſides wee may note diſſimulations lying ſlie ſubtilties world euen among ſuch pretend great loue friendſhip ſeene zebul point haue ſpoken alreadie booke ſo wee may ſee men euill quality matched doct verſ 58 meete together gaal marke wee may ſee one boaſter another diſſembler ſubtill vnderminder third quarrellet contentious liuer tainted ſundrie dangerous bad quality apoſtle ſpeaketh theſe ſay liue deale 2 tim 3 2 together therfore great goodneſſe god one deuoureth another yea lord ſhould bridle vpholding peace church commonwealth could poſſiblie dwell together liue conuerſe one ſtand ſort doe ſo contrary bad quality muſt need fire water deſtroy one another whereas good magiſtrate faithfull miniſter aſſiſtant chriſtians doe labour throw downe workes darkneſſe diuell ſo bridle rage turbulent vnruly ſort people herein may ſpoken griefe oppoſition againſt pietie goodneſſe ſo great although lord working miracle meanes ſomewhat bee done incouragement reſtraining yet little reſpect might deſired looked becauſe ſuch good inſtruments moſt faint fight lord battels againſt ſo fierce ſubtile many enemy like prouidence god noted touching abimelechs hiring vaine fellowes vpon fourth verſe chapter may adde lord doth vſe one wicked perſon deuoure oppreſſe ſo owne people may enioy peace ſafetie ſee politicke diſſembler zebul right picture ſubtile machiauilians adaies ſmoothes flatters gaal ſerues humour one would make fellow drunke drawes leaudly drinke pot pot till quite turned ouer pretended ſhew friendſhip ſo intent plot betray abimelech might meane ſeaſon take ſure effect secondly hence let v note one ſinner oppoſite anothers doct 2 drift purpoſes goeth worke defeating enemy euen thus prouerb ſaith one naile driues another haue way go beyond ſhall vſe weapon skilfulleſt moſt miſchieuouſly fetch wile one budget arrowes one quiuer either ſubtiltie force weapon ſligh treacherous achitophel runnes budget cruell malicious efau quiuer lie point ſhall draw ſubtilleſt cunningeſt fetch ſhall take thence ſharpeſt deadlieſt arrow ſhoot ſame meane diuels bow skill ſhall ouerreach ouerſhoote therein prouides artillery ſure gainer part ſoeuer loſeth hee prouide kingdome ſhall increaſe euen oppoſition ſubiects fight faſt doe againſt zebul gaal ſerue two maſters one ſenſe one abimelech shechem one boaſting ſeekes outface conniuence diſſembling ſeekes root loe meane ſerue one maſter diuell hee reioyces much ſpectacle ioab abner beholding young men play cruelly called good earneſt cut 2 sam 2 14 others throat men curſed doings trading thus ſinne would conſider themſelues ſure goe walles forfeit ſoules whoſe engins tooles appugne yea conſidered quarrel ſerue end make note pageant diuell laugh could ſee iſſue hee winneth winneth hell hee loſeth loſeth heauen gaines onely satan oh would quaile dampe leaudneſſe put caſe ſame ſhip vpon ſea two men walke contrary ſteppes one croſſing motion doth ſhip carrie one way nill reſiſt simile motion ſhip wherein ſaile euen ſo ſinne hath one motion though ſinners mooue diuerſly let ſtriue againſt neuer ſo eagerly muſt yeeld one motion ſinne wil bring hell prodigall man walkes quite aduerſe ſteppes couetous ſteps tend hell one great man ſeekes ouerthrow another hee ſubtill take vantage ambicious lay ſuch traine following ambicious plot incurreth danger law ſo ſupplants wiſdome one folly helliſh cloſer deeper one aboue ſooner may ſubuert ſubtiller goeth beyond length ouerreach one man vnderhand worketh miſchiefe againſt another againe vnſheaths tongue againſt former like put downe latter owne ſinne faſt vndoe buyer would match ſeller diſſembling ſeller would coſen buyer boaſting praiſing ware indeed deceiue themſelues aſwell vſe teach men thinke themſelues ſafe warrantable becauſe reſiſt euill except diſlike hate alſo may ſinne faſt reſiſting allowing againe let teach men abhorre eſtate admitteth peace ſound conſent vnitie fountaine confuſion embrace profeſſion practiſe commeth god order vniforme meanes end vniteth embrace league loue peace thoſe better minded let beware errour wicked let thinke libertie hereby reſtrained becauſe may match vngodly kind play cretians cretians fox fox profeſſion bought price ſerue lord body ſpirits indeed diſſwaded practiſe anſwere themſelues ſweare coſen lie temporiſe world could liue euery one would ouerreach ſhould greatly diſaduantage themſelues forgoing liberty let godly oppoſe innocencie wiſdome ſpirit ſubtiltie leaud quality wicked cannot match thereby let willingly take foile ſubmit themſelues god rather returne euill euill vrging gaal zebul alleaging owne word ſaid verſe 39 abimelech made goe forth againſt ful ſoone turned face away fled may ſee god ſhamed bragges euen among men shechem hee made boaſting well might take ſhame raſh moſt vnwiſe aduenturing ſet vp head guide ſaw nothing bragges thus doth god daily put ſhame boaſters ſuch aduance cleaue vnto boaſter make flouriſh ſome baſe vnſetled perſons admire applaud god doth moſt iuſtly ſuffer doe one deceiue bee deceiued accordingly haue prouoked yet great mercy doth humble bring repentance cannot ſhame ſee haue done although ſee pitie better thereby make vſe thereof runne ſome bad courſe made openly aſhamed ſpeake well giue watchword bethinke themſelues betimes taking better courſe alſo great comfort wary aduiſed ſhun auoide ſuch deceiuers baſe flouriſhers doe take like heed care keepe themſelues euery euill way returne doct verſe 39 40 gaal driuen ſo cowardly flie made ſo great bragges courage manhood ſee many doe ſhew themſelues bee triall without grace little difference doe onely meane hereby groſſe great bragger haue ſpoken already others alſo kind though counted lower degree example many may ſee ſhew great liking good thing profeſſe forwardneſſe religion diſlike others doe ſo beforehand themſelues compariſon many yet cleere either haue ſmall vſe religion beſt many haue diſgrace condemne elſe reuolt time faire ſhewes thereby doe openly bewray nothing froth found ſmall cauſe griefe beſt make great profeſſion yet many ſhould deceiue themſelues others ſtead whereof let god true ſeruants feare alwaies bleſſed prou 28 14 doe infirmity vntowardneſſe feele giue occaſions thinke better walke vprightneſſe hart toward god neglect honour 2 cor 10 6 ſhall haue opportunitie giuing good example others gaal captaine men shechem fled many verſe 41 fell ſlaine according lord foretelling ſin againſt gedeons houſe boaſting defender himſelfe tooke vpon caſt citie brother ſo much remaine let learne leſſon ſhunne auoide boaſters wit neither put themſelues vnder doct ſhadow fleſh euen ſo ſhall ſerued theſe men shechem repoſe confidence man earthly thing doth cleerely ſhew beginning deſtruction men shechem argument handled need repeate hath ſpoke vpon ſundry occaſions heretofore gaal prou 11 2 ſee roſted got hunting gaal thought crake boaſting winde himſelfe brother men shechem verſe 41 abimelech hee knew hee got kingdome tyrannie hee thought liker many preuaile one although commonlie commeth paſſe men ſtabliſh themſelues flattery coſoning yet otherwiſe hee fruſtrate hope ſee caſt abimelech ſo god dealeth ofttimes doct 2 though many vnworthy perſons lift vp head build neſt high againſt dart miſfortune call pride extortion crueltie boaſting c yet god many time hindreth courſe ſuch throweth downe ſoone broke ill courſe iudas matth 27 4 1 king 2 32 2 sam 3 27 2 sam 17 23 tooke rich ioab abner achitophel neere king whoſe day liued yet time caſt downe greatnes glory oh hath done like latter time ſince ſuch wil need darken obſcure god glory goſpell owne pleaſure ſetting vp themſelues may ſee owne eye alſo applauded haue receiued due reward god hath caſt downe ſhame yet worſt behind abideth ſuch whatſoeuer change meet meane ſeaſon beſt ſtate ſin bringeth life haue mentioned let feare godly taſte dainty ſuch count leſt eue reaching geneſ 3 hand doe taſte alſo puniſhments ſuch wiſe wiſh many ſtripes neuer done ſo verſe 42 morrow people went field told abimelech 43 tooke people diuided three band laid waite field looked behold people come citie hee roſe vp againſt ſmote 44 abimelech band ruſhed forward ſtood entring gate citie two band ran vpon people field ſlew 45 abimelech fought againſt citie day hee tooke citie ſlew people therein deſtroyed citie ſowed salt 46 men tower shechem heard entred hold houſe god berith 47 told abimelech men shechem gathered together 48 abimelech gate vp mount zalmon people abimelech tooke ax cut downe bough tree tooke bare ſhoulder ſaid vnto folke yee haue ſeene doe make haſt doe like 49 people alſo cut downe euery man bough followed abimelech put hold ſet hold fire 50 men tower shechem died alſo thouſand men woman forementioned ſlaughter holding gaal citie iſraelites shechem thought among themſelues would ſumme verſe 46 auenged abimelech ſeemeth went citie purſue neuer conſidered puniſhment ſuſtained already raſh putting themſelues vnder vaineglorious boaſter gaal vnaduiſedly followed quarrell vnderſtanding tooke aduantage attempt ſo diſpoſed band ſouldiers hee ſet two take thoſe came forth citie ſlew hee another band ruſhed entrance citie hauing fought againſt whole day took ſlew people deſtroyed citie ſowed ſalt men shechem gone citie walke doe clearing verſe 42 ſome buſineſſe ſome perhaps would thinke abimelech ſhould haue needed prepare two three band armed men ſet vpon ſcatteringly thoſe vnarmed comming forth worke gone vpon pleaſure gained haue gone forth band againſt perſons cleare therefore ſaid moſt certaine went warlike manner fight abimelech though went without gaal captaine much prouoked incenſed loſſe neighbour abimelech ſlaine day many heated much ſpite raſhneſſe deſire reuenge rather good aduiſedneſſe went worke driuen put ſhifts thought ſomewhat muſt doe either muſt ouerthrow elſe ſaw hee would ſurelie root come word god iotham doct gathered generally verſe 46 might fulfilled ſee deſperate ſhifts men driuen falſehood crueltie raſhneſſe vaine confidence man like ſinnes wiſe man would looke better end ſuch doings god brought vpon trouble innocencie hee would haue taught beare whatſoeuer like haue followed runne vpon ſwords point therefore ſought fight abroad waited ſet vpon men citie deſtroyed beſt end ſinne bringeth vpon committers thus wilfulneſſe ſtomacke ſtubborneſſe bring many deſtruction contrary minded peace contention whoring drunkenneſſe riot doe like kind ſeeme bee ſafeſt freeſt danger ſort may looke better fruit end euill doings ſhame ſorrow miſerable death though enemy theſe men shechem found whether bee bed wrought owne hand one repentance breake euill courſe god ſeruants behold ſee wofull end euill doings bring many yet iolitie thought themſelues note wiſe men others fooles walked innocencie vprightneſſe ſay god ſeruants ſee ſhall praiſe highly followed better courſe god direction euen ſay ſee god threat executed vpon euill doer told ſhould ſo middeſt proſperitie iolitie come ſhall ſee good cauſe haue incouragement hold chriſtian courſe turne neither right hand left although ſhall ſee pietie good conſcience iuſtled walles ſcorned yet ſhal worſt day theſe practiſe farre better beſt ſetting matter note time commeth ſhall ſmart ſhall god ſeruants reioyce owne ſinceritie innocencie let reader looke backe former chapter inlarge point adding thereto hath noted touching ſinne iudgement succoth penuel followeth proceeding laying foorth ouerthrow verſe 42 46 ſtill continued men shechem abimelech might force goe dwell ſafely houſe arnmah farre shechem power weakned gaal thruſt zebul yet roſe vp againſt haue heard ſtomack poſſibly might way reuenged ſo told abimelech turned deſtruction ſo citie alſo appeareth theſe foure next verſes reade text lord hauing purpoſed ouerthrow thus goe forward hath many way execute iudgments threatned vpon enemy iuſt cauſe aſtoniſh reſt began formoſt ala counſell god direct waite time follow fellowes like iudgement euen ſo god ſometimes ſweepes away companie bad men euill doct 2 theſe verſes worker ſome one place hee whole kingdomes ioſhuas time made people poſſeſſe inhabit sometime keepeth vnder waſteth enemy degree one another noted ſpace abimelechs raigne ſame point hath handled marke ſhall finde though hee giue ſcope libertie time hee doth may repent meane looking ſuch thing ſay mark ſhall ſee god either beginneth blow vpon proſperitie eaſt wind note spring beginneth nip hold leaues comming similitude foorth elſe great froſt doth kill ſo doth ſuddenly ſend deſolation vpon one way time come therefore let ſeruant god feare diſmaied greatnes pride ſuch ſmall time glorie iollitie ſhall vaniſh ſhall ſeene greater ſurely cut eccleſ 5 8 hope lay glorie duſt oh righteous could praiſe god hee hath kept thoſe time danger within bound ſuffering groſſely reach hand iniquitie haue ſeene ſuch workes god ſhewed enemy euer bee firme couenant keeping god theſe thing thus brought killing ſo many doct 3 former verſes men shechem thing ſo vnlikely firſt making abimelech king ſhall amiſſe conſider little ſpoile men ſo great yet ſo ſmall likelihood thereof till lord ſent euill ſpirit betwixt abimelech would haue ſaid time agreement loue betwixt ſhould haue growne point become vtter enemy ſo neerely ioyned knit together amitie friendſhip could thus alienated vttermoſt defiance one promiſed abimelech aboue reſpected preferred would haue ſaid ſhould hardlieſt handled yea deſtroyed wee muſt vnderſtand two cauſes hereof one riſing one loue wicked curſed bound together rotten band wrath god burning like fire brake conſumed theſe band whereby hee raiſed euill ſpirit betwixt deſtroying let wiſe bee inſtructed hereby men theſe companion friend euill linked together feare god loue goodneſſe fellowſhip hold long likelihood ſhewes ſoeuer continuance thereof euils compact framed deadlier violent ſhall breach accompanied wicked practiſes yet euen ſecret moth ſelfeloue priuy pride ſeeking commoditie therby ground agreement fellowſhip euen wil conſume moth doth garment worke great difficultie beſt intended loue euen betwixt good chriſtians held firme kept vnbroken muſt renuings couenants oft time betwixt little enough diuell ſo ſets raiſe make diuiſion among brother good note welfare happineſſe knit together brotherly loue ſaith sauiour hereby ſhall men know ye diſciples yee loue one another men brother euill neerely knit together becauſe ioh 13 35 ioyne bad cauſe ye haue heard god ſentence ſuch agreement alreadie ſhall ſurely come naught betwixt abimelech men shechem vnlikely ſoeuer ſhall ſeeme ſo time peace loue ſame ſay fellowſhip vnreformed although bee ill end purpoſes entred let haue ſaid make v wiſe ſeeking loue friendſhip one another occaſion fitly offered end sixtieth sermon ninth chapter booke ivdges followeth deſtruction theſe men shechem verſ 46 citie deſtroyed fled double fort caſtle ſtrength euen houſe god baalberith called made couenant therefore hoping ſhould haue ſafe theſe chiefe wiſe men citie abimelech hearing came deſtroyed temple theſe hoped finde eaſe defence holineſſe doct verſ 46 well ſtrength place wee may ſee men haue religion acquaintance god wiſe great ſoeuer poore ſhifts haue prouide ſafetie euen thinke holineſſe place god wood ſtone reliques saint ſome ſuch rotten prop ſhall free trouble feares although ſhould ſeek true god haſte much liker worke good yet heart farre without confidence would helpe euen ſeeking ſhould able deliuer theſe bruiſed reedes ſpiders web much like helpe baal prieſts obtained calling deceiuing people ſuch manner elia cauſed ſlaine euen ſuch helpe doth 1 king 18 40 wilful generation papiſts seminary death greateſt need obtaine themſelues ſuperſtitious votary haue deluded brought ſnare one principall ringleader death conſtrained renounce opinion merit humane ſatisfactions ſinne although loth haue gap opened people ſhame ſo groſſely ſeduced another yet liuing greaterreckoning popiſh church better meane forced confeſſe auoiding perill vainglorie carnall preſumption ſafeſt repoſe man whole confidence onely mercie god chriſt ieſus ſee howſoeuer ſiniſter end ſuppreſſe truth abuſe ſillie proſelites yet cōpelled force conſcience terror death put away lying equiuocating attaine dye hardnes hart wherein liued whē f • lleth otherwiſe thē confeſſe renounce cōceits bruiſed reed vnable ſupport thē commonly vnprofitable themſelues ſo yet ſhould ſerue deterre others venturing reſting ſo boldly vpon vngrounded aſſertions omit third long great account reckoning among people religion viſiting vpon deathbed eare witneſſe ſixe ſeuen place preſent alſo partie ſhortly deceaſing renounced dunghill ſtuffe religion reckoned poperie deceitfull trade particularly chiefe point thereof yet long ſtiffe ſtout defender maintainer thereof oh therefore bleſſed people whoſe god lord iehouah know onely true god hath ſent ieſus chriſt ioh 17 3 eternall life theſe men shechem ſlaine idolatrous temple idoll berith blindnes putting confidence therein ſo ſhall ſerued reſt ſuch proppes ſay ſhal left briar iudas prieſts truſted matth 27 3 let reader looke backe fifth chapter 30 verſe anſwere siſera mother ſelfe wiſe lady recorded ſhall finde point larged ſaid ſlaine temple doll put truſt ſo done abimelech followed matter verſ 47 40 49 purpoſe heard whither fled kindnes men shechem made king promiſed matter thē verſ 2 bone fleſh would regard aboue ſee flatterie end came greater enemie true indeed fell according iotham denounced againſt wit fire ſhould come bramble deſtroy cedar lebanon excuſeth fact abimelech counſell purpoſe god touching deliuerance chriſt death good watchword excuſed iudas traytor prieſts act 2 23 put death good therefore vſe made doctrine euer needfull therefore bee heard regarded namely wee take heed truſt giue credit vnto ſay ſuch wee haue proued faithfull men shechem may teach v raſhly readily truſted deceiuer falſe hearted abimelech sauiour would commit himſelfe ſaid beleeue ioh 2 laſt knew man much leſſe ought doe ſo know much falſehood doubling truſt ignorant prophane hypocrite therefore salomon going neere marke could gaue counſell truſting prou 27 10 men thine owne friend thy father forſake thou c may ſome proofe ſhould made faithfulnes vprightnes firſt reſt vpon eſpecially lie v doe ſo neceſſary gift faithfulnes meane apoſtle requires feruants meaner ſort perſons one two neceſſary duty ſhould diligence without cannot doe duty well may ſee thereby needfull greater matter ſinceritie rare finde according salomon complaineth ſaying ſhall one finde faithfull man paul prou 20 7 2 theſ 3 2 haue faith fruite faith faithfulnes true heartednes ſo ſhould cauſe v begin ſelues vrge heart vprightnes firſt marueile finde others ourſelues may truſted vpon word approue ſelues ſuch would taken obſeruation experience good dealing wee finde thereafter let v giue credit vnto yet meane ſuch good dealing hath learned preaching goſpell ſuch according knowledge ſame vprightnes good dealing men ſhould bee led chuſing companion mariage hearken euery gloſing tongue make faire large promiſes haue deceiued thouſands alſo ſeeking ſeruants haue may child faithfull well religiouſly brought vp ſame care ſhould chuſing executor comeprimitters ſuch would put truſt demanded ſuch ſhall found may truſted matter importance anſwere beſide haue ſaid already euery one aske queſtion muſt firſt begin himſelfe practiſe ſinceritie ſo hee may better complaine want thereof adde ſome call finde worthie goe without although doe hereby excuſe void offer contrary euill meaſure ſay worthy goe without would full gladly finde thoſe deale ſuch carping biting note ſcoffing accuſing preciſenes labour endeuor keepe conſciences pure good many age cannot ſo ſoone perceiue man woman withdraw themſelues ſinnes time bee afraid offend common ſort doe cry preciſians allow none vpright conſcionable way life matter though meete ſuch dealing ſhew ſmall conſcience vprightnes toward god iuſt make others meaſure haue meaſured others salomon ſaith kinde eccleſ 7 teach know vpright hearted man eccleſ 7 23 worth make much ſuch rather diſcourage one example ſhall ſerue cruell landlord cry vnfaithfull tenant hath broken day may runne away rent fault poore tenant dare appeare lord craue differencie cruell lord hath borne hand hath let good peniworth whereas indeede hee hath ſo racked fleeced fitter begge reliefe pay debt farme hauing nothing neere ſufficient owne labour vphold himſelfe ſuch let crie vnfaithfulnes till weary pitie let dead bury dead sauiour ſaith ſerued haue deſerued let reape haue ſowne anſwere let v lament pray againſt ſuch vnfaithfulnes ſo common leaſt let v pray may free hauing doe ſuch vnfaithfull men commonly alſo vnreaſonable leaſt beguiled ere aware abner amaſa ioab except lord giue man wiſedome 2 sam 3 27 20 10 diſcerne cannot alwaies bee auoided beſides leaſt truſt hath found experience let men wiſe repoſe leaſt truſt put precious liquor broken veſſell hauing proued vn • vſe folly venter daſh foot againſt ſtone remember hath hurt v therfore ſay let men truſt ſuch whoſe fidelity truth haue proofe rather cōtrary leaſt may without great detriment themſelues muſt need truſt ſome ſuch let bind ſtrongly ſo let thoſe vndertake ſuretiſhip beware loſe liberty bring themſelues bondage eſtate poſteritie wilfull penurie moſt let chriſtians beware vnder colour loue ſeeke vndermine betray get ſomewhat might tend danger brother wounding owne conſcience ſpeake becauſe many ſilly chriſtians thinke themſelues happy get countenance benefit ſuch ſuperiors knowing benefit vngodly forked bring backe beſtow boner miſchiefe flattering poore men till abiured truth crueltie cauſe salomon admoniſheth well ſuch ſaying deſirous prou 23 3 daintie meates deceiuable meate without inquirie obſeruing beſt manner ſelues others raſhly beleeue euery one ſpeake v faire indeed faire word make fooles faine according prouerb ſay ſo light credit ſend preſent example let looke became ſmooth word faire ſhewes abimelech made theſe men shechem kinſman mother brother repoſed ſuch confidence greater enemie euen ſo neither let theſe looke find better meaſure though may bee laid forth kind fellowſhip among men yet moſt commonly ſeene earthly dealing wherin ſcarcely promiſe kept moſt liuely ſeene marriage note ſolemne kind ioyful beginning haue many ſo might worthily haue prouoked beholder thereof praiſe god reioyce ſuch goodly ordinance ſo like bring foorth ſuch anſwerable fruit thoſe beginning betwixt couple themſelues ſo marrying comming together liking betwixt delightings one another could neuer enough neither might one well anothers ſight continuance longer ſhorter haue theſe turned contrary diſlike wearines hath one another alienating affection croſſing one chiding railing reuiling ſeparating bed board yet muſt need liue together afterward vtter caſting one ſpeake heauineſſe lord chaſtiſements meeting taking hold doe raiſe euen beſt ſubiect wherein ſhould haue promiſed companion one helpe beare burden kind behauiour would preſerue loue doth betwixt ſome others ſpeake ſay theſe correction lord miſchiefe euill corrupt heart falſe raging proud wilfull inconſtant haue wrought betwixt diſguiſed nothing like perſons ſeemed bee firſt meeting oh therefore towards men wee bewray diſeaſe much feared profeſſing repentance god ſecret thing hid men comming word ſacraments need haue vprightneſſe theſe two verſes ſhewed meanes ſlew cutting downe boughes tree bidding men doe verſ 48 49 putting hold ſetting fire till men shechem therein died may ſee force example eſpecially bad touching though haue ſpoken large eſpecially chap 1 end ſinne moſt tribe neglecting lord charge recorded deſire reader turne vnto yet vnto ſo apt occaſion ſomewhat ſay alſo gedeons men followed carrying pitcher lampes great danger feare midianites commendable wicked cruell moſt commonly followed yet denied ſome giue good example would ſome follower alſo meekneſſe humbleneſſe innocencie faithfulneſſe mercy pietie patience like namely rich men would part begin reſt go others deed charitie ſell lower price poore thing deare common price would example mercy harmeleſneſſe gentleneſſe ſuch like hard ſay good might done thus hauing religion holy inſtruction high account louing heartily well eſteeming god people come men wealthier ſort eſpecially whereas might bring many chriſtian practiſe well haue ala cold loue good cauſes ſlow backward therefore deadneſſe vnprofitableneſſe bee ſeene thicke threefold ſhould learne thē diuell labouring cannot make ſorts alike wickedneſſe leaue giue countenance note good thing may bee men bee ſo vnapt learne performe duty aright except ſee good example cannot tell ſet vpon goe euill courſes need none goe therein find way thereto without guide though much fleſhed drawne haue breake ice beſt example giuen let bee rule wee follow otherwiſe follow chriſt doe ſo let perſwade v al zeale forwardneſſe 2 cor 11 1 duty firſt table reuerent receiuing word preached right manner preparing ſelues lord supper ſuch like exerciſe ſo wiſe follow common ſort behauiour practiſe duty men ſecond table let v goe forward vnweariednes alſo curſed abimelech buſineſſe marked one thing another toyleth himſelfe yea without perill life baſe worke one would thinke goe vp mountaine cut downe boughes tree bring necke ſet hold burne good enough thus men toile indanger themſelues pleaſure profit moſt baſe manner though come nothing ſoone loſe hee doe ſorts men poore liuing yet oft faile notwithſtanding whereas meane godlineſſe great rich lieth dead 1 tim 6 perſwaſions brought ſeeke leaſt delighting therein whileſt yet god alloweth time trauell enough thing meet neceſſary example duly come sermon lord supper though might reape ſmall benefit thereby ſo doe accordingly ſit wearie ſleepie preaching word yet moſt part men theſe two action prayer excepted ſhew ſo much reſemblance religion whole life beſide oh euen god faithfull ſeruants grow many like point ſhewing much vnto wardneſſe word sacrament yet haue approched great reuerence chearefulneſſe former time men asked endure ſuch toile paine take world ſo cold duty heauen ward anſwere man borne labour world hard labour ſhall neither haue food rayment make pſalmiſt ſaith riſe earely ſit vp late fare full hardly poore liuing ah poore ſoules haue got ſpeake many way offend god getting yet oft time diſappointed ſeeke either leaud ſpending god curſe vpon ſay haue doe ye ſee ſolemne day death count great gain fruit labor ſoule yet vnprouided life little enough feed clothe bodie thinke vpon ſo ſhort warning prouide ſoule ſoule much value body nay world yet getting ſaluation ſoule bodie ſhall fare better alſo yea euen ſhall bee better able doe earthly labour chearefulneſſe without vexation put finger cold water think euery little time beſtowed way toyleſome tedious particularly giue diligence obtaine faith repentance commanded vnwelcome charge thereof vnto v yet eaſilier obtained aſſured ſucceſſe wee ſo ſeeke wee would find durable poſſeſſion neceſſary daily vſe farre pretious gaine exceeds rich prince without vpon deathbed al confeſſed yet whole quarter thought men haue life ſtrength becauſe want heart thereto generally let learne men shechem ioyne doct verſe 1 50 themſelues acquaintance wicked men hope gaine pleaſure preferment god meet recompence ſuch deſerue one time may ſeene abimelech great promiſes repaired cleaued vnto got end ſo nay ſought much loſe euen liues themſelues intend ſeeke commoditie hand ſuch doe ſaid laſt point ſaue one euen bring themſelues bondage haue conſcience accuſe beſide taken vp ſuch thought wit gaine ſhall get manner diuell occupieth draw mind better imployed beſide ſay muſt need goe ill profeſſe goſpell ſeeke keepe good conſcience ſhall conſider ſuch papiſts libertine prophane bad liuers held hope flattered get loſe beſt caſe haue leaſt doe ala moſt ſuſpect ſeruitude ſuch labour bring prou 22 7 borrower ſeruant lender much receiuer giuer hunt precious ſoule whoſe benefactor would ſeeme bee aiming marke eſpecially ſome euen make child hel fully themſelues yet farre worſe ſo neere lincked fellowſhip ſo bewitched enchaunting intiſing word cannot tell bring themſelues backe againe maze wherein grant ſuch make ſhift digeſt thoſe thing till day viſitation come wit end verſe 50 abimelech went theber beſieged tebez tooke 51 ſtrong tower within citie thither fled men woman chiefe citie ſhut went vp top tower 52 abimelech came vp vnto tower fought againſt went hard vnto doore tower ſet fire 53 certaine woman caſt peece milſtone vpon abimelech head brake braine pan 54 abimelech called haſtily page bare harneſſe ſaid vnto draw thy ſword ſlay men ſay woman ſlew page thruſt died 55 men iſrael ſaw abimelech dead departed euery man vnto owne place 56 thus god rendered wickedneſſe abimelech vnto father ſlaying ſeuentie brother 57 alſo wickedneſſe men shechem god bring vpon head ſo vpon came curſe iotham ſonne ierubbaal thus haue heard god puniſhed men shechem ſinne againſt gedeons ſonnes abimelech alſo plagued ſame prophecy iotham might bee verified vpon laid foorth theſe word followeth vnto end former two miſchiefes abimelech wrought againſt men ſenſe verſ 50 51 shechem deſtroyed citie people ſtrong place hold reſt reſorted ſafetie burnt theſe ſay holy ſtory addeth hee went another thereby ſhewing yet ſatisfied blood former therefore went wit citie neere adioyning called thebez alſo probable though vncertaine either ioyned shechemites leaſt refuſed ſubiect abimelech going againſt tooke alſo thus ſee cruell baſeborne tyrant proceeded bloody attempt thereby alſo ſhewed extremitie theſe people thebez brought vnto driuen ſhift themſelues tower citie wherein verſ 50 51 doct though might ſhelter themſelues day yet could long liue muſt need bee famiſhed leaſt thing could ſee theſe ſuch like danger men lie open changeable world whereof ſee likelihood little may teach v vncertainty al thing yet men repoſe confidence man vpon good ground ſay morrow ſhall bee like day ſpeech lord 12 luke bad luke 12 20 ſoule take eaſe eate drinke bee merry ſeeing hee laid vp much good ſtore ſay ſpeech may bee ſeene lord ſaid vnto thou foole night thy ſoule ſhall bee required thee whoſe ſhall thoſe thing thou haſt prouided euen day died leſt ſhould bee thought bee caſe alone added ſhall bee laieth vp treaſure himſelfe rich toward god therefore many may ſee heare fearefully taken away many waſted haue eſtate changed neuer inioyed ſuch regard theſe thing like haue much doe ſhall ſee owne proſperitie ſo fade like manner oh ſhall vtterly vnwelcome ſay leſſe ſmaller change loſſe ſickneſſe pouertie diſeaſes hard ſtooping come yea although thought ſome ſort prouided ſaid teach wiſe liue ſtrangers make heauen home though walke vpon earth warne fooliſh ſeeke wiſdome cling faſt earthly ſtaies delight bee foole ſpoken caſt hence vtterly ſeeke true happineſſe alſo followeth done thebez opening 52 verſe 56 lord brought time confuſion meane abimelechs alſo well men shechem effecting god iudgement vpon ſaid ſped ſo well haue heard attempted tower thebez take alſo drunke former ſucceſſe therefore looking like hee receiued deadly wound due reward woman great diſgrace caſt downe peece milſtone top tower going cloſe doore ſet fire broke braine pan whereupon ſtrooke quite dead yet paſt poſſibilitie recouery called preſently page thruſt thorow preuent ſhame thought might elſe haue ſaid wit woman ſlaine ſo hee came end alſo laſt attempt hauing ſped ſo well former wee may doct 3 verſe 51 52 ſee wicked fleſhed ſucceſſe haue bad courſes bee ſo blinded therewith make ſtay till cut middeſt make account ſhall doe haue done dreame reſiſting ſay themſelues like pſalme tuſh lord doe neither good euill time god ſhould make feele power diſpleaſure acknowledge teaching going forward til god ſtay courſe ſee cannot breake make ſinne greater like ſhall obſerue god willing beniamites chap 20 booke herod hee ſlaine iames ſword ſaw pleaſed iewes went take peter alſo till attempt lord cut maruell actes 12 2 though god vſually deale thus wicked know meaſure future ſucceſſe former make ſee wrong ground thereby imboldned goe god ſucceſſe corruption made vnfit returne againe muſt know word god followed obeyed carefully v bringeth good ſucceſſe indeed wee may reſt yea bleſſing ſoeuer pleaſeth note lord ſend v outward thing hee promiſeth many ſaying thoſe doe ſo thing ſhall caſt vpon haue alſo inward matth 6 33 comfort thereby neither bought money neither taken v maketh v glad vſe imbrace good meanes ſtrengthening ſtabliſhing v drunken earthly peace make account theſe conſidered godly haue ſmall cauſe repine ſucceſſe ioyfull proceeding vngodly lord giues ſcope might bring ſudden deſolation vpon looke morrow ſhould like day much better neither ſhould grieue godly themſelues often croſſed denied ſucceſſe dreamt deſired ſeeing either enterpriſes euill therein bee croſſed bleſſing lawfull vnlawfully followed therfore god promiſes note ſtretcht indeed reached although doings religious yet may vndertaken much confidence goodneſſe thereof meane ſeaſon themſelues doer looked well purged ſinnes may eaſily ſet behind ſucceſſe beſt action doubtleſſe chriſtian offends none theſe way ſhall neuer want ſucceſſe fruite thereof ſhall farre leaſt wicked man ventureth onely boldly vpon next onſet becauſe former good ſpeed abimelech ſhall paul beleeue god hath well begun giue good ſucceſſe mercy deliuerances haue handled point large hiſtorie scripture ſet downe wofull inſtrument deadlie tower therein ſhelter wherein may note god doth oft time plague whoſe iniquity manifeſt ſinne theſe men shechem haue ſinned like manner though yet religious ſpared borne theſe men thebez reaſon ſinne one ſort manifeſt grieuous cannot hid crieth vengeance either ignorance haue ſo wittingly groſſely offended borne may come repentance yet excuſe liue light goſpell haue knowlege liue abide vnrepentant iames 2 5 brother ſaith iames god hath called poore world rich faith good work meaning many rich vouchſafed honour therefore poore betruſted goſpel treaſure manna heauen receiue willingly matth 11 matth 11 5 whereas rich haue matter buſie themſelues neglected partialitie thinke low degree want part beſt thing alſo may thanke himſelfe abaſement pity ſhortens himſelfe allowance would doubtleſſe leſſe complaining among better ſort people vnruly idle ſeeke owne ſorrow men wee ſo prouided god allotteth neither ſhould many men become poore leaudneſſe otherwiſe muſt neceſſitie ſo ſhould comfort themſelues god better regarded others larger contribution beſtowed vpon therefore againe ſay let ſeemely vertue find fauour entertainement might much aduantage haue rating inferior publike duty giue great cauſe complaining partialitie friendſhip diſlike yea ſcape themſelues proportion obſerued eaſily meane ſort people groſſe men ſeeke higheſt place countenance honor aboue others matter burden charge put baſeſt vnderling themſelues particularly lord chooſeth poore baſe doct particularly verſe 1 tribe iſhaker tola iudge iſrael teach v truth prouerb man gift make ſit among mighty aduanceth baſe meane ought deſpiſed want wealth god hath giuen gift little truth hath regarded alwaies salomon declareth ſaith obſerued poore wiſe man deliuered citie ſore aſſaulted mightie eccleſ 9 15 wiſdome none remembred poore man another place ſaith euill haue ſeene vnder sun folly ſet great excellency rich wiſdome vertue ſet low place eccleſ 10 6 7 haue ſeene ſeruants horſes prince walking ſeruants ground ſeeing hee calleth euill hee well inſtructeth child wiſedome iuſtifie whereſoeuer ſhee bee found howſoeuer ſhee bee iuſtled oppoſed carnall queene south ſaid salomon happy thy ſeruants attend thee may 1 king 10 8 heare thy wiſedome ſo becauſe greater salomon heere wee ſhould count felicitie heare count foot beautiful bring glad tidings receiue ſuch men god prophet rom 10 15 meane ſhew ſoeuer make eies commune dead reade holy work cannot conuerſe perſons taken away v life thus dauid mean family saul alſo though deſtitute grace excellently gifted courage warre gouernment peace ſo nobleſt doubtleſſe might compare meanelier deſcended admirable themſelues beholding predeceſſors ſpirit good part laid foundation nobilitie poſteritie therefore ſo long baſe birth maintaine worthily place high office honour whereunto excellent gift haue lawfully aduanced degenerating pride crueltie couetouſneſſe common companion men bred meanely got aloft ſay ſuch regarded great contempt onely god hee deſpiſeth poore deſpiſeth maker prou 17 5 much hee reprocheth authoritie call vpſtarts defame baſe blood ſo eminent vertues may blemiſhed common diſeaſe among factious flattering follower great vicious perſons ſtaine honour ſuch truly noble vertue wiſdome men yeſterday cannot ſhew armes patron whether better hee hiſtory anſwered raiſe vp new bury old gentrie nobilitie leſſe becauſe haue ſaid ſomewhat two point impertinent hereto haue heard god choſe iſhaker poore tribe tola verſe 3 4 iudge iſrael ſo alſo ſee chooſeth noble bee gouernours iair wealth able giue city euery thirtie ſonnes teach v nobilitie let gouerning doct verſe 3 4 commonwealth honourable mightie hauing example anceſtors prouoke vertue many helpes complement well diſcharging thereof may ſeene many reſpects fitteſt added bee lifted vp inſolency high conceit themſelues haue cauſe conſider came nothing wormes meat alſo would weigh mutable ſtate full lamentables change liues ſay truth vtter ſhame v god hath done much v ſhould found vnfaithfull neither high place greater impediment priuate godlineſſe publike gouernment although euery man might tell owne tale none ſo poore ſo rich alleage ſomewhat ſhould tied dutie preciſe liue thinke good bee releaſed burden count whereby doe lay ſtumbling block owne way therefore wee may boldly giue foorth rule chriſtian practiſe miſerable vnlawfull eſtate life cannot ſtand daily carefull practiſe chriſtianity somewhat deny muſt yeelded occaſions vnſeparable buſineſſe attend vpon greatneſſe yet ſo farre foorth onely men defalke detract nothing ſubſtance high great due greateſt owe greater themſelues yet men dare goe thus farre ſhall find god wil giue honour another rather iealouſie wil breake againſt like fire maintaine honour treading vnderfoot pſalme 2 pſalme 2 9 verſ 2 5 ſaid thoſe thing ſeuerall theſe two king life common meane death ſo ſaid died dutie time diſcharged procuring maintaining god true worſhip outward peace countrie long ſeaſon thē gaue place gathered father body laid earth hope reſurrection teach v v doct verſ 2 5 luke 19 doe duty calling ſerue god therein hath giuen committed truſt talent charge occupie till come allowes none v bury earth ſtraightly forbids wit bee idle ſuffer gift ruſt v end inioy euery man proper gift lord hath ſet v habitation ſtinted time dwelling commandement ſhould idle vnprofitable knowledge lord ieſus act 17 26 particular calling attend thereunto profitable vſes ſelues others hath purpoſe appointed ſhould 2 pet 1 8 haue comfortable fruite thereof neceſſarie thing life incourage v duty ſo might none refuſe idle hangbyes world generall particular calling ſerue god conſcience ſake comfort end ſay god hath ſet v alwaies haue eye vpon departure good father barzillai prouide graue 2 sam 19 37 wee haue thus diſcharged ſelues lord ſhall giue 2 v warning ſickneſſe paine diſeaſe end bee hand call v home ſmall warning wee ſhould readie comming yeeld note ſoules hand body graue ſeaſon hope receiuing againe ſhall hard matter v doe haue ſtrangers prepared wee haue learned doe neither ſhould looke deſire haue abode continuance giue ouer ſelues peace willingly commend ſelues vnto lord ſafe keeping haue ſaid therfore meane time ſhould ſoberly vſe tranſitorie help life wealth friend wife life ſelfe ſo may clog deceiuable ſhew hold v farre better thing meane take note beſt vſe profitable end doe good wee may doe helpe ſeeing graue ſuch thing bee looked ſo remembrance time well paſſed ſhall moſt comfortable eccleſ 9 10 thoſe calling cheare merry making world otherwiſe ſure ſhall able well giue reckoning hereafter ſuch neither poſſibly dye well willingly vnleſſe bee deſperate purpoſe haue ſpoken elſewhere diligent reader ſhall finde ſecond part chapter verſ 6 child iſrael wrought wickedneſſe againe ſight lord ſerued baalim aſhtoroth god aram god zidon god moab god child ammon god philiſtims forſooke lord ſerued 7 therefore wrath lord kindled againſt iſrael ſold hand philiſtims hand child ammon 8 yeere vexed oppreſſed child iſrael eighteene yeeres euen child iſrael beyond iorden land ammorites gilead 9 moreouer child ammon went ouer iorden fight againſt iudah againſt beniamin againſt houſe ephraim ſo iſrael ſore tormented 10 child iſrael cried vnto lord ſaying wee haue ſinned againſt thee euen becauſe wee haue forſaken owne god haue ſerued baalim followeth new reuolt people iſrael handled ſenſe theſe verſes 17 verſe wherein thing bee conſidered theſe wit double repairing returning god hee afflicted enemy ſin forſaking firſt ſeeking repulſe repentance ſound ſecond god deliuered ſeeking repentance former note theſe foure thing firſt ſinne ioyning nation among dwelt ſixth verſe ſecond god puniſhing euen thoſe ioyned idolatrie ſnewed next three verſes third point cry god laſtly fruite thereof tenth verſe ſo forward fruite diuers firſt god denied deliuer fifteenth verſe ſecond cry people god hee deliuered ſet downe next two verſes vnto ſeuenteenth let theſe thing looked particularly returne therefore ſixth verſe opening verſe 6 particularly begin people ſinne ſaid death theſe two iudges whoſe day enioyed peace fiue fortie yeeres people fell againe prouoke god wee haue heard father committing idolatrie manner ſeuen nation mentioned liking fleſh beſides thought thoſe nation ſo liued abundance pleaſure themſelues many delight tickle fleſh forward adioyned falſe worſhip draw away heart ſeruing true god aright ſaid forſooke thus much ſumme verſe therein ſinne diuers thing conſidered firſt teacheth ſhould greatly marueile ſo many doct verſ 6 age giue themſelues popiſh religion ſeeing idolatrie hath moſt age ſo common reaſon hath ſo many playerlike toyes bables ſights bleare eye ſonets deceiue eare maketh thinke peece paradiſe embrace made drunke ſuch fond conceit indeed thereby caried faſt aſleepe hell nothing moueth delighteth word god rightly vnderſtood blind deuotion falſe religion wherein haue nuzled vp fond fantaſticall conceit ſhall goe heauen thereby authoritie warrant maſſe trumperie beginning world nay sauiour chriſts time many hundred yeeres ſhred ragge vſed knowne eſpecially ſuch end whereas true ſeruing god alwaies euen beginning heb 11 whole prone people worſhip god eaſe ſo farre like whether ſound true counterfeit may ſeene onely poperie coyned purpoſe deceiue ſimple ſtrong deluſions alſo religion outward manner holy pure good conſiſteth hearing prayer vſe sacrament ſubſtance thereof yet many allow true manner worſhipping god doe moſt part draw neere god body heart farre would ſay would gladly goe heauen would haue eaſie way thither ſerue god ſpirit truth ioh 4 24 direct way thither cannot bend themſelues thereto whereas great delight worſhipping god aright pſal 84 1 lord allowance promiſe two former kindes popiſh outward worſhip wanting great delight ſay ſound true performing ſo farre fraile fleſh may attaine reward promiſed thereto vnutterable pſal 19 11 verſe alſo may bee ſeene fruite
