people yeelded doct 2 lord long enioyed peace euen wee haue ſeene father fell laſciuiouſnes forgetting god ſufficient deut 6 12 watchword whereof giuen moſes laying ſinne ſelues fearefull great let v onely conſider thus seeing point hath largely handled already diſeaſed perſon pained ſtone note ſtrangury famiſhed hee penury man exile baniſhment theſe ſay might ſet free oppreſſeth would readily offer couenant doe ſeruice god yea much feruently men therefore grieuous ſin let men iudge may health wealth eaſe outward peace doe meane ſerue lord thing requireth yet mean brought leaue conſidered euery one ſhal ſee cauſe particularly ſaid forſooke lord may doct 3 marueiled ſhould forſake loued ſerued may ſee force ſinne beſot make drunken giue ouer themſelues thereto whoredome loue world able bereaue ſound reaſon turne away delight prayer good practiſe forget ioy ſometimes yet blindfold ſo ſhall ſuſpect danger toward al may merrily ſerue humour therein sampſon went farre way let beſt v feare leſt carried away luſts loue like wee ought tempt god let v reſiſt beginning euill wee know little may befall v time wee note dare deale looſely vnfaithfully lord ſuffer ſelues beled away ſtedfaſtnes boldnes careleſneſſe thus ſuffered beare ſway v may cauſe ſcripture time ſaid verified v haue forſaken lord ſtrength yet becauſe men cunning deceiue themſelues hoping long embrace another religion ſhall become ſuch iudged ſo hardly though take vp delight ſins pleaſe thē thought therefore amiſſe giue caueat vaine doe ſuch men worſhip god though draw neere body ſuffer heart goe another way kinde forſaking god though ſo high degree time themſelues like come vnto labour loſt beſtow ſeruing god accompanied ſuch anoiance vnſauourines vtterly abhorreth phraſe forſaking god taken wedlocke either partie renounceth intereſt fellowſhip departeth away euen phraſe ſelling away vſed next verſe god part importeth like action lord iuſtly giuing ouer part reſigned right husband married himſelfe vnto vnto ſtrange idol ſo lord put ouer intereſt vnto ſtrange idolater alienating himſelfe commoditie ſold changeth owner becomes right another man let men thinke may pleaſure breake couenant knot marriage god thinking may returne liſt liſt sampſon companion leuite concubine neither ſo eaſie doe neither ſhall finde god ſo ready haſtie ſeekings vpon occaſion admit ſaid people ſinne occaſion thereof haue heard firſt point foure theſe three next verſ 7 8 9 verſes ſet god diſpleaſure conceiued againſt thus prouoked ſore tranſgreſſions prouoked alſo little like hee ſtirred vp philiſtims ammonite againſt vexed ſore many yeeres onely land ammorites beyond iorden child iſrael dwelt waxed bold paſſed ouer iorden made warre tribe iuda beniamin ephraim ſo able reſiſt ſhould wee ſay muſt need granted heauy bondage vnder remedie leſſe would haue moued wrought vpon would complaine crie god little ſhould haue heard kept ſo great extremity ſhould haue vexed ſay may ſee wee come doct verſ 7 8 vnder ſore affliction manner take heart v make liues weariſome may thanke ſelues god vſeth caſt puniſhments vpon men peece meale degree giueth warning moſt part leaſt word alwaies ſo wiſe men ſeeing plague comming may preuent prou 22 3 elſe laieth hand lightly vpon may firſt repaire intreate ſtay otherwiſe ſuddenly take away righteous wicked ſhall haue cauſe complaine ſhall reſt peace god remoue puniſhments yet reconciled liue obediently hee giue greater grace faith hope patience beare burthen eaſily farre greater contentment danger harden heart bow meekely god vnder burthen againſt outward calamitie bondage wee haue heard god puniſhed people committing idolatrie ſuffered enemy oppreſſe ſore longtime al expreſſed though grieuous may well ſee noted alſo ſin turned sunſhine god fauour moſt darke vncomfortable diſpleaſure men purchaſe themſelues wilfulneſſe rebellion might otherwiſe go good liking dwell moſt ſafely vnder wing protection day long madneſſe caſt themſelues deadly feares vnquietneſſe anguiſh ſoule lord diſpleaſure ſharpe arrowes ſticking deut 33 12 faſt reproch diſcountenance god ſeruants many croſſings diſcontentments god anger wrath reade chap 2 14 end sixtieth two sermon tenth chapter booke ivdges heard former verſes god afflicted verſ 9 people ſinne verſe holy ſtory ſetteth oppreſſion enemy reached people beyond iorden well ſide onely wherein thereat verified whereof hath ſpoken idol ſhould ſnares vnto euen deſtruction beſides ſee miſerie ſpred time thoſe ſide iorden reached euen iſraelites alſo dwelt beyond iorden although enemy began firſt dwelt land amorites yet ſeeing people ſides iorden communicated nation ſinne therfore plagued alike enemy ſo fareth v many ioyne together prouoking god ſhall ſmart together bearing correction though lord begin ſaid shechem abimelech ſome firſt apart yet fire burneth one houſe another wil ſay deuour reſt former length plague haue heard hath done ſaid verſe cried lord ſaying verſ 10 haue ſinned haue ſpoken alſo long miſerie ere complained therfore wil repeate thoſe two point onely noted crie vnfainedly firſt ſmart felt hauing repulſe god ſeeing preuailed thereby ſet themſelues ſeeke lord repent truth heart ſhewed afterwards firſt ſeeking come true repentance appeareth lord reiecting cry bidding goe god ſerued helpe hee would haue done turned truth hee full compaſſion readie receiue thoſe vpright heart exod 34 7 wee may ſee many men extremity doct confeſſe ſinnes god saul hee feared loſſe kingdome crie yet otherwiſe hardly wrung neither doe ſincerely yet ſay ſuch ſpeake doe hypocriſie ſay note need haſt crie onely conſider god looketh truth hand neither reſolue afterwards looke aboue thing keepe couenant god neither therefore indeed doe ſo like ahab bow time bulruſh afterward forgetting careleſnes negligence ſaid promiſed whereas truth vnfainedly repent turne god looke duly conſtantly promiſe made dauid ſaid haue ſworne pſal 119 106 performe keepe thy righteous iudgements need leſſe couenant god man would thinke vnleſſe boldly groſſely ſhew deſpiſe helpe fill church reuolters reade pſalme pſalm 78 34 vſe repeate referre reader place mentioned verſe 11 lord ſaid vnto child iſrael deliuer egyptian amorites child ammon philiſtims 12 zidonians alſo amalekites maonites oppreſſe ye cried vnto ſaued hand 13 yet ye haue ſaken ſerued god wherefore deliuer 14 goe crie vnto god yee haue choſen let ſaue tribulation theſe verſes followeth god ſaid theſe cry ſenſe people called vpon god began ſeemed repent god anſwered indeed ſharpely roughly appeareth text whether high prieſt ſome prophet ſo hardly reproued reaſon awake bring ſound conſtant repentance yet come vnto ſhould haue ſaid yee ſeeke deliuered ye doe end ye ſet libertie may returne old byas againe follow luſts ſerue ſtrange god could haue thought would hereafter ſaith lord haue reuolted call vpon time heard firſt deliuered yet haue forſaken bee ſeene day marke ye ſtil beare haue caſt behind back deliuered egyptian ammorites ammonite ſtead thanks ye forſooke fell ſerue ſtrange god horrible thus therfore lord haue heard caſteth teeth doings namely idol ſhould haue ſaid yee ſee god call able doe could haue helped ſee would neuer haue ſought therefore deliuer ſeeke ye ſee cannot briefly end ſtate thus doct laid open lord note rather repeate whole anſwere lord make heere ſo eaſie matter men deceiue knoweth heart guile falſehood flattery beguile men charitie ought iudge beſt heare ſee heare ſome men good pang either ſome great bleſſing befalles held vnder ſome great affliction feare death kept vpon racke haue heard ſome powerfull sermon hath ſearched quicke behold great workes god power thunder lightning wind tempeſt ſea land ſee god hand vpon men heauy vpon themſelues way vpon ſuch occaſions ſay heare ſpeeches ſee behauiours ſome men note word thankſgiuing trembling admiration nay confeſſions prayer breake earneſt couenants vowes repentance ſay heare theſe thing ſuch time would make ſimplehearted chriſtian crie amazed feare boldly affirme god glorified doubtleſſe theſe perſons throughly changed truly penitent god truth ſurely saul become prophet god thus ſimplicitie doe many iudge ſuch occaſion ſee except bee well experienced ſhould ſay like caſe curſed deceiue ſuch yet thus ſpeake till afterward much aſtoniſhed ſee contrary thus wee ſee deceiue men whereas lord wee may ſee example cannot bee ſo eaſily deluded neither wil ſo ſoone ſatisfied theſe ſpeeches ſtill waiteth truth vprightneſſe ſuch vtter giues credulous eare vnto doth ſuſpect calles proofe ſoundnes affection towards expoſtulateth find ſo saul 1 sam 15 24 30 ſaid fearing kingdome confeſſed ſin laid charge 1 sam 15 lord profeſſed reiected chap 16 1 sam 16 1 people deuteronomy feare ſtrongly poſſeſſed thereof deut 5 29 haſt proteſted would obey lord thing moſes ſhould tell mouth god lord ſmelt found preſently thus ſaith moſes people ſaith wel haue ſaid take word oh ſuch heart ſaith tongue would ſeeme import euen leaud houſwife runne away husband ill debter fled debt taken terrified law ſticke ſay ſweare condition offered ſo preſent danger ſhame may remitted whereas yet treacherous looſe afterward euer iſſue prooues theeues malefactor euen ſo vile perſons vnder god puniſhments ſee breaking away ſtrong hand ſay accuſing condemning themſelues nay ſhame themſelues ſinnes ſo denounce pleade againſt themſelues promiſe vpon condition releaſe preſent woe yet theſe men come triall flie touch recoile againe witneſſe conuince ſaid ſpoken trance oh therefore thoſe forced exclamation complaint either horror feare grieued ſoule maketh body pinched diſtreſſe compell man vnto may taken approoued teſtimonies repentance either themſelues yea ſuch know haue often abuſed lord thus command order liſt vpon flattering promiſe whereas wonderfull mercy hee forbare offer meanes ſearching themſelues better let repent therefore playing wily beguily god oh ſhould terrifie ſcare lord ſtill count hollow perſons rotten heart falſe couenant therefore hee one time reckon villany hypocriſie durſt couer vnder vizard ſpeeches humblenes truth v haue learned practiſed better let v beware paul 1 king 5 22 bid timothy lay hand ſuddenly vpon ſo doe lightly iudge well commend eſtate man vpon ſo ſlender euidence let conſtancie ſpeake time mother truth ſhall prooue meane ſeaſon lift thou ſuch one vp third heauen one moode another thou ſhalt bee vrged condemne nethermoſt hell ſober leaue god maſter knowes ſtandeth falleth particularly theſe two verſes telles deliuerances verſ 11 12 wrought bringing benefit remembrance prick conſciences therefore ſpeake truth incouragement doct verſe 11 12 could haue comming god need helpe dealt ſo treacherouſly eſpecially hauing teſtimonie came remorſe ſhame former reuolts firme reſolute perſwaſion god would pardon themſelues would fal v need doe muſt looke like anſwer ſo haue though voice heauen yet fearefull accuſation conſciences word canonicall scripture men haue bin ſo dealt neighbour yea though haue beneficiall wil ſoone ſhew mind greatly deteſt ſuch vnthankfulneſſe falſehood ſhould moued hearing god benefit brought remembrance ſuch like matter haue ſpoken largely ſecond chapter verſ 1 2 3 ſpeech lord namely deliuer becauſe afterwards verſ 1 • deliuer giuing occaſion ſome doubt difficulty conſidered v accordingly meane regard meaning yee people vnworthy beloued haue abuſed facilitie gentleneſſe ſeeing eaſily entreated heretofore helpe plied mee cry complaint till yee gotten yee would haue euen deliuerance enemy naming many ſorts vnto yee got elbow roome ſaith lord whereas looked haue god worſhip ſeruice aſwell ſaluation ye turned back vpon rebelled againſt bee fruit loue tenderneſſe muſt haue worke deliuer euery ſtocke ſtone euery idoll ammon moab c go away thanks reuerence get obedience worſhip helpe except ſee better fruit come otherwiſe haue done goe ſeeke yee ſerue ſuccour reliefe ſee refuſall conditionall applied former idolatry preſent vnſound dealing reacheth onely preſent time though cried vnto ſaid time caſe deliuer helpe faſt complaine ſhall ſee meete ſhall ſee repentance ſound giue another anſwer manifeſt ſay ſpeaketh conditionally thus muſt doct vnderſtand otherwiſe hauing committed vnpardonable ſin ſpeech ſhould haue contrarily •• scripture thing noted god manner men ſheweth fearefull ſpeeches hee heere offended v note ſame cauſe doth oft afflict v end may make v ſearch ſee feele ſome ſpecial ſinnes fore grieuous ſight yet v nothing little regarded meanes therefore bringeth v ſuch ſenſe able looke vp hart iudgement fleſh doth faint within v may bee ſeene theſe heere dauid felt ſaid innumerable trouble haue compaſſed pſalm 40 12 ſinnes haue taken ſuch hold able looke vp number haires mine head therefore mine heart faileth pſalm 32 4 another pſalme may ſee like doe men ſinnes bring god citeth ſeeth expedient awake though doe often eſpecially reprobate yet ſlender rather vſe benefit doth haue ſo many ſhifts waſh away ſo harden heart cannot profit thereby great vſe comfort owne child end eſpecially terrible feareful ſoeuer beginning proceeding alſo ſometime ſeeme vnto ſo terrifies many firſt conuerſion feeling wrath heauy diſpleaſure iuſtly kindled againſt odiouſneſſe deteſtation liues paſt ſo fall kind deſpaire people act peter ſermon ſaying men brother actes 2 37 ſhall doe yet little made light ſinnes ſo pricked conſciences ſenſe hath ſaid matter may gather manner thing ſinne appeare proper colour indeed wit moſt note fearefull thing many thinke true ſay murther adulterie idolatrie ſuch like truth haue vttered verified ſins alſo yet ſeeme leſſe odious anger impatience worldlineſſe diſtruſt tetchineſſe pride heart ſloth idleneſſe leaudnes eie ſelfloue deceiuing reuenge reſt whatſoeuer come clearely conſcience felt duly conſidered becauſe make ſuch common matter ſo little grieued lord therefore driuen awake v heere hee people make v aſtoniſhed ſtung heart thoſe ſinnes wee thought ſmall none wee lay nuzled drowned god open eye ſee ſeene may felt ſhame fouleneſſe baſeneſſe ſottiſhneſſe note committing danger bring wee iudge euen ſo well reſt horror doth adultery breed thought committing arrow ſhot liuer ſay doubt ſo anger paſt offended ſhame ſo may ſay view hereof may bee taken saul god purſued ſinne made crie ſaying ſhall doe god hath forſaken 1 sam 28 15 ſpeaketh torment thinke wee felt iudas himſelfe ſaid haue ſinned betraying innocent blood ſinne ſo wounded conſcience halter made end life adam tranſgreſſion alſo diuers wrought vpon ſo terrified fled god preſence farre could hide himſelfe thicket geneſ 3 8 among tree ſhould reckon vp hundred ſinned diuers manner one hath abhorred owne ſo vile god make ſee therefore martyr rather would commit ſinne againſt note conſcience feele terrour choſe loſe liues rather wee may reade plentifully booke monument true men doe alwaies ſee feele neither brought moued aſtoniſhed ſinne except lord ſtrong hand thus forced vrged end matter hand may iudge ſhall horror iudgement day ſelfe ſuch thing ſhall fully made manifeſt vſe let v learne ſeriouſly haue ſinne horror deteſtation yea euen put harlot face hath moſt force deceiue v leſt heare ſtrike wound v heart wee looke ſuch thing ſhall find moſt deadly vnwelcome vnto v another thing herein marked although dealt deceitfully doct 2 lord former abuſes deliuerances alſo complaint make new helpe yet lord leaues caſe enough haue hardned made quite deſperate euen theſe word defiance whereby hee ſeemeth wholly abandon protection yet ſecretly drawes deeper ſearching themſelues far ſerious meditation eſtate ſo hee might grant deſire receiue fauour againe oh vnſpeakable admirable note kindneſſe lord thus draw water rocke fetch light darkneſſe god ſo gracious child ſeemeth frowne ſweete pleaſant amiable countenance delightfull promiſes incouragements cannot forget himſelfe ſo farre child though degenerate put habit affection towards euen would play iudge pleaſant louing kindneſſe therefore although eaſie fallen departed god ſee intent god toward time threat terror yet knowing bee ſo muſt grow beleeue time neede magnifieth god deepe rooted tender loue child haue offended make matter vnfained thankes praiſe worſt end anger diſpleaſure ſhall appeare haue remorſe repentance might wrought thoſe offended ſo may receiued againe vngodly ſee neither finde ſuch fruite god renouncing complaint confeſſions terror word workes againſt ſinne voyce voyce ſounds deafe man eare heare rom 7 8 either rebell elſe runne away feare gen 3 10 preſent terror ſo worke theſe lord meant better though ſpake roughly becauſe indeed faire ſpeech fit medicine diſeaſe drawne ſecret condition driuen open threat ſtrangely doth ſame ſpeech word god inſtruct teach wiſedome yea put hope beleeuer vtterly diſanimate turne wicked leaſt whit profit god intendeth thing ſo ſhall worke ſhall worke beſt loue god sweetnes ſhall come bitternes rom 8 28 whereas hauing ſuch promiſe finde ſuch effect chriſt ſaith text looked vpon iudas comming betray luk 22 47 ſo matth chap 26 report looke vpon peter hauing denied theſe lookes frowning lookes worke matth 26 61 diuers peter looke touched compunction went repentant perſon harned wretched perſon mollified ſame aſpect becauſe bountie laſtly point let god child learne double dutie well 3 take occaſion thankſgiuing ſay ſuch haue declined gone compaſſe let wiſely obſerue god meaning toward word workes affliction let firſt take heed leſt giue eare ſubtiltie would prompt ſuggeſtion thou art alreadie gone god behold ſeekes rid note thee altogether feare thee quite auoid satan let ſay renounce right god faith right free loue put difference betweene beleeuers priuilege vnbeleeuer dealing god ſee people iſrael niniuites hath condition annexed argueth god deſirous forgiue reſtore heale ſettle good eſtate againe forſake hee meant ſo needed haue redeemed haue ſpoken conditionally therfore euer hereafter highlier eſteeme life hath promiſe god fauour annexed thereto whereas ſee ſelfe frowned vpon lord boldnes wilfulnes ſtolne liberty taking pleaſures ſinne peace waſted ſpirit abated faith weakned ioy willingnes pray c appalled therfore giue ſelfe peace till haue ſearched ſinnes repented note houerly confeſſing drowſie ſottiſh lying wil ceaſe powring ſoule lord terror may aſtoniſh driue lay ſinne heart bee ſo aſhamed god may accept humiliation ſorrow giue faith reſt promiſe pardoning reſtoring againe secondly let alſo teach god people indent ſeriouſly lord vſe former bleſſing old deliuerances paſt thankfully deſire obtaine new remembring god vpbraides theſe iſraelites ſaying dare ye come demaund deliuerance hand hauing ſo ſhamefully abuſed former theſe word goe crie god c doth god thinke bid verſ 14 opening goe ſinne wiſe ſpeaketh doth oft time scripture another manner word ſeeme meane marke wee ſhall eaſily fall great error abſurditie moſt grieuous caſting teeth ironicall mocking idolatrie ſhould ſay yee proue ſee god doe elia like prophet baal bad cry aloud god baal perhaps aſleepe ſaith c 1 king 18 27 may ſo meane ſhould crie vrge marke well god worſhipped therefore thus ſpeaking bidding goe ſeeke helpe doct idol hand hauing ſhaken lord teacheth v ſtandeth good reaſon wee haue ſerued committed ſelues muſt pay v wage lord iuſtly doth ſend v patronage greateſt need euen conuiction horror yea deſtruction take v theſe mercie contrariwiſe yet according ſame equitie sauiour anſwered peter ſaid fellowes forſaken followed matth 19 29 therfore asked ſhould haue ſaid hundred fold eternall life therfore haue truſted ſtill doe man haue made fleſh arme ſhall know experience one day haue truſted bruiſed reede god anſwere worker iniquitie ſerue satan depart know let know whoſe portion luke 13 27 ſtolne pleaſures ſinne come time ſhall infinitly better euer ſweete thereafter note ſhall feele ſmart ſorrow full meaſure ſhall remedie reuel 18 7 redreſſe papiſts ſhall ſent helpe pope saint pardon pilgrimage god doth threaten ſuch impenitent one haue caſt dead workes neuer ſo hee neuer acknowledge ſuch patron ſhall finde bee cold comforter thoſe torment ſhall feele ſinnes ſo remembring ſought ſhelter vnto whoſe ſeruice life time addicted themſelues thus wiſe parent guide ſuperiour taught anſwere ſcapethrift lewd wretch hath brought himſelfe need priſon miſerie idleneſſe gaming prophanenes bad companionſhip ſuch like doings hee ſeekes helpe thus ſay hee anſwere get whoſe counſell ye haue hearkened followed may ſame miſerie worſe themſelues therefore vnfit enough ſuccour helpe god manifeſt nature ſhall anſwere ſuch liue manner let v learne conclude man ſhall end well euill life added vnleſſed changed repentance therefore good ſuch neuer borne briefly conclude doctrine ſome vſes thereof wee ſee ſecondly god doth import leſſe law like equitie vertue farre ſtronger couenant people perſiſted faithfull ſeruice could haue denied ſuite help defence againſt enemy otherwiſe reaſon doth ſhake ſend idol ſerued except meant himſelfe would haue beſteadded cleaued ſuccour faith attended bringing forth fruit confidence meane obedience ſweet prerogatiue wee haue expreſſe grant king heauen ſo long keep couenant god ſo oft may alſo claime reuerence ſpoken libertie ſonnes ſeruants bee defended guarded againſt inward outward aduerſarie power ſaluation approching confidence throne grace freedom ſpirit call god father whether ye reſiſtance made ſome luſt ſome diuels inſtruments diuel himſelfe libertie chriſtian may hope make aſhamed rom 5 5 pray againſt aſſurance heard euen chriſt himſelfe beſought father becauſe within couenant therefore warreth againſt euill therefore hee may boldly pray grace againſt foiled god worke lord louing maſter ſee ſeruant fruſtrated hope ſeruice thirdly theſe word note wiſedome man beſtow chiefe coſt whence hee lookes beſt recompence acknowledgement time moſt need ſteward kinde commended policie would ſhew curteſie ſuch knew luk 16 4 day hardneſſe want would readieſt remember thankes requitall contrary folly apoſtle romanes taxeth fruite ye thoſe thing whereof yee aſhamed man aſhamed labour hath brought plentifull gaine anſwers coſt hope men haue runne themſelues rom 6 21 breath life groping blind happineſſe vnprofitable ſuperſtitious prophane courſe length ſeeing themſelues deceiued wiſh ſerued maſter might haue ſaued receiued euerlaſting habitation anſwers bidding go ſee money ſaue god luſts maſters none ſeruice neither ſhal haue wage frō thus lord faine vpbraid men though word ſaying go idol yet effect leaueth ſhiftleſſe elſe ſhould perſwade one hundred ſoweth among thornes loſeth labour coſt caſteth himſelfe away vpon one idoll broken ſtaffe truth ſuch bewitching nature theſe idol popiſh onely ſpirituall alſo ſet vp loue heart poſſeſſe ſeruants opinion fruite obtained could hit vpon till length like themſelues time ſtrength thrift coſt ſpent waſted crye miſerably like theeues gallowes deceiued leauing example others bee wiſe profit themſelues neither rule example could doe good wofull experience witneſſeth many verſ 15 child iſrael ſaid vnto lord wee haue ſinned doe thou vnto v whatſoeuer pleaſe thee onely pray thee deliuer v day 16 put away ſtrange god among ſerued lord ſoule grieued miſerie iſrael people hauing receiued hard ſharpe anſwere lord wit hee would heare laid neere heart ſenſe verſe 15 16 cried againe lord ſoone expreſſed confeſſing ſinnes caſting away idol firſt ſuing god ſtead thereof ſerued lord forſaken beſide ſubmitted themſelues doe would reſting confidently perſwaded mercie ſo obtained deliuerance earneſtly ſued ſought preſent calamitie lord intreated granted deſire ſeeme ſtrange firſt cry god ſute doct ver 15 16 reiected wee muſt know ſought vprightneſſe heart ſaid therfore god meant hold racke onely keepe ſuſpence alſo hold deepe feare denying helpe secondly bring repentance indeed ſhew ſignes thoſe alſo effectuall purpoſe draue throughly examination themſelues done ſee firſt gladly would haue deliuered meane would caſt away idol ſinnes would ſtill walke way owne heart ſetteth v common diſeaſe oft euen god deare child affliction crie god mercy helpe faine would haue puniſhment taken away ſo would haue libertie liue hold faſt ſinnes ſtill abide note dearer v owne fleſh euen manner many v oft boldly deale lord ſo repentance hardly attained vnto euen ſue lord eaſe trouble may bee ſeene dauid himſelfe 32 pſalme pſalm 32 5 painefull confeſſe againſt himſelfe need ſpeech people anothoth ieremie preach vnto v pleaſant thing againe heare law thy lord neither follow demetrius ſiluer smith booke actes theſe wicked actes 11 25 foile themſelues anathoth retaine pleaſures vphold wicked gaine ſhould ſo v manner better ſort borne yet may iuſtly complained oh euen better ſort men reformed inſomuch affliction vpon would moſt willinglie bee eaſed yet cannot brought ſee amend thing amiſſe becauſe flatter themſelues great owne eies iniquitie found worthy hated yet worſe theſe murmur vnder affliction doe hide ſinnes particularly cleare people ſaw euil 2 worſhipping ſtrange god would acknowledge til god draue ſore iudgements ſee ſee prouoke ſpeciall ſinnes let v feare wee abhorre weary inſtructions warning giueth v ſay bring v thereto ſharpe correction beſt iudge ſelues iudged lord lord ſo hardly vrging people fell ſerious ſearching themſelues ſo came better ſtate wee may ſee hardly god people brought confeſſe renounce ſinnes hauing fallen ſometimes haue done yet ſee feele hand god againſt releaſe iſſue trouble ſeene many drawne thereby ſorrow repentance haue felt god anger kindled againſt ſinnes firſt hardly moſt part abide told heare iudgements ſhake poſſibly god doe purpoſe bring ſuch home wil ſo worke make feele threat diſpleaſure ſo fierce ſmarty rather ſtill liue vnder feare thereof run fire water eſcape though bodily affliction vpon thus many haue brought home lord hath tamed ſubdued affliction eſpecially inward rebel pride ſtoope vnder burden good hope euen high minded doe kicke againſt pricke refractarie note wilfull doe ſurely come euill therefore ſeeing may find mercy god affliction neuer felt proſperitie ſhould wee ſtorme comming rather looke ſome good apoſtle iames wiſheth v doe telleth iames 1 2 v matter greateſt ioy fall many laſtly matter returned ſerue lord know 4 end repentance ſerue god chearefulnes throughout life euen chiefe end liuing doe indeed bring foorth fruit amendment life worke faileth v meane way godlineſſe pleaſant vnto v let v know wel v diuell hath much preuailed luke 1 74 againſt v next place theſe two verſes let v lay together ſignes people repentance theſe fiue firſt confeſſion ſecond ſubmitting themſelues god third putting away idol fourth returne godly life fifth confidence god taking nay neither making doubt holp • inſtruction theſe thing mentioned maner though vſually scripture expreſſely ſet downe repentance men together yet ſundry place ieremie ier 31 33 hoſea c theſe alſo may found ſuch penitent wee examine ſtories ſuch ſearch hoſea may bee hoſe 14 2 3 4 pſal • 1 1 2 3 luke 19 8 found though named dauid alſo zacheus likewiſe ſo ioyntly laid together let v whenſoeuer liſt looke approoue repentance ſound good ſeuer wee wiſe one confeſſe alone without reſt may bee vncertaine teſtimony ſeene saul confeſſion yet ſome 2 sam 12 13 ſufficient yea ſure good dauids vttered bare confeſſion nathan haue ſinned leaue euill doe good reſting god promiſe ſubmitting ourſelues holy ſay theſe together confeſſions ſignes repentance infallable euen contrarie failing ſome theſe may eaſily breed queſtion ſufficiencie true repentance scripture doth otherwiſe commend holy ſtory thus ſetteth forth people thus repented ſoule lord grieued miſery euen angrie reuolting doth admirably commend god mercy oft ſet downe scripture ſpoken ioel 2 18 c ionas 4 2 though god mooued affection thoſe thing noted men aſcribed god ſo ſpoken manner men euen firſt grieued miſery thoſe pitie ſo god ſaid grieued receiuing mercy may truly ſay god exceedeth mercy towards poore ſinners haue ſore prouoked vnfainedly turne true affection ſo alſo fruites fauour elſewhere haue noted large end oft repeated ſaying exodus lord gratious ſlow wrath ready forgiue exod 34 7 repenting euill brought vpon lord wholly repented notwithſtanding former abomination blotted darkned ſound comfort ſo caſe euen ſo doth change eſtate wofull people reconciling himſelfe otherwiſe foulleſt moſt tempeſtuous day vnto moſt comfortable weather conſtant sunſhine need know theſe change meane walke god fauour continually doe continually delight law prou 23 17 feare theſe point fifteenth verſe hitherto ſpeak briefely becauſe haue handled vpon like occaſions ſecond fourth chapter booke sixtie three sermon tenth eleventh chapter booke ivdges third part chapter verſe 17 child ammon gathered together incamped gilead child iſrael aſſembled themſelues together incamped mizpeh 18 people prince gilead ſaid one man bee begin fight againſt child ammon ſhall head ouer inhabitant gilead theſe two verſes laſt chapter verſ 17 18 paſſe repentance people iſrael haue ſpoke followeth may ſee ammonite ſatisfied vexing people god long done went put ſword take city land owne marke lord ſo dealt people prouided ſo well enemy could neuer goe better time reſpect iſraelites turned god repentance receiued fauor protection cauſed lord ſtand againſt ſo know direction help go deliuer thēſelues bondage miſerie ammonite ſeeing gilead goodly citie richly furniſhed laboured determined firſt deſtroy iſrael aſſembled mizpeh camped gilead farre aiding giliadites brother beſieged thoſe amonites therefore directed god propounded betwixt themſelues namely prince people would begin battell againſt ammonite ſhould guide iudge ouer led hereto god may appeare lord raiſed vp thoſe iudges ouer confirmed iphtah going againſt ſtory thus laid foorth wil ſtay little ſay ſome thing doct verſ 17 ammonite iſraelites firſt child ammon gone take city ground people iſrael hand poſſeſſion oppreſſed warre iſraels repentance turning god might eaſily haue done none durſt heart reſiſt appeareth ſtory ſuffered oppreſſe till laſt yeere eſpecially ſore diſtreſſed tormented beſides god alſo againſt ſought lord truth heart heartned imboldned reſiſt ſtand againſt hope wee ſee manifeſtly declare wee may ſee god keepeth doct verſ 17 18 note many euils trouble deare ſeruants till hee hath made fit able goe vnder whereas come vpon vtterly ouerwhelmed turneth many affliction away altogether ſaw could auoide euen ſo hee deferreth many ſo ſhall touch till hath ſtrengthened ſhoulders put courage heart ſo made able beare yet leaueth vnexerciſed one ſmall eaſie ſeeth profitable fit beare v well conſider ſhall find goodnes hath herein exceeded toward v chooſe ſee firſt inlightning v faith wee weake might eaſily haue diſmaide hee hath kept many ſinnes ſight thoſe ſaw hardly kept deſpaire ſundry trouble alſo appeared v yet wee nothing able heare much leſſe beare would haue ſwallowed v vp note haue driuen v vtter deſperation true vnderſtand firſt conuerſion euen ſo alſo v throughout whole life ſpareth v end may better incouraged ſerue faithfully know ſo afterward may fit ſee ſinnes alſo take part affliction abide v euen wee vſe child tenderly bee young growne vp ſet worke ſhew muſt labour ſuffer ſome hardneſſe better able goe vnder thus lord cal backe saul purſuit dauid 1 sam 23 27 likely could haue eſcaped hand let alone naſhaſh king ammon might eaſily haue deſtroyed giliadites firſt onſet vnarmed lord ſtopt cauſed hearken needleſſe condition whereby time 1 sam 10 protracted helpe ſent meane ſeaſon ouerthrew kind dealing lord reſembles friendly perſon ſpying furious enemy comming fiercely weapon againſt neighbour vnarmed vnprouided meet ſtayeth rage one till haue got himſelfe arm fit encounter may eſcape hand hee hath done ſo commits together knowing innocent partie hauing better cauſe eaſily foile doer wrong thus lord often doth although ſeeth time alſo either quite diuert enemy king aſhur comming againſt weake ieruſalem elſe take people part moſes iſraelites exod 2 12 againſt egyptian fight ſtand ſtill looke pharao zenacherib lord reſerues people till ſuch time ſtrength courage ſuffering may ſo ſay canaanite come vpon people weake late circumciſion greater fauour remoued triall wholly haue onely proofe god goodneſſe haue beſide triall faith grace precious gold triumpheth hauing got victory ouer enemy whether ſpirituall earthly thomas bilney godly man impriſonment ſtrong aſſault giuen owne fleſh againſt paine fire feared ſhould able endure knoweth would haue done triall hotteſt hee weakeſt lord ſo ſuited time fire put feared foile weake became ſtrong heb 11 ouercame heb 11 34 fire yeelding whole body waſt whereas finger could abide candle great grace therefore beleeue apoſtle implieth god wil keepe v ſuch affliction fit 1 cor 10 13 note honour liker ouercome corruption betray cauſe obiect foiles diuers ſeruants god preuented taken vnawares ſtrong trial cranmer firſt aſſault enemy forced yeeld ought c let ſuch know god hath diuers end diuers method teacheth men humbleneſſe knowledge themſelues ſuch aſſaults cannot anſwer end may abler thoſe trial afterward hauing renounced themſelues got firmer hold vpon alſufficiencie god without whoſe protection note weake men let men beware abuſe dealing god owne hurt ſeeing god holding forbearing trial wee could beare doth require exceeding thanks vpon ſerious recording manner dealing v time time alſo growing daily ſtrength ſuffer greater trouble hereafter grace common groſſely inuert note abuſe purpoſe god make vſe ſparing dandling lap armes weare feare expectation affliction altogether whereby longer free weaker ſuffer difference point ye make betwixt theſe ſuch affliction euer vnwelcome intolerable meane vngodly let chriſtians beware therefore ſoftneſſe tenderneſſe furthermore haue heard ſeuenth eighth verſe philiſtims doct 2 verſ 17 18 ammonite ſore vexed iſrael eighteene yeeres time neuer durſt take vp weapon againſt vntill repented began good courage reſiſt aſſembled themſelues againſt may noted liberty courage true repentance bringeth reaſon men conſcience ſee haue dealt trecherouſly god haue nouriſhed followed deſires owne heart contrary knew ſhould haue done haue hope ſuch time neither feele heart ſtrength themſelues deale againſt enemy either ghoſtly bodily plague god threatneth leuiticus people leuit 26 17 ſhould able ſtand enemy ſinned againſt fifth chapter booke ſaid iſrael prouoked iudges 5 8 lord heart ſtand againſt thoſe held bondage wee ſee ſinne diſguiſeth men prepoſterouſly cauſeth thing goe inchanted carried away allurement pleaſures prooueth contrary true wit ſeruice god perfit freedome faith godlineſſe onely giue courage boldneſſe lyon well ſeeing cannot denied bondage like bondman luſts let looke receiue god reward puniſhment life hereafter accordingly liues haue ſought either see iudges 5 8 note vpon order people tooke chooſing gouernour doct 3 verſe 17 18 lord direction may ſee confirming ſending ſpirit vpon iphtah outward incouragement ſtirre vp fight againſt enemy euen like caleb incouraged people like meanes ſuch like caſe ſaying difficultie winning citie hee taketh giue iudges 1 12 achſah daughter wife though people ought haue done meane fight againſt god enemy commandements ſake onely yet neede ſpurres better drawne ſuch incouragements euen magiſtrates miniſters owe duty conſcience god place beate downe ſinne aduance goſpell yet better heartned thereto ſorts incouraged high magiſtrate miniſter beſide readineſſe people dutie ſo euery place ſhall better ſet forward well temporary incouragements though god commandement ſtrongeſt motiue husband wiues ſhould liue kindly together bond promiſe conſcience ſake yet doe much better reſpecteth yeelding mutually owe •• eleventh chapter booke iudges verſ 1 gilead begat iphtah iphtah gileadite valiant man ſonne harlot 2 gileads wife bare ſonnes woman child come age thruſt iphtah ſaid thou ſhalt inherit father houſe thou art ſonne ſtrange woman 3 iphtah fled brother dwelt land tob gathered iphtah idle fellowes went chapter perſon mentioned ſhould goe people ſumme part 4 iſrael warre againſt ammon ſumme chapter part foure ſet downe firſt calling iphtah mentioned vnto 12 verſe ſecond part ſeekes appeaſe ammonits meſſengers moouing reaſons deſiſt warre vaine verſ 29 third part containeth ouerthrow ammonite iphtah verſ 36 fourth ſheweth fell particularly hee performed vow made god might get victory verſ 32 end chapter come firſt part iphtah became guide firſt part captaine ſhewed vnlikely ſhould ſo therefore deſcribed firſt verſe haue ſonne harlot ordinarily might admitted ſuch place ſecond third verſe ſhewed brother therefore whether pride ſcorne emulation expell father houſe ſo faine flie another land ſomuch hee vnlike gouernour yet god ſo brought paſſe prouidence prince gilead euen ſuch driuen away conſtrained ſend againe euen among baniſhed fellowſhip bee guide according decree made former chapter wit ſeeing begun warre ammonite ſo vpon agreement betwixt hee yeelded lord ouerruling action elected iudge ouer 12 verſe theſe particularly lie order firſt deſcribed namely theſe two point one hee ſon harlot firſt verſe ſonne gilead yet valiant man great courage fit warre firſt baſely accounted baſe borne laſt came good eſtimation credit among men well deſerued firſt whereas gilead father iphtah tooke harlot beſide lawfull wife ſee obey commandement lord deuteronomy wit ſhould whore iſrael deut 23 2 demanded god forbad ſuch borne baſtardie enter congregation lord beare office church forbidden man ſo borne worſe others people might know greatly god abhorred whoredome iudiciall conſtitution appertaining iewes iphtah ſo borne yet ſet authoritie ouer people thing god forbad muſt know hee made law himſelfe iewes ſhould lawfull preferre ſuch himſelfe hath authoritie call queſtion hee doth inſtruction ſee iphtah begotten doct verſ 1 harlot law god forbidding ſhould bee whore iſrael obeyed euen wee haue heard gedeon concubine whereby ſee little god law hath regarded age many whether one law ſoeuer wee vnderſtand againſt whoredome neuer common age woful experience proues true ſo want ſuch offender former time may truly ſay number farre exceed antiquitie corrupt example kinde enough licenſe men continue ſtill ſo kindes ſinne verifying full apoſtles prophecie timothy latter day ſhall come perilous time men ſhall 2 tim 3 1 louers themſelues couetous proud boaſters infected diuers ſinnes cauſe commeth wrath god vpon child diſobedience marueile wee haue many plague ſeeing god obeyed almoſt thing ſo may euery one particularly ſay himſelfe moſt obedient ſo ſhall bleſſing ſin man bad enough ſo gilead great man ſhould haue puniſht others rather father familie reproch euen dauid sampſon iuda reuben ala meane perſon ſees commandement god greater force euery great man bold diſpenſe growes thinke ſcarecrow ſaith boldly ſtrumpet prouerbs tuſh ti trick truth ſuch trick youth lord wrath deſtroyed 24 thouſand iſrael yea great enemie church balaam fruſtrate curſed attempt againſt iſrael curſed numb 24 9 finde heart curſe god people ſought bring equiualent plague vpon congregation could inuent fit miſchieuous plot intice vncleanneſſe moabitiſh woman idolatrie heatheniſh god therefore great iudgement god hang ouer land luſt eye maine branch whereof filthines vnlimitted luſt ſorts eſpecially place darkneſſe wee eaſily coniecture perſwade guiltie redreſſe oh lamentable ſuch ſpots note aſſemblies ſuffered boldly ſpit face modeſtie hold vp head aloft hauing better end ſtaffe meane greater aduantage againſt accuſers commonly againſt ſhould moue v ſue lord ſuch ſhould noted ſhamed inordinate perſons reſt may blanke feare example ſo anger lord ſtaied zeale phiniees lord cauſe thruſting thorow zimri cozbi numb 25 8 ſhamefull abomination ſhould word preached forcible tranſgreſſors ſhould ſee price boldnes ſo ſhould law magiſtrate take better effect become ridiculous ſo ſhould feare plague iehu denounceth vpon iehoram ſaying peace ſeeing abomination whoredomes 2 king 9 22 thy mother iezabel ſtill great number ſay leſſe becauſe haue noted fruite ſinne well former part booke onely ſay vngodly ſort take lord bridle reſtraine fleſh lewd courſe adultery sauiour note breaking filthie heart euen ſores ſcabs note body fruites corrupted blood let people god learne dutie euen poſſeſſe veſſels holineſſe keepe themſelues vnſpotted pure preſerue body ſpirits chaſtnes except wil make temple holy ghoſt ſtie vncleane loathſome luſt fit driue ſpirit god away otherwiſe lord ſhall ſet marke vpon worſe brand theeſe euen marke infamie dare promiſe repentance ſelfe ſhall quite waſh liue ſtaine ſhall ſtill continue ſinne ſcarlet dye dauid ſpeakes pſal 51 pſal 51 2 end verſe ſaid iphtah valiant man •• ant verſe 1 muſt know thoſe time warre courage valiantnes gift much ſet good vſe though blemiſh vpon ſonne harlot ſinne yet lord couered may ſay excellent gift fortitude made much deſired croſſe may ſee hee thus abaſed yet vnder ſome ſuch chaſtizement like ſhould haue worſe man greater danger ſuch blemiſhes body occaſions god worke turne doct 2 minde better matter bring loue hold partie greater trouble thereby reade mephiboſheth ionathans young ſonne lame 2 sam 9 3 2 sam 2 9 feete could reſiſt dauid iſhboſheth vncle great toyle little preuailing liued peaceably king fauour fed table could haue better ſtate whereas enioyed limmes libertie hard ſay whether hee would haue ſtirring taking part iſhboſheth owne ouerthrow bin like haue befalne whē abner forſook bin preuented violent death thus doth lord paul ſpeaks clothe 1 cor 12 23 vnſeemly part moſt honour experience many worthie men excellent part church commonwealth haue yet deformity one among reſt late godly memory maſter perkins worthy inſtrument lame hand teſtified often defect occaſion training vp learning vnfit thereby employment wherein god admirable prouidence appeared making lame blemiſh might occaſion good church indeed common ſpeech nature noteth ſome men ſiniſter notorious quality much rather ſuch need pray much vſe good meanes rectifie perfect inner man purge corruption leſt imputation iuſtly caſt vpon wee muſt know god hath ſtroke nature laieth hand vpon many hee might glorified ſhew workes ſenſe ſomewhat diuers sauiour ſpeakes blind man ioh 9 ſuch notable ioh 9 3 grace gift notorious naturally pitie ſuch deafe lame blinde doe well part curſed cham deride ſuch lord oft turnes pitie admiration yea condemnes ſuch ſhamefull vnthankfulnes haue bodily blemiſhes inwardly tainted naught god done part vſe phraſe one way abſolon wemme top toe diſguiſed ſoule faire bodie carried within euen ſee compleatnes many man perſon drawes degree halter many woman beautie make ſtrumpet whether two deſired copper ring precious iewell ſet golden common peble many child haue parent liuing glorie bold ſawcie lewdly diſpoſed ſo better vnborne meane depriued parent chaſtizement nothing vnferiour blemiſh ſcarre haue driuen liue vnder good gouernment good order vſe hereof let v wonder though lord mixe trouble bleſſings may ſay blemiſhes beauty want perfection paul lifted vp third heauen ſo ſafe buffeted little 2 cor 12 7 abaſement may preuent greateſt yea ſay ſome chaſtizement laid vpon v lord doth keepe v oft time periſhing 1 cor 11 32 world ſo ſickneſſe pouertie doe take heart ſinning whereas health wealth imbolden thereto therefore thine affliction come lord meane apparent cauſe thy drawing thy ſelfe ſeene ſo thou ſuffereſt euill dealing waite ſome ſpeciall good come thereby vnto thee end labour make vſe bee hindering thy bodily commoditie loſſe diſeaſe note paine ſuch like looke benefit thy ſoule thou haue rich large ſupplie way ſo lord wont deale end may ſee cauſe ſay dauid good v haue afflicted ſometime ſpeech vertuous pſal 119 71 religious gentlewoman well exerciſed god nurture falne hard trouble heauy croſſe many ſhe confidently looke ſome great bleſſing ordinarie moſt part ſome addition new grace quickning old saint paul ſaith ſame word god ſendeth affliction rom 8 28 note good euen ſo ſhould looke v ſhould ſo vnwelcome v ſo diſcontentedly borne gone vnder commonly moſt part blemiſh baſtardie wee heard brother thruſt verſ 2 vniuſt cruell dealing hee done father ſhame raiſed therby ought haue couered bin able rather haue reuiued ſeeth ſonne part ſorrow enough ſo branded diſgrace ſo ſmal cauſe brother ſhould adde affliction vnto ſhamefull fact taught beware wee doe doct deſpiſe affliction baſe meane contemptible ſame commonly world eſpecially bee good part gift god whereby may bee like bee profitable church commonwealth yea without reſpect alſo becauſe chriſt died brother taught god carrie ſelues toward thē though wicked taught nothing learne pſalme happie iudgeth wiſely pſal 41 1 afflicted wee ſhould pitie mourne mourne ſuch caſes wiſedome put caſe ſuppoſe ſuch affliction abaſement caſt vpon ſelues would deſire pitied regarded beſides haue learned iudgement ſhall hard hearted mercileſſe without iames 2 13 mercie therefore adde ſorrow band alreadie wrapped deeply therein great ſinne ſo threatens committers ſhall goe vnpuniſhed receiue like meaſure themſelues god hand ſo ſometime ſuffer like diſgrace harme hand offered iniurie god lifteth vp head aduerſitie haue abuſed done wrong vnto though thought downe ſhould get vp againe recouer take ſtomacke reuenge iniury done much eagerly ioſeph might haue done brother owne conſciences witneſſes aduanced vnnaturall dealing meane eſtate would moſt certainly haue done ſo indeed feare god gen 50 17 ſtaied although feare ſuch reuenge come pitileſſe dealing others yet enough diſſwade true chriſtian yea hard meaſure offering brother liuing meane ſoeuer beſide inconueniences ſo hee ſhould bring himſelfe hard conceit ſo hee ſhould neuer bee able doe good counſell good inſtruction exhortation comfort ſhould ſtand need hope ſeruant god ſhould loſe eſpecially miniſter note ſo precious thing helpe ſaue ſoule wit harden heart meaneſt againſt vnchriſtian handling ſhould therefore refuſe take good afterward yet ſay muſt tolerate winke ſinnes euils great perſons ſometimes crueltie wrong ſhrouded vnder name policy according rule maſter machiauel ſeeke bring vnder diſcredit corriuals men equall worthineſſe may better themſelues practiſe principle going downe riſe vp ſunke comming vp hill againe whence fallen ſinke againe thruſt backward tread vpon hee get vp thus dealt daniel aduerſaries court darius thus dealt enemy dauid saul court many petie lower kind iniurie among inferiours heire deceaſed inteſtate partie hauing ſtroke hand defraudeth mother brother inheritance portion dominering ouer driuing vnequall condition elſe endleſſe bootleſſe ſuites like may ſaid men mocke others euen affliction ſecretly vpbraideth ſelfe crookednes blindnes c god willing ſhall bee ſaid hereafter due place meane time let theſe conſider reward mocking ſuch example thoſe bethelites 2 king 2 child thoſe philiſtims ſmarted 2 king 2 23 made sampſon maygame yet heathen ſhall portion chriſtians men diſcretion thinke law dealt ſeuerely againſt iphtah thruſting publique place worſhip theſe thought enough except draue alſo number people god amōg meſhec kedar meane infidel let dauid ſpeake bitter puniſhment ſaith saul curſed haue caſt inheritāce 1 sam 26 29 lord returne therfore woe curſeth innocent double woe addeth affliction lord affliction iſhmael curſed mocking izhak doubly accurſed thoſe babylonian gen 21 9 10 ſeeing ieruſalems ruine cried downe downe pſal 137 7 race ground haileſtones vpon ripe eares corne vnſeaſonable putting man eye hath one ſo may vtterly blinde cruell ſo adding ſorrow heauie hearted cauſed lord make law iewes grieue ſtranger enough place euen exod 22 21 alone make ſad heart let rule apoſtle conclude reioyce reioyce weepe weepe remembring thy ſelfe thou wouldeſt haue others thee ſeeing neighbour houſe fire one place wil take ſome brand rom 12 15 ſet fire place may quite deſtroyed followeth third verſe wherein wee ſee brethren verſe 3 hard dealing faine flie whither could ſhelter euen thither among ſtrangers might haue miſcaried altogether god greatly regarded whereby wee may ſee iniurie oppreſſion ſome cauſeth innocent vndergoe much hardneſſe thing may long enough complained one many ſo offending amend great cry complaint heard euery inferiours vnderlings wrong hard meaſure offered mightie ſuch haue power ouer pitileſſe landlord ſuch haue men aduantage put ſhifts money make take vp condition vndoe ſuch exaction good flea skinne body vngodly parent labouring raiſe ſome one child caſting reſt compell ſeeke fortune prophanely ſpeake driue extremity alſo ſtepfathers mother cruell maſters dame may reckoned among many doer iniury giue two three inſtances among many leſt ſhould bee tedious let reſt kind conſidered theſe theſe cruell dealing depriuing neceſſaries laying heauy burthen vpon cauſe poore orphan vnderlings runne away eſau iacob ſhiftleſſe ſtarue miſcarrie euen ſuch dealing reſt cruell void mercie let take warning poore oppreſſed crie eares lord ſhall bee heard ſhall pay full iniury haue offered would loth leaſt wrong god make come againſt ſhal bold thus prouoke grieue neighbour ſhall ſting serpent deadly vnwelcome wiſe part man iudge ſinne iudgeth many dangerous effect follow vpon ſeeth abſurd vnſeemely thing wealthy play lord controller ouer baſer poorer ſort content make drudge ſlaues doe meaneſt workes word deed taking liberty vſurpe ouer made crow ouer sometimes rating reproches nickname vpbraiding pouerty deſpiſe maker while making pray racking poore commodity buy whereas yet worke driue loweſt wage may hard time thing deare chargeable poore ſtandeth need worme troden vpon turneth againe draweth onely weapon hath tongue meane reuile raile moſt diſdainefully vpon rich miſfortunes oppreſſion ſay euery wealthy perſon ſay odious ſo indeed dealing bad prouoked doe badly god teach wealthy conſider wiſelie eſtate poore therefore men exaſperate turne ſhifting euery man ſpeake againſt conſiders greatneſſe ſinne vrge law neceſſitie know hard vndergoe theſe ſhifters turne vpon oppreſſors tongue hand alſo reioycing ſtealing purloyning doe crie complaine dammage ſuſtained yet ſtealing cauſed others robbery onely one rich theefe ſtole openly feare ſecret defends himſelfe hath robbed firſt ſtole himſelfe indeed god mercy oppreſſion poore ſo riſe ſeeth griping wherewith one rich perſon oppreſſeth another vpſhot wrecked vpon pooreſt worſt make part good ſo little harme done kind great part cauſe good gouernment ciuill reſtraineth ſuch ſhould reade heare diſorders place wanting ſetled order execution law would amaze v teach v practiſe equitie moderation mind towards inferior might preuent ſuch ill meaſure hand rather god hand reuenge hardneſſe iphtah ſuſtained hand yet worth noting god prouided ſtrange countrie able maintaine diuers reſorted frame fight againſt enemy god thus scripture verified doct 2 verſ 3 father mother forſake lord taketh vp dealt ioſeph heſter mordecay many others protection reached maintaining ſuch needy diſtreſſed perſons bodily neceſſities temporary ſorrowes much bring alſo note fauour himſelfe ſo wicked world may bee weaned defilement better ſort many thouſands haue father mother bring vp leſſe admirable oh therefore madneſſe pitied multiplicitie danger miſeries ſwarme euery cling cleaue neerevnder god wing ſafetie found enioyed yet ſeeke way haue got ſtand get thing yet account come although priueledge faithfull onely haue god prouider vpholder yet euery hangby catcheth ſpeech end ſaith hope god prouide aſwell hath done c wheras yet neither haue faith beleeue grace beare croſſe fall vnlooked extremitie yet applie themſelues vnto ſuch meanes god bleſſing may giue hope ſufficiencie man ſhift vſe bad courſes maintaine himſelfe yet truth ſay beleeues god prouide firſt beleeues ſees bring deſire paſſe faith worſe vſes vnlawfull meanes whereas god make promiſe obeyer commandement curſeth wicked practizes iphtah prouided firſt god gaue gift valour aboue others taught ſet gift worke good purpoſe ſo beleeuing god would wanting obtained fruit labour courſe ſuch take yet great confidence profeſſe doubt god feede hauing giuen mouth clothe hauing giuen body yea ſaue ſeeing bee hath made theſe hope blind hope neither faith parent contentation thanks fruite enioy deſires much leſſe patience depending vpon god fruſtrate often verſe thing wee haue yet heard laid verſ 3 god prouidence iphtah ſet theſe men reſorted needie hee ſay ſet againſt ammonite carried away could get meane warring againſt iſrael namely gilead great wealthie citie prince gilead agreed among themſelues people hee firſt began warre ammonite ſhould captaine guide rule ouer thus came paſſe ſent meane iphtah intertaine captaine caſt among hath ſaid end third verſe ſaid hee vſed doct 2 verſ 3 ſeruice certaine wandering fellowes appeares dwelling place conſtant ſet worke againſt god enemy could haue better employed dauid alſo learne 1 sam 25 7 ſuch idle needy without imployment ſhould▪ brought wiſdome godly care men magiſtrate 〈…〉 ranged within compaſſe vnto ſome worke profitable maintaining themſelues putting idle courſe ſuch vagrant perſons waite doe miſchiefe theſe neither caſt altogether bad quality pitied relieued miſery yet much nouriſhed harboured houſes townes religious make conſcience themſelues ſpending time whether gentleman entertaine many houſes ſhiftleſſe office others gift wit courage skill c wiſely directed fitteſt moſt profitable obiect leſt breake outrage gouerned done time labour exerciſe habit vſe welcome idlenes beſides cutting much ſinne againſt god man whereas want prouident care wee ſee many growing vp man eſtate practiſe leaudneſſe licentiouſneſſe waxe impudent incorrigible filling church noyſome example offence commonwealth theft beggery repeate haue ſaid chap 9 3 much good hath done late yeeres diminiſh number ſuch cut rogueiſh life enioyning labor croſſed meane good order fooliſh pity ſome incourage continue begging idle life giuing reliefe rather needy dwell much good might yet enioyed thereby take ſuch ſeruice able ought ſo doe cauſe would inſtruct rule looke carefully iphtah dauid wee ſhould haue ſuch diſorders outrage church commonwealth haue neither ſhould ſuch reproch keepe ſuch bad one men houſes though rude bad themſelues yet good care ouer might brought better order added ruled kept compaſſe deliuered magiſtrate committed houſe correction sixtieth fovre sermon eleventh chapter booke ivdges verſe 4 proceſſe time child ammon made warre iſrael 5 child ammon fought iſrael elder gilead went fetch iphtah land tob 6 ſaid vnto iphtah come captaine may fight child ammon 7 iphtah anſwered vnto elder gilead yee hate expell father houſe come yee vnto time tribulation 8 elder gilead ſaid vnto iphtah therfore turne againe thee thou maiest goe v fight againſt child ammon head ouer inhabitant gilead 9 iphtah ſaid vnto elder gilead yee bring mee home againe fight againſt child ammon lord giue ſhall bee head 10 elder gilead ſaid vnto iphtah lord witneſſe betweene v doe according thy word 11 iphtah went elder gilead people made head captaine ouer iphtah rehearſed word lord mizpeh theſe eight verſes ſee god brought paſſe prouidence prince gilead iphtahs ſumme theſe verſes brother vniuſtly expelled citie driuen owne law deſire home againe fight againſt ammonite might better effect goe themſelues ſolemne manner place baniſhment euen land tob entreaty humbleneſſe offer gouernment chiefe command battell againſt ammon iphtah firſt caſting teeth vnkindneſſe beforetime meet ſuch diſcourteſie diſgrace offered time paſt ſhould altogether buried ſilence vnmentioned requireth good aſſurance fidelitie becauſe might doubted preſent neceſſity draue make offer rather loue towards tendered granted accordingly yeeldeth requeſt went home lord ordering buſineſſe found whole congregation readie confirme election elder gilead alſo afterward lord himſelfe ſo iphtah made captaine proceeded worke whereto god appointed generally teacheth ſtrangely god turneth time ſtate doct ver 4 5 thing wiſdome whereby ruleth diſpoſeth doth triall comfort contrary againſt expectation deſire enemy iphtahs comfort croſſing gilead raiſe warre teach v fit learne depend vpon alone haue word direction ſo need aſhamed whatſoeuer come paſſe whereas haue followed owne humor either croſſing wronging iphtah may driuen ſtand need ſeeke helpe hand little croſſe v haue reproched ourſelues bragging boaſting may receiue foile hand haue ſo abuſed ſo may ſhame bee made eate word haue proudly ſet vp ſaile doe depend vpon vncertaine hope future commodity momentany preferment wee may bee diſapointed iuſt reproch eaſily lord ſo altering changing thing doth herein daily fruſtrating many men hope depend vpon blind fortune promiſing themſelues ſhall wiſh vtterly ſhutting god attempt might make v wiſe example hereof king aram many ſeene oft appointed army ſecretly againſt king iſrael 2 king 6 10 11 diſapointed god expectation till raged fretted herevpon iames reprooueth reſolution man hee himſelfe iames 4 13 14 himſelfe ſay theſe changeable thing morrow goe ſuch citie gaine c yet salomon telleth v cannot tell one prou 27 1 day may bring foorth yet men ceaſe determine doe thriue reuenge take pleaſure paſſe time ſo reckon deale ſeaſons although know weather altereth price thing yet wee ſell buy commodity note hand wee know make good performe couenants v neither willing price alter ſtand word yet god doth bring paſſe ofttimes ioynting ſuch common doings onely ſmaller matter alſo richeſt greateſt affaire thouſand way according good pleaſure therfore wiſdome ſubmit ſelues prouidence thing ſtand ſtiffely vpon owne ſeeing breake ſtomackes ſpight heart diſappointing v except doe ſo ſhall neuer quiet returne againe ſee god brought principally good ſeruant iphtah worke enlargement though ſhame conuiction aduerſaries iphtah neither himſelfe made meanes meſſengers writing ſuite friend returne baniſhment neither would lord permit doe ſo prouided better ſhould haue calling returned blindly home priuate exile great matter could god worke haue ſeene behold lord rather haue iphtah abide ſometime diſtreſſe baſeneſſe hee may bee fetcht home publike conſent nation ioſeph priſon ſo much gratifying themſelues greateſt perſons gilead requeſting hand profeſſing themſelues highly beholding vnto hee would grace returning diſgraced caſting nay muſt note ſent come friend ranckeſt enemy former eſtate ſubiect lord gouernor carnal man hearing oh teeth water finger itch ſucceſſe iphtah doth wiſh might haue deſire vpon enemy triumph ouer oh foole prerogatiue thee claime glorie innocencie fruite faith patient waiting vpon god committing man way weldoing another example leſt wee ſhould ſay alone mordecai lord might haue put king mind peruſe chronicle recognize mordecaies well deſeruing long ala obſcure fauour compariſon god meant worthy ſeruant farre better ſo would haue breake moſt ſeaſonable ſeaſon prouidence might moſt manifeſted therby therefore great haman working ouerthrow al church opportunitie bring forth record ſo vnder one aduerſary may defeated ſhame church notably deliuered danger mordecai reſcued onely brought forth trouble higheſt honor rankeſt enemie could forced giue come forth ye diſciples machiauel ſet braines worke politiqueſt manner ye ſee ye teach nouices ſuch way ſo famouſly ſupplant oppoſites ſet vp themſelues roome ye cannot doubtleſſe ye could yet ye teach diueliſh policie contriue whereby haue cauſe ſhame repentance boaſting inſulting therefore digreſſe iphtah buſie god matter neuer thinking reuenge owne priuate wrong loe lord buſie iphtahs affaire contriuing may bring foorth trouble enough perſwade v make god factor aduocate doct 2 pleade v bring matter yea tie owne hand behind v putting forth vnlawfully owne defence may ſay truth thoſe word roll thy way caſt pſalm 37 5 thy care vpon iehouah giue thee thy heart deſire ſo iphtah euen iſſue would haue deſired ſought reuenge euill meanes bad perſon meane haue enemy page conduct home commander ſay obtained iphtah vſing euill meanes without vſing man would haue needed ſhifting ſtirring plotting god effect without theſe ioſeph priſon forgotten pharaoh butler ſet free lord remember bring foorth farre greater honour thus hee dealt relye hee iphtah poore ſouldier baſtard baniſhed mordecai deſpiſed ſtranger ioſeph poore priſoner wee haue heard doe like v would cleaue vnto alſufficient god honour putting ouer deale wholly v wee ſit ſtill goe ſeruice leſſe doe truſt matter wholly giue vp ſelues doer work maſter profeſſeth himſelfe wholly bring matter paſſe ſelues much labour ſinne ſhould neuer able compaſſe haue heard iphtah repaired vnto chiefe gilead ſumme verſe 6 7 8 free large offer made hee would goe thus lord prouided ſeruant followeth anſwere iphtah therfore might well told prince gilead fault ſo good occaſion opportunitie offered iniuriouſly dealt driuing among againſt right law hereupon hee demanded could ſtreight ſeeke among indeed could ſound reaſon requeſt fauour hated hauing receiued ſuch meaſure could hee truſt could denie ſhame remember would preferre ſaid make recompence rather perſwade thereof confeſſed whole matter vnto wilfull ſtood neede ſaw well cruell ſpightfull againſt hee would neuer haue condeſcended vnto would haue held racke learne god doth oft make v ſtand need helpe doct verſ 6 hate deſpiſe firſt end wee may ſee fault hating take ſhame cauſe secondly ouercome enuie need one another would grow ſtrong cauſe lord ſo diſpoſe tribe euer needed one another ſee ſtories booke bookes samuel might hold one another againſt idolater might hate ſpirituall reſpect ſo god made people ſtand need apoſtles railed vpon ſecond act 2 37 act ſo weighed would neuer hate fall doe eaſily one another conſidering plunge may put thereby driuen ſtand need euen among hand doe v ſome great hurt yet ſome doe ſo reſt owne ſufficiencie want note wiſe foreſight caſualties may befall pride heart preſent eſtate would ſtand neede none neither beholding vnto nouriſhing hardnes heart high mindednes ſo may glorie themſelues therfore ſuch rather offer violence themſelues vſe helpe ſuch like ahab ſpake michaiah ſtood great need help wiſhed vſe godly iehoſaphat ſaith hate doth prophecie 1 king • 2 • good better haue beholding reſpect ſuch paſſions ſome reſtraint nature bridling corrupt heart ſeeke enemie ſeeing god doth make v ſtand need one another ſhould wee make heart bow bend eſpecially ſhall alſo owne good benefit although muſt ſay ſo commendable v profitable v thus farre ſeeke may feare better thereby naturall man ſtraine himſelfe aduantage doe croſſe ourſelues euill heart rebell v would carrie v contrarie ſo ſtoope ouercomming poyſon corruption alſo conſcience ſake may pleaſe god therein grace worthie thing indeed done ſhould doe well help one another perſwade turne away alienate rancour ſtomacke enemy iacob hath commendably gone v herein eſau dauid gen 32 18 2 king 6 22 toward saul prophet eliſha perſwade king iſrael handle enemy kindly fell hand yet ſide muſt take heed well flattering men euill hating thē wee may ſinne obtaine get men fauour beare croſſe contentedly euer wee driuen ſeeke helpe whoſe ſinne wee haue ſet outſelues againſt wee haue done duty though wee receiue ill meaſure good god make way v al ſhall well expedient turne heart towards v ſaid let v make none enemy needleſſe prouoking hold peace poſſible yea euen enemy would theſe haue done iphtah vſed become iehoram 2 king 3 eliſha perſiſted reiecting motion made becauſe father ſcorned 2 king 3 13 predeceſſor elija therefore wee wiſe god may ſo order reſiſt proud men euen haue prouoked raſhnes may place doe v much hurt none ſaue perſons haue ſcorned helpe v neede saul newly created king ſome iuſt humour therefore called ſonnes belial defied tuſh ſay 1 sam 10 27 new vpſtart ſhall ſuch baſe fellow ſaue v ſo would acknowledge take king ſhortly ſhould haue done nahaſh came vpon deſpiſed fellow accounted holpen ſeeking saul victorie demaunded people theſe ſpake againſt saul ſo deſpightfully ſaying shall raigne ouer v bring foorth let ſlaine therefore may auoid ſhame imputation folly extreames abandon man nothing worth ſeeke acknowledging onely helper let v learne moderation towards neither burdenſome greateſt yet beare ſcornefull minde toward meaneſt samaritan man fell among theeues knowne one ſcorned better like one would haue looſed relieued extremitie yet may well thinke ſuch caſe hee muſt haue rare proud ſtomack would haue lien ſtill wounded paine rather beholding helpe let giue poore caueat concerning humour muſt depend vpon yet hauing proud heart wiſh depended vpon ſometimes vtter word effect ſay vnto ill becommeth richeſt euen may bee ſure one time ſmart proud ſtomacks much worſe beſeemeth pooreſt rather salomon ſaith ſhould vſe entreatie let ſuch breake heart make holy vſe god affliction vpon ſubmit themſelues bearing burthen ſo heart wealthier iuſtly hardned againſt alſo ſee deſiring helpe iphtah doct 2 verſ 6 expelled oft time thing men reiect god chuſeth doe great enterprizes moſt cleerely verified sauour ſtone builder refuſed made chiefe act 4 11 corner ſtone ſo alſo liuely verified apoſtles paul himſelfe ſaying himſelfe good done reſt al made 1 cor 4 9 gazing ſtocke world angel men ſo day doth lord gather church together counted abiects world doth make member church thoſe deareſt vnto counted meete liue earth therefore let faithfull ſeruant god diſmaied diſcourteſies diſcouragements ſhall meete vnthankfull world lord ſeeth workes hath neuer leſſe account plentifully reward point need ſay much hauing ſo often handled booke alreadie sixtie five sermon eleventh chapter booke ivdges let v proceed iphtah anſwere made elder gilead firſt therefore hee repeateth verſ 7 rippeth vp fault time paſt committed againſt telling comming diſtreſſe might well marueiled neuer hauing made agreement eaſie ſeene hee anſwered might lawfully doe putting away gall bitternes meete ſhould ſecure euen ſo lawfull v ſo good occaſion offered doe hee like caſe wit rehearſe men great iniurying v would make nothing yet neceſſarie followed practiſed v alwaies iphtah ſaid namely repeating doct verſ 7 fault partie able fit beare weightines matter requireth without due regard ripping vp matter note fault betwixt ſuch haue variance oft time reuiuing increaſing ſtrife betwixt party theſe men gilead ſeeing many offence bin great apparant excluding therefore hee maketh mention iniurie offered hauing ſo good opportunitie ſo meekly kindly yet gedeon wel ripping vp burying iniury done men ephraim paſſing ouer ſilence yet ſore prouoked therefore herein muſt craue god ſpirit wiſedome direct note v deale like caſes whether repeate wrong done vnto v farre word heate paſſion vttered paſſe ſhall found expedient rehearſe wrong yet muſt reſolued v doe without bitternes prouoking haue hurt v make ſee fault well end affection loue let v goe ſeeke hand caſt teeth eaſe ſatisfie ſtomackes thereby ſo ſtinging earneſtly deſiring good thing wee ſay neither denying mentioning offence helpe wee yeeld benefit ſhall ſee cauſe ſpeake let v alſo take heed harſhnes tartnes ſpeaking whereby heart otherwiſe eaſily incenſed ſet fire againſt aware anſwere exprobration made againſt verſ 7 let v verſe note doe deny confeſſe doct verſ 8 iniured indeed ſhew conueying cleanly another way vtterly vnwilling heare telling came namely make captaine deliuerance kindneſſe offered hoped ſaid make amends may learne commendable followed doe grant faulted iniured euer bee done v contrarily waſhing away men fault whereof may iuſtly bee conuicted facing lying otherwiſe hiding cloaking extenuating muſt carefully auoided meanes wee doe lay open god put remembrance onely way couer confeſſing renouncing ſuch belongs promiſe forgiuenes prou 28 13 pſal 32 1 called true couering god himſelfe pſalm 32 wee haue ſinned wee ought acknowledge according nature qualitie kinde thereof whether god man publikely priuatly yea one according iames direction theſe word acknowledge fault one another cannot brought iames 5 16 ſo willingly much hardly offer reſiſtance violence corrupt nature ſome ſinnes doe require yet come yeeld ſo farre yet doe houerly faſhion get ſeeke ſo confeſſing howſoeuer may bee commendable men yet god nothing worth haſted hearing much matter harſh doct 2 hearing ſore againſt bewraieth corruption noted v ouer common wit vnwilling haue fault brought light care little ſeldome heare note thing againſt corrupt nature euill practiſe againſt yet ioh 3 19 ſhould ready heare hardeſt knowing wee debters rom 8 12 fleſh enemy profeſſed token doubt filthie hard heart much putrified ſhould ready purge poyſon putrifaction burſt kill v particular practiſe moſt men like theſe gileadites haue ſlandered brother whiſpering report corner thinke ſafe enough comming light againſt afterwards charged make good take ſhame thereof eating word cunningly winde themſelues argument turning ſpeech ſome matter thinke better pleaſe accuſer leaſt may couer owne lewdneſſe preſſed oh ſay let v heare note ſpeake ſeaſon c honeſt dealing lay loade reproch vpon innocent aggrauate conceit falſe rumour againſt truth ſhould bee brought foorth ſauing preſeruing brother good name leaue briar vnconſcionably let ioſephs brother condemne theſe confeſſed ſinne againſt brother concealed propertie ſeruant god hunt purſue himſelfe inward ſinne yea though one wee reade dauid oft haue pſal 51 3 pſal 73 3 done ought doe many thoſe alſo manifeſt men men doe accuſe iudge themſelues ſorer ſinnes priuate note aggrauating bewailing god taking ſhame themſelues committing giue teſtimonie thereof men alſo doe reſiſt aloue loue heare others marueile ſo bad common take priuate reproofe vnkindly nay rebelliouſly leuit 19 17 hating offer yet commanded god doe euen ſo publique hearing fareth inſomuch ſome men conſciences touched liuely manner wholeſome warning yet wee ſee vnwelcome moſt excepted againſt though without leaſt cauſe ſo contrary rather wit yeelding thankes vſe cannot willing heare fault ſhould wiſe giue libertie ſelues nay violence bee brought commit theſe point ſee chap 9 iothams fleeing brother c offer elder compared iphtahs ſpeech verſ 9 ninth verſe demanding aſſurance thereof indeed vrge cauſe queſtion may ariſe could offer iphtah iudge could take good conſcience firſt ſeeing authoritie offer secondly ſeeing deut 23 2 blocke way baſtard might enter congregation lord beare office anſwer queſtions one lord directed thus doe bound law guided herein whole ſtory chapter teſtifieth lord excludeth ſuch deuteronomy bearing publike office terrifie men begetting baſtards world reprochfull lie open much miſerie yet forbidding ſinne preuaileth men commonneſſe ſinne prophane practiſe adulterer much bewraieth thinke meanes bringing baſtards world pitie take ſhall ſhunne weariſome company wiſe tediouſneſſe child vnwelcome annoiances count accompany oh monſters doe thinke auoiding burden lawfull wife child eſcape blot vnlawfull libertie euen reprochfull whoredomes doth god ſet brand vpon curſed fruit prooued experience beſides diſcouragement baſtards oppreſſed ſcorne opprobrie world ſelfe enough hold vnder lord denieth commonly good education ſo prooue vagabond curſeth common indiſpoſition aukeneſſe nature retaine inſtruction gouernment laſtly tainted vile odious note quality ſuch deriue vitious vncleane parent therefore greater ſinne prohibition moſt wickedly fil world cauſe brought ſo great calamitie yet innocent cannot doe ſo god bee thanked ſhouldred hope ſaluation reſpect perſons god feare caſt lord actes 10 34 yet ſuch vnconſcionable beaſtlineſſe thoſe graceleſſe perſons owne filthy luſt would thus endanger loathſome practiſe thoſe vncleane locuſtes popiſh monkes frier land elſewhere hath abundantly witneſſed world former age see firſt verſe chapter iphtah hauing found ill dealing hand haue heard verſ 10 11 lead conſcience feare god caſt partialitie vſed crueltie againſt therfore truſt vpon word requireth oath god mouthes may gathered making god witneſſe promiſe made vnto ſo tieth ſure couenanting otherwiſe wiſely prouided therefore went meſſengers mizpeh rehearſed theſe thing lord ſo promiſe made might ſtand ſure god deſired beholder witneſſe let v learne men haue dealt vnfaithfully diſhoneſtly doct verſ 10 haue wrong offered bee credited although bee bound bond whereas bare word taken went honeſt men haue giuen iuſt cauſe ſuſpect credit ſay may noted one cauſe note men leſſe credit adaies vnfaithfull dealing whereas ſome cannot truſted borrow vpon word bond want credit doe goe without would ſtand exceeding great ſtead vpholding maintenance fruit owne doings haue ſought owne vntruſtineſſe breaking promiſe whereby haue loſt credit together honeſty theſe day many care deceiue yea vndoe others therefore come nought themſelues alſo moſt part whereas ſome faithful conſcionable vpon bare credit liue maintaine charge borrowing men forbearing whereas obiected behalfe theſe vnthrifts deceiuers muſt borne withall though cannot pay haue borrowed anſwer ſee likelihood repay ſo much ſeeke borrow take hand men good argueth little honeſty therefore well content wind cunningly craftily whereby alſo impoueriſh ſome others diminiſh occupying leaſt manner though goe aboue reach detract belly paſtime pay owner therby ſhewing care come due right whether euer haue againe theſe thing thus may note beautie religion ſuch planted men ſoundly indeed winnes credit hath contrary dealing maketh approoued faithfulneſſe conſcionableneſſe honeſty whereas void liueth vtter diſcredit iuſt reproch whereas ye ſay ſome make ſhew religion doe yet deceiue deale vntruſtily creditor anſwer ſhew religion practiſe carrieth beauty ſpeake taken religious offend way know wee religion imboldneth ſuch dealing haue ſo little ſo true alſo ſome haue credit deſeruedly doe ſweetneſſe gaine take heed hold due owner ſometimes though may little reioyce let know ſinne greater yet notwithſtanding ſome dare neither meanes brought doe ſo ye aske doe men take bond ſuch approoued honeſty haue broken loſt credit better truſted common men anſwer becauſe diſtruſted firſt ſeeing mortal ſo men might loſe good ſecuritie thoſe whoſe hand ſecondlie contention may ariſe betwixt poſteritie party ſhal come againe ſeeing ſuch deceiuers world would prouoke euen honeſt contention ſee hole open eſpie aduantage rule holdeth alſo firme good religious action god honour chriſtian continue conſtant loue truth church god fruit whereof ſound good report ſo man begin warpe bewray hollowneſſe treachery either ſtaine eaſily waſht neither looke currant eſtimation reuerēce ſcarce obtain ſo much afterward credited profeſſion although men truſt veſſels oyle wine ſound whole yet begin leake run commit thing vnto danger loſing sauiour asked peter ſayeſt thou mat 16 16 17 tooke word deſerued whereas afterward hee ſatisfied one two profeſſions affection simon iohn 21 15 loueſt thou good reaſon made great cracke credit therefore forſworne chriſt deſerued vpon owne bare note word anſwere beleeued thoſe haue deceiued opinion church touching religion falling error ſchiſme pietie honeſty groſſe offence may thanke themſelues euer afterward people god haue iealouſic reade eccleſiaſticall hiſtorie baptized partie reuolted either religion good conſcience miriam arrogancie church admitted without ſerious repentance confeſſion fault ſlipt ſecond time practiſed greater ſeueritie towards enioyning repentance ſpace time remaine church famous yea ſome euen reuerendeſt father thoſe time cyprian others grew erronious opinion ſuch admitted without rebaptization former ſeale quite puld ſin meane ſeale forgiueneſſe therefore let chriſtians looke ſtanding didiuell poſſible quite ouerthrow cannot hee note foile take away crowne reioycing faithfulneſſe conſtancie impudent perſon hauing foully diſhonored god profeſſion wil hold vp head boldly claime old priuiledge doe ſee among men one periured forger diſabled euer bearing witneſſe againſt publike court haue men ſuch one ſuſpition doth treaſon taint euen blood traitor ſo euen loyall goeth better hee hath got patent reſtitution pardon fellonie doth forfeit ſecond offence like kind enough another thing worth marking much iphtah went verſ 11 ſo eaſily iuſt quarrell hee againſt gilead ſo ſoone done wiſely told concerned heare aſſured demanded ſay taught hold hart iniurie againſt v prou 16 ſoone remit offence honour paſſe mentioneth matter requireth ſecurity goeth ſeeth great grace man doe ſo therein doth example lord himſelfe doth follow exod 34 7 thing againſt v hotly ſheweth great lenitie kindneſſe note ſhould rigorous cruell dealing prouoke men bitternes wrath ſo ſhould make end controuerſies ſoone word may cauſes ſo leaſt reſpect ſeeing many word commonly much ſinne ſomewhat ſaid verſ 4 eſpecially looke backe chap 8 verſe 2 learne hath religiouſneſſe oath time doct 2 paſt wit ſuch offered taken queſtion controuerſie ended ſee rahab hauing granted ioſhua 2 21 oath ſpies ſhe father houſe ſhould bee ſaued aliue deſtruction ierrico reſted ſatisfied therefore men muſt looke ſweare ſeeing oath bee violated vnleſſe made accompliſhment euill caſe keeping double ſinne heroas leaſt euill therein great marke 6 20 heed muſt taken men ſweare ſo muſt offer oath ſo done miniſtred may free ſnare ſo may doe prophet ſpeaketh truth righteouſneſſe iudgement therefore ſuch draw men oath fulfill deſire doe thing againſt conſcience haue anſwer men muſt drawne forced thereto cannot yeeld themſelues raſhly ſweare doe approoue abhorre iphtah doubted oath goeth army oath ſtrong enough adaies hold man faſt neither wee ſafely heb 6 1 • reſt deciding controuerſies although lord hath taught v otherwiſe ratifying couenant betwixt rehearſed lord mizpeh thus men gilead ſay couenant thee lord doe ſay may puniſh v breake therefore ſuch common ſwearers admitted ſolemne oath either accuſation deciſſion controuerſies ſaid haue loſt credit haue often falſified oathes ſhould common ſwearer auoid common periury therefore another man vſeth reuerently conſcience ſuch ruſh vpon commonly careleſly prophane habit herein worſe heathen counted ſuch worthie ſocietie inteſtabiles called ſuch admitted witneſſe commonly ſuch proſtitute themſelues gaine ſweare falſely magiſtrate many ſome lord ſhoaleth among fellowes notorious monſters branding ſome famie miſery terrifying conſciences helliſh feares deſpaire ſtep ſinne abuſing tongue falſe aſſeuerations conteſtations ſay verily thus ſo ſure place true god knoweth ſpeake truth take god witneſſe c whereunto commonly men ioyne deprecation peter bee beleeued yet falſe ſay neuer goeth alone commonlyer falſe aſſeuerer ſtick need falſe ſwearer alſo therfore ſhut vp let men account oathes diuine band pledge caution fidelitie truth depoſed left hand god himſelfe dare forfeit breake let ſure god whoſe cenſure yeeldeth himſelfe find world many yet hereafter hee ſhall giue portion lake burneth fire brimſtone euer indeed puniſhment equall ſinne ouerthroweth ciuill ſocietie ſinewes thereof religion itſelfe sixtie sixe sermon eleventh chapter booke ivdges ſecond part chapter verſ 12 iphtah ſent meſſengers vnto king child ammon ſaying haſt thou doe thou art come againſt fight land 13 king child ammon anſwered vnto meſſengers iphtah becauſe iſrael tooke land came vp egypt arnon vnto iabbok vnto iorden therefore reſtore thoſe land quietly 14 yet iphtah ſent meſſengers againe vnto child ammon 15 ſaid vnto thus ſaith iphtah iſrael tooke land moab land child ammon 16 iſrael came vp egypt walked wilderneſſe vnto red sea came kadeſh 18 went wilderneſſe compaſſed land edom land moab came east ſide land moab pitched ſide arnon came within coaſt moab arnon border moab 19 alſo iſrael ſent meſſengers vnto sihō king amorites king heſhbon iſrael ſaid vnto let v paſſe pray thee thy land vnto place 20 sihon conſented iſrael hee ſhould goe coaſt sihon gathered people together pitched iahaz
