fought iſrael 21 lord god iſrael gaue sihon folke hand iſrael ſmote ſo iſrael poſſeſſed land ammorites inhabitant countrie 22 poſſeſſed coaſts amorites arnon vnto iabbok wilderneſſe euen vnto iorden 23 therefore lord god iſrael hath caſt amorites people iſrael ſhouldeſt thou poſſeſſe 24 wouldeſt thou poſſeſſe chemoſh thy god giueth thee poſſeſſe ſo whomſoeuer lord god driueth v poſſeſſe 25 art thou farre better balak ſonne zippor king moab ſtriue iſrael fight againſt 26 iſrael dwelt heſhbon townes aroer townes city coaſts arnon three hundred yeere ye recouer ſpace 27 wherefore haue offended thee thou doeſt wrong warre againſt lord iudge iudge day betweene child iſrael child ammon 28 howbeit king child ammon hearkned vnto word iphtah ſent iphtah ſtabliſhed captaine ſenſe theſe verſes generall guide wee haue heard ſhewed verſes read hee went worke againſt ammonite manner firſt hee ſendeth meſſengers king ammon reaſons appeaſe may hold warre hearkens none quarrell land iſrael enioyed full 400 yeeres yet king ammon claimeth denied maketh warre particularly let v heare reaſoning matter auoid tediouſneſſe large ſet downe firſt lay verſes order theſe two verſes iphtah demand king ammon meſſengers verſe 12 13 particularly made warre againſt iniurie hee offered ſhould doe ſo king ammon anſwered iſrael taken away part land came egypt required bee ſafely deliuered reſtored peaceably hee would depart moleſting countrie otherwiſe would theſe order firſt let v conſider iphtahs dealing hee go warre doct ver 12 debateth enquireth matter ſee meanes enemy might appeaſed word vſeth beſt meanes could deuiſe keepe peace ought obſerued rule ſo ſhould attempting warre nation ſuite perſon according generall rule much lieth haue peace rom 12 18 heb 12 14 againe enſew peace follow though flee pretious treaſure particular eſpecially know carefully labour preſerue member body cut much ſhould deale caſe preſerue many body men perſons rather commit hazzard warre making account liues chriſtian men dogges ox ſheepe ſuffer ciuill priuat enuy contention ſtrife loſing many ſoules ſo ten tribe deale brother ſide iorden preuent ſtay much might haue riſen bloodſhedding departure heard committed grieuous treſpaſſe againſt lord ioſu 22 33 thought iuſt cauſe make warre yet follow owne mindes giue full credit report firſt wiſely ſend vnto know certaintie thereby ſatiſfied doubt eaſie conſenting part iuſtice point diſputed agreed vpon heathen practiſe warres alſo moraliſts whoſe poſition honeſt warre preferred vnequall hurtfull peace otherwiſe leaue therefore come neerer ſelues ſame rule kept priuate controuerſies betwixt men law attempted till meanes firſt vſed great ſinne among chriſtians runne law ſuing one another many vſe doe hotly raſhly wilfully though themſelues ſuſtaine moſt hurt doe ſo author contention ſuite likewiſe ſame may ſaid offender kindes haue lead away leaud counſell companie yet relent afterward take admonition againſt willingly vſed fauourably ſo farre law may forborne euen ſtiffenecked ſawcie bold defender ſinne ſharply dealt leſt grow paſt recouerie doe water euen ouerflow place come controuerſies ſhall doubt alwaies ariſe betweene man man touching thing equitie whereof vnknowne vncertaine ſhall whoſe right contention proceeding manifeſt wrong vngrounded ſurmiſes firſt taken vp cut commonly moſt raſhnes heate diſtemper bewrayed yea trifling quarrel troden vnder foote neither ſhould men haue ſo many needleſſe ianglings thoſe ſerious could bee auoided ſhould indifferently handled decided either priuatly note peaceable conſent party trauerſe law yea ſay themſelues could hit vpon agreement would yeeld diſcretion loue ſuch might compound difference rather multiplie one ſinne vpon another fiercenes word gall ſtomacks actuall purſuite former ſhewing themſelues vnappeaſeable inexorable pride bitternes enuie heart rather weightineſſe cauſe oft prouokes men heate ſtomacke vtter bewray may ſee iarrings againſt therefore ſo farre iphtah practiſe reioyce haue pretence debate ſuite againſt neighbour follow ſuch eager odious manner may ſee ſue becauſe haue cauſe glad haue occaſion ſuch delight haue therein might fall ſuite claime whole tribe inheritance ſo ſtirre iphtah wrath againſt vſurper many v would bee ſtirred againſt would challenge acre poſſeſſion doe ſay nay againſt contendeth twelue penny matter v yet wee ſhould exceed goe many degree iphtah meanes knowledge acquaintance god particuler duty well conſider let ſuch doings heard among heathen chriſtians one partie heare dutie let giue ouer let contend need owne ſhadow doubtleſſe many contention either party wiſe others folly ſhould ſoone appeare contention growes paſt recouerie ſhould ceaſe end iphtah asking wrong done came 2 warre againſt giueth vnderſtand abſurd odious thing doe wrong deale hardly haue done iniurie v therefore hee ſaith haue done wrong good reaſon ſhould ſatisfie challenge c fooliſhnes wee doe meddle matter belongeth vnto v haue nothing doe yea though wee meane euill thereby ſay folly salomon ſaith one man plucked curſt prou 26 17 dogge eare hurt willingly bee cruell iniurious would liue peace v high degree iniquitie ought ſuſtaine double iniurie rather offer reuenge matth 5 39 prou 17 15 one great ſinne doe wrong hurt man wee prouoked abomination euen let guiltie goe free yet many make conſcience hereof haue ſpoken point chap 8 gedeons proteſtation zeba zalmunna place king ammonite ſends word iſrael taken away verſ 13 part land went egypt toward land canaan therefore made warre true ye may ſee deuteronomy lord ſpeaketh thus child iſrael deut 2 19 ſhould paſſe thou ſhalt lay ſiege againſt child ammon neither make warre againſt giue land child ammon thy hand 37 verſe moſes tels obeyed lord therein ſaying vnto land deut 2 37 child ammon thou cameſt vnto place riuer iabbok vpon bounded ſee whereas manifeſt lord ſuffered iſrael meddle ammon yet king anſwers boldly teacheth ſuch found neither meane well ſimply doct verſ 13 neither care ſay heart full falſehood deceit ſo mouthes full lying lord himſelfe ſaid people iſrael ſhould neither meddle ammonite forementioned ſcripture teſtifieth yet king boldly vntruly auoucheth tooke land enioyed owne ſhould ready beleeue ſo boldly auouched king euen ſo many care lye coyne ſhameleſly lay claime men good boldly impudently ſet againſt truth many dealing doe either commoditie king credit ſet colour doings old prophet beth lying 1 king 13 18 gehazi alſo hee gotten tallents naaman reſpects together anantas saphira saul alſo see anſwere act 5 5 1 sam 15 let credit ſuch v thereafter ſtead dealing 1 sam 15 20 wee ſee beautie truth faithfulnes without men liue one another put away lying therefore apoſtle willeth epheſ 5 25 ſpeake truth euery man neighbour vnreaſonable abſurd anſwere king compared doct 2 iphtah wiſe equall proceeding ſee contrarietie men diſpoſitions ſome ſtriue poſſible meanes againſt contention vnpeaceablenes others againe whoſe delight euer debate oddes ſuch full gladly would liue peace eſau iacob becauſe would make gaine bootie honeſtly minded haue ſome way know godly man buy peace deare rather want wil lay loade enough vpon ſuch therefore ſee wring although without colour equitie beſides peace vile price vnrighteous perſon nothing got hee ſaith water troubled ſeaſon caſt therefore fiſh come net ſeeth king miſchieuouſly minded ſhapeth ſuch anſwere either yeelded vnto tended vndoing tribe threatned implacable diſſention benhadad ſends meſſage ahab thou thou haſt 1 king 20 3 mine deny thou dareſt plaine ſet vpon warre ſent ſo proud challenge excluded poſſibilitie agreement peace ſuch place might haue mindes would chuſe warre rather liue peace might boldly rifle houſes grudge could ſuffer liue except might poſſeſſe haue hamor ſpake iacob ſonnes men citie therefore ſeeſt thou vnrighteous gen 34 23 perſon wonder thou heare vnreaſonablenes come theſe two goe yoked together though feare danger law doe oft reſtraine inward corruption breaking ſo hideous monſter iniuſtice might ſeene colour practiſe lying forging ſubborning concealing truth impudent facing ill cauſe ill title goe aduantage ſake though treading downe poore innocent nay vtter vndoing common adaies euill well ſcurfe iniquitie cleaue better ſort diuell alſo except walke armed breaſtplate continually epheſ 6 14 theſe fiue verſes iphtah ſends word againe king ammonite verſ 14 19 ſo affirmed tooke part ground proceeds reaſons perſwade deſiſt attempt firſt thus iſrael ſent meſſengers came egypt king edom goe land yeelding faine goe great way long tedious iourney wilderneſſe ſo deſired paſſe moab alſo could ſuffered make warre either choſe rather abide long deſert goe farre haue ſaid ſo farre wrong choſe rather offer violence themſelues iniurie like would offer violence conſequently thy predeceſſors child ammon iphtah heere giues place vntruth though hee preuailed doct ver 14 15 wherein honoured lord bearing witneſſe good cauſe ſo let v know dutie doe namely bring truth light much v lieth bring ſhame reſiſt worke much miſchiefe iniquitie thereby hold ſinne multiplying doth greatly lying haue greater deteſtation ſome would taken honeſt men much know lord hath linked ſuch loue make lie among dogges inchanters reuel 22 15 whoremonger let v remember salomon ſaith hee iuſtifieth wicked lier abominable lord prou 17 15 condemneth innocent apoſtle put conſenter euill whether lying ſwearing c higher degree ſinners committers ſeeth phariſees iewes hired matth 27 20 fleſhed falſe witneſſes againſt sauiour worſe falſe witneſſes themſelues thus samuel conuicted saul lye 1 sam 15 eliſha 1 sam 15 14 2 king 5 26 gal 2 14 argued gehazi nay paul galath 2 openly checke detect diſſimulation peter reſiſted face truth men generall hate lying coyner teller particular ſo many occaſions fall ſometimes man fauour kinſman ſticke ſweare againſt conſcience purge adulterie lay men open doe ſo generall hatred thereof turned ſpeciall liking tolerating conniuence neither ſtrange iuſt armed breaſtplate righteouſneſſe ſhould want girdle veritie bribe fauour flatterie friendſhip commoditie ſuch like partiall ſmiſter reſpects vſe prouerbe ſticke ſay crow white great patron ſuch depend vpon wil ſay others feare driuen conceale truth heare falſehood iuſtified bad lyers coupled reuel laſt yet muſt know euery vntruth lie except know report vntruth ſo yet muſt beware offend therein neither vttering raſhly whatſoeuer heare ſpoken may doe good neither telling truth wee bound vtter truth ſhall ſee expedient doe ſo iphtah onely withſtands vntruth alſo ſheweth reaſon ſo wee verſ 15 16 17 muſt withſtand vntruth reaſon approued scripture ſelfe ſo yeeld may ſhew themſelues vnreaſonable ſo bee accounted better waſh away ſound reaſon able reſiſt breeding quarrelling contention hereby wherein phariſies prieſts went neuer reſting moſt ſound reaſons wherewith sauiour commoning conuince withſtood ſhameleſly alleage reaſons v dutie yeeld laban himſelfe though idolater anſwered abraham ſeruant matter hee dealt ſeeing report made thing vnto ſo currant reaſonable ſay neither leſſe ſaith hee gen 2 • 50 thing lord 28 verſe way vſe hereof reaſon haue heard wit child iſrael 2 offer violence themſelues rather would leaſt manner wrong therefore would much leſſe take away ſo great portion ground nothing neither prouoked learne ſhould neuer finde ſweetneſſe comming profit amiſſe namely hurting wronging firſt ſeeing wee thereby prouoke god againſt v god auenger ſuch thing life god againſt gen 12 3 matth 7 2 v beſides deale ſo ſhall dealt againe laſtly beſides ill name wee ſhall haue ill conſcience alſo wee may ſee iudas ſhould offer hard meaſure none ſo leaſt poore ſuch cannot beare loſſe able ſtand v ſuite wee commandement god relieue pleaſure ſhould wee take plucking god threatens rom 12 13 heare crie againſt oppreſſors yet poore griped pilled obſerueth ſhall find either god maketh themſelues ſo wrong crie feare reuenging hand one time elſe ſhall meane ſweete morſels count take wronging iſraelites quailes died mouthes euen numb 11 33 ſo ſhall haue ſmall liking iniurie doe ſay let rather make reſtitution ſpeedily may token repentance onely good end made ſuch doings point hath oft come hand largely inſiſted vpon see verſe twelfth let v marke example iacob proofe doctrine rather would giue laban quarrellous gen 31 39 vnreaſonable man leaſt occaſion challenge pillage robberie needed euen make good euery ſheepe caſſually deſtroyed periſhed owne good dealing doe preuaile euill aduerſarie ſtop mouth yet iacob anſwers laban lord ſeeth v ſecret take cauſe owne hand plead v whereas otherwiſe although men ſhould ſtand v yet conſcience god againſt v wee ſhould able ſtand vnder burthen another reaſon iphtah ſetteth downe theſe verſes thus sihon king verſ 19 25 ammonite would need come againſt v wee going toward canaan god gaue hand ſo wee enioy land ye contend enioyed therfore haue ye doe claime right haue yee vnto yee neuer poſſeſſed sthon wonne law warre lord god hath caſt giuen land v commeſt thou haſt nothing doe againſt v poſſeſſe hee 24 verſe ſheweth ſaid cleerely ſimilitude thus yee ammonite worſhip idoll chemoſh god thinke land yee poſſeſſe yee inioy benefit ſo good right ſo haue benefit true god therefore poſſeſſe good right chemoſh hee called idoll god hee tooke bee ſo ammonite ſo iudged may ſee farre may lawfully enioy ſuch thing taken doct verſ 19 29 warre warre lawfully taken hand iſrael thereby obtaine good ſucceſſe may enioy giuen hand lord ſpeake thing priuat ſame may ſaid god giueth v good friend lawfull dealing god bleſſing calling yet watchword wee honour therewith chriſtian life glad heart god people thereby ought well able prooue ſhew commodity enioy fruites owne rapine oppreſſion couetouſneſſe euill conſcience indeed bequeſts father iacob ſaid lord geneſ 32 10 geneſ 33 5 god hath beſtowed bleſſing vpon v ſeruants ſeeking firſt thing concerne happineſſe god kingdome receiuing theſe ſmaller thing againe token allowing approouing v vſuall argument booke therefore paſſe particularly let v note verſe iſrael would doct verſ 19 guided god therein great need ſo much goe land sihon without leaue learne hence ſay man may vſurpe challenge himſelfe another man right euery man content owne portion allowance yea lord haue meaneſt free tyrannie greateſt taketh cauſe poore owne hand againſt potent enemy though none vpon earth iudge caſe ahab iezabels extorting naboths vineyard doth appeare reaſon good next good church lord hath ſpecial care vpholding ſocietie among men order good gouernment ouerthrowne proprietie good commodity taken away vnequall vſurpation greater ouer ſmaller truth ſmall oddes betwixt beaſts men common band equitie broken ſo much leſſe like church bee ſetled eſtabliſhed ſuch confuſion greater ſinne euen church exerciſe miſchieuous practiſe whereof god god order satan author euen diſorders therefore let none troubleſome iniurious would content another ſhould wrong hurt none ſhould oppreſſed bargaining otherwiſe lord apoſtle hath giuen charge well regarded 1 theſ 4 6 much complaining iniurie hard dealing would ceaſe branch came lord sihon deny paſſage iſrael doct verſ 10 23 land alſo ſhould prouoke warre might giue land hand withall giue paſſage country euen ſo many doe wilfully ſtiffely oppoſe themſelues againſt innocent ſuites law vntill wealth bee conſumed fat lambes againſt sunne others meddle needleſly haue cauſe oft time neither reaſon bee diſſwaded yea ſome better proud ſtomack contrary counſell salomon becauſe lord meaning let fall euill ſuffer meet match may pay griping vnderlings ſmart owne ſinne otherwiſe would able hold back ſome way thus adulterer drunkard cauillers ſuch wilfull perſons go forward confuſion ſo elies ſonnes hardned might deſtroyed 1 sam 2 25 pharao ſuffering iſrael depart ahab would heare micaiah exod 14 8 1 king 22 28 ſo might fall ramoth iudas proceeded betray maſter thinke hauing ſo faire warning little enough haue cooled courage haue holden backe ſuch attempt curſed veſſell wrath appointed miſery happie relenteth meekely ſubmitteth himſelfe god reſiſting wicked attempt ſtopping bad courſe leſt kicking againſt prick goe forward ſorrow deſtruction much verified ſuch take counſell reproofe law god turne away eares yea liue long time vnder vnprofitably till waxe obdurate ſurely thus becauſe al others vnhappy people whō lord hath purpoſed promiſe miniſtery goſpell conuert ſaue elſe ſhould caſe aſwellas ſome cauill againſt ſay either god bound deale paul hee ſaued violence god ſo hardning men author perdition anſwere firſt god free agent bound none creature need al ſtop euill courſe much leſſe ſtriue breake oppoſing balaam iourney king numb 22 18 19 moab latter ſay lord need cauſe man deſtruction ſtay runneth owne accord lord find matter ſinne neede infuſe therfore doe mollifie heart waxeth hard ſelfe without hardning ſee wilfulneſſe ſtiffeneckedneſſe euill doct verſ 21 22 rebellious perſons redoundeth benefit god ſeruants many time haue doe reaſon god reſiſteth 1 pet 5 5 proud giueth grace lowly whereby commeth paſſe ſuch wilfull perſons meete much hardneſſe prouoke againſt although want power yet crueltie violence raſhneſſe runne themſelues againſt rocke contrarily algoeth much better moſt part though ſometime borne downe ſuites comprimiſes innocency good dealing ſeene rewarded thus lord gaue ſentence dauids ſide againſt saul choſe rather houſe rewarded innocencie one gaue vp reprobate ſenſe theſe two verſes ſee god ſeruants may good ſecurity doct verſ 23 24 boldnes vſe inioy poſſeſſions good god hath giuen much better reaſon think owne haue howſoeuer haue come whereas theſe haue ſanctified vſe thing enioy hauing right title god chriſt heire al although meanes lawfull vſe beſides come vnlawfully many much meane haue right chriſt alſo haue ſought good conſcience vſe accordingly bleſſed vnto ſay may learne iphtah anſwered king ammon thus thou thinkeſt thine chemoſh thou imagineſt hath giuen thee much may enioy land amorites lord hath giuen v toucht 18 verſe frame argument wee may obſerue arguer diſcretion conuinceth aduerſarie ground confeſſed himſelfe handling comparatiuely manner thou ſaith thinkeſt thou haſt good right giuen thee chemoſh ſo doe account ſelfe hold firmely iehouah god hath granted wee know might haue ſaid much may lay claime iehouah gift thou thy idoll indeed hath authoritie deitie might haue diſcourſed much truly touching difference betweene god idoll heathen iewes true church god purpoſe might haue ridiculous could ſuch diſpute haue conuicted teach v men muſt bee alike handled confutatation error hereſies prophane cuſtomes ground acknowledged themſelues muſt bee vrged confeſſe truth concluſions would acknowledge man putteth new wind old veſſels man puniſheth frenchman engliſh law take himſelfe ſtand bound law neuer conſented vnto law ciuil like common law sometime may take true confeſſion aduerſarie argument againſt forcible two becauſe truth therefore ſelfe confuteth contrary neceſſarily alſo becauſe conſent therein whereby ſhew wee would diſſent poſſible auoid ſometimes wee may vſe owne confeſſion againſt though falſe ſo bee conuince doe good otherwiſe muſt abuſe errour hurt manner arguing though conclude directly yet ſtrong againſt holdeth apoſtle paul conuict athenian falſe worſhip firſt argues abſurd confeſſion abſurd reaſon ye worſhip ſaith vnknowne god title altar importeth therefore ye know ye worſhip whereupon doubtleſſe worſhip prepoſterous falſe worſhip know paul vſeth one kind apologie heathen feſtus felix another agrippa iew borne teacheth v dealing aduerſary truth ſmite owne weapon god weapon drawne armorie scripture truth reuelation nature therefore ſuch vnreuealed vnto paul doctrine reſurrection profane stoicks church ſmiteth infidell ſpirituall cenſures becauſe capable ſpirituall direction doctrine none ſo erronious hold ſome truth truth hold may ſerue infringe error maintaine ſo brought ſuſpect renounce falſehood may ſooner perſwaded admit truth ſtrong preiudice ſuffer doe heathen confeſſing deitie may graduall conſequences forced acknowledge vnitie ſo workes deity vrged confeſſe worſhip due thereto inward aſwell outward alſo ſee folly manner worſhipping thus prepared hee may better inſtructed truth reaſon former point becauſe truth vniforme repugneth falſehood though diſcerned ſo demonſtration popiſh tranſubſtantiation lutheran vbiquitie beſt confuted owne poſitions confeſſions alſo error hereſies neither hard doe ſo ſince impoſſible writes many truth ſhould contradict himſelfe error ere aware let courſe vſed againſt ignorant vngrounded neither let v preſently raile vpon ſuch abandon becauſe perſwaded thing forcible v let kindly drawne little little driuen thus much bee ſaid hitherto hath paſſed betwixt iphtah king ammon sixtie seven sermon elevnth chapter booke ivdges proceede communication betwixt king ammon iphtah followeth vſed another verſe 25 reaſon king ammon meſſengers preſcription long continuance time euen 300 yeeres well nigh time ground neuer claimed balac king moab iſrael newly come city belonging dwelt neuer challenged contended yet hee ſtroue ſhould enter owne border reaſon iphtah muſt vnderſtood follow vpon former pertinent reaſons manner prooued directly land part ammonite land proues ammon could lay iuſt claime ſecond reſpect becauſe part amorites land bordering vpon ſaith might moab aſwell nay better challenge ammonite yet neither done 300 yeeres ſpace reaſon thus conſidered concludeth nothing doth directly follow ammon title becauſe moab none thus iphtah anſwered committed ſucceſſe god king ammonite hearken although iphtah ſheweth 300 yeeres iſrael enioyed country doct verſe 25 26 amorites quietly yet hee brought reaſons alſo drawne right reaſon aſwell fact poſſeſſion made ſtrong haue heard laid together ſufficiently prooue land king ammon trouble vniuſtly without cauſe ſay may know preſcription time may fall though ſeldome doe ſo ſufficient reaſon hold commodity may right ſide good proofe ſame yet law ſuppoſing great likelihood right ſides haue long enioyed land hath well determined controuerſie giuing v hath long enioyed v predeceſſors ſeeing otherwiſe many endleſſe contention might ariſe becauſe like aliue alleage good reaſon againſt ſo long cōtinuance time neither bring thing certaine former time ouerthrow equitie law aimeth moſt vſually though generally infallibly holdeth moſt part ordinarily iphtah ſaith balak king moab ſtood againſt iſrael ſtiffely hold going land yet hee ſtroue recouering land amorites might iuſtly haue done king ammon hee prooueth thereby nothing doe right vnto teaching thereby men deadly ſet againſt aduerſaries matter ſeeking thereby vexe ſoreſt manner would ſhew rancor bringing foorth greater crime accuſations againſt doe whereby might much eaſily bring downe prouided whereas ſeeke blemiſh name impoueriſh eſtate afflict perſons reſtraint libertie impriſonment baniſhment doe old serpent bite heele becauſe cannot breake head would gladdeſt ſhed blood god indeed pluck back ſo vomit poiſon ſo great miſchiefe conceiue fall ſhort poiſon nothing leſſe deadly want matter worke vpon manifeſt theſe two ſignes one content take ſlighteſt occaſions rather chooſe ridiculous malice malicious aggrauate ſlender accuſations ſlanderous addition owne inuenting combe warpe woof crime amplification thereof diuels forge lying heart braines becauſe innocency aduerſarie yeelds iuſt exception thus thoſe enemy sauiour want matter ſuborned falſe witneſſes periurie argued would haue ſpared produce true greater crime could haue found noted daniel aduerſaries dan 6 5 chap 6 wanting matter treaſon faine bring religion againſt contriued matter law made purpoſe toucht life alſo found ought lay charge would rather haue vſed doctrine ſerueth anſwere pretend couering malice whereas vexe aduerſarie one way could doe many way ſay haue greater cauſes purſue one alleage ſuch ſpeech bragging boaſting without iuſt cauſe greater doth man doubt would take aduantage vſing proſecute ſmaller ſo hotly againſt vpon forementioned reaſons concludeth hee gaue cauſe make warre done hee ſtirred vp doct verſ 27 vniuſtly againſt iphtah bold accuſe auouch owne innocencie hauing ſo good proofe ſo euery one proue goodneſſe cauſe ſhall bee able boldly defend owne innocencie againſt aduerſaries accuſers ſhame iuſt reproch owne peace comfort whereas muſt driuen vſe ſhifts lying diſſembling boldnes heate multiplying word falſe witneſſes may ſeene cauſe prieſts phariſies accuſing sauiour pilat truth ſeeketh corner see note vpon verſes 14 15 ſo hee appealing moſt higheſt ſimplicitie matter 2 iudge therein endeth meſſage thus muſt wee able doe meane afraid make lord iudge cauſe ſo though iuſtled walles vnequall iudges vpon earth yet may reſt god teſtimonie vnto v cauſe therefore fearing man may confident verifying prouerbe righteous prou 28 1 iob 31 35 bold lion ſame kinde iob ſpeaketh ſaying though mine aduerſary ſhould write booke againſt would take vpon ſhoulder binde crowne meaning ſhould commendation ſeeing men world ſee boldnes ſo much preuaile defence bad cauſes therfore face matter themſelues thereby wherby watchword needfull bee giuen men looke ſo much boldly ſtand defence themſelues doings truly good cauſe courage euill impudence though iphtah ſaid enough alſo good purpoſe yet verſ 28 ſee moued king ammon nothing taken bad cauſe hand ſo meant defend vnto death euen men commonly doe hauing begun ill matter doe purpoſe goe forward ſee wiſe ſound reaſons perſwaſions howſoeuer vſed purpoſe ſeaſon ſo iudge would thinke might like preuaile moue eſpecially knowing corruption heart couers ſelfe ſhew honeſtie yet wilfull doe good ſuch bewray themſelues put reſolute wrong preiudicate mind poſſeſſed ſtrong paſſions therfore salomon ſaith word prou 17 10 entreth wiſe hundred ſtripes auaile froward humour poſſeſſeth many would eaſily thought therefore diſcouered ſo much worſe beſeemeth euen ciuill courteous perſons ſtill ſometimes religious becauſe either ſuſpect themſelues ſo ouertaken occaſion ſuddenly falling elſe nouriſh ſerpent boſome wilfully naaman taken tech marueile heathen heard prophet anſwere meanes told ſhould healed highly commended dauid receiued counſell abigail woman ſo readily turne cruell wicked reſolution euen ſo obſtinate thinking diſcredit deſiſt ſhall meete ſhame proceeding happie meeke tractable receiue wholeſome word exhortation ſtop eares good counſell ſubmit themſelues without reſpect thereto ſuch ſhall deliuer themſelues great euill man would thinke ſuch behauiour doth better become profeſſors goſpell wilfulnes obſtinacie concerning vſe whereof haue ſpoke ſomewhat like occaſion 21 22 verſes let reader ioyne together verſ 29 ſpirit lord came vpon iphtah hee paſſed ouer gilead manaſſeh came mizpeh gilead mizpeh gilead went vnto child ammon 30 iphtah vowed vow vnto lord ſaid thou ſhalt deliuer child ammon mine hand 31 thing commeth doores mine houſe meete come home peace child ammon ſhall lord offer burnt offering 32 ſo iphtah went vnto child ammon fight againſt lord deliuered hand 33 ſmote aroer vntill thou come minneth twentie city ſo foorth abel vineyard exceeding great ſlaughter thus child ammon humbled child iſrael third part chapter third part ſhewed generally iphtah ouercame ſubdued ammonite particular firſt god gaue ſpirit ſenſe theſe fiue verſes courage fortitude end secondly hee entred battell hee made vow lord hee ſhould get victorie hee would offer ſhould firſt come doores meete thirdly went forward gilead manaſſeh came place ammonite ſo laſtly fighting lord deliuered hand verſe ſhewed iphtah came ammonite mizpeh gilead diſtinguiſhed mizpeh tribe inda lord furniſhed gift ſpirit fit warre valiantnes mind ſtrength body ſaid may appeare lord appointed hee doct verſ 29 ſhould iudge deliuerer though vnknowne people ſent haue captaine inſtruction benefit heere wee may ſee lord appointeth man ſpeciall calling hee giues gift diſcharge moſes ſent pharao hee alleaged vnfitnes vnſufficiencie ſpeak king lord prouided began diſcharge apoſtles likewiſe chriſt left weake vnfurniſhed ſuch worke take hand aſcenſion wit preach goſpell moſt nation world yet tooke hand made meete worke went iphtah hee fight againſt ammonite deliuering iſrael hee ſpirit god indued gift purpoſe euen farre greater hee ſet greater worke miniſters much calling farre excellent hee ſendeth people conuert make militant church hee ſtirres vp loue zeale labour ſet gift knowledge worke maketh great change among people miniſterie vnfit doe lord meſſage note ſent ſent ſeeke themſelues owne profit people worthie view behold difference men called god ſuch climbe another way owne framing doe one ſame worke one ſets himſelfe aworke ſet aworke god one faſhion go awkly vntowardly ſetting bold face vpon matter carrying great ſhew bearing ſway preaching pleaſeth manner liketh beſt errand hath none doe people cuſhi dauid thereafter welcome hee faileth end office ſo loſeth honour except flatterer hangbyes ala haue enterprized long race iourney without prouiſion enable runne habit make miniſter learning though come neerer degree dignitie applauſe man onely carrie worke ſtitch god hath ſaid paul moſes goe thee fit thee embolden thee miniſter hath enough diſcourage euen within himſelfe haue noted elſewhere yea beare thee againſt oppoſition encourage thee bleſſing thy labour otherwiſe thy prouiſion little purpoſe thou maiſt ſtand like foole errandleſſe ſpeechleſſe called ſeparated god therefore alſo qualified though thy ſelfe weake earthen veſſell yet precious treaſure doeſt thou carrie admirably doth lord make way making high hils ſtoope lie leuell procuring honour conſciences countenance onely ſuch haue wonne god power satan darkneſſe conuerting ſauing ſtopping mouthes ſuch might deſpiſe diſcourage ſaying newfound babler hee beare downe thinke haue v tyed girdle deales maſter ſent therefore ſeekes bring yee vnder yoke girdle chriſt therefore let diſcouragements neuer ſo great note worke ſhall proſper euen mouthes blockiſh brutiſh ſauage ignorant yea prophane one lord ſhall procure credit miniſterie hath changed thereby theſe ſhall iuſtifie wiſedome againſt cauillers ſcorners enemy thereof let neuer ſo many kindes age many contrary manifeſt fruite ſee impeach either ſufficiencie calling worthineſſe meſſage oh therefore lamentable congregation thus furniſhed made partaker ſo bleſſed ordinance god therefore lord ieſus ſhew pitifull caſe ſee people diſperſed ſheepe hauing ſhepheard onely compaſſion himſelfe alſo willed diſciples pray matth 9 38 lord harueſt thruſt labourer harueſt ſeeing none forward worke except lord ſtirre vp thereto point hath ſpoken therefore tedious therein reader vow ſaid iphtah made heere ſhewed verſ 30 31 namely would token thankfull heart offer dedicate lord thing ſhould firſt come houſe meete returned victorie vow though hee meant well ill made great ignorance make diſtinctly aduiſedly dogge firſt met fauning creature like enough haue firſt come foorth meete hee could haue offered lord vncleane ſo forbidden made ſacrifice word haue meaning ſaith ſhall lord offer burnt offering offer ſacrifice ſhall burnt offering lord hee meant ſimply would offer firſt thing ſhould meete thought daughter would haue made vow ſay ſo vowing meant ſhould firſt meete ſhould bee fit ſacrifice would offer virginitie yet perhaps ſhould fit neither dogge meant offer virginitie ſome hold hee ſee daughter moſt like haue bin partie vpon vow ſhould haue bin performed bin liker haue firſt come foorth meete ſhe would thinke wee haue vowed might haue turned owne daughter ſo great ſorrow therefore ſay hee meant offering ſhould meete perpetuall virginitie neither thoſe word taken diſiunctiuely ſome think may thus firſt commeth forth meete ſhall lord offer though hebrew letter • ſo taken ſometime yet rarely ſo little reaſon ſhould ſo taken heere moſt commonly taken coniunctiuely well know haue vnderſtanding hebrew tongue yea oft ſome one chapter may eaſily ſhewed example geneſ 32 1 2 3 4 foure fiue time ſo taken 3 4 verſes geneſ 33 1 2 oft two verſes geneſ 45 1 2 3 many time found moſt chapter throughout old teſtament word ſignifieth coniunctiuely diſiunctiuely haue ſaid therefore heere take otherwiſe ſmall reaſon eſpecially ſenſe place amended thereby vnderſtand diſiunctiuely thus ſhall lord offer ſenſe haue thus fit ſacrifice ſhal lord ſhould lord ſay offering perpetuall virginitie fit thereto ſo ſome vnderſtand haue ſaid god require virginitie inioyned child parent example haue thereof scripture yet meant ſo vowing know moſt like bee daughter ſay againe ſhould firſt haue come foorth meet therefore ſenſe bee take ſo hee would offer perpetuall virginitie fit ſacrifice cauſe conclude word bee vnderſtood coniunctiuely latter clauſe expoſition former thus ſhal lord offer ſacrifice asked whether iphtah offended making ſuch vow ſome think becauſe ſaid ſpirit lord came vpon againe ſeeing reckoned epiſtle hebrewes hebr 11 32 among faithfull anſwere firſt queſtion reaſons queſtion hee vowed ſimply thankfull done well ſuch vowing hee ſinned greatly ſhall appeare better come performing vow afterward verſ 39 firſt reaſon anſwer ſpirit ſaid verſe come vpon ſpirit courage fortitude war although denied beleeuer ſpirit ſanctification alſo hindred hee might ſome particular action ignorance weaknes offend gedeon barak yet true ſeruants god obtained victory alſo many ſound chriſtians among v yet tread awry ſometimes ſo iphtah one anſwere may ſerue reaſons concerning vow till 39 verſe mentioned offended vowing tended praiſing doct god though made faulted greatly ſo wee may bee perſwaded lawfull thing make vow god whereby meane neither generall vow faith obedience required performed old new teſtament neither ſpeciall vow ceremonial onely practiſed old teſtament ſome new wit firſt age church meane ſpeciall vow promiſe made god touching ſome duty performed good end vow made accordingly lawfull belongs church old new teſtament vow iphtahs reſpect godly intent thereof lawfully made right manner hath ſaid ſuch promiſe iacob god deliuer v ſuch danger wee gen 28 20 carefully conſtantly walke afterward ſo helpe dulneſſe infirmitie wee ſet ourſelues firme couenant prayer reading ordinary meaſure frequency feruency giue ſet almes ſpecial cauſes knowne ſelues keepe ſet time faſting ſeaſon ſhall bee cauſe perceiue find ſelues prone drunkenneſſe danger fall thereto drinking wine ſtrong drinke wee may vow abſtaine ſo long time may bee fit keepe ſelues ſinning although wee bee bound already hereunto word yet may wee ſolemnly better bridling rebellious nature renew ſame bond vow end helpe dulneſſe want zeale make ſelues forward duty god loue men dauid haue ſworne ſaith performe keepe thy righteous pſal 119 116 iudgements theſe kind vower lawfull ſo agreeable god word ſtand chriſtian liberty bee agreeable calling generall particular power made deliberately raſhly end good whereas popiſh vowes failing theſe euen iphtahs alſo many theſe point although vowes made manner part god ſtanding conſtant worſhip themſelues yet neither wilworſhips yet ſimply left arbitriment alwaies vſed helpes furtherance godlineſſe wel approoued experience saint preſerue gift faith prayer repentance vertues mind ſo alſo teſtifie thankfulneſſe god bleſſings wee haue receiued minde iacob vowed way hee went aram ſaid gen 28 20 vow vſuall token thankfull heart indented hand expreſſe god ſhould giue victorie ſo wee muſt know proceeded rare feeling ſpirit god exciting quickning vp ſuch feruencie god people find themſelues alway one tenor tune either inward ioy comfort god outward forwardneſſe dutie paul 2 cor 12 9 lifting vp third heauen hee alſo buffeting abaſe lower earth peter rauiſhed ſpirit heauenly act 10 11 c trance going cornelius know hee rare ebbing time elia man men grace familiaritie god appeared reall aſſumption heauen bodily poore caſe faine flee iezabel goe 40 day faſting mourning miſery lay vpon church beſides weakneſſes bewraied therefore called iames paſſionate man one clothed like infirmity others deſired heare men make great moane contrary alway v abundance grace faith feruencie chearefulneſſe ſome odde time contrary befalleth moſt men partly lord ſo diſpoſing becauſe hee knowes wee able beare would turne diſtemper euen much good blood bodie make pleuriſie water channel containe muſt need ouerflow bankes doe harme partly ſelues procuring nouriſh ſelues ſuch motion make wiſe vſe ſetting work applying ſome fit obiect iphtah delight ſweetneſſe pleaſure feele ſo ſuffer heauenly flame vaniſh want laying fewell preſerue although lord cauſeth child euen ſometimes health ſometime death enioy ſuch vnſpeakable feeling operation ſpirit hee doth giue ſuch taſte heauen may cauſe reſtleſſe longing til come thither yet knoweth would ſay peter maſter good v would thinke matth 17 4 departure ſhould ordinarie diet therefore rather conſiders digeſt afford ſaith grace ſhall neither giuen ſuperfluitie yet penury ſhall ſufficient let v learne account ſo beſt v onely let v beware leſt giuing way fleſh counterpoiſe ſpirit earth ſenſualitie luſts bury quench ſpirit ſmother appearing beauty thereof alſo leſt wee cauſe heauy ſad v ſo ſelues bee blockiſh ſottiſh rather heauenly ioyfull chooſe feede ſwine might eate angel foode theſe two verſes ſet downe victory god gaue iphtah ouer ammonite alſo particularly amplified larger verſ 32 33 manner deſcribed many fell battell hee ouerthrew twentie city hee brought ammonite ſubiection wee may clearely ſee encourageth v ſetteth v forward duty euen lord appointing calling v thereto publike calling miniſter ſpake true priuate duty alſo husband wife thence haue hartning liue mutuall helper one another chriſtian peaceable conuerſing together paſſing day ſweetly bearing croſſes contentedly euen hence ſay beleeue god hath ioyned together end magiſtrate ſeuerall duty life want faith enough make note men liues ouercaſt weather cloud tempeſts fill men ſinne ſorrow thing might bee noted hence haue mentioned beſides theſe two little king ammon went worſt battell verſ 33 iphtah ſhewes wilfulneſſe brings man contempt reiecting good ſound perſwaſions ſuch iphtah vſed diſſwade warre though heathen yet knew law nature ought offer iniury innocent know gentile knew god onely light nature honour rom 1 19 accordingly gaue vp heart deſires fulfill againſt nature much haue light word god hauing regard good inſtruction admonition ſhall come naught eſpecially deſpiſers thereof vnleſſe take ſhame abaſhment themſelues ſo come better ſtate according written knoweth maſters doth ſhall bee beaten many ſtripes luke 12 47 puniſhment vpon wilfulneſſe ſee ſet downe like occaſions name chap 8 14 hee loſt twentie city hee owne loſt 2 thoſe alſo fought none liuely ſetteth eies many contented owne claime ſeeke belongs men either colour law otherwiſe loſe ſued ſpend conſume lord doth oft time requite vnconſcionableneſſe way yet great mercy dealeth ſo keepe heauier iudgement would note moſt certainely worſe ſhould corrupt bad dealing ſpeed better ſuffered haue ſucceſſe cleare point example inſtance pharaoh contented haue oppreſſed iſraelites many generatiōs bondage would need purſue gotten clawes though hee ſmarted many way letting goe came ſeeing exod 14 28 ſought vniuſtly encroach vpon god poſſeſſion onely failed hee deſired loſt alſo ventured euen owne life hee people alſo middeſt ſea ſame verified part vnrighteouſneſſe sampſon content liue credit honour owne land within compaſſe would need breake among philiſtims hit delilas company ſoule entirely loued though vnlawfully made vaſſall baſe miſtreſſe behold ſhort time pleaſure ſinne laſted loe louer reward treaſon sampſon poore iudges 16 20 man faine forgoe miſtreſſe force could plucked conſcience abhorred made vndergoe moſt hated wit painefull bondage hee liued beſide ſhame ſorrow vntimely death inſtance firſt ſinnes ſecond table murtherer thiefe perſwaſion bee brought labour hand doe thing good tuſh goeth vtterly againſt bee put labour worke hard yeere long poore liuing hee bring get great booty liue eaſe plentifully long time imagineth merry world yes laſteth kind long get two three purſes fourth enterpriſe taken manner doth hee thinke wiſh heart hee obeyed god ordinance hard work much loathed rather haue put forth hand violence ſeeth neither hath obtained ſought ouerthrow little looked hee hath brought vpon himſelfe lay waite life good another therein defeated ſatisfie ſinne muſt giue life good boote make amends man law needed haue feared law made iuſt tranſgreſſor 1 tim 1 9 holden himſelfe content owne men ſay muſt venture nothing venture nothing haue till venturing loſe note money body ſoule alſo god mercifull theſe thing notably lay foorth folly fruit ſinne euen outward reſpects yet manifeſt ſpirituall adde another inſtance firſt table many ſay hope god ſo hard maſter neither wil puniſh ſinners ſo ſeuerely miniſters would beare hand others goe enter vpon god prerogatiue ſaying euery one himſelfe cannot beleeue god hath reiected ſo many thouſands ſaue ſo meaning god doe ſo hee cruell oh foole paul ſaith getteſt thou diſputing againſt god nay bereauing ſpoiling iuſtice oh ſacrilege vnrighteouſnes higheſt degree surely auſtin ſaith ſpeaking hereof would haue loſe would haue euen woe euer would get heauen diſanulling decree god ſhall neuer get moone keepes courſe though dogges barke would ſcape hell nill muſt portion euer fruit ſee liues moſt men like doctrine driuing ſcaring man would thinke forcibly kind vnrighteouſneſſe paſſe followeth sixtie eight sermon eleventh chapter booke ivdges verſ 34 iphtah came mizpeh vnto houſe behold daughter came meet timbrel dance child ſonne daughter 35 ſaw hee rent clothes ſaid ala daughter thou haſt brought low art trouble haue opened mouth vnto lord cannot goe backe 36 ſhe ſaid vnto father thou haſt opened thy mouth vnto lord doe thou haſt promiſed ſeeing lord hath auenged thee thine enemy child ammon 37 alſo ſhe ſaid vnto father doe thus much ſuffer two moneths may goe mountaines bewaile virginitie fellowes 38 ſaid goe ſent away two moneths ſo ſhe went companion lamented virginitie vpon mountaines 39 end two moneths ſhe turned againe vnto father according vow vowed ſhe known man cuſtome iſrael 40 daughter iſrael went yeere yeere lament daughter iphtah gileadite foure day yeere fovrth part chapter executing vow iphtah gotten victorie returned home mizpeh ſumme theſe verſes dwelt therfore heard made league gileadites lord mizpeh behold returne vow bewraying deepe folly making forementioned vow firſt came foorth meete daughter ſo troubled ioy triumph turned moſt deep bitter ſorrow ſhe ſhe vnderſtood father vow ſubmitted ſelfe onely deſiring time bewaile virginitie hee returne performed vow cuſtome daughter iſrael went foure time yeere bewaile peruſe verſes particularly ſaid bin verſ 34 made ioyfull victorie returne daughter firſt came forth meete trimbrels dance ſo wont exod 15 20 celebrate worthy act prince greatmen meane maides saul thus vſed expreſſe publike thankſgiuings 1 sam 18 6 god aggrauating griefe iphtah ſaid ſhe onely childe daughter came firſt meete muſt done doct thought vowed may ſee effect come raſhnes vnbeſeeming companion wiſe man ſhould ponder doings weigh word reaſon yea religion euen ballances ſanctuarie word god vttered beſt fruite ſorrow repentance true ſaying raſhneſſe doth thought yea might wiſe ſtaied purpoſe though hee gone ſome great luke 15 13 weightie worke gotten portion hand end extremitie miſerie brought himſelfe ſame may ſaid raſhnes choller whereby men ſmite teeth eye head yea breath body ſometime wiues child ſeruants light vpon fume alſo raſh bargaines ſuertiſhips made vndertaken world thouſand miſchiefes beſides likewiſe proteſtations commonly made manner pray god ſinke ſtand bee true ſay god curſe vpon peter himſelf raſhneſſe forgetting himſelfe fall therefore behoueth wiſe well aduiſed vowes god promiſes made men ſnare themſelues neither bring needleſſe ſorrow woe vpon owne head euen ſo aduiſedly circumſpectly made according rule ſet downe verſ 30 wiſe goe performe dauid pſal 119 look eccle 5 3 pſal 15 4 pſal 119 105 hiſtorie gaal chap 9 elſewhere furthermore verſe wee taught god bee praiſed 2 publikely publike benefit wee receiue common wee ſee iphtahs daughter many place haue ſhewed although ſame manner moſes alſo miriam debora ſundrie others reaſons heretofore ſet downe ſo teach poſteritie example doe like god would haue firſt fruites conſecrated wee might vſe reſt thankſgiuing ſhe childe muſt need increaſe heauineſſe vow brought vpon himſelfe ſaw muſt depriued ſinne brought raſh vow making whatſoeuer ſinnes others may beware thereby learne god men ſinne ſpare depriue moſt deare vnto one reaſon hereof lord meaneth humble deeply cauſe deſcend themſelues ſeriouſly purge ſinne waiteth miſchiefe note ſo preuent therefore vſe wee ſhould make whenſoeuer lord dealeth ſo v wee ſhould know hardnes hart otherwiſe without ſuch breaking ſoftned let v leſſe marueile finde ſo though haue often gone gentler meanes yet know haue preuailed ſo wee haue driuen deale hardly v wee count handle v roughly wound v ſo deeply taking thing v moſt deare vnto v accuſed heart hardned deceitfulnes ſinne wee relent yet let v know god hath ſufficient cauſe afflict v exerciſe prepare v greater hold v ſtrangers another place although haue often obſerued ſeuerall ſtories puniſhments fell vpon idolatrous iſraelites verſe may appeare ſore iphtahs daughter meeting verſ 35 ſenſe trouble word hee teſtified ſaying oh thou ſhouldeſt haue chiefe earthly comfort thou ſay art one haſt chiefly caſt downe alſo ſignes thereof hee ſhewed hee cut garment ſorrow manner hebrewes ſaw ſome great calamitie ſuddenly befalne ioel ioel 2 13 place appeareth ſhewes reaſon hee hauing vowed offer lord might ſaid goe backe ſuch ignorance knew libertie giuen lord caſe redeeme man vowed amiſſe verſe affoordeth v many good leſſons firſt ſhe doct ſuch trouble hee gotten victorie lord pulled downe ſo ſore thereby ſay taught god ſeeth expedient thus deale ſeruants oft time hee hath exalted ſome great fauour beſtowed vpon leſt ſhould take much delight therein ſo become ſurfeited therewith hee addeth ſome affliction taketh away ſome part benefit point haue large handled chap 8 verſ 1 booke yet adde ſomewhat appeareth therefore ſundrie particular day paſſed therein better thouſand eſtate beſide lord would haue v claſpe ready learne note little little wee haue hold tranſitory thing though lawfull ſhould count one thing neceſſary though occupied luke 10 42 many make good doctrine haue gathered verſe wit god keeping v vnder ſome way middeſt proſperitie conclude paul neede buffeted leſt hee 2 cor 12 7 ſhould lifted vp aboue meaſure may lay hand vpon mouth ſay god hath moſt iuſt reaſon deale thus v haue ſaid hee ſeeth meete thus exerciſe v leſt wee ſhould bee lifted vp much haue already ſo paſſed bound ſuch manner goe forward theſe word iphtah oh daughter thou art trouble deepe ſudden ſorrow doct 2 ver 35 teſtifie haue poſſeſſed ſay wee may ſee obſerue another thing beſt delight greateſt pleaſures life wee haue exceeding comfort hee daughter may poſſibly doe often turne great ſorrow diſcontentment ſee ſame iacob ſonnes hating brother ioſeph dipped gen 37 33 coate blood hide owne ſinne brought father make thinke ſlaine ſome wilde beaſt ſaw hee brake great paſſion ſaid ſonnes coate euill beaſt hath deuouted oh heauineſſe tooke hold euen ioy moſt deare vnto thus v conſider deare abſolom 2 sam 18 33 father dauid word brought death heauily take wiſh deſire hee might haue loſt owne life haue ſaued word vttered moſt patheticall lamentable manner doe teſtifie thus crieth oh abſolom ſonne ſonne would god died thee oh abſolom ſonne ſonne euen ſo ſore diſquiets corſiues many child parent wiues husband theſe againe one deare friend another vexation haue many men good note houſe land haue brought naught haue ſeene muſt forgoe haue men pleaſures ſtung heart hauing ioy thereof haue forſaken oh men durſt could perſwaded bewray haue ſeene muſt dye leaue haue wrapped deadly ſorrow thraldome thereby ſo neere heart knit earthly delight haue able thinke good thing helpe ſaluation make account well god entertaine good aduice inſtruction offered may bee reaſon truly ſeeing haue ſo greatly abuſed ſetting lord place hart vpon ſo impotently fondly directly contrary god commandement giuing charge rich encreaſe ſet heart 1 tim 6 17 pſalme vpon make ſinne greater muſt know brought yet faith chriſt true repentance ſo bee intitled lord heire haue right lawfulleſt pleaſures profit child god allowance hauing loſt ſame right adam ſinne indeede giuen adam innocencie yet euen godlieſt muſt vſe ſoberly learne enioy god allowance may conference therefore contrary cured contrary ſo let euery mā ſeeing diſeaſe addreſſe himſelfe cure ſee ignorance law land ſometimes breedes man ſuch trouble loſſe make rue life long much man would thinke law god example many man ignorance though otherwiſe welminded drawne bad company ſuch entiſed leaudneſſe made drunke ſnared raſh promiſes bargaines ſuretiſhips others ioyne religion abuſe perfect afterward lamentable complaint father wit iphtah let v heare verſ 36 kind dutifull anſwere daughter father ſaith ſhe thou haſt vowed thing lord concerning ſhe perceiued euery word recorded briefe hiſtory yeeld obediently thee willing confirme helpe make good thy vow obedience rather deſire obedience father highly commendable euen god yet reſpect named wit becauſe ſhe thought father vow lawfull himſelfe thought muſt bee performed kept ſhee ought might haue denied haue yeelded father ſo vainely needleſſely vowed ſhe knowne father libertie law god redeeme ſhe pleaſe god ſhee ſuppoſed demand beware left obeying man good intent offend god maine neither doe parent make conſcience vrge require ſtrict obedience without controle doe make conſcience yet require due often ignorantly would full loth doe knew vnlawfull iphtah doubtleſſe would indeed confeſſe duty lieth ſtreightlieſt vpon parent know demand child hee neglect bound performe ſame might lawfully demanded let none thinke rule himſelfe happieſt weepe reioyce wherein ſtandeth happineſſe whence haue chiefe cauſe reioycing haue hence member holy catholike church chriſt body knit compacted ioynts ſinewes together draweth head body ſubiect diſmembring v draw head influence grace wee ſingular ſelues ſeparate ſelues brother doth great part felicitie hereafter conſiſt ſhall haue fellowſhip saint light euen light god lamb
