iphtahs daughter anſwered father giuen occaſion verſ 37 38 ſhe made requeſt ſelfe verſe ſhewed ſaying giue leaue goe mountaines bewaile virginitie fellowes counted reproch thoſe day die childleſſe ſolitarie place ſhe asked fit purpoſe ſhe would without leaue doe euen good ſhe ſheweth clearely may ſee much leſſe would ſhe haue done dinah iacobs daughter range roue idlely needleſſely dangerouſly may teach youth particularly maiden age doct learne point obedience namely bee owne caruers cut liberty themſelues vnder gouernment authoritie parent go liſt thinke themſelues good craue leaue eſpecially lawfull going forth doe agreeth ſtout loftie ſtomackes therefore moſt going commonly ſuch place ſuch end wiſh afterward ſtaied home doe ſhame ſorrow reape iuſt fruit diſobedience whereas crauing leaue might haue anſwered ſhould haue conſulted ſuch going foorth good ſo might haue ſtaied home ſafety ſhee asked leaue going abroad much would ſhe haue asked weightie caſes branch generall duty obedience whereof much hath ſaid chap 1 elſewhere onely wee may wonder daughter iphtah man ignorant doubt vnaquainted many thing concerning god therefore none fitteſt ſeaſon child religion eſpecially conſidering baniſhment maner liuing ſhe ſay ſhould yet attaine excellent courage ſhew ſo rare patterne obedience men example scripture may compare one aſſuredly greateſt part note child moſt carefull religious parent al knowledge come farre ſhort grace nature ſexe bee reſpected author hebrewes ſaith faith many waxed ſtrong truly verified worthy damſell heb 11 34 among reſt leaue ſhe asked end two moneths ſhe might go 2 point verſe bewaile virginitie comfort ſelfe companion virgin alſo mountaines ſolitarie place among woman reproch thoſe day lamented barren ſo ſhe ſhould die virgine without iſſue kind curſe itſelfe die ſo god commanded men beginning repleniſh earth hebrewes deſired encreaſe holy ſeede commonwealth hoped ſeeing meſſiah ſhould come ſeede abraham might poſſibly come ſome thinke ſeeing ſhe asked goe bewaile virginitie therefore ſhe offered ſacrifice kept marriage vowed father perpetuall virginitie ſhe liued anſwere cannot bee ſeeing neither god euer command require vow virginitie child ſo • rie neither could iphtah mind meane hee made vow haue ſaid hee ſaw moſt like daughter ſhould haue ſhee ſhould haue met ſo indeed beſide daughter conſenting thereto neceſſity ſhe muſt haue vow made beſides returned met daughter ſtricken great griefe ſhee knowing ſenſe hee made vow ſhould meane thus firſt meeteth offer perpetuall virginitie lamenting common ſenſe ſheweth contrary daughter knew hee met authoritie vow virginitie yee ſay nay meant daughter haue anſwered beſides vow burnt offering expounded virginitie likewiſe abſurditie fact vnnaturalneſſe owne child hauing lord requiring leſſe madneſſe though power doe haue either vowed intended ſuch thing much execute therefore although ill grant ignorance offering yet cannot hee vowed virginitie hee meant hee vowed offer ſacrifice ſhould firſt meete thought might ye aske ſhe ſaid ſhe would go bewaile virginitie father meant ſay virginitie expreſſed becauſe ſhe grieued ſhe ſhould dye virgin ſimply ſhe ſhould dye much loſing life ſhe died childleſſe one ſhe liued life long virginitie meaning ſhe lamented ſhe muſt dye virgin learne affliction god doct 2 laieth vpon ſeruants ought grieuous preſent heb 12 11 time alſo according meaſure continuance afflicting hand ſo ought meaſure continuance ſorrowes whole booke lamentation ieremy plentifull witneſſe truth containeth bitter continued complaint made behalfe church deſolation vpon euery part circumſtance whereof laid ballance prouoke due correſpondent heauineſſe humiliation vnder god hand ſo ought v alſo firſt becauſe haue none laid vpon v deſerue ſinne wee muſt led repentance elſe wee abuſe lam 3 3 • beſides greatnes continuance aflictions argue moſt part ſufficiently humbled repent might doe ſinnes call vpon lord effectually wee ſhould moſt men turne away eye vnpleaſing carnally ſolace note themſelues outward bleſſings ſo may auoid heauineſſe choke vſe hereof reproue ſtoicall blockiſhnes thoſe moued affliction reproue againe ſide continuance vnder croſſe doe grow hard hearted rebellious condition fearefull ſigne god reiecting alſo teach v heauier longer trouble vpon v earneſtly labour ſelues grow repentance zeale feruencie iam 1 5 prayer oh ſoone doe euen better ſort god people faint waxe blockiſh vnder doe worſe eſpecially grieuous long vpon yea doe exceed extreame oftentimes laying croſſes neere heart aggrauating beyond meaſure ſinne iob himſelfe trouble exceeded free performe ſolemne worke ſhe choſe ſolitarie place fit verſ 38 purpoſe alſo farre father houſe weane ſelfe thence auoid recourſe friend vnto teach v fall time occaſions bee ſolitarie euen ſelfe commanded v god extraordinary priuat faſting ordinary alſo meditation theſe one ſhould vſe good haue cauſe either longer ſhorter time goe apart ſelues knowing ſpeciall action religious worſhip therefore requireth ſeperation hindrance sauiour chriſt time much preaching companie goe ſome ſolitarie place diſciples returning himſelfe hee might haue freedome heauenly contemplation prayer time great lamentation people mourne death ioſias time zachary prophet whē zach 12 12 familie apart one member another husband apart wife apart fondly doth popery abuſe ſuch example maintaine monaſticall life ſuch like fancy vſed beſt manner euer well vſed much haue brought ſuch abomination come vnto couer much great wickedneſſe point deſerueth obſeruation ſhe heauines wiſely choſe fitteſt exerciſe ſet worke yeeld paſſion would haue made loggiſh vnprofitable vſed ſingular good end euen fit ſelfe death departure mirth ioy hard thing recall home wandring ſenſes ſtraying affection retire thought mindes rouing euery corner world wofull experience tell v sorrow hath likewiſe many thoſe grieuous annoiances attending two compariſon equall fitteſt trumpet ſound retreit naturally contracteth body ſpirits ſo taken heed vnto bringeth ſuperfluous noiſome care delight deſires ſoule narrower compaſſe man wholly home fitter good dutie hee abſent great part himſelfe therefore day griefe ſeaſon opportunitie ſome good dutie time v vnſeaſonable ſo let v vſe accordingly redeeme solitarineſſe confeſſe fit euery ſorrower yet neceſſarie better dutie therfore diſtinguiſh perſons therfore ignorant yet oppreſſed heauineſſe doubt vncertaine god fauour ſinne eſpecially bee preſſed melancholy theſe giue counſell auoide ſolitarineſſe pang griefe melancholike paſſions giue vantage enemie diuell finde alone neere leſt finde deluſions temptation forcible iudas perplexitie hee went aſide companie let ſorrow driue aske counſell make caſes knowne ſuch aduiſe comfort diuell bold aſſault sauiour himſelfe luke 4 2 ſolitarineſſe returne ſpeake point ſuruey taken doubt wee ſhould finde houres ſpeake weekes moneths dedicated moſt part chriſtians heauenly worke vſing ſolitarines meditation eſpecially preparation dye make vp account againſt ſhould called oh look liue long caſe maide within two moneths dying day applied wholly fit death made drunke vnſatiable deſire liuing ſtill therefore tell ſuch ſad vnwelcome matter oh fooles ſuddenly taken vnprouided within day houres death many yeeres therefore leaue lord time iuſtly occaſioneth v ſorrowfull penſiue let v beware blockiſhneſſe commonly accompanieth mirth thinke nothing iollitie ſay wee euery one thus ſelues lord calles home practiſe dutie indeed ought oft vſe meditate eſtate vnburden mind ſoule thoſe manifold needleſſe noyſome thought affection haue ouerloaden ſelfe long time withall lord haue bent ſearch error corruption diſorders hart life going aſide eaſe ſtomack confeſſe loath renounce aske pardon lord haue pray ſpirit may reſtored greater meaſure may returne libertie ſeruice beware againe ſurfeited haue vomited vp world pleaſures vaine deſires vile loathſome luſts good vſe indeed heauineſſe eccleſ 7 1 houſe ſuch mourning better thē houſe feaſting end oh wiſhed damſels well liuing theſe day would ſetforth themſelues world pride boldneſſe niceneſſe curioſitie faſhions modeſtie grace wiſdome maiden another manner ſpectacle ſee many golden ring ſwines ſnout whereas ſaid fill vp meaſure due commendation verſ 39 ſhe returned time ſet vnto father doe hee vowed faithfulneſſe conſtancie obedience maid onely bee commended admired ſhee ſo ſerue god therein ſhe perſwaded keeping couenant promiſe doct made forgoing life doth vrge ſmaller matter much keepe promiſe make conſcience word towards god euen men alſo like ſee paul hauing liberty giuen iourney towards rome rome alſo hee nero priſoner whereby hee might haue made many eſcape ſhifted himſelf yet neuer attempted ſuch courſe faithfully returned captaine keeper though perill life rather would procure ſafety breaking away diſtruſting god vnfaithfulneſſe good cauſe ſeeke ſuch ſhifts great ieſuits zeale pretend neede breaking oath nay priſon prouide themſelues ſundrie haue done teſtifie good cauſe haue maintaine betray ſo groſſely condemneth common vnfaithfulneſſe falſehood alſo haue noted cannot much complaine day practiſed vtter vndoing many thouſands breaking promiſe bond running away men good playing banckroupts defeate ſaid according vow ſufficient verſ 40 proofe vowed virginitie haue ye verſes ſhewed theſe word vnderſtood wit ſacrificed vow doe ſhould firſt meet tie liue virgine therefore ſay leſt ſhould make needle repetition diſſent herein thoſe confeſſed opinion thought otherwiſe doe haue ſhewed reaſons aſſertion though hee ſo performe vow vpon daughter meere conſcience thought ought keepe performe vow hee ſolemnely made though fell vpon owne daughter yet conſult none time admirable doth admoniſh doubtfull dangerous caſes aske counſell ſeeke reſolution withall let take ſeeke ought namely scripture mouth godly learned reſolued scripture see verſe 30 ſaid kept cuſtome daughter iſrael verſ 39 40 went bewaile daughter iphtah foure time yeere tranſlate hebrew word talke comfort bewaile word yeeldeth ſignifications whether two vnderſtood place eaſie ſee vow iphtah taken meaning ment thereby offer ſacrifice followeth neceſſitie theſe maides bewailed met talke ſhee dead although hebrew word deed ſignifieth common bewaile yet haue ſhewed latter ſenſe imbraced held cuſtome lament ſhe ſacrificed appeares ſought thereby ſhould bee forgotten beſides like enough parent might warned make ſuch vowes cuſtome abuſed brought ſuperſtitious doct vſe leſſe miſliked whereas otherwiſe fit breake accordingly ſhould cuſtomes thought dealt agree god law charitie obſerued kept otherwiſe ſuperſtitious prophane hinder put god worſhip danger grow ſuch abuſe broken alſo tend maintaining needleſſe charge expences hurt hindring bee otherwiſe vnlawfull many ſuch day maintained keept aboliſhed therefore blind wicked practiſe ſpending twelue day natiuitie play reuell diſorder alſo leaud cuſtomes ſtill retained ſome part land keepe prophane cuſtomary feaſts drinking sabbath al miſrule like ſort vtterly bee rooted better plant ſet roomes may ſay hauing fully diſcourſed thereof sixtieth nine sermon twelfth chapter booke ivdges verſe 1 men ephraim gathered themſelues together went northward ſaid vnto iphtah wherefore wenteſt thou fight againſt child ammon didſt call v goe thee therefore burne thine houſe vpon thee fire 2 iphtah ſaid vnto people great ſtrife child ammon called ye deliuered hand 3 ſaw yee deliuered put life mine hand went vpon child ammon ſo lord deliuered mine hand wherefore yee come vpon fight againſt 4 iphtah gathered men gilead fought ephraim men gilead ſmote ephraim becauſe ſaid ye gileadites runnagates ephraim among ephramites among manaſsites 5 alſo gileadites tooke paſſages iorden ephramites ephramites eſcaped ſaid let paſſe men gilead ſaid vnto art thou ephramite anſwered nay 6 ſaid vnto say shibboleth ſaid sibboleth could ſo pronounce tooke ſlew paſſages iorden fell time ephramites two fortie thouſand ſumme chapter conſiſting two part ſumme part 2 firſt ſedition ephramites owne coſt quarreling iphtah light rather cauſe comming make warre many ſlaine others flying like manner put ſword verſe 7 ſumme firſt part ſecond declareth ſetteth downe time gouernment iphtah three iudges ſucceeded one another death buriall wit iphtahs theſe ibzan elon abdon end chapter firſt part chapter former part theſe two thing contained firſt bitter contending firſt point ephramites iphtah threatning burne houſe fire iphtahs anſwere defence verſe 4 ſecond thing iphtah killeth diuers skirmiſh fight others flying away verſe 7 ſinnes theſe ephramites ſhew one action verſe 1 many ſhall amiſſe take view text offereth occaſion moſt whereof bee briefer becauſe haue handled already vpon like fact chap 8 1 firſt ſedition riſing againſt ſenſe 3 firſt verſes lawfull gouernour iphtah came pride whereby attributed ſo much vnto themſelues aboue vnthankfulneſſe farre indangered himſelfe ammonite got victorie ſafetie brother thirdly falſe accuſing called helpe conflict boldly making lie ſo charging whereas hee called refuſed come ſhewed diſobedience authority might command laſtly threatning burne houſe fruit ſedition void ſtomake baggage ſaid went northward gilead againſt iphtah contend fight make ſome vſe hereof firſt ſee ſuch beare face honeſt doct men liue countenance among neighbour theſe ephramites may yet poſſibly become proue ſeditious pride ſelfe able ſet men forward abſolon theſe much eaſe idleneſſe ill counſell enuy ſuch like though ſprigges bud forth full faſt readie eaſily yeeld fruit yet muſt haue eſpeciall care grow let prunedoff yea digging roote betimes need branch may wither see haue noted point face shechemites chap 9 2 3 remedie hereof ſeeing pride diſcontentment cauſes hereof let heart bee kept diligence nouriſhing ſuch affection thought cracke pride pull downe thinke note ſelus euen ſuch could ſee face cleare glaſſe god law ſhould appeare loathſome moſt deformed lazer ſuch filthineſſe inborne corruption foule litter moſt monſtrous ſinnes proceed thence ſo farre ſhould ſwelling thinking ſelues great yea petty angel readie doe whereby imagine good ſubiection better lord yea lord himſelfe obeying word many accuſe ſincere preacher profeſſors goſpell ſeditious tumultuous yea enemy good order c man would thinke accuſer like bee ſtained crime chargeth vpon another want feare god ſome ciuilleſt ſuch ſtand law gouernment townes ſhal puld notorious malefactor either crime ſedition demetrius fellowes riot diſorder chargde ſhall found innocent wiſh little preciſer kind confeſſe onely conſcience reſiſt theſe temptation ſinne make ſhift conceale leaudneſſe forcible occaſions prouocations aſſault haue power withſtand thus much looke vpon quarrelling ephramites gedeon chap 8 secondly bitter cauſeleſſe contention threatning burne houſe cauſe rather haue highly thankfull doth teach mettall diſpoſition ſome cannot liue place innocent harmeleſſe take vpon dominere ouer holding feare yet lord hath commanded wee ſhould many maſters neither ſuffer iames 3 1 liue feare v iewes againſt paul ſin contending others though odious whereſoeuer found yet raiſed religion monſtrous hate neighbour weldoing cannot ioyne vnfruitfull ſhameleſſe workes darkneſſe reprooue rather ſuch ſay hate deadly hatred cannot diſliking malicious conceit againſt pacified reconciled wrath vnapeazable reade cain cauſe towards 1 ioh 3 12 brother abel brother deed good euill ought teach v onely liue peaceably thoſe quietly diſpoſed though framed liue chriſtianly alſo doe beſt winne perſwade looke life come feare god firſt innocent liuing among good example giuing vnto little little drawing forward good inſtruction admonition otherwiſe ſhall bee cauſe eſpecially ſhould vrge v neerely knit brotherly loue one chriſtian another beare infirmity ſee helpe one another rather take pritch conceit one againſt another ſo cauſe ſtrangenes breaking fellowſhip wherein many offend greatly till forced hard vſage finde among bad ſort make account brother afterward often former doctrine may added limme branch ciuill men heatheniſh onely king ammon chap 11 3 profeſſors alſo ſometimes ſee theſe ephramites adde ſtrength contention braules giue libertie therein ſay ſticke ſet diſlikes accuſing lye falſe chargings ſo may ſeeme haue iuſt cauſe hate contend wicked ziba bring disfauour diſgrace 2 sam 16 3 innocent man mephibaſheth dauid much lay lye falſe accuſations let odiouſnes ſuch dealing make ſpeaking truth ſet v yet loues ſake brother vrge vtmoſt may doe though might doe iuſtly right kinde ſhewing loue let reader ſee chap 11 13 vnthankfulnes theſe ephramites marueile ſee towards iphtah branded ſuch groſſe euils 4 haue heard bee let v learne god ſeruants may looke world loue labour procuring peace welfare bringing good truly vnthankfulnes may looke ill fruite thereof recompence rendred good go bring wicked world better point meane labouring acquaint god owe haue worth wee may ſee paul word philemon yea cleere alſo word god phile 19 beholding great part liues reade ten righteous men ſake sodome ſhould haue bin deſtroyed euen gen 18 32 ſay beholding ſame good ſeruants god well welfare ſoules holy prayer good endeuours would helper might regarded yea ſay much word world could ſtand ſo haue enioy ſakes might haue god hand willingly withhold themſelues doth whole rabble yeeld againe god people thinke vnthankfulnes vnleſſe god inlightneth beleeue truth euen iphtah receiue hand ephramites ſet libertie yea indignitie diſcourteſie bad vſage omit little hope good done ſay deſire glorifie god bringing foorth iohn 15 9 much fruite let diſcouraged beare contentedly hand onely recompence vnthankfull world yeeld ſuch chriſt himſelfe found foretold v ſaying haue done many good workes among doe yee ſtone againe iohn 10 32 iohn 16 haue knowne ſaith neither know fuller vſe hereof looke chap 8 verſes 22 35 alſo chap 8 1 laſtly verſe whereas finne contending diſſembling theſe ephramites found one many generation 5 partly haue heard already 8 chapter book ſee ephramites ſame gedeon theſe poſteritie iphtah afterward like pride read poſteritie reacheth ſinne keepeth kindred many generation treaſon whoredome flatterie diſſembling ſuch like ſuch taint ſtaines worne till ſpeciall grace god doe worke effect ſame chap 8 1 theſe point ſhunne tediouſnes purpoſe theſe two next verſes ſet downe anſwere iphtah theſe ephramites anſwere cleere vſed meanes like wiſe verſ 2 3 well gouerned man hee would take vp weapon againſt brother ephramites notwithſtanding bold prouoking iudge gouernour ouer might therefore authoritie haue beaten downe ſumme anſwere laid falſe accuſation charge contrariwiſe ſuch time ſore prouoked ammonite driuen make warre thē ſought helpe would goe foorth put ſhifts fought perill danger life lord deliuered hand therefore demand cauſe ephramites aſſault ſet vpon manner thus much iphtahs anſwer let v conſider particularly wee haue done ephramites quarrelling commeth firſt noted diſordered contending courſe law doct ſeditiouſly tumult one affliction aroſe good man another trouble yt daughter accompanied ſome ſort came neighbour ephramites whereby may ſee condition god people glaſſe euer wrapped new combat trouble daily ſo end one beginning another wee ſee booke iob ſaid iob 1 16 trouble one complaint came necke another yet bee marueiled god goodneſſe ſo worketh ruled may ſee turne profit benefit according ſaying apoſtle wit thing rom 8 28 turne beſt loue god like ſaith iames count iam 1 2 brother matter greateſt reioycing whē ye fall diuers tribulation doubt mercie god ſo ſo corrupt defiled thing ſucceed v deſire exceedingly lifted vp forget ſelues ſuch wiſe pride intollerable ſhamefully diſguiſe ſelues ſo ſuch feare god behold v knowing wormes meate greatly grieued ſee inſolencie therefore keepe v ſuch diſguiſednes danger commeth thereby fauour god ſome proſperitie doth vſe exerciſe v new combat affliction hold v vnder yea much benefit v better goe heauen mark 9 45 one foote hell ſo rather ſaue v putting v ſome paine griefe rather loſe forgoe v vtterly ſuffering v enioy vncertaine momentany proſperitie pleaſures ſinne hauing ſpoken thought fit chap 11 verſ 34 8 1 adde onely watch word neceſſarie taken v although wee iphtah chap 11 35 humbled ſome affliction ſo time brought obedience ſubdued meete v yet becauſe wee doe ſo ſoone waſh therefore haue need many thoſe alſo ſtrong affliction iphtah mallet beare v downe one another bruſe v ſo may meekned vnder mightie hand god muſt importunate prayer may accuſtomed daily note beare croſſe patiently contentedly till hee haue perfected luke 9 23 brought appointed meaſure good worke hath begun v whereas ſucceſſion heauie affliction much diſmaieth v moſt part though ala worth naming reſpect chriſts whoſe affliction wee ſhould conformable vnto yet glorie worke v apoſtle ſaith ſay rom 8 18 ſhould otherwiſe ſhould caſt one eye eft vpon righteous equall dealing god eft vpon cauſe within ſelues well vpon greatnes affliction multiplicitie hath often noted handling argument secondly ſee anſwer made falſe accuſations bee proudly giuen againſt v reproch hurt doct 2 theſe ephramites againſt iphtah ſuch ſay ſuffered paſſe leſt author bee imboldned thereby doe ſo ſtill yea goe salomon teacheth ſaying anſwere foole according prou 26 5 folly leſt wiſe owne conceit ſo waxe bold make practiſe though wee walking innocencie vprightnes good conſcience ſhould regard taunt vniuſt reproches euill eccleſ 7 11 tongue commonly ſend v much leſſe hearken ſay v wee ſhould neuer quiet yet weightie matter touch profeſſion credit thereof ought obtaine note vſe helpe magiſtrate reſtraine ſlanderer reſpect mephiboſheth complained dauid ziba procure vnto due vnleſſe repent eſpecially take wee heed giue iuſt cauſe ſpeake euill v wee ſuffer euill doer ſo wee 1 pet 3 17 bring double puniſhment vpon ſelues becauſe much ſeed contention ſowne world bad perſons ſay part dutie roote vp faſt much v lieth ye aske done anſwere beſides ſaid ſhould carefully looke take good part may cannot yet defending innocencie let v ſhew meeknes ſtriue againſt bitterneſſe offender ſee note fault haue good bleſſing labour lawfull goe according greatnes fault ſo let ſatisfaction vrged hand wiſe let v ſee wee keepe vnitie ſpirit bond peace thought good adde haue ſaid eleuenth chapter iphtah anſwere elder gilead replie king ammons lying anſwere come particularly matter ſee whereas make chiefe cauſe quarrell againſt called helpe againſt ammonite hee telleth hee call would come conuinceth lye would doct 3 thinke ſo many ſhould conſent together ſo boldly maintaine falſe matter men viſible church tribe ephraim one famous tribe among reſt therefore day doe carrie head aloft profeſſion outward eſtate world haue great cauſe ſuſpect feare themſelues ſinne like terrifie withhold men ſtanding ſtiffe lye let fearefull example gehazi preuaile ſuch 2 king 5 27 like scripture heart man falſe naught eaſily carrie men odious vile eſpecially matter ſauour profit pleaſure ſelfeloue ſhall ſo blindfold ſhall ſee euill haue done till ſmart vnleſſe ſuch keepe narrow watch ouer heart ſearching faithfully finde amiſſe may done god hath giuen v two eſpeciall good helpes firſt comming light euill iohn 3 19 deedes may way made knowne v owne examinings priuatly way arraigning ſelues god ſo pſal 4 4 lam 3 40 may caſt ſuch filthineſſe lying diſſembling like ſins see branch 3 verſe 1 theſe ephramites dealt iphtah men succoth penuel doct 4 ver 2 dealt gedeon hee followed prince midian wit zeba zalmunna dealt roughly vnkindly theſe iphtah gouernour ſent helpe moſt vndutifully denied yet much worſe came quarrelled hee got victorie ſhameleſly affirmed called battell ſo would bee thought haue deſerued much fame commendation victorie iphtah ſeeing boaſted ready haue gone againſt ammonite indeed meant therein bewrayed two foule fault odious bee taken heed one hardheartednes barbarous vnkindnes helpe brother need caſe owne well ioined diſobedience iphtah gouernour fault ſubtiltie way ſide ſoeuer victorie ſhould goe prouide themſelues firſt taught beware vnkindnes incompaſſionate hard heartednes bee ſenſeleſſe miſeries neceſſities brother moued pitie toward diſtreſſes wee ſhould doe commandement god cauſes ſo ſelues ſubiect fall like trouble doe alſo one time caſe conſciences beare v witneſſe iuſtly forſaken left ſinke ſorrowes ſmart calamity none ſhould offer themſelues pitie v ſeeing wee ſhewed • little mercie kindnes like trouble rather hard hearted towards doubtleſſe one cauſe wee note may ſee euill ſeruant pitie fellow therefore maſter wroth deliuered tormentor matth 18 34 one cauſe ſay god afflicteth v much ſhould otherwiſe neuer pitie brother trouble thereby learne commiſeration towards looke chap 5 deboras complaint 〈◊〉 chap 8 verſ 6 8 fault ſubtiltie double dealing hauing doct 5 verſ 2 3 ill conſcience propounded themſelues ammonite victorie ouer iphtah ſhould free hurt danger ſeeing ſtirred againſt aide iphtah ſhould preuaile againſt would come forth floriſhing boldly lye affirming cauſe take hardly hee got victorie proudly would call bee partaker ſo indeede thus men ſay two ſtrings bow falſehood ſo common world deale ſubtilly hard know truſt salomon complaining asketh faithfull man ſhall found touching vngodly policie prou 20 7 ſubtiltie enough hath ſpoken vpon like occaſion hollow heartednes falſehood ground adde ſomewhat particularly ſinne committed many way ſo three thing eſpecially subtiltie bad policie appeares three thing chiefly remedy obſerue firſt profeſſing religion ſecondly friendſhip betwixt among men thirdly men bargaining worldly dealing remedying long diſcourſe large thē ſhould done firſt becauſe many profeſſing brought like religion credit profit vainglorie ſo fall againe ſmall occaſions therefore take inſtruction let power beautie goſpell perſwade thee become profeſſor rather hope profit ſeeking credit thereby c thou haſt felt note haue wrought thee powerfull preaching thereof faith new life thou ſeeſt ſafe well liking hath made thine eſtate vnto thee compariſon god bleſſing ſhall worke faithfulnes thee honour beautifie thy profeſſion ſo thou ſhalt ſtart aſide many doe otherwiſe thou ſhalt neuer hold thy profeſſion faire ſhewes ſo euer thou makeſt thou doeſt yet thou ſhalt reape fruite peace harueſt ſuch profeſſion becauſe beſt ſound paſſe ſecond remedying doublenes diſſimulation ſecond remedie friendſhip let one chiefe rule chuſe thy friend goodneſſe excelling others pietie vertue eſpecially hee approued continuer therin one free ſtrong affection note choller anger tetchines loue ſtill ſeeing thing deſired man goodneſſe whether kindneſſes prou 19 19 enioyed therewith faile yet hold principle ſtill nouriſh thinking true friendſhip rare precious let counſell salomon forgotten thine owne friend thy father forſake thou beware thy ſelfe tetchineſſe prou 27 10 conceit againſt yea though thou thinkeſt hath giuen thee cauſe talebearer would ſet diuiſion betwixt thee neither prou 17 9 repeate matter ought haue buried forgotten may eaſily alienate thee wiſe let hope earthly commoditie tickle thee want thereof coole diminiſh affection thee towards faithfulnes friendſhip preſerued hollownes diſſembling auoided otherwiſe like league fooles ſoone broken remoue falſehood vntruſtineſſe bargaining worldly dealing thinke good thee thou ſeeſt euill hurtfull third remedie note another eſpecially meaner man wealth thy ſelfe moſt poore body worth value ware commoditie ſhall agreed vpon plainly without ſubtiltie willing giue penny penniworth abraham weighed ſiluer according manner cuſtome time ephron hittite peece gen 23 16 ground bought bury dead ſo thou pay currant money coyne according couenant neere may may equalitie day ſet paiment keepe leaſt let fault thee let ſeene thou art diſappointed hindred paying againſt thy ſo common wealth regarded thee thine owne priuate onely thou ſhalt come neere rule sauiour giueth earthly dealing looke ye matth 7 12 would men ſhould doe euen ſame doe yee vnto ſhalt thou guiltie double dealing falſehood thou thus note ſhunne theſe three hollowneſſe ſubtiltie thou ſhalt haue great cauſe reioyce thine vprightnes ſinceritie eaſily brought halting diſſembling matter let v proceed iphtah anſwers ephramites ſaw would helpe ſaith put life mine hand meaning doct 6 aduentured without reſted god going foorth ſmaller helpe could haue greater paterne wee taught hang neither depend men good thing take hand example neither thoſe thing concerne owne happines directly meane ſeeking faith conuerſion pertaine ſanctification life godlines mercie loue righteouſnes innocencie muſt neglect good dutie becauſe ſee backward rather look example forwardeſt moſt faithfull generall ſpeciall calling wiſe let v regard follow come behinde good thing acknowledge ſhould doe ſo preuenting miſchief neere hand iphtah following hard ammonite ephramites refuſed helpe abigails wiſedome eare commended 1 sam 25 33 imitated many degree nabals folly ſenſeleſſe blockiſhnes euen ſo let v ſay ioſhua goe ioyne ioſhua 24 15 v yet ſerue lord sauiour ſaw many offended doctrine departing away asked peter name reſt ye alſo goe away peter anſwers whither ſhall goe lord ioh 6 68 forſake thee haſt word eternall life ſure therefore prouide ill ſelues pinne zeale forwardnes vpon others gather ſtrength enough owne aſſurance god peculiar goodneſſe towards owne ſoules keepe v cloſe firme purpoſe cleauing daily doth ſo wiſe matth 7 24 build vpon rocke aſſault ſhall batter building declining ſtarting backe others leaueth ſaying thus himſelf ſtand fall owne maſter whether haue euer truly perſwaded god fauour towards cannot tell know haue beleeued therefore men blind ſhall put owne eye ſee world generally diſpoſed coldnes note looſenes lukewarmnes ſhall preſently repent zeale forwardnes haue reſolued vpon better ground may ſhaken euery blaſt winde frowning better want encouragement men becauſe ſee theſe thing price account among ſuch cannot iudge onely ſerue god faithfully many liue ſame towne careleſſe prophane god aſhamed ſo many rather hee acknowledge reiect multitude oh wretched part aſhamed men feare baſe ſinfull man whoſe breath noſtrils god caſt body ſoule matth 10 28 hell point ſee chap 8 verſe 11 compared former ſaying god deliuered ammonite hand without doct 7 helpe manifeſt wee ſee firſt gratiouſly god prouided ſeruant whereas hee could meanes procure aide theſe ephramites lord dealt ſo hee needed went proſperouſly obtained beſt aſſiſtance god forſake truſt hee helpe defence time neede ſo much father mother forſake hee taketh vp thing greatly fleſheth vngodlie ala little know refuge righteous haue time neede wit haue friend might wealth thinke ouermatch aduerſarie thinke hee hath ſhift lord exclude muſt either fall reproch make ſhipwracke conicience although god ſee expedient hee diſappointeth fruſtrateth hope thus enemy dauid daniel sauiour inſulted contriued purpoſes ſo miſchieuouſly manward ſaw way purſued eſcape ſay iewes let v ſee god helpe pinch oh fooles god farre alſo hotteſt furie againſt ye ſaid ſomewhat indeed loe neereſt carrie laugh enemy • orne iphtah deſirous ephramites helpe denied lord ſo wrought firſt complained hee needed ephramites helpe lord hoaſts ſide make ſupply let added encouragement ſpake laſt doctrine hakednes ſolitarines meane want men countenance furtherance ought rather driue cling cloſely vnder lord wing able make enemy people prou 16 7 friend way doe pleaſe hee vſe meanes vphold without helpe either ſo muzzle ſhall note hurt would hee enable ſuch courage boldnes ſhall contemne contempt little regard oppoſition ſuch may doe hurt yet lord ſo grace ſhall goe vnder croſſe willingly bee rather confirmed vnſetled good courſe thereby let ſuch would willingly bee religious ſaue onely reproch others yea euen owne fleſh would caſt vpon let ſuch ſay labour beleeue temptation ſhall little trouble againe obſerue hence bleſſing god giueth weake meanes men goe worke ſimplicitie good conſcience good attempt ought encourage offer themſelues willingly worke tenne thouſand men zebulon napthali iudg 4 6 lord battailes againſt ſome hundred thouſands siſer • armie came againſt ſuch caſe god hath ſet v worke heartned v let v diſcouraged meaneneſſe ſhew reaſon indeed able doe little hereby may perſwade haue greateſt men account haue brought greateſt light goſpel vnto men ſuch meane iudgemēt world euen ſo many dealing effecteth great matter weake meanes see noted vpon iphtah victorie eleuenth chap 32 verſe ſame word vpon theſe promiſſes iphtah concludeth interrogation asking doct 8 wherefore come fight againſt ſhould haue ſaid ſaued liues ſitting home eaſe reaſon haue yee therefore thus come againſt may learne wee ſhould good god commandement proues v moſt bad diſpoſition ſhall found iniurious hurtfull innocent theſe men ephraim againſt iphtah ſo may ſay thoſe doe v hurt good though liue innocent whereas heathen doe good ſuch doe good c vſe matth 5 46 doctrine ſo liue among men wee may charged iuſtly conuicted wronging yet reſt ready doe good may ſtand calling ſhall able ſo ſhall wee ſure neuer feare accuſations vnkinde vnbrotherly dealing brought may anſwere iob mine aduerſarie write booke againſt take ſhoulder reade iob 31 36 liſteth touching reiecting apologie iphtah point hath 9 handled eleuenth chapter although wilfulnes farre worſe became heathen king ammon yet ſomwhat adde ſo fit occaſion like wilfulnes troubled iphtah little eſpecially gouernour loth haue turned edge ſword vpon owne people could haue auoided beſides yet could ſuffer haue graue iuſt defence ſo ſlightly reiected fruite expected hand came ready armed trie matter force like would ſtand debating reaſoning long came preiudicate reſolute minde contrary ſaid indeed gaue eare reall refuſall hearken appeares proceeding warre yee ſay eighth booke predeceſſors bewraied contrary wrath appeaſed anſwere gedeon anſwere indeed vſed like froward child condiſcended vnto proud angrie humour pleaſed gaue ouer much adoe bin beaſts nay doubtleſſe could although would angrie man cannot continue anger ſo long would fewell remoued praiſe man humoured may ſay giues ouer though honour appeaſer yet ſhame becauſe ſhould haue ouercome himſelfe ſhame ſay reſpect although indeed deſiſteth meanes better implacable returne dramme good nature indifferencie religion none would well haue abated ſpirit towards hearkning ſound reaſon father gedeons mildneſſe yes doubtleſſe impoſſible order vnreaſonable paffion reaſon mad reaſon let ſet eye god miniſters diſpoſition moſt ordinary hearer ſo wee may learne armed againſt diſcouragement yoked ſuch ſtiffenecked oppoſite nature winde finger moſt ſerious charge lay vpon conſcience hoſee declare vnto large hoſ 6 4 c weightie thing law account ſtrange thing long information fare neuer heard make word courſe wee ſpoke vnknowne tongue vnto looke ſhould receiue god ſo ſome doe yeeld ſubſcribe hearken ſo may ſay haue piped vnto ye haue danced c doe matth 11 17 conceiue meaning tune ſong yes otherwiſe reſolued haue another courſe runne thoſe ephramites god complaineth hee knew entreate hoſ 6 4 therefore hearing vnderſtand ſeeing ſee winke harden heart againſt v muſt need grieue v yes ſo ought make v mourne moderatly phyſition ouer patient whoſe diſeaſe paſſ skill ere medled indeed ſo ought let v feede caſt away meate thriue diſcredit v diet good ordinary could wiſh could find appetite well food paſt skill died famine ſurfeit meanes vſed therein reſt ſay ſweete ſauour lord periſh manifeſt ſigne god reiect god would perſwade v ala ſhould perſwade haue ſaued owne ſoules blood vpon owne head died want phyſicke wilfulnes meane ephramites againſt iphtah came ciuill warre betweene next sermon laſtly ſo many could agree together ſo wicked action 10 leſſe two fortie thouſand men ſo many loſt liues thereby may ſee eaſily men agree together euill traytors rebel confederate euill doe whereas hard yea dwelling together one towne better ſort agree together good matter againſt euill committed therein though owne great eaſe good doe ſo moſt ſhould ſeeke puniſhing ſinne farre gone themſelues deepe therein one kinde ſo muſt hold backe ſhame leſt owne puniſhment ſhould procured vrging buſily vpon others beſides men commonly owne corrupt nature ſlow backward good vſe purge clenſe ſelues care euill ſoule bodie keepe heart diligence 2 cor 7 1 good life may come thence ſhall wee neuer neede feare wee ſhall vpholders ſinne agree prou 4 23 ſuch purpoſe good note degree wee grow either height ſinne euen heere may bee learned example theſe ephramites like fort may bee ſeene firſt anger kindled againſt iphtah bred heart wrath followed continued anger next hot contention conſent ioyne warre band themſelues againſt innocent helpfull yea euen point haue handled heretofore thus much ephramites quarrelling iphtah anſwere seventieth sermon twelfth chapter booke ivdges followeth fight cruel warre verſ 4 5 6 ſumme theſe 3 verſes ephramites iphtah wee haue heard would wiſe relent ſound good reaſon iphtah brought diſſwade battell reſolute proceed therein wherefore fought ouercame might eſcape hee preuented tooke paſſages ouer water iorden could paſſe ouer returne home alſo many taken ſlaine come verſes ſeuerally fourth verſe whereas ſumme verſe 4 marueiled iphtah made ciuill warre theſe ephramites ſuch know could ſtaied diſſwaded making aſſault vpon therefore free reſpect ſuch ſtreight defend himſelfe although priuate man ſo much wit head chiefe ouer ſword authoritie put hand whereby onely goe againſt forreine enemy alſo ſuppreſſe puniſh rebellious ſeditious land ſhould offend manner lord gaue victory ouer deſpiſed ſought againſt right law take gouernment ouer gileadites caſt ſtrong hand hee rightly poſſeſſed duly conſidered puniſhment deſtruction doct verſ 4 befell thereby euen loſſe two fortie thouſand men liues perſwations would yeeld peace laieth heauy iuſt iudgement god againſt thoſe vnthankfull wilfull ſeditious worth noting ſee ſuch proud ſpirits bring vpon themſelues trouble themſelues ſeeke trouble others either god taketh vengeance ſuch men vpon achan ioſhua ſaid vnto seeing thou haſt troubled v god ſhall ioſh 7 25 trouble thee day ſtoned death elſe lord doth himſelfe without meanes ſaid recompence tribulation 2 theſ 1 6 trouble teach v follow peace men holineſſe without man ſhall ſee lord face heb 12 14 fruit men wilfulnes deare price coſteth haue noted ſomewhat elſewhere knit vp point therefore marke iuſtly god met theſe ephramites ſhame vnto firſt diſturbers peace good order ſo foully foiled beaten prouoked iniuriouſly falleth ſo falleth alwaies ſo cutting combe pulling downe proud ſtomacke ſhould carrie away field preuaile alway ſhould liue ſuch defence innocēt preuenting confuſion would otherwiſe enſue intollerable boaſter hee hath lord reſiſts ſuch pares nailes ſo horne ſhort though heart full curſt ſeeing ſay makebate contentious perſon put worſe well ſerued teach liue within bound meddle giue cauſe let v prouide dealing others cauſe honeſt well grounded affection ſutable carried paſſion heate rage againſt hath note wronged v fall wee defeated put foile may looke ſuch caſe god himſelfe take againſt v bad courſes ſhall wee able hold vp head ſhame men reioyce ouerthrow surely hee need impudent ſhould beare god men owne conſcience downe altogether blank ſhame owne boldnes hath brought vpon ſuch meaſure ſucceſſe haue leaudnes thinking becommeth well enough proſper ſhall ſaid ſuch 5 6 verſes following verſe reaſon added gileadites ſlew ephraim 2 wit becauſe railed theſe ephramites branded themſelues ſo many foule ſinnes together haue heard bad yet added reſt railed alſo theſe railing word vſed contention iphtah vpon gileadites doubly incenſed ſeeing quarrelled iphtah threatned ſo wonder grew diſgrace whole familie meaning gilead ſmote ephraim becauſe ephraim beſides ſedition added diſdainfull reprochfull termes becauſe dwelt betweene two tribe tooke occaſion call mungrels hangbyes men ſet tribe neuter hath ſaid though tribe ephraim famous tribe among reſt none meaneſt yet ſee beſt birth deſcent may poſſibly degenerate grow companion baſe ſhameleſſe theſe worthily ſuch meaſure offered brother leaudnes quarrelling tumult railing thoſe may thus diſguiſe themſelues eaſily nay vſually thinke may ſeene vile abiects ofscourings may dwell among worthy right honeſt ſeruants god good chriſtians kindred alſo many vagrant idle perſons doe hang prince court neither hired belonging houſe ſhifters belly backes offering themſelues runne meane perſons errand ſo townes city vnruly diſordered fellowes either ſhrouded vnder wing godly kindred neſtling themſelues among good note religion note honeſt behauiour ſome without calling brought vp labour ſome without liuing voide grace ready ſet worke miſchiefe opportunitie ſerue diuers city reade booke act apoſtles waited bee hired make tumult vprores therein yet would haue none take thus though meant ſuch ſpeake poore folke townes meane eſtate liue ſay many follow calling diligently labour painefully liuing goſpell truly preached ſome religious approoued good chriſtians ſpeak know although deny alſo many idle hangbies may reckoned worthily among ſpake vſe helpe weede ſuch men haue abilitie authoritie chiefe men townes bee furtherance hereunto preuent idleneſſe irreligiouſneſſe liuing without calling whence ſuch annoyance doe ariſe looke chapter 9 4 11 4 haue heard ſubduing killing many ephramites verſ 5 6 battaile mentioned followeth reſt ſlaine taking paſſages iorden many found bee ephramites ſlew put ſword loſt liues one time two fortie thouſand becauſe many paſſed ouer iorden reubinites manaſſites well ephramites therefore tried language ſpeech whether ephramites tongue pronouncing bad pronounce shibboleth full manner could ſaid sibboleth able pronounce ſo meanes diſcerned ſo taken ſlaine firſt thing noted occaſion moued gileadites doct vſe policie bid ſay shibboleth becauſe theſe ephramites asked made lye ſaue liues denied tribe true satan ſaid iob 2 skin skin iob 2 4 man hath giue life euen truth honeſtie marueile may blame theſe lying ſo weighty caſe life ſelfe becauſe thinke ſhould put theſe might ſhould doe ſaue life indeede confeſſe life ſweete lying lawfull caſe caſe perill life one thing man omit ſome dutie law mercy ſake owne life another commit expreſſe ſinne againſt negatiue law therefore although bee lawfull man preferre life ſome dutie commanded put caſe sabbath day duty yet man may magiſtrate anſwere falſely equiuocatinglye vnder colour mercy ſauing life onely omitting ſome dutie groſſe fault herein therefore rule true euill muſt done good may come thereof negatiue rule law admit exception except god diſpenſe iſraelites robbing exod 11 2 12 35 aegyptians aboue law hence followeth lying bee ſinne well ſinne lye defence man life lye needleſly pleaſe three officious vaine ſhameleſſe lye ſame cloth though ſame colour equall ſo deepe dye v chriſtians ſhould ſeeme hard condition neither caſt ſelues vpon god rather beholding lye life caſe ſhould ſo ſtand better liue liue note worſe death accuſing conſcience abiured proteſtants time perſecution witneſſe fond fooliſh pretence colour warped ſubtile braine man diminiſh one iot commandement god much leſſe diſanull ſaue life euill indirect meanes ſhall loſe done ſee theſe ephramites gained lye conuicted ſame tongue made one breath matth 16 25 truth caſe ſtood fleeing enemy ſo bad quarrell little better looked hand lye ſhift themſelues hauing brought themſelues briar contention rebellion railing let v beware bring ſelues ſuch ſtreights ſinne ſhall finde matter hard enough helpe ſelues extremitie danger trouble god brings vpon v better fenced faith good conſcience danger former deſperate remedileſſe elſewhere haue fully declared shechemites captaine gaal chap 9 secondly whereas text ſaith theſe ephramites failed doct 2 full pronouncing word ſee although tribe ſpake one language yet euen therein ſuch difference one ſpake ſee theſe ephramites could pronounce reubinites manaſſites euen alſo greekes haue great difference engliſhmen namely ſoutherne northward differ much one another dialect manner pronouncing though ſpeake one language ſhould teach v oft wee heare thinke hurt detriment comming thereby ſhould call mind bee humbled ſelues ſinne cauſed confounding language firſt fruite whereof remaineth among v day ought iuſtly humble v much toyle time ſpent learning vnderſtand language might elſe haue otherwiſe beſtowed alſo ſtrange tongue wee ſee wicked keepe many vnderſtanding pure word god romiſh prelate long haue done could haue one language ſpeech ouer earth beſides difficultie reſpect ſpeake doe many trauell forraine land exchange ware commodity end purpoſes except haue learned language cannot ſpeake interpreter labour beſtowed tranſlating scripture writing elſe might haue bin ſpared done commeth ſhort naturall tongue language inſiſt inconueniences ariſe tranſlations euen controuerſies religion faith ſome part cut one ſame language bee generally embraced tranſlate beſt attaine vnto ſignificancie word proprietie meaning naturall language would affoord without difficultie theſe like diſcommodities ariſe diuiſion tongue although liue home owne countrey conuerſe ſuch ſame ſpeech themſelues doe ſo much obſerue let ſuch conſider god mercie confuſion reacheth doth confined though within ſo large bound againe let v know men diſhonouring god tongue periury yea ſwearing blaſphemie curſed ſpeaking ſpecially imprecation might bring deeper iudgement vpon perſon though generall little trouble euen taking away ſpeech altogether kinde example neither experience former age owne haue wanting although god ſhould ſmite oft prouoked ſhould bee end conclude therefore let bee watchword againſt abuſing language leſt wee prouoke many daily doe ſome curſe puniſhment god bee made example feare others ſeeing men would admoniſh v laſtly hence ſlew ſuch could pronounce word doct 3 learne theſe loſt liues returning homeward though eſcaped battaile ſo wicked men paſſe one danger yet ſhall fall another lord againſt neuer ſafe free feare perill ſome euill light vpon although cauſe prophet amos ſaith man flie amos 5 19 lyon beare ſhall meete euen ſo ſee experience ſuch eſcape lying friendſhip money ſuch like hand men god himſelfe certainely meete peſtilence arreſt ſome ſtrange diſeaſe debt impriſonment ſhame ſome note viſitation el worme conſcience ſerpent ſhall bite haue conſcience ſeared hot yron yet plague ſhal take hold euen hardned heart cannot repent ſo dying ſeeke get plunge doe moſt certainely periſh vtterly without recouery throwne gulfe bottomleſſe weeping gnaſhing teeth although ſuch ill diſpoſed perſons dye alwaies company multitude heere flood noah time commeth often paſſe according occaſions offered therefore leſſe marked yet obſerueth ſhall finde bewray vpright harted diſſemblers hollow haue fauour goſpell good thing behauiour ſpeech companie doe teſtifie bad liues ſay ſuch obſerue ſhall find one another ſome one iudgment ſome another ſhall verifie ſay namely ſuch pine wanſe away ſecretly ignorance impenitencie bee areſted apparently ſuch viſitations god teſtifie ſame see note vpon ninth chapter death abimelech men shechem ſecond part chapter verſ 7 iphtah iudged iſrael ſixe yeeres bethlehem 11 iudged iſrael elon zebulonite iudged iſrael tenne yeeres 12 elon zebulonite died buried aijalon countrey zebulon 13 abdon ſonne hillel pirathonite iudged iſrael 14 hee fortie ſonnes iphtah verſ 7 end ſumme diuers iudges iſrael together death buriall owne city dwelt aboad life time wherein ſaid common wil ſpeake ioyntly time long gouerned death buriall ſet downe alike thing herein contained ſeuerally note occaſion ſhall offered text firſt time iudges ouer people ſaid iphtah place ſixe yeere ibzan ſeuen yeeres elon tenne doctrine generall abdon eight one thirtie ſmall number foure enioy place one another whoſe office deliuer people hand enemy ſo doubtleſſe cauſe bondage elſe kept peace oppreſſed brought vnder enemy al great fauour god iſrael changing gouernours ſo oft yet ſaid betwixt time one haue enemy hand ſo expreſly ſet downe former example ſtories thus lord hath bleſſings ſorts church willing change puniſhments till abuſe turne owne bane theſe 31 yeeres peace vnder foure gouernours granted iſrael ſo owne ſinne reuolt god brought vpon ſo long longer time warre diſquiet lord could haue allowed peace without interruption could haue ſerued without vnſetling wearineſſe dealt ſo would v alſo hath vndeſeruedly continued peaceable day euen time late change worke moſt worthy remembrance ſo would haue freed v plague dearth alſo hath allaied peace ſuch domeſtical puniſhments theſe late yeeres haue witneſſed wee may thanke ſelues marueile haue ſorer doubtleſſe hee hath therein remembred mercie iudgement peace trouble wherewith accompanied cauſed ſelues farre bitter ſhould cup made lam 3 39 drink haue tempered lord mercie hold back v confuſion bondage enemy hee inflicted often vpon theſe iſraelites particularly teacheth great mercy god change great madnes men ſorts condition daily manifold affliction cannot expreſſed yet ſo wedded glued world fit heare departure hence bee brought ſober moderate vſe ſtrongeſt perſwaſions looke waite immortalitie ſo may enioy let iudge little cauſe haue doe ſo might bee thought benefit long life man ſo ſhortned nine hundred yeeres ſcarſe halfe nine ſcore men duly weighed euill old iacob told pharao euill haue day thy gen 47 9 ſeruant oh rate would moſt men buy lengthening miſerie madneſſe ſo much extreame becauſe want might much allay vanitie vexation falleth life meane faith grace others ſide meeting much yea ſtinging trouble liues oft time waxe diſcontented deſperate wearie liuing yet without willingnes dye ſaue neceſſitie owne making thinking thereby auoide encreaſe thereby third whoſe fault may leſſe ſimple ignorance elſe may reckoned companion grudge murmur haue ſo many child ariſeth partly diſtruſt god prouidence partly fearing ſhall haue wherewith nouriſh partly pride ſee oppreſſion nation dwelt muſt elſe haue ſuch elbow roome libertie ſo ſhew themſelues boldly openly hide head well meaner perſons lay iollitie aſide inſtruction wee may learne time peace freedome warre perſecution land great proſperitie euery kinde multitude people building purchaſing growing wealth promotion though plague famine ſometime ſweep away diminiſh number people yet god goodneſſe continuing long ſore ſooner outgrowne meane warre perſecution make ſtrippe waſte ſay euen violent fire burneth commeth raging water drowne ceaſe plentie moſt part going peace great outward proſperitie bee acknowledged ſingular great fauour god ſuch able vſe aright giueth much libertie encouragement liue well happily otherwiſe iollitie abundance haue learned fitted right vſe regard looke onely ſeeke madly ſo many doe vſe peace liberty quiet liuing much bewailed benefit ſelfe reioyced thinke time peace good preaching ſhould vſe throughout part land hold downe poperie atheiſme prophanenes ſinne teacheth naturall fleſh decline fall thoſe ſinnes abhorred latter work ſhould better former rare ſeene better ſort vnleſſe obſerue note frailtie many way ready fall lay daily eſpeciall grace faith good gouernment knowledge without fainting wearines time haue done ſince firſt began elſe ſay hardly found leſſe need done becauſe old new prouocations euill ſo many ſtrong euer way otherwiſe preuaile one time therefore men ſhould know conſider waite reward great price man crowned except hee ſtriue lawfully end therefore ſhould weary weldoing neither faint good beginning oh bee lamented many forwarder ſort time paſt growne tempt god boldly take vpon ſtint prayer ſeruice detract coldly goe much like driuen worke dead worke creditor conſtrained rather pay therby debt owe haue wage receiue ſame kinde worke know vnwillingly weariſomly moſt part taken hand ſpeake word thoſe ingrafted chriſt faith ſhew awkly come forward ſincere receiuing doctrine goſpell though wee know ſo may lord gaue thus prouoked hand philiſtims vſed fell like ſinnes ſell nation father ſo often found ſo might haue knowne would ſhould finde ſome ſuch like thing againe oft reuolted lord thus dealing ſay onely laieth foorth boldnes doct 2 ſinning haue ſpoken certainly teſtifieth alſo god doe others ſuch caſe wit hee ſurely auenged ſuch enemy dare ſo boldly tempt yea one time moſt certainly doe ſo let v witneſſe lord hath made fruitfull barren kinde ſoeuer haue brought forth ſower grape wilde oliues made themſelues barren againe fruitfull let ſay looke backe view matter yet better pay rearedges run god leſt length wiſh bin beholding god leſſe except fruit might haue made lord may ſay beholding haue yeelded luk 8 18 hath ſhall giuen hee ſhall receiue fauour vpon fauour keepes old precious remembrance regard occupying whoſe talent occupied whereas hath ſhall forgoe ſtill till haue loſt hath forgotten receiued hee hath ſhall loſe hopeth yea principall hath one point beſides example lord ſheweth v hee turneth chaſtiſements doct 2 verſe 3 benefit vnto people iſſue iobs affliction witneſſeth taketh away good thing correcteth receiue greater outward benefit forgoe yet waite god ſhall haue proofe grace faith patience obedience oft haue already noted booke farre ſweete outward libertie loſe forgoe let people god prouide walke vprightneſſe ſhall ſee whether life bee repleniſhed comfort followed many token god loue pleaſure ſhall finde day vpon earth ſweetely paſſed exceedingly well prouided till taken glorie angell preſcribing woman ſhee ſhould drinke doct verſ 4 5 wine eate thirdly hee ſhould touch come neere dead body reade booke number nazarite one ſeparated others particularly numb 62 c ſuch one ſerued lord ſtrict manner samſon continue eſtate throughout life peculiar perſon therefore type chriſt onely death moſt victorious euen life wherein sauiour fulfilled righteouſneſſe ſignification nazarite lord would haue come neere vnto ſeruice ſeparated common ſort doe examine way rule god word walke owne heart deſire hereby vnder ceremony hee requireth plaine word doth elſewhere ſaying ye ſhall therefore perfect father heauen perfect alſo purifie ſelues euen pure mercifull euen 1 pet 1 16 heauenly father ye holy holy inſomuch another place ſaith without holineſſe man ſhall ſee lord ſignification heb 12 4 nazarite doth exclude vncleane vnſanctified lord preſence fauour ſeruice true ceremoniall rule aboliſhed church new teſtament permitted man vowe regular ſeruing god according outward obſeruances order placing religion therein ſo much retaine obſeruation nazarite much leſſe inuent new rite order yet ſuch holden onely religious men woman day church rome haue ſolemnely entred ſome order haue many confuſed order owne forging therein ayme perfection let theſe diſorders goe equitie inſtitution ſtill remaineth firme bindeth v lord haue know ſet liue ſerue liſt bee ſeruants owne hand hee tieth rule order according whereto haue walke rule ſpirituall firſt vniforme bindeth without exception rom 12 1 ſumme whereof haue ſaid giue vp themſelues bodie 2 cor 7 1 ſoule lord inward ſubiection heart outward obedience life ſtrictly clenſing themſelues ſuperfluitie filthineſſe either body minde ceremony alſo required vſed nazarite ſignification thoſe mentioned text theſe two one ſuffering haire head growe cut 2 time vow nazarites remained vowed either certaine number day moneths yeares vow end time keeping expired offering ſacrifice burning fleſh fire cut haire burnt ſame fire free returned former courſe life although otherwiſe samſon lord appointed nazarite whole life though according common manner made nazarites ſignification much time ſhould taken vp nicely trimming looking body ſeeing know muſt conſumed earth become wormes meate therefore ridiculous folly forget pleaſe ſelues ſuch deceiueable fancy alſo minde ſet curiouſly worke dangerous token pride ſo bewrayeth ſlenderly regardeth inward apparrelling nicenes curioſitie weaker ſexe ſpend many good houres vainely vnfruitefully kind argueth pride folly ſo foule abuſe men matter diſguiſed wearing long haire thinke defend themſelues practiſe nazarites yet world would conuince moſt part furtheſt ſtrict worſhip god ſincere walking nazarites doe alſo mocke skorne thoſe embrace thinkes ſtrange argueth ſomewhat common badneſſe thereof among many change corrupt engliſh faſhions worne expired yet vnnaturall faſhion paul calles man weare long 〈◊〉 1 cor 11 14 hath ſuruiued know ſome nouriſh amarous lightneſſe minde others ſuppoſed ornament perſon marke gent • ie leaſt imitation gentleman theſe thinke might wiſely forbeare ſeeing become faſhion habite baſeſt ſwaggerers ruffian diuels marke hath ſet vpon many wil reformed firſt vſed either enſigne ornament ſpeech worthie reuerend iudge land vſe long locke firſt taken vp branded fellowes couer ſhame honourable perſonage circuit ſitting place iuſtice vpon malefactor practiſed according former obſeruation commanding ſaw beſet ſuch deformed haire immediatly cut ſhorne whether diſcouer eare marke ſhame vnſeemely guiſe know yet many farre enough nazarites may thinke ſet much haire put religion therein loth haue ſheares raſor come vpon ſignification abſtaining wine ſtrong drinke 3 ſimply forbid vſing wee ſee nehemiah lord giueth nehe 8 10 people libertie eate fatte drinke ſweete commanded nazarites time continued ſo abſtaine therefrom ſignification ſay thereof teach god people ſhould auoide exceſſe way leſt thereby ſhould dull blunt power mindes ſo muſt neceſſitive vſe ſhamefull end giuen farre excellent purpoſes ſay iuſt condemning beaſtly drunkard ſuch pot companion though better beare drinke without open diſguiſing themſelues yet ſpending time wickedly needeleſſe brutiſh deuouring nothing inferior ſinning ſundry reſpects much worſe many ſinne occaſion haue ſpoken particularly ſaid rule nazarites caueats thereof generally adde former theſe prohibition ſuch like lord would teach v high account hee hath heart well mortified purged droſſe ſuperfluitie luſts concupiſcence ſtuffed withall wee ſee enioyneth nazarites ſo much actuall worſhip ſtraight reſtraint fleſh vnlawfull exceſſe ſhadoweth theſe two diet • cking body abſtinence doubtleſſe poſſible man equall angel obedience cheerefulneſſe readineſſe integritie ſeruice yet poſſible againe olde man deſires paſſions might ſtill remaine aliue wrath malice couetouſneſſe vncleaneneſſe hollowneſſe looſeneſſe pride vncharitableneſſe vnruly tongue c religion man altogether vaine reaſons 1 lord ſaith sonne giue • e thy prou 23 26 heart meaneth rotten heart corrupt need heart well ſearched well drained ſinfull affection luſts ſuch heart calleth chuſeth knowes mortified note heart alſo heart quickned life god fit dutie within without 2 chiefe ſeruice god inward inward ſtands eſpecially repentance firſt conſiſteth change euill habites quality ſoule ere new put man grafteth vpon rotten ſtocke put new wine old veſſels 3 chriſtian man fetch ſurer euidence hence reformation particular dutie affirmatiue commandements morall law ſoundly diſtinguiſheth himſelfe hypocrite ſeperate part repentance diuide falſe ſound rule many good chriſtian behinde hand worke euer ſhall man pure hardly forgoes ſome one old relikes adam therefore looke much man profiteth peece religion ſo much hee groweth truely religious vſe haue choſen eaſier courſe ſeruice meane note doe good duty doe better tend part chriſtianitie hath leſſe regarded trauaile denying themſelues ouercomming paſſions abſtaining crucifying corrupt nature ſtrongeſt ſo ſhall religion proſper better beſeeme though harder part two yet time beſtowed therein counteruaile labour moſt plentifullie good man debter luſt moſt vnſeemely rom 8 12 ſeruer fulfiller obeyer thereof haue weapon ſinne ſtill vnmortified fighting againſt righteouſneſſe paul ſpeakes monſtrous thus much nazarite verſe angell telleth office childe ſhould bee doct verſ 5 borne wit ſhould come age fit ſhould begin deliuer people bondage philiſtims wherein lord declareth tender loue care people oppreſſed tribulation doth pitie thinketh euen eaſing redreſſing ſorrowes whereby would draw relenting ſinne aſhamed prouoking puniſh hardning heart lying ſtill offence without humbling themſelues cry lord mercy deliuerance yee aske hee doth well take obiect trouble well pitieth therein ſuffered people lye bondage ſo long enemy till samſon grew vp able deliuer anſwere willing ready doe much anſw might good cannot ſtill harbour nouriſh ſinnes would procure vpon themſelues greater vexation continuing wicked courſe lord ſhould deliuer repent ſame hath bin often proued example theſe iſraelites cry eaſe neuer heard till repentance iudg 10 16 lord grieued miſerie god ſuffering oppreſſions hold vnder long time people namely birth samſon till hee came man eſtate taketh pleaſure afflicting hee profeſſeth contrary relent neither caſt themſelues lam 3 33 draw compaſſion lamenting therfore 1 sam 7 2 long abiding vnder tribulation doe argue exceeding hardnes heart whereby procure ſame whereas men cauill god ſay cannot bow obiect heart force relent god muſt ſoften breake elſe author miſerie anſwere binde heauie burthen anſw vpon ſhoulders themſelues take vp leaſt finger appeareth ſlight account make hereof dealing ſo careleſly ſo weightie matter although lord pull ſtone heart prophet ſpeakes make ezek 36 26 heart fleſh yet thing deſired would firſt apply themſelues grace able worke effect put ouer commend bleſſing labor god neglect doe haue within ſhall witneſſe againſt wilfull cauſes deſolation lord bound leaſt reſpect miniſter meanes word affliction benefit example help others much leſſe grace humbled repent therefore vſe none theſe ordinance wholeſome end appointed ſin guiltleſſe hath offered faire themſelues willing accept neuer lord leaue himſelfe hardned impenitent deſired profit vnder doctrine diſcipline therefore let men beware ouerreach themſelues ſubtiltie bold ſpeech yet come anſwer lord face face ſhall dumbe mouthes ſhall lord condemne end might added point came ſo often hand throughout booke oft relapſes people mentioned see alſo firſt branch doctrine vpon 7 8 9 verſes former chapter thus much firſt part ſecond part chapter verſ 6 wife came told husband ſaying man god came vnto faſhion like faſhion angell god exceeding fearefull asked whence neither told name 7 ſaid vnto behold thou ſhalt conceiue beare ſonne thou ſhalt drinke wine ſtrong drinke neither eate vncleane thing childe ſhall nazarite god birth day death 8 manoah prayed lord ſaid pray thee lord let man god thou ſe • teſt come againe vnto v teach v wee ſhall doe vnto childe borne 9 god heard voyce manoah angell god came againe wife ſhe ſate field manoah husband 10 wife made haſte ranne ſhewed husband ſaid vnto behold man hath appeared vnto came vnto day 11 manoah aroſe went wife came man ſaid vnto art thou man ſpakeſt vnto woman ſaid yea 12 manoah ſaid let thy ſaying come paſſe ſhall order childe doe vnto 13 angell lord ſaid vnto manoah woman muſt beware ſaid vnto 14 may eate nothing commeth vine tree ſhe ſhall drinke wine ſtreng drinke eate vncleane thing let obſerue haue commanded followeth angell appeared ſecond time verſ 6 15 ſumme wit manoah wife thus like good wife went told husband ſuch one ſome prophet man god appeared told ſuch thing ſhe ſhould doe ſhe ſaid ſhe anſwered nothing againe manoah beſought lord might come againe hee appeared againe woman immediatly went called husband finding man god field asked former meſſage brought wife alſo ſhould child ſhould borne anſwered euen ſaid wife woman telling husband meſſenger deſcribeth thus fauour man god ſaith ſhe appeared angell god fearefull ſo hebrew word tranſlated ſignifieth alſo wonderful ſo like ſhe ſaid meant though tranſlated fearefull preuent doubt ſuſpitions ſhe telleth neither ſhe knew whence hee neither tell name onely hee ſaid ſhe ſhould beare ſonne ſhe muſt abſtaine wine eate vncleane thing childe ſhould nazarite birth vnto death let v peruſe theſe verſes throughout fully touching doct verſ 6 ſhe vttereth reuerend preſence angell inſiſt hauing elſewhere noted ſubſtance thereof begin ſixth verſe firſt know woman going huſband ſimply ſignifie matter ſoone ſhe receiued meſſage equally concerned became good wife ſo behoueth married couple ſhould communicate mindes one another matrimony ſocietie betwixt two one ephe 5 31 ought haue fellowſhip together imparting heauenly thing one another earthly alſo euen matter heauenly ſeeing meſſage came name god heauen earthly ſeeing temporall comfort bleſſing pertaining life wit bearing ſonne example betwixt two godly couple doth commend v ſociable kind agreement liuing together mariage one minde good thing ſhew foorth inward conſent affection token communion outward thing concerning abraham sarah iſaac rebecca many god hath commanded ſhould thus ſo like manner ſtandeth ſound reaſon ſo neerely linked together cohabitation fellowſhip ſhould neerely affected agree together moſt kindly therefore salomon wiſheth husband reioyce wife ſhe ſhould prou 5 19 louing hinde pleaſant roe ſo ſhould ſee cauſe mariage ſhould bee counted ſingular benefit scripture calleth concerning though ſome couple voide religion haue ſome ſhadow hereof ſeeing agree vpholding familie gathering wealth one yet loue conſtant full vnſoundnes diſlikes diſſimulation inconſtancie vnquietnes want principall ſome true meaſure feare god chiefe ſtaier debate nouriſher true loue betwixt ſhould therefore laid firſt comming together elſe hardly wrought kinde agreement betwixt couple ſo farre moſt ſtrangenes wearines one doth ſoone meete blemiſhes note manifold deface beautie mariage exceedingly yet leſt vrge conſent ſome couple ſhould catch libertie lord allow let adde agreement muſt thing warrantable elſe rather band themſelues together againſt lord abuſe ordinance yoked together may ioyne wit wils miſchief ahab iezabel ananias saphira helper come together end except euill hell ſay becauſe many couple neuer one conſent euill cloſe barke tree ſhould differ diſſwade good duty mutuall affection ſo farre ioyning repugnant diuided farre may bee vertue holy concord great bleſſing ſweete fruite ordinance duty familie education child action god worſhip workes loue saint vſe lawfull liberty c freedome minde ioy contentment ariſeth vnanimitie amitie betweene otherwiſe much impeached fruite accompanieth inward trouble mind outward croſſes body eſtate one ſtrengthened comforted reſolued holpen wiſedome knowledge aſſiſtance yea ſurely precious memorie agreement remaineth pledge boſome ſuruiuor death hath made breach betweene woe alone double woe couple diuided one ſcorneth communicate wife chuſeth breake minde rather husband returne woman bee commended telling huſband ſo ſhe deſerueth ſeeing partie appeared taken man meſſage barren ſhe ſhould beare childe might haue raiſed ſtrange thought doubting wondring ſhould ſome woman would haue concealed ſuch matter leſt husband ſhould haue iealouſie ſuſpition againe ſeeing ſhould haue heard ſuch matter ſome might haue hardlier taken againſt betweene theſe contrary motion conceit ſome woman ſay would haue held ſuſpenſe would haue choſen ſilence ſafeſt ſhe dealt ſimply beſt opening teacheth faithfulnes mariage bed ſhould ſuch holy loialtie agreement betwixt couple may leaſt doubting one anothers faithfulnes neither occaſion offered contrary neither ſuſpition religious oft confirming one another faithfull keeping couenant concerning thing elſe betwixt free opening mindes agreeing together holy duty exerciſes religion might eaſily theſe bee found almoſt among better ſort ſure reiected common ſort thereby may eaſily iudged manner life leade ſay leſſe becauſe graunt amitie ought betwixt action mutually concerning eſpecially office moſt eſſentiall naturall mariage greeke word paul vſeth former text meane beneuolence although doe admit compoſition two word ſignifie well minded yet properly deriued word ſignifieth bed noting containeth ſmaller beneuolences vnder ſaying husband ſhe aske man god whence came hee told name needleſſe 3 let v bee taught ſtay company needleſly eſpecially men woman moſt alone without company may danger taking euill giuing occaſion ſuſpecting note ſuch thing oh infinite miſchiefe hath wrought hereby meane idle needleſſe meeting tarrying together men firſt whereby one draweth another ſome euill much men woman whereby much whoredome hath bin committed yea much neuer thought elies ſonnes meeting woman tabernacle although lawfull yet abuſed monſtrouſly particularly let woman learne shunamite 2 king 4 15 2 king 4 comely modeſtie ſhamefaſtnes fitter ſexe boldnes lightnes moſt bewray company wherein dare ſhew themſelues woman therefore called eliſha chamber yet alone neither ſeruant ſtanding came ſtood doore ſhe went ſtood aloofe became ſober matrone thoſe day paſt modeſtie burthen many woman feare ſhame reſtraines grace wiſedome little ſome doe may teſtifie band ſhaken laſt thing verſe ſparines ſpeech angell 4 asked queſtion reſted meſſage little time ſhe ſtaied companie ſhe ſpent hearing marking pondring mary luke 1 29 inquiring deſcanting admirable weake woman hearing report thing ſo ſtrange ſo vnlikely yet ſo pleaſing man ſhe knew ſhould moue queſtion leſſe occaſion many degree enough haue ſet ſome woman tongue endleſſe running eye minde rouing caſting muſt thinke ſhe bin humour angell glorie bin ſent oh rare woman maiſt ſet men woman ſchoole learne ſobrietie eue wiſe ſhe preuented great deale woe ſelfe v curioſitie foule blemiſh man far greater woman woman chaſt ſo ſhe word goe well together ſhe prouerbs deſcribed light footed fugitiue oftner prou 7 11 12 houſes others owne taxed alſo light tongued talkatiue iangling prating woman vice ſo deteſted paul neuer rife age lamented diſeaſe incident ſuch otherwiſe worſt ſort neither becauſe impotencie intemperancie iſſueth weakneſſe ſexe great part thinke diſcredit themſelues becauſe another nature vnto nature vnto indeed corrupt one muſt ſpied time thoſe wiſe corrected ſay ſuch fit angel company beſeeme company diſcreete graue man wiſe perſon would ſoone wearie though themſelues haue ſtay vnruly member till breath faile put ſilence wheeles iacke till plummet vpon ground need amplifie wiſh prater tatlers galled gagged example middeſt worke made ſee face glaſſe think would trouble glaſſe old curtizan looked beholding wrinkle ſpots therein crackt aſunder becauſe ſo true mirrour verſe ſhewed ſhe told husband man god verſ 7 ſaid birth childe ſhe ſhould doe ſelfe heard verſe 4 5 haue ſpoken repeating ſame thing onely wee may learne manoahs wife report relate thing truly aright done wee heard related vnto v forgetfulneſſe careleſneſſe worſe meaning thing carried ſuch ſort oft time vntruths lye told much ſtrife contention ariſeth bring cauſe great trouble annoyance example many may ziba falſe report dauid mepbiboſheth refuſed goe dauid againſt abſolom hee himſelfe withheld beaſt ſuch time would full gladly haue gone whereon ſhould ride making pſalm 15 good ſigne man ſhall dwell god may collect contrary lord require wee bee wiſe beware pſalm 15 2 beleeuing euery thing leſt become reporter vntruth vnwillingly ſhall eſcape caſt tale owne mould hammer owne forge ere giue broched like heard another apple oyſter ſpeech whereas breaſt honeſt man ſhould harbour truth lodge ſhould preciſely carefull ſee ſafely deliuered vttered forth pledge ſecret pawne left friend let worke deteſtation popiſh practiſe lying giuing foorth report yea coyning oft time thinke make vantage onely falſely ſo incredibly ſhameleſſely hearer bluſh ſhame accordingly liuely glaſſe couple looke direct poynt ſhould note true truſtie one according salomon ſpeaks prou 31 10 faithfull wife prou 31 husband heart reſteth man would thinke need bee leſſe betwixt muſt liue whole life time together much wearineſſe diſcontentment muſt neceſſitie bee betwixt otherwiſe finde reſpect grace chiefely match either ſatisfie eye ſaying samſon giue ſhe pleaſeth elſe make vp wealth begin marriage worſe manner note former finde litle truſtineſſe one ahothers hand appeareth within ſmall time yet haue ſought reape fruite owne labour meete many curſes match euen god hath foretold adde hauing ſo oft ſpoken well marked doubtfull caſe childes bringing doct 2 vp carefull yet knowing doe doubt ſay therefore prayeth lord direction appearing againe angell knew god would leaue ſuſpence ſuch thing would haue doe ſhould teach v difficulty doubt well trouble wee ſhould ſeeke god guide aſſiſt v matter whereof muſt giue proofe good conſcience iehoſophat 2 chron 20 2 pſ • lm 50 15 lord commandeth pſalme ſaying call mee time trouble c skill complaine make moane euery one wee meete heauy affliction haue befalne v yet cannot helpe v rather increaſe ſorrowes god ſhould chiefely complaine make moane men haue acquaintance bee ſtrangers euen ſo haue helpe thriue accordingly let reader ſee chap 1 2 often booke touching argument alſo next poynt anſwerable thereto ſought lord ſo hee obtained asked teach doct verſ 9 vaine pray ſeeing god hauing ſent ſtrange vnuſuall meſſage manoah well vnderſtand knew hee would leaue ſuſpence feare would make minde knowne perfectly therefore prayed faith like manner doe beleeue ſhall obtaine pray muſt pray faith wauer ſaith saint iames iam 1 6 iam 5 15 place prayer faith muſt ſaue saint paul ſaith cannot call vpon beleeue ſay becauſe rom 10 14 prayer babling voyde faith alſo ſuch prayer faith euen one much many ſeruent obtaineth moſt vnlikely thing god hand difficulty ſpeedieſt remedy becauſe time preſent eaſeth heart well time come giueth hope redreſſe one way note vnburdeneth minde vnprofitable heauineſſe cloggeth deteineth well occupied although particularly occaſion mooued manoah hereto trouble concerned married eſtate howſoeuer neuer falleth kinde adaies couple yet ſtead thereof many doe care bringing vp child employing fitteſt trade life beſtowing marriage defraying charge houſekeeping many ſuch many difficulty feares doubtings ariſe mind carefull tender parent gouernours yes doubtleſſe ſuch meane ſo daily ſucceſſiue breede ſmall diſtemper inwardly fretting carking contriuing diſturbance family impatience diſcord wiſe courſe taken ſtay preuent one courſe bee like manoah troubled meſſage god ſent doth repaire ſame god deſireth free feare doubt hee cauſed ſo ſhould husband wife together ſeeing lord ordainer marriage bleſſing poſteritie hath vndertaken prouide many generation feare therefore would pleaſe lord giude gouernement frame mindes patience contentedneſſe croſſes giue bleſſing education care child bleſſe labour calling may bee ſufficiencie word ſhew beſt way iſſue thoſe trouble houſehold familie vnſettle diſquiet man would thinke iollie eaſe ſuch caſes haue god man friend ouer neither haue god friend counſell vncomfortably beare burden owne ſtrength none able doe angell prayer manoah appearing againe woman field without husband ſhe made haſt tell husband appeared verſ 10 againe hee done day already newes ſhee knew would little ioy heart eaſe much doubting troubled teacheth wife another dutie husband fulfill ioy doe thing may make cheerefull glad man farre ſhe able ſide husband ſhould yea much doe like againe ſuch countenance geſture ſpeech whole carriage ſhould betweene might free feare doubt heartie loue kindeneſſe rather good occaſions might make one another ioyfull brawling chiding note prouoking ſecret diſlikings tetches conceit might cauſe ſame though neuer want occaſions nay ſhould yet euill heart miniſtreth many ſay ſhould farre eſpecially neſtling ſeated therefore salomon ſpeaking ſuch woman ſaith thus ſhall finde vertuous prou 31 10 woman price farre aboue pearles heart husband truſteth euen alſo ſhould reſt haue many trouble ſuch alſo accompanie marriage ſo haue little neede trouble one another alſo ought euery way allay note ſtoppe occaſions remooue ſweete chriſtian ſocietie liuing together therefore moſt abſurd one ſhould doe may grieue monſtrous one ſhould ſeeke vexe indeed one minde good thing difficult matter thus ioyne worke together naturall loue content ſo fruite thereof ioy peace good ſucceſſe haue endeauours affaire may procured augmented ſay among ſuch one ſound minde eaſilie obtained though beſt need watch ſuch grace fickleneſſe eſtrangement wearineſſe doe breake ſhall bee found among couple wholely corrupt voide goodneſſe ſuch greateſt number surely eaſilie eſpecially trial come ala worſt make ſhift pleaſe proſper ſee fooliſh woman iobs wife thing went well ſaid haue broken ſo groſſely ſeeing husband plunged miſerie added ſorrow vnſeaſonable ſpeech whereas ſhee ſhould aboue time haue ſpake ſomewhat ſeaſon haue comforted outward help failed man ſaith apoſtle euer hated owne fleſh nouriſhed cheriſhed ſo ſelfeloue might ſomewhat perſwade dutie couple ſhould ſeeke peace welfare example lord ieſus may preuaile know married perſons ſent rule learne let conſider tenderly hee careth church ſpouſe meanes procuring delight auoiding moleſtation ſaying charge wake ſpouſe cant 3 5 till ſhe pleaſe charineſſe care remoouing ſuch thing way might cauſe others heauineſſe griefe bearing burthen afflicted partie might bee eaſed beſt way witneſſe ſympathie affection like mindedneſſe manoah commeth angell ſatisfied doubt verſe 11 marke manner ſpeech vſeth long circumſtance directly goeth matter art thou man ſaith hee appeared woman ſimplicitie age one might aske another concerned anſwered farre practiſe time much courteſie gloſing coloured hypocriſie ſubtiltie little good meaning honeſt ſimplicitie neither ſhall man ſure minde neighbour hath faire word enough tending way ſhew loue diſſimulation rom 12 9 touching vnfaithfulneſſe dealing conuerſation among men haue elſewhere ſpoken chap 12 2 3 limme thereof may bee added ſpeake wit vnfaithfulneſſe ſpeech bird hatcht ſame neaſt falſe deceitful heart meane well ioabs curteſie abner zibas fidelitie mephiboſheth hate doubleneſſe falſehood forbidden type plowing two kindes beaſts wearing two kindes ſtuffe ſowing two leuit 19 19 kindes graine wit ſame plough ſame garment ſame field wee day haue abrogated
