butter oyle ſweete honey heart ſharpe ſword bitter wormewood hath ſeuen abomination indeed confeſſe haue curſed habit commonly cloake malicious politique man may moſt part vnderſtand meane contrarily ſpeake alſo vanitie affectation many others bee full ſhewes courteouſneſſe intend friendſhip goodwill malice vanitie naught former diueliſh latter frothie ſuperfluous sinnes ſtay alway court come downe alſo countrey wherein many men ſo hollow conſciences tell deſerue hollowly dealt haue vſed vndermining queſtions others ſo haue anſwers ſiniſter indirect forked adaies man would haue plaine anſwere another ſaine vſe ſome ſlight wile get ſpeake plainly hath ſo many caſts conceit mind feares aduantage taken ſome way againſt leſſe token bad conſcience matter wee would communicate redreſſe euill towne familie perſon know breake one another meaner better eſpecially wee doe ſlender regard ſhall euen ſo friendly meeting table haue apparant cauſe offered thankes god benefit yet euen harſh heare word ſauouring epheſ 5 4 religion tending edification although giuing thanks ſpeech table ſhould apoſtles commandement ſeaſoned ſome croſſe offer occaſion ſuch ſpeech yet ſhall ye haue moſt part winding away ſeconding giuing liking needleſſe worldly frothie ſpeech euery one delighteth talke ſpeech men many way charged ſo commoning god ſeldome wee haue full coldnes looſenes wandring manoah vnderſtanding man god hee ſaid wife verſ 12 ſeeing ſhe rightly related matter meſſage man god done wife ſhe reported agreed ſecond rehearſall thereof point hee reſteth ſay ſo anſwereth thou haſt ſaid thus beleeue ſhall ſo come paſſe although manward ſeemeth likely whē wee haue receiued meſſage god examining comparing one ſcripture another confirming v therein haue act 10 17 proofe god ſome doubt ought ceaſe diſcourſing though wee held ſuſpence peter viſion till reſolued yet wee ſhould without contradiction difficultie receiue god yeeld reſt euen know according occaſion offered v doe manoah vnreſolued trie ſpirit whether god pray god reueale v therefore sauiour ſpeaketh ſearch scripture knowledge therein according iohn 5 39 act 17 11 example beraeans tried thing holding themſelues truth reſteth becauſe come occaſion manoahs reſting particular ſought haue ſhewed alſo ought doe like ſay ſomething ought reſt generall manner meaning chriſtians perfection end ſhall hereafter full bleſſed reſt glorie sabbath saint begun euen life minde ſoule whole man reſt enioyeth feeleth poſſeſſeth much trauailed tooke paine reſt minde actuall reſolution note certaintie truth againſt errour doubting fruite ſeeking knowledge reſt ſoule perſwaſion aſſurance god fauour alſufficiencie reconciled vnto v fruite ſeeking faith reſt whole man inward ſetledneſſe fruites faith repentance ſanctification end ſeeking encreaſe growth grace becauſe theſe imperfect v know beleeue grow meaſure therefore muſt ſeeke ſtill know beleeue ſetled better daily howbeit herein ſtands happineſſe learning laboring endeuouring rather hold haue learned gotten laieth much charge ſuch hauing long vnder teaching fare neuer heard tenne twentie yeeres asking oh reſolued truth oh might heare way ſaluation plainly deſcribed oh doubt feare temptation luſt corruption remoued thou ſluggard hath bin haſt thou bin iogged pulled punched thy ſnorting dead ſleepe miniſterie doeſt thou open thine eye aske bodie would awake thee thy ſottiſhnes lethargie want rouſing drowned thee note ſleepe ſo long therefore thou haue care thy ſoule beſeech lord bedew moiſten thoſe drie clod thy minde ſoule wherein ſeede word hath lien ſo long vnprofitable length may take roote fructifie ceaſe till meanes thou reſolued ſetled truth ſo thou maiſt reſt ſafely dangerouſly reſt ſay worke exerciſe thy knowledge faith vſe occupied thou haſt vncertaintie error doubting diſtruſt point deſire reader compare haue ſpoken touching gedeon chap 6 manoah reſolued hee ſhould haue childe wife verſ 13 14 though ſhe barren asked ſhould doe childe thing leſſe doubted whereby hee ſtill ſheweth deſire reſolution doubt remained teacheth v wiſe making benefit company familiarity ſuch able willing reſolue v pretend fooliſh baſhfulnes indeed ſlothfulnes lothnes troubleſome leſt meanes wee procure ſelues trouble wee eaſily auoide afterward ſuch baſhfulnes ignorance ſloth repeate thing ſecond demaund angell anſwereth ſame hee woman woman ſumme thing told man god ſhould come paſſe firſt manoah doth two thing one deſireth angel eate hee asketh name whereof angell make anſwere theſe firſt order concerning firſt angel god hath done anſwere manoah theſe two following firſt curteſie thankfulnes offering eate thinking hee man hauing brought ſuch meſſage god wife confirmeth v wee haue heard wee receiue kindneſſe wee ſhould render found man taken thorne foote lion ſo eaſed paine diſcourſe thing inferiour nature may thought ſo wiſely inſert ſo graue argument neither done ſtrangenes would thereby ſhame ſuch boiſterous rough barbarous nature prouoked dutie kindneſſe ſtrongeſt meanes yet bitter ſtomacke doe rather thereby take occaſion hatred miſchiefe like saul dauids innocencie pitie life enraged againſt theſe meete world doe giue ſo teſtifying affection iuſtly pitied hauing heard meſſage god mouthes ſuch yet haue heart way inlarged whereby giue teſtimonie haue taken good preaching earthly king endure ambaſſadour indeed make common men little liketh would haue thought men worthie haue place church earth therefore let good hearer learne firſt bee riuetted doctrine get acquaintance firſt heart go againſt prating drinking gaming ſuch like ſpending time together manoah word angell follow wherein firſt denieth verſ 16 may moued ſtay cauſe eate ſhould make prouiſion therein ſay hee teacheth v theſe two thing one may lawfully willingly perſwaded vnleſſe neceſſitie contrarie ſtay together one neighbour doct 1 verſ 16 another company haue done earthly buſineſſe ſeene cauſe namely thereby may doe good take good one conferre vſe good communication together knowledge edification mutuall comfort increaſe loue betwixt ſelues good theſe reſpects ſay neighbour may keepe company one affaire buſineſſe neither vnworthy nothing v ſee carefull holy ghoſt cleare good meaning manoah blame hee 3 knew ſaith text angell lord q hee known ye may well thinke would haue ſpoken ſo ignorant excuſed blame reaſon therefore ſimplicitie ſhould make ſubiect hard cenſure ſimply indeed excuſable manoah onely becauſe ignorant peter faultie ſaying hee knew chriſt vpon mount becauſe neither bound know able himſelfe inuincible ſhall doe harme way thing purpoſe inſiſt moſt doct 4 knowing afterward meſſenger angell otherwiſe ſuppoſed aſhamed euen blameleſſe error much ought bluſh faultie error nay groſſe ignorance worſt wilfull ſinnes paul rom 6 ſaith implieth leſſe rom 6 21 regenerate ſhould aſhamed looke backe olde profane courſe blindneſſe badneſſe deuout papiſt like ephraim prophet conuerted ſhould abaſhed conſider vnfruitfulnes deuotion kneeling crucifix image virgin mary peece bread ſaying theſe idol fie vpon get hence blinde made themſelues like maker blind worſhip ſhould proud boaſter hath ſcornefully diſdained neighbour heate madneſſe come himſelfe ſeeing better earth firebrand hell aſhamed himſelfe ſay haue thus baſely forgot ſelfe hath come iollily sacrament yet profanely becauſe hee could diſcerne lord boord owne ſeeth boldneſſe farre hee hath ventured ſhould aſtoniſh truth knowledge grace haue greater enemy ignorant could ſee themſelues cannot highly would magnifie god knowledge cauſe yet thereby made ſee eſtate far could euer beleeue ſo reſting thankfull walke light thereof abhorre former blindnes angel ſeeing manoah deceiued taking man led fit matter bidding make burnt offering doct 5 meate deſired refreſh end manoahs ſpeaking meate offering eate kid goates ſpeech ſheweth true wiſedome take occaſion draw one another forward holy duty communication heauenly thing moſt earthly faſt locked vp therein manoah buſie prouiding errour end therefore angell drew profitable indeed ſo well becommeth chriſtians ready leade one another vnprofitable expence time talke thing diuine fit edifying one another neither ought wiſe chriſtian ſtumble meeteth companie ſuch vnſauourie whoſe tongue owne ſet themſelues worke pleaſe ala bee looked hand ſuch neuer learned gouerne themſelues either alone priuate houſes publike action god worſhip ſhould tongue well ſeaſoned companie bring foorth fauourie gracious matter vncleane heart abounding contrary rather let pitie ſuch bad men bad malice milde modeſt ſilence leaſt much ſpeaking likeſt preuaile doe good turne put ſuperfluous frothie talke fearing giue place cauſe vtterers thereof ſay indeed ſpeech farre meeter companie deſerueth accounted pitie looſe vaine talke ſhould haue put pardon v knowne better wee would haue vſed better good effect chriſtian boldneſſe though need thus take occaſion breake bad communication bee farre preferred offenſiue giuing place ill ſpeech till haue gotten vpper hand ſo late repreſſe come neerer occaſion text chriſtians dutie towards come behinde experience right vſe conference ſuch make himſelfe ſport weaknes ſcorne ignorance goe teach ſpend time profitably man may diſcerne teachablenes humble ſpirit many ſimple meaning vtter little good ſpeech come next minde though little conſider purpoſe edifying fit occaſion offered lenitie ſoftnes diuert rather breake ſuch ſpeech looſen band rather violently cut aſunder ſo hearer may ſee themſelues wound better communication ere aware ſecretly bluſh owne ignorance particular angell mentioned counſell offer doct 6 burnt offering lord ſignification thereof thereby hee ſhould conſecrate himſelfe body ſoule power part vnto lord ſo ſhould honour lord became ſhew hee thereby acknowledge himſelfe willing readie obey thing true ſeruing god offer rom 12 1 vp ſelues wholly vnder gouernment apoſtle ſpeaketh roman ſo contrary doe nothing leſſe giue themſelues follow owne luſts deuices deſires wicked heart ſome thing wil yeeld dutie halues reade saul cauſe lord reiected let reader looke point chap 2 chap 10 elſewhere manoah kindneſſe hee receiued angell bidden offer god offered ſo ſhould offend god miniſters like caſe doe like example trauaile aduice counſell brother either troubled conſcience otherwiſe ſome great dangerous doubt ſatisfied quieted good contentment counſell ſay partie ſo counſelled v thankfull minde ſhould offer gratuitie v many thinke dutie ſay wee ſhould offend ſhould deſire giue either wholly part thereof freely ſome good vſe well able ſome godly poore hee would haue done v ſeeing thinke vnmeete v receiue becauſe would wiſe bring reproch miniſterie orgiue occaſion thinke doe baſely ſell gift god money hee bee able willing naaman sirian like caſe ſhew thankfulnes thinke vnmeete receiue ſhall doe good dutie helpe benefit ſome need ſo fit occaſion offered god prouidence relieue ſuch occaſions offered good maner yet taken yet well knowne many doe good vnto wee commanded god take occaſions thereof offereth ye aske eliſha worke vpon naaman manner ſay hee heathen ſtranger newly conuerted requeſted ſuch kindneſſe muſt haue put hand diſpoſe reſpects hee refrained haue ſaid ſomewhat chap 8 gedeon refuſing kingdome demanding earings leſſe therefore ſhall ſerue another thing thinke good ſtay little verſe occaſion word angell ſpake hee called bread manoah called fleſh hee deſired angell hee might prepare kid goates anſwered hee would eate bread whereby doubteth ſome ſay meant one particular thing manoah would prepare ſome refreſhing angell hee would eate hebrew word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifieth bread onely doct 7 food ſo fleſh particularly word ſay papiſts faine catch hold euery thing thinke may ſerue purpoſe take occaſion maintaine tranſubſtantiation crie aloud bread sacrament may ſignifie fleſh doth place scripture appeares ſo haſtie alleage proofe hence purpoſe meane take one thing another though hebrew word may ſignifie fleſh doth bread yet ſhould remember paul wrote greeke tongue greeke word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifieth bread neuer taken fleſh gaine thus playing sophiſters among ignorant able iudge ſee yt abuſe reader groſſely ſaying bread may taken fleſh becauſe hebrew word ſometime ſignifieth ſo greeke word neuer ſignifieth ſo tongue yet concerneth lord supper written ſo goe dogge get fleſh ſhineth water loſe ſeemed haue mouth ſo yet greeke word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifie fleſh doth bread doth follow ſhould ſignifie ſo sacrament againſt ſenſe reaſon ſcripture truth wee ſee ſubſtantiall proofes bring vphold iuſtifie abſurd opinion religion ſay vpon ſuppoſition granted angell manoah ſpake ſame indiciduall thing yet man grant bee neceſſarie conſequence though manoah meant fleſh yet angell might meane bread synecdoche meaning refreſhing bread meate manoah might offer kid might anſwere eate thy bread ſenſe prepare nothing eate ſo much bread much leſſe thy fleſh ſo ſimple thinke otherwiſe except ſhould imagine meate like ſet angell without bread bread needfull alſo neceſſitie meaning muſt need ſame particular ſpare thus much manoahs deſiring eate ſecond thing followeth asking name next sermon seventy three sermon xiii chapter booke ivdges thus ſtill ſeeing man god tooke verſ 17 18 ſenſe ſhew ſuch grace ſpeech knit ſo deſired know name hee ſhewes reaſon wit ſhould come paſſe promiſed manoah might honour ſome reward angell ſeeing needleſſe thing asked anſwere word thought fitter make himſelfe knowne deedes word thereby confirme former promiſe made meaning verſe next word doe proue namely hee wonderfully ſo word originall hee marueilous wonderfully angel reſolued ſhould yeelding gratuitie cauſe manoah asked name hee tell yet deny manoah asked vpon good conſideration namely hee might ſhew himſelfe thankfull thought himſelfe bound wherein gaue cleere teſtimonie honeſt ſingle heart deſiring take opportunitie thereof vnto afterwards kindneſſe offered neceſſarie duty though regarded looked due angell ſhew ſee verſe hee doct verſ 18 deed rather word hath onely left v example alſo confirmed v scripture teacheth miniſter people concerning matter firſt former publike meſſenger god called angel meaning miniſter liable euery ianglers cenſure allowance ſufficiencie let get seale miniſterie angell bringeth wit efficacie working meane powerfull teaching powerfull example theſe ſhall iudges theſe muſt iudge able iudge iudge rule ignorant malicious therefore diſabled iudge beſt miniſters ſeducing ſpirit haue ſtood vpon owne worth like antichriſt day compell men conſciences acknowledge ſucceſſor apoſtle becauſe abundance owne ſenſe boaſted himſelfe ſo baſe teſtimonies inartificiall one ſaith lord lord ſhall enter kingdome heauen doth father heauen neither let man deſire bee matth 7 21 taken better ſubmit himſelfe touchſtone bewray mettall made much inward duty faith pietie ſettle beſt chriſtians bee ſo ſtill notwithſtanding taunt mockes vngodly bayte name hypocrite men ſingularitie ſeeing declare good liues imbrace heart generally let ſuch take warning onely haue name liue dead ſpeake well haue heart doe thereafter ſuch reproach ſcorne honour profeſſion life anſwerable iudgement ſleepeth appeareth ſaid angell willed manoah doe euen ſo meane offer burnt offering vnto lord obiect obiected lawfull offer place ieruſalem therefore lawfull offer angell met anſwere lawfull offer place arke carried ſtaied certaine place building temple ieruſalem indeed law tooke effect lawfull ſacrifice elſewhere high place taken away ſay ſuppoſing action ordinarie anſw indeed manoah bin warrantable time grounded vpon diuine warrant commanding ſo doe whereas againe obiected manoah tribe leui dan ought offer ſacrifice neither according law hee anſwered hee gaue fleſh thing angell tooke bee prophet hee might offer prophet extraordinary calling though houſe aaron yet lawfull ſacrifice elia eliſha prieſts corrupted pure worſhip god lord ſtirred vp prophet reſtore againe prophet ye ſay anſwere hee prophet therefore fleſh offering laide rocke angell wonderfully hee raiſed fire rocke conſumed ſacrifice ſame haue heard haue done gedeons ſacrifice although bee expreſſely ſaid fire brought rocke yet ſeeing mention fire brought manoah yet angell ſaid haue departed flame moſt likely fire ſtricken ſtone angell aſcended heauen though would vſe flame inſteade chariot diſſolued body tooke went away fire great wonder monoah wife ſtricken great feare ſaw angell god appeared manoah angell willed turning hee doct verſ 19 would haue ſet man god meate ſacrifice teacheth fit ready ſhould moued ledde good inſtruction duty wee know neither thought meekely receiuing word exhortation without reſiſtance vnwillingneſſe minde theſſalonians paul writeth thus 2 theſ 3 4 perſwaded lord yee doe already doe ſtill thing wee commande meaning reſolued themſelues make doctrine apoſtles rule life thus ſhould chriſtians bee affected like paterne paul giues widowes ſhould diligently giuen onely particular 1 tim 5 10 duty compaſſion rom 12 euery good worke commendeth grace god highly ſuch thus prepared ſerue god euery part life ſhall ſee good acceptable rom 12 2 god toward ſo ready ſtill new duty ſo doth much checke accuſe ſlow backward good thing ſhall required lead company fancy cauſe readineſſe alacritie receiuing word people conſider miniſter himſelfe tied like dutie vttering according charge peter feede flocke 1 pet 5 2 god ready minde conſtraint apoſtle paul confirmes neceſſitie impoſed vpon wo preach c doe neceſſarie worke willingly thankworthie otherwiſe neceſſarie muſt doe without thanks ſhall bee people hold pleade libertie take refuſe pleaſe therefore cornelius act 10 profeſſeth himſelfe ready heare act 10 33 whatſoeuer peter ſhould ſay god ſaith whatſoeuer meaneth whether reproofe commandement well comfort inſtruction ſhe weth doe ſome duty doe readily either finiſter reſpects halues goſpell bidden goe vineyard anſwered hee would matth 21 32 went ſo many heare zealouſly neuer weighing worke god note forecaſting difficulty repent forwardneſſe others readily yeeld truth mind ſound good heart come ſlowly forward delight therein approue liking ſhould gouerne againe ſome thing word requires yeeld outward action eſpecially yea ſtand ſtiffely defence iudas relieuing poore becauſe diuers reſpect deſire concurreth god commandement euen corruptly peruerting end vſe good duty benefit ought onely tend god glorie doe obey readily becauſe manner obeying conſcience ſake diſpleaſeth v artificer liketh well god calleth diligence calling coueteous note mind ſake occupied therein ſeruing god prouidence auoyding noyſome luſts temptation practiſe faith patience thankfulnes contentment hath readines thereto yea awkeneſſe beſt like dutie ſhould bee vrged others tardie themſelues prone vnto drawn ſuffer exhortation reproofe blemiſhes error vnwelcome readines teachablenes humbly giue place curbe contradicting rebellious nature god hath manifeſted vpon good ground rare gift ſpirit attendeth onely vpon dauid haue reſpect concerneth fit meete teacher choyce made alwaies beſt firſt ſought reſt ſtudents diuinitie might well incouraged follow ſtudie beſt example people well prouided thereby ſo might grow reſolue themſelues many doubt helped teacher reſt ſo might liue comfortably attaine many may ſeene alſo people goe without due wanting ſuch note teacher cauſes may repent would bring great ioy ſtreetes ſaid accuſation conſciences tell v wee ſelues wit moſt vile rebellious diſobedient ought humble v god ſuch meanes doth ſhew v face glaſſe ſin afraid whereas ſhould reioyce ſhew reuerence ſuch caſes duty ſo doe owe ſame reſpect god ſpeciall preſence congregation ſee good thing paſſed meaſure feare exceſſiue ſo wee may beholde thereby hard thing auoyde corruption beſt action went farre one extremitie much afraid ſo wee goe contrary wee come ſhort doe feare preſence god come ſpeciall manner little reuerend behauiour father toward god accuſation v contrary yet ought carry ſelues reuerently place let reader looke backe 6 chapter 22 verſe argument largely handled ſaid verſe angell hauing done verſe 11 came departed ſeene teacheth v ſame wit haue met together lord ſerue example publike vſe prayer word sacrament haue religiouſly ended theſe duty wee ſhould depart euery one place conſidering many great inconueniencies doe follow idle needleſſe tarrying behinde loyterings whereby doe onely forget ſuch good inſtructions haue heard whereas see hebr 2 1 freſh remembrance might returning either meditate reuiue memory good company alſo fall drinking playing prating ſuch like behauiour whereby wee doe much hurt ſelues others got good hearing diuell hath ſtrings bow one therefore cannot draw men neglect meanes altogether hee buſie head wandring oppreſſe body ſleepe neither theſe preuaile yet ſometimes windeth thē ſo deludings hee depriueth fruite ſeemed haue got eaſilie may brought aſleepe leaſt occaſioning forgetfulneſſe heare needleſſe company afterward ſome improuidence men yet hot glowing power word hee doth caſt cold water vpon affection quencheth ſpirit kindled good deſires yet ſo wiſe ſuſpect danger thinke themſelues ſafe enough well fenced diuell hauing ſo lately taken vp holy duty hearing prayer ſo eaſily beguiled doggeth though inuiſibly church well church ſpeake onely common abuſe sabbath chriſtians ought abhorred euen meeting occaſioned beſides auoided let well conſidered publike hearing beſides ſhunning vnſeaſonable company although forbid men returne lawfull calling affaire hearing whereunto word fitteth much better enemy fruite haue gained publique yet ſay thus much firſt ought bee ſome reſpite betweene one may bee ſo much may ſerue draw minde affection together ſettle ſome reuerence vpon ruſh forward looſely matter another nature foole iames forgot hew whereof ſaw themſelues glaſſe word secondly cannot ſeparate themſelues reuiewing thing haue heard prou 18 prou 18 1 muſt need bee haue doe others market faires yet sermon vſuall heard ſorts like occaſions let men watch ſpecially heart tongue neither breake meaſure forget right manner end companying together rather take occaſion ſeaſon others ſuch thing latelieſt heard driue one nayle another vſe phraſe eccleſiaſtes loſe abroad ſhould haue carried home prouiſion familie ala common ſort whereunto ſhall liken like fooliſh market men hauing ſtored purſes money ſacks neceſſaries ſteppe ſome lewde houſe finde ſuch companion either gaming drunkenneſſe iugling picke money purſes commodity bought ſo ſend home farre bare empty came forth dealing bad enough market worſe sermon vpon occaſion religious action worſe ſay becauſe former commonly fall againſt man latter wrong men offer themſelues voluntarily wondered many ſuch sauiour whipt temple becauſe made houſe prayer den theeues came ſuch meeting much looſe vnaduiſed gaddings owne houſes wantonly wailily without good end much ſay full danger wilfull going forth euill end purpoſes youth maſterleſſe perſons bee ſeene neede ſpeake doe know odious miſchiefe bring moſt eaſilie deceiued dinah iacobs gen 34 1 daughter went ſee maydes countrey may bee example ſuch meeter chriſtians learne dauid behalfe anſwere enuious brother eliab asked hee made father hauing ſent thither namely campe anſwered cauſe ſhould haue ſaide haue cauſe might indeed iuſtly found fault let aduiſed perſons ſee cauſe abroad may defend peace conſcience moſt miſchiefes haue haue come men leauing 1 sam 17 29 calling going company without cauſe hauing cauſe returning due time way ſhall ſaid proper place ſaid ſigne went added verſ 22 23 24 former theſe three verſes thing new trouble befell manoah wife becauſe ſeene angell god therefore concludeth ſhould certainely dye wife anſwered ſtrong faith confident wee ſhall dye ſheweth reaſons followeth bee conſidered thus noted ſtory gedeon wee ſee new doct verſ 22 trouble aroſe good man ſo doth daily god ſeruants marueiled doubt great fauour brought vpon lord ſeene alſo trie receiue meekely pſalm 119 71 ſtorie cited trouble oppreſſed manoah cauſed breake theſe word ſhall ſurely dye ſeene lord ſee angell ſo called 21 verſe see chap 6 14 euen eternall word calleth god next verſe wife called iehoua ſometime put ſhape man appeared men alſo angel cleare ſtories ſcripture good men ſeene god thus angell exceedingly terrified heart looked preſent death knew god ſaid moſes man ſhould ſee liue miſunderſtoode word tooke meant appearing bodily ſhape many often ſeene ſo yet liued gedeon manoah wife others reaſon feare reade verſe 20 thing note great weakneſſes oppreſſe god ſeruants doct 2 verſ 22 oft time wee ſee heere manoah kinde deadly feare doubting diſtraction ſay euen ſeruants god haue wound wrapped ſuch ſore diſquietnes either ſome ſore affliction haue thought vttermoſt might come ſome ſudden deep paſſion haue feared ſome grieuous calamitie bee comming toward ſo much haue made reſolution themſelues note vndone yet haue ſeene god hath giuen iſſue haue paſſed ouer head clowd haue ſafely eſcaped waded haue riſen deliberate conſideration grounded knowledge god feare oppreſſing vnaduiſed raſh iudging vnbeliefe oft time haſted melancholy vnto beſt ſubiect ſo yet muſt know grace goodneſſe ſmoothered ouerwhelmed fall deeply theſe diſguiſing themſelues therefore muſt bee carefull daily watch pray faith ſuch oppreſſing turbulent thought vexation take hold euen sauiour hath giuen charge ſaying let iohn 14 1 heart troubled conclude ſeeing falleth ſtorie manifeſt doct 3 good people may oft time point alſo manoah plunged feare doubt ſo dreadfully god fauour toward may learne needfull gather get argument teſtimonies thereof trial come day peace giue diligence make calling election ſure 2 pet 1 10 act 21 1 greateſt need may quiet confident doubt time triall one way endeuour haue good conſcience alwaies toward god men alſo ſame ſecret wee would ſeeme walke moſt innocently men openly many ſuch fruites faith wherein folly ſenſeleſſe blockiſhneſſe rom 2 28 euen many better ſort may bee marueiled ſo weightie matter ſo great vſe vnto ſo careleſſe let reader looke ſixth chapter haue already referred heard laſt verſe great feare oppreſſed manoah verſ 23 hee ſeene lord followeth verſe wife vttered feare next laſt verſe ſhewed samſon borne wife manoah ſaw husband ſo troubled ſhe better ſtaied therefore counſelled reaſons perſwade ſo alſo thus lord oft time ſpareth one doct verſ 23 child alſo ſame houſe hee afflicteth another vpholdeth one another caſt downe bee marked v doth ſee ſpiritual trial well bodily health viſitations end one may bee helper comfort another viſit together rarely ſeene yet ſupplieth want ſome way giuing grace party aſunder wont enioy one together although mercie little obſerued enioyed men readie aggrauate croſſes amplifie higheſt degree blinde ſeeing god goodneſſe afflicting yet ſuch might full ill ſpared cauſeth men accuſe themſelues vnthankfulnes hath procured increaſe multiplying croſſes know addition miſerie made thought ſmall benefit liue ſonne luke 15 17 vnder father wing wiſh might entertained place hireling returne point againe mercifull forbearance lord euen ſeene oftentimes one ſame perſons viſitation although lay hand vpon bodie yet oft time minde free ſpirit able ſuſtaine body infirmitie yet ſpake token god forſaking man ſeemeth afflict euery ſide lord driues people cling himſelfe prop crutch remoued leſt ſhould ſinke altogether iobs wife himſelfe iob 1 downe together may ſay child ſlaine cattell ſubſtance deſtroyed friend kindred alienated wrought doubt ſtrongly vpon weakeſt part lord ſide yea inſtead comfort wife others could neither haue reſiſted deſperate impatience euen hearing firſt heauie meſſage brought vnto much leſſe haue ſaid afterward although kill truſt therefore although lord doe ordinarily iob 13 15 thus meaſure child ſorrow come yet let none indent lord thus hee ſhall deale alway lord tied certaintie neceſſitie temporall croſſes beſt ſeruants ſaue onely god alſufficient miniſter vnto grace ſhall ſufficient many haue fallen ſuch ſtreights infectious diſeaſes pouertie trauaile c wanted ſuccour comfort neereſt vnto onely lord forſake neerer miſerie nature make neereſt friend ſeeing woman though regard ſexe weaker doct 2 veſſell yet ſtronger faith incourage husband hee fainted let v learne husband may deſpiſe wiues counſell god ſhall grace equally aboue many men caſes honoured ſuch wiues faith experience knowledge humilitie innocencie ſuch good gift god might hardly bee wanted much bee regarded haue theſe gift let farre thinking ſide meanely baſely husband remembring commandeth carriage reuerence towards husband againe muſt reioyce ſcorne take good vpon vaine conceit wiues deny ſupremacie many ſay crow ouer yet thoſe want grace otherwiſe ill qualitied let leane much counſell remembring ahab salomon ſinne little differing see verſ 9 10 chapter firſt reaſon ſound good god ſaid ſhe 3 would haue killed v would haue receiued ſacrifice hath receiued knew ſhe accepted god ſay ſeeing bad offer therefore acceptable againe manner allowable god conſumed ſacrifice doct flame may ſay like god heare prayer approue weake poore courſe life wee may aſſure ſelues act 10 4 loueth v therefore aduerſitie forſake caſt v god heareth ſuch lie ſtill ſinnes reaſon woman ioh 9 31 pithie concludent may bee extended ſenſe ſeeing god allowed accepted offering leſſe ground looke nay vnlike ſpeed deſires much would hee time come teſtifie loue towards hauing paſſed word token thereof deuoured ſacrifice meere goodneſſe ſaith ſhe giue v acceſſe maieſtie offer vp requeſts thankſgiuing vouchſafe ſmell aſweete fauour offering needed haue done ſuch matter came himſelfe free loue v reueile himſelfe v ſpecially others doubtleſſe hee meant ſlay v would haue done ſpared labour therefore theſe argument rather reueile himſelfe yet v loue v dearely giue v cauſe hereafter truſt giue thankes ſhe ſaith meanes kill v ſhe implieth viz rather bleſſe v abundantly ſo farre killing v argumentation vnlike paul rom 5 8 chriſt dyed v ſinners much iuſtified blood ſhall ſaued wrath ſerues preſident god people doubt temptation rouſe vp themſelues deadly feare gather ſtrength againe themſelues reaſon framed according thus ſhould euery afflicted ſoule conſcience reaſon time trouble ſay himſelfe time couenant god promiſe ground faith vpon wanted hope yet lord viſited mercie opened eye ſee heart mourne vnder burthen ſinne come eaſe finde forgiueneſſe since time haue much doubting troubled beleeuing repentance haue driuen proue thereupon haue reſted found peace therefore though tempted againe ſtrongly thinke eſtate vnſound naught yet remember god mercy old therein comforted god meant forſake caſt quite hee would haue proceeded ſo farre hath done would haue let lien ſtill darkneſſe vnbeliefe hypocriſie c taken leſſe paine call change reforme gouerne theſe betoken hatred loue deuouring ſacrifice argued god would kill manoah wife doubtleſſe lord owe ſuch fauour ſhewed mercy freely end might ſhew time come finiſh gracious worke thus conſtrue dealing hitherto enabling pray beleeue hate ſin grow knowledge inioy bleſſing vpon theſe much encreaſe let others ſay ſo vnthankfull think hath done vaine mock deceiue verily beleeue good therefore ſhall ſee promiſes fulfilled till ſee lord himſelfe land liuing c end seventie fovre sermon xiii xiiii chapter book ivdges firſt reaſon manoahs wife heard laſt ſermon ſecond followeth appeared v ſaith ſhe inſtructed v ſhould wherto alſo ſhe ſaid huſband attended readily know beleeued word thus muſt vnderſtand much word profiteth bee mixed faith therefore ſhe concludeth ſhould heb 4 1 dye ſo commendable leſſe ſo many v like found eſpeciall gift god vphold ſelues doct tryals beleeue god giue credit haue nothing hath ſent word among v againe againe therefore deſtroy v loueth v yet let v take meant practiſed husband wit receiued meſſage mouth angell beleeued word confirmed doct ſigne reaſon good manner god performance promiſe ſhewes rarely god hath graced woman ſhe weake creature ſhould able thus reſt ſelfe vnderlay husband argument greateſt force might gainſayd except groſſe abſurdities granted yea impoſſibilities wit god might falſifie word ſuch caſes manoah leſſe euidence truth proofe would haue ſerued turne commendeth duty vnto v ſhall tryed like manner wit ſuffer ſelues manoah forget hath made v promiſe forgiuenes hath aſſured v ſhall periſh kept reſurrection day iohn 10 28 may ſome great ſudden feare trouble diuell may quite ſpoyle v remembrance ground whereupon haue note built faith ioynts limmes help ſelues withall note ſhould ſtriue call back word god mind whereupon time paſt wee built faith confidence ſo ſhame ſelues wee ſtill aſcribe god honour beleeuing time paſt haue done nay ſhould embolden ſelues thus cannot diſappointed hope whether deliuerance preſent glorie itſelfe hereafter except god himſelfe conuinced falſhood impoſſible ſay ſo blaſphemy hath paſſed word v haue perſwaded cleare teſtimonie thereof ſundry time ſo ſure ſtate good god word ſo much one iot title fruſtrate thing meerly temporall may ſeeme repugnance betweene lord ſecret reuealed ſay ſeeme becauſe men e • large temporall promiſes reach ſpirituall promiſes neuer repugnancie faith ready hand argue woman thus ſhould god ſhould contrary himſelfe impoſſible laſtverſe referre next chapter following verſe 24 birth child sampſon mentioned ſigne thereof giuen angell lord prepared ſuch purpoſe helpe people againſt enemy giuing ſtrength body courage minde birth parent receiued promiſe god hauing ſuch childe yet many doubt ſee anſwered euen ſo know though many thought heart doct much heauineſſe god people inioying ſundry good thing god hath promiſed accompliſhed yet wee ſee god appoynted time effecteth bringeth paſſe true reaſon much vnbeliefe v yea though ſometime well purged v euery doubting note till obtaine thing promiſed yet ſome liue ſee performed certainely ſhall reſt alſo euen wee ſee promiſe barren woman ſhould beare came paſſe parent beleeued god deed word may one true promiſes remouing iudgements croſſes malice wicked paine penury oppreſſions bleſſings temporary well grace beare affliction vſe proſperity rightly good end dayes many great promiſes dauid kingdome yet long deferring thereof alſo admirable manifold oppoſitions met likelyhood ſhould euer haue inioyed ſo much vpon ſight brake himſelfe ſayd ſhall ſurely dye hand saul one time yet came paſſe inioyed ſtabliſhed therefore let thoſe haue part promiſes god count ſingular priuiledge honour haue lord heauen earth thus bound indeed compaſſe greateſt miſery though man abundance let ſuch ſay reioyce dayly reckoned among god hath aſſured grace enlighten purge gouerne vphold hereafter glorifie let watch wait performance theſe promiſes ſeeing hee hath made note made man hee ſhould change yeſterday day ſame euer renewing mercy dayly hold faith beleeuers crowne let beware none take away crowne childe grew vp holy ghoſt haue reaſon reſtraine take generally rather worthy actes fruites faith ſee hebrewes 11 followeth sampſon induced ſpeciall gift grace well courage minde fit valiant man bodily ſtrength mother ſaid haue ſeene woman timnah daughter philiſtims therefore giue wife 3 father mother ſaid vnto neuer wife among daughter thy brother among people thou muſt goe take wife vncircumciſed philiſtims samſon ſaid vnto father giue ſhe pleaſeth well 4 father mother knew came lord hee ſhould ſeeke occaſion againſt philiſtims time philiſtims reigned ouer iſrael firſt verſe ſome tranſlations election meanes ſerue calling calling neuer goeth without gift faith ſpirit god ſanctifying beginning glorifying heauen predeſtination ſelfe manifeſted time inlightening opening heart receiue glad tidings goſpell ſo chriſt embraced faith holy ghoſt giuen beleeuer quickens heart ſpirituall grace fitteth ſuch partie worke god inwardly renuing changing nature outwardly framing life thus worketh though hee giue greater meaſure ſome deputed appointed greater imployment ſeruice meane hee giueth zeale courage loue diligence conſtancie experience iudgement like yet leſt ſhould erre point know wee hee workes none theſe without meanes thoſe therefore thus ſanctifie hee alſo prepare ſtirring vp earneſt coueting theſe grace ſpeciall hunger thirſt high opinion account ſinglar affection loue feruent deſire honouring giuer ſtudious endeuour meanes prayer labour attaine yea looke affection worketh ſuch bring certaintie aſſurance ſaluation like preſerueth nouriſheth beleeuer encreaſing grace inabling ſeruice better manner ſuffereth ſit ſtill take eaſe till theſe gift drop mouthes indifferent whether attaine come cauſeth giue themſelues reſt till bee ſatisfied time time good thing deſire going mariage led god make philiſtim woman otherwiſe vnlawfull ſpoken throughout whole chapter following lay foorth manner referring thing theſe foure point firſt ſought wife theſe 4 next verſes secondly went agree receiue fell way tenth verſe thirdly done meeting mariage ſet eleuenth verſe twentieth laſtly followed mariage feaſt namely hee paied philiſtims apparell linnen hee tooke occaſion ſomewhat done begin vexe philiſtims end chapter concerning firſt ſeeking wife thus hee going timnah particular ſumme theſe verſes • ſixth towne philiſtims ſaw woman liked deſired father mother ſhe might giuen marueile ſeeing feared god diſliked ſhould deale one idolater neuertheleſſe hee earneſt knowing god moued take wife end hee might ſeeke occaſion thereby againſt philiſtims time lord ouer iſrael samſon growne vp yeeres fit mariage yet doct verſ 2 people iſrael ſtill ſubiection philiſtims lay vnder oppreſſion borne wee may ſee cleerely long held vnder calamitie ſo commeth paſſe oft time long god puniſheth ſo long ceaſe puniſhing child may much marueile may know doth ſo firſt correction may ſome meaſure recompence abuſe patience ſecondly hee may frame v aright minde liking hard doe firſt afflicting v long ere wrought v becauſe vntowardnes little affliction ſhort doth commonly ſearch v deeply bring v readily vpon knee therefore ſuch great ſores muſt haue deepe tent longer continuance paine ſmart wee reade haue afflicted twelue yeeres ſome eighteene goſpell people forefather long vnder moabites canaanite ſore vexed ſo famine haue bin continued three 1 king 17 1 ruth 1 4 ſeuen yeeres vncomfortable grieuous ſtinging haue may eaſily gather ſuſtained ſome yeeres ſince ſaw third yeere famine hold continue much pinching oppreſſing former two neither ſeene wiſe fourth yeere could haue borne ſhould haue caſt vpon v without ſtaruing famiſhing death great number people ſo ſore want bread ſpeake particular men calamity alſo haue lien long endleſſe infinite let act 7 6 vſe doctrine v perſons company make full account preſent ſpeedie riddance croſſe held vnder yet deſpaire though haue ſuffered long relieued eaſed abide patiently pray feruently god ſhall fall extremitie certainly come helpe though know tarrie reader may finde former chapter 13 1 others proceed ſaid ſecond verſe samſon going downe anſwering doubt verſe 2 • ▪ timnah ſaw woman daughter philiſtims next verſe ſaid deſired might wife proceede doubt ariſeth attempt whether well obiect action ſelf againſt law god one ſide namely take ſtranger idolater wife parent alſo godly diſliking ſide himſelfe led ſpirit god renowned epiſtle hebrewes among faithfull worthie memorie theſe ſay thus conſidered breed queſtion could onely like ſuch thing go forward bring paſſe time calling himſelfe backe though denied godly perſon may poſſibly ſlippe ſinne wittingly yet either ſhall ſee fault diſlike proceed duty ſaying repentance haue done ſome lamentable example ananias wife feare leaſt repent ſhall brought remembrance ſome good act 5 11 time dauid neither theſe reade haue done samſon though either void conſcience hee god priuiledged action yea maketh queſtion doubt greater parent themſelues firſt withſtood diſliked attempt therein afterward conſent father went woman mariage feaſt ſhall ſay hereunto anſwere thing came lord anſw iudg 13 5 samſon might thereby haue occaſion vexe philiſtims though marrying vncircumciſed woman generally forbidden yet lord giuing perſonal charge ſo doe aboue law tyed offended therein whole ſtory following doth proue may ſee god onely brought againſt afterward ſinne dauids peter ſinnes great cauſe samſon iuſtly charged hee ſhould haue done like god bleſſed ſtill afterward ſupported great difficulty trouble raiſed againſt philiſtims except ranged ranne ſtolne liberty without allowance might ſee apparantly god haue herein parent knew god minde matter firſt therfore ſaw themſelues bound dutie againſt mariage afterward agree doubteth reuealed god samſon himſelfe told god would ſo haue neceſſarie ſay anſwering doubt cleering verſe hath bin ſaid point ſee ye lord may diſpenſe owne law abraham hath giuen doct verſ 2 3 perſonall commandement contrary hath done ſuch thing know neither wee may looke diſpenſed withall meanes contrary commandements attempt thing samſon heere ſeeking woman taking wife among idolater ſuch like fact vtterly vnlawfull v doe ſhall reckoned againſt committer capitall great ſinne put action together ſeeking liking ſuch woman one kinde though degree one worſe wit ſeeketh ſuch wife deſiſt leaue hee liketh giueth ouer himſelfe thereto elſe ſmall difference betwixt great reaſon ſhould bee odious v much true ſeruing god ſuch match looked great ſinnes namely idolatrie prophanenes one partie ſhall deuoure canker eate goodneſſe partie rather auoided thereby neither poſſible ſo vnequally yoked together enioy chiefe benefit marriage without reſt little worth whereas ſhould conſent agree together good thing conferring praying reading together one minde thing like ſort qualitie contrary minded one another draw vnequall yoke faithfulnes loue except diſſimulation betwixt ſuch eſpecially behalfe worſer partie courſe liues finde held marrying popiſh kindred perſons well knowne bee vncircumciſed finde iuſt accuſation vexation long marueile ſtaightly commanded marry lord 1 cor 7 39 thereby iuſtly challenged matching canaanite ſtrange religion ſuch impious ſcandalous liues though owne religion ſecond point next verſe ſhall appeare let added ſpake briefly vpon ver 2 chap 2 place samſon hauing broken matter mariage parent giue verſ 4 anſwere verſe reaſon anſwere rendred holy ghoſt next anſwere obiect kindred religion woman ſhe philiſtim vncircumciſed doe tell ought take wife among owne people practiſe hee attempteth matter without acquainting parent hee liked woman doth condemne common attempt doct verſ 4 moſt age matter haue ſo degenerated turned away durifulneſſe ſeeking parent conſent note match samſon haue made end done deſired wiues yea many vndone readie leaue begin breake parent whereas lord hath commanding ſeeke parent conſent prouided ſhould raſhly vnwiſely caſt themſelues danger led vnexperienced youth eaſily depth euils ſorrow well aduiſed directed well dutifull therein onely deſpiſe counſell god caſting parent helpe furtherance behinde back doe therefore right ſoone ſmart ſorrow haſtineſſe wilfull proceeding herein follow eſaus moſt curſed example againſt liking parent tooke canaanitiſh woman wiues gen 26 35 whoſe ſight conuerſation could beare abide great part croſſings vexation marriage doe ariſe ſpring fountaine haue begun amiſſe thus gōe worke match ſo proceed moſt part worſe becauſe neuer feared god would ſit light till many weariſome oft complainings ſometime alſo haſty raſh making vp marriage though ſeaſon late moſt miſeries ſuſtaine theſe ſay doe paine penſiueneſſe end dayes therein annoyance marriage come cauſes haue time ſpeake therefore one caution watchword giuing parent child end point giue doe exerciſe tyrannicall power ouer child many doe draw ſuch marriage cannot yeeld vnto theſe ſay doe lightly haſtily caſt affection cannot faſtned without great danger iuſt cauſes may ſeene breaking match proceed god hath commanded wit parent liking good vnleſſe apparently reſiſt god anſwere sampſons parent learne another thing doct 2 marriage god ſeruants ought made ſuch like minded vncircumciſed thoſe contrary religion ſo ſay verſe neuer wife daughter people thou muſt goe philiſtims one bee neceſſarily required commanded lord ſeuenth deutronomy ſcripture doth clearely teach namely deut 7 3 exod 23 33 true worſhippers god may ioyne themſelues idolater thoſe another religion reaſon hand alleaged lord himſelfe wit infected corrupted beſides one hope ſuch ſhall faithfull together papiſt idolater vnfaithfull god looke dores ſuch perſons wife though much wealth foraſmuch many profeſſors religion found bad lewd vild quality thoſe alſo ariſing euil diſtempered ſpirits leſt ſhould ſtumble take liberty amiſſe let know likewiſe forbidden god caſt themſelues away vpon ſuch vngodly one marry owne religion ſuch ought eſpecially looke vnto anſwere god well marryed lord owne religion sampſons parent include vnderſtand vrged marry daughter people vncircumciſed liued law moſes knowne truth among duty marrying aright afterward clearely expreſſed ſet downe saint paul giuing liberty widow marry ſhe addeth lord religiouſly feare god 1 coc 7 39 many otherwiſe profeſſing true religion exceedingly diſguiſed liues ſo whoſoeuer yoked meerely lincked fellowſhip marriage otherwiſe muſt neceſſitie either liue deadly vncomfortablenes better thing companion elſe worſe ſhall fall manner note faſhions match ſome euill way concerning marriage ſpeake ſhall behoue wiſe ſo waighty matter themſelues faithfull friend namely enquire learne diſpoſition behauiour thoſe ſeeke make companyons tainted groſſe notorious vice high degree giuen anger wrath impatience curriſhneſſe ſtoutneſſe wilfulneſſe ſcoffing ſpirited oppreſſed melancholy woman particularly ſtinging tongue parretlike exceeding ſuch bad quality ſo man ſome like manner diſguiſed ſay theſe let great wiſdome care vſed auoyd match ſuch qualitie condition although act samſons god put himſelfe leade yet otherwiſe theſe ſpeeches ſaw woman timnah deſired marry ſhe pleaſed well way allowed ſufficient cauſes reſt neither therefore v proceeding therein pleaſing eye fancy dangerous aduiſe v caſe yea vtterly inſufficient goe alone though better thing accompany allowable yea ought haue place party meane eye heart pleaſed contented ſatisfied ſeeing marriage man life time meet ſhould good liking one note well bearing moleſtations croſſes aduerſities may befall couple yet liking one perſon muſt alſo good grace quality ſaid goe therewith knoweth eye blind heart deceitfull one ſinne let light houſe window whatſoeuer done alone without better aduiſers doth ſurely come euill end one example may teſtifie long agone giuen ſonnes gen 6 2 god ſaw daughter men faire tooke wiues ſo iniquitie multiplied haue heard parent samſon conſented verſ 5 ſhould take philiſtim woman marriage reaſon rendred verſe knew came lord end philiſtims might firſt giue occaſion samſon iniury offred afterward auenged iuſtly followed knowledge law god denying conſent ſuch match therefore knew marriage god diſliked knowledge god word directed doe yeelded afterwards ſo made acquainted god ſonne otherwiſe wit god would haue ſo would elſe haue yeelded gone profeſſed obedience law bad example ought inſtruction haue done doct verſ 5 ſo ſhould know ought doe ſay follow light knowledge haue god perſwaded truth ſhould ſinne contrary ſhould goe againſt conſciences ſo thus peter yet vnderſtand viſion followed knowledge act 10 28 law clearely fully inſtructed contrary viſion ſaw god allowed ſo doe changed minde ſtill better knowledge commendable abimelech toward sarah would haue taken knowne ſhe man wife gen 20 alſo admoniſhed afterward god ſhe ſo yet though heathen yet followed light touching wife man pilate alſo well defended ieſus againſt prieſts bitter falſe accuſations according luke 23 4 knowledge innocencie much well becommeth v chriſtians according light haue god ſo ſhould doe euery one according meaſure hath yet euer ſeeking inlightned confirmed knowledge leſt wee ſhould deceiued bee well grounded leſt conſcience erroneous doe againſt meane perſwaded truth yet moſt men caſe threatneth ſore ſuch perſons make ſo many wound length conſcience neuer kindly healed see chapter 11 35 caueat propounded whereas ſaid lord samſon ſought occaſion 2 philiſtims fight againſt therefore marriage ſought though could many wayes haue plagued defended people yet ſeeing would doe open warre one man muſt haue fit occaſion thereto marriage offred priuate iniuries done againſt samſon philiſtims might fitly take occaſion openly vexe annoy appeareth thus vnder dominion philiſtims certaine couenants made betwixt might without great danger raſhly broken iſraelites samſon priuate man farre could know therefore god would haue ſufficient occaſion fighting againſt offred ſuſtaining iniury ſhould againe make requitall might thought rather reuenged owne priuate wrong publike againſt nation although cannot denyed lord might pleaſed haue armed samſon well othniel ehud like caſe haue chaſed ſubdued profeſſing openly concerneth inſtruction place doct though god would haue samſon doe thus yet like occaſion noted ſecond third verſe wee haue neither warrant authoritie doe like ſeeing wee haue plaine commandement god contrary wit wee ſhould auoide occaſions either reuenging wrong ſhould ſuſtaine ſome hurt damage rather offer leaſt without liuing peaceable manner among moſt men world fit beare iniurie ſo buy redeeme quietnes thereby may eaſily enioy note ſome noted offering wrong ſhall haue loade trouble one reſpect well deſerueth beſide many way therefore wee commanded follow inſue peace yea although ſhould flie v holineſſe without heb 12 14 man ſhall ſee lord whereof ſeeing enough hath bin ſpoken elſewhere need inſiſt longer therein thus much firſt theſe 4 point ſecond part chapter samſons ſeeking wife seventie five sermon xiiii chapter booke ivdges verſ 6 went samſon father mother downe timnah came vineyard timnah behold young lion rored vpon 7 ſpirit lord came vpon hee tare one ſhould haue rent kid nothing hand neither told father mother done followeth ſecond generall point ſecond part chapter wit firſt double iourney samſon woman bee wife hee accompanied father mother whereby appeareth knew god marriage better ſecondly fell iournies way verſ 11 firſt going timnah fell therein laid foorth theſe two verſes went father mother going aſide way young lion met roring ſpirit lord came vpon though nothing hand yet rent peeces hee told father mother done fell way god would giue samſon proofe ſtrength meant endue afterward hee might bold looke power doe greater thing ſaid remaineth wee obſerue particularly concerneth v ſtorie firſt father mother vnderſtood mariage pleaſed god went downe woman ſhould marrie finiſh agreement betwixt countenance euery way parent ſee doct childrens attempt either way bee pleaſing god ſhould ready helpe free meanes delay trouble griefe thereby much lieth euen contrary bound croſſe hinder leſt ſhould allow euill courſe childrens ſinne beſide owne bad example ſhould chiefly laid charge aſſiſtance vnto samſon mentioned 8 verſe chapter therefore let onely bee noted parent warie leſt turne authoritie power god hath giuen good benefit child turne ſay vnto deſtruction damage laying bridle necke ſo embolden euill allowance counſell example young lion ſaid haue met whelp 2 like haue fawned played one full growne word ſignifieth one full growth therefore neither pleaſant kinde ſometime yet growne ſay ſuch one cruell fierce ſet vpon samſon nature doe thing ſo falling ſuppoſe caſe gone vnlawfull buſineſſe behold ill ſucceſſe followed euen reade example fell man god came iuda reprooue idolatrie ieroboam bethel 1 king 13 24 ſeeing tranſgreſſed commandement contrary charge giuen told old prophet bethel might ſee heauie iudgement befell teacheth ought ſee manifold action life looke wee haue good warrant taking hand going leſt meete ſay lion lord croſſing v worſe lion could hurt v ſome 1 king 21 20 way little liking middeſt hot purſuite deſires either outward reſiſtance v ahab elia going take poſſeſſion naboths vineyard inward wound conſcience moſt commonly hee vſeth doe ſuch haue knowledge hardneſſe heart alwaies hindreth keepeth away rom 2 4 repentance occaſion samſons iourneying iuda timnah philiſtims ſay particularly let ſuch trauaile whether within land beyond ſeas forreine country ſee errand lawfull warrantable expreſly croſſing lord charge shemei salomon leſt although ſcape shemei puniſhment 1 king 2 43 yet worſe befall remember dina gehazi nay ſee onely buſineſſe good look alſo affection well orderly carried thereto otherwiſe ſeeking noueltie curioſitie vanitie ſpeake doe ſo ſiniſter intent way marre action trauailing neuer ſo lawfull nouriſhment one creature anothers bane euen ſo trauaile ſundrie ſorts men though ſome good profitable apparant many trauellers went euill purpoſe yet vnarmed againſt euill ſtrongly reſolued depart haue ruſhed vpon pike tempted god caſt themſelues vpon ſtreights indangered body liues conſciences manifold way ſpeake ſuch profeſſe haue god directer way others let dead bury dead iourney well vndertaken man take faith ſanctifie prayer ſo commit himſelfe therein god protection bleſſing ſurely goe otherwiſe worke wee able beare meekely patiently either diſappointment ill ſucceſſe hard accident ſhall befall v wee encounter lion ſhould meete v beſide theſe vntimely vnſeaſonable trauailings abroad leſſe dangerous home neere hand among reſt example ſake sabbath abuſed wanton waily gaddings ſtageplayes gaming houſes drinking yet god commandement moſt lawfull common action ordinary buſineſſe ought bee done may bee done day one inſtance many wicked iourneyings trauailings day vſuall ill diſpoſed ordinary among better ſort heare word preached vſe religious exerciſes although ſuch perſons haue ſtoppe way turne backe neither doe meete oppoſition balaam hinder croſſe deſires yet ſhall reape wage iniquitie hee wiſh kept home free ſuch company many ſtripes meeting lion samſon wee haue heard verſ 7 perill life yet god vſe occaſion trie declare ſhew foorth god power ſtrength ſhould elſe haue hidden ſpirit lord ſtirred vp extraordinary gift might manhood bee found ſtrongeſt perſon whereby hauing nothing hand yet teare lion peeces one part member another young kid lambe example wee may learne though croſſe v feareful doct ſee comming toward v beare lion meet yet lord loueth v hee samſon doth vſe quickning grace hearten v againſt ſo wee finde turne great good note benefit let marked ſay god doth ſpeciall grace bring thus paſſe ſhould looke extraordinary meanes though dealt ſo samſon wee beleeue waite certainly becauſe hath promiſed helpe thereof ſhall need doubt ſuch ſtrength ſhall granted v ſhal put away feare leaſt abate reſtraine without help god ſhall feare troubled wee doe heare croſſe danger ſight lion yea diſquieted ouercome heauineſſe haue ſhould meete beare haue many example weakneſſe feare god deare people ſeruant eliſha hee ſaw armie aramites 2 king 6 15 compaſſing houſe cried ſaid ala maſter ſhall wee doe diſciples like bee ſeene vnbeliefe matth 14 26 thought ſeene ſpirit ſore afraid yet feared ieſus maſter comming toward comfort thē ſelues indeed moſt timerous euen haue little cauſe much otherwiſe yet great affliction oppreſſe v god v haue ſaid able might great thing apoſtle ſaith able doe thing helpe phil 4 13 chriſt ſtrengtheneth yea ſo great oddes betweene one ſame man oppreſſed feare though ſmall trouble taken ſudden great one hee prouided note betweene heate leaſt candle greateſt fire fainted one weake faith eſcaped ouercame force aſſiſted therewith hath large ſhewed gedeon one time afraid goe behold campe hee blanckt encounter conquer whole ſtorie lion conſider may vnderſtand 2 tendeth directly end prepare make samſon able beare diſpleaſure enmitie philiſtims afterward raiſed vp againſt lord giuing ſtrength purpoſe might miniſter matter riddle propound whereby ſore prouoke firſt learne god indueth men excellent gift betimes doth many thereby declareth hee double multiply thoſe perſons alſo vſe ſerue ſingular purpoſes proceeding hindred ſome ſiniſter practiſes ſtand way diuell note inſtruments ſubtilitie diuerting good gift bad purpoſes apparent god worke samſon firſt yeeres diſcretion hee yet young compared followed afterwards made ſtrip waſte philiſtims euen ſo worke ſay ſpeciall manner ſome future age giue ſignes thereof younger yeeres notably ſeene dauid great danger goliah saul told boy hee vndertooke fight wit goliah man warre youth anſwered vnto saul thy ſeruant 1 sam 17 36 kept father ſheepe came lion likewiſe beare tooke ſheepe flocke went ſmote tooke mouth hee roſe againſt caught beard ſmote ſlew therefore vncircumciſed philiſtim ſaid hee ſhall one ſeeing hee hath railed hoaſt liuing god like manifeſt samuel becauſe lord meant make ordinary inſtrument glorie function iudge prophet therefore reuealed himſelfe familiarly viſions vnto tender age yea ſeemed diſcretion ripenes yeeres iudgement lord began work early time come meant accompliſh great meaſure ſee religious prudent training vp young one knowledge god themſelues good literature ordinarie meanes adaies promote worke god time come deſpiſed much leſſe towardlineſſe ſuch god youth ſhall begin grace aboue others bee ſnibbed checked practiſe ſome brutiſh perſons ſcorne reiect ſuch ſaying tuſh reckoning make yee ſuch young saint old diuell truth exemplified many young perſons day good education doe ſhew great towardnes ſchollers vniuerſitie learning countrey young men damzels ſuch thing wherein trained vp ſorts practiſe chriſtianitie farre differing common ſort youth ſaucie diſobedient prophane giue fearefull ſignes miſchiefe working ſuſtaining miſerie afterward hee raiſeth excellent inſtruments ſome fit magiſtracie ſome place doe much good miniſterie teacher onely alſo father begetting many child god others bring foorth much fruite glorie herein prophecie verified thoſe day lord would powre ſpirit vpon fleſh old men onely act 2 17 euen tendereſt young men maiden fruite doubt vnction chriſt ieſus arch prophet church began age twelue yeeres giue demonſtration ſtrange forwardnes wiſdome grace becauſe riper yeeres hee fully declare luke 2 52 annointed ſpirit without meaſure theſe therefore ſpake vſe well gift god dauid samuel receiued youth ſhal haue gotten experience ſee god proſpereth inlargeth ſound great reioycing good many helpe caſt downe deſtroy workes darkneſſe diuell place bee ſtrongly reſiſted ſet againſt ſuch loue darkneſſe light becauſe deed euill haue begun well younger yeeres giuen great hope ſay comming world ſhall dazled deceitfull note beautie though found better portion grace ſhall blindfolded profit pleaſure promotion ſo thereby cannot former workes ſhall complaine late theſe muſt forſake way well could haue ſeene may ſee howſoeuer woond diuels hand firſt maine temptation wherein danger brought deſpaire next alſo tended bring preſumption yet hath preuailed againſt third glorie preſent world thereby hath deceiued matth 4 8 thus much ſaid firſt thing mentioned laſt verſe wit gift god appearing samſon firſt yeeres diſcretion ſecond namely ſtorie doth miniſter matter riddle afterwards ſpeake place ſhall haue fitter occaſion offered namely fifteenth chapter laſtly verſe ſaid hee told father mother hee lion ſhewed neither hee himſelfe 4 vainglorious onely ſhould ſoone haue heard thereof alſo appeareth ſaw cauſe end vttering time let v learne ſpeake hold peace ſilent euen ſpeaking doe good hurt good cannot doe hurt rule guideth v ſilent let v alſo learne ſpeake namely wee ſee may doe good hurt good hurt ſame repeated verſe 9 agreeth haue often vrged generall wit wee ſhould ſhew godly wiſdome well vprightnes doings sauiour mat 11 would commend iohn baptiſt diſciples gone leſt mitth 11 7 ſhould haue much hindred profited people verſ 8 went downe talked woman thoſe thing pleaſing eye samſon 9 within day returned receiue went aſide ſee carkeis lion behold ſwarming bee hony body lion 10 tooke thereof hand ond went eating came father mother gaue vnto eate told taken hony body lion 11 father went downe vnto woman samſon made feaſt ſo vſed young men doe 12 ſaw brought thirtie companion samſon ſaid put foorth riddle vnto declare within ſeuen day feaſt finde giue thirtie ſheetes thirtie change garment followeth according diuiſion made ſecond verſe ſenſe verſe 9 ſecond part chapter samſon went agree woman father mother heard ſeuenth verſe father came thither pleaſed concluding match ſenſe firſt theſe verſes wit ſaid ſpeake thing pleaſed samſon ſhould vnderſtand meant father talked woman good contentment liking ſonne alſo heere ſhewed fell next going vp way went receiue 11 verſe muſt little ſtay reader occaſion doubt ariſing verſe 8 8 verſe wit ſaid samſon went aſide carkeis lion tooke hony ſeeing nazarite appeareth cap 13 5 chap 16 17 may bee thought samſon either ſinned againſt rule nazarite elſe ſpeciall diſpenſation breake touching rule wee reade numb 6 particularly verſ 6 forbad comming carkeis yet ſhould vncharitable caſting blame wilfull finne vpon samſon raſh iuſtifying diſpenſation ſeeing neither mentioned intimated text anſwere samſon neither ſinned againſt rule diſpenſed god reaſon tied ſuch rule ſeeing demanded ſtill could nazarite anſwer againe muſt make difference betweene nazarites borne nazarites immediate ordaining god ſeparated profeſſion others voluntarily vndertook vow according ceremonie ſorts ſomething common profeſſion ſtrict pure worſhip god ſome ceremony annexed thereto differed herein former ſort neceſſarilie tied eſtate whole life ſo priuiledge allowed exempt ſome ceremoniall obſeruances vowed nazarites tied vowed nazarite voluntarie certaine ſpace time onely ſo time bound indifferently article mentioned number samſon ſay voluntarie vowed borne ordained nazarite extraordinarily therefore though probable hee tied long haire namely abſtaine ſtrong drinke mother yet cleere free ceremonie touching dead ſundrie like ordination iohn babtiſt text appeareth luk 1 15 anſwere applied hold sauiour haue nazarite place education onely matth 2 23 profeſſion alſo ſalue obiections drinking wine comming dead c ſoundly enquire onely ſay could proued sauiour profeſſed nazarite thoſe obiections hinder nothing becauſe onely oppugne vowed ordained nazarites thus much proceed doctrine firſt samſons father mother going conclude mariage teacheth parent ſee match child doct vpon iuſt occaſion propound deſire conſent lord pleaſing ought ſaid ready accompliſh beſt manner beſt condition ſo child may reuerence deſire ſeeing god doth allow bleſſe herein would hinder make match ſo parent guardian may neither dare ſeene great blemiſh themſelues ſo iuſt bee held backe attempt ſtaied therein let therefore ſubmit themſelues lord giue parent honour due leſt make moſt ſtrangers work ſhould chiefe doer ſame may know proſpering therein ſhall ſmall point let reader ſee haue noted caleb chap 1 samſon woman agreed mariage hee went againe afterward tooke bee wife fell verſe 9 10 way went ſhewed firſt theſe two married 20▪ afterward tooke wife firſt conſented liue together man wife parent agreeing thereto theſe doe proue vniting one man one woman doct together mariage ſolemne ordinance god appointed ſo likewiſe bleſſed hee obeyed looſe brutiſh liuing together otherwiſe one man many woman c moſt vnfitting chriſtian contrary god ordinance bringeth foorth moſt noiſome euils euen parting ſeparation one married perſons ſaue adulterie odious firſt two point ſaid briefly ſeeing occaſion offered ſpeake particularly elſewhere ſecond thing theſe two verſes wit fell way went samſon went aſide trauailed marriage ſee carkeis lion rent peeces become hee found body ſwarme bee hony ſtrange thing behold thoſe creature loue ſweeteſt place thoſe vnſauourie lord ſo brought paſſe father mother ſhould eate thereof yet know whence came end might miniſter matter riddle propounded mariage whereby occaſion aroſe purſuing philiſtims thus god prepared hony body lion directed finde eate giue eaten haue ſet downe theſe two verſes wee may ſee doct 2 verſe 10 11 god pleaſeth either puniſh bleſſe hee hee intended bleſſing iſrael puniſhment philiſtims vſe meanes effecting ſame though wee ſee alwaies extraordinarily rather ſhall faile come paſſe ſo purpoſed deliuer people pharaos bondage none exod 14 12 ſaw could bee hedged euery ſide hee made way ſee thorow red ſea high way drie ground euen ſo perſwaded hauing appointed purpoſed v good life feare bring v well difficulty hath promiſed finiſh courſe ioy moſt certainly doe though wee ſee may ſeeme oft time v impoſſible hath many way bring paſſe euen hee deliuered eliſha prophet armie aramites 2 king 6 17 armie heauenly ſouldiers hee promiſed great plentie corne prophet next day yet preſent almoſt famiſhed ſay performe meanes foure leprous perſons ſo much great man neere king affirming although 2 king 7 16 god ſhould raine downe corneout heauen could bee ſo yet liued ſaw ſo though liued eate euen prophet told ſo perſwaded whatſoeuer ſeeth expedient v bring paſſe though ſee hee hath way enough doth v wee muſt willingly ſubmit ſelues want forgoe knowing good v haue granted whereas wee trouble feares either grace bee note granted v deliuerances bee wrought v doe either ſmoother faith feare deſpaire helpe breake foorth open murmuring diſcontentednes time cauſeth v ſhift make way ſelues vſing vnlawfull remedy meanes double affliction meaſure continuance oftentimes elſe ſhake aſſe doth burthen ſtaying god leiſure till hee caſe v ſo next commeth vnfitter former ſelues moſt ſhiftleſſe could behold alſufficiencie note power god varietie meanes wiſedome worke deliuerance confuſed diſtruſtfull behauiour ſhould great part cured eſpecially ſeeing whatſoeuer power hath ſuccour v diſtreſſed ſeruants loue ſetteth worke ſhew exerciſe exceeding benefit good dauid ſaw saul comming againſt meanes god 1 sam 23 27 would reſcue neither needfull ſeeing promiſed ſo doe howbeit waiting faith iſſue deliuered ſo ſaw lord wrought thereby gathered ſo hee able ready often like danger rather promiſe ſhould faile note falſified thus wee ſhould hearten ſelues waite pacience difficulty till haue finiſhed courſe ioy tolde either father mother 2 like ſhould haue done ſtrange thing finde honey carkeis lyon giuen tell ſuch thing friend ſeldome heard like wondred newes welcome yet ſay ſignified vnto wiſely done conceale whether thought make riddle vncertaine told might eaſily haue knowne many ſo like haue ſome meanes diſcloſed among philiſtims wee ſee afterward tolde wife onely confirmeth v former doctrine ſeuenth verſe namely wary conceale thing need bee vttered eſpecially ſecrets wee ſee good come thereby concealing may becauſe eaſie man foreſee euery inconuenience may come vnſeaſonable ſpeech therefore wiſeſt way v cut al talke whereof wee ſee ſome good reaſon moue warrant v vtter grow inconuenience thereby notwithſtanding care reſpectiuenes wee ſhall haue leſſe accuſe v ſee dauids fact 1 sam 21 meane requiring ſhew bread armour golia 1 sam 21 6 9 abimilech preſence doeg neceſſitie draue aske chriſt defended fact therefore hee leſſe cauſe bee troubled though much hurt aroſe obiect samſon tolde riddle wife dangerous haue opened parent taken anſwere offended greatly ſo may learne may poſſibly ſhew wiſdome ſome part life whereof yet wee may faile without great heed taking afterward haue heard samſon went take wife fell verſ 11 20 ſumme generally ver 20 way followeth third point ſecond part chapter wit meeting accompliſh mariage thing done thereat eſpecially foure firſt made philiſtims feaſt verſe secondly philiſtims verſe 12 prouided thirtie companion thirdly samſon propounded riddle condition ſhould haue could tell meaning within ſeauen dayes contrariwiſe middeſt 15 verſe laſtly laboured know meaning could till ſeauenth day tolde hauing gotten wife twentieth verſe firſt theſe 4 thing mentioned verſe made ſenſe verſ 11 particular feaſt father going downe againe doubt comfort ſtrange place countenance haue noted twice verſe 6 c added samſon according cuſtome place ſo yong men wont doe mariage cuſtome vnlawfull ſelfe ſee hath vſuall thing call friend together ſuch time marrying kindred feaſt reioyce one another hath practiſe good well bad neither commendation ſimply ſhunne ciuill indifferent action common men multitude indeed bee looked wee conforme ſelues euill manner vſing age liue rom 12 rom 12 2 one cuſtome faſhion feaſting samſon vſed ſo chriſt preſent marriage feaſt canan towne galile many ioh 21 met together approued feaſting bad laban made feaſt called together men place gaue daughter iacob wife alſo young gen 29 22 men philiſtims vſe doe ſuch time action therefore hauing practiſe well godly bad people ſelfe indifferent vſed may done lawfully ſo may alſo omitted becauſe wicked men haue vſed doe nothing well therefore falleth moſt part greateſt number meete feaſts none beſt may ſeene oft time conuenient omit meeting ſuch leſt much wickedneſſe ſhould committed lewdnes tongue behauiour diſhonour god eaſily done haue well filled themſelues cannot altogether let paſſe yet ſmaller company would bee gathered eſpecially ſuch friend beſt ſort people muſt needes ſhould ſo bee placed table ſet together may bee obſerued may bee ſoone interrupted broken ſuch ſit neere better minded wiſe withall ſhould fall offenſiue behauiour sauiour chriſt hee gaue good example marriage preſent took occaſion miracle wrought hold occupied good talke turne people away contrary farre may ſee companie good end may like doe good take good ſo thereafter vſe ſaid point hauing touched hauing occaſion ſpeake fullier afterwards ſaid young men vſed make feaſt 2 marriage therefore samſon ſo ſee force ſtrength cuſtome preuaileth medes perſians law eaſily broken cuſtome people deſire priſoner deliuered ſet free paſſeouer meanes whereof asked barrabas murtherer rather ieſus cuſtomes matth 27 15 bad continued ſtill whereby diſorder reuell maintained euen fruit darkneſſe people ſo reuited though preaching goſpel hath bewraied brought light ſhame odiouſnes yet hardly bee broken almoſt place prophane ſpending greateſt part lord sabbath carding drinking feaſting ſuch like abomination ſuch euery countrey manner thereof making day rather held bacchus saturne lord ſame may ſaid riotous intemperate miſpending twelue day certaine day yeere farre worſe paſſed ſay papiſts euen heathen oft time vſe doe except putting downe faires wont kept sabbath much ado ſome yeeres agone aboliſhed remember many ill cuſtomes ouerthrowne put vſe ouerthrowing many blind dangerous diſordered alehouſes vſe honeſt neceſſitie trauellers hath indeed commendably gone ſome honourable worſhipfull perſons yet vpholding ſome gentleman others ſmall credit remaine ſtill working much euill miſchiefe thereby moſt place thoſe good cuſtomes ſay bad ought hurtfull may ſuffered continued reſpect take samſon manner young men make feaſt philiſtims proceed ſides met marriage meane verſ 12 samſon friend one part philiſtims holy ſtorie ſheweth philiſtims wit tooke thirtie yong men choice enough friend samſon ſtrangers could command ſuch number neither like philiſtims would haue liked ſo cannot meant samſons friend took thirtie men countenance honour philiſtims ſaw manhood ſtomacke neede beware gaue thirtie men pretending honour attend vpon indeed feare theſe philiſtims may obſerue two thing one policie care ouer thēſelues thought danger towards cauſe feare policie ſay feared would ſeeme ſo doe couered faire cloake namely appointing thirtie companion meant ſet foorth countenance light nature teach keepe themſelues danger harme neither meanes euill vſed purpoſe though muſt granted one whether much cleerely fully inlightned written word god may great perill ſeeme feare doe v doct 1 good may put v reproch vſe ſuch lawfull helpe wee haue hand repell ſame though let appeare euen paul hee great ieoberdie life phariſies sadduces like bee rent peeces betwixt hee bewraied hee feared vſed helpe god ſhewed policie ſaid loud voyce among phariſie act 23 6 whereat ſudden diuiſion aduerſaries one ſect againſt phariſies holding paul againſt sadduces onely let man haue ſaid iuſtifie ſhifting vnlawfull policie bringing himſelfe trouble among ſort ſhifters day moſt bold dangerous diueliſh treacherous crue ieſuites haue brought themſelues briar villanous doings ſeeke relieue themſelues lying equiuocations periurie flying comming anſwere thing bee noted theſe philiſtims wiſe care 2 keepe themſelues hurt samſon ſaw man feared ſhewed herein ſet thirtie men countrey would haue honoured much like herod pretended would honour chriſt ſought kill whereas matth 2 8 intended ſuch thing ſet watchman take heede hurt might wrought againſt light nature thus prouide owne ſafetie ſo wee ought wiſely warily preuent danger comming towards v bee wiſe ſerpents beware men well innocent like doues matth 10 16 haue great cauſe theſe day beware wee truſt commit ourſelues giuing credit sauiour hath left v good example behinde whereby wee may take heed farre commit ſeiues men ieruſalem paſſeouer ioh 2 24 many beleeued ſaid ſaw miracle hee ieſus commit himſelfe ſeeing knew teaching v circumſpect farre wee truſt note doe ſufficiently know many ſmart light credit namely heare faire word condition ready thereupon put themſelues hand whereas ſhould know faithfull god bee faithfull men papiſts looſe profeſſors hath many men vtter vndoing haue raſhly put eſtate good hand haue made faire ſhewes truſtines friendſhip toward haue ſuſtained like owne child hauing better opinion blind ſelfeloue cauſe truſting almoſt haue loſt owne folly ſame may ſay vnwiſe vndiſcreet lender ſuch haue vnaduiſedly brought themſelues danger ſuertiſhip till loade griefe haue ended miſerable day priſon penurie none either commonly deceiued pitied ſillie ſhiftleſſe damſels maides care whoſe hand put themſelues till complaine crie haue found truth faithfulnes hand promiſed great matter quietnes liuing eaſe haue ſhort time groſſely broke couenant moſt contentious vnquiet liuing left charge ſhift themſelues woful perſons england full muſt ſay truth moſt place faithful people found let v make account ſuch reſt ſay sauiour let dead bury dead let match together ſeeing needes doe ſo vnfaithfull ſeeing ſubtile vizard age hardly diſcerne oft time betweene one meane betwixt truſtie deceiuer let v paul pray god deliuer v hauing doe ſuch 2 theſ 3 2 haue neither faith fidelitie ſo farre narrow obſeruation finde hollowneſſe falſehood ſuch pretend contrary others eaſily auoided let watchword caution time come gold gliſtereth faire word fit beguile euen good people whoſe innocencie make thinke themſelues breaſtplate righteouſneſſe ſerueth keepe offenſiue let vſe headpeece meane wiſedome preuention danger may defended hurt others know none leſſe deſerue wrong harmeleſſe yet none ſee daily vſually beguiled made pray ſpoiler want circumſpection seventie sixe sermon xiiii chapter booke ivdges verſ 13 samſon ſaid vnto put foorth riddle vnto certainly declare within ſeuen day feaſt finde giue thirtie ſheetes thirtie change garment 14 cannot declare ſhall ye giue thirtie ſheetes thirtie change raiment anſwered put foorth thy riddle wee may heare 15 ſaid vnto eater came meate ſtrong came ſweetnes could three day expound riddle 16 ſeuenth day come ſaid vnto samſons wife entice thine husband may declare v riddle leſt wee burne thee thy father houſe fire haue ye called v poſſeſſe v ſo 17 samſons wife wept ſaid surely thou hateſt loueſt thou haſt put foorth riddle vnto child people haſt told ſaid vnto behold haue told father mother ſhall tell thee 18 samſons wife wept ſeuen day feaſt laſted ſeuenth day come told becauſe ſhe importunate vpon ſo ſhe told riddle child people 19 men citie ſaid vnto ſeuenth day sunne went downe ſweeter hony ſtronger lion ſaid vnto yee plowed heiffer found riddle 20 ſpirit lord came vpon went downe askelon ſlew thirtie men ſpoiled change garment vnto expounded riddle wrath kindled went vp father houſe 21 samſons wife giuen companion vſed friend followeth third thing done verſ 13 14 marriage riddle samſon put foorth philiſtims met together courſe great wiſedome taken samſon bee well conſidered cauſe bee ſought samſon propounded riddle anſwere pleaſant whetting wit miniſtred occaſion mirth ſet inuenting ſearching meaning hard difficult ſo meane might bee kept manifolde offendings without ſuſpition philiſtims euill intended samſon hee ſeeing ſeuen day continue feaſt laſted ſo manner doe long time friend company conuerſant among idolater without much ſinne offending god hee could haue taken ſafer better courſe ſo ſet worke occupie head religious talke place haue fallen next way haue ſet altogether eares firſt yet propounding riddle held greatly within compaſſe lewd wicked talke ill behauiour could hardly haue borne samſon friend yet otherwiſe ſo abounded much diſorder ſuch falleth thoſe kind meeting yet one would thinke ſhould leſſe feare would haue bred moſt bitter contention among wiſedome hee ſhewed putting riddle hee ſhunned auoided practiſe wee may learne pent companie doct good thing haue intertainment euill many way feared company common bethinke ſelues beſt done v may bee let ſuch company turned altogether eſpecially better take libertie offend yet beare hardly bee reſiſted ſpoken againſt whereby griefe greater ſee meanes keep conſciences quiet peaceable muſt haue part ſin fall ſometimes may doe wee bee brought god prouidence ſuch company neceſſitie cannot preuent ſuch may bold ſpeake wealthier ſort much aboue v leſſe cauſe feare ſuch great danger fall yet euen muſt take heed wee iumpe neither fall iuſtifie conſent offenſiue talke behauiour religious communication bee borne brooked ſome thing indifferent yet impertinent vnprofitable would thought vpon v miniſtred v ſtay preuent worſe fit occaſion may taken thereof ye aske ſay example mentioning death among v namely ſuch note iudgements plague god either preſent lately fallen v burning ſtrange death namely vpon drunkard alſo execution malefactor ſuch like matter better borne talked thing meerly diuine yet occaſion ſpeaking onely ill communication may kept away auoided better alſo edification may eaſilier come place honeſt chriſtian man great griefe loſe bee cut ſweete word flow abundance heart ſeeing muſt bee borne oft pro 23 8 time worſe alſo hand ſuch wealth power companie ill minded cannot reſtraine neither may haue place liberty ſpeake god diſhonoured cauilling againſt truth railing vpon god people ſlandering innocent ſwearing filthie talke ſuch like beſt way depart company giue eare may turne neere v ſhew diſlike countenance need aske opinion leaſt ſhew diſſent yet meekneſſe peaceable manner caſe ſo wee may rebuke ſuch vnfruitfull workes darkneſſe god giuing v occaſion iuſtly let v carrie zeale boſomes ſword ruſtie ſcabberd vnſheath defence god truth religion leſt hold peace ſuch caſe ſtones ſtreete crie point hath elſewhere opened samſon appeareth tels would propound riddle ſo could tell ſhould haue thirtie change apparell peeces linnen whether ſheetes ſhirts c could tell within ſeuen dayes ſhould giue much kinde wager laying ſport loſſe one ſide gaine kinde dealing meane manner wagering gaine ſeeing direction god therein warrant ſpeciall practiſe cannot counted vnto ſin neither ought ſtumble might take occaſion ſpeake largely like action exerciſes among mē place vſed samſon ſhould long ſay moſt handle matter doe grieuouſly ſinne againſt god men play wager either couetous deſire winne angry paſſionate playing wagering ſweare blaſpheme name god play fall quarelling goe together eares amidſt paſtimes wagerlaying immoderate playing ſpending whole night dayes therein neglecting meane time neceſſary duty vocation moſt neceſſary duty others ſeruice almighty god ſort ala many ſpend moſt time bowling allyes trucksbettings ſwearing vpon euery caſt prophane men make ſo little account time paſſe away ſo idly let take heed driuen many haue time deſire one houre repent yet goe without laſt thus
