play wager away maintenance ſuch kind gameſters haue money competentlie maintaine familie much leſſe reliefe others though paul biddeth ſtole ſteale labour hand may haue wherewith helpe poore two end chiefely ſerueth yet haue enough play away let reſt companion take heed among many puniſhments god draw vpon themſelues alſo one leaſt becauſe loue paſtime become poore men may wel thinke god denie clothe body ſuch prou 21 17 apparrell rag liuerie much leſſe hee clothe ſoules grace perſons glory hereafter except repent commandement eaſily found ſuch haue heard samſons wagering philiſtims former doct verſ 14 verſe part followes latter end gaue allowance thereto ſhewed liking thereof ſaying vnto put forth thy riddle may heare ſheweth readily wicked men turne heare euen godly otherwiſe diſlike ſcorne ſpeake pleaſing thing euen ieroboam king iſrael greatly like eliſha ſpake kindlie hee pleaſed wel bringing army king syria enemie 2 king 6 21 priſoners chiefe citie samaria hoping thereby hee might haue putting ſword oh fit humour word deed change themſelues ſudden toward applaud friend euen ſo conſtruing thoſe action pleaſe ſuch meane whereby receiue benefit fauour aduantage theſe ſhall aduanced aboue skyes let therewith ioyne admonition good counſell ſo much mildeſt repoofe eſpecially take themſelues croſſed purpoſes profit pleaſure although neuer ſo iuſtly worſt goe vpon earth goodneſſe remembred yea ſay may extended beſt miniſters ſo long plauſiblenes gift doth hold bad admiration affection ſhew greateſt ſignes taking pleaſure delight company let miniſter leaue tickling corrupt fleſh begin ſearch little bewray corruption hidden oh hee bitter irkeſome taſte becomes enemie telling gal 4 16 truth yea former deſert vaniſhed commendation doe teſtifie clearely allow thoſe godlie either miniſters goodneſſe ought chiefely regarded cauſes muſt teach beſt ſort obſerue themſelues beſt circumſpection far goe humoring wicked wit ſo far keepe bound ſpeake may turning euill drawing liking beſt thing degree alwaies preſeruing entire liberty reprouing without iuſt cauſe bluſhing admit ſuch kind dealing like onely flattered let know ſtomacks diſtempered dangerous caſe take liking thing fleſhly ſenſuall euen ſerue turnes flattering thus firſt two thing done feaſt haue verſ 15 heard part third wit samſon told would put foorth riddle readily apprehended willing heare therefore former part verſe ſaid propounded third thing done marriage eater came meate ſtrong came ſweetneſſe meaning hony ſweet meate eate came body lyon ſtrong open vtter ſeeing ignorant comparing 19 verſe would elſe vnderſtand latter part verſe ſhewed philiſtims heard riddle toyled themſelues went owne labour wit finde meaning could owne helpe fourth thing done marriage namely ſought find preuailed due place firſt returne little samſon ſhew made vſe doct verſ 15 work god conſidered obſerued great benefit gathereth riddle raiſed thereby queſtion worke god lyon meane hold much euill among behoueth v marke thing come paſſe daily fall god prouidence dealing wee may learne wiſedome thereby take good preacher gather ſimilies thing ſee reade heare illuſtrate vtter sermon people ſo ſhould god iudgements vpon wicked bleſſings feare ſay ſhould learne profit ſhun one get part ſo may ſay haue made right vſe deed whereas moſt part take good either great work meaning generall adminiſtration god onely gouerning creature hath admirably made ought noted ſpecially end iuſt vniuſt one alwaies peace cannot death giue teſtimonie good eſtate depart hope encourage companion like dieth either wounding yet deſperate conſcience ſtricken like nabal dead palſie inſenſibleneſſe proceede act samſon latter part verſe doct 2 ver 15 ſee occaſion riddle much euill ſtaied companie time would haue otherwiſe lewdly ill beſtowed philiſtims buſilie taken vp ſtudying ſearching meaning riddle ſo ſaid text could three dayes expound hereby may learne much ſinne may ſtaied meeting friend neighbour feaſts merrie making bee perſons intend endeuour preuent ſtop done good religious talke brought admitted thing indifferent yet tending good end haue ſayd occupying poſſeſſing may put bad haue oft ſeene done time namely much euill haue hindred put ſome company better minded reſt hath thus preuented carefully wiſely chriſtian ſauoury communication alſo kind vſage ſuch like good meanes inlarge vrge matter little theſe philiſtims leaſt hurtfull moſt buſie ſeeking meaning riddle ſo may truly ſay moſt bad ſort greateſt good doe either church commonwealth leaſt ſeweſt euils commit labour tyed work calling euen theefe faſt euill hand tyed behind though euill perſons ill minded euen worke ill occupied haue opportunitie ſeeing framed thereto yet nothing ſo much oyle put flame elbow roome much lincked company ſuch like themſelues far ought may ſeeing euery part chriſtian man life ſhould bring forth fruit ought great humbling ſuch god ſhall open eye vntill time dreame danger whereas commanded doe goe honour lord yet ſhall manifold witneſſes brought againſt conuinced contrary whether faſt feaſt labour idle whether alone company whatſoeuer doe yea euen worſhip god congregation heart luſting ſome euill far goodnes therefore happy thoſe ſeruants lord commeth may found occupying talent ſo may able ſay haue neither idle vnprofitable knowledge lord ieſus willingly good aduiſednes ſince taken ſeruice haue ſhewed themſelues faithful diligent alway except infirmitie yet euen alſo occupied namely reſiſting ſame thus ſee three dayes beat brain finding verſ 16 meaning riddle read ſo three dayes till ſeuenth came probable deuiſed among themſelues need ſhould would vſe samſons wife matter help come meaning becauſe ſaid verſe came vrged ſore get ſeauenth day hope otherwiſe altogether paſt although like ſore vrged doe ſo ſay threatned would otherwiſe burne father houſe made great matter ſhould loſe thereby could ſhew meaning vndone aſcribed bringing thither ſhe learne meaning riddle tell hereby ſeeking get ſhifts guile could doct finde coniecturall wit deliberation wee may ſee like theſe philiſtims moſt part people keepe compaſſe matter deale behauiour though well ordered perſons ſay many time haue great prouocation temptation breake doe like ſtormes tempeſts ariſe ſtirre diſquiet loe appeare colour make themſelues knowne little gouernment haue themſelues saul dauid purſued ſhewed plainly hee ſuch aduantage againſt hee could haue killed ſpake mildly kindly 1 sam 24 18 thought put head dauid ſought life moſt ſpitefully exaſperated incenſed againſt another kinde ananias saphira wife kept poſſeſſions hand complaint made againſt neither accuſed haue liued offenſiuely church need praiſe men would doe according act 5 2 c apoſtles perſwaſion ſay relicue poore ſo proceeded ſell ſome part land began diſtruſt ſhould haue enough couetous minde kept away part price ſold yet would make ſhew giue ſwearing falſely thereunto many among v liue peaceably innocently vnoffenſiuely honeſt neighbour well liking religion time yet trial yet theſe great particularly matter money money worth bewray commended none theſe ſhewes goodneſſe lay foorth themſelues contrary colour much like satan ſpake iob though amiſſe another caſe touch iob 2 5 curſe thee thy face may almoſt binde true man laid touchſtone gaine eſpecially man knoweth doth doe approue himſelfe conſcionable honeſt note man indeed philiſtims fall ſhifts vnlawfull meanes crueltie many euill way firſt ſo like manner ſee among ourſelues ſome ſhew themſelues faire chapman may like bargaine well boaſt take good gaine tenne pound c againe alſo agree vpon couenants ſeale writing take witneſſes appoint day payment deliuerie ſhould ſay yet let ware merchandiſe meane ſeaſon waxe cheaper ſuppoſed begin franke buyer ſhrinke palter ſhift diſhoneſtly himſelfe ſo doth ſeller commonly price riſe thing whereas bought ſold hand pretending reſolued vpon whatſoeuer euent reſt ſatisfied loſſe depend vpon god reſtitution ſhrinke backe pſal 15 4 gaine yet confeſſe equall iuſt yeeld forgoe without grudging ſeeing god hath caſt vpon partie ſame humour bewraied ſuch ſellers comming ſhort note price would haue yet compelled deliuer commoditie change impaire qualitie goodneſſe cut ſhort meaſure vſe men gripingly make themſelues amends ſhewing plainly regard thing contract ſaue onely make pray brother ſerue turne without conſcience ciuill reſpect commonwealth alſo men cannot enioy commodity thriue would decay feare note ſhall thing grow deare hundred like occaſions time good carriage behauiour haue fallen bad practiſes offenſiue courſes liue bee maintained thereby diſguiſe themſelues neuer well reported honeſt behauiour yea taketh hold many better ſort euen chriſtians bee hardly laid trial prouocations readily yeeld thing euill vnbeſeeming ſee ſo amend reforme ſuch diſhoneſtie appeares men ſecret falſehood though god onely ſee ſufficiently bewray god hath pleaſure break liues offenſiuely ſuch wicked ſort whē ſtrongly laid prouoked doe ſo doe worſe theſe philiſtims ſore prouoked neerely driuen haue heard time drawing neere muſt giue meaning riddle elſe ſuffer inconuenience fell ſubtiltie violence yet euen therin ſee diſguiſed themſelues groſſely heere ſhall bee amiſſe marke wrangling diſhoneſt 2 contendings theſe philiſtims ſaw muſt loſe commeth playing money wagering euen age wh • vſers ſame mould nature theſe philiſtims ſame may ſeene among many euils ſet downe theſe mentioned place haue practiſed moſt part companion play wagering ſay diſcontentment quarrelling contention denying breaking couenants ſeeking doe force threatnings theſe aſhamed require samſon ſhould tell wife meaning riddle ſhe might declare much goe couenant ſo diſhoneſtie deny theſe miſchieuous fruites futable cauſes ſaid ſomewhat meane ſeaſon marke aggrauating fact ſmall matter could haue loſt thereby doe ſo much ſpeake though would cauſe maruciling vncircumciſed irreligious people ſhould contend ſo ſmall matter like throughout life end may fitly take occaſion hereby iuſtly charge number day great grieuous finne commit fall one another leſſe matter change ſuite apparell yet profeſſe bee guided knowledge thing doe leſſe marueile ſo breake playing winne one anothers good doe much lawfull bargaines quarrell ſtriue ſay worſe groate ſhilling valew ſaid former point generall ſort oh miſchiefe many doe yea vpon ſmall occaſion trifle theſe ready burne downe houſe houſe rather would loſe valew ſuite apparell much ſpent men rage heate law twelue penny matter though ſo much thing ſatisfying ſpitefull ſtomacke man yea vndoings withall one another ſeen one age another leſt come ſhould ſeeme learne wiſedome went wofull long experience doe lamentably teach beholde great fire ſmall ſparkle kindleth falles vpon matter fit iam 3 5 ſaid amplification former point whole time seventie seven sermon xiiii chapter booke ivdges earneſtly philiſtims vrged samſons wife get verſ 17 18 19 meaning riddle wee heard former sermon holy ſtorie ſetteth downe followed threatnings samſons wife ſhe might get meaning riddle hand firſt ſhe ſued moſt earneſt maner know ſumme required hee loued hee would declare meaning vnto anſwered ſound reaſon gaue deniall ſhe ſatisfied therewith deſiſted importunate weeping reſt ſeuen day firſt three paſt ſo word vnderſtood 18 verſe ſhe wept ſeuen day feaſt laſted ſay hee told meaning riddle ſeuenth day ſhe declared samſon ſo controuerſie ended firſt let v marke woman dealing thou loueſt verſe 17 ſaith ſhe hateſt hard indeed firſt entring marriage though thing falles often marriage many vnaduiſed couple word true neither therefore ſo beleeued ſhe vttered wit hee loued yet ſo wee ſee guiltie foule great crime whereby proceede let v note iudgement heatheniſh woman ſhould bee hatred neere vnfained loue betwixt couple marriage much among chriſtians ſhould verified neuer man hated owne fleſh c abſurditie ſay admitted abhorred cauſeth ſay wearineſſe one another falling among thoſe much great ſhame yea ſo diminiſhing loue alſo maketh ready way hatred ſeeing loue ought ſtrong cant 8 7 fire cannot quenched many water prouide ill make marriage yet void grace feare god onely ground louely delightfull quality whereas beſt thing beſide theſe flitting momentanie ſo loue yt grounded true chriſtian loue conſtant bringeth foorth much fruite point ſuch importance apoſtle includes husband dutie therein hee loue wife ſhould ſay good thing wanting hee head relation vnion muſt flow deſcend wife comfort welfare muſt know thorough loue communicate himſelfe wife free bountifull plentifull affection dutie whereupon followeth ſhe againe reuerend ſubmiſſe yet cheerefull manner fitted framed yea ſo weightie point loue ſpeake frothie hot fooliſh loue vanitie vanity except heart man bee knit woman lord one onely religious well qualified alſo onely perſon delight liue within ſpeciall kinde fellowſhip except ſay generall chuſing good woman ſerue turne neither ſhall ſeuerall mutuall office concerne party euer currantly conſtantly performed much leſſe whole life eſtate marriage bleſſed comfortable weeping ſhe iuſt cauſe wee may note doct 2 ſubtiltie bad woman complaine bitterly husband gaue occaſion though hee told hee ought doe muſt therefore hate although philiſtims threatned proue hated ſay therfore leaue ſelfe ſuch ſhe let iuſt cauſe vnkindneſſe offered chriſtian husband let well teſtified doth ſo ſhe many woman doe diſſemble charge husband vniuſtly knowes ſhe doth ſo onely bring bent bow make owne cauſe ſeeme tolerable good ſo ſeeke ſhe draw inconuenience ſay ſhe doe thus let make chriſtians wiſe warie ſuch fetch teach meane giuing due belongs take heed ouercome way ſuch caſe example ſpitefull woman call husband loue queſtion becauſe hee reuenge falſely ſuppoſed wrong another hath offered ſhe impotent humour pretendeth proud woman thus vpbraid husband ſatisfying demaunds touching coſtly attire allowance money eſtate admit alſo iealous woman iuſtifie baſe vncomely conceit behauiours husband ſhall make caſe good alleaging cheerefull woman company though ſobrietie warineſſe theſe caſes let husband ſee innocent beware proſtitute imbondage himſelfe ſuch wiues paſſions leſt yeelding little loſe libertie yet let done kindly peaceably anger bitternes ſhe chargeth loued becauſe doct 3 tolde ſecret equitie concerned know reaſon ſhee ſo doe ſhee drew reaſon wrong ground woman muſt know husband minde al thing elſe thinke loue error alone would haue ſaid behold fondnes follie poſſeſſeth many woman confeſſe thing common concerne either pertaining ſoule bodie preſent life free readie communicating ſuch thing betwixt woman hath right therein well man ſeeing many thing fecreſie beſides lie waightily vpon huſband doe nothing concerne wife yea dangerous bee tolde foorth many woman weake conceale husband wiſedome may impart vnto yet ſhall iuſtly charged want loue next chapter god willing ſaue one samſon withſtood wife firſt good reaſon namely told father mother yet loued dearely 4 long ſhe new marryed neither proofe faithfulnes wiſedome ſilence otherwiſe reaſon good ſeeing man may impart ſome thing wife rather denying requeſt well ſhould reaſonable anſwers withſtand vnreaſonable ſutes ſhall ſhew ourſelues well fortified word ſound reſolution good conſcience giue ſufficient reaſon refuſall otherwiſe like drawne ſinne although greatly ſollicited importunitie others ſelues vngrounded vnarmed againſt ſubtiltie looſe diſpoſition owne heart though thinke neuer ſo well owne ſtrength muſt granted greateſt danger beſide owne readineſſe proneſſe euill haue prouocations alſo thoſe ſtrong inward temptation outward occaſions auoyding reſiſting ioſeph hath giuen v example worthie following neither ſnared inticed inwardly ſaw might eaſily haue ſuch deſire ſatisfied neither allured word flattery ſo much hearken whoriſh miſtreſſe haue ſpoken men ſo word adde woman wiſe would learne ſhake bold ſhameleſſe ſutes ſuch ſhould dare demaund diſhoneſtie reproch vndoing namely proſtitute chaſtity pleaſures hauing ſpoyled doe leaue ſo fruit dalliance afterward ſaid ſhe would anſwered ſo importunate reſt ſeauen dayes feaſt firſt verſe 18 three could finde meaning riddle ſo ſhe woon obtained hand laſt ſhe ſought ſo ſhee told people countrey men philiſtims theſe three thing may ſeene verſe diſtinctly importunate vrging impotencie ouercome telling expoſition riddle philiſtims people miniſter ſeuerall inſtructions v firſt importunate vrging reaſon would anſwer wee may ſee vnreaſonable ſhameleſſe bold yea vnwearyed wicked perſons following bad ſuites ſo neuer giue ouer thinke ſhall preuaile one meanes leaſt importunity wee cannot doe like come neere either ſeeking goodnes men ſuing god ſmall denyall weake withſtanding v men make v ſoone weary honeſt attempt ſo may faint like manner giue ouer making requeſts god yea great matter preuaile vnlike woman canaan would take repulſe diſcouraged hardeſt anſwer giuen sauiour hath taught v luk 18 8 importunate could faile goe without • ke requeſts made according one ſpeciall point wiſedome wherein child light learne child world paſſe ſecond thing three ſee doct 2 following thus continuall vrging yeelded ſuite told meaning riddle withſtood firſt afterwards ouercome teacheth haue ouercome temptation firſt aſſaulting v one would thinke hardeſt doe reſpect time following yet may poſſibly ouercome afterwards giuen ouer example whether ſuch vnlawfull demaunds incontinencie filthy gaine ſeeking ſuch like reaſon becauſe fickle flexible doe ſtrengthen ſelues conſtant one time good thing neither oft inſtant god feruent praying watching neither couenanting againſt ſin looking carefully keeping neither diſgrace ſin meanes whereof satan taketh aduantage againſt v one time euen ſo ſame samſon ſpoken afterwards like withſtanding inticements ſubtile woman firſt full purpoſe time doe ſo ſtill yet yeelded long perſwaſion vnto vniuſt vnreaſonable requeſt laſt marueile ſee thus ſome particular ſinne temptation one brought yeeld laſt reſiſted firſt ſee ſo generall liking imbracing whole doctrine goſpell ſome receiued ioy time yet fall away loue afterward neuer imbraced therefore much haue reſiſted ſinne time may poſſibly afterward fall notwithſtanding ought make beſt v conſtant watching againſt euill well firſt remembring sauiour charge peremptory indefinite reaching time watch neuer haue ſound proofe forgiuenes death ſinne wrought power word marueile inconſtancie bee ſeene pleaſe themſelues ouermuch good action ſoone diſcouraged either within without themſelues leaſt occaſion beſt people muſt plie god prayer hold build vp daily vpon good foundation ruſh grow without mire man watchfull perſiſt good courſe hath ſeemed like hating ſinne hee ſeemed haue diſliked nothing ſet forward matter ſuch difficultie fleſh blood cannot inherit kingdome god neither satan diuided himſelf reioyce men ſhewes therefore get aſſurance god fauour patch vp euill heart fewe colour goodneſſe ioyned ſubſtance alſo weaknes follie samſons paſſe third point 3 teacheth another thing haue ouercome hard difficultie greater temptation yet may afterwards ouercome ſmall one concealed opening riddle father mother farre greater reaſon tell hauing ſo long proofe pietie loue faithfulneſſe rather ſtranger hee knew bee void moſt like hee tolde leſt ſhould ſome occaſion haue opened philiſtims wife vnto follie bewraying wife like ſin man god came reproue ieroboams idolatrie bethel hauing charge giuen god ſhould goe houſe wicked place 1 king 13 8 9 eate refreſh himſelfe well carefully obſerue place hardeſt doe king houſe yet behold hee ouercome went charge fooliſh credulitie might much eaſily haue kept fellow hee inuited home king withſtood fearing diſpleaſure afterwards moued old prophet bethel goe houſe eate went contrary commandement lord therefore departure ſlaine lion high way reaſon hereof many offend way ouercome ſmaller ſinne haue ouercome greater men afraid committing diſtruſting themſelues ſeeke feruently god helpe obtaine note ſmaller ſinne doe ſo much ſuſpect feare ſelues ſo vnarmed ill prouided doe eaſilier fall thus commeth paſſe haue ſlaine lion beare foiles v hauing deuoured camell gnat choke v wee auoid harder inconuenience yet bewray ſhew weakeneſſe ſmaller wee might eaſily haue ouercome ſo fareth v repenting great treſpaſſe eaſilier brought relent ſeeing wee know wee hardned committing yet leſſe offence wee ſhall hardlier bewaile confeſſe ſeeing heart committing doth ſee ſo much euill therefore well god ſeruants liue former experience renue care pleaſing god feare contrary ſhall bee ſo farre diſtemper ſhall able ſame prophet another time beleeue hee deliuered lion beare dangerous ſuffer philiſtim preuaile come third point whereas ſaid samſon 4 opened wife ſhe tell countrey men philiſtims appeareth weeping husband diſſimulation falſehood treacherie vnfaithfulnes euen packe miſchiefe ſhe bewray lie hidden heart vnder faire ſhew kindneſſe loue teach v ſhould giue credit outward ſhewes goodneſſe ſimplicitie ſo reſt ſufficient proofes thereof haue better teſtimonie ierem 17 9 ſeeme ſuch heart man deepe gulfe full abomination ſuch ſubtile waite opportunitie get obtaine ſeeke yet iudge none time till god ſhall lay open waite trie many pray god onely • iames ſaith beſtow amiſſe aske euen vpon iam 43 luſts ſo doe many pretend faire men ſuch thing diſſimulation hypocriſie got knowledge riddle woman verſe 19 bring forth samſon sunne went downe ſeuenth day moſt groſſe part played ſeeke way ahab act killing naboth elia met ſaid haſt thou killed taken poſſeſſion may giue warning v haue doe ſuch muſt need ſo common falſe hood violence vnconſcion ablenes crept euen among men better profeſſion ſo deale ſuch cannot tell haue made couenants bargaines ſure enough onely flie word alſo witneſſe writing leaſt note hole found make men faithfull themſelues wiſe taking heed others beſides note vnweariednes theſe men begun 2 neuer gaue ouer labouring perſwading woman flatterie threat ſweating till ſought yet little hope comming meanes wife aduerſarie samſon wager laid ſhe faithfull might well haue fetched water well bethelem going hoaſt armed men ſhould haue got oh toyle lewd fellowes take pleaſure profit bring wicked purpoſes paſſe haue ſucceſſe one time yet take diſcouragement ſet vpon another take ſuch paine traſh man would thinke ſhould take ſome note grace oh profeſſe loue goodneſſe could brought doe halfe ſo much bring good thing paſſe ſeeke happineſſe euer doe hunting pleaſures ſinne filthie gaine moment haue ſaid ſomwhat woman importunitie though indeed ſhe woed theſe theſe firſt ſwaied motion ſhe two like preuaile draw bee partie therefore ſtrange confidence preſumption attempting goe thus betweene barke tree obtaining purpoſes ſo deſperate meanes leſſe ſetting husband wife together eares ſuch aduenture ſet vpon miſchiefe right embleme curſed brood ieſuites negotiator whore babylon whoſe furie attempt ſedition impoſſible vnto v ſhut vp matter ſeeking meaning riddle 3 let v heare samſons anſwere brought meaning manner ſweeter hony ſtronger lion ſaid effect againe vnfaithfull vntruſtie woman hee anſwered little leſſe hee vttered theſe word yee ploughed heifer ye found riddle much accuſed falſehood vniuſt dealing vnfaithfulnes husband learne one property wicked woman ſhe true truſtie ſtrangers owne husband yet ſpeake truth ſhe neither conſtant ſure either third come note way betwixt ſhe deale ſo friend namely husband thinke would ſuch one doe enemie ſhee would doe without iuſt cauſe ſhe ſhould prouoked whereby let admoniſhed oh faithfulnes precious much deſired art thou samſons wife philiſtims thus much samſon himſelfe ſay next sermon seventie eight sermon xiiii chapter booke ivdges end chapter samſon ſhew verſe 20 done feaſt ended fourth laſt branch ſecond part chapter haue heard ill hee dealt philiſtims yet ſtorie relateth performe challenged due yet deed iuſtly depriued themſelues bad dealing samſon would haue ſtood lord ſtrengthened ſo paid apparell owne countrimen hauing ſlaine thirtie men anſwered demaund wagered greatly offended wife went away father houſe telling whither hee went meane ſhe giuen away father one companion theſe thing fell marriage feaſt ſaid heere ſpirit lord came vpon samſon againe may know guided thereby hee went ſlew thirtie philiſtims aſcalon thereby ſtrengthened alſo doe example bee followed v confeſſe muſt thing vocation god haue commanded generally word apparell theſe thirtie men philiſtims hee ſlew hee 2 gaue told meaning riddle although fell hand ſubtiltie yet doth ſhift ſerue according dealing ſatisfie though mention made linnen hee gaue garment yet muſt vnderſtand thus hee gaue though chiefe onely named manner ſpirit god expreſſe whole oftentimes part beſides wee know would otherwiſe haue contented ſatisfied know doth become v chriſtians yeeld ill meaſure offer v ſee neither samſon ouercome euill good muſt granted hardly yeelded fleſh affordeth much ill counſell againſt debtor fulfill deſires rom 8 practiſe innocencie many prouocations contrarie nay although wee ſhould pretend wee vſe aduantage againſt hath wronged v end may play ſtopgame ſay ſaue ſelues harmeleſſe although doe depriue ſimply owne euen ſay permitted v except aduantage ſuch wee may lawfully take would haue taken againſt equitie whether giuen v occaſion reuenge example hee haue wronged v bargaine ouerſight may prouide ſelues ſome ouerſight ſtands couenant deny v due may lawfully ſeek owne meanes come haue vſed ſo haue reſpect reuenge ſtreight rule practiſe euen among know profeſſe ſhould ſo let others goe thinke condition vnequall may deceiue deceiuer preuent ſubtiltie like play cretians cretian diſſemble cogge lye make conſcience chriſtianitie might meddle buſineſſe yet apparant relike old man luſt fleſh ſhould purged paul may beleeued oh occaſion doth common ſort take recompence euill euill ſhew themſelues kinde colour hit home haue ſtood light neuer ſo little loue talke glorie haue done ſay word though expreſſed agreement betwixt samſon philiſtims meaning riddle ſhould declared owne finding falſehood indirect meanes yet doubteth meant ſo like manner departing innocencie bargaines contract going ſhifting againſt honeſt iuſt vnder pretence euery particular cannot mentioned ſet downe great fault among men proues deale ſo bee farre vprightnes thoſe yeeld due rather ſtriue endleſly odde people paſſe come another point namely samſons 3 wrath kindled againſt wife telling riddle philiſtims therefore going away without father houſe leaſt telling act bee iuſtified hee ought ſuch moodie manner haue departed wife leaue wondering ſo ſudden going giuing cauſe feare returne home renuing diſpleaſure toward againe ſhould ſay haue left young woman new married doubt feares might befall ſhould haue told fault vnto ſhee fit heare betwixt two ſo kinde reproofe counſelling better gouerned haue ended controuerſie either haue taken leaſt haue gone away frow ſullenly diſpleaſure ſheweth fault ſullennes bee angrie bodie yet wee bee knowne ſuch thing neither ſhew cauſe peaceably plainly grieued ſo might make end matter ſatisfied may anſwere giuen v leaſt beare patiently little little ſo cut anger either goe companie diſcontented vnquiet ſaying nothing broyling ſtomackes great griefe offence partie againſt anger kindled conceiued thus doe ſay thing vtterly vnbeſeeming chriſtian queſtion bee made two worſt either open ſecret anger ſay bewraying letting appeare ſo impotent cannot bridle ſuppreſſe euils farre tolerable ſmoothering keeping though vile odious houſe ſet fire farre dangerous threatneth greater miſchiefe ſpeedie conſuming houſe flame pent hath vent breake foorth euen ſo anger hidden concealed farre worſe ſheweth ſelfe may ſeene abſoloms hidden wrath breaking murther except bee high degree inflamed bewraieth much follie ſoone vaniſh come end whereas imagineth euill bringeth foorth hee thinketh ſeeth beſt yet grant degree ſullennes vnbeſeeming chriſtian loweſt degree yea though goe away time ſtrength ouer without hurt remedie weigh follie ſhame ſuch diſguiſing ſelues alſo conſider wee bee take matter ſo hotly done againſt v haue prouoked god many time haue haires head much greater cauſe giue god diſpleaſed v ſhould conſider whether could like lord ſhould ſo hide diſpleaſure againſt v execute vpon v would neither aware thus ſuch like meanes ſhould goe reſiſt aſſwage bee hardly done firſt yet afterwards done eaſily wee labour ſo time chace away altogether ſome reliques remaine v ſome ſore ague cauſes confeſſe ſeparation betweene married perſons euery man muſt owne iudge either ciuill magiſtrate elſe thoſe appointed god church bee iudges theſe ſuch like caſes muſt determine manner ſociety like among men husband vpon euery tetch might ſhorter longer time leaue fellowſhip wife ſure practiſe one meanes beſides many much vncleanenes confuſion blood poſteritie beggery party family ſo forſaken riot diſorder god knoweth ſacred ordinance god religious band ſecuring pledge peace vnion order leapt ouer troden downe limit within bound miſchiefe like enſue therefore let none ſuch guiltie kinde plead samſons example little libertie giuen herein whereas ſome obiect samſon herein gaue place wrath rather withdrew himſelfe abode leſt hee might poſſibly haue broken anſwere samſon dealing outragiouſly word deed commended howbeit going away paſſion thereby excuſed ſeeing amend matter made worſe although partie offended may ſometimes auoid ionathan alleniate ſuch diſpleaſed companie yet followeth partie offended married couple may depart offender goe away adoe thereby nouriſheth humour prouoketh rather thē ſlaketh either goe forward ſo draw end may ſee men verſ 21 get ſuch dealing ſullen take diſpleaſure bewray againſt conceiue impatient cannot beare ſee samſons wife father enduring manner departure diſlike diſcontentment marueile breake loue turne ſhew another good got inconſiderate dealing marke wee ſhall finde ſuch raſh follie vnaduiſed dealing samſons commonly recompenſed ſome ſuch vnwelcome croſſe trouble owne fault cauſe prouoke ſo would buy labour coſt late little wiſedome patience might altogether haue remoued kept away may appeare fact abſolom ſecretly incenſed againſt ammon abuſing ſiſter whereas ought haue accuſed father committed righting cauſe vnder god without nouriſhing reuengefull humour brought hee paſſe thereby enſued ammons murther dauids ſorrow breach familie abſolom himſelfe vnpleaſing exile father court preſence farre different dauids behauiour prouoked shemei leaues man look himſelfe may haue deſerued ſaith god ſhould ſuffer curſe let alone moſt worthie preſident therefore let angry ſullen perſon come foorth ſhew hath gained folly ſaue name foole brand reproch recant call backe wee ſpeake wonder mad man caſting fire dart arrowes deadly thing haue ſome light vpon owne pate iuſt alſo god bee diſpleaſed ſuch reſiſt vniuſtly diſpleaſed others meditate reuenge many euen vpon ſudden vnaduiſed rage haue killed deareſt friend alexander reported haue done drunken fume ſober haue readie reuenge themſelues madnes others leaue print anger face body ſuch light vpon ſome kill forth right repent either haue ſmarted well purſe drawne forth puniſhment appointed ſuch furie outrage let teach v ſhake wilfulnes impatience heate paſſions ſtead little pleaſing ſelues folſie neglect wiſe kinde dealing ſhall repented end muſt vſe meditate corruption pride ſelfeloue anger looſenes tetchines frowardnes like many foule alſo ſelues wormes duſt aſhes therefore ſuch may croſſed laſt ſhould conſider thoſe wee wont bee offended men mortall therefore ſubiect humane infirmity marueile doe thing ſometime like doe croſſe v ſeeing doe v haue done oft wee ſicke ſame diſeaſe infected ſame originall contagion poyſon ſhould rather pitie bee angrie patience infinite ſet downe yet might ſaid good purpoſe anger remedy againſt time occaſion samſons ſullen mood departing wife fact samſons wife father ſo ſoone aleniated ſhe giuen another bee marueiled neither reaſon asked led thereby much leſſe better guide doings ſtrength fleſh whereby readie take ſlight colour pretence reaſon doings hath noted ſhall appeare next chap verſ 2 ſo muſt looke better meaſure hand wicked vnreaſonable men giue leaſt occaſions commonly carried outrage without occaſions teach v haue little doe wee may wee muſt need take wee heed make ſure ſides poſſibly may auoid euill perill fall afterwards wee bee danger haue aduantage againſt v ſubiect like wee muſt beare patiently committing ſucceſſe god well end chapter seventie nine sermon xv chapter booke ivdges verſ 1 within time wheate harueſt samſon viſited wife kid ſaying goe wife chamber father would ſuffer goe 2 father ſaid thought thou hadſt hated therefore gaue thy companion younger ſiſter fairer ſhe take pray thee ſtead 3 samſon ſaid vnto blameleſſe philiſtims therefore doe diſpleaſure proceed keeping order obſerue ſumme chapter reſt firſt begin ye ſumme thus much samſon wife denied vpon returne tooke occaſion ſet fire corne field philiſtims kill armed againſt whereupon came iudea fight men thereof vnleſſe would deliuer samſon hand bound therefore ſo band broken lord ſlew thouſand iaw bone aſſe thirſtie labour obtained water god prayer ſo refreſhed againe part foure firſt samſon tooke occaſion hurt part 4 bee reuenged vpon philiſtims verſe 9 ſecond philiſtims got bee deliuered bound hand owne countrimen midſt verſe 14 third ſtrengthened god ſo brake cord ſlew great many verſe 18 laſt thirſting labour obtaining water god refreſhed order text giues occaſion firſt part chapter concerning firſt part woe hee wrought occaſion ſumme firſt part wife denied returned take giuen another appeareth firſt two verſes hereby hee prouoked ſee third verſe ſo ſet vpon hurt commodity ſo prouoked ſhewed vnto 9 verſe firſt ſaid came wife againe brought verſe 1 kid make merrie ſhew thereby reconciled purpoſed liue againe hauing abſence conſidered fault going ſuch manner reſolued thought good cut occaſions griefe ſeparation renew recouer decayed loue againe condemne samſon choler would ſhame themſelues hee returning condemning departing haue bin ouertaken well • n could brought loue ſuch wilfull doings conſidering time baniſh god thought make man ſlaue rankeſt enemy ſee though good bad haue paſſions carrying ruling yet grace dwelleth ſhall found doct time ſhall done vanquiſhing ſtrength corruption thoſe want grace ſuffer man marke reſiſt sinne nouriſheth ſelfe eſpecially anger ſelfeloue ſmoothing ſelfe vp ionah conceit doe well angrie ſo samſon ionah 4 9 would perhaps haue anſwered hee demaunded departed leiſure recanteth returning condemnes departure ſaid much like ſonne ſent vineyard bid father doe worke himſelfe comming mat 11 29 himſelfe againe bidden went whereas lewde perſon hauing ſinned pleaſeth himſelfe doubleth eſau gen 28 9 taking ſtrange wiues hee relent ſhame terror onely iudas haue noted abimelech chapter 9 samſon cholencke mat • 7 3 pang went away reſolution likely neuer returning let goe ſhe deſerued cooler blood appeaſeth himſelfe muſitian eliſha demurring doings confeſſeth though wife deſerued ill meaſure yet became ſo great 2 king 3 15 heate ſought marry deale ſo deſpitefully againſt preſently vpon marrying particularly samſon vpon better conſideration returded wife againe ſo muſt granted ſhould long diſpleaſure conceiued betwixt couple cannot auoided ſome ſpecially much ſhould ſeparation betwixt man wife vnleſſe conſent loue alſo apoſtle willeth may giue themſelues prayer faſting ſo come together againe leſt 1 cor 7 5 diuell tempt euill ſay bee wiſhed fall worſe matter betwixt ought ceaſe betimes wee ſee samſon returned wife within hee went prayer married perſons ought broken diſſention day peter chargeth much leſſe ought bee ſeparation 1 pet 3 7 longer time therefore ſeeing many occaſions fall hereof betwixt couple marriage reaſon much conceitednes one againſt way wardnes inconſtancie loue falſe heartedneſſe ſuch like let ſuch abhor note would ſhunne like weariſomeneſſe companion neuer ceaſe till renounce diſclaime thoſe corruption pray oft earneſtly againſt ſame arme themſelues many renued couenants ſuch thing may bee betwixt ſhall better keepe order vnder ſhall ſee breach brawles betwixt yea ſhall fit ſet couple together variance ſhall ill doe abroad maintaine peace home occaſion ſaid married couple ſhould abſent obiect long time one obiected many neceſſitie following calling cannot chuſe long time one another many lawyer merchant sea men therefore charge giuen apoſtle corinth 1 cor 7 5 ſtand wit ſhould long abſence betwixt couple anſwere becauſe charge better kept therefore much euill committed anſw meane long abſence one many complaine ſmart meanes thereof yet redreſſe nay ſay plainely ſee ſay men ſuffer much ſorrow ſuſtaine great trouble owne fault ſeeing calling abſence muſt fall betwixt doe neither labour grace themſelues beare better neither ſeeke ſuch yokefellowes excell therein neither faithfully take order betweene themſelues carefully looke euery way auoide danger god contrarie himſelfe neither commandeth contrary long abſence one another yet ſhall follow ſuch calling neceſſitie require laſt muſt needes certainely may bee helped relieue themſelues firſt feare god otherwiſe promiſe haue god bleſſe thing ſpeaking ſuch matter ſay feare god good order taking betwixt themſelues oft earneſt praying part quiet chaſte mindes body vſing therewith good meanes ſame neede ſhall require ſhall attaine redreſſe againſt god hath promiſed ſuch conſent may abſent without many vnquietneſſes inconueniences yet doe moſt certainely meete ſuch ſo qualified fall adulterie like euils fruit ſinne god puniſheth meane irreligiouſneſſe vnfaithfulneſſe ſuch like fall bee able ſay many followeth verſe samſon would haue gone chamber wife dutie husband father philiſtim 2 would ſuffer giuen another oh wofull act eſpecially ſpoken neede wonder reaſon doe ſuch profeſſe yeelde doings dealing philiſtims wee may ſee ſore puniſhment haue doe ſuch vnconſcionable men boldly hold right v ſo deale v wee cannot make reckoning owne muſt come hand neither ſure owne owing due vnto v bondage another ſhould haue power authority ouer good nature ſelfe foundation propriety man good abhorring community cutthrote ciuill ſociety commonwealth labourer done work muſt looke receiue wage man hath lent ware money ſhould denied though hee liſteth ſhould claime detaine another body good point thing come many place heatheniſh vnconſcionableneſſe grown vp world note man cannot ſay thing hee hath owne ſo many way defeate owner due ſo men purſued open wrong may well ſay samſon cauſe complaine deale v philiſtims vſe account honeſt faithfull men much better dealing bee wary circumſpect alſo ready offer good meaſure thoſe haue doe point offereth ſelfe often samſon denied wife hee returned father houſe take enioy may ſee puniſhment men bring vpon themſelues owne ſinne leſſe pitied true finall diſappointment vngodly example fooliſh virgin ſheweth excluding themſelues place yet deſired let euery man therefore auoide occaſions troubling himſelfe well way otherwiſe giuing liberty corrupt affection luſts wherein samſon failing going wife fullen diſcontented manner rather wiſely ſaluing vp offence brought paſſe hee denied hee would gladly haue enioyed thus doth man ſin crop bloſſome ſhould ſeaſon yeeld fruit ſuch like fruites ſinnes neuer yet pleaſanteſt v good hurt among many commeth therby depriued beſt liberty would enioy becauſe wee ſinfull mood ſet light enough laſt verſe former chapter father excuſe curſed act giuing daughter another man tels samſon thought hated therfore ſaith gaue verſe 1 thy companion hee offered ſiſter fairer ſhe wee may learne firſt ſpeech wicked vnconſcionable men haue offered great wrong neighbour make light matter thought ſay might haue done great matter without offence taken thereat cauſe doe ſo thought would haue ſo hardly taken yea many bid goe ſeeke remedy get hiſtory church iulian reuolter ſolicited deale indifferently chriſtians vſed anſwere tuſh haue wrong done maſter command ſmitten one mat 5 39 cheeke turne cruell pharaoh vpbraid poore iſraelites groning vnder burthen ſaying yee idle want exod 5 17 worke babylonian ſo taunted poore iewes mourning vnder captiuity sing v ſome ſongs sion rehoboam alſo willed mitigate pſal 137 3 heauie hand father held ouer ſubiects anſwereth 1 king 12 14 tuſh yee good meaſure ſhewed yee father little finger ſhall heauier loines ſlightly bad men deale lord ſeruice thinke drawing neere body ſufficient ſeruice though heart farre yet himſelfe profeſſeth vaine doe ſuch worſhip math 15 9 saul thought might offer burnt offering peace offering 1 sam 13 9 13 lord though contrary commandement would need imagine bee well pleaſing ſo doe taking harſhly samuel preſſeth ſo diſobedience hee ſhould haue obeyed god haue followed owne fancie returne dealing men haue ſore hurt wronged make light matter ſay meant harme like man prouerbs fained himſelfe mad caſt firebrand arrowes ſaith ſport ſo deale deceitfully prou 26 19 wickedly friend neighbour ſay ſport meane harme leaſt iniurie bee offered heere philiſtim samſon going daughter make little matter great rather ſatisfied ſuch anſwere party thought would ſo hardly taken conclude salomon ſaith young men reioce thy youth c bee eccleſ 11 9 ſure god bring thee iudgement ſo may ſay theſe men health iollity laſteth none controll tread vnderlings vnder foot winde god himſelfe finger make ſlight matter ſinne ſay tricke youth ſmall matte many day make adam ſin eate apple matter nothing loe poſterity muſt die doe ye eſau tuſh great matter ſell birthright gen 25 32 let goe sooth vp ſelues ſay conceit thinkes god papiſts paint good old man ſits idle hee neither doe good euill wee may vſe deale wee liſt god ſhall take wild aſſe moneths light cared none purſuers meane ſhall viſit theſe men ier 1 • 4 ſet face vnconſcionablenes hard meaſure haue offered made nothing men made bee teniſballes obiects wrong ſcorne ſin ſhall ſeeme ſmall great hill mountaine vnto ſhall cry ſaying neuer felt weight ſinne till light committing puniſhment greater wee beare holy ghoſt threatens adulterer god ſhall iudge ſo let theſe heb 13 4 know ſeeing ſtout ſtately common men meddle god take hand iames ſaith bee aduocate innocent againſt oppreſſors bee added former point iam 5 4 end counſell others haue little doe ſuch 2 theſ 1 6 cormorant ſo marke cognizance like next point noteth may know auoide better thus much bee ſaid firſt ſpeech samſons father law next followeth offered wiues ſiſter wife hee 2 reſpected neere ſhe blood feared becauſe hee ſaw hee man great ſtomacke fret ſore againſt philiſtims therfore offered appeaſe wrath yet many heathen know ſuch marriage vnlawfull made lawes againſt thus thought put euen ſo wicked men bad dealing found ſome danger feare meanes therof marke recompence offer worſe offered none hee heere ſuch cannot take better moſt part againſt conſcience either promiſe faire goe pay debt ſatisfie wrong haue done ſhall bee done moſt vnwillingly men loſſes harmes act father law samſon tooke occaſion vex philiſtims verſ 3 lord enemy hee ſaw father law mocke ſo took condition offered ſaid haue receiued wrong philiſtims dealing ſhall ſeene better come queſtion ye haue giuen iuſt cauſe ſeek reuenge yet muſt know hee one appointed god thereto man eaſe ſtomacke vpon pleaſure may wiſe reuenge enemy heate heart howſoeuer wee hardly heare ſaying leaue vengeance god bridle vnruly affection may carrie v euill againſt men ouercome euill good although denie rom 12 21 commanded god purſue euill muſt goe readily samſon heere heere end theſe verſes verſ 4 samſon went caught three hundred fox tooke firebrand turned taile taile put firebrand middeſt betweene two tailes 5 hee ſet brand fire hee let goe ſtanding corne philiſtims burnt vp ſhockes alſo ſtanding corne vineyard oliues 6 philiſtims ſaid hath done anſwered samſon ſonne law timnite becauſe taken wife giuen companion philiſtims came vp burnt father fire 7 samſon ſaid vnto though ye haue done yet auenged ceaſe 8 ſmote hip thigh great ſlaughter hee went downe dwelt top rocke etam samſon hauing gotten occaſion ſet vpon philiſtims holy ſtory theſe fiue verſes ſheweth hee vſed ſay theſe two ſumme theſe verſes way firſt ſpoiling commodity vine oliue tree burning vp corne taking away liues many alſo firſt theſe two vexings ſet downe theſe two firſt verſes manner got three hundred fox abounded thoſe place tailes hee bound together put firebrand middeſt ſent corne philiſtims ripe burned vp heapes rickes corne gathered ſtanding alſo folly v aske hee plagued philiſtims way among verſe 4 5 ſufficient holy ghoſt hath ſet downe puniſhed ſore euen way may conceiue fire kndled many place ſpreading euery place kindled much hurt might ſoone bee done thereby appeared abſaloms dealing ioab ſetting corne field fire much 2 sam 14 30 theſe wild creature terrified fire running fro carrying field might doe greater miſchiefe thing doubtleſſe vnlikely haue come paſſe ſo vnlikely admoniſheth v onely commodity rich ſubiect loſſe ſundry way may conceiue euen way alſo cannot thinke would haue thought though windes wet drought might haue loſt fruites yet ſhould haue ſpoiled way reaſon ſo many caſualties change tranſitorie life liuely put mind hereby poſſeſſe therefore theſe earthly benefit wee ſo ſhall leſſe addicted man ſhew many vnlikely danger men good lie open beſide thoſe common ordinary haue heard late many men commodity brought ſo likelihood paſt danger haue great part deſtroyed vermine mouse rat therefore called vncertaine rich ſeeing man hath hold luk 12 20 1 tim 6 17 one man day another man morrow beſides ought ſet heart cannot keepe neither thereby giue occaſion ſelues diſquieted god meanes ſhall depriue v minde better thing thoſe ſeene mortall eye ſhall alſo witneſſes wee haue treaſure mat 6 20 laid vp v heauen wee walke diſcharge calling whereby god bleſſing encreaſe ſubſtance yet euen regard commandement enioyning v labour profit comfort ſelues good conſcience comming vſing god promiſe good ſucceſſe rather reckoning commodity enioy point haue ſaid elſewhere next thing theſe two verſes make profit 2 lord giueth v opportunity offereth v occaſion ſeruice ſhould wiſe ſee ready vſe may ſo teſtifie obedience god men ſo samſon lord would haue ſet vpon philiſtims ſo ſhould firſt prouoked leſt done without iuſt occaſion offered might haue purſued alone land made much adoe hurt heere till knew ſome brother philiſtims prouoked thereupon hee ſought reuenged verſ 6 looke gedeons ſtory samſon proceed againſt philiſtims purſue verſ 6 liues ſhewed verſe hot enquirie among ſo ſpoiled commodity learned samſon done reaſon rendred ſo becauſe timnite taken wife giuen another vnderſtood went burnt father fire conſidered done great wrong thought auenged himſelfe done verſe earneſt inquirie done ſo doct great diſpleaſure may ſee light nature euen lawfull v doe owne caſes help magiſtrate ſeeke finde ſuch haue done much euill commonwealth troubleſome yet herein muſt differ theſe heere eagerly purſue doer wrong themſelues diſorder ſo much wee inlightened word god ought hearken ſuch offender procure iuſt puniſhment may rather ſinne auenge ſelues thereby salomon dealt ioab ioyned himſelfe adonijah 1 king 2 34 againſt lord annointed hee commanded bee ſlaine blood ſhed cauſeleſſe might vpon owne head great ſin rather would incurre leaſt danger diſpleaſure hand bad perſons worthie cut ſore puniſhed doe ſuffer goe wickedneſſe rather withſtand bring foorth authoritie receiue due yea rather bee readie excuſe fault defend treſpaſſe committed againſt themſelues meaſure purſuing enemy fitter occaſion handle offered 21 chapter philiſtims vnderſtood samſon thus ſpoyled becauſe 2 timnite giuen wife companion went ſaid burnt daughter houſe ouer head ſo timnite hurt ſeeing could come samſon take reuenge therefore puniſhed occaſions samſons ſpoyling though wiſe conſenting knowing hee moſt vnreaſonable act fall vpon way guiltie hurt done lord indeed moſt iuſtly hereby reuenge villany offered samſon looked god onely ouerruled appetite one ſame act moſt iniurious ſelfe yet lord executed moſt righteous iuſtice againſt theſe malefactor arming one wicked perſon againſt another preparing way thereby reuenge theſe philiſtims themſelues ſhal appeare afterward may ſee madnes outrage men though theſe heathen therefore might bee thought haue none match groſſe wickednes among ſuch baptized yet behold deſtitute grace among v feare man reſtraineth ſome let looſe great ſinnes proofe whereof behold dealing thoſe furious iewes act 18 could come paul fell vpon soſthenes companion beate day act 18 17 papiſts cannot come heretike himſelfe terme vſe draw picture exactly great deſpite burne fire ſhewing would doe perſon vnlike practiſe ſeditious ſouldiers chopping ſmall herb pot oppoſe mutinie ſee commeth paſſe ſometimes vile men giuen ouer furie paſſion moode ſhall beare blowes commeth next way though hee fault whatſoeuer next knife dagger cudgel whatſoeuer elſe whether beate eye tooth breake arme legge one moodie euen ſhebeares robbed whelpes nay ſo little led ſound reaſon owne raſhnes haue hurt themſelues doore fall ſtumbling ſtone curſe one beate ſuſtaine damage loſſe neighbour ſatisfied till philiſtims haue blood leaſt till ſeeke though hurt done againſt thus doggiſhly purſued touching ſuch rage madnes haue ſaid ſomewhat heretofore diſcredit diſſwade men ſhewing hideous face therof curſed fruites iſſuing therefrom beholding lamech furie outrage hearing terrour word would abhorre gen 4 23 quality yet remaine among v men better diſpoſition though ſpeake ſo plainly lamech could rancour eate heart enemie garlicke ſaying yet nouriſh ſerpent boſomes ſtill fight againſt ſword spirit confeſſe themſelues bee beaſts yeelding ſo farre whereby whole chriſtianitie called queſtion another thing verſe omitted whereas samſons doct 3 wife threatned neighbour would burne except ſhe told meaning riddle ſhe wee haue heard auoid danger tell griefe great hurt huſband yet behold ſhe could auoide philiſtims burned telling riddle people ſhe ſaued burning samſon went father gaue another wife samſon ſpoyled philiſtims corne commodity cauſe burned father ſo riddle declaring whereof ſaued life ſame occaſion loſing euen ſo ſhee ſought vnlawfull meanes ſhifts ſhunne meane burning ſame vnlawfull ſhifts ſhe procured ſo ioſephs brother ſought gen 37 27 rid becauſe dreames ſuch honor ſhould haue aboue told wiſe could abide therefore ſold farre countrey euen thereby brought honour cleane contrary mindes liking cleere gen 39 1 20 compared 41 40 c ſtorie manifeſtly manifoldly proued experience among v whereas many ſeeing great trouble comming toward doe ſeeke euill practiſes lying ſwearing forſwearing ſuch like winde may bee commonlier ſeene ſay note thereby bring farre greater ſorer ſame trouble vpon themſelues ſeeke auoid worldly ſorrow come trouble much leſſe plunged farre greater euen torment conſciences deadly ſtings ſorrow ſinne long time bee plucked iewes ſought libertie putting chriſt death yet matth 8 11 thereby roſe roſe againe death cut heart deeplier imbondaged much ſpeake ſuch ſeared hot yron ſo much rather haue thereby brought blood vpon child vnto day ſtand rather vpon becauſe thought fooliſh part man beare diſcommodity patiently rather ſhift vnlawfull meanes counted point wiſdome fall rather hand bad men though yeeding ſinne commit caſe god confidence account made though bee againſt man conſcience many politikes cenſure daniel vpright dan 6 10 perſiſting ſeruice god decree made againſt prince ſay men ſhift euaſion deliuer himſelfe elude aduerſaries muſt wilfully fall ſnare oh foole learne example truth denunciation matth 16 25 iob 2 4 ſaue life giue skinne skinne conſcience ſaue ſhall loſe either diſappointed ſhifts god giuing fauour eye enemy count hypocrite ſhifting ſeeme gaine ſomewhat thereby one kinde yet ſhall neuer enioy penniworth comfort rather checking vpbraiding conſcience doe length wearines renounce caſt away iudas wage iniquitie hee loſeth matth 27 3 life truſteth god moſt precious liberty rather runne vpon pike haue ſhall finde heſter ſauing note ir good martyr changing eternall life ſhort enduring trouble good quiet ſpirit hope reward ſhall make tolerable oh men would learne meaſure gaine preſentnes cleerenes worthineſſe ſhould meanes auoid many ſinne ſhifts attend vpon beſides preuenting many afterreckonings ſorrow puniſhment euill conſcience make vnſufferable eſpecially ſame miſchiefe light vpon ſo deare price ſought auoid heathen could ſay vengeance would ſuffer guiltie act 2 4 eſcape though might ſhift preſent word god teacheth v cauſe becauſe god vengeance lord hoaſts hath hundred ſouldiers armed meete enemie though haue eſcaped one man hauing ſhunned beare ſhould meete amos 5 19 lion hath eſcaped former ſtill chace neuer reſt till deſtroyed hee better haue yeelded firſt ſtory al church verifie truth example abiuring hypocrite met worſe meaſure god took hand ſhunned hand men wiſedome man fooliſhnes 1 cor 1 20 god theſe two verſes way ſet downe whereby samſon verſ 7 8 hurt philiſtims body hee ſo lamed pained kicking feete beate life ſo wee vnderſtand thoſe word 8 verſe hippe thigh neceſſary ſupply added making ſenſe runne roundlier thus foote put foorth thigh ſtrong blow weapon fight againſt foote ſpurning ſluggiſh perſons able reſiſt beſt expoſition opinion leauing others iudgement theſe word ſmote hippe thigh mightie plague ſet downe troubling reader opinion extraordinarie ſtrength hee thus ſpurne doct tread downe euen death ſlauiſh daſtardlines philiſtims ſide much bee admired ſeemed ſtriue fight themſelues whit wee may ſee mightily god aſſiſteth ſeruants ſetteth worke haue ſee bringeth paſſe gedeons vanquiſhing midianites couered graſhoppers face earth iudg 7 7 multitude euen three hundred men ſo dealt iehoſaphat child ammon moab 2 chro 20 17 mount seir came caſt people iudah god inheritance fearefull exceeding armie lord ſent meſſenger ſaying feare great multitude battell god stand ſtill moue behold ſaluation god towards morrow goe againſt lord make vſe doctrine ſay wee haue eye wee may ſee god aſſiſteth helpeth trouble feare neede beyond man reaſon reach vnto depend truſt yea hee brings danger oftentimes ſtraits end power deliuering may ſeene weakenes fighteth ſenſibly iehoſaphat dauid againſt goliah truth ionah liuely proofe receiued fiſh caſt ſea preſerued belly caſt vp land extraordinarie prouidence god rather hee ſhould loſt forſaken samſon hauing thus ſlaine hee went abode place called etham high rocke belonged tribe simeon border iudah therefore ſaid next verſe philiſtims came pitched iudah ſeeke hee thus ſlew ſaid 8 verſe marked ſaid ſet downe ſeuenth verſe ſaw burned timnite daughter ſeeing onely occaſion loſſe ſaid thus thoſe philiſtims yee haue done thus neighbour owne countrey hurt would doe ſhould fall hand therefore auenged ceaſe thus much cleering theſe two verſes verſe wee may note men cruell outragious againſt doct verſ 7 onely occaſions hurt though neuer ſought intended much ſhew fury madnes againſt haue done hurt wrong vnto may fitly gathered reaſoning samſon ſo wee may well conclude ſay wee bee exaſperated againſt ſuch doe come way onely preſent wee ſuſtained ſome reproch iniurie much light vpon hath done wrong v wee ſhew ſelues vnreaſonable hee cannot beare little much leſſe beare great deale fall neere hand ſuch hee beate ground ſtumbled much fiercely riſe againſt hath caſt wilfully ground samſon ſaid hee would auenged philiſtims ceaſed hee ſpake became ſeeing god appointed doe ſo authoritie ſet place god terrour rom 13 4 wicked euen comfort thoſe good grace eaſie matter puniſh ſinne aright ſeeke winne prou 17 15 offender great offence doe worke lord negligently fall vpon innocent haſtily cruelly priuate perſons preacher word eſpecially ſhould doe likewiſe wit make ſinne odious themſelues others farre lieth magiſtrate puniſh reproue euen ought like affected ſin becauſe god abhorreth herein ſaying good leui father know euen father hee deut 33 9 goe hinder worke god herein follow wee bleſſed sauiour came deſtroy workes diuell haue oft noted 1 ioh 3 8 therefore preſſe former verſe ſaid threaten ſame verſ 8 verſe ſaid doe accompliſh ſmite great plague reprochfull maner ſetting feete vpon ſpurning vnto death commanded god bin cruelty may learne know except haue 1 charge god execute vpon men ſeuere ſharp puniſhment meere crueltie ſet vpon wee ſhould wiſe like much leſſe delight attempt wee would willing haue like offered ſelues haue wee compaſſion commiſeration ouer ſuch miſerie way ſelues would like caſe deſire ſame branch former often touched ſaid rocke etham iudah ſhew 2 abode till hee taken thence men iudah carried philiſtims ſoone know ſaid ſaue onely may ſee goe hide himſelfe corner though hee durſt ſtand hee done like apprehended went god directing take patiently ſhould doe depend iſſue though defenced high place yet open knowne eaſily remoued thence men iudah came vp thither carrie bound philiſtims committing himſelfe god prouidence whoſe worke done though went thither philiſtims yet euen place gouerned let bee wiſe doe may bee driuen flie ſo anſwere bee armed beare come vpon ſame falleth oft time euen haue well done ſome inſtruments diuell bee ready alwaies moleſt bring trouble vpon notwithſtanding yet may reioyce sauiour willeth bee glad mat 5 12 perſecuted reuiled ſake well let 1 pet 3 17 prou 20 1 man ſuffer euill hee ſhall bee forced hide himſelfe runne away wicked flying man purſueth yet haue ſaid notwithſtanding denyed man reſcue himſelfe open wrong vnconſcionable lawfull meanes neither ought preiudice equity cauſe eightieth sermon xv chapter booke ivdges ſecond part chapter verſ 9 philiſtims went vp pitched iudah ſpread themſelues lehi 10 men iudah ſaid ye come vp againſt v anſwered bind samſon come vp doe hath done v 11 three thouſand men iudah went top rocke etam ſaid samſon knowest thou philiſtims ruler ouer v thou haſt done v ſaid vnto vnto ſo haue done vnto 12 ſaid vnto come downe bind thee may deliuer thee hand philiſtims samſon ſaid vnto sweare vnto mee ye fall vpon ſelues 13 ſpake vnto ſaying wee bind thee faſt deliuer thee hand ſurely kill thee bound two new cord brought rocke 14 came lehi philiſtims ſhouted meeting samſon vexed philiſtims haue heard firſt part ſumme theſe verſes chapter ſecond ſhewed purſuing got bee brought bound vnto manner firſt came vp againſt iudah samſon threatning fight againſt vnleſſe brought samſon bound vnto verſ 9 10 secondly iudah fetched rocke etam hee brought bound vnto verſ 11 12 13 thirdly came lehi place heere mentioned philiſtims ſhouted ioy hee come thinking haue ſome great hand ouer part 14 verſe come particularly theſe three point ſaid firſt verſ 9 10 philiſtims came armie againſt iudah part neere adioyning conterminate owne countrey called lehi ſignifieth cheeke iawbone tooke name act samſon place afterwards ſlaying many iaw bone aſſe iudah ſay came putting men thereof great feare samſon done ſo great hurt abode among tooke harboured maintained euill wrought againſt iudah demanded philiſtims ſo come againſt ſeeing broken league anſwered great hurt ſuſtained samſon would haue deliuered vnto elſe would make warre philiſtims like nay many farre better doct verſ 9 would doe like caſe nay bee found either nation againſt nation man man prouoked ready enough ſeek reuenge yea paſſe bound therein exceedingly rather come behind ſuch caſes though doe euill philiſtims alſo yet man would aske whether chriſtian muſt put vp wrong iniuries anſwere may defend himſelfe innocent caſe ſtop courſe aduerſarie ſo bee without malice reuenging mind ſaid another place neither doe affirme ſin goe vnpuniſhed debarring euery man priuate quarrell reuenge officer epheſus told ſeditious citizen act 19 38 ye haue ought againſt theſe men aduocates ſo ſay caſes weight magiſtrates looke neither impudency wrong doer impotency reuenger commonwealth diſturbed ſo much ſinnes committed againſt maieſty god ought magiſtrate beſtirre himſelfe hee doe behoues wherein reuenger rather one ſtands gap ſtay god hand reuenged vpon whole body diſorder bad member phinees ſtory manifeſt complaine whereas men ſo hot one againſt numb 25 8 another bodily treſpaſſes temporary harmes done vnto yet owne ſpeciall ſinnes doe themſelues infinite harme haue heart goe againſt neither wiſe enough beleeue note deadly enemy bee vnto thus wee may find kind offender thing worthy bewailed duly conſidered eſpecially thoſe hauing found wofull experience haue wrought ſorrow iuſt cauſe complaint rankeſt enemy could poſſibly haue procured reuenging others ſhould alway ready feare hold v written rom 12 vengeance mine ſaith lord rom 12 19 repay would deliuer bound vnto would depart would ſaid vnto done vnto iudah thought great wrong offered philiſtims doct verſ 10 while themſelues none defend samſons fact philiſtims thought much ſhould oppoſed iudah hauing made peace vpon condition would hurt none ſaid hurt wee learne heatheniſh thing reaſonable men doe marueile peaceable innocent people giue themſelues leade harmeleſſe life ſhould hurt ſhould bee quiet ſafety liue harme ſaith salomon intend euill thy neighbour ſeeing hee doth pro 3 29 dwell without feare thee enioy ſuch peaceby haue earthly benefit god alloweth great doth know contrary vnpeaceable moſt part doe reape fruit vnquiet liuing anſwerably muſt granted vnrighteous people ſuch ſhiftingly hurt wrong others procure themſelues much hatred trouble ſorrow breaking men way doth cauſe exclamation diſquiets complaint place god doth pay ſuch home requite leaud bad dealing vnconſcionable men oft time life cauſing find ſuch meaſure offer dealing yet farre ſhould euen teacheth philiſtims againe men iudah claime couenant keeping heathen philiſtims challenge breach againſt light nature much ſhould chriſtians keepe couenants haue made peace one another howſoeuer thing fall breake goe diſhoneſtly god prouidence ſuſtaine ſome hurt thereby euen wee reade pſalme thou haſt ſworne thy neighbour diſappoint though thou ſhouldeſt loſe thereby sundry pſal 15 4 band tye men otherwiſe lawleſſe dutie peace generalleſt common band humanity baptiſme profeſſion communion ſo call sacrament among ſome matrimony conſanguinity affinity friendſhip partnerſhip neighbourhood yea law comprimize hath bound ſome offering violence lincks enough man would thinke make cord eaſie broken boyſterous vnreaſonable ſpirit nay brutiſh beareth ſway either holy thing ciuill ſufficient containe men euen samſon thoſe new rope ſo doe theſe ſuch band loue amitie ſhameleſly breake two like flax end goe forward wee haue heard men iudah anſwered verſ 11 philiſtims riſen vp againſt therefore marueiled came make warre whereupon ariſeth queſt 1 queſtion whether well yeelding ſo philiſtims anſwering ſo wit ſubiect according agreement alſo whether well herein offering yeeld samſon ſaid verſe forſaking countrey man auenger nay apprehending binding ſo deliuer hand god raiſed vp helper vnto people againſt enemy ſhould ſo vnthankfull offer iudge helper enemy hand againe make doubt greater ſaid verſe 4 chapt 14 came lord samſon ſhould take occaſion againſt philiſtims might ſore vexe ſhould iudah helpe cut giuen god ſuch helper whereas ſo openly profeſſedly ſuffered ſhew himſelfe ſuch one iudges othniel ehud reſt priuate manner vexe gaue occaſion anſwere ſo god appointed would thereby haue enemy curbed force weakned eaſe quiet people yet would giue ful deliuerance ſo often proued vnfaithfull vnthankfull toward ſay therefore hereupon may ſeeme whole courſe word deedes men iudah toward samſon faultie euill ought hath yet ſaid contrary yeelding vp philiſtims afterward better ſaid verſe haue ſpoke done wit went ſo ſpeedily apprehending binding ſo ſharply rebuked hurt philiſtims whereas fared better ſaw eaſing anſwere certaine men iudah knew anſw ſuch thing samſon giuen auenge philiſtims though told mother angell 13 chapter verſe 5 may bee gathered word men iudah samſon ſpake ſo ſharply ſaid muſt bind ſo deliuer philiſtims abſurd ſpeake knowne ſet lord deliuer beſides god gaue commandement breake league philiſtims made brought vnder neither hee giuen meanes defend violence armes againſt therefore commit ſucceſſe god cannot laid charge men iudah fault ſo samſon deliuering vp philiſtims hand notwithſtanding god prouidence called samſon auenger wee muſt obſerue deliuerie samſon lord ſtill gaue heart alſo opportunitie afflict theſe philiſtims ſhall appeare fifteenth verſe lord thus carrying buſineſſe wee muſt without apparant cauſe condemne fact people yet hereby doe altogether cleere blame doubt men iudah much afraid philiſtims ready keepe themſelues danger ſtay making warre againſt though commanded god haue kept samſon yet ſeeing perill liues like enough would haue done ſo would haue deliuered vp vnto onely indeed leſſe charged becauſe ſaid commandement god doe ſo excuſeth fact becauſe looked theſe ground neither guided knowledge thus conclude let reader marke fact people iudah bad groſſe left samſon ſhift himſelfe againſt expreſſe commandement god bidden take samſon helper aſſiſt ought beleeue hee would haue directed doe would alſo haue aſſiſted appearing neceſſarie proofe onely charged proceeded herein vpon ſiniſter cauſes warrant knowledge appeares fleſhly fearing philiſtims becauſe ſtrong cleaue samſon reſpect ſeeing ſaw like eaſed greatly againſt thereupon ſo ready goe apprehend aske hee meant prouoke philiſtims againſt yet vnder dominion wee may learne hereby howſoeuer god promiſed doct verſ 11 v way appointed v walke hee theſe men iudah yet cannot doe ſo without oppoſition diſpleaſure reſiſtance men wee commonly looke ſtrongeſt ſide fleſhly carnal eye meane power man god ſo ſoone goe way like without great hurt yet marueilous ſee ſlauiſh mindes v note plainly ſoeuer god reueile v particular dutie haue hundred ſhifts excuſes cannot ſay indeed dare walke approued beaten way god hath laid v tongue able expreſſe innumerable breach god commandements fearfull ſinnes committed thus occaſion ſhunne outward temporary danger diſcommoditie inward violence ſmarting word wee make conſciences thereby doe little regard therefore ariſe ſometime many yeeres trouble yea torment v fact ioſephs brother vex twenty gen 42 21 yeeres dauid ſore troubled remembred ſinnes pſal 25 7 youth bee true scripture experience teach v men runne ſinne auoid outward trouble danger yet make nothing haue done leſt ſhould much diſquiet themſelues yet god doth afterwards make doings prickes eye thornes fleſh thereby may know hold vp head moſt iollily ſione committed though nothing amiſſe ſhall ſo eaſily goe away ſinne haue made dearling ſhall ſting boſomes riſe vp ſtrangle oft doth make liues weariſome put alſo end ſinne zimry coſby corab alſo company might one make end numb 25 8 numb 16 32 diſcourſe looke ſtorie might ſeeme deale hebrewes dealt moſes exod 5 21 oppreſſed pharao told moſes made ſtinke ſight pharao samſon ſay knowing might haue bin like haue ſlaine theſe men iudah ſlauiſh fearing philiſtims ſl • rh daſterdlines yeelding ſetting themſelues againſt kindly anſwered told gently done ſhewed muſt binde carrie philiſtims hee rageth againſt neither hurteth requires oath vpon condition would yeeld himſelfe wit would kill themſelues becauſe hee loued countrey would wiſe ſhed blood citizen yet hee ſaw hee muſt doe hee ſhould fight handblowes loue would rather deliuered enemy countrey cauſe ſhould come danger faith god firme conſtant whoſe mercie truſting doubted commit himſelfe enemy defend nation perill life teacheth ſhould haue regard well ſelues ſo much though haue power hand hurt yea though ſome cauſe offered v deale hardly yet wee ſhould forbeare rather godly wiſedome paſſe offence except greater euill inconuenience doe come thereby ala pleaſure ſhould take ſeeing euill fall vpon brother might haue held iob wiſe would iob 31 29 brought doe ſhould euery way haue regard toward neighbour ſo family ſhould ſhew wiſedome care loue toward vnder gouernment lord ſparing v note haue deſerued hard meaſure hand nay receiuing many continuall bleſſings god ſhould wee alſo deale well iob gaue ſeruants leaue plead cauſe hearkened iob 31 13 wronged neighbour hee ſaid moued ioy euill came vpon hate neither ſuffered 29 30 mouth ſinne wiſhing curſe ſoule theſe commendable grace iob condemnation ſpitefull malicious glory cruelty againſt ſeck hurt wrong see heſter 10 laſt verſe ſhould kindly regard nature hath engrauen loue v countrey grace muſt ſeaſon ripen direct ſhame chriſtians come ſhort heathen point yet memorable example among ſuch procurement countreys good doubted deuote themſelues execrable death offer themſelues accord aſſured ſlaughter ſhall ſay nation thoſe decij marcus regulus ſhall riſe vp iudgement againſt many curſed viper degenerate miſcreants nation hauing ſome bond obliege loue loyaltie alone meane fauours prince dignity reward deſert yet haue attempted taken vp armes againſt owne parent ſought ſhed bowel vpon ground ſome pretenſed conſcience moſt helliſh rancour diſcontent pride vnthankfulnes haue raced image loue dutie allegiance god king religion nation ſorting themſelues two treacherous rankes runnagates one ſhrouding themſelues ſouldiers vnder forreine popiſh prince waiting opportunitie doe miſchiefe creeping cloyſters taking vpon mark antichriſt pope deadly enemie religion state renouncing owne countrey ſeruice thereto end may returne againe worke ruine thereof curſed policie leaue th • ſe ſhut vp poynt let samſon teach v gouernours miniſters people vnite loue nation church god therein almeanes wiſhing peace procuring welfare pray god may doe concerneth roote aduerſarie power might threaten wee ſee paul cannot thinke nation burſteth foorth prayer ſaluation doubting loyall ſouldier pledge life rom 9 3 onely ſoule dauid hee beheld people ſtanding amazed goliah breaketh thus vncircumciſed philiſtim 1 sam 17 26 thus brayeth againſt god hoſte iſrael thus let v onely content ſelues common loue ſtandeth communion peace wealth eaſe pleaſure liberty leaſt diſcontent want thereof may preuaile ſo farre cauſe v forſweare religious ciuil intereſt begat nouriſhed v oath required ſecuring hee verſe 12 thought himſelfe ſafe oath would kill becauſe hee doubted hee ſhould breake band eſcape hand philiſtims vex againe example teacheth v take heed wee commit ſelues hand men cannot ſafely truſt ſuch faithfull god except wee haue good ſecuritie ſo yea though make ſhewes friendſhip loue much bewray themſelues ſuch neither hang peace conſcience vpon men haue none themſelues tender regard v put v ſhirts looke former chapter large hereof wee ſee men venture liues vpon ſecuritie oath putteth life hand ſworne would kill gibeonites thought themſelues ſafe prince iſrael ſworne grant liues rahab ſatisfied ioſh 9 15 spy promiſed oath would ſaue father ioſh 2 12 houſe came take iericho citie wherein ſhe dwelt account hath made oath euen among heathen hath noted ſtorie iphtah men gilead chapter 11 verſe 11 like occaſion therfore moſt fearefull ſuch goe chriſtians breake goe oath haue made witnes faithfulnes brother putting truſt wheras bare word ought haue tyed much condemnes ſuch lay vnconſcionable oathes people vrge ſweare wiſe vrged vpon ſaid meane bound verſ 13 two new cord brought downe rock loe thus dealt deliuered enemy hand conſtrained thus bring bound euen ſheepe ſhambles men ſhould deliuer dogges wolues ſo muſt bee depriued ſuch great benefit hee almoſt twentie yeeres deliuering oppreſſion philiſtims god giuing commandement aſſiſt note wee falleth many time wee muſt cannot auoide depriued caſe ſo requiring beſt helpes meanes health peace libertie commodity god haue v feele ſmart thereof make v know ſelues better ought bring v loue ſpeciall ſinnes cauſes hereof like vnquietnes wee haue occaſion ſpeake often booke men iudah ſhew diligence purge themſelues verſ 14 blame philiſtims brought samſon rock bound vnto place lehi mentioned nigh border philiſtims yeelding vp ſo hand god changed therefore wee ſuing feruently time paſt may reſt better perſwaded forgetfulnes god former kindneſſe vnthankfulnes doth contrary much weaken coole prayer nothing ſo confidently looke help vpon hold confidence comfort promiſes god whereby hee may ſtay himſelfe vpholden trial till god giue good iſſue benefit hereof doth onely reach preſent time prepareth alſo croſſes time come entertaine beare better becauſe experience formerly ioyned arme lord ſhortned make euery new triall ſeeme tollerable iſai 59 1 whereas hee vpon occaſion ſudden vnwelcome trouble fetcheth help rather head heart falleth rather contriue fleſhly ſhifts auoid eaſe diſtreſſe like saul getting muſitian heale troubled conſcience meditate 1 sam 16 17 god former mercy doth make euery new croſſe heauie himſelfe confeſſe ſuch haue expetience like hope neither ſhall helpe thus argue ſickneſſe recouered therefore looke breake loe experience breedeth rotten confidence make preſume often faile faile either like iehoram lion nabal meere blockes caſe plaine digge themſelues pit hold water forſake lord ierem 2 13 iona 2 • owne peace vaine conceit ionah ſaith embrace lying vanity forſake owne mercie whereof haue promiſe ſo length verified written prophet though eſcape beare yet lion ſhall deuoure yea often leaſt feare ſhall vndoing caueat let amos 3 19 adde doctrine leſt miſtaken ſay chriſtians experience feare ſickneſſe dye thereof contrariwiſe let v know act faith euer carried according qualitie promiſe paul faith expreſly carried beleeue pricke fleſh ſhould remoued yet experience 2 cor 12 7 many deliuerances god grace ſhould bee ſufficient beleeuing fruite former experience becauſe hee obtained equiualent ſupplie ſaid occaſion firſt prop samſons prayer wit rehearſing god former goodneſſe ſecond followeth 4 ſeruant done worke great labour againſt philiſtims muſt know thing materiall able proue ſelues god ſeruants right elſe claime place houſe otherwiſe ſtrangers ſo doe faithfull
