ſeruants god ſaid heb 1 14 ſeruant ſo particularly ſhewed ſo ſaid haue pleaſed ſelfe ſerued mine owne humour killing theſe philiſtims thy worke fought thy battailes euen ſo particular action wee looke guided god proue ſtate ſeruants hangbyes may able boldnes ſay haue good conſcience thing accuſed yet peace elſe god might alſo diſcharge himſelfe promiſe vnto v ſmall priuiledge haue noted elſewhere while well occupied wee may boldly ſue god bleſſing ſo samſon earthly maſters tye themſelues prouide ſuſtenance ſeruants looking ſhould troubled care thing ſaue labour boldnes might samſon call vpon lord might periſh thirſt heat worke might elſe haue turned diſhonour lord ſuffer miſcarrie want oh men would trie lord commit way welldoing ſee would effect good deſires elſe let wonder ſeeme hard maſter followeth ſubſtance prayer hauing 5 imployed himſelfe glorifie god name might deliuered hand vncircumciſed hee ſaith ſet thee lord iudge ouer thy people ſuffer come hand power contrary thou promiſedſt till fulfilled thy worke wee ſhould earneſt lord wee may liue dye diſhonour name bee kept may bee iuſt reproch requeſts none make ſet themſelues worke without god though counterfeit make great floriſhes ioab see 2 sam 10 12 2 sam 10 whereas ye obiect yet fall reprochfull euils afterward prayer anſwere thereto neglected nouriſhing grace hee pray anſwere fit occaſion made hereto next chapter therefore deferre place samſon made prayer thus extreame thirſt lord verſ 19 ſumme manifeſt verſe cauſed water come foorth hollow place iaw breaking tooth ſtood therein ſo hee drunke reuiued therefore gaue name thing done accordingly calling fountaine prayed lord heard samſons prayer rather gaue water extraordinarily ſhould periſh teacheth ſame v rather ſhall miſcarrie prouide v though know neither ſee ſed eliah rauens good widow increaſe 1 king 17 5 2 king 4 7 little oyle till paid debt maintained preſerued ionah fiſhes belly againſt likelihood brought ſafe land god hath many way comfort vphold eſtate willing able doe extraordinarie prouidence rather ſhould faile ſee expedient alwaies doe ſo yet doth great deale gaue deſire hee worketh contentation grace ſooner ſhall ſtones ſtreete bee turned loaues bread water wels drinke ſhall periſh euen vnleſſe doe better thing cleaue wee therefore inſeparably remoued ſtedfaſt confidence hath ſaid alſo doe ſame point commeth often hand water samſon drunk reuiued againe neere death 2 verſe appeareth whereby wee may ſee theſe two thing one thirſt moſt deadly intollerable paine wee may well ſee thirſt sauiour complained croſſe reckoned ioh 19 28 one part paine thirſt ſo hunger either dye lingering ſo moſt weariſome grieuous death like vnto ſeeing many kindes death wee may ſee many death thoſe moſt painfull god keepeth v might eaſily miſcarrie way samſon like doe infinite way god hold backe helping hand condemne blockiſh vnthankfulnes neuer ſeldome reckon vp daily ſhould ſuch benefit deliuerances among neither thankfull ſeeing hunger thirſt ſo biting painfull nakedneſſe like muſt pitifull ſuch diſtreſſed people moued bowel compaſſion toward remembring chriſts word hungrie ye gaue meate c matth 25 35 thing heere ſmall refreſhing preſerue samſons life euen little water ſo homely manner prouided wee ſee mentioned comfort reuiue ſhould teach v wee ſhould marke many comfortable refreſhings wee enioy god compariſon meane ſmall without ſhould haue much diſtempered body thereby vnquiet vnſetled mindes alſo meate hunger drinke thirſt reſt wearineſſe caſe aſſwagement paine diſeaſes pinched doe better teach v much freedome accounted oh little intermiſſion paine ſtone anguiſh extremitie gowre like diſeaſes doe wee price euen farre aboue much treaſure cannot valued bee free kind thereof ſeaſon yea loden benefit alſo ſide make liues comfortable pſal 68 19 grace good thing make ſauory thinke ſhould wee yeeld vnto lord therefore samſon gaue name place alſo according occaſion offered teſtifie thankes god hearing prayer ſending water exceeding thirſt neer vnto death doctrine place hath taught ſundry time laſt 17 verſe onely wiſh might bee annexed doctrine thankeſgiuing bee continued ſpecially great deliuerance feare euerlaſting torment bee continued life long ſong zacharias wee taught god giue luk 1 74 grace thereto great reaſon wee ſhould doe ſo ſeeing wee reape enioy fruit thereof life long thing place omit name place hee gaue hee calling fountaine 4 prayed meaning god extraordinarily prouided prayed thirſt teacheth v onely rare effect fruites ſpring feruent prayer iames ſaith feruent prayer auaileth iam 5 16 much finde thereby wee obtaine grace againſt daily ſinne corruption alſo ſuch fruit obtained god v ſhould well appeare samſons leauing memoriall thankfulneſſe place much ſhould doe oft yea one day receiue many bleſſings effect prayer god wee ſhould ſay let thoſe place bee witneſſes remembring god kindneſſe ſo plentifully ſhead vpon v ſuch place could ſpeak ſhould well able teſtifie barren ſilent yeelding praiſes vnto houſes onely chamber note ſhould witnes garden field yea high way haue ſo often paſſed ſafely without danger ſhould like ſhutting vp chapter holy ſtory addeth ſpace twentie yeeres people vnder dominion verſ 20 philiſtims samſon continue place iudging iſrael helping vexing whereby wee may gather although iſraelites freed hand altogether yet many great calamity kept meanes samſon euer way hand croſſe diſquiet therein marke lord hauing oft deliuered people yet ſeeing reuolt bee better hee hold vnder longer yet leſſened bondage made tolerable helpe samſon may hereby learne ſeeing haue liberty peace bleſſings alſo inlargements affliction doe yeeld lord fruit anſwerable ſo great kindneſſe alſo looked hand wee forget wax vnprofitable yea luk 17 17 grieue lord returning old euill courſe againe therfore doth longer ſtraitlier hold v vnder one croſſe trouble another wee either haue ſo good meanes come would elſe giue v profit ſome worthie note ſeruants doe neither enioy ſweet comfortable day wee might doe good liking wee may thanke ſelues great mercy worſe v take heed tempt god ſtill ſuch manner hee looketh grape wee bring forth wild grape wee lie eſa 5 2 ſinnes cannot ignorant doe much diſpleaſe god mocked left heere vpon people long continued bondage ſo hee deale v hee hath done heretofore namely although haue taken heauie yoke bondage necke people land meane ſubiection idolatry poperie yet hee note leaue matter ſorrow enough ſcattering moſt part ignorance without good diligent teacher guide caſt ſpirit bondage vpon reſt euen dealt heere people vnder philiſtims long time samſon borne time till grew able ſet vpon twentie yeres iudged iſrael ſo continued yea hee puniſh v yet leuit 26 21 ſeuen time continue euill courſe let v obſerue farre different manner god viſiting godly puniſhing wicked people heere breach couenant daily reuolts god faine bee inured affliction particularly bee ſeruitude ſuch hated yet becauſe lord choſen among nation peculier people vnto himſelfe therefore eye could ſee miſery hee muſt need pitie euen hee could bridle hee muſt need prouide bondage may tolerable wee may thanke ſelues ſtraitneſſe trouble befals v wee ſee light comfort creuis haue breathing relaxation god indulgence thereby ſheweth could bee content rod burnt might vſed foraſmuch content ſhake ouer v might beate v many ſtripes ſay truth holdeth v vnder rather preuent greater offence ſorer puniſhments time come deale v according former paſt tranſgreſſions let teach v waile bee humbled hollow falſehearted dealing god promiſes amendment formall thankeſgiuing bleſſings wee enioy wee retaine fruit thereof become bad worſe afterward euer let v chuſe rather ſound well ordered courſe enioy conſtant feeling god loue fruition bleſſing breaking cloud blemiſh ioh 15 10 owne happineſſe mixture many vnwelcome affliction againe let ſerue alleniate qualifie rebellious nature commonly deemeth god hath quite hidden face v goe currant ſmooth v time paſt fauour god like diſpleaſure becauſe ſinne like obedience much middeſt diſpleaſure hath ſo oft prouoked v forgetteth ſhew mercy v whereas looke wicked ſhall finde nothing ſo neither doth lord exerciſe affliction alway reſtraine ſuffereth 1 sam 2 25 goe perdition doe puniſh yet ſweetens croſſe ſmites wrath giues euen mat 27 3 taſte eternall diſpleaſure ſhall feele endleſly eaſeleſly hereafter eightie two sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges verſ 1 went samſon azzah ſaw harlot went vnto 2 told azzahites samſon come hither moreparticularly ſaid ſeeing city woman verſ 1 harlot ſo hebrew word bee tranſlated heere though ſignifie alſo victualler went phraſe much hee husband vnlawfull companie chapter 15 1 phraſe ſpeech taken companying husband wife together alſo many place doth appeare ſo cleare samſon firſt verſe ſaid haue vnlawfull companie harlot neither ſhew reaſon take otherwiſe againſt ſignificatiō phraſe ſaw victualler went houſe houſes knowne bee receiuing paſſengers ſome ſignes report meeting victualler ſtreets ſo accompanying home sure harlot whoſe houſe went went thither ill end euen haue company haue ſaid vnlawfull manner therefore ſeeke expoſition ſalue matter needleſſe doct verſ 1 hath well ſeene ſtorie samſon notwithſtanding ſome fault one deere ſeruants god alſo confirmed hee ſo epiſtle hebrewes yet behold hee ſnared heb 11 32 harlot nay made drunke pretious deceiueable wondred raiſeth doubtfull thought heart many god weake people ſee man ſo beloued god hee left himſelfe fal ſo ſhamefully deſire therfore know ſhould come paſſe samſon otherwiſe ſo good man ſhould thus bereaued former good mind time yea ſo diſguiſed become ſo vnlike himſelfe ſo ſhort time hee ſerued god ſo commendably former chapter verſ 16 c could ouercome ſtrength ſlew thouſand one time without weapon ſhould become ſo impotent thus bee ouercome poore ſillie woman yea harlot teacheth ſuch thing may poſſibly befall deere ſeruants god frailty ſubiect ſuch corruption remaineth ſtill may poſſibly forget god time fearefull thing thinke holy eſtate bee ſoone carried occaſion ſteadfaſtneſſe faith 4 1 king 11 4 ionah 1 3 others giue good proofe haue god grace ſo pinned ſleeues may poſſibly fall either reprochfull foule ſinnes partly forementioned meanes partly inward ſuggeſtion heart giuing liberty thereto beſides many outward occaſions prouocations among walke bad example whereto note danger faſhioned made like may firſt teach v ſee great cauſe beſt v ſhould truſt corrupt nature content ſelues ſuch villanie reproch rather ſame goodneſſe v ſo farre ſhould rather daily drawne endeuour pleaſe thing readineſſe yea watch thereunto conſtantly power god arme inable v thereto well conſidering ſelues great word boaſts chaſtnes honeſty grace ſtand v ſtead time tentation triall neither cold prayer endeuours able weaken ſtrong tentations v muſt looke ſtrength hearten ſelues diligent reuerent vſing al good meanes appointed god purpoſe yet know great gainer thereby ſpeake particularly ſin note samſons muſt ſhall ſee cauſe arme ſelues againſt dallying leaſt tickling v thereto forementioned meanes vſing hath ſaid attend particular calling auoide idle vnneceſſary going abroad dinah therefore ſmarted gen 34 1 2 whereby wee ſhall obtaine ſmall liberty freedome ſame theſe thing duly regarded v feruent prayer offered vp oft conſtantly god aſſiſtance bleſſing feare god hauing ſo ſpoken wee ſhall bee ſtrongly poſſeſſed ſmaller ſinnes anger impatience c much leſſe tainted either vncleanneſſe reprochfull euils rather daily renued care watchfulneſſe wee ſhall gather experience hope vpholden note ſame vnto end good thing grow meane account v yea wee hold high price reckoning begin woe lie open infinite danger vſe make beſt v feare ſuſpect ſelues leſt ſhould fall ſeeing haue grace commandement make much heere fitteſt place thinke good adde ſeeing samſon afterward recouer riſe againe therefore ſhould ſecondly ſerue hold haue deere lord yet haue fallen samſon diſpairing god mercy toward rather encourage cling againe true ſubmiſſion mercy much ought knowledge hereof ſtay v condemning ſuch apoſtates haue ſo offended though cannot bee denied haue ſtained credit godlineſſe ſuch blemiſhes sundry among v conſidering themſelues readie fall ſuch raſh vncharitable iudging thinke good piece religion ſmall commendation bee ſpoken cenſure others vntill vncharitableneſſe high mindedneſſe raſh iudging diuels malice ſubtilty together haue brought themſelues like worſe caſe iuſtly expoſed rē proch note diſtempered mood moſt ſpitefully draw vp others point ſeuerall relapſes whereof former ſtory full hath miniſtred occaſion entreate let reader compare ſeuerall place owne benefit another thing verſe ſaid carried ſinne doct 2 eye hee ſaw woman harlot went occaſion ſinne vngouerned eye euill heart ſoone inflamed prouoked thereby ſo oft time many thus dauid deceiued though leſſe bee wondered 2 sam 11 2 gen 39 7 ioſephs miſtreſſe experience teacheth eye glaſſe window let ſinne heart though haue little neede helpe ſelfe fountaine filthineſſe ſmoake fornace wickedneſſe doth proceed come wiſedome ſhall vſe wee ſhould make doctrine keepe eye continent walke middeſt allurement world therefore make couenant iob looke vpon woman leſt wee iob 31 1 caught ſnared precious rather eye offendeth plucke turne away ſuch alluring obiects matth 5 29 oh giueth great eaſe reſt v ſafetie ouer finde giue libertie themſelues way ſpeake euen thoſe repent afterward haue eare heare till eye bring ſoule body ſo ſet fire deſtruction like may ſay eare tongue companie euen idleneſſe venturing meddle deale haue calling warrant threaten infinite miſchiefe v onely example foole prouerbs doth teſtifie whoſe rouing ſtreetes made prou 7 5 gen 34 2 bootie harlot dinahs alſo many doe witneſſe catcht ſnare though ſame neglect rule carrieth ſorts deepe danger haue cried bitterly note late could perſwade doe otherwiſe ſuch example teach others wiſedome till haue brought paid dearely themſelues ſinne dalliance ſo rſt men thinke wiſe enough guide way though god ſhut whereas prophet ieremy denieth ierem 10 23 man direct way ſo bad yet think may bold goe vpon brinke though fall water fallen thing may looke wiſh abridged themſelues little libertie rather haue taken whit much preciſenes hath ſometime ſcoffed others ſetting watch ouer heart eye much ſay truth god onely wiſe knoweth hee doth let ſuch bold perſons ſeeing needes fall dangerouſly onely others might learne beleeue thoſe admonition concerning ſuch offence ſee example euen offendors themſelues pride may bee crackt looſenes corrected themſelues made priuie owne corruption glad liue euer thankfully vnder god gouernment yet ſay point ſome glorie bee counted virgin therefore refuſe mariage rather ſhun diſcommodities accompanying ſhall haue ſmall reward ſo god ſinne breaking another way sodomie nouriſhing vncleane luſts ſo doubled ſhall haue puniſhment accordingly ſeeing ſin samſons committed immediatly great doct 3 ſeruice hee god againſt philiſtims mentioned latter end former chapter worke came citie azza hee ſaw woman ſay wee may ſee wee haue praiſed god victorie gotten haue ſerued good ſort manner yet euen wee ſubiect offend breake againſt ſome way occaſion may offered note euen free danger falling ſo firme ſtanding whereas might thought perill many day indeed meete ſhould ſo meane wee ſhould better fenced ſtrengthened againſt euill ſorts haue well occupied taken vp dutie god confeſſe grant wee conſider well wee ſhould ſuch ſeruice note done god samſon againſt philiſtims ſhould ſay ſenced againſt ſweete baites ſinne long time afterward meete ſuch good ſpirituall refreſhing ſoules might fitter proceed cheerefully readily one dutie another leaſt farre ſuch diſguiſings samſons diuell handleth matter ſlightly couertly worketh thereby v ſecuritie pleaſing ſelues good haue done ſometimes eaſily led dreame imagine wee hauing well occupied may boldly take libertie good right remit ſlake care wee prone rebellion wicked nature forward way ſinne haue fleſhed ill companie ſuch like inticements thing marueiled haue well occupied haue done faithfull ſeruice god break amiſſe go like cain iudas god preſence diuels ſhop forthwith worke buſines ſay would eaſily thought wee might brought vnto yet wilfull ignorance wee know better neither ſee yet wee doe ſloth pride looſenes ſecuritie bearing ſway v wee may poſſibly bee miſled yea eaſily full ſoone manner haue ſaid vſe reproue ſay muſt wee euer ſeruing god ſpeech vnſauourie vnbeſeeming profeſſors goſpell may ſee know ſeruice god perfect freedome ſhall ſee alſo neglecting haue well ſmarted ſtop mouthes anſwere let ſaying sauiour bee added wit wee haue done luke 17 10 moſt vnprofitable ſeruants come farre ſhort ought doe yea meanes vſing fray away satan noyſome temptation except watch pray reſiſt matth 26 41 alway frailtie permit theſe thing like duly conſidered ſhall ſee ſmall cauſe flatter ſelues though wee might take ſome libertie authoritie ſinne theſe men azza heard samſon verſe 2 ſhewed ſecond verſe wit went preſently take compaſſed houſe lay waite night purpoſing though diſappointed kill morning diligence without delay heathen preuent miſchiefe putteth v blame iuſt reproch chriſtians wee bee much carefull doe like thereby wee preuent cut atleaſt much inconuenience alreadie begun wee doe alſo hinder marre growth thereof goe example particularly diſorder lewd meeting drinking gaming whoring ſuch like bee ſprung vp countrey townes houſes among v ſhould hinderers ſuch worker euill may oppoſe themſelues againſt magiſtrates headborowes townes maſters family ſo apprehending ieſuite seminarie ſuch knowne carrie traytors heart againſt prince land come ſow heretical idolatrous cockle darnell among lord wheate alſo ſhould goe aleniate people true worſhip god publike hearing goſpel preached ſhould forward theſe philiſtims hunting hole bringing foorth rather haue ſloth backwardnes ſuch good attempt condemned iuſtly eſpecially diligence ſuch theſe philiſtims againſt abomination wee ſhould ſo ioyne together rooting lend helpe hereto ſhould yet enquire cauſe tell bewray haunt tell citizen azza samſon ſo v poore people building temple brought morter ſet forward ſame could doe greater thing v ſay doe beſt endeuour leaſt ſhew forward readie mindes doe good therein lamentable ſloth backwardnes ſhewed ſetting god matter buſineſſe forward yet time labour coſt enough following owne much like mentioned prophet dwelt ſieled houſes themſelues ſuffered god houſe lie waſt habac 1 4 oftentimes lately former chapter like occaſion ſaid verſe samſon eſcaped hand labour diligence take onely ſo alſo verſ 3 hurt whereby may ſee god puniſh great ſinne committed gaue time thinke whereas forthwith chaſtiſed hee dealt iuſtly ſeeing god oft time dealeth ſo v meane purſue v ſome wilful knowne ſinne committed leſt ſhould miſconceiue ſo learne end forbearing v haue prouoked know ſhould doe v wrong ſhould forthwith lay hand vpon v yea ſome ſharpe manner reaſon god deferring apoſtle peter ſetteth downe telleth v 2 pet 3 9 lord patient v ſuch caſes end euen bring v repentance loe good meaneth v forbearing v though wiſe man part tempt hope ſpared samſon heere becauſe ſinnes neuer without feare though may without outward danger time yet wee haue done ſo time paſt time come doe ſo ſo sauiour ſpeaketh man goſpel healed ioh 5 14 diſeaſe caueat watchword fit v goe thy way ſinne leſt worſe thing befall thee beſt ſuch caſe iudge ſelues ſpeedily euill haue done bee iudged lord bee ſharpe ſmartie euen samſon found afterward doe like caſe find daily 1 cor 11 31 yet without due regard corrupt heart driue v vpon common rocke wit wee ſhall hurt ſelues way many doe euen cry peace peace god deferre puniſh thinke ſo wee loue flatter ſelues fauoureth v doth ſtrike v euen wicked ſaid pſalme becauſe lord pſal 50 21 hold tongue ſmite ſin like vnto mind allowed therein god anſwered reproue thee ſet thy bad doings thee thou ſhalt acknowledge whether thou wilt ſo ſhew fauoured thee ſecond part chapter verſ 4 hee loued woman plaine sorek whoſe name delilah 5 vnto came prince philiſtims ſaid vnto entice ſee wherein great ſtrength lieth meanes may ouercome may bind puniſh euery one v ſhall giue thee eleuen hundred ſhekles ſiluer 6 delilah ſaid samſon tell mee pray thee wherein thy great ſtrength lieth wherewith thou mighteſt bound doe thee hurt 7 samſon anſwered vnto bind ſeuen greene cord neuer dried ſhall weake another man 8 prince philistims brought ſeuen greene cord dry ſhe bound therewith 9 ſhee men lying waite chamber ſhee ſaid vnto philistims vpon thee samſon brake cord threed tow broken feeleth fire ſo ſtrength knowne 10 delilah ſaid vnto samſon see thou haſt mocked told lie pray thee tell wherewith thou mighteſt bound 11 anſwered bind new rope neuer occupied ſhall weake another man 12 delilah therefore tooke new rope bound therewith ſaid vnto philiſtims vpon thee samſon men lay waite chamber brake armes threed 13 afterward delilah ſaid vnto samſon hitherto haſt thou beguiled mee told melies tell thou mighteſt bound ſaid vnto thou platteſt ſeuen locke mine head threeds woofe 14 ſhe faſtened pinne ſaid vnto philiſtims vpon thee samſon awoke ſleepe went away pin web woofe 15 againe ſhe ſaid vnto canſt thou ſay loue thee thine heart thou haſt mocked theſe three time haſt told wherein thy great ſtrength lyeth 16 becauſe ſhe importunate vpon word continually vexed ſoule pained death 17 therefore hee told heart ſaid neuer came raſor vpon mine head nazarite vnto god mother wombe therfore ſhauen ſtrength go ſhall bee weake like men 18 delilah ſaw told heart ſhee ſent called prince philiſtims ſaying come vp againe hee hath ſhewed mee heart came vp brought money hand 19 ſhee made ſleepe vpon knee ſhe called man made ſhaue ſeuen lock head ſhe began vex ſtrength gone 20 ſhe ſaid philiſtims vpon thee samſon awoke ſleepe thought goe time ſhake ſelfe hee knew lord departed theſe verſes ſet downe ſecond part chapter wherein samſon ſinned againe like manner like iſſue ſumme theſe verſes former wicked fact god arreſt vpon treſpaſſe purſue ſeeing hee made benefit conniuence hee went away without puniſhment proceeded like ſinne againe behold paid dearly accordingly tempted god farre ſinne whoredome ſaid loued another woman philiſtims vnderſtood conſidered meanes vexed great ſtrength body whereby hee wrought great miſchiefe enticed flattered woman eaſily wonne promiſing great ſumme money ſo agreed together therein perſwade get ſubtilty great ſtrength lay ſo might knew vſe ſome meanes weaken handle afterward pleaſure practiſe ſhe ſo hired readily went made drunke ſottiſh inordinate loue ſuffered moue ſuch queſtions although hee held yet laſt hee told heart euen ſhe asked might bee made weake till hee ſaw late adam god gone hee gen 3 7 loſt great ſtrength god giuen theſe verſes containing ſecond part chapter ſeeing many matter much therefore auoiding confuſion tediouſneſſe handling draw theſe two point firſt new occaſion philiſtims laid wait samſon againe end fifth verſe manner wit moſt earneſt ſuing delilah learne great ſtrength lay ſecond ſhe neuer ceaſed til ſhe found brought word verſ 21 firſt touching samſon holy ſtory relateth occaſion purſuing verſe 4 philiſtims thereby moued lay verſ 5 occaſion caſt affection vpon another woman iſraelite nation philiſtims holy ſtory expreſſeth place ſhee dwelt plaine sorek woman name loued delilah ſaid samſon hee went another woman note doct verſ 4 filthy luſt ſatisfied yeelding anger wrath onely time breaketh rangeth ſtill yet fire broken flame ſtandeth ſtill taketh hold one houſe hath burned another euen ſo ſimil wicked luſt one woman two twenty ſatisfie vnbridledneſſe outragiouſneſſe thereof would might ſerued yeelded vnto goe farre salomon euen defile thouſand iehu anſwere iehorams demand peace 2 king 9 tels 2 king 9 22 mother iezabels witchcraft without number reaſon hereof becauſe vnlawfull pleaſure ſin doth bait doth fiſh egge ſinner goe forward blind ſeeing manifold vnfruitfulneſſe thereof like gameſters neuer leaue trade pennie left ſheweth wickedneſſe heart one kind many meaſure ſinfull though bee cleare proofe alwaies ſpeake meane vnſatiableneſſe men filthie appetite ſo partly ſeeing ſinne ſecretly committed moſt part therefore hardly knowne many far proceedeth partly ſuch ſinne kind hardly haue ordinary opportunity effect deſire truth ſay appeareth hath found way ſo confeſſion ſome haue gone farre wicked courſe life howſoeuer may haue come ſhort number ſo many thouſand salomon yet haue made vp full longlying ſin leaud companion haue intercepted haue full ſwinge true affirmed guilt ſinne infinite reſpect tranſgreſſion againſt infinite maieſtie alſo becauſe ſinners appetite though actually finite yet extendeth itſelfe deſire multiplying ſinne infinitely could death bad men thinke euill courſe ſhould bee ſtopped may time paſt haue done yea becauſe age death thing muſt need end iollity inſiſt inſtance alone may bee ſeene ſundry kindes ſinne theft prodigality drunkenneſſe reſt heart meaſure ſinfull giueth ouer euill till want opportunity till muſt ceaſe neceſſity violence bee put vnto delighteth old ribald ſee heare report pageant ſtories practiſes vncleanneſſe remembreth hath wrought though old bone cannot beſtirre ſo liuely time paſt yet old adam within aliue laſciuious euer angry man hath done till haue none angry till hee cut ſo cannot ſhew might bee endleſſe ſhould follow particular oft thinke wee peter like haue denied maſter ſo three time vehementlieſt laſt yet hee onely feare meere infirmity profeſſedly much worſe neither yet occaſions ſtrong great brought thereto euen word ſilly damſell vſe haue ſaid tentation ſinne vncleanneſſe obiect thereof ſinne wee prou 4 18 keepe heart eye poſſible obſeruation diligence allowing liking offer ſort curbe vp tie ſhort though carnall reaſon would perſwade v giuing little liberty fleſhly affection couetous deſires would content ſatisfie ſo would deſire reach note ſome man ſay worth thus many hundred pound c would reſt content yet groſſe bewitching v thinke ſo ſeeing without god ſpeciall grace money encreaſeth ſo doth loue thereof alſo yea next way bring v vtter extreame bondage prouoke v endleſſe ingaging ſelues thereunto nay rather ioyne prayer watching fall mar 26 41 vprightneſſe ſo ſhall ſure fall ſuch tentation ſay leſſe becauſe haue handled ſpeech adonibezek cap 1 verſ 4 eightie three sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges goe forward left heere note wee another thing wit vſe benefit wee commonly 2 make god long ſufferance patience euen goe forward ſpirituall deluſion ſinnes without making queſtion god call v account flatteringly tell ſelues perſwaded well long god let v go vnpuniſhed whereas ſhould bee ignorant patience god toward v end ſhould acknowledge vnfained thankes might iuſtly haue puniſhed v hath done others ſpared v end wee ſhould turne againe lord true repentance rather wondring rom 2 4 lenity ſo much adoe enduring penalty enlightened come ſelues ſee wee haue tempted god ſhould wiſe flatter ſelues leſt lord forced thereby tie v ſhorter vſe ſharpeneſſe ſhal like well like ſpake samſons eſcaping former verſe onely adde fearefull thing loue conniuence god note chiefe bridle containe faithfull people obedience become occaſion greateſt licentiouſneſſe argueth tender nature filiall affection waxen hardened degenerated ſlauiſh deſperate boldneſſe like preſuming himſelfe ſure enough maſter fell waxe wearie worke take vpon iollity doe reckon without hoſte ſhall one thing ſo much ſting heart god come take correction neuer well till turned loue father iealouſie foe whoſe ſwift wing taking reuenge ſhall ſure recompence delay leaden foot ſlow puniſh samſon himſelfe ſequell found coſt thus much samſons ſinne ſhewed philiſtims tooke verſ 5 occaſion thereby get hand dealing woman loued intice tel great ſtrength lay ſo might doe deſired withall end might draw perſwade thereto offer chiefe prince meane large ſumme money may ſee wiſdome readineſſe men world going remedie bodily miſchiefe comming toward ſoone heard samſons haunt chiefe went thither tooke order ſuppreſſing without great coſt charge oh commendable indeed might bee ſeene v yea ſo much greater miſchiefe hangeth ouer v meane wee could offer like violence ſinne giue reſt till wee rooted heere effected went yet may ſee haue greater cauſe doe moſt emminent danger temporall bodily euill ſee ſloth follie admirable lamentable prouidence together coſt conſent diligence haue noted like occaſion former verſe maruell counſell deceiue inticements 2 allurement ſuch harlot haue good skill fooles woond eaſily deluded samſon ſtrongeſt reaſon perſwaſion wiſeſt carnall friend would neuer haue drawne ſlauerie ſhame baſe companion brought deluſion note deceiuing whereby may learne carried away ſinne giuen ouer luſts depart religion alſo ſound wiſdome reaſon right mindes ſay deluded mocked diſguiſed euen made fooles samſon heere mad beſide ſelues ſaid prodigall ſonne hee ſpent good harlot hee came luk 15 17 himſelfe length whereby cleere beſide himſelfe reade foole prouerbs hee followed oxe prou 7 22 ſlaughter ſuch due bee ſhoaled among ſuch driuen companie ſober wiſe men yet thus samſon deceiued deluded drawne inticed wicked woman vtter ſecret namely great ſtrength lay vſe ſhould make abhorre ſinne fellowſhip ſuch perſons labour retaine godly wiſedome guide v holie feare offending rather take part pleaſures ſinne ſeaſon ſo ſhall deceiued deluded otherwiſe wee cannot chuſe yea moſt ſottiſh manner samſon inchantment brought bee let bee ſufficient ſhew enough corrupt heart man humble ſight god world depth darkneſſe yea though ſuch rebellion deformitie inferior appetite ſoule originall ſinne whereas created moſt obedient ſubiect pure light vnderſtanding thing ſo infeebled infatuated reſiſteth iudgement minde led away ſtrength allurement euen contrary knowledge ſtill remaineth guide degegenerate become moſt brutiſh ſottiſh ſo bewraieth ſelfe euen otherwiſe goe none ſimpleſt vnciuill ſort offering money theſe prince philiſtims alſo ſuch liberall maner much hundred pound piece doct 3 money well nigh eſtimation ſhekell reckoned common ſhekell much twentie penny v therefore eleuen hundred want little hundred pound rate offering ſay ſo many hundred according number prince came might eaſily draw purpoſe ſuch one light inconſtant falſehearted samſon harlot without reſpect money teacheth v hireing people money hath bin doct readie way draw lewd practiſe commonly offered hath bin age neuer eſpecially popiſh crue attempting deſperate murthers c like hath bin noted fact abimelech chap 9 hired lewd fellowes iudg 9 4 money shechemites wofull example prieſts preuailing thereby iudas one twelue apoſtles betray maſter hireing watchman matth 28 defame reſurrection may notable preſidents hereof mention point end ſeeing mat 28 12 13 common odious may reach alſo god faithfull ſeruants doe either one either ſet worke others ſell helpe either corrupt corrupted money go together mutuall cauſes effect bring wicked purpoſes paſſe ſo euill age farre ſubtile skilfuller former doe miſchiefe may ſoone preuaile cuſtome euen among touching coſt ſee chap 17 2 thus wee haue heard wicked woman hired philiſtim verſ 6 7 8 9 prince wofull worke deceiuing samſon firſt point two appeareth fourth verſe ſecond part chapter followeth ſhe went worke preuailed ſecond declared laid foorth verſes following 21 ſhe obtaining one time ſhe ſought ſhe ſet vpon fundrie time foure ſeuerall attempt expreſſed haue made end firſt bee ſeene theſe foure next verſes theſe therefore follow order firſt attempt muſt thinke ſhe went ſimply doct verſ 6 asking queſtion ſtrength lay taught deceiue ſo doubt ſhe flattered pretending ſhe marueiled ſo great ſtrength ſhe reioyced little ſhe louer indued ſuch excellent gift qualitie therefore ſhe one louing againe truſtie kindneſſe towards deſired know great ſtrength lie ſee boldneſſe men though furniſhed excellent gift doe cauſe cheriſh harlot hauing fellowſhip keeping companie samſon man ſo ſpoken manhood ſuch good courage durſt bold looke face yet ſhe baſe houſewife dare boldly demaund weightie matter greateſt ſecrets whoriſh daughter whoriſh mother herodias meane ſo farre admitted dance herod matth 14 6 king permitted demand recompence ſhe liſted euen halfe kingdome ſhamed aske head iohn baptiſt onely people euen herod himſelfe reuerenced mark 6 20 ſtood feare theſe ware ſtrumpets fardall ſtuft withall euen ſubtiltie crueltie falſehood ſo tempered together demaund delilah man knowes qualitie predominant among reſt whereof ſpeake inſolent impudencie ſhameleſneſſe practiſe curſed kinde euen day paramour demaund vnreaſonable pledge vncleane loue appeares embezeling patrimonie maintenance ſometimes cauſing ſpend euen blood quarrell occaſion true ſaying much familiaritie breedeth contempt much euill euill ſooner kind meane whoredome thing notoriouſly exemplified harlot iezabel note ſo much abuſed remiſſenes ahab inſult ouer 1 king 21 7 vnderling common phraſe companion harlot call themſelues ſeruants miſtreſſes deed vaſſals ſlaues yet bondage great ioyned miſerie ſweete although indeed ſweete poyſon reward good enough ſuch employment yet many chuſe kinde life libertie rather honeſt mariage returne ſaid familiaritie meete beſt ſwell confeſſe bee high minded humble meeke toward yet grauitie whereby bad may afraid think fit companion except change quality note tit 2 7 good may cling ioyne companie acquaintance without feare haue familiaritie bad euill vtterly vnlawfull ſerues onely confirme make bold wickedneſſe thus many man otherwiſe worthie samſon brought meane account indiſcreete vnſeaſonable laying open minde hee ſhould euen ſo imbolden woman thereby aske may bee bound hurt abſurd thing either incourage propound ſeeth samſon anſwering ſhould haue admitted ſpeake verſ 7 ſuch matter telling hee might bound make way euill followed ſhe repulſed beaten back ſuch boldnes firſt ſhe ſhould haue incouragement much leſſe doubt haue proceeded ſhe afterward great wiſedome samſon anſwer balaam anſwered word aſſe time ſhould haue ſaid numb 22 29 himſelfe thinke hee gone farre enough prouoking god hee opened mouth dumme beaſt reprooue ſhould samſon haue thought imboldned wicked woman tamper meddle touched life concerned ſoule bereaue furniture grace god ſhould haue thought ſay time ceaſe ſpeaking admit ſpeake ſuch matter yea turne vtterly away rather vtterly giue ouer ioſeph whoriſh miſtreſſe lay day day yeeld wicked requeſt scripture gen 39 10 teſtifieth yet hearkened vnto neither would companie v haue made vagary outſtrayings yea though ſo groſſely samſon neither fellowſhip lewd woman horrible fond filthie lingering whoriſh companie conſciences ſhall accuſe v ſo note warne v deſiſt breake betimes ſuch longing lingering haue nothing doe withall ſet eye ſhame ſorrow fall v long haſt ſay let v thinke high time v wee haue vnhappily gone ſo farre breake brood ſcatter miſts ſuch idle filthie thought wicked luſts aſtoniſhment aske ſelues haue wee done helpe faithfull ſeruent prayer throw duſt samſon dally delilah marke thinke ſeriouſly vpon end thereof ſo wee ſhall ſome purpoſe make benefit example samſon otherwiſe wee may common ſort wonder condemne follie ſelues play fooles like worſe kinde ſtrange purpoſely proſtituted himſelfe harlot purſuit luſt could breake band ſinfull deſire ſnared time preuenting miſchiefe hee firſt enticed matter gone ſo farre vnder feete ſmall liſt ſtrength riſe vp call himſelfe ſerious remembrance note offence delilah lap armes fit likely place occaſion ſuch thought meditation wiſedome driuen breaſt corrupt affection blow ſmartie enough hee loſt feeling miſerable ſight behold man intangled ſnare owne luſt ſin waſteth conſcience hee ſhiftleſſe cannot helpe himſelfe readie beare burthen ſhall laid vpon ſhoulders rather riſe vp vnder therefore great loue god man hauing firſt preuented beginning ſinne ouertaken deceitfulnes firſt view yet vpon aduiſed conſideration danger leadeth vnto ſhall awake rouſe vp himſelfe flie ſerpent ſhifting lye though would ſatisfie 2 yet keepe himſelfe ſafetie bewraying ſecret wiſedome commendation alike dealt fooliſhly anſwering ſo hee ill looking ſtop mouth lye forewarneth v ſhift ſelues looke make part good lying though way lie open thereto readie hand ſee way ſinne kind thereof condemned howſoeuer little account made rather bee taken heed ſeeing oft time runne headlong haue ſaid wee ſee readier way ſhift ſelues wee thinke ſaue credit auoid greater danger ſeeing bee looked samſon caſe hee preſent ſhould prouide owne ſafetie lye poore ſhield whoſe innocencie watchfulnes ſhould haue defence let v beware entring acquaintance ſin bee coſtly maintaining draw man wretched neceſſitie adde thereto many ſins euen samſon muſt ſeeke couert ſafegard himſelfe lye want better except firſt daſh would haue gone ſtitch haue told matter touching dallying humour playing wilie beguily wiſdome skill enough ſhift trifling anſwers hardeſt ſhould come although ſauoured ſomewhat confidence conceitednes ſuppoſed ſtrength much like peter raſhnes hee told maſter ſhould denie luke 22 34 mat 26 34 35 yet ſequell bewraied common folly hee one eye might eaſily haue ſeene leſſe euill could follow alſo ſhall appeare due place hereafter hee told truth ſhe verily thought hee went verſ 8 9 forthwith make proofe word whereas hee told hee ſhould weakened bound ſeuen greene withe cord ſhe cauſed brought foorthwith ſhe bound though indeed hee brake oh wonderfull ſottiſhnes ſuffer ſhe certaine philiſtims lying waite chamber thereby ſhould ready take weakened indeed ſhe ſuppoſed looked thus wee ſee whereto flattering word tended euen ſeeke life good may looke haue neere fellowſhip ſecret company ſuch companion though salomon ſaith lip drop honey combe euen ſhe pleaſure ſelfe man yet path leade deſtruction prou 5 3 whore hunt pretious life man haue read many partly haue moſt wofully handled ſtrumpets themſelues haue truſted life good partly haue bin deliuered enemy hand ſlaine maruell ſhe hath ſold ſelfe much eaſilier ſell paramour therefore well ſame salomon giue warning ſhee bee ſhunned hell prou 7 27 mouth though bodily danger ſo much feared yet leaſt ſpirituall hurt farre greater occaſion ſay adde ſin farre grieuous abhorre common harlot might eaſily bewray yet refraine making thoſe going leaſt honeſt ſtoope lure ſo become whore diſhoneſt thing better ſort feared falſhood trecherie haue ſaid ſomwhat former chapter thus much firſt attempt delilah though ſhe preuailed verſ 10 ſhee ſought yet ſhee gained ſhee imboldned ſet vpō hauing receiued check diſcouragement ſhe done already therefore ſhee diſcouraged attempteth matter ſecond time theſe next three verſes ſeene ſhe boldly ſaid hee deceiued told lie might iuſtly cauſe ſhe ſaid doubt loue therfore ſhe required better dealing hand elſe ſhe ſhould much grieued ſhameleſſe behauiour ſhould teach v boldneſſe euill 1 high degree ſinne ſhould keepe ſelues farre euen dare open mouthes woman hearken conſent filthy vncleane demand motion wherby alſo ſhe may know priuie wickedneſſe v ſame ſay boldneſſe ſin boaſting threatning ſlandering lying ſwearing challenging fight like vnto theſe fearfull heare theſe ſee committed ſuch boldneſſe oh modeſty baſhfulnes ſeemly comely ornament euen conſcience yet wrought word wanting doe keepe preſerue many ſhamefull euils oftentimes haue religion guide defend boldnes ought vſed defence commendation ſute making good thing therein ſhewed note ſo employed kinde point heere enlarge ſeeing often commeth hand followeth samſons anſwere ſute ſecond attempt verſ 11 much like former ſaith bound new rope neuer occupied ſhall bee weake another man wherein wee ſee dallies ſtill ſuffers demand meet ſort haue ſuffered yea anſweres alſo though held lie yet ſeeing hee refuſe anſwere charge ſpeake ſecret bee vttered alſo hee doth ſo ſecond time tried already ſhe ſought know onely end ſhee might deliuer philiſtims hand theſe reſpects ſay palpable dotage doe ſo euen ſo next way ſet forward ſoliciting importuning till ſhee got hand therefore degree ſinne alſo bringing miſery might haue made wiſe enough haue refuſed heare hauing ſeene philiſtims lay chamber iuſt opportunity ſerued binde take may teach v better ſottiſhneſſe bee ſo impotently doct giuen ouer man appetite either way lingring clinging wicked woman purſuing hotly ſinne ſeeking fulfilling man deſire ſo way bee remoued eſpecially neither proofe former danger thereby feare preſent euill foreſeeing come yet certaine apparent hold though groſſe manner god ſeruants bee commonly enchanted bewitched monſtrous yet let v reſt like impotency hunting greedily wealth world ioying pride life c ſo bridle wee keepe vnder wicked heart eſpecially wee haue faire warning bring v ſuch like ſlauery bondage abhorre firſt entertaine eſpecially hauing proofe woe follow conſider fact samſon thinke phraſe holy ghoſt vſeth deſcribe ſinne meane drunkenneſſe occaſions note property drunkard wilfully ruſhing ſo obſerue one venterouſneſſe boldneſſe well ſaid deſcribed drunkennes among many property diſeaſe put man marueilous confident hope ſo dareth fight man without weapon ſobriety durſt encounter though well armed wonder braine ouercharged nature oppreſſed ſtead purelight vnderſtanding mind ingendred frothie conceit appearance ſtead ſpirit vigour affection ſucceedeth degenerate boldneſſe foolehardie ventrouſneſſe men iudge boldneſſe drunkard come rather want wit preſence courage euen thus fareth samſon diſtemper ſpirituall drunkenneſſe still make companion anſweres faire farre flouriſhing caſting skill ſtrength enough match goe beyond whereas ala fareth man ſpake thinking himſelfe ſtrong enough goe alone vpright tottereth falleth euery turne although ſecret yet vttered yet theſe preamble dalliance trifling nibling fiſh hopping bird bait ſnare ſhe haſteneth yet would ſeeme haſten vnto doubtleſſe samſon grace great part imbezeled feebled ere lock cut carried truer meaſure himſelfe better iudgement owne caſe thinke himſelfe owne man able reſiſt miſtriſſe rather luſt bound chaines laid vnder foot foiled vanquiſhed ah poore samſon may ſaid thou wert ſtrong enough match lion thouſands men grace ſtands bigneſſe bone ſtrength armes greatnes ſtomacke thy luſt thy harlot ſtronger lion mightie men therefore let enough conuict ſuch folly samſons humour tuſh ye muſt tell bad company ſtealing liberty god denieth would haue think haue ſhaken hand feare god would bee loth part good conſcience others yea may bee anſwered ſo thought samſon would haunt harlot houſe yet ſecretly keepe goodneſſe lay ſtrength effect poore ſoule onely fooliſh conceit boldneſſe indeed onely lay foundation woe felt declining weakeneſſe aſtoniſhment ſhaken louer departed hee feareth nothing till late make ſport play matter greateſt importance danger therfore ſuch bold perſons ſay turne looſe company ſtrongeſt enemie foiled laugh ſuch ſay yea ſhal ſure ſhal laughed though wiſe pitie rather ſhall giue counſell eſcape truly perſwade walke humbly feare owne frailty watch againſt ſuſpect owne frailty falſhood heart hee ſay may keepe miſchiefe hold venturing dealing ſuch aduerſary know maſter looke eſcape danger yet reiect grace know certainty theſe kind merchantventurers alwaies make ſhipwracke bring better gaine grace man hath little enough quench dart tentation ſuggeſted yet beginning ſinne ſhalt thou adding fewell fire helping diuell forward inward prouoking thy ſelfe ſinne thinke quit thy ſelfe well hotteſt aſſault god try thee grace ſhall bee ſufficient thee thou wilt tempt trouble thy 2 cor 12 9 ſelfe know thou haſt promiſe ſafety kept harmeles maieſt looke certainely thy downefall thy owne wiſedome grace propped vp ſuch pillers ſhall totter reele houſe hath loſt foundation yea goe worke thus owne head moſt aſſuredly samſon ſhall fall bewray folly laſt teach experience fooles wiſdome word vnhappy men could doe ſhall ſee oddes betwixt keeping innocent wilfull offending ſhall finde ſtrength one like though little aware ſuch matter iſſue ſecond attempt altogether former verſ 12 ſhe bound rope againe company lying ready purpoſe hand bin worke though yet fell hand let teach v onely feare ſuſpect trechery vnfaithfulneſſe leaud woman know ſuch one generally alſo wherein ſoeuer wee haue doe beware defile heart hand wicked action practiſes whatſoeuer ſhewes promiſes giuen offered v remembring word sauiour bee wiſe serpent innocent mat 10 16 doues beware men doe ſay though would teach men vncharitableneſſe charity ſuſpitious giue warning god ſeruants beware 1 cor 13 5 wee put ſelues men hand truſt faithfulneſſe vpon faire word countenance sauiour willeth v take ioh 2 24 heed giues v example alſo would commit himſelfe men though ſpeake faire giueth reaſon thereof knew man doe thus iudge men warie counſelled religion haue proofe thereof word deed yet ſo finally neither time onely lie knowne euill knowne reformed neither wee one ſide iudge men without ground warrant neither yet wee ſide commit ſelues hand hauing knowledge experience wee haue men vnfaithfulneſſe common vpon bare ſhew heere end time eightie fovre sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges third attempting samſon delilah followeth verſ 13 14 theſe next two verſes ſhee ſeeing hee dealt ſo ſlightly matter good earneſt forbid meddle ſtill dallied ſhe tooke deniall ſport therfore ſets vpon againe deſpairing importuning ſhee might time preuaile ouercome may learne reſiſt finne houerly doct ſo waighty matter ſtriking happineſſe deale ſlightly looſely wee doe againſt little enough withſtand wee giue token wee fall commit ſinne ſelfe ſhortly diuell wicked inſtruments lie way deceiue v draw v ſnare wiſe diſcerning artificial marking goe worke farre hold backe yeelding tentations doe earneſtly ſtrength reaſon reſolutely diſſwade ſelues ſame feruent conſtant therein put ſhifts inuent argument greater force whereby may better hope preuaile v diuell dealt saniour according reſolute ſtrong deniall moſt ſlie ſubtill mat 4 4 5 manner refuſe bait faintly balaam al ſhewes numb 22 38 2 pet 2 15 iud 11 made wage iniquity offered ſhew feare danger greatly like enſue ſtand ſtrongly owne conceit wee eaſily withſtand ſin vpſhot haue need counſelled againſt moſt day ſo deceiue themſelues diuell hath would hand doubt draw v ſnare commit ſinne ſhortly euen theſe ſpeake finde feele coſt confidence ſeeme haue samſon third attempt ſo far giuing ouer hauing twice tryed ſhe ſought life vtter vndoing yet hee anſweres doct 2 third time ſuch effeminate ſottiſhneſſe ſo howſoeuer hee thought ſtill conceale ſecret keepe himſelfe free vttering euen thitherto done yet hee began third attempt ſlide ſlip ſtagger drunken man little conſidering hee tampering locke told thing ſhe asked ſo came neerer bewraying vttering ſhee ſought hee could hardly conceale ſaying locke faſtened threeds woofe pin hee ſhould weakened another man ſhe thinking indeed hee came neere point ſeeing ſpake locke ſhe made triall word hauing done ſo ſhe called philiſtims againe ſet vpon yet hee held backe yeelding withſtood deceiued although hee much adoe ſee keepe whereby wee may ſee men giue themſelues liberty full doct ſcope talke fro thing dangerous hurtfull take liking therein auoid occaſions reſiſt tentations drawing leading thereto ſhall chuſe bee ſnared caught therewith though intend ſuch thing came paſſe ſo note ſhall hardly forbeare containe themſelues running headlong giuen ouer thereto led away owne concupiſcence saint iames ſaith inticed alſo ſnared ſo iam 1 14 cannot well go ready conſent wee ſee samſon afterward telling whole heart vnto euen ſo ſay men ſhall oft long tampering ſinne whereto neerely affected come readily ſpeedily conſenting committing ſhould rather turne away weane themſelues betimes leaſt liking longing much leſſe ſhould haſten liberall talking ſuffer ſelues importuned caſes medling need doubteth ſhall much eaſilier yeeld thereto thoſe commonly wee call men good nature tainted leaud company grow firſt diſſolute degree deſperate wax rotten degree wee ſee fruit long lying doth wee ſee running houreglaſſe euery part ſands courſe haſtening houre end though laſt paſſage actuall ending reof ſo may ſay samſon dallying houering reply euen firſt ſecond third preparation final bewraying ſecret though fourth onely confeſſed actually fourth away matter whole fourth firſt ſecond third though obſcurely enfolded ala firſt ſhifting thought hee might haue proceeded ſtill ſecret firſt daſh waighty vtter ſo two three dalliance tentation preuailed ſtrong longer ſhift withhold reſiſt like let v know euen alſo ſpokon vnto v fourth attempt followeth ſhee gaue deadly verſ 15 16 17 blow warning ſerue man chuſe fall danger great ſoeuer would meanes auoide might let v heare dealing growne ſubtill wee thinke theſe thing done betwixt one day foure day together act heere ſet downe number foure immediately following one another ſome ſpace betwixt ſhe might take fit occaſion ſubtill manner renue ſuite requeſt againe shee beginneth therefore manner whereas hee told hee loued ſhee ſubtilly anſwered ſhee ſaw hee loued becauſe heart hee mocked three time told ſhe asked ſubtill ſecret winding impudent importunity earneſt vrging wiſedome thought holding lie delay ieſting manner yet thinking following matter ſhe good earneſt ſaying hee grieued becauſe ſhe ſaw loued brought thereby pitie ſo wounded ſubtil flattering diſſembling ſore vexed ſee ſo grieued therefore great woe like bring himſelfe neuer duly conſidered ouercome told according deſire heart euen hee might bee brought loſe ſtrength ſumme theſe three verſes let v weigh theſe thing particularly 15 verſe doct verſ 15 ſubtilty woman learned laſt told loued yet ſhe knew doted ſee artificiall wicked eaſily grow herein need doubt ye like offender like ſoone deceiuers attempt doe waxe worſe worſe ripe ſubtilty deceiuing ſaith paul timothy obſerue 2 tim 3 12 moſt part men fitted trade wit meanely bungerly ſoeuer go worke compariſon begin world meane ſubtilty ouer doe afterward ſoone grow ripe faculty euery kinde euill dealing experience ſheweth cleerely ſay men obſerued would confeſſe leſſe ſay whether ſpeake begin vnlawfull trade courſes whoredome oppreſſion flattery beguiling ſuch thoſe lawfull buying ſelling letting houſe land earthly dealing may bee ſeene vniuſt steward euill practiſes luk 16 3 vſed theſe cunning craft found inuented goe one beyond another otherwiſe time paſt moſt part haue done admirable conſider ſhew plainly purpoſe mind ſet heart vpon better thing howſoeuer ſome beare v hand doe ſerue god well beſt ſo would leſſe thought long imbrace goſpell grow experienced well ſeaſoned ſuch true ſauing knowledge holy doctrine whereby abhorre ſuch dregges doings attaine finding chriſtian life meate drinke doe ſo may worthily bee complained yea lamented teares euery ſuch could doe ſee fewneſſe latter ſort many euery ſwarming former ripeneſſe ſinne elſewhere yet adde vtter griefe euen theſe ripe headed nimble fellowes grow ſo ſoone maſters trade haue ſerued halfe prentiſhip ſhall ſuch dullard dunce ſearching themſelues trying whether ſtate ſaluation ſeeking acquaintance god conſidering hath helpes former example preſent meanes purpoſe greater euer age ſince apoſtles time ſhall domineere ouer others ſet vp himſelfe ſhall cogge coſen goe beyond neighbour deceiue hath ſtrings bow ſhift ſcrape rake pelfe together howſoeuer age may commence higheſt degree profeſſion skill ripeneſſe miſchiefe bounded within delilah trade though doubtleſſe ſtrumpets old age punies ſubtilty villany extends farre prince world hath ſubiects ye go enquire hath made chriſtian life eaſie conſtancy obedience liueth ſweet life void ſorrow reſolute purpoſe endeuour abſtaining euill watching ouer heart life alwaies alſo enioyeth liberty god alloweth reſt aſſured loue ſo goe one duty another without vnſetledneſſe wearines note diſquietneſſe word ye enquire man hath ſo improued doctrine goſpell hee hath found hundredfold mat 19 29 meaſure contentment reiecting lying vanity ſo hee become light example others like thoſe theſſalonians paul 1 theſ 1 7 calles paternes thoſe saint dauid calleth excellent ſay pſal 16 3 inquirie made theſe yet beſt yee ſhall finde meete ſee affect anſwere great matter oh euery little enough godlineſſe men content mediocritie heere godlineſſe vice vertue perfection maſterſhip god trade alſo without compariſon greateſt gaine worke tedious men vnhappie cannot hit vpon samſon ſo blindfolded beautie hee become ſicke ſeeing grieued ſo muſt reſt good earneſt muſt vtter ſecret elſe loued ſhe charged could ſhe beare vnkindneſſe hand ſhe louing ſo dearely ſhe made thinke ſhe ſubtiltie ſide ſhould care ſay thus blindfolded oft importunate vrging ſo wounded rather hee would haue thought hee cut loue death thinke hee could hold longer told ſhe asked till hee felt late hee vndone make others afraid example make ſport ſinne trifle matter ſuch conſequence may learned samſon companion verſ 16 ſinne ieſtingly dalliance thinking yet themſelues goe ſhall fall good earneſt ſhall bee able auoid might bee exemplified many particular pray giue v leaue merrie ſaith wanton meane harme harme waiteth dalliance angrie moody perſon yet knowes dangerous ſinne anger giuing reine himſelfe reſiſting occaſions time ſtrikes wound length kils rage yet ye muſt let alone cannot angry ſaith prouoked hath ſpoken hath done nay many man hath vndone himſelfe ere hath done dallying ſinne ill playing beares lion fierce creature amiable note qualitie ſinne moſt hideous monſter man danger deuoured hee playeth onely prophane world doe proue bee true ſhame many would better thought euen godly doe finde ſo yeelding luſts bad deſires farre haue power ouer themſelues brought point either conſciences diſquiet ſore torment bring foorth ſight men ſinne much gaue ouer themſelues vnto delighted haue heard dauid let bee warning dally ſinne ieſt neerer aware satan meane drawing goe brim banck riuer plunge headlong bottome depth let men rather farre treading ſteps leade thereto haue obſerued threefold dallying anſwere therefore briefer another thing heere samſon let v learne euen death men bee put vnlawfull delight pleaſures haue giuen ouer themſelues brutiſhly ſottiſhly vnto hee vexed almoſt death heare tell ſhe muſt forſake could loue hart toward ſhe ſaw yet ſhe ſpake groſſe diſſembling bondage grieuous greater bondage whore man cannot cling lure whoſe heart falſe toward ſeeketh deſtruction muſt take heed reſt beſt thing ſubiect change much wee hang ſecuritie vpon deceitfull pleaſures eſpecially vpon wicked alluring woman whō rather samſon would thinke forgoing behold ſhameth abandon god conſcience ſpeake outward miſchief note enſued ſurely true samſon ſinned againſt conſcience ſhall ſay commit ſecret filthines greedines yet without remorſe death think pluckt violence old acquaintance cuſtom become poore man lambe nathan deſcribes dauid euen 2 sam 12 3 ſonne therefore men haue liued long time lewd courſe without let welcome death make vtter ſeparation betweene luſts liued ſtreight league vnion ſoule body together oh bondage vnſpeakable bee inwardly note linked loue neither enioied extreame miſerie forgone intollerable vexation let one motiue among others humble ſinner god ſhew meaſure ſinfull corrupt nature alſo teach ſo eagerly purſue luſts except bring world ſorrow vpon himſelfe time forſaking come though laſt caſt many man renounces old courſes vngodlines repents yea aſhamed doings conſcience terrified ſome violent feare griefe hee hath proſpereth euil yet ala ſeeth theſe terror ſeaze vpon muſt think ſeaze vpō al many dying ſots liued without feeling moſt part vaniſh away come nothing ſo thoſe great penitent get vp recouer maladie far doe put remembrance former trouble ſhew diſtaſtfull vnto forced bitternes thereof note ſay thing libertie returne againe naturally byas ſtone falleth downward oh therefore pray labour may bee good ye ſet heart delight accounted moſt precious end elſe bitter parting euer loue enioying loue beſt thing feare exceed meaſure beſides vnſpeakable ſound ioy affoord alſo yeeld euen perpetuitie ſhall neuer bee pulled away sauiour ſaith ioy ſhall man take iohn 26 22 ſo wrought wiſe hee thought himſelfe purpoſing ſhee ſhould neuer know ſhee ſought verſ 17 hand yet becauſe gaue place wicked affection onely ſnared danger told vnto wit neuer came raſor head locke cut ſhould loſe ſtrength much told might take life bring ſhame ſorrow vpon deed yet hee might though ſmall effect haue ſaid wit beſide euill ſhall ſuſtaine hereby doe alſo ſet lord againſt depriue grace thy ſake thus much doubtleſſe ſuffered ſo many good obſeruations ariſe wiſe man may ſeek doct 1 begin firſt briefly two three one ſhall need complaine hurt wrong doe vnto v common place doe witneſſe none greater enemy v ſelues hee monſter men ſhould offer note one halfe vnto v samſon himſelfe may ſeene behold leſſe doe ſome nay many offer themſelues ſtorme rage crie hold little due v much wee ſuſtaine greater hurt whereas ſinnes worke owne woe yet blind ſelfloue neuer angrie ſelues yet wee could finde heart purſue others vnto death oh rend heart ſins deeply diſpleaſed ſelues theſe philiſtims could haue done samſon miſchiefe himſelfe owne folly rather madneſſe attempted ſuch matter againſt make infamous hee made himſelfe would ſtreight haue reuenged nay hee reuenge ſequell leaue ſinned reuenging come ſelues dare iuſtly reproue v fault neuer ſo groſſe ſhall haue badge liuerie preſently thinke enemie watch ſeaſon euen eſau dealt brother iacob yet gen 27 41 ſo farre louing reproofe hurting v wee men wee ſhould might keepe hurt ſpeake lighting vpon v precious balme vnto head well wiſe man ſay pſal 141 5 ſee theſe men alous themſelues owne hurt endure touch flee face long enough hoped ere wrong themſelues willingly indeede reaſon ſenſible proofe moſt prepoſterous man take loſſe penny anothers hand without ſtorming ſpend many pound haue wicked deſire ſatisfied nay vndoe himſelfe ſtrip himſelfe hath yet thinke neuer worſe himſelfe hee hath done nay man may tell neither therefore preuent outcry late repentance time come time ſuch fooles crie loſt haue vndone ſelfe let v learne way become owne beſt friend greateſt enemy ſinne moſt preuaileth v threatneth greateſt deſolation god take man part againſt note himſelfe moſt ſtriueth hate himſelfe meane corruption within deare himſelfe till wee come point haue heartie indignation ſin haue moſt delighted wee haue againſt others cauſe ſometime againſt note ſelues circumuented ouerſhot bargaine cunning coſener farre repentance eſtate wiſe man ſhould reſt though worke bee difficult confeſſe ſpeake buſineſſe though man haue many thoſe great enemy hinder yet ſinfull heart dangerous trecherie whereof onely enemy doe miſchiefe doubtleſſe diuell ſtrongeſt allurement rebound backe hurt neither enter heart lieth open euill vnfenced againſt euill remaineth beſt occaſioneth externall euill enemy ſtirre vp encreaſe pure angel haue diuels enuious enemy nay ſinne make god enemie euer euer reconciled lieth harboured vnremoued otherwiſe though hee correct v yet hee loueth v father child cauſe much enemie meane ſinne effect god enmitie therefore hee afflicteth ſinne count enemie croſſe hee inflicteth patiently beare ſay goe vnder triall willingly ſeeing haue ſinned turne griefe againſt chiefe enemie knowing except ſinne vndoe thing ſhall turne good rather alſo samſon brought hee neuer meant 2 bee wit vtter ſecret baſe houſewife following importunitie note force widow importunitie luke 18 5 ouercame wicked iudge grant iuſtice though mind ſo doe let v ſee good men importunate v thing elſe turne wee away hearing ioſeph alluring miſtreſſe let v ſpecially vſe importunitie gen 39 10 earneſt ſuite sauiour hath willed v god prayer wicked iudge would moued ſaith sauiour heare poore luke 18 7 widow leſt ſhe ſhould make wearie ſhall god auenge elect crie day night largely 14 chapter like occaſion againe thinkes anſwere samſon ſuch ſtrumpet 3 nazarite c lock cut ſhall another man ſauoureth incredible ſottiſhnes argueth plainly wretched ſinner breaketh courſe till heate power ſinne doe yeeld tyrannie thereof hee bound hand foote carried whither creditor aduerſarie whither himſelfe liſteth cannot enough excuſe samſon might haue hee would rather haue choſen haue kept ſecret like brought ſtockes ſet heeles brought ſtreight hee would doe hee deſired ſhunne himſelfe headſtrong luſt hauing got hand ouer note vſed impotently made ſtark beaſt ſlauiſh foole knew ſorrow muſt ineuitably enſue vpon betraying himſelfe yet hath ſay grace vnder boord ſtrength containe himſelfe ſaid minde touching vpon 4 verſe entice c execution plot doth liuely preſent eye nature ſinne take wiſedome man firſt impoſeth condition pleaſeth knowing man would neuer ſuch vaſſall ſo long right minde wit samſon could ſay nazarite c ſo could haue ſaid ſin ſhall make ſelfe pureſt worſhipper god moſt prophane creature execrable samſon would ſay ſo leaſt weigh deſperatly runnes vpon pike doubtleſſe power though ſaluation lien vpon time preuent bleſſed bee god holdeth election men haue loſt grace feeling samſon loſt eye ere philiſtims put let little enforce vpon ſo iuſt occaſion fourth verſe boldly auerre affirme ſay tell ſinne proue good euidence bring ſuch ſorrow samſons peter dauids salomon commit count foole indeed put one thing beleeue thee occaſion offered god grace bee ſtirring effectuall thee watchfulnes iealouſie ouer thy ſelfe thou wilt abſtaine vpon meditation ala find grace ſtrength oftentatiō ſought without yet thou maiſt haue matter enough thy minde diſſwade flaite thee denie thou ſhalt haue ſmall liſt power weigh ponder nay thy intangled drunken heart make ſot thy minde moſt diſguiſed beaſt thee heart infatuate luſt ſtoppeth freeſeth vp paſſage knowledge cannot ſuccour poore diſtreſſed embondaged ſoule leaue ſhift conclude samſons ſin preſumptuous impotencie yet vnauoidable caſe ſtanding oh ſtill learne men haue quit themſelues well ſoone haue ſpoken bold word againſt ſinne generall come particular doe men haue blood ſaith curſed cain though hanged preſently yet hee knoweth ſhame woe thereof ſome iewes ſome knew well enough scripture ſaith knowne would haue crucified lord life ſometimes denie ciuill men kept crime meane good men offending though ſtrongly tempted goe ſtifly rule ſtill ſay thee ſhall reade beware dalliance venturing farre thou ſhalt haue power withdraw thou wouldeſt wouldeſt thou mighteſt truſt thy ſelfe thy ſtrength caſe bruſed reede beſt lawes leaue little iudge may becauſe man ſubiect corruption except god grace law within thee ſuſpect ſtrong purſuite luſt thou art iudge aduiſe thy ſelfe wilt hardly law thy ſelfe gouerne thee thou fearfull giue little libertie thine heart euill great note ſhall maſter thee thou feare anger thou ſhalt murtherer thou flee baite ſnare ſhall catch thee euer beare minde sinne groweth predominant get maſterie man may well mad reaſon ſinne reaſon think moderate himſelf yeeld euer ſlaue ſinne force thee yeeld euen ſtrong fit ague maketh doe ſtrongly ſhaketh thus much time eightie five sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges proceed ſtory becauſe ſee samſon though otherwiſe indued god ſingular doct 3 verſ 17 grace yet moſt impotently giuen ouer loue woman wee doe reade hee elſe tainted ſins let admoniſh v may poſſibly weake reſiſting prone committing ſome one ſinne another ſhall bee amiſſe v think ſeeing haue ſo many example scripture ſin common among moſt ſay end euery one v ſhould obſerue ſelues ſee ſelues weakeſt vſe moſt meanes ſtrengthen ſelues againſt ſame watching prayer reading houerly heartily ſeeke better thereby wiſe dare bold commit ſeeing cannot bee ſure ill ſucceſſe samſon hee husbandman ſuruaies ground vſeth fence quick ſet ſtrong thicke hedge thin troden downe wee loue lay load need blemiſh liues make reſt diſgracefull therefore requireth labour blot wee cannot abide ſet ſelues amend ſo much take knowledge yet one dead flie corrupts whole pot ſweeteſt oyntment ſweeter ſooner salomon eccleſ 10 1 exceſſiueneſſe kinde defame excellency gift doe ſee experience truth hereof honeſt man ſaith one couetous haſty vncharitable breaker promiſe one interpoſition eclipſe light credit yea paul like kinde ſpake houſe cloe cauſe ſo 1 cor 1 11 weighty caſe euen tuſh matter ſay one infirmity none wee hope many good quality conceit leaſt muſt priuiledge v licenſe v ſcapes ala erre foully one ſecret lurking companion enough betray houſe eſpied ſay men v nay hee doe thus thus worſe dare truſt kind occaſion ſerue oh caſt diuell watching faſting prayer oft renued couenant lurketh behind doe miſchiefe many others ſeeme caſt till beare thy head high doubtleſſe god ſuffer ſuch one proſper doe profeſſing take liberty except wil haue good deed ſhame euil become execrable becauſe company iſrael achans ſinne wee keepe ſeruant ioſh 7 12 houſe otherwiſe none worſt painfull ſome leaud quality ſake though would giue v ſeruice ſhall god endure v man may feele ſin hee cheriſheth well meate loueth doth know let know god mocked let ſuffer ſinne rankle feſter labour purge euery ſuperfluity fleſh ſpirit ſanctifie whole lumpe may bee ſeaſoned euery part conſcience may bee good thing haue heard ſhe brought tell great verſ 18 19 20 ſtrength lay let v ſhut vp ſecond part chapter ſee followed vpon ſet downe theſe next three verſes firſt ſhee ſumme cauſed philiſtims come yet againe better hope cauſing samſon ſleepe vpon knee lock ſhe cauſed cut philiſtims ready take thinking doe hee time paſt done free himſelfe hand found late adam eating fruit lord departed heere ſhee philiſtims hauing diſappointed deceiued doct verſ 18 ſo oft euen three time leaſt yet diſcouraged wearied goe ſtill yea preuaile length may ſee euill perſons withheld diſcouraged bad attempt take hart go forward many repulſes reaſon haue hope preuaile doe commonly miſſe purpoſe following ſo earneſtly going ſo ſubſtantially worke doe god ſuffering goe forward ſeeing hee purpoſed deſtroy moſt cleerely bee ſeene ſpitefull ſhameleſſe attempt prieſts againſt sauiour ſeeking life though pilate three time alleaged innocency giuen luk 23 22 23 anſwere deſiſt yet could bee made leaue procured themſelues falſe witneſſes confederate ſuch wiſe ſought made end diligence vnweariedneſſe good cauſes bee ſought yet ſuch would gladly effect ſhall bee found nay ſoone anſwered put faint ſuters eſter indeed eſter 4 16 ſome ieopard liues good cauſe preſerue church god time many follower may ſeene indeed many log way hinder goodneſſe much diſcouragement giuen ſuch would bee forward yet men backwardneſſe may wiſe excuſed know whether lord may one time giue ſucceſſe wee good tarrie leiſure often philiſtims hauing better hope preuaile former time 2 ſhee giuen vnderſtand came money hand ready paid according promiſe beſides may ſee wicked ſpare coſt bring bad matter paſſe follow better cauſes looke vpon penny draw backe ſhall begin ſay beſide ye may ſee breake promiſe bee liberall ſuch buſineſſe like well ſucceſſe haue therein would might truly ſay better attempt oft time drawing backe euen promiſed ſo farre men furthering goodnes deale heerein moſt doe promiſes though aduiſedly made therein like done elſewhere haue alſo bewailed impudent ſhameleſſe woman brought prince verſ 19 philiſtims together haue heard former verſe ſhewed ſhe made ſleepe vpon knee cauſed ſeuen lock head ſhauen ſhee began vex calling philiſtims ſtrength gone moſt baſe thing vtterly vnbeſeeming hauing excellent doct gift god ſhould become ſlaue ſuch whoriſh miſtriſſe bee made ſleepe vpon knee hee would turne face thouſand men lie downe foot leaud woman oh ſottiſh follie almoſt incredible thus gift might bee reuerenced ſay ſuch good grace might go many brought ſhame abuſing ſins come place way commonly baſe houſewife man gift bringeth honour euen note ſo ſame perſon deface gift deſpiſed faire comely garment ſimil ſoiled filthie lothſome channell mire dung hee cannot keepe credit honour god hath giuen worthie without deriſion memorable lord ſpake hophni phinees ſinne among others deſpiſe ſet light men good 1 sam 2 30 part neuer ſet vp ſo much leaudneſſe defaceth vile ſinne make traitor iudas contempt caſt vpon demas 2 tim 4 10 forſaken paul baſe word doth many man vncleanneſſe make nay many profeſſour good hope though haue repented yet brand contempt diſdaine doth hee carrie dying day ruben geneſ 49 dignity gen 49 4 gone yet come samſons puniſhment baſeneſſe ſpeak companion rather fruit ſin doubtles would neuer appeare many man think ſin ornamēt vile occupation ſometimes hee ſaw baſe ſeruice put note heathen ſaw leſſe deſcribe ſhadow mighty giant enamored ſtrumpet made lay aſide harneſſe ſit ſpinning diſtaffe betweene knee yet many ciuill man diſcretion would ſhun many ſinne ſhame example seeing man good quality ſort giuen drinking gaming ſo farre giuen ouer hee rather make baſeſt fellow towne companion ſit hee thinketh may doe yet hee loathe baſeneſſe ſinne ſuch like count repugning common honeſty returne men good part otherwaies doe ſhame themſelues groſſe ſinnes well enough ſerued need venture ſo farre owne luſts forſake ſeruices god houſe meaneſt whereof honorable next thing followed ſhee cauſed one cut lock haire couered head deadly wound ſhe gaue therewith ſtrength failed grace likewiſe forſooke heere may ſee degree man ſhall bee brought loweſt ebbe depth ſinne samſon broke law nazarite doct 2 ſolemne law wedlocke betwixt couple therby made himſelfe profane looſe liued moſt holy eſtate yea ſinne compariſon ſhould bee made farre greater breach law wedlocke ſeeing one particular general ſetting open doore many ſins oh little thought thinke ſhall euer commit wee begin tamper odious fearefull ſinnes hazael prophet told 2 king 8 13 euill ſhould doe anſwered dogge ſhould doe great thing yea haue begun alſo dallie mean leade yet thinke keepe farre enough yet ſee heere followeth end wherein abaſement ſtood ſhall appeare particular follow loſſe ſtrength god preſence lock cut former theſe ſaid loſing ſuch good thing enioyed ſuch action ier 5 25 doe onely hold many good thing v alſo depriue v thoſe ſinnes depriue v one benefit god ſome another riot ill company ſpend good drunkenneſſe whoredome waſte body care world vo • uptuous delighting rich doe moth eate vp religion sabbath loſt ill vſing euen samſon loſt ſtrength whereby hee ſlaine thouſand one time without either helpe man vſe warlike inſtrument haue samſons ſtrength loſe wilful ſinne waſteth chriſtians ſtrength alacrity meane cheerefulneſſe ſpirit duty god worſhip ſaid enough point vpon cap 5 complaint debora ſpeare loſe bee fruit bare ſloth neglect much contempt wilfull ſinning againſt knowledge ſhall need greatly care may loſe grace quencher euen nouriſheth fire ſhall ſoone enough loſe adam eue ſtrength giuen zeale loſe gift ſauour religious note exerciſes wax barren grace length fall leaud company follow common faſhion world nay become diſgracers truth louers thereof moſt repugnant practiſe neuer poore vnarmed traueller falling among theeues ſo bereft money apparell comfort gameſter ſhrigged ouerreacht falſe handed coſoner tree ſo ſtript beautiful leaues fruit violence tempeſt poore samſon heere gratious furniture ſpirit vnkindly aſſault ſinfull luſt oh difference betweene samſon himſelfe betwixt diſguiſed nakedneſſe ſinne cauſed vſe heereof teach v ſeeing hee grew low ebbe degree forementioned therefore promiſe ſelues priuiledge beyond otherwiſe preuenting meanes leading thereto let v thinke grace haue ſeeing coſt v much paine obtaine much hearing long practiſe vſe many good meanes watchfulneſſe prayer let v thinke ſay therefore wee need feare ſuch ſudden loſſe ah foole come day came ſeuen yeeres houſes iobs child blowne downe ſo may man goodneſſe ſtrength bee waſted ſuddenly dangerous fall yea fruit many yeeres growth gaine may periſh day though denie vſually paireth degree rather ſinnes committed daily duty neglected ſtrength chriſtian lie faith truly samſons locke faith quailed wilfull ſinning man feele god louing giues leaue himſelfe offend much fruites alſo decay feruency care feare diligence good duty c one growes vnbeleefe ſo degenerate deadneſſe careleſneſſe looſeneſſe c whereas ſome cauiller lying wind aduantage might ſay ſee samſon condemned ſhauing locke therefore long haire ſuch blameworthy habite ſome would ſeeme make anſwere two way firſt guiſe samſon common generall permitted indifferent perſonall belonging vow nazarite aboliſhed abſtaining ſtrong drinke ſuppoſe greater part plead long haire ſo eaſily yeeld abſtaine secondly ſay though liberty extended yet equitie thoſe might challenge moſt due moſt proportionable nazarite pure worſhip ping god theſe former reſpect ſee ſmall cauſe vſe ſuch habite condemne moſt vnſeemly wearer thereof moſt prophane worſhippers beſt ſuppoſe none moſt pure worſhippers god therefore let abuſe returne heires firſt inuented couer ſhame lewdnes firſt brought vpon enough wiſe man ſaid vpon thirteenth chapter foole though hee braied morter yet would follie depart prou 27 22 ſaid theſe two verſes ſtrength gone ſhe verſ 15 20 began vexe calling philiſtims hand fall vpon handle pleaſure ſo oh wee ſee eaſie matter bring miſerie vpon one ſhall onely deſtitute earthly helpe haue god againſt alſo euen ſo iudas time viſitation came hee vtterly forſaken god beſide hee caſt maſter diſciples fellowes prieſts pretended friend caſt samſon forſaken louer hated philiſtims lord left therefore neerely prouerb verified woe alone vnlike thriftleſſe debtor folly come vpon creditor haled priſon forſaken friend deſtitute comfort might haue liued comfortable manner haue comfort others wiſe carefull managing buſineſſe vſe thus much ſhould fall danger haue men yea friend againſt v ſometimes may befall v good cauſe yet lay foundation ſtrongly lord forſake v 2 chron 15 2 doubtleſſe doe forſake touching cruell trecherie betraying thus reueiled himſelfe detecteth like vnfaithfulnes whereſoeuer found chriſtians monſtrous ſuch falſehearted one farre worſe philiſtims samſon awaked ſee done verſ 20 thought hee would doe hee done namely ſtrength ſhift himſelfe could lord departed leauing hath alreadie ſaid without ſtrength body vſe grace guide himſelfe comfort minde ſee god hath deliuered men doct oft time danger looke ſtill ſhould doe ſo neuer thinking iuſtly might haue plunged deeply ſame long neither weighing owne ſecuritie little regarded profit deliuerances paſt exceeding blockiſhnes ſenſeleſnes men prophet ſaith wiſe onely doe euill good looke iere 4 22 ſhould doe haue done thing like haue done pleaſe allowance note haue god libertie ſo nay rather conſider god againſt bad courſe therefore haſt ſeeing plague hang ouer head prou 22 3 haſt good captaine humble themſelues god elia craue pardon 2 king 1 13 oh let beſt v know wee may neſtle ſelues ill courſe though wee haue bold lord time paſt way wee yet leſſe experienced tempt farre deceiue ſelues haue done imagining ſhall doe well former day changeable world ſuch change come ofteſt change euill courſes beſides god mocked bad crie peace caſe much worſe thus corah periſhed companie yet thought ſhould haue ſtill time paſt iezabel deceiued 1 king 19 2 threatned elia ſhould loſe head morrow little weighing one day doth bring foorth ſhe little loſt life 2 king 9 33 fearfull manner peace vngodly ſaith iſai 57 21 god thus samſon though reprobate yet miſerable reuolter fared knew god gone looked eſcape done diſappointed deceiued palpable deceiuablenes bred v dreame god hee pſalme ſaid ſeeing god winke held peace euill therefore hee himſelfe approued pſal 50 21 bad courſe would doe neither good euill ſo change proſperitie thought bee feared confeſſe god ſuffereth long adminiſtration doth oft time let ſuch meaneth deſtroy goe without ſtop proſper oxe fatted ſlaughter whereas hee meeteth owne child mercie though ſmart bitternes rather ſhould periſh howbeit neither courſe generall appeares many example scripture experience whoſe ſinnes haue gone hand doth hold life yet faileth death ſure courſe altred wicked man prophet ſaith iſai 65 20 though hundred yeere old accurſed day commeth whereof ſhall ſaid yeſterday let terrifie vngodly one leſt god come vpon vnawares alter condition moſt intollerable vexation let thē rather men amazed terror god ſhake hand renounce ſtale courſe wherein ſetled frozen let trie whether vnfained humbling ſoules obtaining mercie god finde happie euer changed eſtate doe vnderſtand perſons make farre vſe god ſparing samſon doe occaſion themſelues ſinne boldly ſtill yet promiſe themſelues peace former time ſay men bee found ſay may ought looke build vpon certaine ſhall well time ſo faith teacheth ſpeake ſuch haue obtained fauour god might beleeue token thereof walke way euen wom god hath giuen ſuch heart feare endeuour obey commandements ſay may aſſure themſelues ſhall finde goe well alway marke ſay alway day yeſterday time paſt ſo samſon found hee walked according rule knowne ſuch haue fully purpoſed cleaue vnto god without warping falling ſinne doe fully account beleeue ſoules ſhall alway note liking fauour bleſſed men deſire haue thinke promiſe entailed bare bond election adoption conſtant care keepe holding faſt good conſcience waxe diſſolute let look good day ſhall changed ſorrowfull god giueth man certaintie outward eſtate peace health wealth friend proſperitie much leſſe granteth man ſecuritie impenitent courſe laſtly whereas ſaid lord gone meaning 2 hee taken ſtrength grace enioyed ſo feebled darkned drowned hee loſt inward peace toward god hope pardon yet ſuch hypocrite god hath made affliction vnder haue groaned break heart reclaime though former grace honour neuer recouered like danger lye open vnto dare tempt cloſe vnto retaine zeale ioy comfort promiſes poore samſon committing either ſame great offence haue euill conſciences cold comfort thoſe faint prayer leſſe fellowſhip god yea ſenſe feele election
