would haue guſtered flaited could ſoone haue grieued decay leaſt grace want little trouble note wofull loſe grace feele ſuch loſſe yet yet ſuch like men wilfull ſin cauſeth thē vſe teach v onely abhorre cauſe hereof eſteeme mercie mercy haue tender conſcience watchfull heart effectuall operatiue may make liues plentifull good duty ſound comfort ariſing therefrom vſe cauſe v feele abhorne leaſt temptation ſinne moſt certainly procure ſenſeleſnes herein vnprofitable lying vnder burthen ſecond part samſons apprehenſion ſeuerall worthy inſtructions ariſing therefrom bee ſpoken confequents thereof next sermon god willing eightie six sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges third part chapter verſ 21 therefore philiſtims tooke put eye brought downe azzah bound fetter hee grinde priſon houſe 22 haire head began grow againe ſhauen 23 prince philiſtims gathered together offer great ſacrifice dagon god reioyce ſaid god hath deliuered samſon enemy hand 24 alſo people ſaw praiſed god ſaid god hath deliuered hand enemy deſtroyer countrey hath ſlaine many v 25 heart merrie ſaid call samſon hee may make v paſtime called samſon priſon houſe hee laughing ſtccke vnto ſet betweene pillers theſe fiue verſes third part chapter ſumme ſhewed manifold outward vexation brought vpon samſon many ſinnes though philiſtims inſtruments thereof intended ſuch thing yet ſhewed theſe tribulation repent reade manaſſes haue done affliction 2 chton 33 12 heere ſhewed alſo great ioy philiſtims prince people got hand though ioy laſted praiſed idoll dagon gathered themſelues together great number make themſelues paſtime bringing forth samſon pleaſure end euen laughed theſe thing ſet forth theſe verſes laſt ſhewed ſet betwixt pillers whereby samſon made preparation miſchiefe hee brought vpon philiſtims caſting downe houſe vpon firſt god thus gaue samſon vp hand enemy doct verſ 21 puniſhed ſee iuſt lord ſo prouoking hee vncircumciſed philiſtims ſay wee learne need bee breake boldly againſt hee muſt make owne deare child ſmart well loueth apoſtle peter ſpeaketh brought hand enemy 1 pet 1 6 heere ſeene euen ſo vſeth doe cauſe ſeeth meet reaſon end may riſe vp againe falles repent working affliction god bleſſing fitteth rather proſperity ſo ready abuſe preſently ſhall appeare ſtory meane wicked going ſinnes readier iudgement one time meeteth taketh hold ſhould thus take downe pride boldneſſe tempting could brought good knowne ſo cauſe wee ſhould diſcontentedly beare affliction eſpecially ſelues hauing giuen iuſt cauſe thereof reioyce trouble themſelues trouble v ſay except repent ſo become true worſhippers god v lord ſhall trouble vex euery vaine heart ſo farre trouble ſhall exceed goe beyond god threatneth ſecond epiſtle theſſalonians may ſee calamity diues 2 theſ 1 6 eſpecially compared lazarus comfort come lay trouble particular let v ſee one thing omitted samſons puniſhment wee may diſcerne euident proofe god iuſt equall proceeding reuenge euery relapſe mentioned scripture note may afraid tempt wee ſee samſons diſeaſe groſſe grieuous ſinne began bee ſeated habited hee ſcaped philiſtims laid wait azza verſe 2 3 god ſpared gaue ſafe conduct putting proofe behold ſin ſubdued abhorred vnkinde itch killed milde medicine prouoketh god freſh ſame ſinne hee fire raked vp hot aſhes catching hold new fit matter worke vpon flameth amaine ſecond time therfore much water wil quench much leſſe letting alone like heale doth god deale taketh hand pay home make ſee hee dallieth dallier ſo faine beare penalty former dealt dauid extreme dealing two ſo great ſo rebellious ſinnes adultery murther take away child borne adultery eſpecailly ſo patient reſpit betweene dauid forgot gentle correction ſo hainous offence therefore waxed hee bold againe lord ſhewed ſuch lenity ſo prouoked againe grieuous manner ambitious numbring ſubiects eſcape cleerely god remembreth ſtory well witneſſeth ſets himſelfe reſolute courſe reuenge ſo hee till hee made dauids heart ake ſo ſaw boldneſſe tempting god little gained hee ſtayed till angell well ſlaked matter ambition ſlaying ſeuentie thouſand people let watchword v god haue mercifully paſſed ſome wilfull offence ſparing v ſay count great aduantage fauour dare bold prouoke againe may iuſtly feare ſcourges wil bee ſmartie samſon many found bee ſay wee haue heard many ſinnes samſon committed doct 2 inward vexation mind god departed though ſaw purpoſed little lay particularly outward miſeries ſet downe verſe done heapes one another firſt ſaid tooke apprehended liberty yet forthwith put death would bee ſatisfied ſo ſhort reuenge ſo bee rid hee ſhould ſuffer longer paine ſo meant keepe aliue ſo hold vpon racke much torment vexation might bee worſe death vnto therefore plucked eye thereby prouided ſhould ſee doe miſchiefe lead one chiefe city put among raſcall priſoners made grinde horſe theſe apurtenances duely conſidered may eaſily ſeene depth miſeries plunged yet beſide mocking laughing diſpoſed make themſelues paſtime thereby bring forth purpoſe ſee many ſins committed certaine many iudgements god looked bee heaped vpon perſons doe commit euen heapes vpon heapes wee haue eye pſal 32 10 behold pſalmiſt ſaith many ſorrowes compaſſe ſuch euery ſide cauſe many ſorrowes trouble many ſinnes saul though king yet found ſo ſeeing life full iniquity could free many plague till laſt made vtter riddance scripture full example godly haue turned aſide tranſgreſſed many way ſorts puniſhed accordingly although many eſcape long flouriſh proſper world yet altogether void thoſe inward doe ſting moſt part readineſſe ſhall bee thought come ſoone farre ſoeuer ſeeme greateſt iudgement ſoeuer ſhall ſo fall ſuffered go without deſtruction commeth vpon happy ſhall haue kept heart pure good heere let v note ſinnes doe onely keepe many benefit v alſo bring many iudgements ſhame pouerty ſorrow doct 3 bondage priſon miſery vpon v beſide quench grace god v faith hope good conſcience feare god reſt men make little matter becauſe ſee little account price world ſhort haſteth wicked heart deſire giue himſelfe liberty way knowes god doth allow though bee altogether ſo groſſe ſhamefull samſons ſinne haſteth owne miſery time appeareth himſelfe alwaies ſeene obſerue conſider samſon deepely drunken therefore vomit ſtronger one two ierkes make ſturdy body dance hee ſtung quicke ſtout ſtomacke come downe becauſe ſees remedie hardened heart cannot repent neither without rom 2 5 violence meekned ſubtil traitor ieſuite firſt examination farre moone bee knowne nothing held well racke hee confeſſe bee ſo much good done ſeuerity god vſe rather faile purpoſe let teach men try god thinke themſelues well able ſtand beare angry countenance venturing far finde opinion god lenity confuted themſelues loden ſorrow let rather vſe ſame meeken heart cry miſery great trouble commonly argueth ſtrong rebellion long trouble hard heart ſingular mercy god haue tamed continuance puniſhment ſmall cauſe reioycing haue remoued heart left obſtinacie haſten cure ſhorter ſhall ſorrow god delight puniſh long much together returne samſon granted samſon needed whipping muſt therefore need bee whip note ſo many ſtrings none meete ſee execution done meaſure prophet complained edomites pſal 137 aimed nothing leſſe puniſhing ſinne wholly ſatisfying reuenge god bring vpon samſon perſonall hatred philiſtims publike good honour owne worke vpon enemy church hee made prey teeth obiect furie oh conſider thou obiecteſt samſon ſimply went god worke god bound himſelfe ſhelter enemy end hee furniſhed extraordinary ſtrength ſo literally verified one ſhall chaſe thouſand deut 32 30 god ſtood making good harmes could befall owne quarrell elſe samſon might iuſtly haue complained hee note would haue owne worke goe forward god buſineſſe required hotter purſuit maſters euen wicked leaud buſineſſe croſſed therein hee owne man god ſeruant looke charge damage befel imployment himſelfe defray ſtand ſo ſee vſed gift abuſed owne luſt ſo god bereaued ſent among maſters pay wage owne worke god tooke himſelfe highly wronged therefore hee take samſon hand purpoſe making worſt foe arbiter denie euen herein ſhewed fauour ſpeake phyſicke procured recouerie wee thinke god fitteſt miniſter fitteſt quality let v aſcribe alſo wel quantity liſteth bodily diſeaſes ſecond place one chiefe thing ſame meaſure workes vpon tenth would haue killed peter yet leſſe would haue ſtirred samſon returned filthineſſe without doubt reſtraint ſo forcible god mercifull delight extremitie lam 3 33 exod 34 7 iuſt cannot faced boldnes samſon thus led away paine ſuch baſe worke ſo doct 4 verſ 21 reprochfull manner ſee withall conſtrained leaue goe louer alſo ſo neerely knit whoſe ſake hee ſuffered woe much ſore hard beare doth ſee hee might haue free haue continued happie eſtate wherein could haue ſhaken alienated mind yet muſt leaue whether would ſeeth cauſe hee faire warning ſo doe euen ſo obſerue wee perſwaſions ſerue draw v ſome ſpeciall ſin whether samſon deluded yet god knoweth way enough ſcare v one among reſt wee ſhall plucked violence though would alſo ſhame ſorrow belly full ſhall wiſh late wiſer time ſaith salomon young man among fooles deſtitute vnderſtanding prou 7 6 going toward houſe harlot euening night began darke ſubtiltie inticed followed ſtraight way oxe goeth ſlaughter foole ſtocks correction till dart ſtrooke thorow liuer bird haſteth ſnare knowing ſhe danger beſt end commeth following wicked heart deſire committing ſin whē meanes reclaimed frō great matter worth marking ſay lord pul vngodly filthie pleaſure wherein liued doth reſtraine immediate forerunner finall woe pluck godly thoſe baites allured indangered dealeth kindly recalling woe repentance enioying many good thing wont deny fauour child granteth wicked wrath one point hereof ſee thoſe two died one death bodily ſpirituall haman iudas meane eleuen apoſtles wee life curſed death may adde foole goſpell achitophel infinite others luk 12 20 2 sam 17 23 top wickedneſſe held backe god end neereſt hand wit good apoſtles gratiouſly weaned purſuite would haue bin bane ambitiouſly ſought ſtriuing ſhould greateſt chiefe among reſt sauiour held ſo iohn 13 14 made aſhamed thinke gone loſt nay gained rather learning humilitie found ſauour ſweetnes ſeruice afterward loue appeareth great lamentation made departing made way enioying moſt worthy precious benefit maſters aſcenſion euen ſo hee wrought apoſtles doth ſame elect people note ſee cannot enioy deſired vnlawfull liberty without vtter vndoing begin thinke high time looke doe ſee depth folly refuſe forſake owne mercie ionah ſpeaketh looking lying vanity ſo reſolue renue ionah 2 8 old acquaintance god returne firſt husband fall old diet againe oh mercie god inualuable may ſo though ſome bitternes thē becauſe fleſh ſauoureth goodneſſe yet fauour god behalfe toward vnutterable could ill haue ſpared euen themſelues iudges therefore returne let ſuch muſt thus roughly vſed samſon meane bereaued plucked ſinne ſo deare violence ere giue ouer let ſuch ſay beware leſt god ſhall thus croſſe like blind idiot wilfull rebel fight againſt god increaſe owne miſerie renuing old ſinnes ſeeking forbidden pleaſures gaine little better ſwine returne mire ſuch 2 pet 2 22 neither forbearance violence doe good vpon may feare caſe bad others may ſeeing god vſeth commonly remedie cure maladie ſee end ſinne beginning entrance diuell moſt ſlighly cunningly ſheweth foole pleaſure profit bringeth iudgeth yea offereth conceit ſhal euer finde may fitteſt allure blindfold wiſe ſuffereth thinke end vndoing ſuch wiſedome note prou 24 7 high foole ſo diuell winde v ſinne commeth tempter hath brought v commit begin ſee haue done wofull caſe left commeth accuſer leauing v briar iudas meerely deſtitute helpe ſhift ſelues former ſtories theſe iſraelites plentifull witnes becauſe ſhewing miſerable end ſinne men need follow wicked luſts ſo haue thought good admoniſh reader good ſay inticed ſtrongly baites ſinne whereby ſeeth himſelfe danger ſet note owne eye particularly wofull effect former yeelding dallying deceitfull allurement thereof holie ghoſt doth ſet downe foure fiue followed samſons ſinne profeſſor ſhould forcibly haled vncleannes woman ſeeth likelihood turne away let anſwere himſelfe thus ſinne abhorred god delight ſet againſt make mine enemie moſt grieuous reproch profeſſion yeeld burthen conſcience importable loſſe grace vnſpeakable griefe godly vnutterable fleſhing ioying wicked vnſatiable beſides vtter vndoing euer iniurie partie ſhould offer ſuch diſcurteſie neuer bee recompenſed let oft ſhall ſee cauſe twit croſſe carnall humour anſwere himſelfe got eue ſhe taſted forbidden yet deceitfull fancie many cauſes bee deſired let ſay doe thinke long till crie thing ſo impotently haſt hath great ſorrow vndoing meanes ſhall found little enough obtaine deliuerance ſuch bondage ſeeing ſpeaking v inſtant going committing ſinne let ſuch like meditation vſually ſeriouſly thought v wiſe laſtly verſe one thing thinke good note doct 5 care theſe philiſtims ſet priſoners worke ſet samſon grinde mill among reſt worthie following v chriſtians though would ſhamed v herein knowing ill occupied malefactor priſon might good imploying ſome honeſt labour get ſomewhat toward keeping many ſtarued want thereof alſo ſtaied held much idleneſſe miſchiefe otherwiſe doe day lamented ſeene moſt priſons wee ſee commoditie ſetting worke priſon appointing worke poore liue among v libertie diligently ſet worke doe maintaine themſelues many great charge alſo kept thereby many offence ſorrowes nay heathen haue gone ſo farre ciuil policy though hatred ſin themſelues bad kindes prouide order ſo confuſed companie priſoners might well become chriſtians onely doe ſame goe little beyond regard welfare ſoules alſo impriſonment time execution godly captaine ioſhua achan chap 7 ſonne ſaith giue glorie ioſh 7 19 god confeſſe thy ſinne disburden thy conſcience though thy hodie puniſhed deſtroyed ſeaſon yet thy ſoule may bee ſaued day lord pitifull thing conſider ſuch ſhould left themſelues fulfill meaſure ſinne till death approcheth laboured dealt moſt weightie matter ſaluation thing would moue v doth ſee ſo little care many miniſters teach painfully people walke libertie well paid labour verſe ſhewed though ſo cleerely doe ſee verſ 22 vnderſtand firſt view samſon ſitting irkſome priſon paine body greater mind think euil courſe frō eſtate falne miſerie repented due conſideration prodigall ſonne ye aske appeareth may reſt perſwaded ſeeing may bee doubted well part ſtorie anſwere ſeeing ſo cleere verſe ſay fetching light heereto scripture firſt verſe hope forgiueneſſe becauſe thoſe forementioned ſeruants god obtained ſinned preſumption theſe doe reaſon thus neither know therefore ſhall finde like mercy need monſtrous irregular concluſion loue god ſhould keepe ſinning preſume ſin becauſe god loueth neuer dampe thou makeſt ſuch concluſions feare mercy belongs vnto thee know certaine though thou haſt thought thy ſelfe ſure ſaluation hauing ſought haſt begun reforme thy ſelfe yet thou degenerate offend wilfully thy vnauoidable errours weakeneſſes ſpeak lord ſhall fill thy life thy ſoule conſcience ſuch perplexity diſtreſſe thou ſhalt neuer enioy good day thy ſatiſfying thy rebellious thou die ſo whoſoeuer thus ſinneſt thou neuer wert ſonne beloued god baſtard counterfeit doe ſee death hath befallen ſuch impudent coſoners vile baſe borne claime themſelues name inheritance great perſons dead long ſince yet liuing like penalty far greater ſhall lie vpon thee oh foule impoſter deceiuer pleadeſt name regenerate one arrant deceiuer comming home god humbling himſelfe looking mercy vncomfortable eſtate hee thing almoſt admirable euen fall depth note miſery fell ſuch example ſee god doth oft worke heard went doe hee worketh ſay doct grace man miſery proſperity rarely ſeene found haue occaſion ſay oft worthie noting ſeeing hee dealeth ſo trouble nay rare behold caſe moſt carried impatience curſing feele god heauie hand vpon bitterneſſe againſt god himſelfe ſo handling neuer looking owne deſerts ſo hope might eaſily brought confeſſe god iuſtly yea ſhewed mercy alſo iuſtly puniſhing thus dealeth men brought good trouble meane hee bringeth due conſideration vileneſſe prouoking glad ſeeke reconciliation euen thus ſay hee draweth perſwadeth take vp thought exceeding benefit hee meaneth ſhall take good affliction onely repentance among pſal 51 1 2 none leaſt hee cauſed enemy god blaſpheme threatned god prophet offence 2 sam 12 14 ſharpely doth yet acknowledge god ſhould deale iuſtly puniſhing thereby declaring much warne v haue conuerſation honeſt men may iuſtly ſpeake euill v euill doer 1 pet 2 22 goe heart ſhall come repentance thinke haue cauſed holy profeſſion goſpell ſelfe bee ill ſpoken ſet heere god lay ſtumbling block men way ſo cauſe fall woe vnto ſuch conuert ſinners wicked courſe dauid promiſed doe ſo good workes pſal 51 13 ſhall ſee cauſe glorifie god v hee ſhall viſit haue mercy verſe ſheweth al indignity iniuries philiſtims verſ 25 offered samſon griefe god brought vpon thought enough make ſatisfaction heart merrie feaſting muſt need haue brought ſolemne place laugh ſo diſguiſed loden miſeries ſcorned ſo might ſatiſfie themſelues ſport paſtime thereby euen deſired aboue three thouſand according receit roome chiefeſt thus meete end ſaid samſon fetcht priſon houſe ſet ſee vnnaturall crueltie philiſtims could bee ſatisfied wrong offred samſon muſt make laughing ſtocke loade taunt reproches alſo though vice ſo foule light nature ſome heathen abhorred meane ſhew immanitie miſerable yet ſort vice might eaſily preuaile ſuch put light brutiſh paſſion impietie appeares monſtrous crueltie roman vſed behold great pleaſure ſingle combat malefactor condemned swordplayers ſhedding others blood therefore leſſe bee maruelled heathen occaſion let v doct know chriſtians reckoned among v moſt cruell thing adde affliction afflicted puniſhment inflicted itſelfe anſwerable fully treſpaſſe yet inſatiable deſire reuenge fearefull example prieſts againſt sauiour ſhould haue highly honoured great workes among preferred murtherer vniuſtly got liberty pilate crucifie lord glory mat 21 17 1 alſo railed ſpitted moſt ſhamefully reuiled mocked middeſt agony indeed herein reſemble father diuell moſt inſulteth hee hath man vnder lord alway neareſt ionah extremity ionah 2 9 10 although god euill doe iuſtly puniſh ſuch one yet ſhould moued ſome pitie toward adde vexation ſuch god ſmiteth therefore wee reade lord afflicting iſrael iuſt deſerts ſending long vaſt wilderneſſe yet king edom would needes vexe alſo bidding paſſage coaſts diſpleaſed therefore prophet amos writeth thus three tranſgreſsions edom amos 1 11 foure intreated neither turne addeth reaſon becauſe purſue brother ſword caſt pitie toward cauſe ſaith hee leaue vnpuniſhed vſe v beware crueltie eſpecially mixed enuie cauſe salomon ſaith anger cruell wrath raging prou 17 4 ſtand enuie thus dauid prayes againſt purſued man god afflicted ſaying let day prayer turned pſal 109 15 16 ſinne becauſe remembred ſhew mercie perſecuted poore man contrite heart c theſe thing wee reade deſpiſe god would mocked see place booke name vpon fourth verſe firſt chapter conſider againe notwithſtanding ſuch diſguiſing samſon 2 wee haue heard thus brought high degree ſhame contempt miſerie whereby might thought better abiect caſtaway yet conſider ſay euen reclaimed forementioned ſinnes reconciled god againe ſaid ſay againe none may miſtake ſo ſaying haue ſet downe repentance god ſheweth deare hath ſaid fall merited patience priſon forgiuenes ſinnes acknowledged beleeued pardon became godly man repented hath proued elſe theſe turned quite god greatly extenuate aſſwage miſerie ouer thus turned god lord prouided ionahs body ſhelter gourd leſt extremitie ionah 4 6 heate sunne might haue added affliction diſquieted minde euen hee ſay much gratiouſly preuent poore priſoner ſeruant mercie fauour againſt time enemy grew height malice leſt might otherwiſe haue intollerable yea hereby lord animated beare indignitie quietly becauſe ſtrength alſo renewed thereby knew god called deſpitefull rabble together auenged heereby let v learne whatſoeuer men haue euill liues heretofore howſoeuer haue brought vpon head much miſery thereby yet much comfort bee taken themſelues others haue truly renounced caſt workes darkeneſſe haue fellowſhip ſhelter themſelues vnder chriſts wing poore chicken vnder hen may couer remit able make hold vp head ſo many ſorrowes trouble doe otherwiſe oppreſſe oh happie ſweet vniting v chriſt faith ſo reſolued may abide loue iohn 15 11 wee carefully ſeeke enioy preſerue doe wiſely decline thing doe make benefit ſeeme farre leſſe gainfull beautifull vnto v truly ſaid salomon wounded ſpirit prou 18 14 make trouble waighty ſpirit man free cheerefull good conſcience ſupported god beares vp affliction howſoeuer proofe hereof ſweeteſt affliction ſent vpon v innocency yet hath place alſo euen croſſes drawne vpon v ſome ſinne wee haue humbled ſelues truly haue delayed ſeeke reconciliation maieſty man recouereth particular confidence god ſeeth affliction hauing done came ſhall ſpeedily bee remoued ſupply patience giuen whileſt vndergoe triall therefore oh fooles cauſe god thus puniſh double fooles abuſe correction lie vnder impenitent note theſe ſhall need philiſtims adde ſorrow vpon ſorrow ſeeing make burthen double treble ſin aggrauated conſcience hardened againſt god verſ 26 samſon ſaid ſeruant led hand leade may touch pillers houſe ſtandeth vpon may leaue 27 houſe full men woman prince philiſtims alſo roofe three thouſand men woman beheld samſon played 28 ſamſon called vnto lord ſaid lord god pray thee think vpon god beſeech thee ſtrengthen mee time onely may bee auenged philiſtims two eye 29 samſon laid hold two middle pillers whereupon houſe ſtood borne vp one right left 30 ſaid samſon let mee loſe life philiſtims hee bowed might houſe fell vpon prince vpon people therein dead ſlew death moe ſlaine life 31 brother houſe father came downe tocke brought vp buried betweene zorah eſhtaol ſcpulchre manoah father iudged iſrael twentie yeeres followeth end third part chapter conſider ſumme iſſue dealing samſon deſtruction many philiſtims brought vpon meanes hee himſelfe verſ 26 loſing life tooke beſt opportunity bring paſſe ſet betwixt pillers ſaid former verſe hee asketh ſeruant led ſet ſo hee might feele ſhoulders ſpake though hee would haue eaſed reſted himſelfe wearied grinding priſon bearing chaines bolt intending indeed ſeeke beſt opportunity caſt downe houſe vpon philiſtims firſt marke notwithſtanding loſt eye doct ſhould haue guided body yet hee vnmindfull worke calling namely plague philiſtims god enemy therefore vſed help ſeruant thereto ſhould learne remember conſider trouble diſcouragements thoſe weightie charge duty power performe wee note leaue occaſion thereof neither lay aſide wee eaſily brought doe thereby although wee haue incouragement abilitie thereto deſired yet ſhould vſe haue may come rare example ionah behalfe whale belly ſtreightnes roome noiſomenes ſtinch hee could man would thinke doe nothing yet euen made faithfull prayer god vpheld himſelfe faith notwithſtanding diſabled altogether performe ſome duty neceſſitie yet thoſe wee may wee ſhould samſon labour performe haue care diſcharge ſpeak many profeſſors goſpell hauing receiued checke ſome better forward religious duty well liked making conſcience way moſt ſay ſuſtaining rebuke ſame diſcouraged ready leaue chriſtian courſe altogether leaſt feruencie forwardneſſe vtterly vnmeete doe ſo ſhew feare man god ſo cut ſhort due thinke good wiſe tollerable whereas ſeruants tenant otherwiſe inferiours ſuch ſuperiours ſhould abridge depriue ſome helpes liberty might diſcharge thereof yet ought feare giue ouer duty may performe rather conſtantly hold therein practiſe ſame al point may ſhall help man god againſt moſes would leaue leaſt dutie exod 10 26 vndone pleaſe pharao remember haue read valiant roman captaine fight ſea firſt hee aduenturing put foorth hand catch gable enemy ſhip eagernes ſurpriſe draw owne nauie priſoner loſt right hand ſword enemie cut haled againe left hand thinking pull away attempt loſt left hand alſo ſaw himſelfe diſarmed hand neere fell downe teeth drew ſhip ſuch violence hee wonne deſpite defender thereof bring alluſion ſhew exceeding reſolution carnall men aduancing purpoſes honour wealth fleſhly proiects matter holy profeſſion wherein god highly honoured wee bring forth much fruit take repulſe ſmalleſt diſcouragement either zealous therein ordinary worſhipper god carefull ouer family liberal relieuer diſtreſſed saint walking particular calling good conſcience ſhort ſeruing god inwardly outwardly labour attendance cauſe requires alſo ſhut one way ſeekes paſſage another trying meanes rather yea though diſappointed part yet ſomewhat rather nothing paul indeed reſtrained publike preaching ſat ſtill could priſon ſo band famous liberty ſaying elija therein weake take life lord 1 king 19 4 iezabel giues permiſſion thy prophet teach openly make racket may honour god publike let v among ſo yet family ſequeſtred al theſe note yet ſpirit ſhall diſcharge god ſhall ſay haue offered god ſeruice church hee refuſeth therefore muſt pardon haue ſmaller liſt otherwiſe occupied madneſſe follie elſe ſloth hypocriſie oh ſaith many ſon wife ſeruant ye little know father husband maſter landlord haue diſcourage otherwiſe tell could doe ſeruing god well well marke paul ſaith thou ſeruant 1 cor 7 21 though ſtreitned doe thou maiſt worſt maſter cannot make thee cold without thine conſent although thou free vſe rather therefore great ſinne dauid hee driuen ſhifts saul offer helpe achiſh againſt church make beſt 1 sam 27 2 want incouragement muſt coole affection though may hinder action much leſſe may excuſe diſcontentment worſe ſeeing ſuch ſullennes argueth reſolute purpoſe indeed dutie therefore many ſuch grow looſe conſcienſles trouble affliction ſearch man others time inlarged ſet free barren hypocrite euer plentifull complaint miſerie muſt thinke zachary elizabeth many diſmaiments vnder herod ſo corrupt time let v wee ſhall borne forwarder end time eightie eight sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges goe forward samſon preparing bring verſ 27 paſſe great ſlaughter philiſtims ſo lord prepared perſons execute vpon therefore ſaid houſe full men woman prince philiſtims vpon houſe prouiſion made might beſt ſee aboue three thouſand men behold samſon pleaſe themſelues therein cleerely laieth folly yea vaine deceitfull folly ignorant irreligious haue ſtill ſo readie flocke together hundred thouſands ſatisfie eye behold may prouoke fooliſh laughter danger ſoeuer yet ſo diſliked ſound iudgement doct 1 affirme ſo may ſaid long alſo yeeres paſt yet ſtill light goſpell haue inuented maner ſpectacles delude ſimple withall euen ſhameleſſe ſhewes moſt dangerous ſtage play omitting none play part may increaſe ſinne ſome play vice foole ſo diſguiſing themſelues void reaſon ſome reſemble diuell counterfeiting make mentioning diuels scripture onely ridiculous ieſt matter laugh ſo may bolder ſinne leſſe feare diuell damnation ſome brought ſtage woman apparell god hauing commanded contrary ſaid deut 22 5 ſhall ſo meeting doe onely philiſtims pleaſe eye alſo ſtrongly incenſed prouoked lewdnes luſt ſome nothing ſo much acquainted god ſhould ſhew ſome ſuch ſtrange iudgement vpon vpon theſe haue heard ſome haue lately faire warning kinde haue middeſt paſtimes denie lamentable doubtleſſe leſſe doe ſay nay farre deſerued theſe muſt left magiſtrate ſhould vaine beare ſword terror offender like ſort philiſtims meeting laugh pleaſe themſelues beholding samſon brought foorth gaſing ſtocke among like ſort ſay brutiſh flockings together ſome part countrey moſt sabbath ſummer haue vſed lately ſure ſtill may ought know feaſt drinke dance much miſrule accompanying miſrule ye may well geſſe haue mentioned god neuer commanded better thing ſaying yet aloud eares remember ye keepe holy sabbath prophane cuſtomes like let periſh come naught holy aſſemblies heare ſermons pray riſe vp bee duly reuerently frequented vſed contrary theſe lewd cuſtomes haue elſewhere ſpoken noted ſlauiſhnes samſons ſinne brought doct verſ 26 27 committed 17 verſe reſeruing wit baſenes ſhame followed place proper god threatned whole body people renouncing ſeruice ſhould loſe headſhip ouer nation become taile befell one man samſon wilfulnes vnlike noah implication prophecieth church two head therof shem iaphet cham ſhould vnder ſeruant vnto dwelt tent god otherwiſe cham ſhould hold dominion ouer samſon made lord ſome ſort ouer theſe heathen rule ſo held honour ſeruice god wearie loe hee made moſt vile vnderling loden deſpite malice could lay vpon note neither beleeue honour ſeruing god whereas yet angel haue greater greateſt king vpon earth hold maieſtie heb 1 14 ſeruing lord maintaining truth inuiolable ſhame miſerie contrary samſon doubtleſſe ſaw former cleerly ſo oppreſſed latter ſo foule manner weigheth ſtorie ſhall neede proofe deformed vile nature ſinne euen thus adam ſinned whereas ſoueraigne lord ouer creature hee became vileſt worſt god reſtored thus euill angel content higheſt honour became diuels abaſed loweſt curſedeſt ebbe ſhame particular thought good omit though haue ſaid meetly enough part miſerie ſinne cauſed end ſuch like samſons diet ſo well may know time god hath tamed ſo fetcht poore offender make buckle ſtoope lure glad meaneſt roome houſe prodigall wiſhed himſelfe hireling father wretched penurie luk 15 19 place ſonne liked thinke reproch weare god liuerie rather hiſſed confuted text let goe like vagabond cain vpon face earth true ſhame herein god vouchſafes roome church ſo time ſhall ſhame ſhall breake foorth confuſion ſhall neither place hide head cloakes left couer ſhame much leſſe haue entrance kingdome let rather ſuch goe chriſtians enioy honour good report among beſt religion haue hitherto kept reprochfull crime fruit thereof ſhame among godly byword wicked let ſuch ſay look example beſeech god ſhew yet cleerely priuiledges ſinceritie godly care obedience euen glorious ere glory ſelfe obtained ſo may cleaue faſt vnto ſtill beware leſt catching ſome ſhadow glory forſaking zeale following common ſins time become moſt ridiculous pageant ſcorne held awe reuerence admiration vertues sure venture samſon breake doe euill hauing owne pleaſure auoid little trouble ſhall reape great deale samſon ſet vpon worke beſought lord inable verſ 28 aſſiſt muſt know prayer feruent effectuall offered vp faith obtained ſought whereas may ſeeme ſeeke reuenge prayer wee muſt conſider lord inſtrument bring paſſe worke good ſucceſſe intreateth god aſſiſt euen apoſtles act act 4 29 prieſts forbidden preach name ieſus commanded beſought god ſtop hinder threat hauing effect prayed boldnes might vtter preach word ſame samſon againſt theſe enemy god god heard alike apoſtles though god promiſed neceſſarie aſſiſtance yet grace ſo pinned ſleeue might alway make account without ſeeking prayer faith elia eliſha appeareth wee haue toucht prayer made ſupply deadly thirſt god worke chapter fifteenth alſo obſerued ground libertie god faithfull ſeruants haue acceſſe god prayer effect samſon prayeth thus lord ſeeing brought ſo great company theſe philiſtims blind ſhall neuer able purſue thou haddeſt commanded enemy thee thy people ſeeing thou haſt reſtored ſtrength ſo good opportunity ſeeing thus ſaith token beleeue leſſe beſeech thee grant may bee auenged may payed home iniurie haue done plucking mine eye woe haue wrought mee thy ſeruant whereby haue hindred thy worke among thus ſee fareth god people behauiour affliction wit teſtifie beleeuing feruent ſupplication ſuch time need ſhewing thereby make onely refuge ſtay taught earneſtly diligently ſhould go doct lord buſineſſe may haue opportunity chiefly tribulation namely feruent prayer ſuing helpe one ſucceſſe ſeeking lord doth much regard commend hee oppoſe ſelues againſt enemy wherein finde proue bee ſo lord loueth cheerefull giuer ſo hee loueth cheerefull doer buſineſſe 2 cor 9 7 ſo ſhould wee bee alſo rather ſeeing forward readily minded god matter howſoeuer attempt runne ſhould draw backe latter point euery almoſt booke theſe two verſes ſhewed samſon ſetting ſhoulders ſtrongly verſ 29 30 pillers houſe ſaid life periſh houſe fell prince people ſo many ſlaine death ſlew life died ſee one point momentanie flitting eſtate ioy doct wicked bane vexation chiefe heart ſmart haue feathered neſt ſay prouided great wealth pleaſure honour whereby giue ſhew fooles haue gotten pettie paradiſe earth yet haue done want one chiefe thing helpe hold keepe ſtill deceitfull note pictured felicity length time day may containe enioying themſelues cannot buy compaſſe thing liking want leaue fade giue ouer vſe neuer yet withall ſend alſo farre worſe conditon prouiſion haue many made ſumptuous goodly building fat paſtures commodious ground laid thereto commodity neerly adioyning fiſhponds burrowes coneyes douehouſes parkes orchard garden may bee deuiſed pleaſure salomon ſpeaketh himſelfe eccleſ 2 heerein one followeth another farre wealth note reach looke enioy ſo ſhew happineſſe thereby little time denies ſeruice performe longer without reſt nothing nay vexation ſpirit alſo thus death lord meſſenger come oft ſudden ſergeant bailiefe arreſting taking away pleaſant delight samſon violently delilah vntill cry againe ſee plucked vaine ſeeing none reſcue ſame may ſaid thoſe haue prouided yeerely reuenewes auoid danger maintaine fleſhly reioycings though god good benefit may lawfully enioyed yet ſet god place made delight men ſtead fauor gouernment curſed vſers thus muſt taken againſt enioy longer ſay themſelues death vnwelcome art thou v haue taken vp pleaſure heere haue nothing elſe ſay wiſdome went wiſeſt proſperity hath bewrayed bee meere fooles left themſelues nothing rather obey god therefore charged ſhould lay vp felicity giue credit told told note rich man goſpell certainty earthly thing till tomorrow luk 12 20 21 therefore muſt ſuch become word follie wilfulneſſe euery common man mouth know wherfore doings note ſerue matter talke looked haue famous euer vniatiable gathering great prouiſion making earthly abiding proſpering hath ſaid well ſetled momentany reſt theſe thus comforted himſelfe soule eate drinke take thine eaſe thou haſt much good laid vp thee many yeeres hee ſay luk 12 19 ſpake thus thou foole night fetch away thy ſoule thee whoſe ſhall thing thou poſſeſſeſt ſaith much daily theſe pitie warned much like great man died yeeres agone ſickneſſe grew faſt would bee ſhaken hee hoped would haue firſt comming could get helpe againſt death approched drew neere hee vttered theſe word laſt whereby cleere little thinking ſuch thing ſee vanity another hauing builded goodly houſe hee ſhewed commodity pleaſantneſſe plaine countrey man asking liked anſwered like well man might keepe alwaies thereby marring ioy could commend it▪ together deadly vnwelcome remembring momentanie flitting eſtate thereof vncertaintie enioying ioy wicked better haue ſaid yet none may thinke lord deale partially bee knowne owne people degenerate partake ſinne play fooles reioycing euill thing tranſitorie paradiſe ſhall ſmart likewiſe time enioy better priuiledge doe therefore let v bee wiſer imbrace proſeſſe ioy cannot taken v neither ſhall euer repented haue ſought reioycing lord word ſeruice saint ſhort ſufficiencie bee ſaid fully point yet handled like occaſion chap 15 againe heere let v marke time ioy philiſtims 2 damped taken met together ſport themſelues bee merrie furtheſt thought trouble death loſing diſappointment paſtime euen houſe throwne downe samſon vpon like apoſtle ſpeaketh men cry peace 1 theſ 5 3 peace al thing ſafe ſhal ſudden deſtruction come vpon trauell vpon woman child ſhall able eſcape euen baltazar alſo moſt fearefully threatned loſſe kingdome dan 6 25 middeſt banqueting doctrine doth mauellouſly croſſe vile nature giue ſelues leaue health welfare meet together abide v time make ſelues drunke take fill therefore cannot away heare change awaked carnall drowſineſſe cauſe ſeeing men hearken lord bidding v watch beware ſuch ſurfetting luk 21 34 ſpirituall drunkenneſſe therfore leaues many ſnare oft time wherein like fooles taken may ſee god hath prou 22 3 begun iudgement owne ſo eſcape ſhal much grieuouſly meet afterward enemy therefore iudgement ſleepeth enlarge hauing ſpoken 1 pet 4 18 place mentioned chap 15 caſting downe ſuch houſe know paſſed ſtrength 3 common man ſtrength reſtored againe ſee ſo hee alſo inward grace appeareth hath ſaid repentance prayer faith therefore ſince caſe thus altered muſt behold another man beſotted made drunke wicked woman let v marke difference betwixt time grace man god guideth time bondage god letteth follow deuices deſires wicked heart may bee ſeene samſon oh grace could ſeene eye ſee darke reſemblance ſome outward ſhewes thereof would admirable manner draw v loue meekeneſſe moſes loue ionathan zeale dauid like ſo would fouleneſſe loathſomnes terribleneſſe ſinne cauſe v abhorre diuell iezabels cruelty ioabs malice haman murtherous mind ſeene oh ſhame man hath reuerenced highly regarded approued innocency faithfulneſſe conſtancy good carriage become foole iſrael baſe ridiculous contemptible perſon againe ſay oh glorious worthy thing ſee note ſuch one reformed caſt mould goſpell looke vpon thy ſelfe euer thou diddeſt ſerue god vprightly theſe vertues ſet downe place thee yea prayer ſweet thee hearing ſuch like fruites amendment pleaſant thou haſt ſuffered thine heart carrie thee corrupt inclination thereof thou art become vtterly diſguiſed thou haddeſt neuer ſame perſon onely adde ſinne maketh men impotent taketh heart committers haue ſhewed way loathſome odious reade one example end booke lord brought warre vpon people idolatry iudg 5 8 canaanite ſaid people ſo put hart thinking ſinne ſo appalled conſciences remembring tranſgreſſed among fortie thouſands one durſt take vp ſpeare ſhield againſt enemie point plentifully particularly vpon thoſe word thought hee would doe time end eightie nine sermon xvi xvii chapter booke ivdges proceed samſon vpon hee caſting downe houſe vpon philiſtims died alſo obiect verſ • 0 demanded kill himſelfe finde commendation renued repentance falles ground waſhed away laſt ſo wofull fact alſo aduiſedly done hereto anſwere cannot bee ſaid hee killed anſw himſelfe indeed died end propounded might die neither deſire ſought reuenge vpon god enemy worke calling like bring procure faithfull ſeruing god though loſſe life euen apoſtles preached note chriſt ſaw would coſt life ſhould ſlaine would need preach fell ſo indeed preaching ſhall ſay therefore killed themſelues ſought owne death zealous diligent preacher paine ſtudy miniſtery empaireth ſpendeth ſtrength health ſaid procurer owne vntimely death hath ſpent ſtrength calling end god gaue paul ſaid ready bound die lord ieſus act 21 13 ſo samſon ſaid let loſe life philiſtims runneth raſhly death followeth vocation death come therewith vnto yeelds willingly rather becauſe brought neceſſity vpon himſelfe owne ſinne hee could otherwiſe purſue god enemy hazard owne life euen valiant ſouldiers ſeeke death yet looke vſe vſe v wee ſhould abhorre leaſt ſinne way yea ſpeech thought intending ſeeking owne death ſo yet duty walke eſtate god hath ſet v ſuch wiſe onely ready fit willing die alſo god faithfull diſcharge duty meet v death hee apoſtles bee readie yeeld remember hee mat 16 25 loſeth life god ſake ſhall finde therefore let neither life thing haue thought good requires though loſe liues yet many doe forgoe commodity commendable god cauſe heathen ſpake according light ſaw vnnaturall men deuoure themſelues ſouldier may diſranke himſelfe forſake ſtation without emperours permiſſion hath ſet place ſo neither ought deſtroy owne life ſoule wilfull death waite time god hath appointed indeed heathen ſaw thus much man might auoide apparant perill violent death whether incurable diſeaſe one ſtarued himſelfe death free himſelfe ſtone purſuit enemy plinius made themſelues erroneouſly beleeue magnanimity waiting death caſe cowardiſe like many brutiſh people among v ſome great diſtreſſe mind ſhame owne ſinne hath brought vpon bereaue themſelues liues like iudas abimelech others croſſed ſmall matter ready wiſh themſelues deepe ground high euen chriſtians often forget themſelues haue pang vpon curſe day birth deſire death doubt many doe raſhneſſe death came offered ſelfe would recant howſoeuer bee raſhneſſe madneſſe vtterly vnbeſeeming chriſtians token vnſauorie heart little ſeaſoned doctrine confidence patience wiſe man weigh cowardlineſſe preuenting trouble croſſes violence enduring patiently let ſuch diuell hath woond withall ſo farre worke vpon melancholy terrours conſcience weakneſſe nature ſuch dangerous tentations theſe drowne hang ſtab themſelues abuſing scripture ſuch example samſon end let ſuch ſay bee fenced well againſt malice inſtruction anſwering sauiour like caſe auoide satan dare tempt lord god mat 4 7 returne little samſon ſo farre equitie condemne 2 laſt act loſing life philiſtims far preferred annoying euen greateſt auengings ſlew many death life therein liuely figure sauiour chriſt though deſtroyed workes diuell life euen hee came ſame end foiled ſhrewdly many way yet 1 ioh 3 8 death triumphed ouer led captiue act meane samſons chriſts doe ſhew glaſſe ſhould doe namely endeuour doe beſt good death ſhall better bee done lay life liue well dye better becauſe wee note ratifie confirme good liued iuſtifie death one fruite peece honour good life receiueth good death followeth oh therefore begin wee betimes feare god commanded remember maker day eccleſ 12 1 youth let bee tedious v nouriſh thoſe good beginning laſt end may like elſe hundred one ſhall haue ſmall cauſe reioyce end ſay like particular may bee ſaid death righteous ſaid samſon yea much affoordeth ſmall encouragement al ſuch faithfull work lord meane rooting deſtroying enemy owne ſoules eſpecially corruption nature fleſhly luſts iſſue frō thence watchfulnes diligence ſuppreſſing ought daily prayer conſtant faith god almightie power nothing impoſſible armour ought continually exerciſed aſſaulting concupiſcence fruites thereof though yeeld firſt becauſe ſtrong mightie yet hauing receiued deadly blow firſt death chriſt ſhal decay ſenſibly death quite aboliſhed walles iericho fell downe ſeuenth day compaſſing thereof thus samſon dieth philiſtims moſt contrary vnlike manner dyed riot idolatrie crueltie impenitencie faith stephen calling vpon name lord let act 7 59 well laid looked though wee muſt dye bad yet eccleſ 3 19 may wiſe dye doe ſo outward manner death though paine diſeaſe kinde death bee one ſame v wiſe man ſaith wit foole dyeth ſo dyeth wiſe yet iudge ſay wee muſt meaſure godlines happy eſtate men outward thing though fall alike let v beware feare death wicked ſay token thereof muſt dye waite wee ſaying come lord ieſus come quickly reioycing thinke ſhall dye priuiledge beſtowed vpon faithfull prouide dye faith author epiſtle hebrewes ſaith patriarkes heb 11 34 among reſt samſon wit god putteth difference betwixt death death though world cannot diſcerne generall common abaſement body fleſh yet deny ſometimes difference appeareth alſo euen manner dying though ſome ſo bereft ſenſe reaſon force diſeaſe others god diſpoſing ſo euen beſt either much diſguiſed ſickneſſe leaſt giue great teſtimonie excellent grace thē yet grace liued therein die vſually moſt part may obſerued well paſſed life note bringeth good death oft time ſheweth plentifull apparant ſignification pſal 37 37 confidence comfort ſpirituall triumph death impoſſible finde witneſſe hereof death martyr thing day much ſticking ſtomacke papiſts would ſpeake truth compared deſperate diffident death ieſuites seminary inſtance theſe becauſe arrogate moſt themſelues ſufferings catholike cauſe call bad perſons except deeply deluded wee ſhall behold manifeſt ſignes diſtruſt feare impatience beſt cry dangerous eſtate therefore let comfort ſuch hold purpoſe entire cleauing lord beleeuing promiſes obeying dying may differ vngodly ſo god account ſhall differ though death differ great ſtay againſt temptation contrary againſt baſe common condition body diſhonour thereof lying deathbed laid walles graue hath put firſt difference others faith purifying heart precious account hee maketh ſhall eminently teſtifie difference pſal 116 15 hath raiſed vilenes ignominie clothed incorruption glorie laſtly make end samſon haue ſeene ſtory 2 grieuouſly fell withall turned againe lord called vpon heard gather ſtory therfore ſhort ſumme according vſuall maner dealing cōtinued hiſtories let v learne time haue ſinned againſt lord willingly wittingly meere infirmity ordinary courſe life vſe doe god ſeruants though attaine meaſure grace ſeruice god deſire yet neither doe oft commonly goe againſt knowledge ſmother yet diuell layeth ſnare lyeth wait continually catch therein may eaſily like ſometime finde worſe prouided therefore fall taken ſuch trippe outſtraying met withall god purſuing let lie ſtill horſe mire making light ſinne putting due conſideration farre ſoone labour come themſelues againe conſider ſeriouſly whence fallen eſtate eſtranged god giue reſt themſelues till prodigall ſonne reſolue broken heart goe againe father refuge ſay haue ſinned receiue v graciouſly ſo god offereth raiſe vp ſuch fallen father prodigall receiue welcome ioyfully ſo samſon others haue ſlidden let renue couenant ſtrongly lord may hold firme time come euen death againſt ſinne eſpecially hath foiled moſt leſt returne back ſtrongly vpon water ill ſtopped laſtly let returne againe humbly penitently mercie ſhall according faith granted trow moſt happie feeling finding ſweete lord gainfull ſeruice prouide taught abide conſtantly loue hee willeth doe putting ioh 15 11 matter vpon venture vrging lord ſuch ſharp manner diſcipline boldneſſe samſon ſay doe gladly alſo except long woe ſtand vpon thornes till haue brought ſorrow vpon themſelues doubled leaſt owne labour trouble recouering welfare againe verſe appeareth ſtrange ſpectacle caſting verſ • 1 downe houſe vpon philiſtims prince reſt ſo amazed ſuffered kinſmen samſon come thither carrie backe againe vnto land inheritance burie conſidered aduiſedly would haue taken reſt vnder power haue put moſt cruell death gibeonites deſired dauid certaine kindred 2 sam 21 5 6 saul hanged vp reuenge themſelues saul meane ſlew ſundrie contrary league ioſhua made ioſh 9 23 ſhould dye cut wood draw water ſeruice tabernacle thus wee ſee god ſometimes appalles wicked ſo people may fare better caſting ground ſought chriſt ioh 18 6 take wee ſee hee might eaſily haue eſcaped hand would ſeene expedient euen ſo feares multitude buſineſſe alſo many way lord putteth hooke noſtrils wicked ſo deſiſt leaue moleſting vexing faithfull ſeruants though ſore againſt euen saul called away purſuing dauid great danger 1 sam 23 2 lord ſhould reuenge wrong vpon aduerſaries hee ſeeth alwaies expedient ſhould make riddance wicked earth ſo innocent righteous ſhould haue faith patience tried hee hath appointed ſeeing patient toward therefore ſhould much afraid goe cruell courſe againſt wee ſee prieſts counſell gamaliel thought good ſaw cauſe ruled letting act 5 35 40 apoſtles goe intended moſt cruelly againſt hindred purpoſe feared lord would haue reſiſted indeed ſo terrified hee conſtrained let alone thus well death ſome maliciouſly minded againſt faithfull companie ſo aſtoniſhed appalled deſiſt wicked attempt ſuch feare time cannot tell may doe thus conclude god eaſeth ſhoulders ſeruants many way wee ſee burthen oppreſſed many way cannot expreſſed leaſt manner taking oppreſſors away middeſt floriſhing crueltie wee may ſee knoweth deliuer ſheweth accordingly due ſeaſon doth forget end may faint good beginning diſcouraged good courſe hold alwaies beſt depend vpō iſrael pharaos drowning exod 14 28 shuſhan prouinces haman abaſement like found eſter 8 17 though ſome hot fierie trial hard faithfull go vnder yet haue borne brunt would good note haue done otherwiſe ſundrie way whereby god vſeth ſuccour ioynt enemy haue another place diſcourſed large therefore thus much ſaid point whole hiſtory samſon seventeenth chapter verſ 1 man mount ephraim whoſe name micah 2 ſaid vnto mother eleuen hundred ſhekels ſiluer taken thee thou curſedſt ſpakeſt alſo mine eares behold ſiluer tooke mother ſaid bleſſed bee thou lord ſonne 3 reſtored eleuen hundred ſhekels ſiluer mother mother ſaid haue wholly dedicated ſiluer vnto lord hand ſonne make grauen image molten image therefore reſtore vnto thee 4 yet herestored money vnto mother mother tooke two hundred ſhekels ſiluer gaue founder made thereof grauen image molten image houſe micah 5 man micah houſe god made ephod teraphim conſecrated one ſonnes became priest 6 thoſe day king iſrael euery man right owne eye chapter enter handling vſe muſt ſtay ſay ſomthing ſatisfying reader onely chapter alſo follow end booke meane whereas may act mentioned theſe fiue next chapter follow former order time ignorant thought thing mentioned theſe fiue chapter following done order time thoſe thing goe finde conference scripture neither ſhould appeareth act ſet downe done long becauſe may ſeeme ſtrange ſay neither dare affirme barely becauſe man ſaith ſo ſhew reaſons scripture affirme therfore thing ſaid haue done theſe chapter following done time iudges leaſt end death othniel mentioned firſt chapter vacation thoſe eighteene yeeres vnder eglon iudge iſrael may inconueniently bee reckoned ſecond chapter eleuenth verſe thoſe follow doe mention horrible wickedneſſe people iſrael ioſhua dead chiefe ruler ouerliued reaſons theſe thing done time iudges thereabout theſe firſt ſaid next chapter tribe dan reaſon 1 populous tribe inlarge border time ſhould idolatrie thoſe bad time firſt brought priuate familie ſpread whole tribe firſt part chapter firſt part conſider woman ſixe former verſes ſumme 4 firſt verſes firſt thing ſpoken idolatry laid text ſhe ſaid bee mother micah man mount ephraim added certaine money ſhe vowed lord ſtollen ſon whereat ſhee curſed theefe knowing hee taken away confeſſed fault ſhee bleſſed reſtoring againe ſhee anſwered ſhee vowed lord vſe therefore bad take againe ſhee tooke two hundred ſhekels therof make molten image put houſe micah may gathered owne word added reſt like apurtenances thereunto many thing offer themſelues v heere worthie noting firſt doct ver 1 2 micah mother ſuperfluitie great wealth wel nigh hundred pound vow ſuperſtition idolatrie ſo appeareth wealthie much hee able make maintaine furniſh houſe chappell image meaneſt mettall adorne ſhe increaſe ſheweth howſeuer many want great need whoſe penurie ſhould relieued ſuperfluitie others yet meane haue tell well beſtow imploy ala haue heart doe good eſpecially others neither wil 1 cor 16 2 taught lay aſide god bleſſeth good vſes end themſelues doe beſt good namely may bring foorth much fruite ſo ſoules may fare well yet fault theſe ioh 15 9 two heart lay ready enough doe amiſſe idolatrous vſes though thought well imploy yet ſuperſtitiouſly blindly led ſinne theſe zeale carried amiſſe want knowledge yet excuſeth ſeeing poſteritie viſible church likelihood themſelues lately ſo others whoſe knowledge greater offend kind groſſely either cannot depart forgoe meane portion ſuperfluitie one extremitie laſh vnlawfully vpon luſts either voluptuouſnes adulterie drunkenneſſe ſuch like another dangerous extremitie one theſe though like meaſure tend moſt men vſing good aime beſt manner diſpoſing god hath giuen enough gathering manna exod 16 18 gathered leſſe homer wanted hee gathered nothing ouer condition euery man god hath giuen ſufficient yea ſin men cauſeth ſea drowne much wealth much loſt land would haue v thereby take knowledge rather ſhould loſt doth good note hand wicked men ſhould doe much euill hurt therefore let v bee ready imploy good comforting euer way ſo alſo may haue poſſible good well vſing fitter place purſuit point ſaid third verſe ſaid money ſhe poſſeſſion ſtollen nothing ſaid manner fact barely ſimply ſet downe ſo teach v among thing fickle vncertaine hauing enioying worldly good ſoone loſt many way ſuſpecteth owne child one man today another man tomorrow benhadad ſaid ahab ſeruant thy ſiluer gold mine 1 king 20 31 32 little benhadad himſelf ahab pleaſure driuen begge life thus hath bin good bad age yet ſay though wee ſhould ſet ſixe ſeuen labour commodity god hath commanded v ſo doe make ſmall account god goodneſſe giuing theſe earthly benefit vnto v great bleſſings ſingular vſes wee commanded occupied calling obtaining neceſſaries epheſ 4 28 life thereby ſuch change hath god made condition earthly ſubſtance ſubiect may learne truſt vncertaine rich moſt 1 tim 6 17 prone ready doe liuing god may liue indanger ſelues wronging offering violence comming ſo ſoone loſt doe good rather rich good workes follow example wicked world commit miſchiefe get vſing therfore sauiour chargeth v ſaying lay vp treaſure ſelues vpon earth ruſt moth doth corrupt theeues breake matth 6 19 ſteale lay vp treaſure heauen haue ſaid enough ficklenes outward thing one occaſion moſt former chapter money ſtollen owne ſonne many child make light matter ſtealing plucking parent though 3 euen parent liue ſuch make conſcience dare ſo doe defraud parent aggrauated micha ſin robbed owne mother yet himſelfe rich needed fall ſuch practiſes ſhe houſe moſt like vſed thing common together leaſt money like fall ſhare yet notwithſtanding behold ſin could forbeare muſt need put hand time ſheweth ſin meaſure ſinfull commit ſetting aſide lewd wanton humour heart ſo full naughtineſſe muſt haue vent ſome way oft time haue need put hand beares mouth ſort waily idle needleſſe oathes ſpeeches ſome medlings buſie body men matter dangerous thing high alſo ſtealings rich men micha note whoredomes married perſons thoſe lye call ieſting lye pleaſure ſake drunkenneſſe ſuch lewd companion abroad yet may well ſufficiencie ſatisfied home hundred like ſort though al ſin vile odious ſin neceſſary becauſe ſome needleſſe yet ſure ſinneth hath need therefore wanteth excuſe euen god man committeth adultery like ſure ſay troubleth deſtroyeth owne ſoule remember nathan inlargeth ſin dauid circumſtance 2 sam 12 8 hauing many wiues robbed poore neighbour onely wife killed husband alſo better concealement adulterie ſo inexcuſable euen cenſure offender himſelfe abhorred condemned moſt deeply therefore thinke god take ſuch hand beſides teacheth parent traine vp child religiouſly diſgrace make odious ſin well follow inſtruction good example lying ſwearing ſtealing like may god bleſſing bee farre ſuch like ſinnes eaſily ſoone faſten vpon vnleſſe good education weaned ſhall appeare next point ſaue one cleerely idolater alſo great theefe may note 4 dare fall idolatrie falſe worſhipping god truſted duty men abraham ſaid king gerar gen 20 11 well idolater feare god ſmal likelihod feare man preuaile ſo hee ſay doth rightly conſider howſoeuer deceiuer may time greatly prouoked neither hath occaſion offered held ſtrong outward bridle inducement outrage may ſay ſhew good example among men walke without offence toward yet ſhall ſee time ſhew wee ſee ſeruants child friend betruſted great matter bewraying length vnfaithfull heart reaſon great falſe god man ſhall looke better hand euen holy ghoſt luke 18 2 ſaith iudge hee neither feared god reuerenced man much rather true idolater ſeeing euen ſound religion haue ſaid yet heart vpright may poſſibly bee deceiuer among vſes point one leaſt pray ſuch authoritie may religiouſly prouide people may feare god leaſt want ordinary meanes may draw thereunto therefrom conſcionably carried obedience outwardly towards men seeing moſt forcible meane containe men within compaſſe feare caſt body ſoule hell matth 10 28 rather deſtroy body beſides nothing ſecret god thing naked manifeſt whereas ſeuereſt magiſtrate proceed witneſſes himſelfe priuie conſcience fact offender elſewhere concerning idolater particular euen deuout eſpecially papiſts preſident micah ſufficient ſtop mouthes abettor iuſtifie innocencie good behauiour towards men whereof cauſe colour rotten hollowneſſe heart brake foorth hideous horrible vnrighteouſnes vncleannes crueltie murthers treaſons lying vnder maske ambigious ſpeeches moſt ſlanderous defamation meane perſons prince gouernment beſides periuries breach league promiſe many ſome maintained schooles well practiſed deuouteſt leaſt euill perſons reſt little better iudgements practiſe euen atheiſticall damnable ſeeth late monſters opinion poſitions haue broched flow fountaine reſolute malicious purpoſe ſerue owne turnes hold vp tottering kingdome though ruine ouerthrow oppoſites deſtitute ground scripture ſound reaſon theſe eleuen hundred ſhekels hee heard mother curſe doct 5 loſſe confeſſeth leſt ye ſhould think confeſſion went ſound repentance yee may ſee bewray contrary though aſhamed taken theefe whereas penitent theefe like goſpell freely acknowledge luke 23 40 41 full teſtifie loue ſinne hee exten uateth ſinne ſaying ſhekels taken thee tooke ye muſt marke ſaith take ſteale extenuating fact farre one repented let warning v make light ſinne wee fall commit neither confeſſe wee ſlightly wee returne againe meanes turne vtterly daniel ninth chapter aggrauate deface people samuel dan 9 5 time make ſpeciall ſinne hee guiltie confeſſeth hee ſay make odious ſinnes ſo ſay lord forgiue v ſinnes eſpecially asked ſelues 1 sam 12 19 king wit danger extenuating ſinne nature true repentance haue diſtinctly ſpoken place ninetieth sermon xvii chapter booke ivdges proceede micah mother doct 6 marked ſonne ſaw mother ſo troubled loſſe money heard curſe hee ſuffer lye ſtill eſtate made haſte quiet telling note though bad man iuſt condemning thoſe ſeeke vexe parent doe know grieue heart yet doe otherwiſe ye aske anſwere beſides many wilfull part played otherwaies doe irreligious prophane vnthriftie courſe ſpending good waſtfully riotouſly whereas onely child ſhould grieue parent neither one neighbour ſtranger ſhould vexe diſquiet another ſhould procure peace welfare ſeeke vex man would note thinke goodly ſight behold becauſe god bountifull rich mercie toward v haue ten thouſand time prouoked reuenge worſt enemie haue hath proked v therefore cruell rigorous ſo hard hearted reioyce men harmes laugh ſhrewd turnes befall prouoking thereby like done themſelues ſo farre either pitie ſeeke reſcue oppreſſions ſaith mother miſſed money ſhe curſed doct 7 curſing ſo ſhe might meane well hard happe ſuch count well ſtollen ſhe might doe whether ſoeuer vnſauourie vngodly yet hearing newes againe ſonnes confeſſion ſhe another extremitie bleſſeth faſt ſhe curſed theſe diſtinct point let v little conſider ere goe verſe firſt theſe wee ſee woman glaſſe curſed nature moſt people except corrected grace thing croſſeth befalles otherwiſe note would driues god remembrance conſideration prouidence owne iuſt deſert hath brought vpon ſo let paſſe dutie ſuch accident god calles practiſe preſenteſt v wrath reuenge ſeeing cannot haue full vpon ſuppoſed wronger v therefore toole readieſt draw euen venomed arrow quiuer poyſoned heart curſing banning ſwearing ſuch like men content themſelues ſaue onely vent ſome wicked heart preſently elſe thinke would burſt come neerer partie requite ten one hit home purpoſe philiſtims samſon till come bee greateſt impotencie men bewray kinde caſualtie ſuch ſee redreſſe muſt bee ſtood howſoeuer thus laylor act 16 27 priſoners fled thus men doe good impaired ill debtor ſuertiſhip coſonage ill bargaines robberie nay euen god immediate hand croſſeth trauell ſea land harueſts commodity vnſeaſonable weather bad ſucceſſe note like themſelues without bluſhing doe well herein ſee ſweete ſeaſons ſay good harueſts liking ſhould bleſſe god thankfull indeed cannot plough ground becauſe ſo ſteely drought ſow reaſon immoderate wet ſee corne graſſe come perfection hazard weather beare behold loſſe deſtruction creature without griefe true corrupt nature thee thou wilt finde ſome excuſe ſalue thy curſed vngodly doings withall grace ſeaſoned thy heart purged old adam meaſure thee thou ſhouldeſt finde ſuch diſtemper affection inconſtancie thee preſently thou ſhouldeſt take thy ſelfe manner ſay oh fountaine ſendeth forth bitter ſweete ſhall receiue good thing god hand note euill ſhall ſerue aduantage hee touch ſhall curſe face groſſe offer baſe man ſhall offer god count friend onely hee pleaſeth hee croſſe neuer ſo little count none ſo great enemie abhorre ſuch dealing well bleſſing doe ſhamefully contrary thankſgiuing ſtinking offering god noſtrils ſtead ſweete ſauour god hateth man double tongue well double heart tongue ſpeaketh men would ſuch quality theſe learne ſearch reſt theſe goe alone laid together would giue iuſt iudgement vpon themſelues trie eſtate ſhould make good vſe ſuch inſtructions ſure lewd pitch cannot chuſe defiled ſo haue doe conuerſe prophane filthie one world may doe liſt keepe garment vndefiled meane liues vnſtained conſciences pure good wee haue much proofe ſpeake owne part countrey many good hope forwardnes haue bad example yea owne declinings middeſt ſo many prouocations brought diſguiſed liues moſt ſhamefully yet certified eaſily beleeue farre worſe people country goe many foule inormities may lie vnpuniſhed much iniquitie ſwarme though cannot compared hauing none people doe may ſee euery one doth liketh following owne minde dangerous ſo therfore howſoeuer bee others sauiour hath taught v deny matth 7 21 ſelues haue fellowſhip vnfruitfull workes darkneſſe renounce owne ſubiect obeying whereof epheſ 5 11 direct way happineſſe ſo hee teacheth doth luke 9 23 father heauen ſhall enter kingdom heauen matth 5 22 ninetie one sermon xvii chapter booke ivdges ſecond part chapter verſ 7 young man bethlehem iuda family iuda leuite ſoiourned 8 man departed citie bethlehem iuda ſoiourne could finde place came mount ephraim houſe micah iourneyed 9 micah ſaid vnto whence commeſt thou ſaid vnto leuite bethlehem iuda goe ſoiourne may finde place 10 micah ſaid vnto dwell vnto father prieſt giue thee ten ſhekels ſiluer yeere ſute apparell thy victual leuite went 11 leuite content dwell man young man vnto one ſonnes 12 micah conſecrated leuite young man became prieſt houſe micah 13 ſaid micah know lord doe good ſeeing haue leuite prieſt ſecond part chapter ſheweth micah ſumme theſe verſes hauing brought new ſtrange worſhippe namely idolatrie houſe ſo pleaſed himſelfe therein wanting nothing ſetting new trade worke worke man meane prieſt ſay tooke opportunitie offered leuite ſought ſeruice take entertaines content heard ſon ſerue prieſt though none might law ſuch came aaron wherby ſee law god little regarded men ſet haue owne behold accordingly hee wiſhed offered leuite little commendation hee much better liking taking ſonne buſineſſe took therefore receiued houſe neuer examining prouing inquiring might well throughly know behauiour make prieſt forthwith applauding himſelfe ſucceſſe reioycing little ſuppoſed well firſt theſe two verſes ſhewed micah got verſ 7 8 leuite prieſt ſonnes roome thus young man ionathan deſcribed place hee dwelt familie tribe leuites ſcattered tribe dwelling went ſeeke place hee might ſtay himſelfe hee wanting maintenance fell came trauell micah houſe meanes hee ſtaied abode firſt wee may ſee another note badneſſe time leuites appointed god ſerue tabernacle alſo prouided maintenance man one ſay many leaſt appeareth left deſtitute man neither imployment dwelling maintenance went ſeeke ſee go ill magiſtracie go hard doct verſ 7 commonwealth onely wee haue ſeene part miniſtery alſo either none carefull place good ſet miniſterie ſhould bring foorth many child god maketh houſe barren family ſome driuen ſeeke place leuite baſe vnmeete thing vnfit thoſe ſerue god ſo holy calling ſome come place money cauſeth leſſe regarded people neither moſt good among although haue ſome gift many able want fitneſſe direct people aright meane ſoundly plainly vnto true happineſſe many offenſiue ſcandalous life ſtead theſe many abuſes good gouernours ſeeke incourage thoſe bee worthie onely good hope prouide may preach attend charge cheerefulnes end appointed god ſee may go ſeeke place wandring perſons whereas beſt backed incouraged doe good little enough church commonwealth knit together ſoule body one ſo like enemy laugh weepe fare ill well together two one ſhip either enioy ſafetie miſcarrie alike ſo ought conſent accord ſweetly together preſeruation ſoule ſee followes temper body body much affected diſtemper ſoule neither well either frame true ſeldome commonwealth happy wherein church miniſterie hangeth downe head partly prouidence god iuſtly puniſhing neglect ſeruice partly naturall reaſon namely becauſe light knowledge reſtraining rule conſcience gouerning corrupt nature man breake ſquare commit vnrighteouſneſſe greedineſſe although law penaltie keepe men awe much anarchie confuſion therefore let magiſtrate backe miniſter authoritie ſword iuſtice ſharpen edge ſword word deſpiſed made vnprofitable let miniſter requite againe forcible perſwading conſcience working vpon ſoule till hee haue brought men thought ſubiection god ſo neither preſume deſpiſe authoritie forbeare tranſgreſſe terror ſo much god ſake conſcience ſmall vantage magiſtrate ſome themſelues confeſſe ſome aske perhaps confuſion leuite thus trauailed ſeeke liuing worke indeed thinke well ſome thinke otherwiſe miniſter another tradeſman go countrey enquire worke ſuch thinke miniſter ſhould doe like paul worke owne hand might leſſe troubled maintaine leaue ſuch gargarites anſwere point firſt diſorder haue ſaid leuite employed worthie priuate inſtructing people publike alter like like diſorder miniſter ſhould leuite goe ſeeke himſelfe place ſufficient willing giue church account gift god hath giuen vſe demanded lawfully place muſt ſeeke vp approue welcome entertaine beſt manner fit well diſcharging executing dutie call themſelues let ſhift god ordinance haue violated diſcredit diſcouragement note ill ſucceſſe befall mend owne hand god ſent would haue ſeene ſecondly confuſion leuite compelled runne ſeek reliefe although ſetled ſhame people neglect cauſe miniſter prouided forſakes ſtudie publike teaching watching ouer people roue countrey tendring ſeruice preach among ſtrangers money ſome baſe ſtraglers doe whereas lord hath wiſely prouided exemption onely rouing euen
